column1: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: All right Jim. Your quarterlies look very good. How are things at the library?
column2: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Oh, I told you. I couldn't close it. So...
column3: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: So you've come to the master for guidance? Is this what you're saying, grasshopper?
column4: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Actually, you called me in here, but yeah.
column5: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: All right. Well, let me show you how it's done.
column6: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: [on the phone] Yes, I'd like to speak to your office manager, please. Yes, hello. This is Michael Scott. I am the Regional Manager of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products. Just wanted to talk to you manager-a-manger. [quick cut scene] All right. Done deal. Thank you very much, sir. You're a gentleman and a scholar. Oh, I'm sorry. OK. I'm sorry. My mistake. [hangs up] That was a woman I was talking to, so... She had a very low voice. Probably a smoker, so... [Clears throat] So that's the way it's done.
column7: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: I've, uh, I've been at Dunder Mifflin for 12 years, the last four as Regional Manager. If you want to come through here... See we have the entire floor. So this is my kingdom, as far as the eye can see. This is our receptionist, Pam. Pam! Pam-Pam! Pam Beesly. Pam has been with us for... forever. Right, Pam?
column8: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Well. I don't know.
column9: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: If you think she's cute now, you should have seen her a couple of years ago. [growls]
column10: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: What?
column11: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Any messages?
column12: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Uh, yeah. Just a fax.
column13: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Oh! Pam, this is from Corporate. How many times have I told you? There's a special filing cabinet for things from corporate.
column14: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: You haven't told me.
column15: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: It's called the wastepaper basket! Look at that! Look at that face.
column16: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: People say I am the best boss. They go, "God we've never worked in a place like this before. You're hilarious." "And you get the best out of us." [shows the camera his WORLD'S BEST BOSS mug] I think that pretty much sums it up. I found it at Spencer Gifts.
column17: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: [singing] Shall I play for you? Pa rum pump um pum [Imitates heavy drumming] I have no gifts for you. Pa rum pump um pum [Imitates heavy drumming]
column18: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: My job is to speak to clients on the phone about... uh, quantities and type of copier paper. You know, whether we can supply it to them. Whether they can pay for it. And... I'm boring myself just talking about this.
column19: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Whassup!
column20: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Whassup! I still love that after seven years.
column21: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Whassup!
column22: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: Whassup!
column23: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Whass...up!
column24: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: Whassup.
column25: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: [Strains, grunts] What?
column26: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Nothing.
column27: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: OK. All right. See you later.
column28: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: All right. Take care.
column29: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Back to work.
column30: 01x01 - Pilot;Jan: [on her cell phone] Just before lunch. That would be great.
column31: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Corporate really doesn't really interfere with me at all. Jan Levinson Gould. [walking out of his office] Jan, hello. I call her Hillary Rodham Clinton. Right? Not to her face, because... well, not because I'm scared of her. Because I'm not. But, um... Yeah.
column32: 01x01 - Pilot;Jan: Alright, was there anything you wanted to add to the agenda?
column33: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Um... Me no get an agenda.
column34: 01x01 - Pilot;Jan: What? I'm sorry?
column35: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: I didn't get any agenda.
column36: 01x01 - Pilot;Jan: Well, I faxed one over to you this morning.
column37: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Really? I didn't... [looks at Pam] Did we get a fax this morning?
column38: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Uh, yeah, the one...
column39: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Why isn't it in my hand? A company runs on efficiency of communication, right? So what's the problem, Pam? Why didn't I get it?
column40: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: You put in the garbage can that was a special filing cabinet.
column41: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Yeah, that was a joke. That was a joke that was actually my brother's, and... It was supposed to be with bills and it doesn't work great with faxes.
column42: 01x01 - Pilot;Jan: Do you want to look at mine?
column43: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Yeah, yeah. Lovely. Thank you.
column44: 01x01 - Pilot;Jan: OK. Since the last meeting, Ellen and the board have decided we can't justify a Scranton branch and a Stamford branch.
column45: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: OK...
column46: 01x01 - Pilot;Jan: Michael, don't panic.
column47: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: No, no, no, no, this is good. This is good. This is fine. Excellent.
column48: 01x01 - Pilot;Jan: No, no, no, Michael, listen OK. Don't panic. We haven't made... We haven't decided.
column49: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: All the alarm bells are kind of going... ringie-dingie-ding!
column50: 01x01 - Pilot;Jan: I've spoken to Josh in Stamford. I've told him the same as you and it's up to either him or you to convince me that your branch can incorporate the other.
column51: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: OK. No problem.
column52: 01x01 - Pilot;Jan: This does, however, mean that there is going to be downsizing.
column53: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Me no wanna hear that, Jan. Because downsizing is a bitch. It is a real bitch. And I wouldn't wish that on Josh's men. I certainly wouldn't wish it on my men. Or women, present company excluded. Sorry. Uh, is Josh concerned about downsizing himself? Not downsizing himself but is he concerned about downsizing?
column54: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Question. How long do we have to... [Telephone rings] Oh uh, Todd Packer, terrific rep. Do you mind if I take it?
column55: 01x01 - Pilot;Jan: Go ahead.
column56: 01x01 - Pilot;Michel: Packman.
column57: 01x01 - Pilot;Todd Packer: Hey, you big queen.
column58: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Oh, that's not appropriate.
column59: 01x01 - Pilot;Todd Packer: Hey, is old Godzillary coming in today?
column60: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Uh, I don't know what you mean.
column61: 01x01 - Pilot;Todd Packer: I've been meaning to ask her one question. Does the carpet match the drapes?
column62: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Oh, my God! Oh! That's... horrifying. Horrible. Horrible person.
column63: 01x01 - Pilot;Jan: So do you think we could keep a lid on this for now? I don't want to worry people unnecessarily.
column64: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: No, absolutely. Under this regime, it will not leave this office. [zips his lips] Like that.
column65: 01x01 - Pilot;Phyllis: So what does downsizing actually mean?
column66: 01x01 - Pilot;Stanley: Well...
column67: 01x01 - Pilot;Oscar: You guys better update your resumes just like I'm doing.
column68: 01x01 - Pilot;Angela: I bet it's gonna be me. Probably gonna be me.
column69: 01x01 - Pilot;Kevin: Yeah, it'll be you.
column70: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: I have an important question for you.
column71: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Yes?
column72: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Are you going to Angela's cat party on Sunday?
column73: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Yeah, stop. That is ridiculous.
column74: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Am I going to tell them? No, I am not going to tell them. I don't see the point of that. As a doctor, you would not tell a patient if they had cancer.
column75: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Hey.
column76: 01x01 - Pilot;Ryan: Hey.
column77: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: This is Mr. Scott.
column78: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Guilty! Guilty as charged!
column79: 01x01 - Pilot;Ryan: Ryan Howard from the temp agency. Daniqua sent me down to start today.
column80: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Howard, like Moe Howard. Three Stooges.
column81: 01x01 - Pilot;Ryan: Yup.
column82: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Watch this. This is Moe. Nyuck-nyuck-nyuck-nyuck-nyuck. Mee! [hold hand up for a high five] Ah, right here. Three Stooges. Oh, Pam. It's a guy thing, Pam. I'm sort of a student of comedy. Watch this. Here we go. [Yelling in cod German] I'm Hitler. Adolf Hitler. [Continues with cod German]
column83: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: I don't think it would be the worst thing if they let me go because then I might... I don't think it's many little girls' dream to be a receptionist. I like to do illustrations. Um... Mostly watercolor. A few oil pencil. Um, Jim thinks they're good.
column84: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam.
column85: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Sure. Mr. Davis, let me call you right back. Yeah, something just came up. Two minutes. Thank you very much. Dwight, what are you doing?
column86: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: What?
column87: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: What are you doing?
column88: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: Just clearing my desk. I can't concentrate.
column89: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: It's not on your desk.
column90: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: It's overlapping. It's all spilling over the edge. One word, two syllables. Demarcation.
column91: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: You can't do that.
column92: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Why not?
column93: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: Safety violation. I could fall and pierce an organ.
column94: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: [crosses fingers] We'll see. [Dwight begins smashing pencils with his phone] This is why the whole downsizing thing just doesn't bother me.
column95: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: Downsizing?
column96: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: Downsizing? I have no problem with that. I have been recommending downsizing since I first got here. I even brought it up in my interview. I say, bring it on.
column97: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: You just still have these messages from yesterday.
column98: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Relax. Everything's under control. Uh, yeah. Yeah. That's important. Right. Oh this is so important, I should run to answer it. [Imitating Six-Million Dollar Man sound effect]
column99: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: What?
column100: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Come on. Six-Million Dollar Man! Steve Austin! Actually, that would be a good salary for me, don't you think? Six million dollars? Memo to Jan. I deserve a raise.
column101: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Don't we all?
column102: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: I'm sorry?
column103: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Nothing.
column104: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: If you're unhappy with your compensation, maybe you should take it up with HR. OK. Not today, OK? Pam, just be professional. [Sighs]
column105: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: I think I'm a role model here. I think I garner people's respect. [Imitating a PA] Attention all Dunder Mifflin employees, please. We have a meeting in the conference room, ASAP.
column106: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: People I respect, heroes of mine, would be Bob Hope... Abraham Lincoln, definitely. Bono. And probably God would be the fourth one. And I just think all those people really helped the world in so many ways that it's really beyond words. It's really incalculable.
column107: 01x01 - Pilot;
column108: 01x01 - Pilot;
column109: 01x01 - Pilot;
column110: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Now I know there's some rumors out there and I just kind of want to set the record straight.
column111: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: I'm Assistant Regional Manager. I should know first.
column112: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Assistant to the Regional Manager.
column113: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: OK, um, can you just tell me please? Just tell me quietly. Can you whisper it in my ear?
column114: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: I'm about to tell everybody. I'm just about to tell everybody.
column115: 01x01 - Pilot;Oscar: Can't you just tell us.
column116: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: Please, OK? Do you want me to tell 'em?
column117: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: You don't know what it is. [Laughs]
column118: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: OK. You tell 'em. With my permission. Permission granted.
column119: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: I don't need your permission.
column120: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: Go ahead.
column121: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Corporate has deemed it appropriate to enforce an ultimatum upon me. And Jan is thinking about downsizing either the Stamford branch or this branch.
column122: 01x01 - Pilot;Ryan: I heard they might be closing this branch down. That's just the rumor going around. This is my first day. I don't really know.
column123: 01x01 - Pilot;Oscar: Yeah but Michael, what if they downsize here?
column124: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Not gonna happen.
column125: 01x01 - Pilot;Stanley: It could be out of your hands Michael.
column126: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: It won't be out of my hands Stanley, OK. I promise you that.
column127: 01x01 - Pilot;Stanley: Can you promise that?
column128: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: On his mother's grave.
column129: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: No.
column130: 01x01 - Pilot;Phyllis: What?
column131: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Well, yeah, it is a promise. And frankly, I'm a little insulted that you have to keep asking about it.
column132: 01x01 - Pilot;Stanley: It's just that we need to know.
column133: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: I know. Hold on a second. I think Pam wanted to say something. Pam, you had a look that you wanted to ask a question just then.
column134: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: I was in the meeting with Jan and she did say that it could be this branch that gets the axe.
column135: 01x01 - Pilot;Man: Are you sure about that?
column136: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Well, Pam maybe you should stick to the ongoing confidentiality agreement of meetings.
column137: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: Pam, information is power.
column138: 01x01 - Pilot;Stanley: You can't say for sure whether it'll be us or them, can you?
column139: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: No, Stanley. No, you did not see me in there with her. I said if Corporate wants to come in here and interfere, then they're gonna have to go through me. Right? You can go mess with Josh's people, but I'm the head of this family, and you ain't gonna be messing with my chillin.
column140: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: If I left, what would I do with all this useless information in my head? You know? Tonnage price of manila folders? Um, Pam's favorite flavor of yogurt, which is mixed berry.
column141: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Jim said mixed berries? Well, yeah, he's on to me. Um... [Laughs]
column142: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Watch out for this guy. Dwight Schrute in the building. This is Ryan, the new temp.
column143: 01x01 - Pilot;Ryan: What's up? Nice to meet you.
column144: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Introduce yourself. Be polite.
column145: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: Dwight Schrute, Assistant Regional Manager.
column146: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Assistant to the Regional Manager. So, uh, Dwight tell him about the kung fu and the car and everything.
column147: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: Uh... yeah I got a '78 280Z. Bought it for $1,200. Fixed it up. It's now worth three grand.
column148: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: That's his profit.
column149: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: New engine, new suspension, I got a respray. I've got some photos.
column150: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: Damn it! Jim!
column151: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: OK. Hold on, hold on. The judge is in session. What is the problem here?
column152: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: He put my stuff in Jell-O again.
column153: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: [Laughing]
column154: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: That's real professional thanks. That's the third time and it wasn't funny the first two times either Jim.
column155: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: It's OK here, but people sometimes take advantage because it's so relaxed. I'm a volunteer Sheriff's Deputy on the weekends. And you cannot screw around there. That's sort of one of the rules.
column156: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: What is that?
column157: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: That is my stapler.
column158: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: No, no, no. Do not take it out. You have to eat it out of there, because there are starving people in the world [turns to camera] which I hate, and it is a waste of that kind of food.
column159: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: OK you know what, you can be a witness. [points to Ryan] Can you reprimand him?
column160: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: How do you know it was me?
column161: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: It's always you. Are you going to discipline him or not?
column162: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Discipline. Kinky! [Laughs] All right, here's the deal you guys. The thing about a practical joke is you have to know when to start and as well as when to stop.
column163: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: Yeah.
column164: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: And yeah, Jim this is the time to stop putting Dwight's personal effects into Jell-O.
column165: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: OK. Dwight, I'm sorry, because I have always been your biggest flan.
column166: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: [Laughing] Nice. That's the way it is around here. It just kind of goes round and round.
column167: 01x01 - Pilot;Ryan: You should've put him in custardy.
column168: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Hey! Yes! New guy! He scores.
column169: 01x01 - Pilot;Dwight: OK, that's great. I guess what I'm most concerned with is damage to company property. That's all.
column170: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Pudding. Pudding... I'm trying to think of another dessert to do.
column171: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Do you like going out at the end of the week for a drink?
column172: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Yeah.
column173: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: That's why we're all going out. So we can have an end-of-the-week-drink.
column174: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: So when are we going out?
column175: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Tonight, hopefully.
column176: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: OK. Yeah.
column177: 01x01 - Pilot;Roy: Hey, man.
column178: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: What's going on?
column179: 01x01 - Pilot;Roy: Hey, baby.
column180: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Hey.
column181: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Roy's my fiance. We've been engaged about three years. We were supposed to get married in September but I think we're gonna get married in the spring.
column182: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Do you mind if I go out for a drink with these guys?
column183: 01x01 - Pilot;Roy: No, no. Come on. Let's get out of here and go home.
column184: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: OK. I'm gonna be a few minutes. So it's only twenty past five. I still have to do my faxes.
column185: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: You know what? You should come with us. Because you know we're all going out and it could be a good chance for you to see what people are like outside the office. I think it could be fun.
column186: 01x01 - Pilot;Roy: It sounds good. Seriously, we've gotta get going.
column187: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Yeah, yeah.
column188: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Um... What's in the bag?
column189: 01x01 - Pilot;Roy: Just tell her I'll talk to her later.
column190: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: No, definitely. All right, dude. Awesome. Will do.
column191: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Do I think I'll be invited to the wedding? [scratches head]
column192: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: So have you felt the vibe yet? We work hard, we play hard. Sometimes we play hard when we should be working hard. Right? I guess the atmosphere that I've created here is that I'm a friend first, and a boss second... and probably an entertainer third. [Knock at door] Just a second. Right? Oh, hey do you like The Jamie Kennedy Experiment? Punk'd and all that kind of stuff?
column193: 01x01 - Pilot;Ryan: Yeah.
column194: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: You are gonna be my accomplice. Just go along with it, OK?
column195: 01x01 - Pilot;Ryan: All right.
column196: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Just follow my lead. Don't pimp me, all right? Come in. So, uh, Corporate just said that I don't want to...
column197: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: You got a fax.
column198: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Oh, thank you. Pam, can you come in here for a sec. Just have a seat. I was gonna call you in anyway. You know Ryan. As you know, there is going to be downsizing. And you have made my life so much easier in that I am going to have to let you go first.
column199: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: What? Why?
column200: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Why? Well, theft and stealing.
column201: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Stealing? What am I supposed to have stolen?
column202: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Post-it Notes.
column203: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Post-it Notes? What are those worth, 50 cents?
column204: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: 50 cents, yeah. If you steal a thousand Post-It Notes at 50 cents apiece, and you know, you've made a profit... margin. You're gonna run us out of business, Pam.
column205: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Are you serious?
column206: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: Yeah. I am.
column207: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: I can't believe this. I mean I have never even stolen as much as a paperclip and you're firing me.
column208: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: But the best thing about it is that we're not going to have to give you any severance pay. Because that is gross misconduct and... Just clean out your desk. I'm sorry.
column209: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: [Pam starts crying] You been X'd punk! [Laughing] Surprise! It's a joke. We were joking around. See? OK. He was in on it. He was my accomplice. And it was kind of a morale booster thing. And we were showing the new guy around, giving him the feel of the place. So you... God, we totally got you.
column210: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: You're a jerk.
column211: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: I don't know about that.
column212: 01x01 - Pilot;Michael: What is the most important thing for a company? Is it the cash flow? Is it the inventory? Nuh-uh. It's the people. The people. My proudest moment here was not when I increased profits by 17% or when I cut expenses without losing a single employee. No, no, no, no, no. It was a young Guatemalan guy. First job in the country, barely spoke English. He came to me, and said, "Mr. Scott, would you be the godfather of my child?" Wow. Wow. Didn't work out in the end. We had to let him go. He sucked.
column213: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Hey.
column214: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Hey.
column215: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: How are things?
column216: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Good. I thought you were going out for a drink with...
column217: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Oh no, I just decided not to. How's your headache?
column218: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: It's better, thanks.
column219: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Good. Good.
column220: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Yeah.
column221: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: That's great
column222: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Is...?
column223: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Yeah?
column224: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Um... Are you...
column225: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Am I walking out?
column226: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Yes.
column227: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Yes, I... Do you want to...
column228: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Yeah.
column229: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Great. Let me just...
column230: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: [Car horn honking] Oh, Roy.
column231: 01x01 - Pilot;Pam: Yeah. Listen, have a nice weekend.
column232: 01x01 - Pilot;Jim: Yeah, definitely. You too. Enjoy it. [looks at camera] You know what, just come here.

column1: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Hey, uh, can I help you out in here?
column2: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Oh, I'm all set, thanks.
column3: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Gotcha. Good. I'd go with the rows. That's a good idea.
column4: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Today is diversity day and someone's going to come in and talk to us about diversity. It's something that I've been pushing, that I've been wanting to push, for a long time and Corporate mandated it. And I never actually talked to Corporate about it. They kind of beat me to the punch, the bastards. But I was going to. And I think it's very important that we have this. I'm very, very excited.
column5: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: That's the thing. It's very sturdy paper and on the back it says, "100% post-consumer content." What? Hello? Uh-huh. Wait. What? I'm sorry, Mr. Decker. I think I'm losing you. [Shedder whirring] Hello? Hello? Yeah. Hold on one second. I don't know. Hold on one second.
column6: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: Do you really have to do that right now?
column7: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: Yes I do. I should have done it weeks ago actually.
column8: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: Mr. Decker, I'm sorry about that. What were you... Can you hold on one second? Yeah, just one second. Thanks. [Power off, silence] Hello? That's it. Perfect. So what I was saying... [Dialing tone] Hello? Thanks, Dwight.
column9: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: Retaliation. Tit for tit.
column10: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: That is not the expression.
column11: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: Well, it should be.
column12: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: This is my biggest sale of the year. They love me over there for some reason. I'm not really sure why but I make one call over there every year, just to renew their account, and that one call ends up being 25% of my commission for the whole year, so I buy a mini bottle of champagne, celebrate a little. And this year I'm pushing recycled paper on them for one percent more. I know. I'm getting cocky. Right?
column13: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: Solitaire?
column14: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Pam: Yeah, Freecell.
column15: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: Six on seven.
column16: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Pam: I know. I saw that.
column17: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: So then, why didn't you do it?
column18: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Pam: I'm saving that 'cause I like it when the cards go T-ts-ts-tch-tch-tch.
column19: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: Who doesn't love that?
column20: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Hey, Oscar! How are you doing, man?
column21: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Oscar: All right.
column22: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Did you have a good weekend going there?
column23: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Oscar: It was fine.
column24: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Oh yeah, I bet it was fun. [to Mr. Brown] Oh, hey! This is Oscar---
column25: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Oscar: Martinez.
column26: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Right. See? I don't even know, first-name basis!
column27: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Great. We're all set.
column28: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Oh hey, well, diversity, everybody, let's do it. Oscar works in... here. Jim, could you wrap it up, please?
column29: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: Yeah, uh, Mr. Decker, please.
column30: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: It's diversity day, Jim. I wish every day was diversity day.
column31: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: You know what? I'm actually going to have to call you back. Thank you. Sorry about that.
column32: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Thank you. Thank you. Thank you. Great.
column33: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Come on people, let's get 'em in. Get in the cards! Get in the cards!
column34: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Thank you. Thank you very much. OK. Thanks for filling these out and I promise this'll be quick. At Diversity Today, our philosophy is about honesty and positive expectations. We believe that 99% of the problems in the workplace arise simply out of ignorance.
column35: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: You know what? This is a color-free-zone here. Stanley, I don't look at you as another race.
column36: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Uh, see this is what I'm talking about. We don't have to pretend we're color-blind.
column37: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Exactly, were not...
column38: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: That's fighting ignorance with more ignorance.
column39: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: With tolerance.
column40: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: No. With more ignorance.
column41: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Ignorance.
column42: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Right. Exactly. Uh, instead, we need to celebrate our diversity.
column43: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Let's celebrate.
column44: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Right. OK.
column45: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Celebrate good times. Come on! Let's celebrate diversity. Right?
column46: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Yes, exactly. Now here's what we're going to do. I've noticed that...
column47: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: You know what? Here's what we're going to do. Why don't we go around and everybody... everybody say a race that you are attracted to sexually. I will go last. Go.
column48: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: I have two. White and Indian.
column49: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Actually, I'd prefer not to start that way. Michael, I would love to have your permission to run this session. Can I have your permission?
column50: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Yes.
column51: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Thank you very much. And it would also help me if you were seated.
column52: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: OK.
column53: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Thank you. OK. Now, at the start of the session, I had you all write down an incident that you found offensive in the workplace. Now, what I'm going to do is choose one and we're going to act it out.
column54: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: A few of the ground rules?
column55: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Hey, hey why don't you run it by me and I'll run it by him.
column56: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: OK, can we steer away from gay people?
column57: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Um...
column58: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: I'm sorry. It's an orientation. It's not a race. Plus a lot of other races are intolerant of gays, so...paradox.
column59: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Well, we only have an hour.
column60: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: I figured it would save time.
column61: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: OK. Why don't we just defer to Mr...
column62: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Mr. Brown.
column63: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Ah. Oh, right! OK. First test. I will not call you that.
column64: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Well, it's my name. It's not a test. OK? Um, so looking through the cards, I've noticed that many of you wrote down the same incident, which is ironic, because it's the exact incident I was brought in here to respond to. Now, how many of you are familiar with the Chris Rock routine? Very good. OK.
column65: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: How come Chris Rock can do a routine and everybody finds it hilarious and ground-breaking and then I go and do the exact same routine, same comedic timing, and people file a complaint to Corporate? Is it because I'm white and Chris is black?
column66: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: So we're going to reenact this with a more positive outcome.
column67: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: I will play the Chris Rock guy. I would like to see someone else pull this off.
column68: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Well, let's have someone who wasn't involved in the reenactment.
column69: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: OK, I will play guy listening.
column70: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Great. Guy listening. Ok, anyone else remember?
column71: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Kevin: I remember.
column72: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Great. You're the Chris Rock guy and you're guy listening.
column73: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: OK.
column74: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Kevin is a great guy. He's a great accountant. He is not much of an entertainer.
column75: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Kevin: Basically, there are two types of black people and black people are actually more racist because they hate the other type of black people. Every time the one type wants to have a good time, then the other type comes in and makes a real mess.
column76: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: OK. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. He's ruin... He's butchering it. Could you just let me... [As Chris Rock] Every time... Every time black people want to have a good time, some ignant ass... [Bleep] I take care of my kid!
column77: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Wait a second.
column78: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: [Bleep] They always want credit for something they supPOSED to do!
column79: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Stop it!
column80: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: [As Chris Rock] What you want a cookie?
column81: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Now, this is a simple acronym. HERO. Uh, at Diversity Today, we believe it is very easy to be a HERO. All you need are honesty, empathy, respect and open-mindedness.
column82: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: Excuse me, I'm sorry, but that's not all it takes to be a hero.
column83: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Oh, great. Well, what is a hero to you?
column84: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: A hero kills people, people that wish him harm.
column85: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: OK.
column86: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: A hero is part-human and part-supernatural. A hero is born out of a childhood trauma, or out of a disaster that must be avenged.
column87: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Ok, you're thinking of a superhero.
column88: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: We all have a hero in our heart.
column89: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Now, I need you to take these forms. This kind of expresses the joint experience we had today. And I need you to look 'em over and sign them as kind of a group pledge.
column90: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: [Clears throat] I don't think I can sign this.
column91: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: I can't leave until you do.
column92: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Well, OK, it says here that I learned something and I knew all this stuff already, so... I know, I could sign something that says that I taught something, or that I helped you teach something, so... Pam! Where is she? Pam, could we change something on this?
column93: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Michael, can I talk to you candidly?
column94: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Sure.
column95: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: We both know that I'm here because of the comments you made.
column96: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Here's the thing. This office, I think this is very advanced in terms of... racial awareness and it's probably more advanced than you're used to. That's probably throwing you off a little bit.
column97: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Um, it's not throwing me. I need your signature.
column98: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: OK, well I know. You told me that several times.
column99: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Yes, but you're not listening to me. Yours is the only signature I need.
column100: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: OK.
column101: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Those are my instructions from the Corporate offices to put you through this seminar for the comments that you made. The reason I made copies for everyone was so you wouldn't be embarrassed.
column102: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Well, here I am thinking that you actually cared about diversity training. And you don't.
column103: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: Don't worry about dating.
column104: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: I won't.
column105: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Mr. Brown: OK. Thank you.
column106: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Yeah, yeah.
column107: 01x02 - Diversity Day;
column108: 01x02 - Diversity Day;
column109: 01x02 - Diversity Day;
column110: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: "I regret my actions. I regret offending my coworkers. I pledge to bring my best spirit of honesty, empathy, respect and open-mindedness..." Open-mindedness, is that even a word? "...into the workplace. In this way, I can truly be a hero. Signed, Daffy Duck." [Laughing] He's going to lose it when he reads that.
column111: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: Yeah, hi. Is Mr. Decker around? Oh, well, could you just have him call me after lunch? Thank you.
column112: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: "I pledge to always keep an open mind and an open heart." I do believe... in that part of the pledge I that just read. But a pledge? Come on. I mean who are we, the Girl Scouts? No. Look... the guy, "Mr. Brown," he got us halfway there. He got us talking. Well, no. I got us talking. He got us nothing. He insulted us and he abandoned us. You call that diversity training? I don't. Were there any connections between any of us? Did anyone look each other in the eye? Was there any emotion going on? No. Where was the heart? I didn't see any heart. Where was my Oprah moment? OK, get as much done as you can before lunch because, afterward, I'm going to have you all in tears.
column113: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: All right? Everybody pretty? Come on. Here we go. It's time. Let's do some good.
column114: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Toby: Hey, we're not all going to sit in a circle Indian style are we? [Laughing]
column115: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Get out.
column116: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Toby: I'm sorry.
column117: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: No, this is not a joke. OK? That was offensive and lame. So double offensive. This is an environment of welcoming and you should just get the hell out of here. OK, let's go. Let's do it. Come on. Let's have some fun, everybody. Here we go. Take a seat. Cop a squat. And um... thanks for coming in. Um... Diversity... is the cornerstone of progress as I've always said. But don't take my word for it. Let's take a look at the tape.
column118: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: [on the tape] Hi. I'm Michael Scott. I'm in charge of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products here in Scranton, Pennsylvania but I'm also the founder of Diversity Tomorrow, because today is almost over. Abraham Lincoln once said that, "If you're a racist, I will attack you with the North." And those are the principles that I carry with me in the workplace.
column119: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: OK. Questions? Comments? Anybody? Jim?
column120: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: [/b]: Uh, is that it?
column121: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Yes. I only had an hour to put it together but I'm going to add on to it later on.
column122: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Kevin: It was kind of hard to hear.
column123: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Uh, yes. That probably had something to do with the camera work. Anybody else? Um...
column124: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Kelly: I have a customer meeting.
column125: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Yeah, well, if you leave we'll only have two left. Yes. Enjoy. Absolutely. Namaste. Ok, well since I am leading this, let's get down to business and why don't I just kind of introduce myself, OK? Um. I am Michael and I am part English, Irish, German and Scottish. Sort of a virtual United Nations. But what some of you might not know is that I am also part Native American Indian.
column126: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Oscar: What part Native American?
column127: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Two fifteenths.
column128: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Oscar: Two fifteenths, that fraction doesn't make any sense.
column129: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Well, you know what, it's kind of hard for me to talk about it. Their suffering. So who else? Let's get this popping. Come on. Who's going? Who's going? Let's go here. Oscar, right here. You're on.
column130: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Oscar: OK, Michael, um... Both my parents were born in Mexico.
column131: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Oh, yeah...
column132: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Oscar: And, uh, they moved to the United Sates a year before I was born. So I grew up in the United States.
column133: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Wow.
column134: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Oscar: My parents were Mexican.
column135: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Wow. That is... That is a great story. That's the American Dream right there, right?
column136: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Oscar: Thank... Yeah...
column137: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Um, let me ask you, is there a term besides Mexican that you prefer? Something less offensive?
column138: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Oscar: Mexican isn't offensive.
column139: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Well, it has certain connotations.
column140: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Oscar: Like what?
column141: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Like... I don't... I don't know.
column142: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Oscar: What connotations, Michael? You meant something.
column143: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: No. Now, remember that honesty...
column144: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Oscar: I'm just curious.
column145: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: ...empathy, respect... [Phone ringing] Jim! Jim!
column146: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: Hello? Hello?
column147: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: I have something here. I want you to take a card. Put it on your fore... Don't look at the card. I want you to take the card and put it on your forehead and... Take a card, take a card, any card. Um... And I want you to treat other people like the race that is on their forehead. OK? So everybody has a different race. Nobody knows what their race is, so... I want you to really go for it, cause this is real. You know, this isn't just an exercise. This is real life. And... I have a dream that you will really let the sparks fly. Get 'er done.
column148: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Why? Because Martin Luther King is a hero of mine. There's this great Chris Rock bit about how streets named after Martin Luther King tend to be more violent. I'm not going to do it but it's...
column149: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Oh this is a good one.
column150: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Pam: Um, hi. How are you?
column151: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Stanley: Fine. How are you?
column152: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Pam: Great.
column153: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Push it.
column154: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Stanley: I admire your culture's success in America.
column155: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Pam: Thank you.
column156: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Good. Bom bom bom-bom bom. Come on Olympics of Suffering right here. Slavery versus the Holocaust. Come on.
column157: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Stanley: Who am I supposed to be?
column158: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: No, that was inadvertent. We didn't actually plan that.
column159: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: Lots of cultures eat rice, doesn't help me.
column160: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: Um... Shalom. I'd like to apply for a loan.
column161: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Pam: That's nice, Dwight.
column162: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: OK, do me. Something stereotypical so I can get it really quick.
column163: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Pam: OK, I like your food.
column164: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: Outback steakhouse. [Australian accent] I'm Australian, mate!
column165: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Pam, come on. "I like your food." Come on stir the pot. Stir the melting pot, Pam! Let's do it. Let's get ugly. Let's get real.
column166: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Pam: OK. If I have to do this, based on stereotypes that are totally untrue, that I do not agree with, you would maybe not be a very good driver.
column167: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Dwight: Oh, man, am I a woman?
column168: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: You'll notice I didn't have anybody be an Arab. I thought that would be too explosive. No pun intended. But I just though. "Too soon for Arabs." Maybe next year. Um... You know, the ball's in their court.
column169: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: What are you watching?
column170: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Ryan: Chappelle's Show.
column171: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: Really?
column172: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Ryan: I downloaded it on her computer. I hope she doesn't mind. She just had a lot of extra space.
column173: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: No way. I think she likes this stuff.
column174: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Ryan: Great. She's cute, huh?
column175: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: Yeah, you know, she's engaged, but...
column176: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Ryan: Oh, no, the girl in the... sketch.
column177: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: Oh, yeah. She's hot.
column178: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Kevin: Hey.
column179: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Angela: Hey.
column180: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Kevin: You wanna go to the beach?
column181: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Angela: Sure.
column182: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Kevin: You wanna get high?
column183: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Angela: No.
column184: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Kevin: I think you do, mon.
column185: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Angela: Stop...
column186: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: OK. All right. No. It's good. You just need to push it. You need to go a little bit further. All right. OK.
column187: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: [Voice raised, Indian accent] Kelly, how are you?
column188: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Kelly: I just had the longest meeting.
column189: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Oh! Welcome to my convenience store. Would you like some googi googi? I have some very delicious googi, googi, only 99 cents plus tax. Try my googi, googi. [Lowering voice] Try my googi, googi. [High-pitched voice] Try my googi, googi. Try my... [slap!]
column190: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: [trying not to cry] All right! All right! Yes! That was great, she gets it! Now she knows what it's like to be a minority.
column191: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: [on the phone] Mr. Decker, we didn't lose your sale today, did we? Excellent. OK. Let me just get your... what's that? No, we didn't close last time. I just need your... Oh. W-What code were you given? Oh, OK. That's actually another salesman here. I can redo it if you want to do that. Oh, he gave you a discount? No, I don't blame you.
column192: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: I just hated it when that guy was in here. Mr. Brown, if that was his real name. I mean, he had never met any of us before, and here he was telling us how to do our thing. I just wanted... I just wanted to do it our way. You know? On our own. Man I should have gotten some food.
column193: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Kevin: [Itialian accent]Maybe some spagh-etti.
column194: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: Okay, Kevin. You can take that off that thing, OK? That would really, really have shown him up, wouldn't it? If I'd brought in some burritos or some colored greens. Or some pad Thai. I love pad Thai.
column195: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Stanley: It's collard greens.
column196: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: What?
column197: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Stanley: It's collard greens.
column198: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Michael: That doesn't really make sense. Because you don't call them collared people, that's offensive. Hmmm... OK, well, it's after five. So... Thank you very much. Buena vista Oscar. Thank you. Good job. Oh, my man. Thank you Brazil. Nice.
column199: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: [Pam is asleep, resting her head on Jim's shoulder] Um... Hey.
column200: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Pam: [stirs] Mmmm.
column201: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: Hey.
column202: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Pam: Oh.
column203: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: We can go.
column204: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Pam: Sorry.
column205: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: That's fine.
column206: 01x02 - Diversity Day;Jim: Uh... Not a bad day.

column1: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Pam. Pamela. Pam-elama-ding-dong. Making copies.
column2: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: I'm not making any copies.
column3: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Let's go. Messages. Stat. Lots to do, lots to do. Information superhighway.
column4: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Nothing new.
column5: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Lay them on me. What?
column6: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: There's nothing new.
column7: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: That's not what you said earlier.
column8: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Oh, do you want me to repeat the messages that I gave you before for the... [nods toward camera]
column9: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: The most sacred thing I do is care and provide for my workers, my family. I give them money. I give them food. Not directly, but through the money. I heal them. Today, I am in charge of picking a great new health care plan. Right? That's what this is all about. Does that make me their doctor? Um... Yes, in a way. Yeah, like a specialist.
column10: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: So, which health plan have you decided on?
column11: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: I am going to go with the best, Jan. I am going to go with the one with the acupuncture, therapeutic massage, you know, the works.
column12: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: Wait, acupuncture? None of the plans have acupuncture. Have you looked at them closely Michael?
column13: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: I think it was you who didn't look closely enough at the Gold Plan.
column14: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: The Gold Plan? I'm not even on that plan.
column15: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Well, I'd recommend it. It's very good.
column16: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: Michael.
column17: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: You gotta crack these things open.
column18: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: You know the whole reason that we're doing this, is to save money. So you just need to pick a provider and choose the cheapest plan.
column19: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Well, that is kind of a tough assignment. Um... It won't be popular decision around the old orifice.
column20: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: It's your job. So...
column21: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Well, it's a suicide mission, you know.
column22: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: Michael... maybe... I mean...
column23: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: There, there...
column24: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: Sometimes a manager, like yourself, has to deliver the bad news to the employees. I do it all the time.
column25: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: [scoffs] When have you ever done that?
column26: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: I'm doing it right now. To you.
column27: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Last night on Trading Spouses, there's... have you seen it?
column28: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: No. I have a life.
column29: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Interesting, what's that like?
column30: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: You should try it sometime.
column31: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Wow. But then who would watch my TV? That is...
column32: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: [laughs]... your problem.
column33: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Jimbo! Ha haaaaa. Ah.
column34: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: There's a decision that needs to be made, and I'm having an unbelievably a busy day. So I'm going to let you pick a health care plan for our office and then explain it to your co-workers.
column35: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Gosh.
column36: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Yeah!
column37: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: That is a great offer. Thank you. I really think I should be concentrating on sales.
column38: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Really?
column39: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Yeah. I just don't think this is the kind of task, that I... am going to do. You know who would be great for this?
column40: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Any time Michael asks me to do anything, I just tell him that Dwight should do it.
column41: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Yes. I can do it. I'm your man.
column42: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Right now, this is just a job. If I advance any higher in this company then this would be my career. And uh, well, if this were my career, I'd have to throw myself in front of a train.
column43: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: OK, first, let's go over some parameters. How many people can I fire?
column44: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Ah, none. You're picking a health care plan.
column45: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: OK, we'll table that for the time being. Two, I'll need an office. I think the conference room should be fine.
column46: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: You can use the conference room as a temporary workspace.
column47: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: [to self] Yes, I have an office. [to camera] Bigger than his.
column48: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Nope, you cannot use it.
column49: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: OK, I take it back, it's a workspace.
column50: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Temporary workspace. You can use it.
column51: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Thank you.
column52: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: If Dwight fails, then that is strike two, and good for me for, ah, for giving him a second chance. And if he succeeds, then, you know, no one will be prouder than I am. I groomed him. I made him what he is today. Unless he fails, and we've talked about that already.
column53: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: What did I do? I did my job. I slashed benefits to the bone. I saved this company money. Was I too harsh? Maybe. I don't believe in coddling people.
column54: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: In the wild, there is no health care. In the wild, health care is, "Ow, I hurt my leg. I can't run. A lion eats me and I'm dead." Well, I'm not dead. I'm the lion. You're dead.
column55: 01x03 - Health Care;Stanley: There's no dental, there's no vision, there's a $1,200 deductible.
column56: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.
column57: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: [on phone] Pam, Michael Scott. How's tricks?
column58: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Where are you?
column59: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Oh, I am in my office. I am swamped. I have work up to my ears I'm busy, busy, busy. Can't step away. I just wanted to check in and see how everybody's doing. Everybody cool out there?
column60: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Actually, people are really unhappy. Um, Dwight sent around this memo and people are freaking out 'cause the...
column61: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Pam! Whoa, whoa, I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I, I, I, I gotta go. I'm getting a call.
column62: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: No you're not.
column63: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: I have to make a call after I finish... my work. You know what? Uh, just don't let anybody in my office under any conditions today. I'm just too busy. Too swamped, you know? I am unreachable. I am incommunicado, capisce?
column64: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: OK.
column65: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Thank you, Oh, gah, here we go again. Gotta go, I have to take this.
column66: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Still no one calling.
column67: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Dwight, what...
column68: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Uh, knock, please. Please knock. This is an office.
column69: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: It says "workspace".
column70: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Same thing.
column71: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: If it's the same thing, then why did you write "workspace"?
column72: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Just knock, Please? As a sign of respect for your superior.
column73: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: You are not my superior.
column74: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Oh gee, then why do I have an office?
column75: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: I thought it was a workspace?
column76: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: OK. Dwight. Are you really in charge of picking the health care plan?
column77: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Yes. And my decision in final.
column78: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: This is a ridiculously awful plan. Because you cut everything.
column79: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Aww, times are tough, Pam. Deal with it.
column80: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: You cut more than you had to, didn't you?
column81: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Sure.
column82: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Well, why did you do that? You work here, don't you want good insurance?
column83: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Don't need it. Never been sick. Perfect immune system.
column84: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: OK, well, if you've never been sick, then you don't have any antibodies.
column85: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: I don't need them. Superior genes. I'm a Schrute. And superior brain power. Through concentration, I can raise and lower my cholesterol at will.
column86: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Why would you want to raise your cholesterol?
column87: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: So I can lower it.
column88: 01x03 - Health Care;Oscar: He literally won't come out of his office.
column89: 01x03 - Health Care;Kevin: He's got to come out sometime. To go to the bathroom.
column90: 01x03 - Health Care;Angela: Kevin! That's inappropriate.
column91: 01x03 - Health Care;Oscar: Michael, can I talk to you?
column92: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Ah, uh, I would love to, but I am really busy. Rain check?
column93: 01x03 - Health Care;Meredith: Michael. Michael, please, can we talk to you about this memo?
column94: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Ah, what? Which memo?
column95: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Dwight's health care memo. I told you about it.
column96: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Is it a good plan?
column97: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: It's a great plan. It saves the company a fortune.
column98: 01x03 - Health Care;Oscar: It's like a pay decrease.
column99: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Michael, he made huge cuts.
column100: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Cuts? What? Wow, Dwight, did you make cuts?
column101: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Yeah, you said...
column102: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: No, no , no, you know what? I said nothing specific because I was so busy. Why don't you go in there and find these people a plan that will work for them? OK?
column103: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: I can handle that.
column104: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: OK? All right. Do we feel good? All right. Good. Plus, there's some other good news. Today, at the end of the day, I will have, for all of you, a big surprise. OK? So hang in there, and I will see you at the end of the day. Right?
column105: 01x03 - Health Care;Oscar: This is not good.
column106: 01x03 - Health Care;Angela: It's ridiculous. Did you talk to him?
column107: 01x03 - Health Care;Oscar: What was that?
column108: 01x03 - Health Care;Angela: You let him walk all over you. It's just pathetic.
column109: 01x03 - Health Care;Kevin: What are you guys talking about?
column110: 01x03 - Health Care;Angela: Nothing, Kevin.
column111: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Do I know what the surprise is? Hell no! It doesn't matter. The point is, they're not unhappy anymore. They're out there thinking, "Wow, my boss really cares about me. He has a surprise. He's cool. I... what a great guy. I love him. I... love him.
column112: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: OK, everyone. Gather round. Step forward. It has been brought to my attention that some of you are unhappy with my plan. So what I'd like you to do is to fill this out and write down any diseases you have that you might want covered and I'll see what I can do.
column113: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: OK, you know what Dwight? We can't write our diseases down for you because that's confidential.
column114: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: OK, well, I didn't say to write your name down, did I? Fill it out, leave it anonymous. Or, don't write any disease down at all and it won't be covered. Sound fair? Good. I'll be in my office.
column115: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Workspace.
column116: 01x03 - Health Care;
column117: 01x03 - Health Care;
column118: 01x03 - Health Care;
column119: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: You know what? Come with me. We are going on a little mission. Operation Surprise.
column120: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Where are you going?
column121: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Um, headed out. Part of my busy day, you know. Meetings. [Giggles] Couldn't find the knob.
column122: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: So, basically, I want to do something nice for my employees. Atlantic City, OK? They have this thing where they send a bus, right, for free. Picks everybody up, you head down there, get to the hotel, room is comped, they give you a pile of chips, and your food, everything just kind of all-inclusive, free kind of weekend.
column123: 01x03 - Health Care;Travel Agent: I don't know of anything like that, but, um, you know what you might want to do, is just call those casinos directly. Um, maybe?
column124: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Yeah, yeah, yeah. I did, so...
column125: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Wait. What are you writing? Don't write Ebola or mad cow disease. Right? 'Cause I'm suffering from both.
column126: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: I'm inventing new diseases.
column127: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Oh, great.
column128: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: So, let's say my teeth turn to liquid and then, they drip down the back of my throat. What would you call that?
column129: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: I thought you said you were inventing diseases? That's spontaneous dental hydroplosion.
column130: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Nice.
column131: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Thank you.
column132: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: [on his cell phone] Calling you to ask you a little favoroonie my friend. Um, trying to give the troops around here a little bit of a boost. And I was thinking that maybe we could take them down to take a spin on your big ride.
column133: 01x03 - Health Care;Man on Phone: You mean the elevator that takes you down into the mineshaft? It's not really a ride.
column134: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Its says here that it's a 300ft drop.
column135: 01x03 - Health Care;Man on Phone: It goes 300 feet into the earth, but it moves really slowly.
column136: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: So it's not a free fall?
column137: 01x03 - Health Care;Man on Phone: It's an industrial coal elevator.
column138: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Uh, all right. Well, once you get down into the mine, what... you got laser tag or something?
column139: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: OK, so I don't know what the surprise is. Am I worried? No. No way. See, I thrive on this. This is my world. This is improv. This is Whose Line is it Anyway?
column140: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Damnit! Damnit Jim!
column141: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: All right, who did this? I'm not mad. I just want to know who did it so I can punish them.
column142: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: What are you talking about?
column143: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Uh, someone forged, uh, medical information and that is a felony.
column144: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: OK, whoa. 'Cause that is a pretty intense accusation. How do you know that they're fake?
column145: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Uh, leprosy? Flesh eating bacteria. Hot-dog fingers. Government-created killer nanorobot infection.
column146: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: You did this, didn't you?
column147: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Absolutely not.
column148: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Yes you did.
column149: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: No I didn't.
column150: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: I know it was you. Fine. You know what? I'll have to interview each and every one of you until the perpetrator makes him or herself known. And until that time, there will be no health care coverage for any one!
column151: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Killer nanorobots?
column152: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: It's an epidemic.
column153: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: The problem, Jim, is that people who are really suffering from a medical condition won't receive the care they need, because someone in this office is coming up with all this ridiculous stuff. [reads off of paper] "Count Choculitis"
column154: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Sounds tough.
column155: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Why did you write that down Jim? Is it because you know I love Count Chocula?
column156: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Do you?
column157: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: I think you need to confess...
column158: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Mmm hmm.
column159: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: ...the fact...
column160: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Yep.
column161: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: What are you doing? Those are my keys.
column162: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Good luck. [closes door and locks it]
column163: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Jim! Damnit! No! Jim! Let me out! Jim! Let... [Without looking, Jim throws his keys to his left, they land on a shelf next to Stanley]
column164: 01x03 - Health Care;Stanley: [looks at keys, continues talking on phone] ...the light green or green...
column165: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: [answering phone] Jim Halpert.
column166: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Let me out.
column167: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Who is this?
column168: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Let me out or you're fired.
column169: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: No, you can't fire me.
column170: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Yes I can. I'm manager for the day. Clean out your desk.
column171: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: OK, can you hold on? I'm getting the, ah, beep. [presses button on phone]] Jim Halpert.
column172: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: [on phone] Hey, Jim. It's Pam.
column173: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Hey Pam! How are you?
column174: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Jim! Open the door!
column175: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Good, how are you? Busy?
column176: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: I'm doing OK. Getting excited for the weekend though. What are you up to?
column177: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Jim!
column178: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Um, I'm not bothering you, am I?
column179: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: No, not at all.
column180: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: You don't have anything you're doing?
column181: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: I have nothing to do.
column182: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Jim!
column183: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Oh great. Um, no, this weekend? Nothing. I'm not really doing anything.
column184: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Jim!
column185: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Oh yeah?
column186: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: I might go to the mall.
column187: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: The mall?
column188: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Jim!
column189: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: I need new shoes.
column190: 01x03 - Health Care;Jim: Oh, interesting, what kind of shoes?
column191: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: Hello?
column192: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Uh, hello. Uh, this is Dwight Schrute calling for Jan Levenson-Gould.
column193: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: This is Jan.
column194: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Hi. Dwight Schrute calling, acting manager, Scranton branch. Listen, I needed your permission to fire Jim Halpert.
column195: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: Who is this?
column196: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Dwight Schrute.
column197: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: From sales?
column198: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Well...
column199: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: Where's Michael Scott?
column200: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: He is not here right now. He put me in charge of the office.
column201: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: Dwight, listen to me very carefully. You are not a manager of anything. Understand?
column202: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: That's not entirely true, because he put me in charge of picking the health care plan.
column203: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: Really?
column204: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Yeah.
column205: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: OK, when Michael gets back, you tell him to call me immediately.
column206: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Call you immediately. Good. Oh, hey, listen, um, since I have you on the phone, um, can I fire Jim?
column207: 01x03 - Health Care;Jan: No. Please don't use my cell phone ever again.
column208: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Oh, this is your cell, I thought this was your... [dial tone]
column209: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Hey, hey, everybody, Ice-cream sandwiches! Aaaahh! [laughs] Here you go. Take one, take one. It's all good. Phyllis, think fast. Ya-bome! Oh, oh, I see Angela. Angela? Right? Waaaaah! Oh, hey temp. Why don't you take two? Because you don't get health care. And uh, faster metabolism.
column210: 01x03 - Health Care;Ryan: Did you get the kind with the cookies? Instead of the...
column211: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Why don't you just eat it, OK? And here you go, Stanley the manly.
column212: 01x03 - Health Care;Stanley: Oh, thanks.
column213: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: There you go.
column214: 01x03 - Health Care;Stanley: This isn't the big surprise, is it? Because we've been having a pretty horrible day.
column215: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Uh, nope. Nope. This isn't the surprise. It's surprising, um... because you didn't expect it. But you will... you'll know it when you see it.
column216: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Michael. Michael?
column217: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: [under his breath] Oh, Christ.
column218: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: I tried being rational, OK? And what happened? The employees went crazy, I got no help from corporate. That leaves me with no options.
column219: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: I'm now going to read out loud your submitted medical conditions. When you hear yours read, please raise your hand to indicate that it is real. If you do not raise your hand, it will not be covered.
column220: 01x03 - Health Care;Stanley: What about confidentiality?
column221: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: You know what? You have forfeited that privilege. I have tried to treat you all as adults, but obviously I am the only adult here. Number one, inverted pen1s.
column222: 01x03 - Health Care;Meredith: Could you mean v*g1n*? Because if you do, I want that covered.
column223: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: I thought your v*g1n* was removed during your hysterectomy?
column224: 01x03 - Health Care;Meredith: A uterus is different from a v*g1n*. I still have a v*g1n*.
column225: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: OK, great. Dermatitis. Thank you Angela. I'll make sure that's covered. OK, now. Who wrote this, hysterical one? a**l fissures?
column226: 01x03 - Health Care;Kevin: That's a real thing.
column227: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Yeah, but no one here has it.
column228: 01x03 - Health Care;Kevin: Someone has it.
column229: 01x03 - Health Care;Kevin: Do you think we should go ?
column230: 01x03 - Health Care;Oscar: I don't know, Kevin. This is important. I don't want... [spots Michael through the blinds] There he is.
column231: 01x03 - Health Care;Kevin: What is he doing?
column232: 01x03 - Health Care;Oscar: I don't know.
column233: 01x03 - Health Care;Oscar: Well?
column234: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Well, what? You could be referring to anything.
column235: 01x03 - Health Care;Oscar: OK, the health care plan.
column236: 01x03 - Health Care;Pam: Why did you put Dwight in charge of that? He did a horrible job.
column237: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Uh, Dwight? Did you raise benefits?
column238: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: I most certainly did not.
column239: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Oh come on! That's horrible! Aaah... Thanks, Dwight, for a crappy plan. Ah, Damn! Oh, mmm, I wish I had time to change it, but Jan needs it by five, and... what time is it, what time is it? [looks at watch] Ah, it's after five. Oh, oh it's awful. So, well, OK. See you guys on Monday.
column240: 01x03 - Health Care;Angela: What about the surprise?
column241: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Oh... Yes. Exactly. Thank you Angela, for reminding me. Terrific. Um, before I tell everybody what the big surprise is, would you like to tell me what you think the big surprise is?
column242: 01x03 - Health Care;Stanley: We all think you don't have a surprise.
column243: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: All right, I have some news for you. There is a big surprise. And... here it is. Here we go. And the big surprise is... Brrrrrrrr! Drum roll... Brrrrrrrr! Brrrrrrrr!
column244: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: When I am backed into a corner, that is when I come alive. See I learned improve from the greats, like, um, Drew Carey and Ryan Stiles.
column245: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: [clapping hands] God, yeah... Ah! This...
column246: 01x03 - Health Care;Michael: Robin Williams. Oh, man, would I love to go head-to-head with him. Oh! That would be exciting. [as Robin Williams] "Hi. I'm Mork from Ork." Well, I'm Bork from Spork. Nanoo, nanoo. Jibelee, baloobaloo.
column247: 01x03 - Health Care;Dwight: Oh, um... Jan wants you to call her.

column1: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Michael!?
column2: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Oh! God. Dwight, come on...
column3: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: I wanted to talk to you about the downsizing?
column4: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: There's no downsizing.
column5: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: I, but if there were, I'd be protected as assistant regional manager?
column6: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Assistant to the regional manager Dwight.
column7: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Yeah, so I don't have to worry?
column8: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Look, look, look. I talked to corporate, about protecting the sales staff. And they said they couldn't guarantee it if there's downsizing, okay?
column9: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: But there's no downsizing, so just don't...
column10: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Bottom line. Do I need to be worried?
column11: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Mmm, mm, mm. Maybe.
column12: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: It looks like there's gonna be downsizing. And it's part of my job, but... blah! I hate it. I think the main difference between me and Donald Trump is that, uh, I get no pleasure out of saying the words, "You're fired." [as Donald Trump] "You're foir-ed. Uh, you're foir-ed." It just makes people sad, and an office can't function that way. No way. [as Donald Trump] "You're foir-ed." I think if I had a catchphrase it would be, "You're hired, and you can work here as long as you want." But that's unrealistic, so...
column13: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: It's a real shame, 'cause studies have shown that more information gets passed through water-cooler gossip than through official memos. Which puts me at a disadvantage, because I bring my own water to work.
column14: 01x04 - The Alliance;Stanley: Why'd you do this?
column15: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: I didn't do it. What do you mean? Oh, the water cooler was brought over here for... maintenance. So what do you guys hear? What's the scuttlebutt?
column16: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Get set for Operation Morale Improvement starring Michael Scott. Now, I think I have had a little stroke of genius in that I have had my assistant Pam... Smile, Pam. I have had her go out and find out whose birthday is coming up, so we can have a little celebration for it. Not bad, not bad at all. All right. And the birthday person is... drum roll please. Here we go, who is the birthday, birthday person?
column17: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Who is it? Who's the birthday?
column18: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: Um... Actually, we don't have any staff birthdays coming up.
column19: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Next person on the...
column20: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: Oh.
column21: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: ...calendar.
column22: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: Okay, umm... that would be Meredith.
column23: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Yes! All right, come on down Meredith!
column24: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: But it's not until next month.
column25: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Um... uh, OK. Well, great, well, you know, it'll be a surprise.
column26: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: You still want to have a party?
column27: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Yeah, why not? Sure. Go ahead, live a little. Come on, Pam. Come on, shake it up. Shake it up! Shake it up!
column28: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: [grabs cell phone off desk] Brrrp! Uh, Spock, are there any signs of life down there? Well, let me check Captain. Eeee. Eeee. Eeee. Eeee. No, Captain. No signs of life down here. Just a wet blanket named Pam. Brr-rrrp. Star Trek.
column29: 01x04 - The Alliance;Phyllis: Well, uh, for decorations, maybe we could... it's stupid, forget it.
column30: 01x04 - The Alliance;Angela: What?
column31: 01x04 - The Alliance;Phyllis: I was just going to say, maybe we could have streamers, but that's dumb, everybody has streamers. Never mind.
column32: 01x04 - The Alliance;Angela: No, yeah, I think that's a good idea.
column33: 01x04 - The Alliance;Phyllis: Yeah?
column34: 01x04 - The Alliance;Angela: What color do you guys think?
column35: 01x04 - The Alliance;Phyllis: Well, there's green, um, blue... yellow... red...
column36: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: How about green?
column37: 01x04 - The Alliance;Angela: I think green is kind of whoreish.
column38: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: This was tough. I suggested we flip a coin. But Angela said she doesn't like to gamble. Of course by saying that she was gambling that I wouldn't smack her.
column39: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: These are my party-planning beeyatches. Pulled off an amazing '80s party last year. Off the hook!
column40: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: So I was thinking, if you haven't already got a cake, um, maybe going for one of those ice-cream cakes from Baskin-Robbins. Those are very good. Very Delicious.
column41: 01x04 - The Alliance;Angela: Meredith's allergic to dairy, so...
column42: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: She's not the only one that's going to be eating it, right? I think everybody likes ice-cream cake. It's not, uh, it's not just about her, so...
column43: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: It is... her birthday.
column44: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Mint chocolate chip! That'd be good, how about some, mint chocolate chip?
column45: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Hey, so listen, I was thinking that it might be a good idea if you and I formed an alliance. 'Cause of the downsizing? I think an alliance might be a good idea, you know. Help each other out.
column46: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Do you want to form, an alliance, with me?
column47: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Absolutely, I do.
column48: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Good, good. Excellent, OK. Now we need to figure out who's vulnerable and who's protected...
column49: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: At that moment, I was so happy. I mean, everything Dwight does annoys me.
column50: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Did you get your tickets?
column51: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: To what?
column52: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: The gun show. [Rolls up his sleeve and kisses his bicep]
column53: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: And I spend hours thinking of ways to get back at him, but only in ways that could get me arrested. And then here he comes and he says "No, Jim, here's a way."
column54: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: There's one other thing and this is important. Let's keep this alliance totally a secret. Don't tell anyone.
column55: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: An alliance?
column56: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Oh yeah.
column57: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: What does that even mean?
column58: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: I think it has something to do with Survivor, but I'm not sure.
column59: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Um, I know that it involves spying on people and we may build a fort, underground.
column60: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Jim! Hey. Hi, Pam. Listen, could I talk to you a second about the... paper products?
column61: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Did you tell Pam about the alliance?
column62: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: What? No.
column63: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Just now.
column64: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: What? Oh no no no. Dwight, no. I'm using her, for the alliance. Who knows the most information about this office? Pam.
column65: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Right, that's good, good, pursue this.
column66: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Well I'm trying to. Do you see what I'm doing?
column67: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Mmm hmm.
column68: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: But listen, I'm going to have to talk to her a lot. All right? And there may be chatting, and giggling. And you gotta just pretend to ignore it. Wipe it away.
column69: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Done.
column70: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: All right.
column71: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: [to the camera] Can you get her? She's right there. [camera zooms in on Meredith at here desk] That is Meredith, the birthday girl. And this... is Meredith's card. Happy Bird-Day. [laughs] Um, let's see. Jim, Jim wrote, "Meredith, I heard you're turning 46, but, come on, you're an accountant. Just fudge the numbers." Not bad, pretty funny, I don't appreciate condoning corporate fraud though. Uh, here's the thing. Whatever I write here has to be really, really funny. Because people out there are expecting it. I've already set the bar really high. And they're all worried about their jobs, you know. It's kinda dark out there. Can you imagine if I wrote something like, uh, "Oh, Meredith. Happy Birthday. You're great. Love, Michael." [pretends to vomit and laughs]
column72: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: They seem awfully chummy, don't you think?
column73: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Yeah, what do you think that's about?
column74: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Only one way to find out.
column75: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: I'm on it.
column76: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: You are not going to believe this.
column77: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: What? I believe it.
column78: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Well, tensions were high in the kitchen.
column79: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: I could tell, from the body language.
