column80: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Hey Kev, that looks good. What is it? Turkey?
column81: 01x04 - The Alliance;Kevin: Italian.
column82: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Oh, Italian. Nice. Wow! You got the works there. Red onion, provolone...
column83: 01x04 - The Alliance;Kevin: Yeah.
column84: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Toby and Kevin, they're trying to get Angela kicked off.
column85: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Good, let 'em. It helps our cause.
column86: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Well, I don't know, if Kevin's in accounting, and Toby's in Human Resources and they're talking...
column87: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Oh, they're forming an alliance
column88: 01x04 - The Alliance;Toby: I love their sandwiches.
column89: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: I love their sandwiches too.
column90: 01x04 - The Alliance;Kevin: Their bread's really good.
column91: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Their bread is very good.
column92: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Damn it. God!
column93: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: OK, listen, we need to assume that everyone in the office is forming an alliance and is therefore trying to get us kicked off.
column94: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: God... Damn it! Why us?
column95: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Because we're strong, Dwight. Because we're strong.
column96: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: [staring at birthday card] Meredith, Meredith... Meri... Mary had a little lamb. Mary... Meredith had a little lamb. Don't bring that lamb to work or it'll poop on the floor.
column97: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Hey, Oscar! Come on in. What's up?
column98: 01x04 - The Alliance;Oscar: Uh, I'm sorry to bother you.
column99: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Oh, not at all. Come on in. What's going on?
column100: 01x04 - The Alliance;Oscar: My nephew is involved with, um, a charity for cerebral palsy, and I was wondering if maybe you'd like to... you know... if...
column101: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: What?
column102: 01x04 - The Alliance;Oscar: Donate to the charity?
column103: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Oh, God. Of course I would. Get it over here. Get that over here.
column104: 01x04 - The Alliance;Oscar: Thank you.
column105: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: No, I'm always good... for some serious buckage. Wow. Two dollars, three dollars? People out here do not care about diseases. I am going to give you... $25.
column106: 01x04 - The Alliance;Oscar: That's... that's... that's very generous.
column107: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Oh, my gosh, well... Listen, Oscar, generosity and togetherness and community all convalescences into... morale. That's what I say, so...
column108: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: [whispering] Hey, Jim, can I talk to you for a second?
column109: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Sure, what's up?
column110: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: Um, I don't know, I'm just like, I'm going a little crazy 'cause I keep overhearing all these conversations between Michael and corporate about like, staff issues?
column111: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Oh no?
column112: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: Yeah, he's making me take notes on these meetings and I'm, like, "These people are my friends." But he's all like, "This is confidential. You can't tell anybody." But I just feel like I want to... aaah. Just promise me you're not gonna say anything.
column113: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: No, will not, I'm not going to tell anybody. This is between you and me.
column114: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: OK, yeah.
column115: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Jackpot.
column116: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: That was beautiful. All her idea too. Awesome. She is so great.
column117: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: [looking at birthday card] Meredith, bad breath. Meredith has bad breath.
column118: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Hey, you wanted to see me?
column119: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Yeah. What do you know about Meredith?
column120: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: I don't think she'd be missed.
column121: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: There's not going to be downsizing Dwight, OK? I just, I need to know a little bit more about my friend.
column122: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Name, Meredith Palmer. Uh, personal information, divorced twice, two kids. Uh, Employer, Dunder Mifflin Paper Incorporated. Awards, multiple Dundies.
column123: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: I know all that. I know all that. I just, I need something kind of embarrassing, you know. Kind of fun, inside.
column124: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: She had a hysterectomy.
column125: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: [laughs] Which one is that again?
column126: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: That's where they remove the uterus.
column127: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Oh God! Dwight, no. I'm trying to write something funny. What am I going to do with a removed uterus?
column128: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: It could be kind of funny.
column129: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: You know what, I am on a deadline here, and just... OK. Thanks, thanks for your help. I'll work it out. Thank you Dwight. That was a waste of time.
column130: 01x04 - The Alliance;
column131: 01x04 - The Alliance;
column132: 01x04 - The Alliance;
column133: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: OK, here's the deal. All right? Pam says that one of the alliances is meeting in the warehouse during Meredith's birthday.
column134: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Oh my God, we have to be there.
column135: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: I know, but it's gonna be a little tough because there's no good place to hide there.
column136: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: No no, yes there is. Behind the shelves. Oh my God.
column137: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: What? What?
column138: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: I know. I know exactly what to do.
column139: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: [gives Dwight a high five] Great.
column140: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: I'm a deer hunter. I go all the time with my dad. One thing about deer, they have very good vision. One thing about me, I am better at hiding than they are... at vision.
column141: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: This is going to be perfect, OK? Centrally located. Perfect cover. I can hear and see everything.
column142: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Good.
column143: 01x04 - The Alliance;Ryan: Michael? Are you done yet?
column144: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Almost there. Just a sec. Just a second. It is perfect, thank you. Excellent, here we go. It is time, thank you. OK, come on. Let's go! Get the cake. Here we go. Come on! Shhh. Be quiet.
column145: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Wait, this isn't gonna work. The lid's open.
column146: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: So tape it down.
column147: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: I can't do that. You won't be able to breathe.
column148: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Look, I can breathe just fine. OK, but if it makes you feel better, I'll poke holes in the box.
column149: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Thank you, thank you. OK.
column150: 01x04 - The Alliance;Everybody: Surprise!
column151: 01x04 - The Alliance;Meredith: Oh! Surprise.
column152: 01x04 - The Alliance;Angela: No, it's ah...
column153: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: It's surprise Meredith. One, two...
column154: 01x04 - The Alliance;Everybody: [tunelessly] Happy birthday to you.
column155: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Find a key.
column156: 01x04 - The Alliance;Everybody: Happy birthday...
column157: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: So do you want me to stay here and, you know, stand next to the box?
column158: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: No, you need to go upstairs to the party so people don't notice we're both gone.
column159: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Right... That's good.
column160: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Can I trust Jim? I don't know. Do I have a choice? No, frankly, I don't. Will I trust Jim? Yes. Should I trust Jim? You tell me.
column161: 01x04 - The Alliance;Everybody: [singing] ... birthday, dear Meredith Happy birthday to you...
column162: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: And many more!
column163: 01x04 - The Alliance;Stanley: Last year, five years ago...
column164: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: You were surprised, weren't you?
column165: 01x04 - The Alliance;Meredith: Yes.
column166: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: You looked freaked, man. We said "Surprise." You were, like, "What?" "What the hell's goin' on here?" Good cake. Why don't you have some?
column167: 01x04 - The Alliance;Meredith: Uh, I can't. Um...
column168: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Come on. A little bit.
column169: 01x04 - The Alliance;Meredith: I can't eat dairy.
column170: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Oh, right. God, too bad. It's so good.
column171: 01x04 - The Alliance;Meredith: Yeah, it makes me sick.
column172: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: You know what? If I were allergic to dairy, I think I'd kill myself. 'Cause this is way, way too good.
column173: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: He's in a box?
column174: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Pam, he's in a box. He's downstairs, in a box, on the floor, near the shelves. I'm serious. Go down there and work your magic.
column175: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: [on her cell phone] Hey where are you? Yeah, we were supposed to meet here. What? Oh my gosh! That ties in perfectly with something that Michael was telling me earlier! I just don't know what some of the people in, like, accounting are going to do? It said specifically that...
column176: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: [box falls over] Oh.
column177: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Jim, good party, huh? Just a little something I whipped up. You know, a little morale boost. No big deal.
column178: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Speaking of which, I meant to tell you. Very impressive, the uh, donation you gave to Oscar's charity. What was it? 25 bucks?
column179: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Well, you know, money isn't everything Jim. It's not the key to happiness. You know what is? Joy. You should remember that. Maybe you'll give more than three dollars next time.
column180: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: Yeah, well, three dollars a mile. It's gonna end up being like 50 bucks. So... God, I can't even calculate what you're gonna have to give.
column181: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Is Oscar around?
column182: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: I just thought it was kind of a flat, you know... 25 dollar, one-time donation. I didn't think it was per mile kinda deal. You know, so...
column183: 01x04 - The Alliance;Oscar: Well, that's what a walk-a-thon is.
column184: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: I know...
column185: 01x04 - The Alliance;Oscar: It says it right on the sheet. Look, look at the sheet. It says, "However many dollars per mile."
column186: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Right. Got it. Yes. So it does. Um...
column187: 01x04 - The Alliance;Oscar: I just think it's kind of cheap to un-donate money to a charity.
column188: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: No, no, no, no, no. That wasn't what I wasn't, that wasn't... No. It-it-it's not about the money. It's just... it... it's the ethics of the thing, Oscar. How's your nephew? Is he in good shape?
column189: 01x04 - The Alliance;Oscar: Yeah.
column190: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: How many miles did he do last year?
column191: 01x04 - The Alliance;Oscar: Last year, he walked 18 miles.
column192: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Son of a bitch. That is impressive.
column193: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: Happy Birthday. [gives Meredith her card]
column194: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Read it out loud. And say who wrote everything so we know whose is the best.
column195: 01x04 - The Alliance;Meredith: "Happy Bird-day" Um... "Meredith, good news. You're not actually a year older because you work here, where time stands still."
column196: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: [under his breath] I don't know about that.
column197: 01x04 - The Alliance;Meredith: That was Stanley. "Meredith, happy birthday, you're the best. Love, Pam."
column198: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: [pretends to vomit] Huh! Thanks, downer.
column199: 01x04 - The Alliance;Meredith: This is from Michael. "Meredith, let's hope the only downsizing that happens to you is that someone downsizes your age."
column200: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Because of the downsizing. Rumors. And because you're gettin' old.
column201: 01x04 - The Alliance;Meredith: No, I... I get it. It's funny.
column202: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: [laughs] You didn't get the joke. So, that's cool. That's, you know what? Actually... I have a bunch of these, good ones, that I didn't use. Um... Oh, where's that? Oh, OK, here's a good one. Um... "Hey Meredith, Liz Taylor called, she wants her age back and her divorces back." 'Cause Meredith's been divorced like, twice. Is that right?
column203: 01x04 - The Alliance;Meredith: You're right. You're right. Yes.
column204: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Divorce. Um... OK, "Meredith is so old..."
column205: 01x04 - The Alliance;Oscar: How old is she?
column206: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Everybody? If... could do it? "Meredith is so old..."
column207: 01x04 - The Alliance;Everybody: How old is she?
column208: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: "She's so old, she went into an antique store and they kept her."
column209: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: That wasn't even mine. I got that off the Internet. Website. Um, don't get mad at me.
column210: 01x04 - The Alliance;Oscar: Uh, nice party Michael.
column211: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: This isn't my fault. Ladies, not your best effort. The streamers? I think we could have done better than that.
column212: 01x04 - The Alliance;Angela: Phyllis wanted red, I didn't.
column213: 01x04 - The Alliance;Phyllis: Oh, boy... You...
column214: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: OK, we... all right. People, hold on, hold on. Just a second. OK, I think we're losing sight of what is really important here. And that is that we are... a group of people... who work together. I was... I really wasn't gonna flaunt this. I have made a very sizable donation to Oscar's nephew's... walkathon. $25.
column215: 01x04 - The Alliance;Oscar: Per mile.
column216: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Per mile, yes.
column217: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: When I retire, I... don't want to just disappear to an island somewhere. I wanna be the guy who gives everything back.
column218: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: A check for the kids, and for the team.
column219: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: I want it to be like... "Hey, who donated that hospital wing that is saving so many lives?" "Um, well, I don't, I don't know. It was anonymous." "Well, guess what, [whispering] that was Michael Scott." "But it was anonymous, how do you know?" "Because I'm him."
column220: 01x04 - The Alliance;Oscar: Thank you, Michael.
column221: 01x04 - The Alliance;Michael: Come here. [hugs Oscar and In a low voice] Don't cash that till Friday, OK?
column222: 01x04 - The Alliance;Toby: Really? Today?
column223: 01x04 - The Alliance;Ryan: Yeah.
column224: 01x04 - The Alliance;Toby: Oh, Happy Birthday.
column225: 01x04 - The Alliance;Ryan: Thanks.
column226: 01x04 - The Alliance;Toby: Yeah, I could say something.
column227: 01x04 - The Alliance;Ryan: No, don't. Don't do that.
column228: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: OK, OK. I have something that totally tops the box.
column229: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: Oh, tell me, tell me.
column230: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: OK. I have just convinced Dwight that he needs to go to Stamford and... [Pam starts laughing]... spy on our other branch. No no no.
column231: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: But before he does so, I told him that he should dye his hair to go undercover.
column232: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: [laughing] That's perfect!
column233: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: If we can get him to drive to Connecticut... and put peroxide in his hair...
column234: 01x04 - The Alliance;Roy: [yelling] What the hell is this? What are you trying to cop a feel or something? Huh Halpert?
column235: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: No, no, dude, no.
column236: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: Hey, Hey!
column237: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: No, dude, no, I was just, listen! Whoa.
column238: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: Come on.
column239: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: God, I don't even, I don't even know how to explain this. Uh, um... Dwight, uh, asked me to be in an alliance. And then um... um... we were... we've just been messing with him. Uh, because of the whole alliance thing. Um...
column240: 01x04 - The Alliance;Pam: It's just office pranks.
column241: 01x04 - The Alliance;Jim: It's stupid. It's, it's just office pranks.
column242: 01x04 - The Alliance;Roy: [looking at Dwight] An alliance? What the hell is he talking about?
column243: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: I have absolutely no idea.
column244: 01x04 - The Alliance;Roy: Come on.
column245: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: Do I feel bad about betraying Jim? Not at all. That's the game. Convince him we're in an alliance, get some information, throw him to the wolves.
column246: 01x04 - The Alliance;Dwight: [With blonde hair] That's politics baby. Get what you can out of someone, then crush them. I think Jim might have learned a very valuable lesson.

column1: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: [to Jim] Hey, you ready?
column2: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: All right, all right, secret sign. Hey, Ryan. [Ryan holds up his bag] Very good. Excellent, excellent.
column3: 01x05 - Basketball;Dwight: Michael!
column4: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: Today at lunchtime we're going to be playing the warehouse staff at a friendly little game of basketball. My idea. Last time I was down there, I noticed they'd put up a couple of hoops, and I play basketball every weekend. So I thought, "This might be kinda fun." And so I started messing around and... I'm sinking a few, you know. Swish, swish, swish. Nothing but net. And their jaws just dropped to the floor. African-Americans! So... you know, it's really just a good friendly game, a reason to get together.
column5: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: Pam, Pam, thank you ma'am. Messages, please. Thank you.
column6: 01x05 - Basketball;Dwight: Michael, can I talk to you, please? Privately? In your office? I think I should be on the team.
column7: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: No. And that's not me being mean, Dwight. That is based on your past behavior.
column8: 01x05 - Basketball;Dwight: Oh, please.
column9: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: [to camera] When I let him come to my pick-up game...
column10: 01x05 - Basketball;Dwight: I apologized for that.
column11: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: [to Dwight] I vouched for you.
column12: 01x05 - Basketball;Dwight: Michael, I...
column13: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: I vouched for you in front of Todd Packer, Dwight. All right, here's what I'm going to do. The hand strikes and gives a flower. You are not going to play basketball. But I need somebody to come in and take over the holiday and weekend work calendar.
column14: 01x05 - Basketball;Dwight: I can handle that.
column15: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: Good. Excellent, it'll be fun. Because corporate, uh, wants someone to be here on Saturday. And so we're going to have to have some people come in on the weekend, and I know nobody's gonna want to do it and I know everybody's gonna complain and bitch and I don't want to have to deal with that.
column16: 01x05 - Basketball;Dwight: And that's why you have an assistant regional manager.
column17: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: Yes it is. Assistant to the regional manager.
column18: 01x05 - Basketball;Dwight: [to camera] Same thing.
column19: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: No, it's not. It's lower, so...
column20: 01x05 - Basketball;Dwight: It's close.
column21: 01x05 - Basketball;Dwight: So we need someone to work this Saturday and I think that, that should be...Jim.
column22: 01x05 - Basketball;Jim: God, this is so sad. This is the smallest amount of power I've ever seen go to someone's head. Phyllis, can you believe this?
column23: 01x05 - Basketball;Phyllis: Keep me out of it.
column24: 01x05 - Basketball;Pam: My fiance has plans for us this Saturday. So I really hope that Dwight doesn't make me work. Maybe I should sleep with him? I'm kidding, kidding. Totally kidding.
column25: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: All right, managing by walking around. This is our warehouse. Or, as I like to call it, the whorehouse. But don't you call it that, I've earned the right.
column26: 01x05 - Basketball;Ryan: Fine, don't worry about that.
column27: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: And here we have "Mister Roger's Neighborhood." Come on over here. Hey, this is Ryan. He's temping upstairs.
column28: 01x05 - Basketball;Lonny: What's up?
column29: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: And this is the foreman. Mista Ra-jahs.
column30: 01x05 - Basketball;Darryl: It's not my real name.
column31: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: No, it's Darryl. Darryl is Mista Ra-jahs.
column32: 01x05 - Basketball;Ryan: Darryl Rogers?
column33: 01x05 - Basketball;Darryl: Darryl Philbin. Then Regis, then Rege, then Roger, then Mister Rogers.
column34: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: [laughs] And that is Lonny. And this is Roy. Roy dates Pam. You know, the uh, the best looking one upstairs.
column35: 01x05 - Basketball;Ryan: Yeah, yeah.
column36: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: You still getting it regular man? Huh? I mean, I can tell her it's part of the job! Rapport!
column37: 01x05 - Basketball;Pam: [on the phone] No, no, I know that the warranty's expired, but isn't it supposed to last longer than two years if it isn't defective? OK, fine, three years.
column38: 01x05 - Basketball;Jim: Pam gets a little down. Her toaster oven broke. Um, which she got at her engagement shower. Um, for a wedding that still has yet to be set... and that was three years ago.
column39: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: So, um, one o'clock sharp and we've got a game on.
column40: 01x05 - Basketball;Darryl: We're loading at one.
column41: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: Oh, I see, you're chickening out on me. You're bailing on me.
column42: 01x05 - Basketball;Darryl: No, we got a truck going out at 1:15. So, that's the busy time.
column43: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: Oh, well, I'm glad that some time is a busy time because whenever I'm down here it doesn't seem too busy to me. Oh, oh. You can dish it out, but you can't take it. OK, fine, have it your way. [clucking and dancing like a chicken]
column44: 01x05 - Basketball;Darryl: All right, fine, you know what? One o'clock.
column45: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: All right, see you at one.
column46: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: Are we ready for the game?
column47: 01x05 - Basketball;Everybody: [half-heartedly] Yeah.
column48: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: I... yeah, yeah. I know, grumble, grumble. But you would follow me to the ends of the earth, grumbling all the way. Like that, uh, dwarf from Lord of the Rings.
column49: 01x05 - Basketball;Dwight: Gimli.
column50: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: Nerd. That is why you're not on the team.
column51: 01x05 - Basketball;Dwight: Just trying to be helpful.
column52: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: Uh, [in a nerdy voice] "I'll help, Elwyn Dragonslayer, uh, ten points, power sword."
column53: 01x05 - Basketball;Jim: That's him.
column54: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: OK, so, let's put together a starting line-up, shall we? Stanley of course.
column55: 01x05 - Basketball;Stanley: I'm sorry?
column56: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: Um, what do you play? Center?
column57: 01x05 - Basketball;Stanley: Why "of course"?
column58: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: Uh...
column59: 01x05 - Basketball;Stanley: What's that supposed to mean?
column60: 01x05 - Basketball;Michael: Uh, I don't know. I don't remember saying that.
column61: 01x05 - Basketball;Jim: Uh, I heard it.

column1: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Tonight is the Dundies, the annual employee awards night here at Dunder Mifflin. [holds up a trophy of a business man] And this is everybody's favorite day. Everybody looks forward to it, because, you know, a lot of the people here don't get trophies, very often. Like Meredith or Kevin, I mean, who's gonna give Kevin an award? Dunkin' Donuts? Plus, bonus, it's really, really funny. So I, you know, an employee will go home, and he'll tell his neighbor, "Hey, did you get an award?" And the neighbor will say, "No man. I mean, I slave all day and nobody notices me." Next thing you know, employee smells something terrible coming from neighbor's house. Neighbor's hanged himself due to lack of recognition. So...
column2: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: So, you ready for the... the Dundies?
column3: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Ugh...

column45: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Okay, now I'm laughing at you.
column46: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [talking to the speakerphone] Will her highness, Jan Levinson-Gould, be descending from her corporate throne this evening to visit us lowly serfs here at Dunder Mifflin Scranton?
column47: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jan: [on speaker phone] It's a, it's, it's a two and a half hour drive from New York, Michael.
column48: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Well, you could take the bus. You could work on the way here. Sleep on the way home.
column49: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jan: No.
column50: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Wuh... Come on, Jan. This is important. I mean, this is, this is, validation to my employees here that you and corporate approve of this. So...
column51: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jan: No, we don't approve of this Michael. I mean, y-you only had the budget for one office party a year, so... we're not paying for this.
column52: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Um...
column53: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Michael looks at the camera and motions for the camera to leave the office]
column54: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [to camera] Could you...?
column55: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jan: Are you there Michael?
column56: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Yeah, I'm here, I just wanted to, uh, talk to you for a second about that.
column57: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Michael closes the blinds]
column58: 02x01 - The Dundies;[The camera tries to find a crack in the blinds]
column59: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Um, what, ah, what is, I mean...
column60: 02x01 - The Dundies;[The camera pans around to reception, Pam is listening]
column61: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: ...come on, Jan!
column62: 02x01 - The Dundies;[The camera goes to a side of Michael's office where the blinds are still partially open]
column63: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: You're dropping an A-Bomb on me here.
column64: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jan: Really? I'm dropping an atomic bomb on you?
column65: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Well, yeah, I mean, what is...
column66: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jan: You already had a party on May 5th for no reason.
column67: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: No reason?! It was the 05 05 05 party...
column68: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jan: And you had a luau....
column69: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: ...it happens once every billion years.
column70: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jan: And a tsunami relief fundraiser which somehow lost a lot of money.
column71: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Okay, no, that was a FUN raiser. I think I made that very clear in the fliers, fun, F-U-N.
column72: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jan: Okay, well, I don't understand why anyone would have a tsunami FUN raiser, Michael. I mean, that doesn't even make sense.
column73: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Well, I think a lot of people were very affected by the footage.
column74: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: This is a little character I like to do [places a green turban with a yellow feather on his head], it is, uh, loosely based on Karnack, one of Carson's classic characters. [puts an envelope to his head] Here we go. The PLO, the IRA, and the hot dog stand behind the warehouse. [tears open envelope and pulls out card] "Name three businesses that have a better health care plans than Dunder Mifflin." Here's the problem. There's no open bar because of Jan and it's the reason why comedy clubs have a two drink minimum. It'll be fine, I just...wish people were going to be drunk.
column75: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Phyllis catches Dwight trying to sneak into the girls bathroom]
column76: 02x01 - The Dundies;Phyllis: Dwight, get out of here!!
column77: 02x01 - The Dundies;[The door swings open and Dwight is being pushed out by Phyllis]
column78: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: No, no, no, no...
column79: 02x01 - The Dundies;Phyllis: What were you doing in the ladies room?!
column80: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: ...no, no, no, no, it's not what you think.
column81: 02x01 - The Dundies;Phyllis: Why were you peering over the stalls?!
column82: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: No, why were you in there?!
column83: 02x01 - The Dundies;Phyllis: You are a pervert!
column84: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: What were you doing in there?
column85: 02x01 - The Dundies;Phyllis: You, are, a pervert!
column86: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: I am not.
column87: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [in video] The Dundie award for "Longest Engagement" goes to Pam Beesley.
column88: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Pam, everybody! [starts clapping]
column89: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Pam just sits there stirring her drink, rolls her eyes and glances over at Jim]
column90: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Jim, at the adjacent table, crosses his arms and glances over at Pam, both look annoyed]
column91: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Whoooo! When is that girl gonna get married? That's what I have to say. Ah, Roy's accepting.
column92: 02x01 - The Dundies;Roy: [on video] Yes.
column93: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [on video] Thank you Roy. Are there any words you'd like to say, on Pam's behalf?
column94: 02x01 - The Dundies;Roy: [on video] Ah, w-we'll see you next year.
column95: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [on video] Yeah, oh, hope not! Oh God!
column96: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: I'm not changing that, it's the best one.
column97: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: No, it's hilarious, you're right. I just think, um, "world's longest engagement", um, we're all expecting it, you know?
column98: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: That's why it's funny. Every year that Roy and Pam don't get married, it gets funnier.
column99: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Well I think if you use the same jokes it just comes across as lazy.
column100: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Oh, [taking it to heart] lazy. Uh huh.
column101: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: Excuse me, everyone, could I have your attention please. I just wanted to say that the women in this office are terrible. Especially the ones who wrote that stuff about Michael on the bathroom wall. Having a bathroom is a privilege. It is called a ladies room for a reason. And if you cannot behave like ladies, well then you are not going to have a bathroom.
column102: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: You're taking away our bathroom?
column103: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: We are going to have two men's rooms.
column104: 02x01 - The Dundies;Phyllis: But where would we...go?
column105: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: Be prepared to hold folks [Michael comes out of his office] From 9 am to...
column106: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Michael...
column107: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Yes.
column108: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: ...Dwight is banning us from our bathroom.
column109: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Okay, well, that's just ridiculous, so just don't, I-I don't have time for this right now.
column110: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: Nnnnno, there needs to be repercussions...
column111: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Just don't, don't talk-
column112: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: ...for people's behavior.
column113: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Don't talk-
column114: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: And it's-
column115: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Just STAP IT YAP IT!!!!
column116: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Okay, look, I know there have been a lot of rumors flying around about the Dundies this year. How there is no money, and how there is no food, and how the jokes are really bad, but WHAT THE HELL EVERYBODY!? I mean, God. The Dundies are about the best, in every, one of us. Can't you see that? I mean, okay, we can do better. so, tonight, for the first time, we are inviting all of your friends and family to attend the awards with us.
column117: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: [with a small fist pump] Yes!
column118: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Yeah, not bad, right? So let's make this the best Dundies ever.
column119: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: [clapping] Best Dundies ever.
column120: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: Welcome to the eighth annual Dundies awards.
column121: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Quick cut to everybody talking and ignoring Dwight]
column122: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: Before we get started, a few announcements. Keep your acceptance speeches short, I have wrap it up music, and I'm not afraid to use it. [points] Devon!
column123: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: "The Dundies, how can I explain it? Awards you like to hate it. I'm psyched you all made it. You never had to work so hard and feel that no one notices you. You're just a name and number and no one even says hello." [to Ryan] Card!
column124: 02x01 - The Dundies;Oscar: The Dundies are kind of like a kid's birthday party, and you go, and there's really nothing for you to do there. But the kid's having a really good time, so you're, kind of there. That's-that's kind of what it's like.
column125: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: "You down with The Dundies? You down with the Dundie-"
column126: 02x01 - The Dundies;[The music stops, Michael looks back at Dwight]
column127: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: The waitress tripped on the cord.
column128: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Alright, alright, joke landed. So we are here, thank you all for coming to the 2005 Dundie awards. [takes off sweater to reveal tuxedo] I am your host, Michael Scott. And I just want to tell you please, please, do not drink and drive. Because you may hit a bump and spill the drink!
column129: 02x01 - The Dundies;Kevin: [to waitress] Oh, just put these on the group tab.
column130: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Nope, actually this year, ah, no group tab, we're going to be doing separate checks.
column131: 02x01 - The Dundies;Stanley: You said, we could bring our families.
column132: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: I did. And why didn't ya Stanley?
column133: 02x01 - The Dundies;Stanley: I did, my wife's name is Terri.
column134: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Well, I'm looking forward to meeting Terri.
column135: 02x01 - The Dundies;Stanley: It's this person who's hand I'm holding Michael.
column136: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Michael is dumbfounded, Dwight pushes a button on his keyboard that says, "OHHH, YEAHHHH."]
column137: 02x01 - The Dundies;
column138: 02x01 - The Dundies;
column139: 02x01 - The Dundies;
column140: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [to Dwight, in a low voice] Shut it. [normal voice] Um, good. Speaking of relationships, of all, all way shapes and forms. Um, I was out on a very, very hot date with a girl from HR, Dwight.
column141: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: Really? We don't have any girls from HR.
column142: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: No, that...for the sake of the story. And things were getting hot and heavy.
column143: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: Yeah?
column144: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: And I was about to take her bra off...
column145: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: Yeah!
column146: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: ...when she made me fill out six hours of paperwork-
column147: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: Like an AIDS test?
column148: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: No! [under his breath] God.
column149: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [clears throat] Alright, so let's get this party staaaarrrrted.
column150: 02x01 - The Dundies;Darryl: Hey let's go to Poor Richard's.
column151: 02x01 - The Dundies;Roy: Yeah, let's get out of here.
column152: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Um...
column153: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Um, guys, where you going? Pam, show's just getting started.
column154: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Sorry.
column155: 02x01 - The Dundies;Ryan: You staying?
column156: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Yeah, gotta eat somewhere.
column157: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: And now... to someone who quietly goes about their job, but always seems to land the biggest accounts...
column158: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: ...the "Busiest Beaver" award goes to Phyllis Lapin.
column159: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Everybody starts clapping, Phyllis gets out of her booth and makes her way to Michael, she gives Jim a high five along the way]
column160: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Yeah, way to go Phyllis. Nice work, per usual.
column161: 02x01 - The Dundies;Phyllis: This says "Bushiest Beaver".
column162: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: What? I told them busiest...idiots.
column163: 02x01 - The Dundies;Phyllis: It's, it's fine.
column164: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Well, we'll fix it up. You don't have to display that.
column165: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Pam and Roy are at the truck, arguing.]
column166: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: ...because that's what happens every time!
column167: 02x01 - The Dundies;Roy: ...talking about? He's a jackass every year.
column168: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: No.
column169: 02x01 - The Dundies;Roy: [Put's his hand on Pam's arm] Come on, we're going to Poor Richard's.
column170: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: [Breaks Roy's grip] No, I don't want to go, I don't want to.
column171: 02x01 - The Dundies;Roy: Pam. Go.
column172: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: If you would have asked me that, then you would know.
column173: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Michael has false teeth in and glasses with squinted eyes on them]
column174: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [in a stereotypical oriental accent] Herro everybodeeee. I'm gonna cwall Jan Revinson-Gould.
column175: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Hey! How are ya? I thought you left?
column176: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Oh no, I just, I decided to stay.
column177: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Oh!
column178: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: I'll just get a ride home from Angela.
column179: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Oh.
column180: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Oh good, I'm just in time for Ping.
column181: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Yeah.
column182: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [doing impression] Oh, dat wir be fwar. Ah, me so horny.
column183: 02x01 - The Dundies;[The camera zooms to an Asian customer behind Michael, she is looking at Michael in disbelief]
column184: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Right? You know wat I'm talking 'bout.
column185: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: [to an off camera waiter and still clutching Jim's beer] Can I get a drink?
column186: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: This next award goes to somebody, who really, lights up the office.
column187: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Cut to Pam still drinking the beer]
column188: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Somebody, who I think a lot of us, cannot keep, from checking out. The "Hottest in the Office" award goes to... ...Ryan the temp!
column189: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Yeah. [singing to music] "Hidy ho, you sexy thang. You sexy thang you." Here you go.
column190: 02x01 - The Dundies;Ryan: What am I going to do with the award? Nothing. I-I don't know what I'm going to do. That's the least of my...concerns right now.
column191: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: And the "Tight Ass" award goes to Angela. Not only because she is everybody's favorite stickler, but because she has, a great caboose. So...come on down.
column192: 02x01 - The Dundies;Angela: No.
column193: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: [Pam starts sipping an empty glass] I think those might be empty.
column194: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: No, no. 'Cause the ice melts and then it's like second drink! [laughs]
column195: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Second drink?
column196: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: The "Spicy Curry" award goes to our very own Kelly Kapoor! Get on up here. Here you go.
column197: 02x01 - The Dundies;Kelly: "Spicy Curry", what's that mean?
column198: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Um, not everything means something, it's just a joke.
column199: 02x01 - The Dundies;Kelly: Yeah, but why'd you give it to me?
column200: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: I don't know, it's just...
column201: 02x01 - The Dundies;Kelly: This is a bowler-
column202: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: I know. It's ju- they didn't have any more businessmen. So...
column203: 02x01 - The Dundies;Kelly: Yeah, but everyone else-
column204: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Just sit down Kelly.
column205: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [sweaty and chugging water from a bottle] It's so freakin' hot in there. Now I know what Bob Hope was going through when he performed in Saudi Arabia. Man! I got Dwight sucking the funny out of the room, but you do what you can do. [Music starts playing in the background] Here we go, he's early with the cue. Here we go.
column206: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [Michael is singing to the tune of "Tiny Dancer" by Elton John] "You have won a tiny Dundie."
column207: 02x01 - The Dundies;Guy at bar: Sing it Elton.
column208: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Hey, thanks guys. Hey, where you guys from?
column209: 02x01 - The Dundies;Other Guy at Bar: We just came from yo' mama's house.
column210: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Oh, alright, yeah.
column211: 02x01 - The Dundies;Guy At Bar: Sing 'em a song dude.
column212: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Uh, you know what guys, we're just having a little office party, so if you want, uh...
column213: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [Something flies by Michael] Hey, you know, cool it guys, really-
column214: 02x01 - The Dundies;[The guy at the bar throws another object, looks like a wad of wet napkins, this time it hits Michael on the shoulder]
column215: 02x01 - The Dundies;Guy At Bar: You suck man!
column216: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Let's cut it. [Dwight turns the music off]
column217: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [clears throat] [with a lot less enthusiasm] I had a few more Dundies to, uh, give out tonight, but, I'm just going to cut it short. And wrap it up so everybody can enjoy their food. Um...thanks for listening, those who listened. [clears throat] This last Dundie is for Kevin, this is the "Don't Go in There After Me" award. It's for the time that I went into the bathroom after him, and it was really, really smelly. So...
column218: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [give Kevin his award]There you go.
column219: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Yay Kevin. Whoo hoo for Kevin! For stinking up the bathroom.
column220: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: [starts clapping] Yeah, alright Kev.
column221: 02x01 - The Dundies;[More people start clapping]
column222: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Woo! Hey, I haven't gotten one yet!
column223: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Yes, I have not gotten one either. So, keep going.
column224: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: More Dundies!
column225: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam and Jim: [clapping] Dundies! Dundies! Dundies! Dundies!
column226: 02x01 - The Dundies;Everybody: Dundies! Dundies!
column227: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: [getting his spirit back] Alright, alright, alright, okay. Alright, we'll keep rolling. Okay, this is the fine work award. This goes to Stanley, for all the fine work he did this year.
column228: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Fine work! Fine work Stanley!
column229: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: You know you did.
column230: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Here here! Speech, speech, speech, speech [other people start joining in]
column231: 02x01 - The Dundies;Stanley: Well, well, last year, I got great work, so I don't...
column232: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Pam starts laughing her cute drunk laugh]
column233: 02x01 - The Dundies;Stanley: So, I don't know what to think about this award. But at least I didn't get smelliest bowel movement like Kevin. [starts chuckling]
column234: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: And this next award is going out to our own little Pam Beesley...
column235: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Cut to Pam, her face goes from drunken elation to sober realization]
column236: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: ...I think we all know what award Pam is going to be getting this year.
column237: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Cut to Jim's reaction of scared expectation]
column238: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: It is the "Whitest Sneakers" award! Because she always has the whitest tennis shoes on!
column239: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Get on down here! Pam Beesley ladies and gentlemen! [Pam grabs the microphone from him] Oh, here we go.
column240: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: I have so many people to thank for this award.
column241: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Quick cut to Jim laughing and staring at Pam with amused wonder]
column242: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Okay, first off, my Keds. Because I couldn't have done it without them. [people clap] Thank you. Let's give Michael a round of applause for MC-ing tonight because [people start clapping again] this is a lot harder than it looks. And also because of Dwight too.
column243: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Dwight stands up, but nobody claps]
column244: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Um, so, finally, I want to thank God. Because God gave me this Dundie.
column245: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Quick cut to Jim, he's doesn't know whether to laugh or take her seriously, so he gives her an amused/appreciative grin]
column246: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: And, I feel God in this Chili's tonight. WHOOOOOOOO!!!!
column247: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Pam Beesley ladies and gentleman. [Pam hugs Michael and gives him a quick peck on the cheek] Oh! Thank you.
column248: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: What a great year for the Dundies.
column249: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: We got to see Ping. [Pam nods] And we learned of Michael's true feelings for Ryan. [Pam nods] Which was touching. And, we heard Michael change the lyrics to a number of classic songs. [Pam nods] Which for me, has ruined them for life. [looks at Pam, who is staring at him, nodding]
column250: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Jim looks at the camera, then back at Pam, who is still nodding]
column251: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: What?
column252: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Nothing.
column253: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Okay.
column254: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: What?
column255: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: I don't know, what?
column256: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Pam starts laughing, then suddenly falls off the bar stool]
column257: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Oh my God! You are so drunk!
column258: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Did you get that? Please tell me you got that. This is all going to be on.
column259: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: Quick, quick, the woman is having a seizure. Grab her tongue, grab her tongue! It's okay, I'm a sheriff's deputy.
column260: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: He's a volunteer.
column261: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: Don't get into that now. We need something to cushion her head. Throw pillow? A cush-
column262: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Dwight come on, come-
column263: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: It's okay, I'm going to use my shirt.
column264: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Dwight starts taking off his shirt, but gets stuck]
column265: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Dwight, get off me!
column266: 02x01 - The Dundies;[A Chili's employee comes over, Jim helps Pam up, Dwight is stuck in his shirt]
column267: 02x01 - The Dundies;Employee: I'm sorry, you're gonna have to put your clothes back on, people are trying to eat.
column268: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: [struggling] Ahh! I can't-
column269: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Was this year's Dundies a success? Well, let's see, I made Pam laugh so hard, that she fell out of her chair, and she almost broke her neck. So I killed, almost.
column270: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Oh my God!
column271: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Whoa.
column272: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: I just want to say, that this was the best, Dundies, ever! WHOOOOOOOOO!!!
column273: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Whoa.
column274: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Whoa, careful, careful.
column275: 02x01 - The Dundies;Chili's Employee: We have a strict policy here not to over serve. Apparently, this young woman was sneaking drinks off other people's tables. I Xeroxed her driver's license and she is not welcome to this restaurant chain ever again.
column276: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Great work tonight.
column277: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: Watch your step.
column278: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Excellent.
column279: 02x01 - The Dundies;Dwight: Thanks, I had to, uh, check her pupils to make sure there wasn't a concussion.
column280: 02x01 - The Dundies;Michael: Yes, that too, but I mean with the audio. Great work.
column281: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: I feel bad about what I wrote on the bathroom wall.
column282: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: No you don't.
column283: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Oh, here she is. Careful, careful, whoa. Alright, easy. Almost there.
column284: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Hey, um, can I ask you a question?
column286: 02x01 - The Dundies;[Pam stares at Jim for a little while, then glances at the camera, realizes she's on camera]
column287: 02x01 - The Dundies;Pam: Um, I just wanted to say thanks.
column288: 02x01 - The Dundies;Jim: Not really a question. [starts to laugh] Okay, let's get you home, you're drunk.

column262: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Todd Packer: There's this guy. He's at a Nymphomaniac Convention. And he is psyched 'cause all these women are smokin' hot perfect 10's, except for this one chick who looks a lot like, uh... [points at Phyllis]

column264: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Michael: No. No, no, no. That crosses the line.
column265: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Todd Packer: Ex-squeeze me?
column266: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Michael: Not you. Kevin. Just unwarranted. Hostile work environment, Kevin.
column267: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Kevin: Packer said it.
column268: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Michael: No. You said it. He pointed. A point is not a say. Look. Kevin, we are a family here and Phyllis is a valued member of that family. Like a grandmother.
column269: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Phyllis: I'm the same age as you, Michael.
column270: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Michael: I don't know about that.
column271: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Phyllis: We're in the same High School class.
column272: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Michael: Well, I have a late birthday and usually September's a cut-off point. [to Kevin] You know what? You just crossed the line. Okay? There's a line and you went over it. And you must be punished. So go to your corner.
column273: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Kevin: You mean where my desk is?
column274: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Michael: Yes, your corner. Go.
column275: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Kevin: Okay. I have a lot of work to do anyway.
column276: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Michael: Mmmhmmm.
column277: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Todd Packer: Oh my. They really got to you, didn't they?
column278: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Michael: They didn't get to me. I got to them. I am still the same old Michael Scott. New and improved. You know what? I love Phyllis. You know what else? I think she is gorgeous. I think she is incredibly, incredibly attractive person. [to Phyllis] C'mere, c'mere, c'mon! Come on! Come on.
column279: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Phyllis: Michael! Come on!
column280: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Michael: Oooh!
column281: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Phyllis: You don't have to worry. I'm not going to...
column282: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Michael: I'm not worried.
column283: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Phyllis: ...report you to HR.
column284: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Michael: You know what? The only thing I'm worried about... is getting a boner. Good work today, everybody.
column285: 02x02 - Sexual Harassment;Michael: Times have changed a little. And even though we're still a family here at Dunder-Mifflin, families grow. And at some point, the daddy can't take a bath with the kids anymore. I am Upper Management. And it would be inappropriate for me to take a bath with Pam. As much as I might want to.

column1: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: I'm an early bird, and I'm a night owl. So I'm wise, and I have worms. Oh, breakfast.

column8: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: Today, I, Michael Scott, am becoming a homeowner. Investing in real estate.

column43: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: Ok. Fine. Yes, you can come.

He's like Mozart, and I'm like Mozart's friend. No. I'm like Butch Cassidy, and Michael is like Mozart. You try and hurt Mozart; you're going to get a bullet in your head courtesy of Butch Cassidy.
column49: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: Oh, most honorable Pamera. Not offensive, because that's the way they talk in movies.

column51: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: We are. Dwight and I are going to the big thing. So why don't you have everybody work on their expense reports and I'd like them in by the end of the day.

column53: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: Very good.

column238: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Stanley: A little bit more and I would have had it.
column239: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Dwight: You know you can always refinance your mortgage. We had a 15 year on our beet farm. We paid it off early.
column240: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: Yeah, well, you know what? Nobody cares about your stupid beet farm. Beets are the worst.
column241: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Dwight: People love beets.
column242: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: Nobody likes beets.
column243: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Dwight: Everybody loves beets.
column244: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: Nobody likes beets, Dwight. Why don't you grow something that everybody does like? You should grow candy. I'd love a piece of candy right now. Not a beet.
column245: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Dwight: Let's get this roof going.
column246: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: Stop it! [smacks Dwight's arm]
column247: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Dwight: Ow.
column248: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: Final lap. Final lap. Time to beat is 1:15.
column249: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Stanley: Oscar!
column250: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Crowd: Go! Go! Go!
column251: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: Time to beat is one minute, 15 seconds. Here they come. [Michael and Dwight enter] Guys?
column252: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Dwight: What is going on?
column253: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: Nothing. Guys? Timer's still going? Er?
column254: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Dwight: That's my stopwatch.
column255: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: [hands expense report to Oscar] Here you go. All done.
column256: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Oscar: Great.
column257: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: Yeah, I filled out the expense reports. That took about five minutes and then I closed two sales at lunch time. So, about as productive as any other day. If not more so.
column258: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Ryan: I figured I could throw it away now, or I could keep it for a couple of months and then throw it away. I mean, it was really nice of Pam to make them, but what am I going to do with a gold medal made of paper clips and an old yogurt lid?
column259: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: Hey.
column260: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Pam: I have 59 voicemails.
column261: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: Mmm. Hey, can you ignore those and do something for me instead?
column262: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Pam: Sure.
column263: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: Okay, today. 5 o'clock. Closing Ceremonies.
column264: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Pam: Really?
column265: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: Notify the athletes.
column266: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Pam: Cool.
column267: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: Michael.
column268: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: Yeah. Jim. Slim Jim. What's going... What's going on?
column269: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: Nothing. I just wanted to congratulate you on your condo.
column270: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: Oh. Thanks. Thanks. It's very cool. It's a three bedroom, gay-friendly.
column271: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: Nice.
column272: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: You know.
column273: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: Hey, would you mind coming out here for a second? I just have something for you.
column274: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: Really?
column275: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: What's this?
column276: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: These are the Closing Ceremonies. Step up. You're on the top one. [Michael stands on podium] Congratulations to Michael, because he closed on his condo. So, gold medal. [everyone claps]
column277: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: I don't really know what to say. Um, I'm not one for making speeches, but ah, my heart is very full at this moment.
column278: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: And for Dwight Schrute, the silver medal.
column279: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: Get up here, Dwight.
column280: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Dwight: Silver medal.
column281: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: Yep, not as good as gold. [national anthem plays] Why are you playing the national anthem?
column282: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: Um... 'Cause your condo's in America.
column283: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Michael: Oh. [doves move across cord] What the hell is that?
column284: 02x03 - Office Olympics;Jim: Those are the doves.

column1: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Sure, can I ask who's calling? Just a second.
column2: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Jim Halpert. What? How did you get this number? Stalker.
column3: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: Katy and Jim met in the office. And now I guess they're like going out, or dating, or something. And, uh... I don't know! You know? They're just... She calls him, and they... You know, I'm sorry. I feel like I'm talking really loud. Am I talking really loud?
column4: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: So we're still on for lunch? You're meeting me here? Okay. Great. Bye.
column5: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: [to Jim] Hey! You can just give her your extension.
column6: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Okay.
column7: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Howard, slash Ryan, Ryan Howard is sitting in my office. And he has been a temp here for a couple of months and he's kind of gotten the lay of the land a little bit. Had a few laughs along the way. And now he wants to know what I think.
column8: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: The temp agency wants to know what you think.
column9: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Shall we? Let us proceed. First up, proficiency in necessary skills. Aaaaeeexcellent! [laughs]
column10: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Michael's in there right now evaluating the temp. He hasn't evaluated me in years.
column11: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Five years from now, what do you want to do? Where do you want to be?
column12: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Ah, well, I'm interested in business.
column13: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Oh! Good. Ambitious. Excellent. Want to be a manager?
column14: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Uh, no, actually, uh, what I want is to own my own company.
column15: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: That is ridiculous.
column16: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Ryan's about to attend the Michael Scott School of Business. I'm like Mr. Miyagi and Yoda rolled into one.
column17: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: [speaks in a Yoda voice] Much advice you seek. [regular voice] Do you know who that is?
column18: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Fozzie bear?
column19: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Mmm... No. That was Yoda.
column20: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: There are ten rules of business that you need to learn. Number one[/b]: You need to play to win. But... you also have to win to play.
column21: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Got it.
column22: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: And I will give you the rest of the ten at lunch.
column23: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: [to Ryan] [makes clicking noises like shooting a gun] Hey!
column24: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Michael and I have a very special connection. He's like Batman, I'm like Robin. He's like the Lone Ranger, and I'm like Tonto. And it's not like there was the Lone Ranger, and Tonto, and Bonto.
column25: 02x04 - The Fire;Oscar: [in background, on phone] But it says no late fee... .
column26: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: [alarm sounds] People!
column27: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: Okay! Everybody!
column28: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: This is not a test! Move to the exits!
column29: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: Do not panic!
column30: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Head towards the exits.
column31: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: Safety partners.
column32: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Get up off your desks!
column33: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: Do not panic.
column34: 02x04 - The Fire;Oscar: [in phone] No, I don't hear it? Alright.
column35: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: No, panic is warranted!
column36: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: Go in single file lines.
column37: 02x04 - The Fire;Oscar: [in phone] No, no. Finish the...
column38: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: This is not at drill!
column39: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: Arms at your sides! Arms at your sides!
column40: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Please, move quickly! This is a paper company, people! Step lively!
column41: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: Go, let's go.
column42: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: This whole place is a tinder box, it is ready to blow!
column43: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: This is not a test! Can you leave?!
column44: 02x04 - The Fire;Phyllis: Oh, you say that every time.
column45: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: DO YOU WANT TO DIE?
column46: 02x04 - The Fire;Phyllis: Oh, boy...
column47: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Do you want to die? OUT!!
column48: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: Alright, let's go, let's go.
column49: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: STANLEY! Have you ever seen a burn victim?
column50: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: Come on, you're safety partners!
column51: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Move to the exits!
column52: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: You're safety partners!
column53: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: We've got smoke! We've got smoke! Smoke! Gah! [Spots Kelly] Oh, Kelly! You're okay! I've got you!
column54: 02x04 - The Fire;Kelly: I'm okay!
column55: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Cover your nose and mouth. Breathe through your nose.
column56: 02x04 - The Fire;Kelly: Let go of me!
column57: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Breathe through your nose. Remove your stockings. Okay? They'll melt right into your flesh! Stay below the smoke line. Let's go! Clear out, stat! STAT MEANS NOW!
column58: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Yes, I was the first one out. And, yes, I've heard women and children first. But, we do not employ children. We are not a sweat shop. Thankfully. And, uh, women are equal in the workplace by law. So, I let them out first, I have a lawsuit on my hands.
column59: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Another rule of business is being able to adapt to different situations.
column60: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Yeah.
column61: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Adapt. React. Re-adapt. Act. All right? That's rule number two.
column62: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Okay, guys, listen up, we need a head count. We need to count off. Michael's number one. Where is he? Where is he?
column63: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: So what was rule two?
column64: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Ah... adapt, react, re-adapt, act.
column65: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Okay, well, let's... . let's kind of take it a little slower.
column66: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Hey, Michael. Um... Ryan needs his number for the count off.
column67: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Okay, uh, well, one is taken.
column68: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Uh, okay, two?
column69: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: NO!
column70: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Okay... uh, sorry?
column71: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Okay, he can have 14. Marjory's not here today.
column72: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Well, he needs a permanent number, right?
column73: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: No.
column74: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: ...I don't.
column75: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Oh, you know what else? I thought of a nickname for the three of us. Three Musketeers.
column76: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Um, yeah. Okay. That... No, no, no. I got one. I got one. The Three Stooges.
column77: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: That's funny, too. But if we're the Three Musketeers...
column78: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: I don't want to be like "a guy" here. You know? Like, Stanley is the "crossword puzzle guy". And Angela has cats. I don't want to have a thing... here. You know, I don't want to be the "something guy".
column79: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Okay, you know what? I am going to be, uh, setting the agenda here. Okay? Can everybody gather up, please? Important announcement. Very important announcement. I think this is a perfect opportunity for all of us to participate in some really intense, psychologically revealing conversations. So we're going to be playing Desert Island, umm, Who Would You Do?
column80: 02x04 - The Fire;Stanley: Ooh.
column81: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: And, um...
column82: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: ...Would You Rather?
column83: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Would You Rather. Would You Rather is our third game.
column84: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: [to firemen] Hey guys, great response time. Listen up, I got some theories. Okay, there's a...
column85: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Okay, so... three books on a desert island? Angela.
column86: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: The Bible.
column87: 02x04 - The Fire;Stanley: That's one book. You've got two others.
column88: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: A Purpose Driven Life.
column89: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Nice. Third book?
column90: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: No.
column91: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Okay. Phyllis.
column92: 02x04 - The Fire;Phyllis: Um, The DaVinci Code.
column93: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: The DaVinci Code!
column94: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Nice.
column95: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: I would take The DaVinci Code... so I could burn The DaVinci Code.
column96: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Okay. Great, that's going to keep you warm for like 7 seconds. Question[/b]: is there fire wood on the island?
column97: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: I guess.
column98: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Then I would bring an axe, no books.
column99: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Uh, it has to be a book, Dwight.
column100: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Fine. Physician's Desk Reference.
column101: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Nice. Smart.
column102: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: ...hollowed out, inside[/b]: waterproof matches, iodine tablets, beet seeds, protein bars, NASA blanket, and, in case I get bored, Harry Potter and Sorcerer's Stone. No, Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban. Question[/b]: did my shoes come off in the plane crash?
column103: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Rule number four. In business, image is everything - Andre Agassi. This car is an investment. Right? If I have to take out a client or I'm seen around Scranton in it. I love it. I love this car. Do you like it?
column104: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Yeah.
column105: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Okay. Thought people read more books.
column106: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: DVDs! Five movies. What would you bring to the island? Yes! Meredith?
column107: 02x04 - The Fire;Meredith: Legends of the Fall, My Big Fat Greek Wedding, Legally Blond, Bridges of Madison County...
column108: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Wow.
column109: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: Legends of the Fall?
column110: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Wow. Bridges of Madison County, Legally Blond, these movies are just... .
column111: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: Well, I kind of liked Legal...
column112: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Wait, wait, wait. Pam. No. Do you understand? The... the game is Desert Island Movies, not guilty pleasure movies. Desert Island Movies are the movies you're going to watch for the rest of your life! Forever! Unforgivable.
column113: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: I take it back.
column114: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Unforgivable.
column115: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: I take it back!
column116: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Good.
column117: 02x04 - The Fire;Meredith: ...and Ghost. But, ah, just that one scene...
column118: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Is this your car, Ryan?
column119: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Wow, some pretty big books back there, huh?
column120: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: [to Dwight] Don't...
column121: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Good shocks.
column122: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Hello, Mr. Egghead! Woop! So... oh, Stanley Kaplan! I know him. 'M' is for Murder, 'P' is for...
column123: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: That's actually a test prep book.
column124: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: ...for Phone. What?
column125: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: That's a test prep for business school.
column126: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Um, oh, thinking about business school?
column127: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: I just got in. I applied, I go at night.
column128: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Really?
column129: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Yeah.
column130: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: So you think you know a lot about business?
column131: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: No, not yet.
column132: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Uh huh.
column133: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Just started.
column134: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Yeah. Quiz me.
column135: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: I... wouldn't even know where to start.
column136: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Come on, egghead. Let's do it.
column137: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Do it.
column138: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Quiz me up.
column139: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: All right, um... Why have people been rethinking the Microsoft model in the past few years?
column140: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Uh...
column141: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: When I was Ryan's age, I worked in a fast food restaurant, to save up money for school. And then I spe... lost it in a pyramid scheme. But I learned more about business, right then and there, than business school would ever teach me, or Ryan would ever teach me.
column142: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Is it cheaper to sign a new customer? Or to keep an existing customer?
column143: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Keep an existing...
column144: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: [to Dwight] Shut, it. Can I... can I just do it please? [to Ryan] Uh, it's equal.
column145: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: It is ten times more expensive to sign a new customer.
column146: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Okay. Yes! It was a trick question.
column147: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Yeah, but look, I mean, he didn't need business school. Okay, Michael comes from the school of hard knocks.
column148: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Okay, Dwight.
column149: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Self taught. You didn't even go to college.
column150: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: You know what, Dwight? You don't need to help me here. Okay? Well, you know... Maybe you should go to business school like Ryan, then... then you'd know what you're talking about.
column151: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: [scoffs] Come on. I'm studying with the master, huh?
column152: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: For instance, why don't you go to business...
column153: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: [to Ryan] You should learn from him, right?
column154: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: I am.
column155: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Right?
column156: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: I am.
column157: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Stop. Dwight. You know what? You're acting like a dork. Would you cool it? Please. Okay. Hey! He's not your five year old brother, Dwight. He's a valued member of this company... and you know what? He knows more about business than you ever will.
column158: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Stupid!
column159: 02x04 - The Fire;
column160: 02x04 - The Fire;
column161: 02x04 - The Fire;
column162: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: I did not go to business school. You know who else didn't go to business school? LeBron James, Tracy McGrady, Kobe Bryant. They went right from high school to the NBA. So... so it's not the same thing. At all.
column163: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Look at this stuff. Market fragments. What is that supposed to be?
column164: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: It's a way of looking at consumers as subsets of a larger client base.
column165: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: You are so smart. You are so eff-in' smart. You should be teaching me.

column167: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: Okay.
column168: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Five movies. Go ahead.
column169: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: Um, Fargo, um, Edward Scissorhands, Dazed and Confused...
column170: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Ooh, definitely in my top five.
column171: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: Yes. In my top three, so suck it.

column173: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: Breakfast Club. Um... The Princess Bride and...
column174: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Okay that's five.
column175: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: No, my all time favorite!
column176: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Pam, play by the rules.
column177: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: All time favorite.
column178: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Play by the rules. Dwight. All time favorite movie.
column179: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: The Crow.
column180: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: I became a salesman... because of people, I love making friends. But then I was promoted to manager, at a very young age. I still try to be a friend first, but... You know? I'm very successful... your coworkers look at you differently. Huu, what do you think?
column181: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Maybe we should get some air.
column182: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Nah, I'm okay.
column183: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: I'm really uncomfortable.
column184: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: All right. Let's move on. Let's move on to the main event. Who Would You Do?
column185: 02x04 - The Fire;Kevin: Present company excluded?
column186: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Um, not neccessari...
column187: 02x04 - The Fire;Kevin: Pam.
column188: 02x04 - The Fire;Oscar: Pam.
column189: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Um... okay. Ah, you know what? Maybe I'll... I'll finish explaining the rules. Let's... let me explain it first, and then...
column190: 02x04 - The Fire;song: ["Everybody Hurts" by R.E.M.] Think you've had too much / in this life.
column191: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Yeah, so we'll get right... You know what? I'll be right back. Stanley, you're taking over for me, buddy. I'll be right back.

column195: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Come on Dwight! Use words.

column201: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Yeah, it's all him and Michael talk about anymore.

column203: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: He doesn't even know that I do that.
column204: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: You should tell him.
column205: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Oh yeah, Pam. Right. That's going to help things, just talk it out. I hope the war goes on forever and Ryan gets drafted.
column206: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: Dwight.
column207: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: What?
column208: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: I'm sorry I said that, I didn't... just part of me meant it. Besides, he'd end up being a hero anyway.

column243: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Dwight. Hey!
column244: 02x04 - The Fire;Angela: You can't go in yet!
column245: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Dwight, don't! He is an idiot. The man is an idiot, ladies and gentlemen.
column246: 02x04 - The Fire;Kevin: What if he dies in the fire? And that's the last thing you ever said to him.
column247: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: I didn't say it to him. I said it about him.
column248: 02x04 - The Fire;Meredith: ...Jim.
column249: 02x04 - The Fire;Phyllis: Definitely Jim.
column250: 02x04 - The Fire;Kelly: Definitely, definitely, Jim.
column251: 02x04 - The Fire;Phyllis: Come on, Pam.
column252: 02x04 - The Fire;Kelly: How about you Pam?
column253: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: Um... Oscar's kind of cute.
column254: 02x04 - The Fire;Phyllis: Yeah, I like Oscar.
column255: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: Ooh, Toby!
column256: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: [in the background] How long does it take to find a cell phone? I don't know either.
column257: 02x04 - The Fire;Meredith: Is there anybody else.
column258: 02x04 - The Fire;Kevin: [clears his throat]
column259: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: [on the phone] Hey, where are you? Oh good. Yeah. We're just here, we're playing Desert Island. It's when you pick your five favorite DVDs...
column260: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Seriously, where the hell is Dwight? Hey, call my cell phone. It'll make it easier for him to find.
column261: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: What's your number?
column262: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: I gave it to you in the car.
column263: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Um...
column264: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: I saw you program it in.
column265: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: You got to... you got to give it to me again.
column266: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Okay. Alright.
column267: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: Now I have it.
column268: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Uh, I better tell somebody. [to fireman] Excuse me, sir...
column269: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: [coughing]
column270: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Dwight!? Great goin'. God, Man! Why did you go in there? What... Everybody was scared out of their wits, man? Oooh.
column271: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: [coughing] Everyone, okay? Uh, I have an announcement. Apparently, in business school, they don't teach you how to operate a toaster oven. Because some smart, sexy temp left his cheese pita on oven instead of timing it for the toaster thing.
column272: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Wow. Okay. Well, I guess they don't teach how to operate a toaster oven in business school.
column273: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: That's exactly what I said.
column274: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Hey, did you miss that day there, Ryan?
column275: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Were you absent?
column276: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Toaster Oven 101?
column277: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: You failed?
column278: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: I am so sorry.
column279: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Hey! I know what'll impress everybody, I'll start a fire. Oh, man. Bad idea. Bad idea jeans.
column280: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: I have a song. Attention, everyone! That I want to sing. That I wrote especially for this occasion when I was up there among the flames. Ready? [sings to Billy Joel's "We Didn't Start the Fire"] Ryan started the fire! It was always burning since the world's been turning!
column281: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight and Michael: [singing] Ryan started the fire! It was always burning---
column282: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Everybody!
column283: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: [singing] ...since the world was turning.
column284: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: I can't believe I started the fire.
column285: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight and Michael: [sing gibberish to "We Didn't Start the Fire"]
column287: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight and Michael: [singing] Ryan started the fire! It was always burning...
column288: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Eat it! You gotta eat it. You have to eat it!
column292: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Good, how are you?
column293: 02x04 - The Fire;Katy: I'm good. It's good to see you.
column294: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Good to see you, too.
column296: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Yeah, I am too.
column297: 02x04 - The Fire;Katy: Oh, I have been thinking the whole way over and I have my answers.
column299: 02x04 - The Fire;Katy: Um, for the... the desert island.
column300: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Oh! Right! Right, right, right, come-ah on, on, on. [to everyone] Ladies and gentlemen! Gather around! We have one more participant. Come on, be polite. Be polite. [to Katy] Desert Island. Five movies. Go.
column301: 02x04 - The Fire;Katy: Okay, um, first, Legally Blond.
column302: 02x04 - The Fire;Pam: I forgot what a super, nice girl Katy is. And just... good for Jim! They are so cute together. And, um, what an adorable car.
column303: 02x04 - The Fire;Jim: Okay, I think the game's over... People are like leaving. There was a bigger crowd last time. Do you just want to go to lunch?
column306: 02x04 - The Fire;Katy: Alright! You want to drive?
column309: 02x04 - The Fire;Katy: [looking at Roy and Pam] They are soo cute.
column310: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: I'm really sorry, Dwight.
column311: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Answer me this, though.
column313: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: Was it worth it? Was it worth it temp?
column315: 02x04 - The Fire;Kevin: Was it worth it?
column317: 02x04 - The Fire;Ryan: I'm really sorry, Dwight.
column318: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: The fire guy! The fire guy!
column319: 02x04 - The Fire;Dwight: [sings] Joe McCarthy, Richard Nixon, Studebaker, television, North Korea, South Korea, Marilyn Monroe, Ryan started the fire!
column320: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Okay. Rule five - safety first, i.e. don't burn the building down. Okay? That should be a no brainer.
column321: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: Oh... look! Ryan is book smart. And I am street smart. And book smart.
column322: 02x04 - The Fire;Michael: I'll give you the rest of the ten tomorrow.
