column1: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Happy Halloween, everyone! [notices Pam, in her cat costume] Oh... that's great!
column2: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: Hey... Happy Halloween. Jan called.
column3: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Ohh... OK.
column4: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I know why she's calling. It's the end of the month, and I was supposed to let somebody go by the end of the month. And somehow I'm supposed to put on a costume and smile. [dials a number on his speaker phone] Okay.
column5: 02x05 - Halloween;Sherri: [on phone] Jan Levinson's office.
column6: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Hey, Sherri. Michael Scott returning.
column7: 02x05 - Halloween;Sherri: Oh, she's in a meeting. Uh, she just wanted the name of the employee you let go.
column8: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Well, I'm gonna wait till the end of the day. Because the book said it's best to wait till the end of the day.
column9: 02x05 - Halloween;Sherri: I just need the name of who you're planning to let go.
column10: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I don't know... yet. I will have to call her back.
column11: 02x05 - Halloween;Sherri: I know she wanted the name.
column12: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Okay... Sherri?
column13: 02x05 - Halloween;Sherri: Yeah?
column14: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: If you were getting fired, how would you wanna be told so you could still be friends with the person firing you?
column15: 02x05 - Halloween;Sherri: Jan wants the name as soon as possible, Michael.
column16: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Thanks.
column17: 02x05 - Halloween;Sherri: Mm-Hmm.
column18: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I'll call her back. [talks softy, to himself] Wish I could fire Sherri.
column19: 02x05 - Halloween;Sherri: Hey, I'm still here.
column20: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Okay! I'm sorry.
column21: 02x05 - Halloween;Sherri: Yeah.
column22: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: No?
column23: 02x05 - Halloween;Sherri: OK.
column24: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Bye.
column25: 02x05 - Halloween;Sherri: Hanging up now.
column26: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I mean you hear about layoffs in the news, but when you actually have to do it yourself, it is heavy stuff. It's... these are people's lives you're talking about.
column27: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: [entering] You wanted me?
column28: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Yes.
column29: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: [notices Michael's costume] Papier-mache?
column30: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Yes.
column31: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: Hmm.
column32: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Yeeesh.
column33: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: Mm-hmm.
column34: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Um, Pam, I have to let somebody go today. This is, uh, the hardest thing I've ever had to do.
column35: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: Why did you put it off until Halloween?
column36: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Because it's very scary stuff.
column37: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: I think it's gonna put a damper on the party a little.
column38: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: You're worried about the party? There's a man's life at stake here.
column39: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: So it's a man?
column40: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: No. Or a woman. A human life. If you had to guess, who it would be based on their job performance... and who you think deserved to be fired - who would that be?
column41: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: I just answer the phone.
column42: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: And... sometimes you just let it go to voicemail.
column43: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: You're costume is fantastic! [laughs]
column44: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I know. I sent away for it in July from a catalog. [bobs his head around, causing the costume head to jiggle around]
column45: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: Oh no, don't, don't, don't, don't. [Michael laughs] Aah! [laughs, then leaves] Okay...
column46: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Oh, man. Okay, I have to fire somebody.
column47: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: [eyeing Jim's costume] What is that?! What are you supposed to be?
column48: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: I'm a three hole punch version of Jim. 'Cause you can have me either way. Plain White Jim, or Three-hole Punch.
column49: 02x05 - Halloween;Phyllis: That's great!
column50: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Oh, yeah.
column51: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Yeah, well look... [pulls his hood over his head and pops up his light saber] What about me?
column52: 02x05 - Halloween;Phyllis: What are you? A monk?
column53: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: I am a Sith Lord. [looks at Jim] Oh big deal. Three round pieces of paper taped to a shirt. This cost me 129 dollars.
column54: 02x05 - Halloween;Phyllis: Ass.
column55: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Hey.
column56: 02x05 - Halloween;Oscar: Michael.
column57: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: You guys excited about the party?
column58: 02x05 - Halloween;Angela: Yeah.
column59: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: It's gonna be fun.
column60: 02x05 - Halloween;Kevin: Yeah.
column61: 02x05 - Halloween;Angela: Yes.
column62: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: [looks to Oscar] Oh, boy... look at you! Haha. Showing your colors. Bet you wish you wore a dress every day.
column63: 02x05 - Halloween;Oscar: What are you implying?
column64: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: All good. Happy Halloween. What happened to all those spooky decorations that we had? The cobwebs and such?
column65: 02x05 - Halloween;Angela: You know, I don't know. We put them all up last night.
column66: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Well, you know what? Go buy some more. I'll approve the overages. Sound good?
column67: 02x05 - Halloween;Angela: Yeah.
column68: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Good. Oh, yeah, also about budget stuff. Um, I'm going to need you to find, like a, a full employee salary, plus benefits, like fifty grand. I'm going to need you to find 50 grand in the numbers.
column69: 02x05 - Halloween;Angela: But we don't keep two sets of books.
column70: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Well, that's not what I'm saying. Just, you know, find it. Pretend that your jobs depend on it.
column71: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Mmm-hm-hmm. Interesting take on Dorothy. I love it. Hey, you know what would even be better? Soccer ball and cleats.
column72: 02x05 - Halloween;Kelly: Why is that?
column73: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: "Bend It Like Beckham."
column74: 02x05 - Halloween;Kelly: Oh, like ... the movie about the Indian girl who plays soccer?
column75: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: [laughs] Yeah. That would be perfect.
column76: 02x05 - Halloween;Kelly: Yeah, I mean, I guess I could do that. I don't really play soccer or anything.
column77: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Well, I don't really have two heads. So...
column78: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Wait, what are you again? Oh, right... Three-hole PUNCH! [punches Jim in the chest and cracks up laughing]
column79: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: Okay, greatest strength.
column80: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Okay, okay...
column81: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: A dog-like obedience to authority
column82: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Nice.
column83: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: But that doesn't sound good.
column84: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Okay, okay. Um, how 'bout, the ultimate team player? [Pam laughs and types]
column85: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Dwight is... special. But, I don't believe that his talents are being used in this office. So Pam and I have put his resume on Monster.com, Google, Craig's List. We're really interested most in jobs that take Dwight out of state. Um, preferably Alaska... or India.
column86: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: He's a gun nut.
column87: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Um. He sticks to his guns.
column88: 02x05 - Halloween;Angela: Well, I looked through all the budgets. And there is one department...
column89: 02x05 - Halloween;Oscar: Yes?
column90: 02x05 - Halloween;Angela: ... that has three people...
column91: 02x05 - Halloween;Oscar: Yeah?
column92: 02x05 - Halloween;Angela: ... doing the work that could be done by two.
column93: 02x05 - Halloween;Oscar: This is great. [Angela shakes her head] Oh.
column94: 02x05 - Halloween;Kevin: Yeah. Oh.
column95: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Who do you think it should be?
column96: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Jim. Definitely.
column97: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: No, Jim brings in money.
column98: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Phyllis.
column99: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Eh.
column100: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Stanley. Pam. Oscar. Meredith. Kevin. Angela.
column101: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: It's not a popularity contest. Although it does make sense to fire the least popular because it has the least effect on morale.
column102: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: One of the warehouse guys.
column103: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: [turns to the fake head, listening] What? There was someone left off that list? Who?
column104: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Who is he saying?
column105: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: You're right, I didn't even think of him.
column106: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: No, Michael.
column107: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Yeah, that's actually a really good idea.
column108: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: No, not me.
column109: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Yeah... I could.
column110: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Not Dwight.
column111: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I'm not saying that's what he said.
column112: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: I know that's what he said.
column113: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: [listening to his head] What?
column114: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Tell him, not Dwight.
column115: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: That is not a very nice thing to say about him.
column116: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Tell him to stop.
column117: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Are you kidding?
column118: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Quiet, you.
column119: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I agree. He'd land on his feet.
column120: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Make him be quiet.
column121: 02x05 - Halloween;Angela: Those aren't chips and dip.
column122: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: No, I made brownies.
column123: 02x05 - Halloween;Angela: Uh!
column124: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: ... What?
column125: 02x05 - Halloween;Angela: I'm just trying to figure out why you're sabotaging things.
column126: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: I made brownies.
column127: 02x05 - Halloween;Angela: And I made cookies. Same category.
column128: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: I'm guessing Angela's the one in the neighborhood who gives the trick-or-treaters some toothbrushes. Pennies. Walnuts.
column129: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: [on phone] Dunder-Mifflin. This is Pam. [listens] Uh, yeah. [snaps her fingers in the air, getting Jim's attention] Just one second. I will, uh, transfer you to our manager, Michael Scott.
column130: 02x05 - Halloween;
column131: 02x05 - Halloween;
column132: 02x05 - Halloween;
column133: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Um... Whoa. [picks up ringing phone][in managerial voice] Michael Scott here. Yes, I am regional manager of this orifice. Mmm hmm. Dwight Schrute is amazing. Yeah. No, he is actually the single greatest employee of his generation. Mm hmm. You know what? I'm gonna tell you what. You hire Dwight K. Schrute, and if he does not meet, nay, exceed every one of your wildest expectations, well then, you can hold me, Michael Gary Scott, personally and financially responsible. Okay. Okay. Okay-kay-kay-kay-kay. Okay.
column134: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Stanley, could you come with me, please.
column135: 02x05 - Halloween;Stanley: No.
column136: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: As Assistant Regional Manager...
column137: 02x05 - Halloween;Stanley: To the.
column138: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Look! I've got some bad news. You're fired. You need to pack up your things and go. [Stanley laughs.] I'm serious, Stanley. It's over. I'm sorry.
column139: 02x05 - Halloween;Stanley: [laughs, and imitates Donald Trump] You're fired. Get your fingers off my phone.
column140: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: So. How did it go with Stanley? How... how'd he take it?
column141: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: He wouldn't listen to me
column142: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Ahh, come on.
column143: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: If you want to fire him, you're going to have to tell him yourself.
column144: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I don't wanna fire Stanley. I never said that. I'm certainly not going to do it myself. Get those big, baleful, eyes staring at me. Yikes. Just, okay, just... [waves Dwight away]
column145: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: [whispering on the phone] Cumberland Mills?! And how did you get my resume? Oh no, no. I'm very flattered. Don't get me wrong. I'm just not sure that it's my official resume or if it's something that maybe a satisfied customer posted online. What does it say under martial arts training? Oh. Okay, I'm gonna have to supplement that. Could I have your fax number?
column146: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Would I ever leave this company? Look, I'm all about loyalty. In fact, I feel like part of what I'm getting paid for here is my loyalty. But, if there were somewhere else that valued that loyalty more highly, I'm going wherever they value loyalty the most.
column147: 02x05 - Halloween;Oscar: Oh... hey.
column148: 02x05 - Halloween;Ryan: Oh, your dress is stuck in the back. Kind of just...
column149: 02x05 - Halloween;Oscar: Oh. [fixes his dress]
column150: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: [on the phone] So you got the fax? So why didn't you add it to the res... ? What do you mean? Of course martial arts training is relevant. Oh, excuse me! I know about a billion Asians that would beg to differ. Uh, yeah, I get a little frustrated when I'm dealing with incompetence. Well, you know what? You can go to hell, too. And I will see you there... burning. Fine! Okay... oh wait! So you'll let me know when you've made a decis... [stops and hangs up phone.]
column151: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: Jim is really talented. And he should be the one who's getting a better job offer. Like, for real.
column152: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: Don't take this the wrong way, but... you should go for that job.
column153: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Um... it's in Maryland.
column154: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: Yeah, but I mean, look at the salary. And it's definitely a step up. And a challenge.
column155: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Yeah. Yeah. You know what? Maybe... maybe I will. [starts walking away]
column156: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: Jim...
column157: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: This is called leveraging an offer. [walks into Michael's office] Michael, can I talk to you for a moment?
column158: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Oh, God.
column159: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: I just thought you should know that I was just offered a job with better pay, better benefits and a better title at Cumberland Mills.
column160: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Fantastic!
column161: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: And I turned it down.
column162: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: What?! That would've solved all my problems.
column163: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: Out of loyalty to this company...
column164: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Oh, you idiot.
column165: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: ... so I was hoping to be made Assistant Regional Manager officially.
column166: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: If you left, I wouldn't have to fire anybody.
column167: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: But then you wouldn't have me here.
column168: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Big deal. Oh, it would've worked out so well. Can you get it back?
column169: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: It's in Maryland.
column170: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: You can call. Can you call 'em?
column171: 02x05 - Halloween;Dwight: I can't. I... I suppose I coul... no. They never really made me an offer anyway.
column172: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Wohahah! Why are you torturing me?! God.
column173: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Honestly, I don't think Michael has the slightest clue of who he's gonna fire. I think he keeps hoping that someone's going to volunteer. Uh, or be run over by a bus before the deadline. But in the end, really, what's going to happen is it's gonna be the first person to give him a dirty look in the hall. And therein lies the true essence of his charisma.
column174: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: [clearing his throat and interrupting Jim's talking head] Can I speak to you a minute?
column175: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Um... yes.
column176: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Michael, I really didn't mean to...
column177: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Help. Me.
column178: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: I'm sorry?
column179: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I want you to role play firing me. I want you to fire me, and I will take it.
column180: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Oh, you want me to be you?
column181: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Yes.
column182: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Okay.
column183: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I want you to be me, and I will be Creed.
column184: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Oh, are you firing Creed?
column185: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: No, no, no. That's just the first thing... came... in head.
column186: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: We should switch seats in order to...
column187: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Yes, that's a good idea.
column188: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Alright. [they stand up] Excuse me.[They sit down] I'm really sorry, but I have to let you go. And it's purely budgetary. It's not personal...
column189: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Aaaahh! I'm gonna kill myself!
column190: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Wow.
column191: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I'm going to kill myself, and it's your fault!
column192: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: That's an overreaction.
column193: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Corporate is really breathing down my neck. And they're saying this has to be done by the end of the month.
column194: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Is this you? Are you being you, or is this Creed? Are you...
column195: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I... this is Creed.
column196: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Okay.
column197: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I'm improvising, so just try to keep up. [phone rings]
column198: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Oh, hold that thought. Hold that thought.
column199: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: And I'm very angry, and I want...
column200: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: [picks up the phone] Michael Scott here.
column201: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I'm gonna kill you. I'm going to kill you for firing me.
column202: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Toby? Mm hmm. [looks back to Michael] I really have to take this Creed, so it was really worth...
column203: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Get off, get off. No, no. OK.. just get off.[sits back down in his chair and waves Jim off.] Just, just... yeah.
column204: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: What happened?
column205: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: It wasn't me.
column206: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: Oh. That was like crazy. 'Cause I was...
column207: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: Yeah, I know.
column208: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Uh, hey... Creed?
column209: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: Huh?
column210: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Could I talk to you for a second?
column211: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: You are great. Very ambitious. And I feel like you want more than this little office has to offer. And I understand that you'd wanna just spread your wings, and fly the coop.
column212: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: What are you telling me?
column213: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I... we're gonna have to... You... you want something better.
column214: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: No, I don't. I wanna stay right here.
column215: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: No, you wanna leave.
column216: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: No, I wanna stay here.
column217: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Why... why are you making this so hard?
column218: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: Um, I think there's a misunderstanding, Michael.
column219: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I think you're right.
column220: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: Can I go?
column221: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: No, of course you can't go. We haven't even started this horrible process of... okay, Creed. I need to let somebody go today. They told me I need to let somebody go. And as much as I think you're a great guy, and I like you, you're... you're, goodbye.
column222: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: Let's fight it.
column223: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Hmm?
column224: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: Let's call Jan and fight this thing together like the old days.
column225: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: What old days? What are you talking about?
column226: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: Did you start the paperwork yet?
column227: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: It's right here on the desk, yeah.
column228: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: You don't have to do this, Michael.
column229: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I can't, I can't...
column230: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: Undo it!
column231: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I can't change anything. This is the way...
column232: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: No, you have the power to undo it.
column233: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I don't... okay, just listen.
column234: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: Michael, undo it!
column235: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Don't...
column236: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Yeah, I went hunting once. Shot the deer in the leg, had to kill it with a shovel. Took about an hour. Why do you ask?
column237: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I have to fire someone today, okay?
column238: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: Fine. Fire someone else. Fire Devon. He's terrible. I am so much better at my job than Devon.
column239: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Okay, well... I already picked you. And you know that. So, unless I just go through with this, you're always gonna look at me as the guy who almost fired you.
column240: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: No, no, no, no, no, no. I will forget so fast. You will be my savior. You're they guy who gave me my life back. Thank you. I knew you'd see it my way Michael. God Bless you. You're a fine man.
column241: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Don't...
column242: 02x05 - Halloween;Creed: Listen, you will not regret this either. Devon is terrible; No one's gonna miss him. Good, good, good.
column243: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Devon, could I talk to you for a sec?
column244: 02x05 - Halloween;Devon: Creed's an idiot, you know that.
column245: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Well, he...
column246: 02x05 - Halloween;Devon: No, no, no, no, no, no! You had it right the first time.
column247: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Well, maybe I did.
column248: 02x05 - Halloween;Devon: Exactly. You gotta go with your gut, man.
column249: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Huh. No! I can't, no. I can't go back. I would look like an idiot.
column250: 02x05 - Halloween;Devon: That's why I'm being fired?
column251: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: No.
column252: 02x05 - Halloween;Devon: So you might not look like an idiot?
column253: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: No. It was all the stuff that I said. It was the business downturn, the cutbacks, and, and...
column254: 02x05 - Halloween;Devon: This is unbelievable!
column255: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I just hope that you and I can remain friends.
column256: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Devon, wait, please.
column257: 02x05 - Halloween;Devon: What!
column258: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: Look, look. In addition to severance, and everything, I want to give you this gift certificate to Chili's. From me. Okay? No hard feelings.
column259: 02x05 - Halloween;Devon: [takes the gift certificate and tears it up] Kevin, Jim, Pam, Kelly, Toby, Oscar, Meredith, Phyllis, Stanley, or the temp. If any of you wanna meet me for a drink, I'm going to be at Poor Richard's. And the rest of you can go to hell!
column260: 02x05 - Halloween;Angela: [watching nearly everyone leave] What about the Halloween party?
column261: 02x05 - Halloween;Pam: Oh, hey, Jim. Wait, stop. Um, I'm sorry... for pushing you towards Cumberland. Seriously, if you left here, I would blow my brains out.
column262: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: [motions for her to follow him] Come on.
column263: 02x05 - Halloween;Jim: That's just a figure of speech, you know? Blow your brains out? Come on. All it really means is that we're friends. Who else is she gonna talk to if I'm gone, right? I mean, if she left, I wouldn't blow my brains out. Of course, I would take that job in Maryland. Because it's double the pay, and soft shell crab just happens to be my favorite food.
column264: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: I love Halloween. You know, it's just, it's just fun. Every year, it's just fun. Last Halloween I came as Janet Jackson's boob. It was topical. People got a... a big kick out of it. The year before that, I came as Monica Lewinsky, and I wore a stained dress. The year before that, I also came as Monica Lewinsky. And before that, I was O.J. It was pretty funny. Oh, I wish you were here last year.
column265: 02x05 - Halloween;Children: [ringing the doorbell of Michael's Condo] Trick or treat!
column266: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: He... Hey, hey, hey, hey! How you doing? Wow! You guys looks great.
column267: 02x05 - Halloween;Kid: I'm a bumble bee.
column268: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: You look great! And you're a princess?
column269: 02x05 - Halloween;Kid: A fairy princess.
column270: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: A fairy princess. You're very... .
column271: 02x05 - Halloween;Kid: I'm a lion.
column272: 02x05 - Halloween;Michael: You're a lion. [trying to to open a bag of candy] Wow, I want to hear your, your... Oh! [the bag tears open, spilling all the candy] Oh, okay, that's all yours. That's all yours. Grab it, grab it. You know what? You guys are getting all of these.

column1: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Where is my desk?
column2: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: That is weird.
column3: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: This is not funny. This is totally unprofessional.
column4: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Ok, well, you're the one who lost the desk.
column5: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: I didn't lose my desk.
column6: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Okay, calm down. Where was the last place you saw it?
column7: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Okay, who moved my desk?
column8: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: I think you should retrace your steps.
column9: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Ok, I am going to tell Michael and this entire office will be punished!
column10: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Colder... warmer... little warmer... there you go, ooh, warmer... warmer... warmer... warmer... warmer ... cold, cold, cold, back up... ooh, ooh, warmer, hot, red hot, hot, very hot.
column11: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: [In bathroom, answers phone] Dwight Schrute.
column12: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: [On the phone with Dwight] Hi, Dwight, um, what sort of discounts are we giving on the 20 lb white model.
column13: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Jim, I've given you this information, like, twenty times.
column14: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: I know.
column15: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: It's by the ream?
column16: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Uh, yeah, ream.
column17: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: ...now, $9.78, signs and discounts 7%.
column18: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Ok, thank you, gotta get back to work.
column19: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Wash your hands, Kevin.
column20: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: [On the phone] Right, oh let me just check the pricing list. Hold on one second...
column21: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: [Also on the phone] Sensei, hello it's Sempai...
column22: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Umm...
column23: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Dwight...
column24: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: You know what, let me give you a call right back. I'm going to uh, find it and then I'll call you back, thanks.
column25: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Yes, I just had a ques-... Yes Sensei. Arigatou gozaimashita. Hai.
column26: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Was that your mom?
column27: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: No, that was my Sensei.
column28: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Oh, I thought it was your mom.
column29: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: I am now Sempai, which is Assistant Sensei.
column30: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Assistant to the Sensei, that's pretty cool.
column31: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Assistant Sensei.
column32: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Ok.
column33: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: I am a practitioner of Goju Ru Karate, here in Scranton. My Sensei, Ira, recently promoted me to purple belt, and gave me the duties of a Sempai. Not that a lot of people here in America know what a Sempai is, but it is equally as respected as a Sensei.
column34: 02x06 - The Fight;Stanley: I don't want to stay until seven again this year.
column35: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: I don't really have any control over that Stanley.
column36: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: Michael tends to procrastinate a bit whenever he has to do work. Umm, time cards, he has to sign these every Friday. Purchase orders have to be approved at the end of every month. And expense reports, all he has to do is initial these at the end of every quarter. But once a year, it all falls on the same Friday and that's today. I call it the Perfect Storm.
column37: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: [singing and tapping on his coffee mug] I don't want to work, I just want to bang on this mug all day.
column38: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: Did you ask me here for any specific reason?
column39: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Uhh, yes, I did, here's the dizzle. I have a very top secret mission for you. I want you to update all the emergency contact information.
column40: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: Why is that secret? [Pam knocks and walks into Michael's office]
column41: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: [to Pam] Hello, oh God, busy work. Ahh, get away, cretin.
column42: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: Umm, I put stickers so you know where to sign.
column43: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Yes, thank you. I know where to sign.
column44: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: It's just last year you...
column45: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Last year they were out of order, weren't they Pam?
column46: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: Well, the last pick-up for overnight deliveries is at seven. So you need to have them signed by then. Or much earlier.
column47: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Chillax, Pam. Stop Pam-M-S-ing. That's pretty good. Um, actually, I'm sending Ryan on a top secret mission. Tell her what it is.
column48: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: Updating emergency contacts.
column49: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: Well, is that really a priority?
column50: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Is it a priority? Oh I don't know, um, what if there is a tornado, Pam? People's legs are crushed under rubble. "Please, would you be so kind as to call my wife? No, I can't because we don't have any emergency contact information because Pam said it wasn't a priority." Think. Think with your head, Pam. Ok, well. She walks out. That's the problem with being a boss is that when you are tough they resent you and when you are cool they walk all over you.
column51: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: Catch-22.
column52: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Catch-22. Yes. Why don't you give me your contact information to start with, ok, what's your cell?
column53: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Uh, Larissa Halpert.
column54: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: What's her address? [Ryan's cell phone rings]
column55: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: 117 Mount Bergin St.
column56: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: Hello?
column57: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: [in his office on his cell phone, talking in a fake high voice] Hey Ryan. This is Michael Jackson calling from Wonderland.
column58: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: Do you mean Neverland?
column59: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: This is Tito.
column60: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: What?
column61: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Calling from... [Ryan hangs up]
column62: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: [Reading Jim's palm] You're major and minor lines cross at a ridge - that sucks.
column63: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: You making this up as you go along, aren't you?
column64: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: I am just following the website.
column65: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Well, at least I don't have cavities.
column66: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: Yes, you have very nice teeth.
column67: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Thanks.
column68: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: Who is your emergency contact? [Ryan's phone rings]
column69: 02x06 - The Fight;Kevin: Stacy.
column70: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: [looks to see who is calling but doesn't pick up]
column71: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: [Taps on the glass in his office to get Ryan's attention] Pick up.
column72: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: Hello?
column73: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: [in a high pitched voice] This is Mike Tyson.
column74: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Hey, Dwight. As Sempai, do you think there is ever going to be a day where humans and robots can peacefully co-exist?
column75: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Impossible. The way they're programmed... You're mocking me.
column76: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: No I'm not.
column77: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Look, I'm going to offer you a little piece of advice. I'm not afraid to make an example out of you.
column78: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Oh, that's not advice. What advice sounds like is this[/b]: umm, don't ever bring your purple belt to work because someone might steal it. [reveals Dwight's purple belt]
column79: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Ok, give that back to me.
column80: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Ok, say please.
column81: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: No. That is not a toy.
column82: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Please?
column83: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Please?
column84: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Good, and it absolutely is a toy. Arigatou.
column85: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Arigatou. This is not a toy. This is a message to the entire office so they can see that I am capable of physically dominating them.
column86: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: And this is more a ying-yang thing. The 'Michael' all cursive, the 'Scott' all caps. Left brain, right brain. Or, duality of man.
column87: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: Could you practice on the forms?
column88: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: No women or children, unless provoked.
column89: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Ok, Roy?
column90: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Warehouse guy. Doesn't count.
column91: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Ok. Michael? Could you beat up Michael?
column92: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Yeah, yeah, I don't think that would happen.
column93: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Because we're friends.
column94: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Because I would kick his ass.
column95: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Well, Dwight's a purple belt, so...
column96: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: So? I've beaten up black belts.
column97: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Uh, how did you know they were black belts?
column98: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: They told me. After. You see, I used to run with a very tough crowd. Street Fighter types. Real, real bad people, I'm just lucky I got out.
column99: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: Is your wife still your contact?
column100: 02x06 - The Fight;Toby: Um, ex-wife. Yeah. Um, her last name is 'Becker' now.
column101: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: 'Kay.
column102: 02x06 - The Fight;Toby: You don't need to write 'ex'.
column103: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: And after that, nobody ever messed with the 'Damn Rascals' ever again.
column104: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Sounds tough. When you're a Jet, [starts snapping] you're a Jet all the way, right?
column105: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: You were a Jet?
column106: 02x06 - The Fight;Angela: Have you signed the expense reports yet?
column107: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Yes, in theory, I have. I just need to cross some t's and dot some i's. Alright, I'm going to be in my office if anybody needs me. [Puts Dwight in a headlock] Hoo-hah. Oh, wow, sleeper hold. That's my rebuttal. Shhh. Hoo. You are the weakest link.
column108: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Argggg!
column109: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: I'm friends with everybody in this office. We're all best friends - I love everybody here. But sometimes your best friends start coming into work late, and start having dentist appointments that aren't dentist appointments. And that's when it is nice to let them know that you can beat them up.
column110: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Just hit me. You'll see.
column111: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: I can't. I just got a manicure.
column112: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Oh, queer... [realizes he is on camera] eye. Queer eye. That's a good show. Important show. Go ahead. Do it.
column113: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Just have Dwight punch you.
column114: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Oh yeah, that would be kind of worthless because I know a ton of fourteen year old girls who can kick his ass.
column115: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: You know a ton of fourteen year old girls?
column116: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: What belt are they?
column117: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Look, Dwight is a wuss. When we rented 'Armageddon'...
column118: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: No!
column119: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: ... he cried at the end of it. He did.
column120: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Michael, I told you, it was because it was New Year's Eve and it began to snow at exactly midnight.
column121: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Oh, Bruce Willis. Are they going to leave him on the asteroid?
column122: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Ok, I'll punch you.
column123: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Ok, here we go. Alright, come on.
column124: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Kiyah!
column125: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Fuuuaaaahhhhh... oohhhhh!
column126: 02x06 - The Fight;
column127: 02x06 - The Fight;
column128: 02x06 - The Fight;
column129: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Did I want to harm Michael? The one man I've been hired to protect? No, I did not.
column130: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Are you ok? Are you sure you are alright?
column131: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Yeah. [Jim opens office door for Michael] Thank you.
column132: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: I come from a long line of fighters. My maternal grandfather was the toughest guy I ever knew. World War II veteran. Killed 20 men then spent the rest of the war in an Allied Prison Camp. My father battled blood pressure and obesity all his life. Different kind of fight.
column133: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Ok, he has to be stopped. Please, please, please, please, just ask Michael.
column134: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: I don't know.
column135: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Ok, I'll buy you a bag of chips.
column136: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: French Onion?
column137: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Obviously.
column138: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: Ok.
column139: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Yes.
column140: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: [to Kevin, who he is teaching to fight] Take this pen and stab me with it.
column141: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: [Pam knocks on his door] Go away.
column142: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: I just have a quick question.
column143: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: I haven't signed them, ok?
column144: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: No, it's not that. Um, I was just wondering, since I'm probably going to have to stay late, could you ask Dwight to stay late too so he can walk me to my car?
column145: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Come in. Um, Pam, I hate to break this to you but Dwight can't stop you from being mugged. He's just not tough enough.
column146: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: He's a purple belt. That's really high.
column147: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Oh, I could beat up Dwight. That's ridiculous. I could murder him.
column148: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: It's just out there, you...
column149: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Oh, so that's what they are saying?
column150: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: Yeah.
column151: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Ok, alright, where is Dwight?
column152: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Uh, Kitchen.
column153: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Ok.
column154: 02x06 - The Fight;Kelly: Hi-yah!
column155: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Good.
column156: 02x06 - The Fight;Kelly: Wow, that's actually pretty cool Dwight.
column157: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Now watch, let me take you from behind.
column158: 02x06 - The Fight;Kelly: What?
column159: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Watch out Kelly, he might sucker punch you.
column160: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: I didn't sucker punch you, Michael.
column161: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: No, Really?
column162: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: In case you remember, I was defending my honor... like a samurai.
column163: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Really? Well, the offer, Dwight, was for one punch which I absorbed. I had no idea that there would be a second punch. So, catch-22.
column164: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Ok, fine. Tit for tit. Give it your best shot. Two punches. Go!
column165: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Look, if we were in a bar right now, there would be two punches[/b]: me punching you and you hitting the floor.
column166: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: No, I would block your first punch rendering it ineffective.
column167: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Really?
column168: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Yeah.
column169: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: You know what? You're just lucky that we are at work right now.
column170: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Ooh, what about, uh, Dwight's dojo?
column171: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: No, they must have class.
column172: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: No, it's free during the day. It's fine.
column173: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Look...
column174: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: I've got the key.
column175: 02x06 - The Fight;Toby: Michael...
column176: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Hey, Toby.
column177: 02x06 - The Fight;Toby: Any word on those time cards?
column178: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: I've got an idea[/b]: why don't you leave right now. Why don't you walk away from the room, 'kay? Fine. We'll go at lunch. Pam, make an announcement. Figure out carpools.
column179: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Um, well, we are all getting excited to see this fight. The Albany branch is working right through lunch to prevent downsizing, but Michael, he decided to extend our lunch by an hour so we could all go down to the dojo and watch him fight Dwight. Fight... Fight, fight, fight, fight, fight, fight, I'm coming, fight...
column180: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: I recognize that. That is Japanese for California Roll.
column181: 02x06 - The Fight;Ira: Uh, no, it's not.
column182: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: I think it is. A guy told me about that.
column183: 02x06 - The Fight;Ira: Actually, it's a symbol for eternal discipline.
column184: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Oh.
column185: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: [Reading Pam's palm, while she has on extremely padded gloves] Wow, that is really interesting.
column186: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: What?
column187: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Your love line- I'm just kidding. I can't see anything.
column188: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: Well, look closer.
column189: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: [Jim moves his head closer and Pam taps him gently in the face] Oh, ok.
column190: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: Once point for me.
column191: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: [Gently taps Pam on the forehead] Tied up.
column192: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: Oh, you're dead.
column193: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: What, what are you going to do? Bring it, Beesley. Bring it. Oh yeah, good move. Not such an ultimate fighter now.
column194: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: Hey, put me down. Put me down. [Meredith turns and looks at Jim and Pam] Oh my god, hey, put me down. Hey...
column195: 02x06 - The Fight;Ira: Ok, gentlemen, listen up. After a clean strike to the chest, stomach, or kidneys, I will separate you and award a point. The first person to three wins. Alright?
column196: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Yes, Sensei!
column197: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Alotta rules. Alotta rules. On the street we didn't have any rules. Maybe one - no kicks to the groin, home for dinner.
column198: 02x06 - The Fight;Ira: Shi mate!
column199: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Hiii! [kicks Michael]
column200: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Hey!
column201: 02x06 - The Fight;Ira: Alright, break.
column202: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: What the hell was that?
column203: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Yes!
column204: 02x06 - The Fight;Ira: Dwight - awarded a point.
column205: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: No.
column206: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Eat it!
column207: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Alright, that's the way you want it.
column208: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Two more.
column209: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Play dirty, huh? Ok, game on, man.
column210: 02x06 - The Fight;Kevin: Sweep the leg.
column211: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: I'm comin' atcha man. Ok, purple belt, ok. I got him.
column212: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: No.
column213: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: I got his pants.
column214: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: It was my pants.
column215: 02x06 - The Fight;Ira: No points for pants.
column216: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Dwight, you have... No, you have something... God, you look like such an idiot! [Lots of yelling and flailing of arms by Michael and Dwight]
column217: 02x06 - The Fight;Ira: Clean single kick, gentlemen.
column218: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Go on, I dare you to kick there again. Kick there again, I dare ya.
column219: 02x06 - The Fight;Ira: Ok, break. Break.
column220: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: No holding.
column221: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: You can't see. You can't see. Good boy. Good boy. Great boy. Two points, three points, four points. I win. I win. [Michael is using his head guard to hit Dwight] Eight points. Nine points. [Begins to hock a loogie]
column222: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: No, stop it! Come on! Michael.
column223: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Open your mouth.
column224: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: No, Michael!
column225: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: You talkin' to me? You talkin' to me? "Raging Bull." Pacino. Oh, I want that footage. I want it. I need it. Ah, I have to get back to work. I have lots of work... Oh, oh check this out. Come here. [Michael opens his blinds and looks at Ryan in the parking lot] There he is. Mr. Temp. Having lunch by the car. Let us play with him. This'll be hilarious. [Calls Ryan on the phone, Ryan doesn't pick up after seeing that Michael is calling] Oh, we're playing phone tag.
column226: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan's Voicemail: Seven new messages. First New Message. [Michael's voice] "Hi, Ryan. This is Saddam Hussein." Next new message. "Hi, Ryan. This is your girlfriend... and I'm mad!"
column227: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: My emergency contact is Todd Packer. Todd F. Packer. Do you know what the F. stands for?
column228: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: Fudge?
column229: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: [knock at the door] Yeah... uh, come in. Oh, hey Karate Kid. The Hillary Swank version. Hi. How are ya?
column230: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: I need to change my emergency contact information from Michael Scott.
column231: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: Ok, to what?
column232: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Just put "The Hospital." Contact number[/b]: just put 9-1-1. [Dwight leaves]
column233: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: He is such a sore loser. You heard, obviously, that I mopped the floor with him this afternoon. You know what, um, do yourself a favor and just keep me as his contact and I will call the hospital. Cut out the middle man.
column234: 02x06 - The Fight;Kevin: Later Jim.
column235: 02x06 - The Fight;Jim: Later, Kev. [Puts French Onion Potato Chips on Pam's desk] Have a good weekend.
column236: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: Yeah, you too.
column237: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: [Knock at the door] Yeah.
column238: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: I have the emergency contacts.
column239: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Yeah, just throw them on the chair. I'll take it from here. So, whatcha up to this weekend?
column240: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: Uh, hanging out with some friends, probably.
column241: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: If you're doing anything crazy, give me a shout.
column242: 02x06 - The Fight;Ryan: Yeah, alright, I'll um, see you Monday.
column243: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Alright, bye.
column244: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Dwight?
column245: 02x06 - The Fight;Angela: Michael, did you finish yet?
column246: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: This close. Dwight, may I speak with you for a minute?
column247: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: I'm busy.
column248: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Well, [points at himself] busier. Making the time.
column249: 02x06 - The Fight;Stanley: Michael, can't your conversation wait till Monday.
column250: 02x06 - The Fight;Toby: We want to go home.
column251: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Well, you don't even have anyone to go home to, Toby.
column252: 02x06 - The Fight;Pam: The shipping place closes in a half hour.
column253: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: I know, but I've been carrying the load on my back all day, and if everybody would just chip in a little bit, it'd might help me out. What do you say? Let's g*ngb*ng this thing and go home. Good? Dwight.
column254: 02x06 - The Fight;Angela: This is illegal.
column255: 02x06 - The Fight;Stanley: I don't care.
column256: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: I have been testing you the entire day. Did you know that?
column257: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Of course.
column258: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: And I am happy to say that you have passed. So effective immediately I am promoting you from Assistant to the Regional Manager to Assistant Regional Manager.
column259: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Michael, I don't know...
column260: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: I know, I know, I know, I wouldn't be offering it if I didn't think you could handle it.
column261: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: I can handle it. I can. Wow. So I guess this will just be my office.
column262: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: No, no, title change only.
column263: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: I'll have Pam send out a memo.
column264: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: No, no. Three month probationary period. Let's not tell anybody about this right now.
column265: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Just a formality.
column266: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Absolutely but not really.
column267: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Michael, I have so much to learn from you.
column268: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: Yes you do.
column269: 02x06 - The Fight;Dwight: Thank you, Sensei.
column270: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: And, ditto.
column271: 02x06 - The Fight;Michael: I told Dwight that there is honor in losing. Which, as we all know, is completely ridiculous, but there is, however, honor in making a loser feel better which is what I just did for Dwight. Would I rather be feared or loved? Um, easy. Both. I want people to be afraid of how much they love me. And I think I proved that today at the dojo.

column1: 02x07 - The Client;Ryan: [entering office] Hey, have they left for the big meeting yet? I've got Michael's lucky tie.
column2: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: No. They're in the conference room.
column3: 02x07 - The Client;Ryan: Good.
column4: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Wait, are those Michael's Levis?
column5: 02x07 - The Client;Ryan: Yeah, who dry-cleans jeans?
column6: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Michael and his jeans. He gets in them, and I'm not exactly sure what happens. But I can tell you, he loves the way he looks in those jeans. I know that's why he started casual Fridays.
column7: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: [to Ryan] I'll take those. Thanks. [throws jeans under her desk]
column8: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: This is a projection of the county's needs...
column9: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Wow, graphs and charts, somebody's really been doing their homework. Looks like USA Today.
column10: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Thirteen schools, uh, two hospitals...
column11: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: So this possible client they're talking about, actually a big deal. It's Lackawanna County. Our whole county. And if we get this, they may not have to downsize our branch. And I could work here for years. And years. [groan] Years.
column12: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: So when we get to the Radisson, I'd like to, um-
column13: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: I changed it. To Chili's.
column14: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Excuse me?
column15: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Radisson just gives out this vibe, "Oh, I'm doing business at the Radisson". It's kind of snooty. So.
column16: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: You had no right to do that, Michael.
column17: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Here's the thing. Chili's is the new golf course. It's where business happens. Small Businessman Magazine.
column18: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: It said that.
column19: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: It will. I sent it in. Letter to the editor.
column20: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Alright. But you will let me run this meeting.
column21: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Uh huh, uh huh. [under his breath] Power trip.
column22: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: What?
column23: 02x07 - The Client;Oscar: She had done a background check on me, she had it printed out.
column24: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: No...
column25: 02x07 - The Client;Oscar: Yeah. And she was asking me about stuff, line by line, while we were having dinner.
column26: 02x07 - The Client;Toby: That is unbelievable.
column27: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: What is going on?
column28: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: We are doing worst first dates.
column29: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Oh my God, I win! Ok, it was a minor league hockey game. He brought his brother, and when I went to the bathroom, the game ended and they forgot about me.
column30: 02x07 - The Client;Oscar: Ok, that's a joke.
column31: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: No, they had to come back for me.
column32: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Wait, when was this?
column33: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Umm... it was not that long ago.
column34: 02x07 - The Client;Kelly: Wait, not Roy. Say it's not your fiance. [laughs]
column35: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: I always knew Pam has refused to go to sports games with Roy, but I never knew why. Interesting.
column36: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Ok, let's do this thing. [to Pam] Wish us luck.
column37: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Good luck, Michael. Good luck, Jan.
column38: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Thank you.
column39: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: [under his breath] Kiss ass. Ok, probably going to go late tonight. Burning the midnight tequila. So, I think you could all just take off now.
column40: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Michael, shouldn't take more than an hour.
column41: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Well...
column42: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Do you always shut down the entire office when you leave for an hour?
column43: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: No, no. That would not be efficient. Actually, they just don't get very much work done when I'm not here. [Jan stares at Michael] That's not true. I know how to delegate, and they do more work done when I'm not here. Not more. The same amount of work is done, whether I am here or not. [another Jan stare] Hey, everybody, listen up. This is what we're gonna do. You sit tight, until I return. Sound good? Doesn't matter, it's an order. Follow it blindly, mwahahaha, ok? Alright, ciao. [to Oscar] Adios!
column44: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: So which way is Chili's?
column45: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Uh, I'll drive.
column46: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Oh, no, that's alright. I wanna leave straight from there.
column47: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: It's just a couple blocks away, so... boy, you really don't know Scranton, do you?
column48: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: I know Scranton.
column49: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: At all!
column50: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Alright.
column51: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: You ever been to Scranton, Jan? Dar de-
column52: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: If it's a couple blocks away-
column53: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Dar de dar.
column54: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Ok.
column55: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Jan Levinson-Gould. Jan is cold. If she was sitting across from you on a train and she wasn't moving, you might think she was dead.
column56: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: We should come up with a signal of some sort.
column57: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Why would we need a signal?
column58: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Well, in case one of us gets into trouble, the other one can signal-
column59: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: What kinda trouble are you planning on getting in, Michael?
column60: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Well, I... it could be either of us.
column61: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: You're gonna let me do the talking, we agreed on that.
column62: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Yeees.
column63: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Hello? Christian?
column64: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: Yes.
column65: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Thought that was you. Hi. Michael Scott. This is Jan Levinson-Gould.
column66: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Just Jan Levinson.
column67: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: No Gould?
column68: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: No. [To Christian] Thank you very much for meeting with us. Have you been waiting long?
column69: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: No, not long.
column70: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Uh, Jan, what happened?
column71: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Michael.
column72: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Is Gould dead? What uh-
column73: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Michael, we got divorced, ok? [to Christian] I'm so sorry. Excuse me.
column74: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Wow, you're kidding me! Do you wanna talk about?
column75: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Michael. [to hostess] Uh, could we have a table for three, please?
column76: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: When did this happen?
column77: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: We're in a meeting.
column78: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Ok.
column79: 02x07 - The Client;Hostess: This way, please.
column80: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Christian.
column81: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Alright, after you.
column82: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: Thank you.
column83: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: [mouths "Wow" to the camera]
column84: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: I thought we could start by going over the needs of the county.
column85: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: Right. Well, Lackawanna County has not been immune to the slow economic growth over the past five years. So for us, the name of the game is budget reduction-
column86: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Awesome blossom.
column87: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: What?
column88: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: [to Christian] I think we should share an Awesome Blossom, what do you say? They are awesome. Want to, Christian, blossom?
column89: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: Sure.
column90: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Ok, it's done. Actually, [turns around] Megan, may we have an Awesome Blossom, please, extra awesome? Now it's done.
column91: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: So-
column92: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: I heard a-
column93: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: If you have a-
column94: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Very very funny joke the other day. Wanna hear it?
column95: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Christian, you don't have to listen to this.
column96: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: It's ok, I like jokes.
column97: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Ok.
column98: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Just the one.
column99: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Just one joke. Ok. Well, if it's just gonna be one, I will think of a different joke. Umm... let's see... choo choo choo.
column100: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Dunder-Mifflin, this is Pam.
column101: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Pam, it's Michael. I need you to go into my office and check some data for me.
column102: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: [to Michael on speakerphone] Ok, you want me to read 'em?
column103: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Yes.
column104: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Ok. Um, a fisherman is walking down Fifth Avenue walking an animal behind him-
column105: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: No.
column106: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: When-
column107: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Nope. Told it. Not as good as you think. Pick another one.
column108: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Ok. There's a transcript between a naval ship-
column109: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Oh ho ho, yea! Bingo! And a lighthouse. Yes. That is hysterical. Could you start that one from the beginning?
column110: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Sure. There's a transcript between a naval ship and a lighthouse.
column111: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Is this real? [Pam dumps Michael's screenplay on Jim's desk]
column112: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: It is a screenplay. Starring himself.
column113: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Agent Michael Scarn.
column114: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Of the FBI.
column115: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: How long is this? [flips through pages] Oh, Pam. Good work! Oop, wait, stop. Drawings.
column116: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: What is that?
column117: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Oh, those are drawings. In case the writing didn't really put a picture in your head. And there he is, in the flesh, Agent Michael Scarn. Now we know what he looks like.
column118: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: First guy says "Well, I'm an astronaut, so I drive a Saturn". And the second guy says, "Well, I am a pimp, so I drive a cheap Escort". And the third guy says "I gotcha both beat, I'm a proctologist, so I drive a brown Probe".
column119: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: Ohhh no! [laughs] Oh my God, that's funny! I almost had Awesome Blossom coming out of my nose!
column120: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: [to waitress] Excuse me, could I have a vodka tonic, please?
column121: 02x07 - The Client;
column122: 02x07 - The Client;
column123: 02x07 - The Client;
column124: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Do we all have our copy of "Threat Level: Midnight", by Michael Scott?
column125: 02x07 - The Client;Everyone: Yeah, yeah.
column126: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Alright, let's get this started. I'm gonna be reading the action descriptions, and Phyllis, I would like you to play Catherine Zeta Jones.
column127: 02x07 - The Client;Phyllis: That's the character's name?
column128: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Oh yeah-
column129: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Ok, you guys should not be doing this.
column130: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Why not, Dwight? This is a movie. I mean, this is for all of America to enjoy.
column131: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: You took something that doesn't belong to you.
column132: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Dwight-
column133: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Brought it in here-
column134: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Do you want to play-
column135: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Made copies of it-
column136: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: The lead role of Agent Michael Scarn?
column137: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: [making the mouth on his tie talk] Yum! Yum yum yum! [Christian laughs] That's delicious! I love it!
column138: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: We would probably be upset with ourselves if we went this whole night without talking business, so, Dunder-Mifflin can provide a level of personal service to the county that the warehouse chains just can't match.
column139: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: Well, we are out to save money.
column140: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: What's the bottom line?
column141: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Bop! Be blah bop, be boo boo bop.
column142: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: That's why I wanted a signal, between us, so that I wouldn't have to just shout non-sense words. That's her fault.
column143: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Did somebody say "baby back ribs"? Hmmm? Hmmmmm?
column144: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: I don't think Christian has time for that.
column145: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: I have time.
column146: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: [singing] I want my baby back, baby back, baby back [Christian laughs]
column147: 02x07 - The Client;Michael and Christian: [singing] I want my baby back, baby back, baby back-
column148: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: [singing] Chili's baby back ribs...
column149: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: [reading the screenplay] Inside the FBI, Agent Michael Scarn sits with his feet up on his desk. Catherine Zeta Jones enters.
column150: 02x07 - The Client;Phyllis: Sir, you have some messages.
column151: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Not now!
column152: 02x07 - The Client;Phyllis: They're important.
column153: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Ok, what are they?
column154: 02x07 - The Client;Phyllis: First message is[/b]: "I love you". That's from me.
column155: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Not in a thousand years, Catherine. We work together. And get off my desk!
column156: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Yes, I have acted before. I was in a production of "Oklahoma" in the seventh grade. I played the part of Mutey the Mailman. They had too many kids, so they made up roles like that. I was good.
column157: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: If it isn't my old partner, Samuel L. Chang.
column158: 02x07 - The Client;Ryan: Agent Michael Scarn, you lost some weight.
column159: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Thank you for noticing. Now keep me company for one more mission. [Pam gets up to talk to Roy]
column160: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Hey, uh, I have to work late.
column161: 02x07 - The Client;Roy: [looks around conference room] You're joking right?
column162: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Michael Scarn takes out a nine-millimeter gun and shoots the-
column163: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Pow! Pow! Pow!
column164: 02x07 - The Client;Ryan: Hahaha, Agent Michael Scarn, you so funny. Word.
column165: 02x07 - The Client;Kevin: Michael's movie? Two thumbs down. [Smiles] Heh.
column166: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: A man sitting several seats down, who has a gold face, turns to Michael Scarn. [out of character] Uh... Ooh, Oscar, you wanna play Goldenface?
column167: 02x07 - The Client;Oscar: Mr. Scarn, perhaps you would be more comfortable in my private jet?
column168: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Yes, perhaps I would, Goldenface. Sam, get my luggage.
column169: 02x07 - The Client;Ryan: I forget it, brutha.
column170: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Samuel, you are such an idiot, you are the worst assistant ever. And you're disgusting, Dwigt. [out of character] Wait, who's Dwigt?
column171: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Here's what we think happened. Michael's sidekick, who all through the movie is this complete idiot who's causing the downfall of the United States, was originally named Dwight. But then Michael changed it to Samuel L. Chang using a search and replace, but that doesn't work on misspelled words, leaving behind one Dwigt. And Dwight figured it out. Oops.
column172: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: D-W-I-G-H-T.
column173: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Ok, you know what? I am done with this. That's it, the end.
column174: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Well, some of us wanna keep reading, so-
column175: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Uh, you don't speak for everyone, Jim. Ok, announcement. My uncle bought me some fireworks. Anyone who wants to see a real show, come with me outside now.
column176: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: That's actually a good idea. We'll all take a brief intermission. [To Pam] Hey, are you hungry?
column177: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Yeah.
column178: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Yeah?
column179: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: So after watching my mom go through so much pain, I decided to keep that promise, that I made to her, and take care of her.
column180: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Woo, well, this brings us to Jan. Truth or Dare? Tell us about your divorce. Ohh, ohh.
column181: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Oh no, Michael, Michael, please. No, really.
column182: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Oh, so you're not gonna play? She's not playing.
column183: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: It's not fair.
column184: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: She's not playing the game.
column185: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: We'd been fighting for a while-
column186: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Check please.
column187: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: He didn't want kids, but I knew that going into it. But he also knew that I did. I guess I thought that he would change his mind; he thought that I would change mine.
column188: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: You didn't.
column189: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: I was stupid.
column190: 02x07 - The Client;Michael and Christian: No.
column191: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: No, you were not stupid. Gould was stupid. Right?
column192: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: That's right.
column193: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: You know?
column194: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: You were really brave! You, you put your arms out there, you slit your wrists.
column195: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: It's true.
column196: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: You said "World, this is my blood! It's red, just like yours. So love me!"
column197: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: I had plans to meet a friend tonight. Which I had to cancel. But this is cool, too. I'm not a complainer.
column198: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: [Pam lights a candle] Wow.
column199: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: For the bugs.
column200: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Nice. That's excellent, because bugs love my famous grilled cheese sandwich.
column201: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Yes... nice! I can't remember the last time someone made me dinner.
column202: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: Right down the street?
column203: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Uh huh, Kenneth Road, born and raised. Spent my whole life right here in Lackawanna County and I do not intend on movin'. I know this place. I know how many hospitals we have, I know how many schools we have. It's home, you know? I know the challenges this county's up against. Here's the thing about those discount suppliers. They don't care. They come in, they undercut everything, and they run us out of business, and then, once we're all gone, they jack up the prices.
column204: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: I know.
column205: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: It's bad.
column206: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: It's terrible.
column207: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: It, you know what, it really is.
column208: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Uh- [Michael signals for her to shh]
column209: 02x07 - The Client;Christian: I don't know. I guess I could give you guys our business, but you have to meet me half way, ok, because they're expecting me to make cuts.
column210: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Well, corporate's gonna go ballistic, but, uh, you think we could Jan?
column211: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: So, I guess I'll see you in [looks at watch] ten hours.
column212: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: What are you going to do with your time off?
column213: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Travel. I've been looking forward to it. It's gonna be... really nice. Gonna find myself.
column214: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: [points to Jim's iPod] You have new music?
column215: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Yeah. [Pam puts her hand out for an earbud] Definitely.
column216: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: [waving to Christian] See ya.
column217: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Bye... thanks. [pumps fist] Yes!
column218: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: We did it!
column219: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: We got it!
column220: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Nailed it. Nailed it! Come here.
column221: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: I am really- [Michael kisses Jan] Thrilled. [Michael and Jan kiss again] Let's go.
column222: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: What!?
column223: 02x07 - The Client;Jan: Let's go.
column224: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Goin'. Ok. Where we goin'? Doesn't matter. Goin' to the go go. [nervous laugh] Oh-ok.
column225: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: [waking up on office couch] Michael? Michael? [goes into Michael's office] Michael? [looks out Michael's window] His car's not in the parking lot. I should check the accident reports. [taxi pulls into Dunder-Mifflin parking lot] Who's this? Jan?
column226: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Morning, Pam. Hey.
column227: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: No, nothing happened. I-I swear, nothing happened. What, I'm, totally being serious. A gentleman does not kiss and tell, and neither do I. [laughs] No, seriously, guys, I'm not, I don't want to go into it at all. It's off limits. Fine, I took her back to her hotel and we made out for a little while. It was great. I mean she told me about her divorce, we talked for about five hours, she fell asleep on my arm. So.
column228: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Hello, Dwight.
column229: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Did you do her?
column230: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Who.
column231: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Jan Levinson-Gould.
column232: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: Uh, no, no, no Gould.
column233: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: Did you do her?
column234: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: This is none of your affair because she is your boss-
column235: 02x07 - The Client;Dwight: And she is your boss.
column236: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: And she is a woman. She is a strong, soft, thoughtful, sexy woman. And you know what? I don't think that I can sit here and let you talk about her that way without me defending her honor. [to camera] Jan, I defend your honor. [to Dwight] Is that all?
column237: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Jan didn't come back for her car last night.
column238: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: What!?
column239: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Could it be that Agent Michael Scarn has finally found his Catherine Zeta?
column240: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Oh, I don't know... [Jim laughs, phone rings] Oh my God. This is Jan's cell.
column241: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: No way.
column242: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Dunder-Mifflin, this is Pam.
column243: 02x07 - The Client;Michael: I know we have to register as a consensual sexual relationship with HR. My question[/b]: do I do it as the man? Does she do it as my superior? I don't know. That leads to other issues that we may have in our relationship. It's, uh, [phone rings] Excuse me. Hello? Hi! Just talking about you. The camera? No. Uh huh. How's traffic? I miss you. What. Ok. Well, if it was a mistake, it was a wonderful mistake. No. [to camera] Would you excuse me? [to Jan] No, I did not intentionally get you drunk. Um hmm. No, no. [goes under his desk] This is just a fight. This is just a first fight of many fights we're gonna have. Right. No. Wha-so-I don't understand, you wanna see other people. Only other people. Wh-why, ok, I think you're still a little bit drunk [to camera which is now under desk] Excuse me? Excuse me?! [to Jan] I think you're, yes, why don't you just come back here, go to the hotel, have a few drinks and-no, no. I didn't slip you something!
column244: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Some might even say that we had our first date last night.
column245: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Oh, really?
column246: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Really.
column247: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Why might some say that?
column248: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Cause there was dinner, by candlelight.
column249: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Uh hmm.
column250: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Dinner and a show, if you include Michael's movie. [Pam nods reluctantly] And there was dancing and fireworks. Pretty good date.
column251: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: We didn't dance.
column252: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: You're right, we didn't dance. It was more like, swaying. But still romantic.
column253: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: Swaying isn't dancing.
column254: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Least I didn't leave you at a high school hockey game.
column255: 02x07 - The Client;Pam: I have some faxes to get out.
column256: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Oh, come on, Pam. I-
column257: 02x07 - The Client;Jim: Ok, we didn't dance. I was totally joking anyway. I mean, it's not really a date if the girl goes home to her fiance. Right?

column1: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: [bouncing on an exercise ball] You should get one of these.
column2: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: No. Thank you.
column3: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: Do you even know what this is? It is a fitness orb and it has completely changed my life. Forget everything you thought you knew about ab workouts.
column4: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: Done.
column5: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: This ab workout is specifically designed to strengthen your core. [knocks things around Jim's desk] Sorry.
column6: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: S'ok.
column7: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: Numerous health benefits, strengthens your back, better performance in sports, more enjoyable s*x.
column8: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: You're not having s*x.
column9: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: Plus, improves your reflexes [knocks over more stuff] see, I would have caught that.
column10: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: Ok, you know what, uh, how much is that?
column11: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: It's only twenty-five bucks.
column12: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: Wow. Um, ok. [pops Dwight's orb with scissors]
column13: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Pam, could I see you in my office?
column14: 02x08 - Performance Review;Pam: It's performance review day, company-wide. Last year, my performance review started with Michael asking me what my hopes and dreams were, and it ended with him telling me he could bench-press 190 pounds. So, I don't really know what to expect.
column15: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Pam, you're trustworthy-
column16: 02x08 - Performance Review;Pam: Thank you.
column17: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: And a woman-
column18: 02x08 - Performance Review;Pam: Oh, no.
column19: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: And I want you to listen to a voicemail from my boss. [Jan on recording] "Michael, it's Jan. I guess I missed you. I'll, uh, be there this afternoon for performance reviews. I hope it's understood that that will be our only topic of discussion. See you soon." First impressions?
column20: 02x08 - Performance Review;Pam: Uh, just off the top... I think she'll be here this afternoon.
column21: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: My boss is coming in today, the lovely Jan Levinson-Gould will, well, no Gould. The Gould has been [makes slashing neck hand motion] swack, divorced. Um, the awkward part is that this will be the first time that we'll be seeing each other since, well, uh, it was really nothing. We just sort of got caught up in the moment. The vulnerable divorcee gives herself to the understanding, with rugged good-looks, office manager. Just, uh, she didn't want it to continue for some reason. It, we both, I didn't want it, we both didn't want it to continue. Was not professional. Um, when people say something's mutual, it never is. But this was mutual.
column22: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: [playing Jan's message] "I guess I missed you." I guess I missed you. So, she misses me?
column23: 02x08 - Performance Review;Pam: She missed you.
column24: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: But then she goes on to say "that will be our only topic of discussion". That doesn't mean anything, those are just words.
column25: 02x08 - Performance Review;Pam: I have one idea of what it means.
column26: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Ok. Yeah, what, what?
column27: 02x08 - Performance Review;Pam: Well I don't think you're gonna be very happy with this.
column28: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Ohhh, great. Well, now I'm in a terrible mood. Let's do your performance review-
column29: 02x08 - Performance Review;Pam: Because she's conflicted. She has to be professional, but she's fighting feelings... for you.
column30: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Ah, why, that's great news? That, that, then why would, why would I not like that?
column31: 02x08 - Performance Review;Pam: Um, just cause, that, you work together, and it might be awkward.
column32: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Oh, wow, wow. Alright, let's listen to that again. [plays Jan's message] "Michael, it's Jan. I guess I missed you".
column33: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: Oh, hey, listen, Jim. Here's a little tip for your performance review.
column34: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: Ok.
column35: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: Tell Michael that we should be stocking more of the double-tabbed manila file folders.
column36: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: We don't have double-tabbed manila file folders.
column37: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: Oh, yes, we do.
column38: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: No, we don't.
column39: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: Yeah, it's a new product. So, you should just suggest that to him and he'll be sure to give you a raise.
column40: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: Alright... well, I'm not asking for a raise. I'm gonna actually be asking for a pay decrease.
column41: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: Uh, that is so stupid. What if he gives it to you?
column42: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: I win.
column43: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: Ugh, you know what? I am going to zone you out for the rest of today. I need to stay focused, and I don't have to see you tomorrow or Sunday and please don't call me, and we'll see how things go on Monday. Uh, stupid.
column44: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: Wait, wait; one thing. Uh, by tomorrow, you mean Saturday, right?
