column218: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Why on earth would we give you a raise?
column219: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: That is an excellent question. Thank you for asking. Let me bring up one word[/b]: dedication. [points to graphs] I have never been late. Also, I have never missed a day due to illness. [Michael sighs] Even when I had walking pneumonia. I even come in on holidays.
column220: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: You do? How do you get in?
column221: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: I have a copy of your key.
column222: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: That's a serious offense!
column223: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: That is a serious offense. Very serious. As is toying with a man's heart.
column224: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: Oh! Michael, for God sakes!
column225: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: I'd also further like to talk about my merits in the workplace.
column226: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Ok, third wheel, why don't you do that?
column227: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: For instance, the time I brought in deer jerky for the whole office.
column228: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: That was deer!? Gross, oh!
column229: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: You liked it!
column230: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Oh, did not!
column231: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: Jan, have you ever had deer?
column232: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: No.
column233: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: It's a delicacy. And you know what? It's an aphrodisiac. So when we're done here, you guys could go over to The Antler Lodge, sample some deer and talk about my raise.
column234: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: What do you say, Jan?
column235: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: Ok! Here's what I'm gonna do[/b]: I'm gonna step outside, collect my thoughts, and I will return in about ten minutes.
column236: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Ok. You just, uh, clear your head.
column237: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: [Dwight opens door] Thank you, Dwight.
column238: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: Look, I know it's your job, I know you have to ask, but I promise you, I'm not gonna discuss it with him, I'm certainly not gonna discuss it with you. [digs a cigarette out of her purse] Do you have a light?
column239: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: And in conclusion, I think that Lex Luthor said it best when he said "Dad, you have no idea what I'm capable of".
column240: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: That's from Superman?
column241: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: Smallville. And that is why, I feel, that I deserve this raise.
column242: 02x08 - Performance Review;Pam: Do you think Michael and Jan actually...
column243: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: I don't really wanna picture it. But thank you, Pam.
column244: 02x08 - Performance Review;Pam: How do you come back from that?
column245: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: Um, you don't, I don't think, come all the way back, you know. Especially working together.
column246: 02x08 - Performance Review;Pam: No, I mean doing that with Michael. How do you come back from that?
column247: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: Oh-
column248: 02x08 - Performance Review;Pam: As a human being.
column249: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: Yeah, no, I don't think you can.
column250: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: I'm heading back to New York; Alan and I will conduct your performance review over the phone tomorrow.
column251: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Wait.
column252: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: 'K?
column253: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Wait, wait, wait, come, I just, I just wanna know why?
column254: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: Michael, now is not the time or the place.
column255: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Ok, so you're saying that there is a different time or place?
column256: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: No, I am saying we are never having this conversation.
column257: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Well, ok, well never as in 'never ever ever', or never as in there's still a chance?
column258: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: Never, for me, always means 'never ever ever.'
column259: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: I just want to know, from the horse's mouth, what is the dealio?
column260: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: Michael, it has nothing-
column261: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Am I too short?
column262: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: With your looks, ok? It's your personality. I mean, you're obnoxious, and rude, and, and, and stupid, and you do have coffee breath, by the way, and, and I don't agree about the b.o., but you are very, very inconsiderate.
column263: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Really?
column264: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: Really. You're, you're, you're a great guy, ok?
column265: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: I appreciate that, thank you.
column266: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: And you were very sweet, and you stayed up with me and talked with me, cried with me, and I appreciate that-
column267: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: No, I wasn't, I didn't cry-
column268: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: At this time in my life. I just am not in the place right now where I'm looking for a relationship, so we can still work together, we can still be friends but... ok?
column269: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: So my looks have nothing to do with it?
column270: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jan: Ohhh, God.
column271: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Jan is not in a place where she feels she can have a relationship right now. And it doesn't matter how great a guy I am. And that is all I needed; I'm good. I can go home now.
column272: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Hey, it's 12:20; where the hell's Dwight?
column273: 02x08 - Performance Review;Jim: Ummm... no idea.
column274: 02x08 - Performance Review;Michael: Never missed a day, my ass.
column275: 02x08 - Performance Review;Pam: [Jim bows to Pam; she bows back] Thank you.
column276: 02x08 - Performance Review;Dwight: [running through parking lot] I'm here! I'm here! I'm here! It's ok!

column1: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: It is Friday morning and it is another beautiful day in Scranton, Pennsylvania. [sees man in a turban outside] Oh my God. Ohhh. [dials phone number] Pick up, pick up, pick up, pick up. Oh, we have a serious problem here. [goes out onto office floor] Alright everybody, lock the doors, turn off the lights. Pretend you're not here.
column2: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Are we in danger?
column3: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: There's no time to think about if this is real. Just, shh, everybody. [knock at the front door]
column4: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Kevin: Michael, should I call the... [Michael waves his hands] What?
column5: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: The IT tech guy and me did not get off to a great start.
column6: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Yeah, I tried to install it myself, but, uh, you guys have these things so password-protected...
column7: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Sadiq (IT guy): That just means you have to enter your password.
column8: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Oh...
column9: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Sadiq (IT guy): What's your password, Michael?
column10: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Oh, umm... [looks at Post-It on computer]
column11: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Sadiq (IT guy): Oh, it's 1-2-3.
column12: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Yes.
column13: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Mi-
column14: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: AH! Guh-oood.
column15: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Sorry.
column16: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Please don't do that.
column17: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Ok, I'm sorry. What is going on in there? Why is he here? What are you doing?
column18: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: I can't tell you.
column19: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: You have to tell me.
column20: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: I don't have to tell you anything.
column21: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Look, Michael, I know you don't want to have to think about this, but if something were to happen to you, God forbid, then I would need to know in order to take over.
column22: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Dwight, nothing is going to happen to me, ok? I'm in the best shape of my life. Look at this. [flexes his arms] Brrr! That's strong!
column23: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Yeah, but that doesn't matter, you could get a brain aneurysm-
column24: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: I'm not going get a brain-
column25: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Or get hit by a car-
column26: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Stop it.
column27: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Or a bus or a train. Get poisoned, fall in a well, step on a mine, choke.
column28: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Uh, oh, ok; if I step on a mine in Scranton, Pennsylvania, and die, you can have my job, ok? Why don't you just go... away?
column29: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: There are certain things a boss does not share with his employees. His salary, that would depress them. His bed, it--- And I am not going to tell them that I'll be reading their e-mails.
column30: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: So how do you search?
column31: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Sadiq (IT guy): By keyword phrase.
column32: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Try "profits". No! Try "Michael Scott". "Michael" "boss" and "funny". [Sadiq (IT guy) types; result pops up] Oh my God, wow! [chuckles] E-mail from Stanley. Stanley, Terribly nice guy. [reads e-mail] "Sorry I didn't write back sooner; I can't go to the game tonight because my boss Michael is an ass and making me stay late." Well, Stanley's an ass. Not one of our harder workers.
column33: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Oscar: Hey, what's the deal, Michael? Why are you spying on our computers?
column34: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Oh, no, everybody; Oscar's gone crazy! What other ghost stories do you have for us? That I'm a robot? [robot voice] I will destroy everything in my path-
column35: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Oscar: Actually, it's just-
column36: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Beep! Bop!
column37: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Oscar: Ok...
column38: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Bommmm. Bop! Onk onk. [Tin Man voice] Oil can. Oil can.
column39: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Oscar: Tin Man. Actually we just a got a memo from IT saying you're doing e-mail surveillance.
column40: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Oh, what? No. That defeats the whole purpose.
column41: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: So it's true? You have access to our e-mails?
column42: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: You know what the problem is?
column43: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Stanley: I think I do.
column44: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: The problem is that when people hear the term "big brother", they immediately think it's scary or bad, but I don't. I think, wow, I love my big brother.
column45: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Kevin: I gotta erase a lotta stuff. A lot of stuff.
column46: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Oh hey, just so ya know, if you have a lot of sensitive e-mails, they need to be deleted immediately.
column47: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Angela: I know.
column48: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Good. [Pam overhears]
column49: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: [whispers to Jim] Hey. Something just happened. Dwight just told Angela that she has to deleted all of her sensitive e-mails immediately.
column50: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: What?
column51: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: I know!
column52: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Hmm...
column53: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Do you think that they're like-
column54: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: No.
column55: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: No, right, no, no.
column56: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: [humming]
column57: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Uhhh, ew, ew, ew... .Maybe?
column58: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: It's like squishing a spider under a book. It's gonna be really gross but I have to look and make sure that it's really dead. Sooo... [to camera guys] If you guys see anything... ?
column59: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Hey, Dwight, um, my friend is kinda into these two girls that he works with.
column60: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Nice.
column61: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: One is tall and brunette, and the other one is short, and blonde, and perky, and kinda judgmental. Who do you think he should choose?
column62: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Does he have access to their medical records?
column63: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Ummmm...
column64: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: I think one of the greatest things about modern America is the computerization of medical records. As a volunteer sheriff, I can look up anyone's psychiatric records or surgical histories. Yeast infections. There are a huge number of yeast infections in this county. Probably because we are down river from that old bread factory.
column65: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Meredith has an E-vite from Jim. Barbeque at Jim's tonight. Tonight? Wonder where my e-vitation is. Click on guest list. Angela, Stanley, Oscar, Meredith, Phyllis, Kevin, Creed. Must be... .[scrolls down list] No.
column66: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Hey, Angela-
column67: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Angela: Hi.
column68: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: How's it going?
column69: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Angela: It's ok.
column70: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Listen, are you bringing anyone to Jim's party tonight?
column71: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Angela: No. Are we supposed to?
column72: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: No. I mean, I don't know, I don't think so.
column73: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Angela: Hmm... [Pam reaches towards vending machine] Excuse me.
column74: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Oh.
column75: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: There's always a distance between a boss and the employees. It is just nature's rule. It's intimidation mostly, it's the awareness that they are not me. I do think that I am very approachable, as one of the guys. But maybe I need to be even approachabler.
column76: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Kevin: That's pretty young.
column77: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Yeah.
column78: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Kevin: [to Michael] Are you gonna eat with us?
column79: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Of course. Hangin' with my crew, crew that I am one of. Hangin' with my Cup of Noodles. This is a meal in a cup.
column80: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Uh hum.
column81: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Hot, tasty. Reminds me of college. Lived on this stuff. Brain food. Mmmm... You know what I really, really miss about college? The parties. Everybody'd go. The athletes, the, the nerds, professors.
column82: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: The professors would go to the parties?
column83: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Yeah! They were the most fun. We always invited them.
column84: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: It's true. I'm having a party. I've got three cases of imported beer, a karaoke machine, and I didn't invite Michael. So three ingredients for a great party. And it's nothing personal, I just think that if he were there, people wouldn't be able to relax, and you know, have fun, and my roommate wants to meet everybody. Because I'm pretty sure he thinks that I'm making Dwight up. [sighs] He is very real.
column85: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: [to cameraman] What? [looks at Dwight eating a Baby Ruth] Ohhhh... Yes! Thank you!
column86: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Question[/b]: on the Internet there are several different options to get to your house for the party tonight-
column87: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Oh, uh, no. Could-
column88: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: I was wondering-
column89: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Could, keep that down.
column90: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Why?
column91: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Because not everybody knows about the party.
column92: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Like who? Who doesn't know?
column93: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Umm, Michael.
column94: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Why just Michael?
column95: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Because it's a surprise.
column96: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Is it?
column97: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Uh hmm.
column98: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Oh, that's perfect!
column99: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: So, don't tell.
column100: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: I won't.
column101: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Ok.
column102: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: So, Dwight thinks that tonight is a surprise party for Michael.
column103: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Really? That's great.
column104: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: I know.
column105: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Maybe we can get him to hide and wait somewhere.
column106: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: [laughs] Oh man. Oh, you know what, speaking of which, I was just trying to get a handle on, you know, numbers for food and stuff. So do you think that Roy's gonna come, or...
column107: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Oh, no, he can't make it.
column108: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Oh, ok, cool.
column109: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Hey there.
column110: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Hey.
column111: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Almost quittin' time.
column112: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Yup, it's, uh, four o'clock.
column113: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: One more hour. Take care of anything you forgot to do. Hey, you know, I don't know if you have any plans tonight, but if ya don't, we could hang out.
column114: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Oh, um... .I can't.
column115: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: You have plans.
column116: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Uh hmm, definitely.
column117: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: I do, too. I do, too.
column118: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: You do?
column119: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: I do, yeah. Big plans.
column120: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Because you said "do you wanna hang out"-
column121: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Tonight, I can't do it tonight, no. Improv class, I have improv class, hanging out with my improv buds-
column122: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Really?
column123: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Yeah.
column124: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Aw, that sounds like a lot of fun.
column125: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: It's the best. It's the best. I would not miss it for the world. But if something else came up, I would definitely not go.
column126: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Improv sounds great.
column127: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: It is. Ok.
column128: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Alright.
column129: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: [someone coughs] What?
column130: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: I think Stanley just coughed.
column131: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;
column132: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;
column133: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;
column134: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Hey, Pam. Do you need me to walk to your vehicular transport?
column135: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: No thanks.
column136: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Alright. Oscar, got big plans tonight with-
column137: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Oscar: I'm on a call.
column138: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Kevin, big man, big man, what are you doing tonight? Where are you off to?
column139: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Kevin: My brother is in town and we are going to see the Alaska Film Festival at the Scien-
column140: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Ok, alright.
column141: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Kevin: Oh.
column142: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Hey, Angela, rushy, rushy. Where you rushin' off to?
column143: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Angela: I'm just leaving for the day.
column144: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Yeah, well duh. Where ya headed?
column145: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Angela: Charity. Bake drive.
column146: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Liar!
column147: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Angela: No!
column148: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: You are a liar.
column149: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Angela: No, I'm not.
column150: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Dwight, oh ho, Dwight, Dwight, my loyal compadre. You and I are hangin' tonight. The two of us. We are celebrating our freedom and our manhood. You know what? Why don't we watch that show that you've been wanting to watch, that stupid Battleship Galaxy.
column151: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Battlestar Galatica.
column152: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: That's, whatever stupid show you want-
column153: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: I can't-
column154: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: To watch tonight
column155: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Tonight.
column156: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: We're watching it.
column157: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Unfortunately, I've got plans. I have to go to practice. Soccer practice.
column158: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: I didn't know you played soccer, Dwight.
column159: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Clarinet.
column160: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: You, too, Dwight?
column161: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Have fun tonight! Whatever it is that you're doing, and I'll see you Monday. [to the camera] He has no idea!
column162: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Quick announcement everybody, if I could have everybody's attention. We do have wine in the kitchen, and, uh, there is beer available on the porch and despite what you might think, it's not all for Meredith and Kelly, so please enjoy.
column163: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Jim! You really think this is a good idea, huh? A hide-a-key rock?
column164: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Mark: Hey, you must be Dwight!
column165: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: You don't work with us.
column166: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: That's because Mark's my roommate.
column167: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Mark: Hey, I love the Birkenstocks.
column168: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Thanks. Yeah, I always keep an extra set in the car, for special occasions. Jim, come here.
column169: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Uh hmm.
column170: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: When is the guest of honor coming?
column171: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Oh, uh, later-ish.
column172: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: He's gonna love it!
column173: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Great. [to a group of guests] Just wanna let you guys know that we will be taking the tour like I promised-
column174: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Hey.
column175: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Hey! Just in time! You wanna go on the group tour? We were just about to leave.
column176: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Definitely.
column177: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Well, the group tour is now leaving, then. Ladies and gentlemen, just a few things that we are gonna be pointing out to you today, you will be able to see both bedrooms and, uh, if we're lucky, maybe get a chance to peek into the bathroom, who knows. I have to remind you that flash photography is prohibited and as much as you can, please refrain from touching things. I know you might want to.
column178: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Ryan: Hey, is Katy coming?
column179: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Uh, actually, I haven't talked to her in a while.
column180: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Ryan: Huh, is it ok if I call her?
column181: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: We can talk about that later.
column182: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: Ok, let's get right into it. I need two people for the first scene.
column183: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: [In Horshack voice from 'Welcome Back, Kotter'] Ooo Ooo Ooo Ooo, Mr. Cart-air, Mr. Cart-air.
column184: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: Ok, Michael. And... anybody? How about Mary-Beth? Come on. Ok, so you start us off Mary-Beth.
column185: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Mary-Beth: Great. [skips] La la la la la laaa...
column186: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: [fake kicks in door] Boom! Detective Michael Scarn. I'm with the FBI.
column187: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Think about this; what is the most exciting thing that can happen, on TV, or in movies, or in real life? Somebody has a gun. [gasps] That's why I always start with a gun, because you can't top it, you just can't.
column188: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Girl acting Pregnant: I'm supposed to meet my doctor here? Have ya seen him? He's a very angry midget.
column189: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Boom! Freeze! Michael Scoon, FBI. You know what you did. Boom! Boom! Boom! [shoots at Pregnant Girl and another actor] Yeah, you thought that you could get away with your little ruse, didn't you? Didn't ya!? Well, you didn't, because I know where ya hid the diamonds. I been on to you and your little friends for weeks. [another actor steps in] Boom! Boom! Boom!
column190: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Actor: I'm not even in the scene!
column191: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Actress: Again!?
column192: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Boom! Boom!
column193: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: Stop, stop, ok, stop.
column194: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Boom! Boom!
column195: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: You shot me, great. Now stop.
column196: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Why
column197: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: You can't just shoot everyone in the scene.
column198: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Well, if you hadn't stopped the scene, you would have seen where it was going.
column199: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: Ok, what about the scene they set up?
column200: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Boring.
column201: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: No, it wasn't. No more guns.
column202: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: I could of-
column203: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: No. No. Michael, I want you to give me all the guns you have.
column204: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Ok.
column205: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: Just, I want you to get rid of all your guns and give them to me. Great.
column206: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Yehhhehh.
column207: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: Yeeehh, ok.
column208: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Jim's bedroom.
column209: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: See, I knew we lost somebody on the tour. It's-
column210: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Cool... This is your desk.
column211: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: This is my desk.
column212: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Your home office?
column213: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: My home office, this is it.
column214: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Down. You have to sit down so I can get the full effect.
column215: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Ok, sure. Will do.
column216: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Ok, wait, so that would make me [walks to side of room] like right here.
column217: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Yeah, that... Yep, that feels about right.
column218: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: And Dwight would be like-
column219: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: You know what? Let's just leave that image out of it, because this is a happy place. Happy thoughts, Pam. Happy thoughts.
column220: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Umm, [gasps] yearbook!
column221: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Yeah, you don't have to, ummm. Alright, yes, that's not gonna be awkward at all.
column222: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: [finds Jim's picture] Ooooohhh no!
column223: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Oh yeah.
column224: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: You were so dorky!
column225: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Thank you.
column226: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: Freeze!
column227: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: I'm in.
column228: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: You wanna go over the rules one more time?
column229: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: No, no, no. I'm looking in my wallet for money so you can tell me my fortune.
column230: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Bill: I promise it's worthit . Ooo, I can see you walking out of here and you're thrilled with your reading.
column231: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: What are you... [whispers to Bill]
column232: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: Michael, what did you tell him?
column233: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Nothing.
column234: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: Then why are his hands up? Bill?
column235: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Bill: He told me he couldn't show it to me, but he has a gun.
column236: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Improv Teacher: Ok, let's call it a day. Nice job, Bill.
column237: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Good, it's good. Good work, everybody.
column238: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Angela, burger? Dog? Havin' fun?
column239: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Angela: I got sap on me.
column240: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Chicken, hot dog, burger.
column241: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Angela: I'm a vegetarian.
column242: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: There is soda inside.
column243: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Angela: Guh.
column244: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Stanley: I didn't think the premium laser color copy batch would sell as well as it did.
column245: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Oscar: Yeah, it surprised us all. I'll tell you why. Because when they---
column246: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Kelly: I'm sorry guys; can we please not talk about paper? There's gotta be something else we can talk about.
column247: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Angela: I think it's alright. Jesus drank wine. [Pam overhears]
column248: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Hey Phyllis, come here for a second.
column249: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Phyllis: Sure.
column250: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Have you heard anything about any secret office romances?
column251: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Phyllis: You tell me. Well, you do mean you and Jim right? Oh God. I am so sorry, I thought, you guys hang out all the time and you're talking all the time. I'm sorry!
column252: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: That's ok. It's ok.
column253: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Kevin: [smacks Ryan's hand] Not so fast... Fire Guy.
column254: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Mary-Beth: How do I get to Bernie's Tavern from here?
column255: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Bill: Oh, don't worry. We're all gonna carpool.
column256: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: So Bernie's, huh? We're all going to Bernie's? [to camera] Go to Bernie's?
column257: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Bill: Oh sorry, we're not going as a group, it's just a private friend who just happens to know all of us from different ways is throwing a private birthday thing.
column258: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Right, right, right. Well guys, I'd love to go to Bernie's with you, but, you know, I have an office party. A big office party I need to go to, so... Can't get out of it.
column259: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Bill: Ok.
column260: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Ok, see you later. Nice job, Bill. Not.
column261: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Phyllis: [singing] Here I go again on my own. Going down the only road I've ever known...
column262: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Oh by the way how's your side project going?
column263: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Oh, yeah I gave that up.
column264: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Jim: Really?
column265: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Yeah, it turns out I was, um, just grasping at straws.
column266: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Pam: Just because two people are hanging out, it doesn't mean that they're together, you know? Like people can just be friends. And I think that it was really unfair to think that there was anything else going on.
column267: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Kevin: [singing] Just turn around now, cause you're not welcome anymore.
column268: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Dwight: Surprise! [laughs] Everybody!
column269: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Phyllis: Dwight...
column270: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Wow! Who opened the morgue for this thing? I'm just driving by, thought I'd drop in. [to Jim] There's some wine. I would love a glass, if you're gonna open it. Here ya go Temp, take my jacket! [sees Sadiq (IT guy)] Oh, come on! That guy? He is a good guy, not a terrorist. Karaoke, I love it! I am a karaoke fiend. I call dibs. I got next, I got next up. Come on, let's get this party started, ha! Ok? Where's that wine?
column271: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Ok, yeah, this is a duet, so, need somebody else, Pam? You wanna come up and sing this one? Need somebody else. Takers, please. [singing] Baby when I met you there was peace unknown. Kelly? Tried to get you with a fine tooth comb. I was soft inside, there was something goin' on. This part goes to the, uh, girl. You do something to me that I can't explain. Hold me closer and I feel no pain. In every beat of my heart, we got something goin' on. Tender love is blind---
column272: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael and Jim: [singing] It requires a dedication, all this love we feel needs no conversation. Divided, together, uh huh. Making love with each other, uh huh.
column273: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: We're making love!
column274: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael and Jim: [singing] Islands in the stream, that is what we are, no one in between, how can we be wrong? Sail away with me...
column275: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Talk! Just talk!
column276: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Mary-Beth: I am-
column277: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Shut up!
column278: 02x09 - E-Mail Surveillance;Michael: Funny story[/b]: the way that I got into improv was, I got into improv. The story about me getting into improv was that I was walking down the street, and a race car pulls up, and the guy says "Hey you're funny, you're the funniest guy I've ever seen, or my name is not Dale Earnhardt." [giggles] And that was an improv. Um, the real way is that I found a flyer.

column1: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Go. Get the door.
column2: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Here we are.
column3: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Go. Push!
column4: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Oh god.
column5: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Push!
column6: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: No, no, turn it around.
column7: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Really shove it.
column8: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: You'll break it.
column9: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Shove it through! Break it!
column10: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: You shove it. Shove it back! Here we go. Don't break the branches, Dwight.
column11: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: All right.
column12: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: I got a splinter.
column13: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Well, suck it up. We all have problems. Hey, everybody, look what we have! [laughs] Nice, huh?
column14: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: I've got it leveraged. Push. Straight up.
column15: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: On three. Ready? Big, one, two, three.
column16: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: One, two, three. [they push the tree up and it breaks through a ceiling tile.]
column17: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Merry Christmas!
column18: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Did it work?
column19: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kevin: [holds up the piece of tree he just cut off with a paper cutter] Well, sort of. Why did you get it so big?
column20: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: A, that's what she said, and B, I wanted it to be impressive. The biggest day of the year deserves the biggest tree of the year.
column21: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kevin: But what are we going to do with this hacked off part?
column22: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Well, that is a perfectly good mini-tree, Kevin. And we are going to sell that to charity. That's what Christmas is all about.
column23: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: So this year, for the first time ever, I got Pam in Secret Santa. And I got her this teapot, which I know she really wants, so she can make tea at her desk. But I'm also going to stuff it with some inside jokes. Like, this is my high school yearbook photo. She saw it at the party, and it really makes her laugh. Not sure why. What else .. ooh. This is a hot sauce packet. She put this on a hot dog a couple years ago because she thought it was ketchup. And it was really funny, so I kept the other two. [holds up a miniature pencil] This would take a little too long to explain, so I won't. And this is the card. Because Christmas is the time to tell people how you feel.
column24: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Angela: Is there anything we're missing? Phyllis, you got the lights?
column25: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Phyllis: Yes, I got those cute little ones. [Angela looks at her disapprovingly] Do you think I should have gotten the big ones?
column26: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Angela: We'll see.
column27: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: Angela drafted me into the party planning committee. Her memo said that we need to prepare for every possible disaster. Which to me seems excessive.
column28: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: [comes into the conference room in a Santa hat and beard] Merry Christmas! Ho, ho, ho, [points to Ryan] pimp. I'm kidding. What do we got, what do we got? How many plates are we getting?
column29: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Angela: Fifty.
column30: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Double it. Double everything. Double ice cream. Double napkins. Double it. On me.
column31: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: It was a tough year. I had to fire somebody this year. This party has to really rock. Check it out. Christmas bonus. 3,000 G's. I got this for helping save the company money. So I guess some good came out of firing Devon after all. Maybe I should call him and tell him that.
column32: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: I want people to cut loose. I want people making out in closets. I want people hanging from the ceilings, lamp shades on the heads. I want it to be a Playboy Mansion party. And also, I want you to spread the word that I will have my digital camera. And I'll be taking pictures all along the way. And the best and craziest thing that happens will be on the cover of the newsletter. Incentive.
column33: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: You do realize that we can't serve liquor at the party.
column34: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Yeah, I know. Damn it. Stupid corporate wet blankets. Like booze ever killed anybody.
column35: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kevin & Oscar: One, two, three. [they lift and start to move a desk]
column36: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: You guys should use a hand truck.
column37: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kevin: Do we have one?
column38: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: No.
column39: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Angela: [having trouble with a plastic tablecloth as Pam stands idly by] Will you help me?
column40: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: No! No way! It... no.
column41: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Darryl: Come on, Mike, let me borrow the hat for just a couple of hours.
column42: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: You wanna be Santa?
column43: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Darryl: Yeah.
column44: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Have you ever seen Santa?
column45: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Darryl: Yeah, I've seen Santa.
column46: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Okay.
column47: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Darryl: Who cares?
column48: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Well, I'm sorry. It just doesn't work.
column49: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Michael, I would like to be the elf.
column50: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: That makes sense because he has elfish features.
column51: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: [now wearing an elf hat and ears] Okay, everybody listen up! It is time to get your presents, wrap them, and place them under the tree like so. If you do not get your present wrapped and under the tree within the next five minutes you will be disqualified from Secret Santa. All right? No exceptions except Michael.
column52: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Toby: I got Angela. She is into these posters of babies dressed as adults. I got her one of those. I felt kind of weird buying that.
column53: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Oscar: I got Creed. And to tell you the truth, I don't know anything about Creed. I know his name's Creed. I know he works right over there. I think he's Irish and I .. I got him this shamrock keychain.
column54: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kevin: I got myself for Secret Santa. I was supposed to tell somebody, but I didn't [smiles happily].
column55: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: You get something good this year?
column56: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: I think I did a pretty good job.
column57: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Yeah? Who did you have?
column58: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: Well, I can't tell you cause it's a secret.
column59: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: I think I got something pretty nice for my guy.
column60: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: Yeah?
column61: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: I spent a lot of dough. Lot of dough. Wow.
column62: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: Well, there's a $20 limit, right? So .. ?
column63: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Yeah. I wanted this party to be really special so I sorta went above and beyond.
column64: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: That's great. Well don't tell me who it is, cause I can ..
column65: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: It was Ryan. Yeah. I have Ryan.
column66: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Gather round. Secret Santa, let's go. Let's go. Come on. Stanley, no, I'm going to handle the cord. Okay, safety reasons.
column67: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Stanley: I know how to plug something in.
column68: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: I want to do it.
column69: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: All right, let's count it down, like Rockefeller Center. Ready?
column70: 02x10 - Christmas Party;All: Three, two, one. [very dim lights come on the tree]
column71: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Not great.
column72: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Phyllis: I'm sorry, everybody.
column73: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: I think the tree looks nice.
column74: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Hey, I could get some flares from my car.
column75: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: No, no. Shake it off, everybody. Just, let's do Secret Santa.
column76: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Presents are the best way to show someone how much you care. It's like this tangible thing that you can point to and say, "Hey, man, I love you this many dollars worth."
column77: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: First present, Oscar.
column78: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Oscar: [rips off the wrapping] Shower radio. Neat.
column79: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kelly: Oh, good, that was from me.
column80: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Oscar: Thanks, Kelly. You know I was gonna get one of ..
column81: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Okay. Okay. That's enough. Let's keep it moving on. Jim.
column82: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: Oh, cool. [opens his plastic bag]
column83: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Creed: That's from me.
column84: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: Great. Where did you get it?
column85: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Creed: I don't know. It was so long ago.
column86: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: He obviously forgot to get me something, and then he went in his closet and dug out this little number [holds up way-too-short sleeves] and then threw it in a bag.
column87: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Creed: Yep. That's exactly what happened.
column88: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Pam.
column89: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: [opens up her present] Oh, my god! Thank you very much, Santa, whoever you are. It's awesome.
column90: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: There's a little more to it.
column91: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: All right, next. Ryan. [tosses present]
column92: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: No, don't!
column93: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: [unwraps present] Whoa, a video iPod.
column94: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Whoa. Wow. Jeez. Somebody really got carried away with the spirit of Christmas. That was me, I got a little carried away.
column95: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: Wasn't there a $20 limit on the gift? This is 400 bucks.
column96: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: You don't know that.
column97: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: Yeah, you left the price tag on.
column98: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: I did?
column99: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: Yeah.
column100: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: What? Oh, shoot. Wow. Okay, well, who cares? It doesn't matter what I spent. What matters is that Christmas is fun, right?
column101: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Michael.
column102: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Oh hey, for me. What is in here? [opens a handmade oven mitt] Oh, come on.
column103: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Phyllis: I knitted it for you.
column104: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: An oven mitt? Okay. [walks out]
column105: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: So Phyllis is basically saying, "Hey Michael, I know you did a lot to help the office this year but I only care about you a homemade oven mitt's worth." I gave Ryan an iPod.
column106: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kevin: Should we just keep opening up the presents?
column107: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: We don't do anything until Michael gives us further instructions.
column108: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: I got it! We are going to turn Secret Santa into Yankee Swap.
column109: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: What is Yankee Swap?
column110: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: One person chooses a gift. The next person can either choose a gift or steal that person's gift. If your gift gets stolen, then you can steal somebody else's gift or choose a new gift.
column111: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: I thought that was called Nasty Christmas.
column112: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: Yeah, we call it White Elephant.
column113: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Well, I call it fun!
column114: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Oscar: Why are we doing this?
column115: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Because it's better. Because it's more special.
column116: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Angela: It sounds mean.
column117: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Shut it. No, it's not. Okay, just give it a shot.
column118: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Angela: Michael should have asked the party planning committee first. He's not supposed to just spring things on us out of nowhere. [starts to cry]
column119: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Okay, Meredith is up first. Here's the deal. You can either pick a new gift or you can steal somebody else's gift that they've already gotten, like the oven mitt.
column120: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Meredith: I'll take the teapot.
column121: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: Oh, shouldn't we ... I bought that specifically for Pam.
column122: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Yankee Swap! That's what makes it fun. Pam, you can steal the oven mitt now.
column123: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: I'll take the iPod.
column124: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: And I have to give it to her? I don't have a choice?
column125: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Yes, now you can steal the oven mitt, the old shirt or the shower radio or pick a new gift.
column126: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Stanley: [after Ryan opens a new gift - a nameplate saying 'Kelly'] That was meant for Kelly.
column127: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: Yeah, I figured.
column128: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: I think this is going great.
column129: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kelly: [unwrapping the poster] Yikes.
column130: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Toby: Well, it's for Angela, so ..
column131: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kelly: That's like, the creepiest thing that I've ever seen.
column132: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Angela, you're up.
column133: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Angela: I'll take the poster. Some people like these.
column134: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kelly: I will steal the iPod.
column135: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Everyone wants the iPod. It's a huge hit. It is almost a Christmas miracle.
column136: 02x10 - Christmas Party;
column137: 02x10 - Christmas Party;
column138: 02x10 - Christmas Party;
column139: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Oh, well, Oscar, you little gourmand, you have the next turn.
column140: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Oscar: I'll take the ... teapot.
column141: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Meredith: Damn it.
column142: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Okay, moving along. Meredith, let's go.
column143: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Meredith: I really want the iPod.
column144: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: It's already been stolen this round. Pick something else.
column145: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: [holding oven mitt] I hope nobody takes this baby, cause this is great. Wow, look at that fine craftsmanship. Somebody really put a lot of work into that. It's beautiful.
column146: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Meredith: I'll take the oven mitt.
column147: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Sucker! See, I wanted somebody to take it. Boom! Reverse psychology.
column148: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Reverse psychology is an awesome tool. I don't know if you guys know about it, but basically you make someone think the opposite of what you believe and that tricks them into doing something stupid. Works like a charm.
column149: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: [opens present] "In addition to these paintball pellets, your gift includes two paintball lessons with Dwight Schrute."
column150: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: You and me, Michael. Yes!
column151: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Who wants to take paintball lessons? How is that better than an iPod?
column152: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: I never said it was better than an iPod.
column153: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Michael keeps bragging about his iPod, but you know what? Two paintball lessons with someone as experienced as I am is worth easily, like, 2 grand.
column154: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: [shooting paintball gun at target] Take that, Saddam!
column155: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Last gift. Kevin.
column156: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kevin: I want the foot bath.
column157: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kevin: That's the thing I bought myself. I'm really psyched to use it. [pauses] Maybe I should have taken the iPod. Oh, shoot.
column158: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Pam, steal something or pick the final gift.
column159: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: I want the iPod.
column160: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kelly: Damn it.
column161: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: Sure you don't want the teapot?
column162: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: Well, I mean, it's an iPod. But ..
column163: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: Right.
column164: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: Sorry, I ..
column165: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: No. No. Definitely. It's ..
column166: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kelly: Okay, well, I guess I will take that book of short stories.
column167: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Yes! There you go. I want the teapot. Gracias.
column168: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: Got to be kidding me.
column169: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Yankee Swap is like Machiavelli meets ... Christmas.
column170: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: [after Phyllis leaves suddenly] What is she so upset about?
column171: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: Maybe because you hated her present so much.
column172: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Come on! I think that Yankee Swap was a big hit! I think it's a success and I'm the one who ended up with Dwight's stupid paintball pellets.
column173: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: Yeah, but, Michael, the point is that we all bought gifts for specific people.
column174: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Stanley: And you should have just bought a $20 gift like everyone else.
column175: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Well, I didn't. I got a big bonus because I fired Devon, and I used the money to buy something awesome. Sue me!
column176: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Oscar: You got a bonus check?
column177: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: How much?
column178: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: It wasn't. It wasn't that much. It was $3,000.
column179: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Stanley: All right, I'm done now.
column180: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Unbelievable. I do the nicest thing that anyone has ever done for these people and they freak out. Well, happy birthday, Jesus. Sorry your party's so lame.
column181: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Liquor Store Clerk: It comes to $166.41.
column182: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: All right, now, you're the expert. Is this enough to get 20 people plastered?
column183: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Liquor Store Clerk: Fifteen bottles of vodka? Yeah, that should do it.
column184: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Cool, cool. Box it up.
column185: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: I bought this teapot for Pam, and I know she really wants it. So, can I trade you for it?
column186: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: No trades.
column187: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: Come on, it's a shamrock keychain. Good luck.
column188: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: "A real man makes his own luck." Billy Zane. Titanic.
column189: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: Look, it has sentimental value, Dwight. Can I buy it from you?
column190: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: No. I want it. I'm going to use it.
column191: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: You don't even drink tea.
column192: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: True. But I get sinus infections, and sinus infections can be cured by making your tea from green tea leaf stems ..
column193: 02x10 - Christmas Party;JIm: Okay ..
column194: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: .. and pouring it directly into your nose, like so. [demonstrates]
column195: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: To think that my gift for Pam will be used for that, it's a little too much to handle.
column196: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Roy: This is awesome.
column197: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: I know. It's totally going to change the way I work out.
column198: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Roy: Yeah, I was gonna get you one of these for Christmas, and now I don't have to. I'm gonna save a ton of money.
column199: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: So what are you going to get me instead?
column200: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Roy: I don't know. Probably like, a sweater or something.
column201: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Uh-oh. Looks like Santa was a little naughty.
column202: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Angela: What is that?
column203: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: This is Christmas spirit, as in spirits, booze.
column204: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Meredith: We can drink?
column205: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Toby: We're really not supposed to serve alcohol.
column206: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Zip it, Toby! Just .. I mean, it's a party. Come on. If I can't throw a good party for my employees, then I am a terrible boss. Who wants a drink?
column207: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Meredith: Me. Please.
column208: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Go, here we go!
column209: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Meredith: The deal is that this is my last hurrah, cause I made a New Year's resolution that I'm not going to drink anymore. During the week.
column210: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Phyllis: Hi guys.
column211: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: Hey.
column212: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Phyllis: Does everybody know my boyfriend, Bob Vance?
column213: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kevin: Kevin Malone.
column214: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Bob Vance: Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration.
column215: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Stanley: Stanley Hudson.
column216: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Bob Vance: Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration.
column217: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: Ryan Howard.
column218: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Bob Vance: Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration.
column219: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: What line of work you in, Bob?
column220: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Roy: I think after I lost Culpepper and T.O it was over, man.
column221: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Darryl: Oh, yeah, I need McMahon, Deion Branch to have big games or else I'm done.
column222: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Roy: It's possible. I can't believe you traded Shaun Alexander, man.
column223: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Darryl: I had to. I needed defense.
column224: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Roy: Come on! Shaun Alexander? He's the best back in the league.
column225: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Darryl: It's defense.
column226: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Roy: Oh, no. That is not worth it.
column227: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Darryl: It is worth it.
column228: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Roy: Never.
column229: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Darryl: Are you kidding? You wait.
column230: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Anybody making out in here? [checks hallway] Not yet, give it time. Oh, hey, Ebenezer, boink. [takes picture of Jim] Okay, how's it going in here? [takes picture of Meredith and Kevin]
column231: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: We're running low on cups. Do you want me to just run out and get some?
column232: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Angela: There should be some ..
column233: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: No, no, no, no. We'll find some, don't leave the party.
column234: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Phyllis, Meredith, Michael, Kevin: One, two, three. [do a shot]
column235: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Kudos to Ryan, king of the party committee.
column236: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: Oh, no.
column237: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Yeah, yeah, yeah.
column238: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: I really did not do anything.
column239: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Oh, no, no. No false modesty, my friend.
column240: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: You know, you don't have to answer calls during a party. Just thought you should know.
column241: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: [laughs] No, I was just checking out my present. [holds up teapot]
column242: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: But ..
column243: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: I traded with Dwight. Just, I figured, you know, you went to a lot of trouble and it means a lot. And also, Roy got me an iPod or was going to get me an iPod, so ..
column244: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: Well, either way. This is an amazing gift because it comes with bonus gifts. Look inside.
column245: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: [opens teapot] Oh my god! The yearbook picture!
column246: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: Yeah, I think I made the right choice.
column247: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Pam: Oh, my God! It's incredible. [Jim reaches and steals his card back before she can notice it] Is this the Boggle timer?
column248: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Jim: I didn't think you were going to get that one. I really didn't.
column249: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: This is so awesome.
column250: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Not bad. And if it couldn't go to Ryan, you are the guy I'd want it to go to.
column251: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Thank you.
column252: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: You're welcome.
column253: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Todd Packer: [grabbing Michael around the neck] Merry Christmas, asswipe!
column254: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: No way. Oh, you're kidding me. Packer! Yes! Todd Packer, ladies and gentlemen!
column255: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Todd Packer: [rapping] What's up my nerds. Check it out. [points at the mistletoe stuck down his pants]
column256: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Oh, no, no. Oh look at that. Icing on the cake.
column257: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Todd Packer: Pacman need a drinky.
column258: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Oh, let's fix you up. Who wants to fix up .. Toby. Toby's gonna fix you up.
column259: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kevin: [listening to music through headphones] Yeahhh.
column260: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Darryl. There you go. [hands him the Santa hat] You earned it.
column261: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Darryl: That's okay, Mike.
column262: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: No, no, no, no. I really, really want you to have it.
column263: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Darryl: All right. Thanks, man.
column264: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Hey, Merry Christmas.
column265: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: [looking at Xeroxed butt pictures] Whose butt is that?
column266: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kevin: Mine.
column267: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Ryan: Oh, how did I not guess that?
column268: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: [coming out of his office] Lampshade on head! It's happening!
column269: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Creed: [as Jim decorates a passed out Todd Packer] Oh, no.
column270: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kelly: Hey.
column271: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Oh, hello there. [Kelly leans up and kisses him] But what are you doing?
column272: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kelly: I don't know.
column273: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: You shouldn't do things like that. The man is supposed to do that.
column274: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Kevin: Thanks for the party, Michael.
column275: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Meredith: Yeah.
column276: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Bob Vance: Oh, hey. Listen up. We're going to Poor Richard's. Who's in?
column277: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Oscar: I'm in.
column278: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Dwight: Yes.
column279: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Oscar: Michael? Poor Richard's?
column280: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Yeah, that sounds good.
column281: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Christmas is awesome. First of all, you get to spend time with people you love. Secondly, you can get drunk and no one can say anything. Third, you give presents. What's better than giving presents? And fourth, getting presents. So, four things. Not bad for one day. It's really the greatest day of all time.
column282: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Hey, Meredith. Heading over to Poor Richard's?
column283: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Meredith: Yep.
column284: 02x10 - Christmas Party;Michael: Cool, cool, cool. Do you need a ride? [Meredith drops her top. Michael takes a picture] All right, let's head out. Sounds good. Do you have a coat?

column1: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Hey.
column2: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: Hello. Jim?
column3: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: What's up, buddy?
column4: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: This is not funny. Why is my stuff in here?
column5: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Wow, that's weird. Oh, dollar for a stapler, that's pretty good.
column6: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: Yeah, well, I'm not paying for my own stuff, okay? I know you did this, because you're friends with the vending machine guy.
column7: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Who, Steve?
column8: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: Yeah, Steve, whatever his name is.
column9: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: Sorry. What do I want? What do I want... Oh, it's a pencil cup.
column10: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: No, no, no, no, no. That's my pencil cup.
column11: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: Um, I don't think so, I just bought it.
column12: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: Uh, I think so, and you're going to hand it over to me.
column13: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: I love these.
column14: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: Okay, fine. Where's my wallet?
column15: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Oh, there it is. J1.
column16: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: But I don't have any...
column17: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Here, you know what? You can have some nickels.
column18: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: [putting quarters in] Five, ten, fifteen, twenty, twenty-five...
column19: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Hello, everyone.
column20: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: Good morning, Michael.
column21: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Phyllis: Where are we going this afternoon?
column22: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Ah! Ha ha ha!
column23: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: Last week, Michael sent out this mysterious memo.
column24: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: "It's time for our first quarter camaraderie event, so pack a swimsuit, a toothbrush, rubber-soled shoes, and a ski mask."
column25: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: A ski mask and a swimsuit.
column26: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: So that he can have us rob a bank, and then escape through the sewers.
column27: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: And brush our teeth.
column28: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Yeah?
column29: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Stanley: Michael.
column30: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Stanley! Bo banley.
column31: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Stanley: I need to know...
column32: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Banana fana fo fanley.
column33: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Stanley: What we're doing.
column34: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Be my mo manley.
column35: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Stanley: You said bring a toothbrush.
column36: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Stanley.
column37: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Stanley: Is this an overnight?
column38: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Maybe. The suspense is just so exciting, isn't it?
column39: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Stanley: Should my wife tell her boss she's not coming in tomorrow?
column40: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Maybe, I don't know.
column41: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Stanley: Not maybe. Yes or no.
column42: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Well, no. But... okay, don't spoil it for everybody, all right? But we are going on a booze cruise on Lake Wallenpaupack.
column43: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Stanley: In January?
column44: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: It's cheaper.
column45: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: This is not just another party. This is a leadership training exercise. Right? I'm going to combine elements of fun and motivation and education into a single mind-blowing experience.
column46: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: It is now time to unveil the destination of this year's retreat. We are going on a harbor cruise of Lake Wallenpaupack. It's a booze cruise!
column47: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Meredith: All right!
column48: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Ryan: I have a test for business school tomorrow night. Is it okay if I skip the cruise and study for that?
column49: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: No. This is mandatory. But don't worry, you know what? You're gonna learn plenty. This is gonna turn your life around, Ryan.
column50: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Ryan: I'm already in business school.
column51: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Well, this...
column52: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Kelly: Wait, Michael?
column53: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Yeah?
column54: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Kelly: Why did you tell us to bring a bathing suit?
column55: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: To throw you off the scent.
column56: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Kelly: Yeah, but I bought a bathing suit.
column57: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Well, just keep the tags on and you can return it.
column58: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Kelly: I took the tags off already.
column59: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Well, that's not my fault, okay? Just.. we're not going to pay for a bathing suit. Okay, I know what you're all thinking, "Who is this smart little cookie?" Her name is Brenda... something, and she is from corporate. And she is here, like you, to learn from what I have to say.
column60: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: I am a great motivational speaker. I attended a Tony Robbins event by the airport last year, and... it wasn't the actual course. You have to pay for the actual course. But it talked about the actual course. And I've incorporated a lot of his ideas into my own course.
column61: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Leader... ship. The word "ship" is hidden inside the word "leadership," as its derivation. So if this office is, in fact, a ship, as its leader, I am the captain. But we're all in the same boat. Teamwork!
column62: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Oscar: Last year, Michael's theme was "Bowl over the Competition!" So guess where we went.
column63: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Now, on this ship that is the office, what is a sales department? Anyone?
column64: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Darryl: How about the sales department is the sails?
column65: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Yes, Darryl, the sales department makes sales. Good. Let me just explain. I see the sales department as the furnace.
column66: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Phyllis: A furnace?
column67: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Yeesh, how old is this ship?
column68: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: How about the anchor?
column69: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Phyllis: What does the furnace do?
column70: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: All right, let's not get hung up on the furnace. This just... it's the sales... I see the sales department down there. They're in the engine room, and they are shoveling coal into the furnace, right? I mean, who saw the movie Titanic? They were very important in the movie Titanic. Who saw it? Show of hands!
column71: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: I'm not really sure what movie you're talking about. Are you sure you got the title right?
column72: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Titanic?
column73: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: I think you're thinking of The Hunt for Red October.
column74: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: No, I'm Leo DiCaprio! Come on!
column75: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Michael stands in the front of the boat and says that he's king of the world within the first hour, or I give you my next paycheck.
column76: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Phyllis: Michael, everyone in the engine room drowned.
column77: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: No! Thank you, spoiler alert. You saw the movie, those of you who did. They're happy down there in the furnace room. And they're dirty and grimy and sweaty, and they're singing their ethnic songs, and... actually, that might be warehouse.
column78: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Darryl: What?
column79: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: The... no, no. No, I didn't... okay. Well, okay, in a nutshell, what I'm saying is... leadership. We'll talk more about that on the boat. Ship.
column80: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: Aye aye, Captain.
column81: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: [singing] A three-hour tour, a three-hour tour.
column82: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Pam, you are Mary Ann! We have the Professor and Ginger, welcome aboard. Angela, you are Mrs. Howell. Lovey. [to Kelly] Uh... the native. Sometimes they come from neighboring... [to Stanley] We have one of the Globetrotters, I am the Skipper, and Dwight, you will be Gilligan.
column83: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: Cool.
column84: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Actually, I'm the Skipper. But you can be Gilligan.
column85: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: I'd rather die. Hi, I am Michael Scott, I am the captain of this party.
column86: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: I am Captain Jack, I am captain of the ship. I'm also captain of anyone who sets foot on the ship. [to boarding passengers] Hi, welcome aboard.
column87: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Okay.
column88: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: In an office, when you are ranking people, manager is higher than captain. On a boat, who knows? It's nebulose.
column89: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Hey, look! I'm king of the world!
column90: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Okay, all right! Welcome aboard! I am your captain, Captain Jack.
column91: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: And I am the regional manager of Dunder-Mifflin, Michael Scott. Welcome, welcome!
column92: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Okay! So...
column93: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Okay! So...
column94: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Please. The life preservers.
column95: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Right.
column96: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: They are located underneath the seats, all along the border of the boat.
column97: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: But don't worry, you are not going to be needing life preservers tonight.
column98: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Well, we might, okay? Please let me finish, okay? Thank you. So, the Coast Guard requires that I tell you where the safety exits are. On this ship, it's very easy. Anywhere over the side. [Dwight laughs loudly.] Not only am I your ship captain, I am also your party captain! Whoo! We're gonna get it going in just a few minutes here...
column99: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: I'm your party captain too! And you are gonna put on your dancing shoes later on! So we are gonna...
column100: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Okay, Michael, if you don't mind...
column101: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Rock it!
column102: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Please, okay?
column103: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: If the boat's a-rockin', don't come knockin'!
column104: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Michael.
column105: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Yep.
column106: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Your company's employees are not the only people on the boat tonight, okay?
column107: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: We're all gonna have a good time tonight!
column108: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Why don't you let me and my crew do our job. You just sit back and have a good time. All right?
column109: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Hm? Okay. Yep.
column110: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;
column111: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;
column112: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;
column113: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Katy: You guys, it's like we're in high school and we're at the cool table. Right?
column114: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Roy: Yeah.

column116: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Roy: No, she was totally Miss Artsy-Fartsy in high school. She wore the turtleneck and everything!
column117: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Katy: That's hilarious.
column118: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: It's not hilarious, but...
column119: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Roy: Where did you go to school?
column120: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Katy: Bishop O'Hara.
column121: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Roy: Piss slop who cares-a? We played you! You... you really look familiar. Did you... you cheered for them, didn't you?
column122: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Um, no.
column123: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Katy: Yes, I did! [chanting] A-W-E-S-O-M-E! Awesome! Awesome is what we are! We're the football superstars! A-W-E-S-O-M-E!
column124: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Roy: I remember that! We crushed you like 42-10!
column125: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Having fun?
column126: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Brenda: Yeah. Everybody's really nice.
column127: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Good. Well, that is what Scranton is all about. Not like you New Yawkers.
column128: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Brenda: When are you going to start the presentation?
column129: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Well, we already sort of started it back at the office and on the dock with the Gilligan thing, so... right now, I was thinking. Yes. Okay, listen up all you Dunder-Mifflinites! I would like to talk to you all about life preservers. Now, one important life preserver in business is IT support.
column130: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Not now, Mike, we're doing the limbo! That's right, partiers, it's time to limbo, limbo, limbo!
column131: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: So, okay.
column132: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: Limbo, whoo!
column133: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: All right! I need a volunteer to come up here and hold my stick. Who's it gonna be?
column134: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Meredith: Me.
column135: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Okay...
column136: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: Me! Me, me, me.
column137: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Uh... usually it's a woman.
column138: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: I'm stronger.
column139: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Hey, I got an idea! How would you like to steer the ship, Dwight?
column140: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Keep us on a steady course. Keep a sharp eye out. I'm counting on you!
column141: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: I was the youngest pilot in Pan Am history. When I was four, the pilot let me ride in the cockpit and fly the plane with him. And I was four. And I was great. And I would have landed it, but my dad wanted us to go back to our seats.
column142: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: All right, all right, that was great! Now it's time for the dance contest!
column143: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: But before that, I have to do my presentation.
column144: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Nope! Dance contest!
column145: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: All right, we'll have a motivational dance contest! Hit it! Yeah, okay, dancing! It is a primal art form used in ancient times to express yourself with the body and communicate!
column146: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Sometimes you have to take a break from being the kind of boss that's always trying to teach people things. Sometimes you have to just be the boss of dancing.
column147: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: [singing] What do you do with a drunken sailor? What do you do with a drunken sailor? What do you do with a drunken sailor early in the morning?
column148: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Angela: Hey, come inside and talk to me.
column149: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: I can't. Do you want us to run aground, woman?!
column150: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Darryl and Katy: [chanting] Snorkel shot! Snorkel shot!
column151: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Roy: Whoo! Who's next? Come on, Pam! Come on! Come on!
column152: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: No, I'm not going to do that.
column153: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Roy: Come on!
column154: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Darryl: That's what I'm talking about!
column155: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: Hey, why don't we find like a quieter place to hang out?
column156: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Roy: I've just gotta wait for Darryl to do his shot. Just a minute. Come on! [chanting] Darryl! Darryl!
column157: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: It's getting kind of rowdy down there.
column158: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Yeah. [chanting] Darryl! Darryl! Darryl!
column159: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: Sometimes I just don't get Roy.
column160: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Well...
column161: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: I mean, I don't know. So... what's it like dating a cheerleader?
column162: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Oh, um... [A long silence.]
column163: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: I'm cold.
column164: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: So, what's this presentation all about?
column165: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Ah! See, this is of general interest. It is about priorities and making decisions, using the boat as an analogy. What is important to you? If the boat is sinking, what do you save?
column166: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Women and children.
column167: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: No, no. Salesmen and profit centers.
column168: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: That's a stupid analogy.
column169: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Okay, well, obviously you don't know anything about leadership.
column170: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Well, I was the captain of a PC-1 Cyclone Coastal Patrol Boat during Desert Storm.
column171: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: Wow. You should be the motivational speaker.
column172: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Okay.
column173: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: Yeah. He gives me real responsibility, Michael. Captain Jack delegates. He's let me steer the ship for the last hour.
column174: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Katy: I'd like to be engaged. How did you manage to pull that off?
column175: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: Uh, I've been engaged for three years, and there's no end in sight. So... you don't wanna ask my advice.
