column176: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Suppose your office building's on fire. Jim, who would you save?
column177: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Um... let's see, uh... The customer. Because the customer is king.
column178: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Not what I was looking for, but a good thought.
column179: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: He's just sucking up!
column180: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Roy: When you were in the Navy, did you ever almost die?
column181: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Oh yeah, oh yeah. And I wasn't thinking about some customer. I was thinking about my first wife. The day I got back on shore, I married her.
column182: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: You know what? I would save the receptionist. I just wanted to clear that up.
column183: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Roy: Hello, everybody, could I have your attention for just a second? Could you listen to me for a second? We were up at the front, and we were talking about what's really important, and... Pam, I think enough is enough. I think we should set a date for our wedding. How about June 10th? Come on, let's do it! Come on, Pam!
column184: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: I don't want to take credit for this, but Roy and I were just having a conversation about making commitments and making choices. Right? Did I motivate you?
column185: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Roy: No, it was Captain Jack.
column186: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Well... could have been either one of us, because we were pretty much saying the same thing. Congratulations. That is great!
column187: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: We gotta celebrate! Hey, I got an idea, I got an idea. I can marry you right now, as captain of the ship!
column188: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Yes! I can marry you as regional manager of Dunder-Mifflin!
column189: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: No, no, I want my mom and dad to be there.
column190: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Then I'll give you away!
column191: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Pam: No, thank you.
column192: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Katy: Do you think that'll ever be us?
column193: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: No.
column194: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Katy: What is wrong with you? Why did you even bring me here tonight?
column195: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: I don't know. Let's break up.
column196: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Katy: Whoa. What?
column197: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: This is where Captain Jack drives the boat.
column198: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Meredith: Wow!
column199: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: Seasick? Captain Jack says you should look at the Moon.
column200: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Captain Jack is a fart face. I'm on medication.
column201: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Brenda: Really? What?
column202: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Vomicillin. Okay. All right. It's time to be boss. It's time to motivate. Let's blow some minds here. Okay, guys, guys, cool it. Everybody, Dunder-Mifflin Scranton employees, Brenda, I have some very, very urgent news I need to tell everybody right now. Listen up. The ship is sinking! Okay? We're going down, right now. Just wrap your heads around the reality of that. Shh, please! Everybody, it's my turn now, okay? Captain Jack is gone. In five minutes, this ship is going to be at the bottom of the lake! And there aren't enough spaces on the lifeboat! Who are we gonna save? Do we save sales? Do we save customer service? Do we save accounting? This is a business scenario. Right? It's a scary... it's a...
column203: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Captain Jack: Hey! Hey! What the hell is going on here?
column204: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: It's a predicament, and it's something that each and every one of us has to think about.
column205: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: I'm in the brig. See? The boat's not as corporate-friendly as advertised. What was the deal with the guy jumping overboard? What was... if he had just waited and heard what I had to say, he would be motivated right now and not all wet.
column206: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Is somebody there?
column207: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: What happened to you?
column208: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Captain Jack has a problem with authority.
column209: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Oh, right, because you announced that his ship was sinking?
column210: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: He just totally lost it. If you ask me, he caused the panic.
column211: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: What a night.
column212: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Well, it's nice for you. Your friend got engaged.
column213: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: She was always engaged.
column214: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Roy said the first one didn't count.
column215: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: That's... great. You know, to tell the truth, I used to have a big thing for Pam, so...
column216: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Really? You're kidding me. You and Pam? Wow. I would have never have put you two together. You really hid it well. God! I usually have a radar for stuff like that. You know, I made out with Jan...
column217: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Yeah, I know.
column218: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Yeah? Yep. Well, Pam is cute.
column219: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Yeah. She's really funny, and she's warm. And she's just... well, anyway.
column220: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Well, if you like her so much, don't give up.
column221: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: She's engaged.
column222: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: BFD. Engaged ain't married.
column223: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Jim: Huh.
column224: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: Never, ever, ever give up.
column225: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Dwight: Don't worry, Michael. I'm taking us to shore.
column226: 02x11 - Booze Cruise;Michael: It's a fake wheel, dummy.

column1: 02x12 - The Injury;Oscar: ...Lord of the Rings trilogy, if you see it back to back, it's really long. But it's good.
column2: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: [off camera] Yeah, that's right.
column3: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.
column4: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Pam! It's Michael. Help me! I need help right now.
column5: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Michael, what's wrong?
column6: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I'm hurt, I have hurt myself. Oh my God!
column7: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Ok, wait wait wait wait...
column8: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Ungh, this is not looking good Pam!
column9: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Michael, do you need me to call an ambulance?!
column10: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: No, I want you to pick me up.
column11: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: What?
column12: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Ok...
column13: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: What's going on?
column14: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Wait a second, I thought you said that you were hurt.
column15: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I am hurt. I hurt my foot.
column16: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: I'm sorry? Pam.
column17: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: [exasperated]
column18: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: What is going on?
column19: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I want to come to work. But I need you to come and pick me up. [Jim lunges across Pam's desk and puts Michael on speakerphone]
column20: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: OH GOD!
column21: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Hey, whoa, Michael...
column22: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Oh God!
column23: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: It's, okay, it's Jim. Just say again, uh, really loudly what happened.
column24: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: OK, buhhhh, I burned my foot very badly on my Foreman Grill and I now need someone to come and bring me into work.
column25: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: You burned your foot on a Foreman Grill?
column26: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I enjoy having breakfast in bed. I like waking up to the smell of bacon, sue me. And since I don't have a butler, I have to do it myself. So, most nights before I go to bed, I will lay six strips of bacon out on my George Foreman Grill. Then I go to sleep. When I wake up, I plug in the grill, I go back to sleep again. Then I wake up to the smell of crackling bacon. It is delicious, it's good for me. It's the perfect way to start the day. Today I got up, I stepped onto the grill and it clamped down on my foot... that's it. I don't see what's so hard to believe about that.
column27: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Pam, could you come get me?!
column28: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Uh, I have to stay here and answer the phone.
column29: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Ok, could someone come and get me please, Ryan?
column30: 02x12 - The Injury;Phyllis: Michael, you should stay home and rest.
column31: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: There's no toilet paper here. Could Ryan... tell Ryan to bring toilet paper. Could you tell 'em that?
column32: 02x12 - The Injury;Kevin: Can you hop?
column33: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I tried hopping, Kevin, and I bumped my elbow against the wall and now my elbow has a protruberance.
column34: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: [panicked] No one wants to pick me up!?
column35: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: [silence, Dwight enters the office] What is going on? What is going on?
column36: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Michael, is, um, sick and he wants one of us to rescue him.
column37: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I'm not sick! I'm burned!
column38: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: I'm coming Michael!
column39: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Oh...
column40: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: I'm gonna save you!
column41: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Don't... is that Dwight? I do not want Dwight.
column42: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Hold on Michael! I am coming! Wait there!
column43: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I don't want Dwight!
column44: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Michael, why don't you call your girlfriend?
column45: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I don't have a girlfriend.
column46: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: But you said that you went out with her this weekend.
column47: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: It was all made up. Just someone come, ok? Anyone. Anyone but Dwight.
column48: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: [sounds of a car crash] What was that...
column49: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: What was that?! [everyone runs to Michael's office window]
column50: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Oh!
column51: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Ohhhhhh!
column52: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: He hit the pole!
column53: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: It's broken right, he can't...
column54: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Oh my gosh.
column55: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Oh Dwight, Dwight, [Dwight pukes on his back windshield] Ohhhhhh!
column56: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim and Pam: Oh my God!
column57: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Is he ok?
column58: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: He's still driving... Dwight, you forgot your bumper!
column59: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Hellooo? ... Please don't send Dwight!
column60: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Morning everyone. Don't freak out. I forbid anybody to freak out. Clearly, I have had a very serious accident, but I will recover, God willing. I just want to be treated normally today. Normal would actually be good, considering the trauma that I've been through.
column61: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: You missed two big conference calls today, one with corporate.
column62: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Did you explain why?
column63: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: No, I didn't mention that you cooked your foot.
column64: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Burned my foot, Pam.
column65: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Please stop popping my cast. Thank you.
column66: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: So, where are you shipping your foot?
column67: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Ha ha ha. So where are you shipping...
column68: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Your foot?
column69: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Thank you. Pam, messages please?
column70: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: You didn't have any.
column71: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Really, well, it, uh, seemed very important to you earlier that you needed to stay and...
column72: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: And do my job?
column73: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: No, your job is being my friend, Pam. OW! God!
column74: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: [holding mini-fan] It slipped.
column75: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: What?
column76: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Sorry.
column77: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: It's just that before, you said that you didn't want any special treatment.
column78: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I don't want any special treatment, Pam. I just want you to treat me like you would some family member who's undergone some sort of serious physical trauma. I don't think that's too much to ask.
column79: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Do you want some aspirin, because you seem a little fussy.
column80: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: No, I don't want some aspirin, yeah I'm a little fussy. Aspirin's not gonna do a damn thing. I'm sitting here with a bloody stump of a foot.
column81: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Hey, Pam, I'm assistant regional manager, and I can take care of him. Part of my duties are to.
column82: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: What? Part of your duties are to what?
column83: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: What?
column84: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: You just said "part of your duties are to" something.
column85: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: No, I didn't.
column86: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Yes, you did. What is wrong with you?
column87: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: What is wrong with you?
column88: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Where is my cornbread?
column89: 02x12 - The Injury;Ryan: Here you go.
column90: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Thank you. Did you get all dark meat like I like?
column91: 02x12 - The Injury;Ryan: Yes. I ordered three full rotisserie chickens worth of all dark meat.
column92: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Where are the yams?
column93: 02x12 - The Injury;Ryan: They were out of yams. I got you creamed spinach.
column94: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Did you go to the one in Stroudsburg?
column95: 02x12 - The Injury;Ryan: Yes.
column96: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: And they had no yams?
column97: 02x12 - The Injury;Ryan: They had no yams.
column98: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: How strange. Because they always have yams.
column99: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Aw, man, is that a Prism Duro-Sport?
column100: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: You've seen one of these?
column101: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Yeah, they're like an i-Pod only they're better 'cause they're chunkier and more solid.
column102: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Roy gave it to me for Christmas. I'm trying to figure out how to put songs on it.
column103: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Oh, no no no. Don't go there. I know this Russian website where you can download songs for two cents a piece.
column104: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Really?
column105: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Yeah, I'll write down the address for you. Only, the only thing is, is that all the songs are in Russian. ... Kidding!
column106: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Oh! Ha, haha.
column107: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Why would they all be...? Ok, see you later, Pan.
column108: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Pan?
column109: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Pam... PAAAM!?
column110: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Oh, God.
column111: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: [phone rings] What.
column112: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Come here please.
column113: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Tell me before I come there.
column114: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I want you to rub butter on my foot.
column115: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: No.
column116: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Pam, please? I have Country Crock.
column117: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: No.
column118: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Uh, ow. Ryan! ... Ryaaaaan ... RYYYYAN!
column119: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: These covers are totally indestructible.
column120: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Really?
column121: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Yeah. Throw it. I promise it won't break. Chuck it. [Pam throws her mp3 player]
column122: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Oh no, it's broken.
column123: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: What?!
column124: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: No, it's fine. I told you it wouldn't break. You could throw it all day long.
column125: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: That is so cool. Thanks Dwight!
column126: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Yep.
column127: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: So, I guess Pam and Dwight are friends now.
column128: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Oh God no, Dwight isn't my friend... Oh my God! Dwight's kind of my friend!
column129: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: No, nope, no one is helping me out at all Mom. No, I'm not gonna call Jan. She'd just worry... drive down here and make a big thing... Who told you that? No, it was mutual. What is Pam doing chatting with you?
column130: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Huh. Do you like candy?
column131: 02x12 - The Injury;Angela: It's alright.
column132: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Cause you're sweeter than candy.
column133: 02x12 - The Injury;Angela: What is wrong with you? [Dwight pats Angela on the rear and runs away laughing]
column134: 02x12 - The Injury;Angela: Hey!
column135: 02x12 - The Injury;Toby: Wow, you just dive right into it.
column136: 02x12 - The Injury;Ryan: You know, around age twelve, I just started goin' for it.
column137: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: [loud noise in bathroom] No! Guh! OW! Awww, help, help me!
column138: 02x12 - The Injury;Toby: What, what happened?
column139: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I fell off the toilet. I'm caught between the toilet and the wall.
column140: 02x12 - The Injury;Toby: What do you need?
column141: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Ugh, not you. Someone else. Get Pam.
column142: 02x12 - The Injury;Toby: I don't think Pam's gonna want to come into the men's room.
column143: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Get Ryan. He needs to lift me. [Ryan shakes his head] and he needs to clean me up a little bit. Bring a wet towel.
column144: 02x12 - The Injury;Toby: Ryan, is, uh, dead.
column145: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: No, he's not.
column146: 02x12 - The Injury;Toby: Dead.
column147: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I just saw him.
column148: 02x12 - The Injury;Toby: No. Can't, can't you just get up yourself? I... You only grilled your foot.
column149: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Ugh, forget it. I'll just get up myself. No! Uh, aaaahhh! Ah! Oh God!
column150: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Do you think Dwight's bein' a little weird today?
column151: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: No, he's actually been really nice and helpful.
column152: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: And that isn't weird?
column153: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Wow...
column154: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Can I have everyone's attention please? Phyllis, Oscar, Ryan, who's supposed to be dead, can I ask you all a question? Do you all know what it's like to be disabled? Oscar?
column155: 02x12 - The Injury;Phyllis: Um, I had scoliosis as a girl.
column156: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: No, never heard of it. No, a real disability, not a woman's trouble.
column157: 02x12 - The Injury;Creed: When I was a teenager, I was in an iron lung.
column158: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Wuh, how, how old are you? Look, the point is, I am the only one here who has a legitimate disability, although I'm sure Stanley has had his fair share of obstacles.
column159: 02x12 - The Injury;Stanley: I'm not disabled and neither are you.
column160: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Ok, [lifts up cooked foot] what does this look like to you Stanley?!
column161: 02x12 - The Injury;Stanley: Mailboxes, Etc.
column162: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Shuuut it, ok, well, well you know what, disabilities are not things to be laughed at or laughed about. You people are jerks. Imagine if you had left Stevie Wonder on the floor of that bathroom instead of me.
column163: 02x12 - The Injury;Phyllis: Oh, we wouldn't. We love Stevie Wonder.
column164: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: [sigh] I burned my foot!!! Ok, twenty minutes, conference room, everybody's in there!
column165: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: [looking up at Creed] Dad?
column166: 02x12 - The Injury;
column167: 02x12 - The Injury;
column168: 02x12 - The Injury;
column169: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: While we are waiting for our special guest to arrive, I wanted you all to take a look at a few of the many, many disabled icons who have contributed so much to our society.
column170: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Quick question: uh, why is Tom Hanks on the wall?
column171: 02x12 - The Injury;Ryan: Twice.
column172: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Good question. Forrest Gump: mentally challenged, Philadelphia [points to a picture from Big][/b]: AIDS.
column173: 02x12 - The Injury;Kevin: I think that's from Big.
column174: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I don't think so, no.
column175: 02x12 - The Injury;Kelly: Yeah, he's dancing on a piano with Robert Loggia.
column176: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: He grew into a man overnight. Rare disability, still works. [sigh] A crossword puzzle Stanley, seriously, are you learning nothing here?
column177: 02x12 - The Injury;Stanley: Uh hmmmm... .
column178: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: What you mean uh hmmm... ?
column179: 02x12 - The Injury;Stanley: I mean I'm learning nothing.
column180: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Ok.
column181: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: Michael Scott, I'm looking for Michael Scott.
column182: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Yes, right in here, come on in.
column183: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: Great.
column184: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: This, ladies and gentlemen, is our special guest.
column185: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: Sorry I'm late. Someone parked in the handicapped parking space.
column186: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: Hey everyone, I'm Billy Merchant, you may have seen me around here before, I'm the properties manager of this office park
column187: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: You are so brave. You are so brave.
column188: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: Thank you. Actually, I've been meaning to come by here for a long time...
column189: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: But it's hard for you! Right? Because you're in a wheelchair.
column190: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: No, I just have a lot of properties to manage.
column191: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Let me ask you something, how long does it take for you to do something simple, every day, like brush your teeth in the morning?
column192: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: I don't know, like 30 seconds?
column193: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Oh my God, that's three times as long as it takes me.
column194: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: How did you get in your wheelchair?
column195: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: This morning? Just like every other morning, just climbed on in. [Everyone laughs]
column196: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Hey, hey, hey, not funny! Not funny.
column197: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: Hey, hey, relax, just jokin around here.
column198: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Well, that's good, he still has a sense of humor.
column199: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: Listen, I've actually used a chair since I was four years old. I don't really notice it anymore.
column200: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Well they notice it. Don't you? You notice it. It's the first thing you saw when he rolled in here, isn't it?
column201: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: I want to clamp Michael's face in a George Foreman grill.
column202: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: So, there are just a couple things I want to remind everybody of...
column203: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Ok...
column204: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: First is parking. You can't block the freight entrance with your car, even if your blinkers are on. Does anybody have any questions? [to Dwight, whose arms is raised] Yes. Yeah? yes...
column205: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Dwight, you have your hand up.
column206: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Ignore him. You know what? We're not that different, you and I. When I clamped my foot into a non-stick...
column207: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: You know what Michael?
column208: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Yeah...
column209: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: Let me stop you right there.
column210: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Ok.
column211: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: And leave.
column212: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Did you see Born on the Fourth of July? I was under the impression that Billy would be more like that guy.
column213: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: What's wrong with that guy?
column214: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: You mean today? He stepped on a George Foremen grill and he burned his foot.
column215: 02x12 - The Injury;Billy Merchant: No, not Michael. The moon-faced kid who crashed into the pole. He looks like he has a concussion.
column216: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: [popping his bubble wrap cast] Hey!
column217: 02x12 - The Injury;Ryan: I found the pudding cups you wanted in a gas station in Carbondale!
column218: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: You did it! Look at you, and with the plate and the napkin. Very nice. Thank you, Ryan.
column219: 02x12 - The Injury;Ryan: You are very welcome.
column220: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Did you get the yams?
column221: 02x12 - The Injury;Ryan: No, the gas station in Carbondale did not have fresh yams!
column222: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: [sigh] Ok, I'll just have the pudding.
column223: 02x12 - The Injury;Ryan: You sure?
column224: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Yeh.
column225: 02x12 - The Injury;Ryan: Ok.
column226: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: You know what? I feel better. Ryan brought me some chocolate pudding and his kindness healed my foot.
column227: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Yeah, baby, I am feelin' better. My body's literally healing itself. It is amazing what the human body is capable of when you have a powerful brain.
column228: 02x12 - The Injury;Ryan: I ground up four extra-strength aspirin and put them in Michael's pudding. I do the same thing with my dog to get him to take his heartworm medicine.
column229: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Uh, finally feel the blood coursing through my foot veins.
column230: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: [hits his head on his desk] Uh, ugh, ohhhh...
column231: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Uh, ok, I think we need to take him to the hospital because I'm pretty sure he has a concussion.
column232: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Oh, now you feel some compassion for him.
column233: 02x12 - The Injury;Angela: He needs to go right now, and you're his emergency contact. I think that you should go with him.
column234: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Why don't you go with him?
column235: 02x12 - The Injury;Angela: I, barely know him...
column236: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: I want Michael to take me...
column237: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I can't take you, I don't have my car and yours is all vomity.
column238: 02x12 - The Injury;Meredith: You can take my van!
column239: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Oh, ok, that's, great. No, I can't drive. Jim why don't you drive.
column240: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Fine.
column241: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: We'll go. I'm still recovering. So let's just, Ryan, could you get my coat please.
column242: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Slowly, slowly. Let's just get to the elevator.
column243: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Choo choo choo choo choo choo...
column244: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: What are you doing? What, stop...
column245: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Vietnam sounds.
column246: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: [Dwight falls onto the couch] Stop, stop, stop, stop.
column247: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Tired... [Jim grabs spray bottle from planter]
column248: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: You can't lay down.
column249: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Want to take a rake... .
column250: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Wake up. [sprays Dwight]
column251: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Ahh!
column252: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Dwight, here, let me help you Dwight.
column253: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: I'm just gonna get...
column254: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Ok, Pam, thanks.
column255: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Get up, get up.
column256: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: You're the best.
column257: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Yeah.
column258: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Just keep him awake.
column259: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: It smells like chicken soup.
column260: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: I know.
column261: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: I have to go to the hospital.
column262: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: I know.
column263: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Where we going?
column264: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: I just want to say goodbye ok?
column265: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: I'll be back, I mean...
column266: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Yes, I know, but it's gonna be different.
column267: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Why?
column268: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: It's just hard to explain.
column269: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Aw, Pam, you're adorable [taps her nose]
column270: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Oh my goodness!
column271: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: [giggles]
column272: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Come here.
column273: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Oh, huggy hugs.
column274: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Shotgun!
column275: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: You don't think you should sit in the back with Dwight?
column276: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: The rules of shotgun are very simple and very clear. The first person to shout "shotgun" when you're within the sight of the car gets the front seat. That's how the game's played. There are no exceptions for someone with a concussion.
column277: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Oh, God, a mini-van. What is Meredith's problem?
column278: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Well, I think she has a kid.
column279: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Well, yeah she has one kid, no husband. She's not gonna find one driving this thing around.
column280: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Where are we going?
column281: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Come on, get inside.
column282: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: Where are we going?
column283: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: We're going to Chuck E. Cheese.
column284: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Chuck E. Cheese? Oh, God, I'm so sick of Chuck E. Cheese.
column285: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: We're going to the hospital, Michael.
column286: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: I know, just sayin'.
column287: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Dwight, what are you drinking?
column288: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: I found it under the seat.
column289: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Oh my God, Dwight, put that down.
column291: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Give the bottle to Michael [sprays Dwight]
column293: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Give the bottle to Michael!
column295: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Give it to me.
column297: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Dwight... [to Jim] You just keep your eyes on the road. [to Dwight] Give me the bottle or you're fired.
column298: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: You can't fire me, I don't work in this van!
column299: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Give it to me Dwight.
column301: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Give me the bottle!!
column302: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: [to Michael] Will you stop?
column303: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Gimme the bottle, Dwight!
column307: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Michael stop. [sprays Michael, then Dwight]
column308: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Stop, stop it! Stop spraying! [Dwight whines] Gimme the bottle!
column311: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Stop spraying me! Gimme the bottle!
column313: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Dwight, what is your middle name.
column316: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: It's Kurt. Wow, I am so sad that I know that.
column317: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: What do I write under "reason for visit"?
column318: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Concussion. [Michael scribbles something out] What did you write?
column319: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Nothing. I wrote "bringing someone to the hospital".
column320: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: So you thought they meant your reason for coming to the hospital.
column321: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: No... you know what Jim, this isn't about me anymore. I made a miraculous recovery, which is more than I can say for him. [Dwight falls towards Jim]
column322: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Come on Dwight. [sprays Dwight]
column326: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Doctor, what is more serious, a head injury or a foot injury?
column328: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Well, you don't have all the information. The foot as been fairly severely burned and healed quickly, very quickly, actually like suspiciously quickly.
column329: 02x12 - The Injury;Doctor: [to Dwight] So, I'm ordering a CAT scan.
column331: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Look since you have the machine up and running, can I just stick my foot, we take a look?
column332: 02x12 - The Injury;Doctor: Well, for a burn, you really just need to look at the outside of the foot.
column333: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Ok, what kinda machine is that?
column334: 02x12 - The Injury;Doctor: Does the skin look red and swollen?
column335: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: That's what she said.
column336: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: That's my joke, damnit Dwight.
column337: 02x12 - The Injury;Lab Tech: Ok, no electronics past this point. Camera, sound equipment...
column338: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: It's ok, they're with me.
column339: 02x12 - The Injury;Lab Tech: No metal of any kind.
column340: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Alright, well, I guess this is where we leave you off.
column341: 02x12 - The Injury;Dwight: I don't want to do this.
column342: 02x12 - The Injury;Michael: Uh, well you should of thought of before you crashed your head on your way to pick me up. We'll, see you when you get out.
column345: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.
column346: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Dunder Mifflin, this is Jim.
column347: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Oh my God, what is going on, is Dwight ok?
column348: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Uh hmm, he should be fine, but, uh, they brought him in for a CAT scan.
column349: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: I can't believe he's getting a CAT scan.
column350: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: Michael went in there with him too. It's pretty sweet.
column351: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Really? Michael went in with him?
column354: 02x12 - The Injury;Jim: But they shouldn't be much longer now, so we'll be back soon.
column355: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: Ok, that's uh, good news [Pam sees Angela eavesdropping] Uh, yeah, no I'll let you go.
column361: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: I just wanted to let you that Dwight's gonna be ok. The doctor said there's a really simple treatment for a concussion, so he'll probably even be back at work tomorrow.
column363: 02x12 - The Injury;Pam: I just, uh, thought you'd want to know that.
column364: 02x12 - The Injury;Lab Tech: Ok Mr. Schrute, inhale with me on three. One, two, uh Sir? [Michael tries to put his leg in the scanner] Stop that. Stop. Stop that.

column1: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Not much what's up with you?
column2: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Oh, I can not believe I fell for that. [laughing] Oh, my God.
column3: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Ah, ah, ah, what? What? Where's the funny? Give it to me.
column4: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Umm, is it me or does it smell like up-dog in here?
column5: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: What's up-dog?
column6: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Nothin' much what's up with you?
column7: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Oh, oh, wow! I walked right into that. Oh, that's brilliant!
column8: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Hey, Stanley, is that jacket make of up-dog?
column9: 02x13 - The Secret;Stanley: I'm on the phone.
column10: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Mmm, what flavour coffee is that? Up-dog?
column11: 02x13 - The Secret;Ryan: What's that?
column12: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: I don't know, nothin', what's up with you?
column13: 02x13 - The Secret;Ryan: Huh?
column14: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: [low] No, damn it!
column15: 02x13 - The Secret;Kevin: What does that mean?
column16: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: What does what mean?
column17: 02x13 - The Secret;Kevin: The thing you just said?
column18: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Just forget it.
column19: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Dwight! Hey is it me or does this place smell like up-dog?
column20: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: What's up-dog?
column21: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Gotcha! [laughing] Oh, God. [low] Crap! Nothin' how ya doing?
column22: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Good. How are you doing?
column23: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: [mouthing] So close.
column24: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: [low] Damn it.
column25: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Today is spring cleaning day here at Dunder Mifflin. And yes I know its January. I am not an idiot. But, if you do your Spring cleaning in January; guess what you don't have to do in the spring? Anything. They say a cluttered desk means a cluttered mind. Well I say that an empty desk means a...
column26: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Empty mind.
column27: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: No, that's not... no, that's not what I was going to say.
column28: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Meredith, men's room. Make sure you replace the urinal cakes. They're worn down. Kevin file drawers. Angela kitchen. Oscar dusting. Where is Oscar?
column29: 02x13 - The Secret;Angela: He's out sick.
column30: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: That's unacceptable.
column31: 02x13 - The Secret;Angela: I agree it's unacceptable. [longing look]
column32: 02x13 - The Secret;Kevin: Whhh... What are you guys doing?
column33: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Michael.
column34: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Yes.
column35: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Oscar is out sick.
column36: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: On a Friday? [Dwight nods]
column37: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Can I do some of the talking?
column38: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: I will do all the talking.
column39: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Ok, let him know that I'm here.
column40: 02x13 - The Secret;Oscar: Hello.
column41: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: What difference does it make whether your here?
column42: 02x13 - The Secret;Oscar: Hello?
column43: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Hi, Oscar its Michael.
column44: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: And Dwight.
column45: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Yechh, yeah, um, heard you were under the weather?
column46: 02x13 - The Secret;Oscar: Yeah I think I came down with the flu.
column47: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Really? Oh, that is a shame. You know it's cleaning day here today? Could have used some of that famous Hispanic cleaning ethic.
column48: 02x13 - The Secret;Oscar: Yeah, I feel terrible about it.
column49: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Ask him his symptoms. I'm on Web M.D.
column50: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: What are your symptoms?
column51: 02x13 - The Secret;Oscar: I have the chills.
column52: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Umm, hmmm.
column53: 02x13 - The Secret;Oscar: I feel nauseous and my heads killing.
column54: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Checks out.
column55: 02x13 - The Secret;Oscar: Michael is there anything you need from me? I'd like to go back to bed.
column56: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: I need you to go back to bed. I need you to get better. See you Monday. Unless you're still sick. So have a great long weekend.
column57: 02x13 - The Secret;Oscar: I'll just be sleep--- [Michael hangs up the phone before Oscar can finish]
column58: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Ok. First impressions?
column59: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: He sounded sick.
column60: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Which is exactly how you'd wanna sound like if you wanted someone to think you were sick.
column61: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: That's exactly what I was thinking.
column62: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Question? May I investigate?
column63: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Yeah. Drop what you're doing. Make this a priority. Because an office can't function efficiently unless people are at their desks doing their jobs.
column64: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: I bought my veil.
column65: 02x13 - The Secret;Kelly: Oh my God! That is so exciting! Can I be a bridesmaid?
column66: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Ummm...
column67: 02x13 - The Secret;Kelly: Listen, you don't have to answer now. But how are you going to do your hair?
column68: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Ok. I was thinking about wearing it down. Kind of like, I don't know, like loose with big curls and...
column69: 02x13 - The Secret;Kelly: You'd look like an angel. I'm seriously going to cry.
column70: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Wowweee. Mikey likey. Why don't you wear your hair like that all the time. It's much sexier. [Pam puts hair back up] [Michael walks by Jim] Man, this must be torture for you.
column71: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Yeah. On the booze cruise I told Michael about some feelings I used to have for Pam. I had just broken up with Katy and had a couple drinks. And I confided in the world's worst confidant.
column72: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Hey Michael.
column73: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Hey Jim-bag.
column74: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Remember that thing I told you on the booze cruise about Pam? That... was... personal so if we can just keep that between you and me. That would be great.
column75: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Really?
column76: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Umm, hmm.
column77: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Who else knows?
column78: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Nobody.
column79: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Wow!
column80: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Jim and I are great friends. We hang out a ton, mostly at work. But, the fact that he told me his secret and no one else knows says everything about our friendship. And it is why, I intend on keeping that secret for as long as I possibly can.
column81: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: My lips are sealed. [singing] My lips are sealed... Bangles.
column82: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Alright. Great. Thank you.
column83: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: [singing] Can you hear me, they talk about us...
column84: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Listen Temp. I am conducting a little investigation so I'm no longer going to be able to head up spring cleaning. Do you think you can handle it?
column85: 02x13 - The Secret;Ryan: Yeah, I think I can handle it.
column86: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Do you think? Or do you know?
column87: 02x13 - The Secret;Ryan: I think.
column88: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: [low] Oh God, here.
column89: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Hey, whatcha gettin'?
column90: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: I'm going with grape.
column91: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Ah, good stuff, good stuff. Did you see the game last night?
column92: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Which one?
column93: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Any of em? So, uh, what's the 411? Any news on the "P" situation?
column94: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: I don't know what you mean.
column95: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: P-A-M. P-A
column96: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Uh, uh, ok.
column97: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: No it's okay, we're talking code.
column98: 02x13 - The Secret;Stanley: What is?
column99: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Listen Stanley. How long does it take you to pick out a soda?
column100: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: I'm going to take off actually.
column101: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Alright, well, cool. [Michael walks by Jim] Still deciding?
column102: 02x13 - The Secret;Stanley: Hmm?
column103: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: [Michael presses a button for Stanley] Peach iced tea. You're going to hate it.
column104: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Hey Oscar how ya doin'? Dwight Schrute calling. Listen a little question for you, buddy. I called six minutes ago and no one answered. So I was wondering if you could explain. Oh, I see, so. Sounds like you're too sick to come into work but your well enough to go to the pharmacy.
column105: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: There are several different ways to tell if a perp is lying. The liar will avoid direct eye contact. The liar will cover part of his or her face with his hands, especially the mouth. The liar will perspire. Unfortunately I spoke to Oscar on the phone so none of this is useful.
column106: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: It's Grrrrrrape! Soda.
column107: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Tony the tiger. You don't hear that much any more.
column108: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Not so much.
column109: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Ok, what is going on here?
column110: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Nothing.
column111: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Oh, really nothing? Fact: You are drinking grape soda. You never drink grape soda. Fact: You are talking to Jim. You never talk to Jim.
column112: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Fact: I love grape soda. I always have. Fact: Jim and I talk all the time. We tell each other secrets.
column113: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Ok. So what is the secret Michael?
column114: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Um, I had asked Michael if I could head up the Oscar investigation and he said that only Dwight was capable of handling such sensitive material.
column115: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Is that true?
column116: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Um, I don't know, yeah, yeah, yeah it is.
column117: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Thank you Michael. I know your telling the truth.
column118: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Ok.
column119: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: I can tell. I won't let you down.
column120: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Good.
column121: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Thanks.
column122: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Whooo, nice. That was, that was slick. What are you doin' for lunch?
column123: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: I don't know probably just gonna eat my ham and cheese sandwich in the break room.
column124: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Oh nonsense [lifts leg and puts it on Jim's desk], no way, no. Why don't, why don't I take you out to lunch? My treat.
column125: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: No, that's alright, thank you though. It's, I, gotta do some cleaning, should probably stick around here.
column126: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Hey you know what we could do? We could spread out a blanket in the break room. Have a little picnic order some 'za. Talk about you know who.
column127: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Oh, ah, no but no. You know what let's go out. That was a good idea. Let's go out.
column128: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: I know just he place.
column129: 02x13 - The Secret;
column130: 02x13 - The Secret;
column131: 02x13 - The Secret;
column132: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: [at Hooters] Oh man, you should order milk. Get it?
column133: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Why do I like Hooters? Well I will give you two reasons, the boobs and the hot wings.
column134: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Oh, here we go, here we go. Bogy at 3 o'clock. Hi.
column135: 02x13 - The Secret;Dana: Hey I'm Dana. Welcome to Hooters.
column136: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: We're not worthy. We're not worthy. Hello Dana, I am Michael and this is Jim and we are brothers.
column137: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Nope we're not brothers.
column138: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: I'm his boss actually. And I treat him well. I'm taking him out to lunch cause I can afford it and he can have whatever he wants.
column139: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Can I just have the ham and cheese sandwich, thanks.
column140: 02x13 - The Secret;Dana: And for you?
column141: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Tell me Dana, how is your chicken breast?
column142: 02x13 - The Secret;Dana: Oh, it's great. It's served with our world famous wing sauce.
column143: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Mmmm, sounds yummy. I will have a chicken breast hold the chicken. [Giggles]
column144: 02x13 - The Secret;Dana: Is that what you really want?
column145: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: No, I'm gonna have the gourmet hot dog.
column146: 02x13 - The Secret;Dana: Great.
column147: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Who took all the black ones?
column148: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: That's a communal bowl.
column149: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: So, how did Oscar sound when he called in?
column150: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Sick, like lots of sniffling. I don't know.
column151: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Sniffling how?
column152: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Umm. How many different ways are there to sniffle?
column153: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Three.
column154: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Ok, it was the second one.
column155: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Ok, good, thank you. That wasn't so hard now was it?
column156: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Nuh-uh.
column157: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: What do you like best about Pam?
column158: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Uh, I really don't want to talk about it.
column159: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Is it her boobs, or...
column160: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Um, she's easy to talk to I guess and she's got a really good sense of humor.
column161: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Really?
column162: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Uh-huh.
column163: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Never get's any of my jokes.
column164: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: What about you?
column165: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Her boobs, definitely.
column166: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Wow, that's not what I meant.
column167: 02x13 - The Secret;Dana: Here you go.
column168: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Oh, thank you.
column169: 02x13 - The Secret;Dana: And I understand we have a birthday today.
column170: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Ohhh happy birthday Jim!
column171: 02x13 - The Secret;Dana: Ready girls? Front side.
column172: 02x13 - The Secret;Hooter's Girls: You put your front side in; you put your front side out. You put your front side in and shake it all about. You do the hokey pokey and you turn yourself around. That's what it's all about. Whoo, hoo!
column173: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Thank you.
column174: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Woo! Yeah!
column175: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Thanks, thanks Dana.
column176: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Thank you very much.
column177: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Hilarious. Hey.
column178: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: What did you guys talk about?
column179: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: [Holds up Hooters t-shirt] Just you know politics, literature.
column180: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: I hate you.
column181: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Quick Oscar update. I have conducted interviews with everyone in the office.
column182: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Just go to his house and see if he's sick. I could have done this Investigation in like twenty minutes.
column183: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Including prep time?
column184: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Just do it.
column185: 02x13 - The Secret;Ryan: If I had to I could clean out my desk in five seconds and nobody would ever know I had ever been here. And I'd forget too.
column186: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: [Michael messes up hair to look like Jim's] Expenses.
column187: 02x13 - The Secret;Kevin: Michael is that a wig?
column188: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: No. It's... I wear it like that sometimes. Is that a wig?
column189: 02x13 - The Secret;Kevin: No.
column190: 02x13 - The Secret;Angela: This is from Hooters.
column191: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Yeah, it's a business lunch.
column192: 02x13 - The Secret;Angela: Did Toby approve this?
column193: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: No he did not. I don't need his permission.
column194: 02x13 - The Secret;Toby: You just got your corporate credit card back. Do you really want me to take it away again?
column195: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Uhhh it's ridiculous. They took my card away because I spent $80 bucks at a magic shop. What they don't understand is that I bought the stuff to impress potential clients. So business related, right?
column196: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: I put a cigarette through a freakin' quarter. And you know what Toby? They almost bought from us.
column197: 02x13 - The Secret;Toby: I'm not processing this.
column198: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Look Jim needed a relaxing lunch, he has been depressed and it has been affecting his productivity. How is that not work related?
column199: 02x13 - The Secret;Toby: He seems fine to me.
column200: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: You're not his friend, you don't know. He is in love with a girl he works with who's engaged. So just cut me some slack. Please?
column201: 02x13 - The Secret;Kelly: Pam?
column202: 02x13 - The Secret;Phylis: Angela who would you choose Jim or Roy?
column203: 02x13 - The Secret;Angela: It's nobody's business, Phyllis. Roy.
column204: 02x13 - The Secret;Kevin: Jim has got it bad for Pam.
column205: 02x13 - The Secret;Creed: Oh ho! Which one is Pam?
column206: 02x13 - The Secret;Kevin: Well she's the... Hey Michael so do you think Jim will try to break up the wedding?
column207: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: You know what Kevin? Jim is a friend of mine, so the only people that this crush really concerns is Jim and Pam... and me.
column208: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: As a volunteer Sheriff's Deputy I have been doing surveillance for years. One time I suspected an ex-girlfriend of mine of cheating on me. So I tailed her for six straight nights. Turns out she was, with a couple of guys actually so... mystery solved.
column209: 02x13 - The Secret;Kelly: Jim, why didn't you tell me you had a crush on Pam?
column210: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Well the cats out of the bag. I used to have a crush on Pam and now I [hesitate] don't. Riveting.
column211: 02x13 - The Secret;Kevin: Nice... she is so hot.
column212: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Hey.
column213: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Hey.
column214: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Did you find anything good in your desk?
column215: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Ah, coupon for a free sandwich.
column216: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Score.
column217: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: It expired in August, and my cell phone charger from two years ago.
column218: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Big day.
column219: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Big day.
column220: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Hey oh, listen, um, I told Michael on the booze cruise. It's so stupid. Um, I told Michael that I had had a crush on you when you first started here.
column221: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Oh.
column222: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Well I thought that, I figured you should hear it from me rather than, I mean you know Michael.
column223: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Right.
column224: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: And seriously, it's totally not a big deal, ok? And when I found out you were engaged, I mean.
column225: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: No, I know, like, I kind of like, I thought that maybe you did when I first started.
column226: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Oh you did?
column227: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: No, I mean, just 'cause we like got along so well.
column228: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: No, no, you saw through me, great.
column229: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: So are you going to be like totally awkward around me now?
column230: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Oh yeah, yeah... hope that's okay.
column231: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Mmm, hmm.
column232: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: And Pam it was like three years ago so I am totally over it.
column233: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Cool.
column234: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Ok.
column235: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Stay low... This is it... There he is. He's been gone for at least two hours. Who is that? Come to Papa... Oh yes. Let's roll. I knew it! You are so busted. Ice skates, shopping bags? I think I know what's going on here. You weren't sick at all.
column236: 02x13 - The Secret;Gil: Who's this?
column237: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: This is Dwight Schrute. Who is this?
column238: 02x13 - The Secret;Gil: Gil.
column239: 02x13 - The Secret;Oscar: Are you going to tell Michael?
column240: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: How bout this. I don't tell Michael and in exchange you owe me one great big giant favor. Redeemable by me at a time and place of my choosing.
column241: 02x13 - The Secret;Dwight: Guess what I found out about Oscar tonight? He was lying about being sick. Should I have reported Oscar's malfeasance. Hmm, probably, but now I know something he doesn't want me to know. So I can use his malfeasance to establish leverage. Otherwise, it's just malfeasance for malfeasanceses-ses sake.
column242: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Hey.
column243: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: I know, I know, I know.
column244: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Umm, what happened?
column245: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: I, oh, just, um, I know I was trying to, expense reports. And then God, Toby, you know he just... I know. I'm just, I just hope that, I just hope that [starts to get choked up] this doesn't affect our friendship! Stupid, this is so stupid.
column246: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Hey, hey, wow, wow. Listen man it's, you know what. It's not a big deal.
column247: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Ok, I'm fine, no I know, I'm good, I'm good, it's just.
column248: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Look its one day, everything's gonna be alright. No big deal. You good?
column249: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Yeah I'm good.
column250: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Good.
column251: 02x13 - The Secret;Ryan: Creed did you organize the menu book?
column252: 02x13 - The Secret;Creed: Oh, I thought that was more on a volunteer basis.
column253: 02x13 - The Secret;Ryan: No, that was mandatory.
column254: 02x13 - The Secret;Creed: Oh, I thought it was a volunteer thing.
column255: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Hey, here's your schedule for next week. Are you okay?
column256: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Yeah I'm fine. Look, about you and Jim.
column257: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Oh, no, that's, you don't have to.
column258: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: No, I feel it's my responsibility as your boss slash friend.
column259: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: No, really, it's okay. I know that Jim had, like a crush on me when he first started. But that was a long time ago, so.
column260: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: It wasn't that long ago. It was on the booze cruise.
column261: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Jim had a crush on me on the booze cruise or he told you about it on the booze cruise?
column262: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: Yehhh, okay, shuuttt it Michael. I'm done. That's it. I'm out.
column263: 02x13 - The Secret;Jim: Ready?
column264: 02x13 - The Secret;Pam: Yep.
column265: 02x13 - The Secret;Michael: People are always coming to me. "Michael, I have a secret. Your the only one I trust." No thanks, because keeping a secret can only lead to trouble. Like I was watching Cinemax last weekend. This movie, Portrait of a... Prostitute something. Secrets of a Call... More Secrets of a Call Girl. And the lead character, Shila, is framed for murder. She goes on the run and winds up working at a bordello in Malibu. I don't, I don't want to live like that. I like it here. I don't want to be Shila, I like being Michael Scott.

column1: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ryan: [catching Jim looking at him at Pam's desk] What?
column2: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: Oh, nothing.
column3: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: Pam's on vacation and she gets back tomorrow, so it'll be nice to see her. It'll be nice, and, uh, she set a date for the wedding with Roy. Uh... June. Summer. So, that'll be nice. And that's that.
column4: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ryan: [again catching Jim looking at him] What?
column5: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: Oh, nothing.
column6: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ryan: Jim's been looking at me kind of a lot all week. I would be creeped out by it, but it's nothing compared to the way Michael looks at me.
column7: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Spamster!
column8: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: Um, Pam plus Spam plus...?
column9: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Hamster.
column10: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: Right.
column11: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Welcome back! How was your vacation?
column12: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: It was great.
column13: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Yeah?
column14: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: Mm-hm.
column15: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Did you get lucky? Oh! Boink!
column16: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: Roy and I just got back from the Poconos. I get ten vacation days a year, and I try to hold off taking them for as long as possible, and this year I got to the third week in January.
column17: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: I am Pam. Spicoli guy. Oh, God. Names, numbers. Okay. [walking into office] Whoa! God! Yuck, yuck. Yuck. Yuck!
column18: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: What?
column19: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Wow! What happened in there?
column20: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: I don't know.
column21: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: There is stink in there, my God! What is... what is that?
column22: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: [looking at pile on Michel's carpet] Oh... I don't know.
column23: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Is it a bird?
column24: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: No, I don't think it's a bird.
column25: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Oh, God! How could that happen? How could... right in the middle of the carpet.
column26: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kevin: What's goin' on?
column27: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Um, somebody vomited right in the middle of the carpet in my office.
column28: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kevin: [taking a look] I don't think that's vomit.
column29: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Check it out.
column30: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kevin: Me?
column31: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Check it out. Don't be a wuss, just get... no, I'm not holding your coffee.
column32: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kevin: Oh, that's ridiculous.
column33: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: What is it?
column34: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kevin: Michael. [tapping on door]
column35: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: What is it? No, just tell me what it is.
column36: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kevin: [pounding on door] Michael, I ... I ... I gotta get outta here. I can't hold my breath that long.
column37: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: Open the door up!
column38: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kevin: It smelled terrible.
column39: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam and others: [after going in to check out the smell] Phew. Oh! No, mm-mm. [leaving quickly]
column40: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: I cannot believe a pipe burst and left that in there.
column41: 02x14 - The Carpet;Toby: That's no burst pipe.
column42: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: How do you know that? What is it, then?
column43: 02x14 - The Carpet;Creed: Hi guys. Somebody makin' soup?
column44: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: [as cleaning lady with mask leaves] Here she comes. All cleaned? Great. [walks into office]
column45: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: [coughing] It's still stinky.
column46: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: That is worse.
column47: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: She probably scrubbed it into the fibers of the carpet. Total permeation.
column48: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: [while in his reeking office] I am a big Fear Factor fan. I'm a big fan of anything Joe Rogan does, actually, so this is sort of like my audition tape. Um... [clearing throat] I can't stand it [gets up to leave], I can't stay in here another second. No!
column49: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: Hey! Welcome back!
column50: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: Thanks!
column51: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: So, how was the resort? Did you ski a lot?
column52: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: A little.
column53: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: Good! What's goin' on here?
column54: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: What? I did not do that. That sounds disgusting.
column55: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ryan: [barely stifling laughter] It wasn't me. Um... it wasn't me. [regaining composure] It was not me.
column56: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: [smelling the stink] Oh. Wow.
column57: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: [giggles at Roy]
column58: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: [sitting at Jim's desk] Hey Jim. I thought that we would be desk buddies while they changed my carpet.
column59: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: That might be a little difficult with the one computer.
column60: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Oh... It's ...
column61: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: But there's definitely a desk open in the back.
column62: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: [reluctantly] Yeah ...
column63: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: ...which I guess I'll be taking.
column64: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: No, no, no! Seriously, I don't mind sharing.
column65: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: No, no, no, seriously, I'll be in the back.
column66: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: Hey, Kelly.
column67: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kelly: Are you moving back here?
column68: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: Um, just for the day while Michael's at my desk.
column69: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kelly: Because Toby used to sit there, but he had to move over there because of an allergy.
column70: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: Allergy to... the desk?
column71: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kelly: [shaking head] Weird.
column72: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: [putting his feet on desk] Yeah, yeah, yeah. Old bullpen.
column73: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: [putting his feet on desk] Ha ha ha... the old bullpen.
column74: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Don't ape me.
column75: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: Okay.
column76: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: This is great.
column77: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: Yeah!
column78: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: The pressures of my office are insane.
column79: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: [agreeing] Mm.
column80: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: I just... you couldn't understand, but man, you guys have it so easy out here, you know? I used to sit right here.
column81: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: No way!
column82: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Yeah.
column83: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: And who had your office?
column84: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Ed Truck. [exclaiming is disgust] Ed Truck was the manager before me. Horrible. He hated fun. It was like, "Oh, Ed Truck is walking toward us. Stop having fun. Start pretending to do work." What a jerk. He's... You know what? I swore to myself that if I ever got to walk around the room as manager, people would laugh when they saw me coming and would applaud as I walked away.
column85: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kelly: [to Jim] I'm serious. My closet doors will not shut. I mean, it only takes so long to measure to make sure that clothes will hang up because aren't all hangers like that big? So I don't understand why the closet engineer didn't think of that. So now I'm doing this new thing where I just leave piles of clothes on the floor and then I walk around the piles to get an outfit...
column86: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: You know who used to sit at that desk?
column87: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: That guy Miles who quit to form his own company?
column88: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Mm-mm. Todd Packer.
column89: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: No!
column90: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Yeah.
column91: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: I thought he was out on the road.
column92: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: He was, but, uh... that desk was empty. He'd come in and sit there sometimes.
column93: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: Ah.
column94: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: When I was in training, many years ago... not so long ago... I worked side-by-side with a fellow named Todd Packer, and together we rocked the office [picture behind Michael falls]. Packer and I once spent the whole day with our pants off, and when people noticed, we convinced them that they were crazy.
column95: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: I will gladly pay you Tuesday for a hamburger today.
column96: 02x14 - The Carpet;Stanley: [on phone] Excuse me one second, please. [to Michael] What is it that you need right now that you can't wait until I'm off the phone with a customer?
column97: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Oh, a customer, well, sound the alarm. [laughs] Okay.
column98: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Another time, Packer held this guy's head in the toilet for like a minute. Guy had no sense of humor about it. Probably why he wasn't hired.
column99: 02x14 - The Carpet;Creed: [after Michael punches him in the arm] What did you hit me for?
column100: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Charley horse!
column101: 02x14 - The Carpet;Creed: What?
column102: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Charley horse!
column103: 02x14 - The Carpet;Creed: You shouldn't have hit me, Michael.
column104: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Oh, okay. Gah.
column105: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Once, as a joke, Packer banged every chick in the office. [giggles] It was hysterical.
column106: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kelly: [to Jim] Beyonce, pink the color, Pink the person, hot dogs, basically anything that is awesome. Snow cones...
column107: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ryan: Hey Jim, Michael wanted me to ask you how to raise your desk chair.
column108: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: It's the lever on the side.
column109: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ryan: That's what I told him. Thanks. [leaves]
column110: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kelly: Oh my God, he is so cute! Would you talk to him for me and see if he likes me?
column111: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: No, I don't think I can...
column112: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kelly: Oh, please Jim? Please, please, Jim. Please, please, please? He's so cute. I like him so much. And I would do it, but I'm too shy. Please, Jim, please, please, please, please, Jim. Please, please, please...
column113: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: [whispering] Dwight.
column114: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: [whispering] Michael.
column115: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Let's send up Accounting.
column116: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: What?
column117: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Old fashioned raid. Sales on Accounting. Yeah. Follow my lead.
column118: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Hey guys.
column119: 02x14 - The Carpet;Oscar: Hey, Michael.
column120: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Ahem. What's up?
column121: 02x14 - The Carpet;Oscar: Hey, Dwight.
column122: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael and Dwight: [as they throw accountants' files and supplies around] Ahhhh! Whoo hoo! Come on, come on, come on, come on! Sales rules!
column123: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: Yeah! [laughing]
column124: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Yeah! Oh ho ho [laughing]
column125: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: Should we help 'em pick up their stuff?
column126: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: No, no, no, no. We don't do that. We don't do that.
column127: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: Okay.
column128: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Watch out, Pam. You're next!
column129: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: You're gonna throw my things on the ground?
column130: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Maybe!
column131: 02x14 - The Carpet;Oscar: What happened in Michael's office was wrong. I understand it [chuckles], it makes sense [regains composure] But it... it was still wrong.
column132: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Why would somebody ruin a perfectly good carpet? I don't know. It could be done out of hate. It could be done out of love. It could be completely neutral. Maybe somebody hates the cleaning lady. And, well, she doesn't do a very good job, obviously, because my office still reeks like you would not believe. I hate her.
column133: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: You know what? I am beginning to think that what happened to my carpet was an act of terrorism against the office. The only thing that makes any sense.
column134: 02x14 - The Carpet;
column135: 02x14 - The Carpet;
column136: 02x14 - The Carpet;
column137: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: [on phone] Hello, am I the 107th caller? [hangs up, dials again] Hello, Rock 107. Am I the 107th caller? [hangs up and dials again] Hell , Rock 107. Am I the 107th caller? [hangs up and begins to dial again] I'm totally gonna win us that box set.
column138: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Stop.
column139: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: Jethro Tull...
column140: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Stop it. [Dwight hangs up] Stop. It. [Dwight beings to dial] Don't. Don't.
column141: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: I need to make a sales call. Please?
column142: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: All right.
column143: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: [on phone, whispering] Am I the 107th caller?
column144: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: [to Roy in Jim's earshot] ...back so soon.
column145: 02x14 - The Carpet;Roy: We can go back in, like, a couple of weeks maybe.
column146: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: Yeah, right.
column147: 02x14 - The Carpet;Roy: Okay, maybe another month, like, maybe for, like President's Day or something.
column148: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: Yeah, that's right. We could do a three-day weekend. I wonder if I could, like, call in sick on the Friday. Then I get a four-day weekend.
column149: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kelly: [to unseen co-worker] But it's so weird to fall asleep. And I just hate it. 'Cause I try to go to bed at, like, 9:30.
column150: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: [to Roy as Jim escapes into bathroom] Are you kidding?
column151: 02x14 - The Carpet;Roy: No.
column152: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Hi, guys.
column153: 02x14 - The Carpet;Angela: We haven't finished getting things in order from your last visit.
column154: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: I'm just walking around.
column155: 02x14 - The Carpet;Angela: Were you?
column156: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Well, yeah.
column157: 02x14 - The Carpet;Oscar: It's just that we're really swamped over here, Michael.
column158: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Oh, and I'm not? Why would you say that? Because I'm having fun? You guys just are workin' for the weekend, aren't you? I'm workin' for the week. Sales team, listen to me. This is what we're gonna do. I'm gonna up the ante a little bit literally. Right here, I'm gonna put a crisp one hundred dollar bill. The person with the most sales at the end of the day gets to keep the cash. Sound good?
column159: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: Yeah!
column160: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: [counting cash] Seventy, eighty, one, two three. Eighty-three dollars. Still a lotta money and I'm going to ... [moves money after seeing workmen walk by] ... I'm gonna leave it right over here where everybody can see it. I will be taking Jim's clients today because he is not here and out of sight, out of the contest. Let's see who winds up with the cash, shall we?
column161: 02x14 - The Carpet;Phyllis: You're gonna compete against us?
column162: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Oh, it is on, Phyllis, it is so on!
column163: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: It is so on!
column164: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: God, this is gonna be fun.
column165: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: Michael is gonna wipe the floor with us!
column166: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: [on phone] So you have 40 boxes going out, and I will deliver those personally in a Sebring. Very good, nice doing business with you. Thank you. [hangs up] Yes! [chuckles] Oh, yeah! Read it and weep. Oh! Oh, look at that! [puts post-it on Phyllis' forehead] Look at me, Phyllis! Oh, what is that? That's my sale! [humming then dancing victoriously]
column167: 02x14 - The Carpet;Darryl: [walking by with new carpet] What... What's that? Whatcha doing?
column168: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: [stops dance] Nothing.
column169: 02x14 - The Carpet;Roy: [laughing] I think he's dancing.
column170: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: No. Just ...
column171: 02x14 - The Carpet;Darryl: That was definitely not dancing.
column172: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: You know what, guys? It's none of your concern. It was official business, so just...
column173: 02x14 - The Carpet;Darryl: Paper business.
column174: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Yeah, paper business. Is this done?
column175: 02x14 - The Carpet;Roy: Nope.
column176: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Extreme Home Makeover puts together a house in an hour. If you were on that crew, you would be fired like that. [snaps]
column177: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: Somebody did something bad to Michael's carpet. Maybe that's all we need to know.
column178: 02x14 - The Carpet;Creed: [to Oscar] Who do you think did it?
column179: 02x14 - The Carpet;Oscar: Are you kidding? I thought it was you.
column180: 02x14 - The Carpet;Creed: Really? I thought you. [both laugh in Michael's earshot]
column181: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: This was no act of God. A person did this. A person who works in this office. Maybe all of them.
column182: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: You know what? Today is not a good day for a sales contest. We're... we're not... we're not doin' this today.
column183: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: That doesn't seem fair.
column184: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: You wanna talk about fair? Does anyone need to smell my old carpet? You explain to me how that was fair, and I'll explain to you how this is fair. Plus I just... I think that picking today was sort of taking advantage.
column185: 02x14 - The Carpet;Dwight: But you're the one who picked today.
column186: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: I am a victim of a hate crime. Stanley knows what I'm talkin' about.
column187: 02x14 - The Carpet;Stanley: That's not what a hate crime is.
column188: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Well I hated it! A lot! Okay, I... you know what? If the guilty person would just come forward and take their punishment, we'd be done . [no one comes forward] Very well. Then you are all punished.
column189: 02x14 - The Carpet;Pam: What's our punishment?
column190: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: You're all on a time out. Just sit there quietly. [phone rings, Phyllis reaches to answer] No. NO! [phone continues to ring]
column191: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: Hey!
column192: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ryan: What's up?
column193: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: Nothing much. Let me ask you something. It's actually little awkward.
column194: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ryan: What?
column195: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: What do you think of Kelly?
column196: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ryan: I don't know. Depends if you like a little junk in ... [notices camera] Umm... She's really cool.
column197: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: Are you interested in her?
column198: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ryan: Yeah, totally.
column199: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: Really?
column200: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ryan: Did she say something?
column201: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: She said lots of things.
column202: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ryan: Do you know if she's looking for a long-term thing or if she'd be cool just hangin' out?
column203: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: I have no idea.
column204: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ryan: Can you find out?
column205: 02x14 - The Carpet;Jim: Yeah. Sure.
column206: 02x14 - The Carpet;Kelly: [to Jim] Oh, long-term, definitely. Fall in love, have babies, spend every second together... but don't tell him that, okay? Just tell him I'm, like, up for anything. I mean, I'm not a slut, but who knows?
column207: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Do you remember Ed Truck?
column208: 02x14 - The Carpet;Creed: Sure. He hired me. How's he doing?
column209: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: How would I know?
column210: 02x14 - The Carpet;Creed: I thought you might.
column211: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: My biggest fear is turning into him.
column212: 02x14 - The Carpet;Creed: Michael, you should have much bigger fears than that.
column213: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: [sighs] I wasn't talking literally, Creed. Yeah, being buried alive would be worse. Happy? Why am I talking to you?
column214: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: [meeting Ed Truck in parking lot] Ed? Hi. Thanks for meeting me. Must be kinda neat comin' back.
column215: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ed: Yeah. Should we go upstairs?
column216: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Uh, well, honestly Ed, I really don't wanna be up there right now.
column217: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ed: So, what's the problem with my pension?
column218: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Oh, no, no, no. You're good. It was clerical. You're good. Um, well, somebody did something in my office, and I now think that they did it on purpose and it was directed at me.
column219: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ed: Well, what was done?
column220: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: I didn't get a good look at... it, but it smells horrible.
column221: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ed: Yeah, somebody once did that in my office.
column222: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Really?
column223: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ed: Yeah.
column224: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Well, that figures. So how did you deal with people not liking you?
column225: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ed: You can't expect to be friends with everybody.
column226: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Well... s-sure I can.
column227: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ed: No. They'll always think of you as a boss first.
column228: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Not necessarily. You can love a boss like you do a father.
column229: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ed: I'm not sure that ever happens.
column230: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Well, okay. Different management styles.
column231: 02x14 - The Carpet;Ed: Why can't your workers be your workers, family be your family, your friends be your friends?
column232: 02x14 - The Carpet;Michael: Last week I would have given a kidney to anyone in this office. I would have reached right into my stomach and pulled it out for them. But now, no.
