column13: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Fine, fine, fine, fine, fine, fine, fine. Hi, children. I'm Michael Scott, and... I... am in charge of this place... ahh, what'll make you... understand... I am... like Superman, and the people who work here are like citizens of Gotham City.
column14: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim and Dwight: [in unison] That's Batman.
column15: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Okay, I'm Aquaman. Where does he live, guys?
column16: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: The ocean.
column17: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: [under his breath] I work with a bunch of nerds.
column18: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: [looks at Sasha] Mmm... hello tiny one.
column19: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Toby: [to Sasha] Come on.
column20: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: You are the future!
column21: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Kevin: This... is my file cabinet. Uhm... oh. This... is the partition... between my desk... and Angela's.
column22: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Kevin: Abby's my fiancee Stacy's daughter, I think she'll have a good time. I just hope she doesn't look on my computer. ...Actually, I'd better go check.
column23: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Stanley: Michael, you remember my daughter, Melissa.
column24: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Oh, yes, hello, how are you? Good to see you. Wow, you've really grown up. You know what? Don't mind me saying so, she is turning into a stone cold fox. Better keep the... frat boys away from her.
column25: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Melissa: I'm in eighth grade.
column26: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Oh.
column27: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Stanley: She's in middle school.
column28: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Yeah, middle school's amazing. It is extraordinary. An extraordinary time.
column29: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: It's not that children make me uncomfortable, it's just that, why be a dad when you can be a fun uncle? I've never heard of anyone rebelling against their fun uncle.
column30: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: [while Jake is throwing things at Michael] They want how many spiral pads?
column31: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Meredith: Um, fif--well, fifty... I... over ordered because they had a back order.
column32: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Okay.
column33: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Meredith: I got permission to bring Jake into work, which is great because he got suspended this week and now I don't have to pay for a sitter.
column34: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Angela: Can you put that down there?
column35: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Kelly: Yep. [spreads tablecloth]
column36: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Toby: [to Sasha] Okay, tell them what you wanted to say.
column37: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Sasha: Do you need any help?
column38: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Angela: No. Thanks. We'd... have to explain everything, it's probably just easier if we do it ourselves.
column39: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Toby: Alright, I wasn't expecting that. Let's uh... let's go draw.
column40: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Kelly: Oh my God, she is so cute, I want to die. Don't you just love kids, Angela?
column41: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Angela: I guess I wouldn't mind a pair of small, well-behaved boys.
column42: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Kelly: God I cannot wait to get pregnant and have babies!
column43: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Ryan: Kelly and I both agreed that we would just have fun, and, I'm learning that fun for Kelly is... getting married and having babies. Immediately. With me.
column44: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: [on phone] Just compare last year's order to this year's. Uh-huh. Yeah, I'm looking at it right now. [Sasha walks in the door] ... Yes. We--yeah, they're very--they're different. [Sasha walks out] Yeah, we can stick with last year's, you're just going to have to supplement it, somehow.
column45: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: Hey, Abby! Do you want to help me shred some old documents? It's actually pretty cool.
column46: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Abby: No thanks.
column47: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: I only have one goal today. To make one kid like me. Just one.
column48: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: What are you reading?
column49: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Abby: From the Mixed-Up Files of Mrs. Basil E. Frankweiler.
column50: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: Aww, best book?
column51: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Abby: Yeah, but I've read it before.
column52: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: Pfft. So have I. Hey, question. If you had to spend a night in the Met or the Aquarium, which would it be?
column53: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Abby: Definitely the Aquarium.
column54: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: Definitely. Yes. Glad you said that. ...You don't want to help me with some of my sales, do you? 'Cause, I'm kind of swamped.
column55: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Abby: Sure.
column56: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: Really?
column57: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Abby: Mmhmm!
column58: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: Yesss. And you're Abby, right?
column59: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Abby: Yeah.
column60: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: I'm Jim. [Jim hi-fives Abby] Annnnd... let's sell some paper.
column61: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Abby: Alright.
column62: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: Let's start with... your mom.
column63: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: [on phone] Yes. Well... we can... [Sasha walks in, begins playing with Michael's toy train] uhm... hey, uh, you know what? Can I call you back? I'll call you right back. Yes, I promise. ...Hello, can I help you? ... You can pick that up, if you want. That's--- that's alright. [Sasha moves the train to Michael's desk] Want to bring it over... here, make some room. My name's Michael. What's your name?
column64: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Sasha: Sasha.
column65: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Nice to meet you.
column66: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Sasha: Ooh! [picks up train whistle]
column67: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Oh, you know what that is! That is a train whistle, like I'm the conductor. [blows into whistle] But I'm sort of the conductor of the office here, right? [blows into whistle] You want to try?
column68: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Sasha: Sure. [Sasha blows into whistle continously]
column69: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: All aboard for sales! Next stop, Cu...camonga! [Sasha and Michael laugh]
column70: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: [shaking hands with Abby] Ow, ow, ow, ow, you broke my hand.
column71: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: There is no way that hurt.
column72: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: Really? 'Cause she's pretty strong, Dwight.
column73: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: Little girl. Come over here. Shake my hand. Come on, I don't have all day. [Abby shakes his hand] I don't feel anything. Nothing. [to Jim] You're so weak. [Jake walks over and messes with Dwight's bobbleheads] Uh, excuse me, these are expensive collector's items, okay?
column74: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Do you have any computer games?
column75: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: No, I don't have computer games on my work computer. That would be innappropriate.
column76: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Yeah, Meredith doesn't have any either. It's so lame here.
column77: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: You call your mom Meredith? That's very disrespectful.
column78: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Whatever, okay?
column79: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: You can refer to me as Mister Schrute.
column80: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: That's your name? Mister Poop?
column81: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: Schrute. Mister Schrute.
column82: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Sure, Mister Poop. [Jake walks away]
column83: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: [quietly] ... Schrute. [Jim and Abby snicker, Angela glares at Dwight]
column84: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Sasha: [to Phyllis] Are you Mother Goose?
column85: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Melissa: I drink like, a hundred Ice Macchiatos a day, and practically nothing else.
column86: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Ryan: Wow.
column87: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Melissa: There's a really cool coffee place, Jitters, at the Steamtown Mall. Ever been there?
column88: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Ryan: No.
column89: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Melissa: You've never been to Jitters? Ryan, you are so dorky. Gimme your number, so I can text you.
column90: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Ryan: Uhm...
column91: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Melissa: Come on! [Kelly glares through the door] You have an email address?
column92: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Kelly: ...that I thought you should know ...
column93: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Stanley: Mmhmm. What?
column94: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Kelly: I think something a little fishy is going on. [points to Ryan and Melissa]
column95: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Stanley: A little fishy?
column96: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Kelly: Yeah. I mean, I've been noticing them all day, I was thinking that maybe ... [Stanley gets up]
column97: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Stanley: That little girl is a child! I don't want to see you sniffing around her anymore this afternoon, do you understand?!
column98: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Ryan: Yes, I--
column99: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Stanley: Boy have you lost your mind? 'Cause I'll help you find it! Whatcha lookin' for, ain't nobody gonna help you out there! Jesus could come through that door and he's not gonna help you if you don't stop sniffing after my child!
column100: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Ryan: Okay.
column101: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Ryan: Stanley yelled at me today. That was one of the most frightening experiences of my life.
column102: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: [plays the recorder] That was Greensleeves. A traditional English Ballad about the beheaded Anne Boleyn. And now, a very special treat... a book my Grandmutter used to read me when I was a kid. This is a very special story, it's called Struwwelpeter, by Heinrich Hoffman from 1864. [reading from book] The great tall tailor always comes to little girls that suck their thumbs--- are you listening, Sasha? Right? And 'ere they dream when he's about, he takes his great sharp scissors out, and then cuts their thumbs clean off!
column103: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Dwight! Dwight!
column104: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: There's a photo...
column105: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: What the hell are you reading to them?
column106: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: These are cautionary tales for kids, my Grandmata used to read these---
column107: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Yeah, you know what? No, no no no no. They, no. The kids don't want to hear some wierdo book that your Nazi war criminal grandmother gave you.
column108: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Sasha: What's a Nazi?
column109: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: What's a Nazi?
column110: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: [standing up] Nazi was a fascist movement...
column111: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Don't!
column112: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: ...from the 1930's...
column113: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Don't! Don't! Don't talk about Nazis in front of--- you know what? They're going to have nightmares, so why don't you just shut it?
column114: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: I was gonna teach the children how to make corn-husk dolls.
column115: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: [sighing] Why don't you just leave? Okay?
column116: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: ...Okay.
column117: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Bye, Mister Poop.
column118: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Alright. There goes Mister Poop. Now, who likes Dane Cook?
column119: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;The Kids: [raising hands] I do, I do!
column120: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Children cannot lie. They are innocent, and they speak the truth, and out of the mouths of babes, Michael Scott is freaking cool. [cracks up]
column121: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Angela: You know, I never misbehaved in front of my father because he was a very strict disciplinarian. I can only hope my mate has some of those same qualities [makes eye contact with Dwight].
column122: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;
column123: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;
column124: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;
column125: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: This is where the magic happens! Right over here, let me show you this. See all these? [pets shelf of paper] You know what that is? That's paper. This is where paper comes from. Any questions?
column126: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Melissa: So... you cut the paper and dye it and stuff.
column127: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: No, we don't actually cut the paper. That's a good question. The paper is sent to us cut, and dyed, from a paper manufacturer, and then we sell it to a business for more than we paid for it.
column128: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Abby: That's not fair. [the rest of the kids agree]
column129: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Yes it is, well, w-w--you need someone in the middle to facilitate...
column130: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: You're just a middleman.
column131: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: I'm not just a middle... man...
column132: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Melissa: Wait, why doesn't the saw mill just sell paper directly to people?
column133: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: You are describing Office Depot, and they're kind of running us out of business.
column134: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: We have better service than they do!
column135: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: ...There's Creed! Let's take a look at what he's doing, everybody! This is Creed, and he is in charge of... something. Right?
column136: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Creed: That is correct.
column137: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Say hi to the kids.
column138: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Creed: Hi kids.
column139: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Yaaaaay.
column140: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Creed: Have you ever seen a foot with four toes? [begins untying shoe]
column141: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Kids: Ewwww!
column142: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: What are you doing? N--stop it! Stop it! Just--no, no, no, no! No! Would you cut it out?! What is your problem?
column143: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Creed: Th-the hair covers it, mostly.
column144: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: No no no, we're not gonna see--- we're not gonna see the four toed... Creed, okay?
column145: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: You know, there's something interesting about me you might want to know. I ... used to be ... the star of a kids show.
column146: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Kids: No way.
column147: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: It's true. I did.
column148: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Melissa: You serious?
column149: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Really?
column150: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: I am totally serious. There was a show called 'Fundle Bundle' and I was the star.
column151: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Abby: That doesn't sound like a show.
column152: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Melissa: What?!
column153: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: It's true! I can prove it! I can prove it, watch this. [gets up and runs out] Ryan, can you come here a second? [clears throat] I would like you to go to my mother's house in Dickson city, and if she is in the pool, the back kitchen window should be unlocked, I want you to boost yourself up, I want you to go down to the basement. In the basement is a tape labeled 'Fundle Bundle'. I want you to grab it, I want you to get my guitar.
column154: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Ryan: Right. Okay.
column155: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: I want you to get the tambourine. Do you know how to play the tambourine?
column156: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Ryan: Um, I'm already getting the pizzas from Bernetti's, so...
column157: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Melissa: You know, I can go with him.
column158: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Oka--
column159: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Ryan: No! I will... go.
column160: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Okay! Thank you Ryan. Good attitude, hottest in the office.
column161: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: [to Abby] Alright, nowwww... what kind... of pizza do you like?
column162: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: I don't get why parents are always complaining about how tough it is to raise kids. You joke around with them, you give them pizza, you give them candy, you let them live their lives... They're adults, for God's sake.
column163: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: I am going to give you a little blast from the past of Michael Gary Scott when he was a child star, and a show that you might remember called 'Fundle Bundle.' Okay? Without further ado, Ryan?
column164: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Miss Trudy: [from TV] ...Bundle, are you ready to come on in? [TV children cheer] Let's have some fun!
column165: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: That... is Miss Trudy. Can't tell from the costume, but she had an amazing body. Okay, you can... fast forward. And... I want you... to...
column166: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: Is that a real fun shooting windmill?
column167: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Stop! Stop! Stop! [Ryan resumes the tape] Yes! That is, uh, Edward R. Meow.
column168: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: That's pretty funny.
column169: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Yeah.
column170: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Edward R. Meow: ...Recess! Hey, what's your name?
column171: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Chet: My name's Chet.
column172: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Edward R. Meow: Well hi Chet.
column173: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Oscar: Is that Chet Montgomery?
column174: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Uhh, I don't know.
column175: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: That is!
column176: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Darryl: Checkin' in with Chet. Doppler's up.
column177: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Edward R. Meow: What do you want to be when you grow up?
column178: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Chet: I want to be on TV!
column179: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: [employees chuckle] And he is on TV now!
column180: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Can everyone please shut up, please! So you don't miss it.
column181: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Edward R. Meow: Okay, next? So, whats your name?
column182: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Oh! That's me. Shh. Shh.
column183: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Edward R. Meow: Well what's your favorite subject at school?
column184: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Young Michael: Recess.
column185: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Edward R. Meow: Ree-cesss. So tell me, what do you want to be when you grow up?
column186: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Young Michael: I want to be married and have a hundred kids so I can have a hundred friends, and no one can say no to being my friend.
column187: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Edward R. Meow: [jaw drops, awkward pause] Uh, ah... oh, okay! Well uh, nice talking with you, Michael. Uh, back to you Miss Trudy!
column188: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Miss Trudy: Hi everyone, it's one of my favorite times of the day.
column189: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Coulda sworn there was...
column190: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Melissa: Did you get married?
column191: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: ...uh, no.
column192: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Abby: Why not?
column193: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Uh, just never happened.
column194: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Sasha: So, do you have any kids?
column195: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Uh, nope.
column196: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Do you have a girlfriend?
column197: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: I do okay.
column198: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Melissa: Was Chet Montgomery cool back then?
column199: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Yes.
column200: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Even I have a girlfriend.
column201: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Okay! Alright, okay.
column202: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Sasha: So you didn't get to be what you wanted to be.
column203: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: ...I guess not... you know, I have a load of work to do so I am going to grab a slice of this delish pizza... and I'm going to go do my work. Bye.
column204: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: He's not coming out. He won't pick up the phone.
column205: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: Can't believe his mom dressed him like that, that's the real tragedy.
column206: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Roy: [wrestling with Jake] Pam! Pam! I love this guy! [laughs] Come on!
column207: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: So, Melissa... I met your mom a couple times. She's so nice.
column208: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Melissa: Who? Terry?
column209: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: Mmhmm.
column210: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Melissa: That woman is not my mother. That is my step-mother.
column211: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Mister Poop, I have to tell you something.
column212: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: Uh, okay. But first, that's not my name.
column213: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: You're ugly.
column214: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: Well at least I'm not a horrible little latchkey kid who got suspended from school. So...
column215: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Meredith!
column216: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: [Toby knocks on door] Yeah?
column217: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Toby: I think these belong to you. [puts toys down on desk]
column218: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Oh, that's okay, she can keep those.
column219: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Toby: Believe me, she has enough toys... she doesn't need your watch.
column220: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Thank you.
column221: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Toby: Is everything okay?
column222: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: You have to ask me that because you work for human resources.
column223: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Toby: Uh... it's true...
column224: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Well, sure, playing the field is great, don't get me wrong, but there's more to life than notches just on my bedpost.
column225: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Toby: Mmhmm.
column226: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Tell me something honestly, do you... think... that it is too late for me to have kids?
column227: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Toby: Well, you need a wife first, or at least a girlfriend.
column228: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: What about...
column229: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Toby: Not Jan.
column230: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: ...Jan. Kay.
column231: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Toby: If you really want to have kids, I--- I guess you could somehow... foster parent, or something.
column232: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: ...Or biologically.
column233: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Toby: Somehow.
column234: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Thanks, that's, no, that... that really means a lot to me. Hey, does Sasha have a godfather, because I...
column235: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Toby: Yes.
column236: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Oh... kay.
column237: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Is it okay if I take one?
column238: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: Sure.
column239: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Thank you.
column240: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: You're welcome.
column241: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Is your job hard?
column242: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: It's not too bad. I get to shred things sometimes, do you want to see?
column243: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Yeah!
column244: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: Really?
column245: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: Yeah.
column246: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: Okay. Um... here it is. Don't put your fingers in there. [shreds paper] Cool huh?
column247: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: That's so cool, yeah!
column248: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: Yeah, I get to do this like, every week.
column249: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jake: That's so awesome!
column250: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: I know.
column251: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Yes, it is true. I, Michael Scott, am signing up with an online dating service. Thousands of people have done it, and I am going to do it. I need a username. And... I have a great one [types]. Little kid lover. That way, people will know exactly where my priorities are at.
column252: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Kevin: Go ahead.
column253: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Abby: Do you want to come over for dinner tonight?
column254: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: Ohh, man, I would love to! I can't tonight, but can I come over some other time? [Abby nods]
column255: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Kevin: What're you doing? You never have plans.
column256: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: Thanks, Kev. Uhm... I'm actually going on a date.
column257: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Kevin: Niiice.
column258: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: Hey, uh, no, please? You can't leave yet. There's still one more thing we need to do.
column259: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: [singing] You... who are on the road... must have a code... that you can live by... [Dwight joins in] and so... become yourself... because the past... is just a goodbye... and teach... your children well...
column260: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Jim: Why does he own a guitar if he doesn't know how to play?
column261: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: I think he thought his ukulele skills would transfer. [Jim leaves]
column262: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael and Dwight: [singing] ...did slowly go by... and feed... them on your dreams...
column263: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Pam: My theory is that... [Jim signals he's leaving, waves bye to Pam]
column264: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael and Dwight: [singing] ...The one they picked... the one you'll know by... don't you ever ask them why... if I told you would cry... you never look at them and sigh... and know they love you...
column265: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: And they do, your parents, love you very much.
column266: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Michael: One more time. [singing] You...
column267: 02x18 - Take Your Daughter to Work Day;Dwight: The Schrutes consider children very valuable. In the olden days, the women would bear many children, so we would have enough laborers to work the fields. And if it was an especially cold winter, and there weren't enough grains or vegetables, they would eat the weakest of the brood. [Laughs] They didn't eat the children.

column1: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: So, Phil recruited me to sell these cards, and now I am recruiting you.
column2: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Oscar: Who is this guy again?
column3: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Don't worry about Phil. He drives a corvette. He is doing just fine. Okay. Calling cards are... the wave of the future. These things sell themselves.
column4: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Ryan: Who uses calling cards anymore?
column5: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: You know what? That's a nice attitude, Ryan, I'm just helping you invest in your future, my friend.
column6: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Oscar: This sounds like a get rich quick scheme.
column7: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Yes! Thank you! You will get rich quick. We all will!
column8: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Toby: Didn't you lose a lot of money on that other investment, the one from the email?
column9: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: You know what, Toby? When the son of the deposed king of Nigeria emails you directly, asking for help, you help! His father ran the freaking country, okay? ...Alright, so, raise your hand if you wanna get rich. [Jim and Dwight raise their hands] Alright.
column10: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: No, um. How is this not a pyramid scheme?
column11: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Alright, let me explain. Again. [draws on board] Phil has recruited me and another guy. Now, we are getting three people each. The more people that get involved, the more who are investing, the more money we're all going to make. It's not a pyramid scheme, it is a... it's not even a scheme per se, it's... [Jim draws a triangle around Michael's diagram] ... I have to go make a call.
column12: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: Happy birthday Michael.
column13: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Oh ho ho! What?
column14: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: I said happy birthday.
column15: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Thank you! That's really nice.
column16: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Today is my B-day, and people around here just go crazy for it. I don't know why. Oh! Fun fact. I share my birthday with Eva Longoria. So, I have a perfect ice-breaker if I ever meet Terry Hatcher.
column17: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: What's up?
column18: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Hey. ...Oh, happy birthday.
column19: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Ah, thank you sir.
column20: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Meredith: Did you hear anything yet?
column21: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kevin: No. I'm still waiting.
column22: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: [Dwight knocks on door] Yeah.
column23: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Yes. There he is, the birthday boy!
column24: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Ohh, god.
column25: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Birthday hug!
column26: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: No no no, no, new suit, please.
column27: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: That suit is amazing.
column28: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Thank you very much. It is from Italy. [checks jacket] Actually--- no, Bulgaria.
column29: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Mmm. Maybe I should get one.
column30: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Good luck. One of a kind.
column31: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Ebay. Hm. Question! May I be in charge of the party planning festivities?
column32: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Not necessary, the party planning committee is all over it. They've been working twenty-four seven all day yesterday.
column33: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Excellent. On my part, I did manage to reserve the...
column34: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Don't! Nope! Please, don't want to spoil it for anybody. Spoil the surprise.
column35: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Let's get the party started. [Begins 'raising the roof']
column36: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Let's get the party started. Not the way I taught you! [Michael joins in]
column37: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Phyllis: When should we bring out the cake, one or one thirty?
column38: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: One's good.
column39: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Angela: One thirty. [Pam yawns] I'm sorry, are we boring you?
column40: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Party planning committee, listen up. Michael would like trick candles for his birthday cake, so make that a priority.
column41: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Phyllis: Where do we get those?
column42: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Not my problem. Here is a list of things that Michael would like to be surprised by. [hands list to Pam]
column43: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: Michael wants a strippergram?
column44: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Yes, but he doesn't want to know when, or whom.
column45: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Angela: No. This is a closed door meeting.
column46: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: [answering phone] Yeah?
column47: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: Michael, I have Jan on the line.
column48: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Oh, great, put her through.
column49: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jan: Hello, Michael.
column50: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Hey, you.
column51: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jan: I'm... returning your call, you said it was urgent.
column52: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: It is urgent, I just wanted to call and wish you a happy birthday.
column53: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jan: Well, today's not my birthday, so...
column54: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Really? 'Cause, I thought we had the same birthday.
column55: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jan: ...Happy birthday, Michael.
column56: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Thanks. [grins]
column57: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jan: Am I on camera?
column58: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Nope. Totally private. You can say whatever is in your heart. [Jan hangs up]
column59: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: [to Ryan, sitting across from Michael] ...You can take a five, if you want.
column60: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Somebody brought in donuts for my birthday!
column61: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Stanley: Mmhmm, happy birthday.
column62: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Thanks.
column63: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Man, I'm so sorry. When do you find out?
column64: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kevin: They said this afternoon. They're waiting on a second opinion.
column65: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Oh, okay.
column66: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kelly: Second opinion on what?
column67: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kevin: Um, I might have skin cancer.
column68: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kelly: Oh, no! I was watching Grey's Anatomy, and there was a lifeguard on it, and he had skin cancer too.
column69: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Kelly, you know what...
column70: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kelly: I never really thought about death until Princess Diana died. That was the saddest funeral ever. That and my sister's.
column71: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Toby: Who brought in donuts?
column72: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Somebody got donuts for my birthday!
column73: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Toby: Happy birthday!
column74: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: You didn't know it was my birthday.
column75: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Toby: I... guess I forgot.
column76: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Well, I guess I forgot to give you a donut [closes box].
column77: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Toby: Are you serious?
column78: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Mmm.
column79: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Oscar: Skin cancer is treatable.
column80: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kevin: Right.
column81: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Oscar: It's going to be okay.
column82: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Angela: You don't know it's going to be okay. Don't give him false hope. ...It's probably nothing, though.
column83: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Delivery Woman: Hi, delivery for Michael Scott.
column84: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Here we go. Ohhhkay, this is great! [giggles] Thank you my friends, she is perfect! Ahhh, Dwight, may I have your chair please? And, um, some singles, if you will! Allllright. Nnnnn-dink! [puts single into delivery woman's pocket, giggles] Okay, um, alright. This has arms. Is that gonna be a... is that alright?
column85: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Delivery Woman: Uh... s-sure.
column86: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: [laughing] Okay. I'm so nervous.
column87: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: I can sign for it.
column88: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Delivery Woman: Oh. Thanks.
column89: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: When I was seven, my mother hired a pony and a cart to come to my house for all the kids... and... I got a really bad rash from the pony, and all the kids got to ride the pony and I had to go inside, and my mother was rubbing cream on me... for probably three hours, and I never came outside. And by the time I got out the pony was already in the truck. And around the corner. So that was my worst birthday.
column90: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: [eating donuts while Dwight plays the recorder] Stop it. Stop! What is that?
column91: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: It's 'For the Longest Time,' by William Joel. It's you favorite song.
column92: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Yeah, well, it's on the radio. My birthday blows. Nobody even signed my birthday poster. Probably my mother is the only one that cares enough to send me anything.
column93: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: I probably care more than she does.
column94: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: You're making it worse. I bet Luke Perry's friends don't treat him like this [points to James Dean poster].
column95: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: When does he hear?
column96: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Sometime today.
column97: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: Ohh... poor Kevin.
column98: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: If I knew I had a week to live, I would... probably go to Europe. And South America. And the Grand Canyon. And... I would want to see the Pacific Ocean. ...It would be a pretty busy week.
column99: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Uh, that's a list price of four dollars and fifty cents. Unfortunately, this item is on [watch beeps] back... order... [hangs up] Michael! Michael! Michael Michael Michael! Come here, come here, come here! Come here!
column100: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: What?
column101: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Listen up everyone! It is 11:23 exactly, the exact moment when you emerged from your mother's vaginal canal, so... huh?! Right, have a seat. Please.
column102: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: [grinning] Ohhh, God.
column103: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: There is a tradition that the Hebrews have of hoisting the birthday boy up on a chair.
column104: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Ohhh, no.
column105: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: So come help me celebrate Michael's birth moment. Kevin!
column106: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Oscar: ...I'll do it.
column107: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Ohh, no, no, no! I can't... Ryan, come on. Let's do this.
column108: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Creed! Come on. Stanley!
column109: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: ...I feel like we should go get Kevin something. Do you think we can sneak out of here?
column110: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Maybe, but... we're gonna need somebody to create a diversion, and...
column111: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: On three, we're going to hoist away! Ready?
column112: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Okay.
column113: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Happy birth moment, Michael.
column114: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Thank you.
column115: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: One. Two. Three! [Michael is raised until his head hits the ceiling]
column116: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Whoa whoa! Alright. Alright. Watch it... please.
column117: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Oscar...
column118: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Oscar: It wasn't me.
column119: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;
column120: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;
column121: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;
column122: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Okay, that is not an eight foot sub.
column123: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Delivery Boy: Uh, we don't make an eight foot sub. This is eight one foot subs.
column124: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: F. Alright, what's the damage?
column125: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Delivery Boy: Uh, thirty-nine sixty.
column126: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: [pulls out wallet] Thirty nine... sixty.
column127: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Why tip someone for a job I'm capable of doing myself? I can deliver food. I can drive a taxi. I can, and do, cut my own hair. I did, however, tip my urologist, because... I am unable to pulverize my own kidney stones.
column128: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Here they come.
column129: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Get in here... everybody.
column130: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Come and get it!
column131: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Birthday party subs! My gift to you.
column132: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Oscar: What is this?
column133: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Uh, bologna, tomato and ketchup.
column134: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: The best.
column135: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Stanley: These are all the same?
column136: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Yes.
column137: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Angela: Bologna? I don't eat bologna.
column138: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Well, then just have the tomato and ketchup. Still good.
column139: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Angela: No.
column140: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Just the bread, it's fresh baked.
column141: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Angela: No.
column142: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Mm-kay. Get whatever you want. [under breath] And choke on it.
column143: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: When I was sixteen, I was supposed to go out on a date with a girl named Julie. But there was another Michael in the class that she apparently thought the date was with, so she went out with him, on my birthday. And, she got him a cake, at the restaurant. And it wasn't even his birthday, but I heard about it the next day in school. So... That was the worst birthday I think I ever had.
column144: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: So. We got Kev some stuff. Um... a party pack of M&M's, his favorite candy. A DVD of American Pie 2, which is his favorite movie, and, he lent it to Creed, so, I can guarantee you he won't get that back.
column145: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: Sixty-nine cup of noodles.
column146: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Which we realize sounds crass, but, it... is his favorite number.
column147: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: And his favorite lunch.
column148: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Hey temp, you know uh, we still got five feet of sandwich left [pulls ice cream cake out of freezer].
column149: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Ryan: [making peanut butter and jelly sandwich] Someone ate three feet of that thing?
column150: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Hell, yeah. Save room for ice cream cake.
column151: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Angela: [grabs cake] Oh. Thank you.
column152: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Oh. I got it.
column153: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Angela: What are--- it's... the party planning committee.
column154: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: [whispering] This is the most important day of the year. I can't risk anything.
column155: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Angela: Fine.
column156: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: What about that meeting... later... to discuss finances?
column157: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Angela: Yes... [whispering] but don't expect any cookie.
column158: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: [whispering] But what if i'm hungry?
column159: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Angela: [whispering] No cookie.
column160: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: [puts fabric softener into cart] ...What?
column161: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: You use fabric softener?
column162: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Yeah, you don't?
column163: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: No, I do.
column164: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: ...Okay.
column165: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Office Staff: [singing] Happy birthday dear Michael, [Michael joins in, Kevin's phone rings] Happy birthday... [everyone but Dwight stops] ...tooo youuuu.
column166: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kevin: Hello? Hey.
column167: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Kevin? Respect the birthday please.
column168: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kevin: No, um, no not yet. I will. Bye. [hangs up] It was just Stacy.
column169: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Are you done? ...Good. Okay.
column170: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Here we go. Make a wish.
column171: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Uhhh... blow out the candle. Okay. Mmmm... [blows out the candles]
column172: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Yaoo yay! [claps]
column173: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: ... I asked for trick candles.
column174: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Pam was supposed to get 'em.
column175: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Okay. Well, when she comes back we'll do it again. [notices Meredith hugging Kevin] Hello, what about the birthday boy? Haven't had a hug all day.
column176: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Angela: No one cares about your birthday. Kevin's waiting to hear if he has skin cancer.
column177: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: ... Aww, that... sucks, great. ... Wow, that's good timing. That's... that's, sorry, that's terrible. Terrible news. That's terrible... terrible news for both of us [takes cake into office and slams the door].
column178: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: [checking watch] We should probably head back.
column179: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Yeah. Okay. Oh. I dare you to make an announcement.
column180: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: You dare me? How old are you?
column181: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Just... quit stalling.
column182: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: [over loudspeaker, imitating Darth Vader] Luke, this is your father. Come set the table for dinner.
column183: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Such a dork.
column184: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: [loudspeaker] Jim Halpert? Price check on fabric softener, the kind that gives you...
column185: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Store Employee: Ma'am? Please don't touch that. That is not a toy.
column186: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: Oh I'm sorry. I'm sorry.
column187: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: How old are you?
column188: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: I hate you.
column189: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Toby: [to Kevin] Honestly, is there any way you can get on your fiancee's plan? Our health plan is s... just... it's terrible.
column190: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: There you are. Good news. Did some research. It turns out that 98% of people with skin cancer fully recover.
column191: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kevin: Still scary.
column192: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Yeah, but it's not brain cancer. And it shouldn't stop us from having fun. You know what they say the best medicine is.
column193: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kevin: Well the doctor said a combination of interferon and dicarbazine.
column194: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: And laughter... also.
column195: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Toby: I don't really think people are in the laughing mood.
column196: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Why are you here? I didn't even invite you to my birthday party.
column197: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Toby: I work here.
column198: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: [mocking voice] Nyeh, I work here. [to Kevin] Alright, well, you know what, since Toby doesn't speak for everybody and I am your boss, I... think you should just go home. Take the rest of the afternoon off. Take a sick day.
column199: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kevin: If I go home now, I'll just drive myself crazy.
column200: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Well, you're pretty much driving everyone else here crazy... crazy with worry.
column201: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Where have you been? And don't say the bathroom, 'cause I kicked in all the stalls.
column202: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Well that's an invasion of privacy, so, I'm going to tell Michael.
column203: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Please, don't.
column204: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: You... owe me.
column205: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Excuse me, everyone. Attention please. Kevin, we're going to take you to a very special place, a place that will make you happy, and a place that is far, far away from the evil sun.
column206: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Stanley: Is this trip related in any way to your... birthday?
column207: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: How dare you sir. You are gross.
column208: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: [sees 'Happy Birthday Michael Scott!' poster at skating rink] That should not be there.
column209: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: I'll get someone to take it down.
column210: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: No, it's alright. It's already up. Just leave it. Where's Kevin? Come on! Let's get our skate on!
column211: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kelly: Don't be scared! You're good! You're good!
column212: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Ryan: Whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa.
column213: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Think you can let go?
column214: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: No. [laughs]
column215: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa. [Michael skates by]
column216: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: YEAH!
column217: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: Who is that?
column218: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: Is that Michael?
column219: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Yeah, I've been pretty much skating my whole life. I thought about playing in the NHL, but, you're on the road so much. You got no time to spend with your wife and kids. And I really want a wife and kids.
column220: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: I got it.
column221: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Hey Pam, all this stuff with Kevin... um, it's pretty scary. And I'm thinking that uh, next time you're in the shower, you should check yourself out. You know, give yourself an exam. Those things are like ticking time bags. Alright? Think about it.
column222: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Jim: ...It's something to think about.
column223: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kevin: I can't relax about it, you know?
column224: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Kevin. You heard anything yet?
column225: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kevin: No, not yet.
column226: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Okay. Well. Live strong.
column227: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kevin: Okay, Michael.
column228: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Alright.
column229: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Carol: Michael?
column230: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Yeah. Carol? She sold me my condo! Hey! What, is this place on the market? Or...
column231: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Carol: Uhh, no, I... don't just sell real estate. Uh, my daughter has a skating lesson.
column232: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Oh, these... all your kids?
column233: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Carol: No just the front two.
column234: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Oh, hey guys. Whats up? You wanna go for a ride? Is that okay?
column235: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Carol: Sure.
column236: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Cool. Alright. Grab on. Here we go. Ready? Hang on tight. Alright. We are moving. We are reaaallly mooovin' now!
column237: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Push. Good! That's great. You got it. [Kevin's phone rings] Excuse me.
column238: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kevin: Hello? Yeah okay. Alright. Okay, I will, thanks. [hangs up] It was negative.
column239: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Oh... God... [stomps] God! [throws hockey stick and yellow paper bracelet down] We're gonna beat this, okay? We're gonna... come here [hugs Kevin].
column240: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Well, apparently in the medicine community, negative means good. Which makes absolutely no sense. In the real world community, that would... be... chaos.
column241: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Kevin: This is awesome. Thanks, you guys.
column242: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Okay, who's this from? Wowwwee, look at that! Jersey!
column243: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Turn it around. Turn it around.
column244: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Cool. Ohh. Great. From Dwight.
column245: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Dwight: Number one!!
column246: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Thank you... Dwight. That's great. Thanks.
column247: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: Michael?
column248: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Yeah.
column249: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: This is from all of us.
column250: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Michael: Oh! You didn't need to do that. ...Nightswept. This is... really amazing. Thank you. I love it.
column251: 02x19 - Michael's Birthday;Pam: Michael's birthday was actually pretty cool. It was a good day. I don't know... It was a good day.

column1: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Kevin Malone, you're next. Spit that out. [Kevin shoves the rest of the donut he's eating into his mouth] Spit... Okay, come on, let's go.
column2: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: You look cute today, Dwight.
column3: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Thanks, girl.
column4: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: So, yesterday Dwight found half a joint in the parking lot. Which is unfortunate because as it turns out, Dwight finding drugs is more dangerous than most people using drugs.
column5: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Let's go over some of the symptoms of marijuana use, shall we? You tell me who this sounds like: slow moving, inattentive, dull, constantly snacking, shows a lack of motivation.
column6: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Kevin: [nods] Hey...
column7: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: I like the people I work with generally, with four exceptions. But someone committed a crime and I did not become a Lackawanna County Volunteer Sheriff's deputy to make friends. And by the way, I haven't.
column8: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: [mimicking Stanley] I enjoy the tangy zip of Miracle Whip.
column9: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: [laughs] Jim does the best impressions. Sometimes he'll look up at me from his desk and he'll just be someone else. Like he'll go um, [makes mournful face, giggles] that's supposed to be Phyllis. I can't do it as good as he can.
column10: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Kelly: And the guys are saying, chug, chug, chug, but I'm so small and all I'd eaten that day was one of those Auntie Anne pretzels from the food court so I said "Is it okay if I sip it?" and they said no, but Ryan seemed cool either way.
column11: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Stop! This is not Kelly Kapoor story hour. Illegal drugs were consumed on company property, okay? Your ass is on the line, mister! My ass is is on the line! Now I'm going to ask you again. What time did you go home last night?
column12: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Kelly: Six.
column13: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: I didn't know that you were at a party on Saturday night.
column14: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Ryan: I go to a lot of parties.
column15: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Okay, I'm gonna need to search your car. Give me you keys.
column16: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Ryan: I am not giving you my keys.
column17: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Don't make me do this the hard way.
column18: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Ryan: What's the hard way?
column19: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: I go down to the police station on my lunch break. I tell a police officer, I know several, what I suspect you may have in your car. He requests a hearing from a judge and obtains a search warrant, once he has said warrant, he will drive over here, and make you give him the keys to your car, and you will have to obey him.
column20: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Ryan: Yeah, let's do it that way.
column21: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Ry, is he bugging you? Dwight, dude, you gotta take a chill pill, man. It was one joint in the parking lot. You know, you're totally harshing the office mellow.
column22: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: I can't stop this investigation. It is my job.
column23: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: Whoa. You are a volunteer.
column24: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: I volunteered for this job.
column25: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: And that's not the same.
column26: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: It is my duty...
column27: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: [interrupting] Volunteer duty.
column28: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: ...to investigate the crime scene. I have six more interviews to go and then I will reveal what I know.
column29: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: [fake coughing] Narc!
column30: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Kevin: [giggling]
column31: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: If you are attempting to compliment me then you have done a very good job.
column32: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: I wasn't attempting to compliment you.
column33: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Well, you have...
column34: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Uuf, well...
column35: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: ...because being a narc is one of the hardest jobs that you can have...
column36: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: [shakes head] Okay...
column37: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: ...and I am very proud of being a narc.
column38: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Why don't you just cool it, cool it Dwight, please, God! [to Jim] Dude, where's my office? [Jim quietly laughs] I totally lost it, 'cause I was half-baked. Smokin' doobies. Doobie brothers, I was smokin' doobies with my brothers. Peace out, Seacrest!
column39: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: Well, your office is behind you.
column40: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Thanks. M-m-munchies. Who wants some munchies?
column41: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Ryan: I don't think Michael's ever done drugs. I don't know if anyone has ever offered him any.
column42: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Oscar visited Mexico when he was five to attend his great-grandmother's funeral. What does that mean to a United States law enforcement officer? He's a potential drug mule.
column43: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Have you ever taken any illegal drugs?
column44: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Oscar: No, I have not.
column45: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Do you think it's possible that maybe you could have had some drugs in your system without you knowing about it?
column46: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Oscar: What are you implying?
column47: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Have you ever... pooped... a balloon?
column48: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Oscar: Okay. I'm done with this.
column49: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: He sure left in a hurry.
column50: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: I don't want to blow this. This is what all good law enforcement officers dream of. The chance to solve an actual crime.
column51: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Do you know what this is? [pushing a photo toward her]
column52: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Phyllis: Yes, it's marijuana.
column53: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: How do you know that?
column54: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Phyllis: It's labeled.
column55: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: [grabs pictures back and looks at it] Dammit.
column56: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Creed: That is Northern Lights Cannabis Indica.
column57: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: No, it's marijuana.
column58: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: I'm just saying that you can't be sure that is wasn't you.
column59: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: That's ridiculous, of course it wasn't me.
column60: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: Marijuana is a memory loss drug, so maybe you just don't remember.
column61: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: I would remember.
column62: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: Well, how could you, if it just erased your memory?
column63: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: That's not how it works.
column64: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: Now how do you know how it works?
column65: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Knock it off, okay, I'm interviewing you.
column66: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: No! You said that I'd be conducting the interview when I walked in here. Now exactly how much pot did you smoke?
column67: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: [opens eyes wide in total surprise]
column68: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Oscar: So Pam told me that you do a great Stanley impression, I'd love to hear it.
column69: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: Oh, um...[mimicking Stanley] Why do you keep CC'ing me on things that have nothing to do with me? [Pam and Oscar laugh, Stanley walks in, and Oscar leaves quickly]
column70: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Stanley: Is that supposed to be me?
column71: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: Oh, hey Stanley. Uh, I was just doing an impression.
column72: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Stanley: I do not think that is funny.
column73: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: He does everyone in the office.
column74: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Stanley: Hmmmpt.
column75: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam/Jim: [in unison] I do not think that is funny.
column76: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: Jinx! Buy me a coke.
column77: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: Oh...
column78: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: No, no, no, no talking. Jim is not allowed to talk until after he buys me a coke. Those are the rules of jinx, and they are unflinchingly rigid. [Jim puts money in drink machine, selection is sold out]
column79: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: Sold out? That has never happened in the history of jinx.
column80: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: [mouths] C'mon!
column81: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: Sorry, that's not my problem.
column82: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: [presses drink button, looks at camera, makes Jim-face]
column83: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: I know you're innocent, but I can't look like I'm treating you any differently.
column84: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Angela: I understand.
column85: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Where were you yesterday after work?
column86: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Angela: [smiles knowingly]
column87: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Uh-oh. Uh-oh. Who's he calling? Ratting somebody out. Narc! Narc! Kevin?
column88: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Kevin: That is so good, Michael
column89: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Remember the narc bit? [laughs] Uh-oh, who's in trouble?
column90: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Attention everyone. Drug testers are coming in a couple of hours to test everyone's urine.
column91: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Waa... what? What are you talking about?
column92: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Company policy. If drugs are found on the premises there is automatic drug testing conducted within twenty-four hours.
column93: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Oscar: Is that true, Toby?
column94: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Toby: Oh, when you sign your job application you agree to comply with random drug testing.
column95: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Two nights ago, I went to an Alicia Keys concert at the Montage Mountain Performing Arts Center. I scored these great aisle seats. Anyway, after the opening act this beautiful girl sits down next to me and I never get to meet girls with lip rings and she had one. I don't know exactly how this happened but one of her friends started passing around some stuff and they said it was clove cigarettes, and I'm sure that it was clove cigarettes. Everybody in the aisle was doing it.
column96: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Okay, attention everyone the drug testing has been cancelled. Instead, I will be going around to each of you and doing a visual inspection.
column97: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: No you can't do that.
column98: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: I can do that, it is my office.
column99: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: No you cannot. It has to be official, and it has to be urine.
column100: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Hmmm. Ha. [under his breath] Alright. Great.
column101: 02x20 - Drug Testing;
column102: 02x20 - Drug Testing;
column103: 02x20 - Drug Testing;
column104: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Kevin, what prescription drugs are you taking, besides Rogaine?
column105: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Kevin: I'm not taking Rogaine.
column106: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Angela, what about you?
column107: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Angela: I don't take any prescription drugs.
column108: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: You're not on anything?
column109: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Angela: [Gives Dwight a knowing look]
column110: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Good.
column111: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Kelly: So the first time we went out to dinner, it was like, whatever, fine, but I was so nervous. So this time I wanted to be special, so I bought a new dress! [Jim hunches his shoulders and grins] One of those kinds that is kinda low cut at top to show something, but not everything. [Jim shakes his head no in agreement] I mean not everything, Jim. [Jim shakes his head in agreement] I promise, I'm not that kind of...
column112: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: Hey guys, what's going on?
column113: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Kelly: We're having the best conversation. [Jim, eyes wide, shakes his head, no]
column114: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: Oh, okay. Well, Michael wants to see everyone in the conference room. [Jim shakes his head. Seems relieved to be getting away from Kelly] But you know what? We have a few minutes so you guys should definitely finish up your conversation. [Jim nods his head as if to say, "Gee, thanks, Pam."]
column115: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Kelly: So, I was looking so hot...
column116: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: It has come to my attention that some people here think that the use of drugs is something to laugh about.
column117: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Phyllis: We don't feel that way.
column118: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Angela: No, not at all.
column119: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Oscar: You were the one joking around calling Dwight a narc.
column120: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: No, uh, no. That was a test. I was testing you, and you all failed. Miserably. When I said that Dwight was a narc, how many of you defended him? How many of you said, "Hey, you know what, he's right? What he's doing is protecting this office from the evils of drugs."
column121: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Thank you, Michael.
column122: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: I am ridiculously anti-drug. So anti-drug that I am above suspicion in any way that involves suspicion, or testing of any kind.
column123: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Drugs ruin lives people. Drugs destroy careers. Take Cheech and Chong everybody knows that Cheech and Chong are funny, but just imagine how funny they would be if they didn't smoke pot. I want everybody to take a look to their left. Now I want everybody to take a look to their right. One of those people will be dead from drug use at some point in their lives. This year more people will use cocaine than will read a book to their children.
column124: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Stanley: Where did you get these facts?
column125: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Are these facts scaring you, or are they not?
column126: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Stanley: They are not.
column127: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Do you think that smoking drugs is cool? Do you think that doing alcohol is cool?
column128: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Stanley: No, I don't. I have a glass of red wine with dinner about once a week. For the antioxidants.
column129: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Okay, enough, enough, enough! I have written down a list of illegal drugs. Take a gander. How many of these are you familiar with?
column130: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Toby: Hookah is not an illegal drug, Michael.
column131: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Yes it is.
column132: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Toby: No it's not. It's a type of pipe. You can fill it with tobacco, often mixed with fruit, or other flavors.
column133: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Okay, you know what, Toby? Pam, can you take this down? [Pam throws her hands up to indicate she has no notepad] In addition to Toby's urine being tested, I would like to test his blood and his hair.
column134: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Toby: You can't do that.
column135: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: I can test anyone randomly, and I have chosen you randomly.
column136: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Toby: That's not random.
column137: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Okay, eeny, meenie, miney, moe, is random. Okay, you know what? I'm going to need a volunteer to select one of these words and tell us of something tragic that happened in either their lives, or the lives of a loved one. Yeah, Pam.
column138: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: I know that Jim has an amazing story about a relative of his who got caught up in the world of drugs.
column139: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Really? [Jim shakes his head no]
column140: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: Uh, hmmm.
column141: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Jim it's okay. You can t... [Jim looks at Pam and shakes his head, Pam looks at him and gestures for Jim to go up and tell his story] This would be a good place to let it out, Jim. These are people you can trust. These are people who care about you. [Jim shakes his head no] It's okay, just we will not judge you. We are here to not judge you. [Jim stands up] Oh, he's doing it, okay. [Jim looks at Pam] It's okay. [Jim pretends to try, looking teary eyed, shakes his head no, mouths "I can't" and sits back down. Pam is amazed.] Oh. Okay, are you sure? [Jim shakes his head. Kevin pats his shoulder] That looked like it was going to be good. Alright. [Pam nods in admiration at Jim] Okay, well.
column142: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: Wow! He really pulled out the big guns. Fake crying. Did not expect that.
column143: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: The point I'm trying to make with all of this people is that I hate drugs. I hate them, and based upon what I have seen you all don't quite hate 'em as much as I do so you are going to have a drug test, and I am not.
column144: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: No, you will be tested.
column145: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Yes, I will not be.
column146: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: You will be. That is the law according to the rules.
column147: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Okay, well Dwight just know that I've been very busy today and I got a lot of work to do and I wasn't planning on going to the bathroom and I don't even know if anything is going to come out, okay? So good. Thank you.
column148: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Hi, Linda. Dwight Schrute, Assistant Regional Manager. You might remember testing my urine a few years back when I was applying to be a volunteer sheriff's deputy.
column149: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Linda: We test a lot of urine.
column150: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Mine was green.
column151: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Linda: Oh, right. How are you?
column152: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: I'm all better.
column153: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: So I need you to do some work on the St. Andrews account. I need your urine. I need some filing done.
column154: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: What kind of filing?
column155: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Just forget it. Just the urine.
column156: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: That goes directly to the tester.
column157: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Just. I need your urine.
column158: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Like in a cup?
column159: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Yes in a cup, we're not animals, Dwight.
column160: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: For what purpose?
column161: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: It's none of your business.
column162: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Then I refuse.
column163: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Okay. Alright. Just, I went to an Alicia Keys concert, over the weekend, and I think I may have gotten high accidentally by a girl with a lip ring.
column164: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Are you serious?
column165: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: I need clean urine for the lady.
column166: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: But that's illegal.
column167: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Don't think of it that way. It's like, urine goes all over the place. You know, there's no controlling it. It just... goes
column168: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Not my urine.
column169: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: A cup could find its way under the urine. It might be an accident. It happens.
column170: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Were you forced to do drugs at this concert?
column171: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: No, just look. Look. Just... just fill up the cup.
column172: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Angela: Do you want to give Michael your urine?
column173: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: I want him to have all the urine he needs.
column174: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Angela: You're not going to get my permission on this.
column175: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: I know that. Don't you think I know that?
column176: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Linda: Yeah, we do testing all over the country.
column177: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Ryan: Cool. Hey, are you guys hiring?
column178: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Linda: You want to work at the urinalysis lab?
column179: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Ryan: Yeah. Maybe.
column180: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: My father's name was Dwight Schrute. My grandfather's name was Dwight Schrute. His father's name Dwide Schrude. Amish. I loved my father very much. Every morning he'd wake up at dawn and make us biscuits with gravy. When I was little my dad and I played a lot of games together. My dad cheated a lot but I never busted him on it. I would have, except I didn't know about it. He didn't tell me till years later. I was shocked when I found out.
column181: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: What? [Jim shakes his head] Did you want to tell me something? You look like you want to tell me something. [Jim shakes his head no] You look like you have something really important to say and you just can't for some reason. [Jim smiles] Come on, you can tell me. Jim, you can tell me anything. [Jim stops smiling and looks down. Pam wonders what that means]
column182: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Kevin: I'd like a magazine.
column183: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Linda: We just need urine, sir.
column184: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Kevin: I'd still like one.
column185: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Dwight. Well, I passed the test thanks to you and your untainted pee. Thank you very much.
column186: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: That's great.
column187: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: What's wrong? Where's your costume?
column188: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: It's a uniform and I turned it in today when I tendered my resignation.
column189: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Why? Wha...
column190: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: I took an oath when I was sworn in and I broke that oath today.
column191: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: [placing a coke can in front of Jim] Here. [Jim looks confused] Just buy it from me. I haven't talked to you in hours and it's been weird and I really want to know what the hell's going on with Dwight. [Pam scoots the coke can towards Jim. Jim pulls out his wallet and hands Pam a dollar. He gives the coke back to Pam]
column192: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: Hi.
column193: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: Hey.
column194: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: How much time do you have left on your break?
column195: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Pam: Ten minutes.
column196: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Since you did such a good job with the investigation, I decided to pull a few strings. Call in a few favors. and I've decided to make you official security supervisor of the branch.
column197: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Really?
column198: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Yes, sir.
column199: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: That's fantastic because I've always felt that the security here sucked .
column200: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: So you wanna? Thanks.
column201: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Hank: Dwight K. Schrute, I hereby declare you an honorary voluntary corporal in charge of assisting all activities security.
column202: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Okay.
column203: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Hank: Here's your badge.
column204: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Thank you, Michael. Very nice. Great. [To Hank] Can I have a gun?
column205: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Hank: No, I don't have a gun.
column206: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Okay, I'll have to bring in my bow staff.
column207: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Hank: I don't think so.
column208: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Good.
column209: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: [salutes] Thank you, Michael.
column210: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: No. Oh. Uh...[awkwardly salutes]
column211: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: I need to go over some details with you.
column212: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Michael: Alright. [to Hank] Well, Thank you.
column213: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: First of all, Hank, how many orange traffic cones do you have?
column214: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Hank: Two.
column215: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Dwight: Oh, God.
column216: 02x20 - Drug Testing;Jim: Wow. What a terrible day to not be able to talk. Dwight was literally carrying around his own urine and dressed like one of the Village People. Why does he do the things that he does for Michael? I just don't get it. What is he getting out of that relationship?

column1: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Kevin: So, uh... you found a band for your wedding yet?
column2: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: No.
column3: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Kevin: 'Cause I'm in a band. We really rock.
column4: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Yeah, I mean it's inevitable. I definitely overhear some wedding preparation, but I'm fine with it. She hears me arranging my social life. And we both have to hear Dwight order deer urine over the Internet, so it evens out.
column5: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Phyllis: Oh I got the 'Save The Date'.
column6: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: Yeah?
column7: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Phyllis: Yeah, pretty stationery.
column8: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: Oh, thanks!
column9: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Angela: I didn't get mine yet.
column10: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: Uh...
