column11: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: There are a few people I decided not to invite, and that might make things kind of awkward but ... it's my wedding. And I don't want anyone there who has called me a hussy.
column12: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Yes, thanks, Fantastic Sam's. Adult Cut Plus. Comes with a shampoo and blow dry. We're doing I.D. photos today. Gotta represent.
column13: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Phyllis: Uh, on or off?
column14: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;I.D. Photographer: Off.
column15: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Phyllis: Okay... [removes glasses]
column16: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: Oh! What is on your face? Is that a disguise?
column17: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Phyllis: [leaving the room] Excuse me.
column18: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: Clown paint.
column19: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: I.D. badges are long overdue. Security in this office park is a joke. Last year, I came to work with my spud gun in a duffel bag. I sat at my desk all day, with a rifle that shoots potatoes at 60 pounds per square inch. Can you imagine if I was deranged?
column20: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: That's a nice tie.
column21: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Ryan: Thank you.
column22: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: That is... who makes that?
column23: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Ryan: Um, I don't...
column24: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Do you mind if I wear that for the photo?
column25: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Ryan: Um... let's um, let's keep our clothes.
column26: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Oscar: It's like child abuse. I say, if Jesus saw that, he'd freak out! He'd freak out, Toby! I mean on some levels... it's... and I'm supposed to work there. I'm supposed...
column27: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [walking into the Conference room] What's the dealio?
column28: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: Just letting Oscar vent a little. We would use the break room, but the photographer's back there today.
column29: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: What's the problem?
column30: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Oscar: Angela!
column31: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: It's just a little dispute over a poster in their workspace.
column32: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Oscar: Since Christmas.
column33: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: So what, you're having a little spat. I forget, are you guys dating?
column34: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Oscar: No.
column35: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: Michael, can I talk to you for a uh, second please?
column36: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Yes.
column37: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: Here's how I usually handle this: all I do is listen.
column38: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Yeah?
column39: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: These things just have a way of working themselves out.
column40: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Okay.
column41: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: It's like if you write someone a letter, when you're really angry... they say to keep it in a drawer for a couple days. Then you just never end up sending it.
column42: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: What do you know about conflict resolution? Your answer to everything is to get divorced. So...
column43: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: Okay.
column44: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Okay... what?
column45: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: That was the right decision for me and my marriage.
column46: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Yeah, well... that's not gonna fly here. Because in this office, it is till death do us part... assuming we don't get downsized. [leans over to Pam] Uh, Pam, will you get Angela and meet us in the conference room please?
column47: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [holding up a binder] A mediator's tool chest. Okay, well, before we get started, you should know that are 5 different styles of conflict.[in a comedic voice] My Shaolin temple style defeats your monkey style.
column48: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Angela: Can we go? I have a lot of work to do.
column49: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: No. Okay, this is important. The first style is lose/lose.
column50: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Oscar: What's the next one?
column51: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Just hold on, please! Okay, if we do lose/lose, neither of you gets what you want. Do you understand? You... you would both lose. Now I need to ask you, do you want to pursue a lose/lose negotiation?
column52: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Angela: Can we just skip to whatever number 5 is - win/win or whatever?
column53: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Win/Win is number four and number five is win/win/win. The important difference here is with win/win/win, we all win. Me too. I win for having successfully mediated a conflict at work.
column54: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [in front of poster] Okay, since this is the disputed poster. Now, one at a time, I want you to express your feelings using "I" emotion language and no judging or "you" statements.
column55: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Angela: I got this poster for Christmas, and I feel I want to see it everyday. It makes me feel like the babies are the true artists, and God has a really cute sense of humor.
column56: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Come on, seriously, that?
column57: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Oscar: I don't like looking at it. It's creepy, and in bad taste, and it's just offensive to me. It makes me think of the horrible, frigid stage mothers who force the babies into it. It's kitsch. It's the opposite of art. It destroys art. It destroys souls. This is so much more offensive to me than hardcore porno. I'm talking about the...
column58: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Okay, okay. Stop, stop, stop! Let's see if we can just brainstorm and find some creative alternatives that are win/win.
column59: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: Win!
column60: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Yes. Thank you, Pam. How about Angela makes the poster into a t-shirt, which Oscar wears. That way, he can never see it and whenever she looks at Oscar, she can see it. Win/win/win.
column61: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Oscar: No.
column62: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Angela: That's... no...
column63: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Okay... well, brainstorm. Own the solution.
column64: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Angela: How about, I leave it up?
column65: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Oscar: How 'bout, she takes it down?
column66: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: How about, Angela can keep it up on Tuesdays and Thursdays?
column67: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Okay, that is called a compromise. And it is style 3. And it is not ideal. To sum up, win/win - make the poster into a t-shirt, win/lose - take the poster down, compromise - Tuesdays and Thursdays. And the answer is... make the poster into a t-shirt! Win/win.
column68: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: Win.
column69: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Oscar: Fine.
column70: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Angela: But, it...
column71: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [claps his hands twice] It is done!
column72: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: Win
column73: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Photographer: [snaps a photo of Creed, then Creed turns to the side for a profile shot] No, you're all good.
column74: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Creed: Great. [gets up and leaves]
column75: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: Hey, Angela.[hands her a Save The Date card] I didn't have your zip code.
column76: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Angela: Oh. Thanks.
column77: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Angela: It was hand delivered. But, I did get a Save The Date after all. It's not my taste.
column78: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: You solved it?
column79: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Yes.
column80: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: Well, good. We can, uh, throw that one out. [shuffles through papers]
column81: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Are those all the other complains?
column82: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: Mmm-Hm.
column83: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: I would like to see those please.
column84: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: I... I can't do that.
column85: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: You can't do that, huh? Huh, ok. Now you and I have a conflict. I order you to give me that file.
column86: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: That... [shakes head and places hand over the file]
column87: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Okay. [yanks the file away, despite Toby's resistance] There! No more conflict. [looks at the camera] I had to use win/lose on that. It was not pretty. [looks back at Toby] All right... is that it?
column88: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: [sighs and pulls out a box under his desk] It's all Dwight's.
column89: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: Every Friday at 4, I have a standing appointment with Dwight for him to file a grievance against Jim. I tell him that I'm sending them to a special file in New York. That box is the special file in New York.
column90: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Ohh... God. Alright. Why do I have to do everything?
column91: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Photographer: Are you sure? [looks at Oscar, who is front of the camera, holding the baby poster in front of his chest]
column92: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: Oh, he's sure. Just shoot.
column93: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Photographer: [shoots twice]
column94: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [looking through papers in the complaint box] This is from Kevin. He says Stanley uses his Miracle Whip without asking. Meredith complains that everyone talks too loud in the morning and the lights are too bright. Creed... huh. Duh, duh. Creed is sick of looking at the redhead all day and wants a seat facing the receptionist.
column95: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: Nice.
column96: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: You will notice that not one of these complaints is against me.
column97: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: Actually, I have a separate folder for complaints against Michael. This [unlocks a drawer]is January through March of this year. [pulls out a fairly large folder]
column98: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: How many of you have at one time gone to Toby to complain about another employee? [looks at all the employees, most of whom raise their hands] And... did you get what you wanted, or were you merely listened to, you forget about your problem, and you move on? [employees mumble "merely listen to and forgotten..." ] That is outrageous! I love this place... and it pains me to see all of the negativity festering... [sighs] Okay, today we are going to get everything out of these files and into the open, where it can be resolved. Alright, how about the Phyllis/Angela dispute?
column99: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Angela: You already did me.
column100: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: That's what she said. [Jim mouths these words along with Michael] The thing is, Angela... you are in here an awful lot. You have complained about everybody in the office, except Dwight, which is odd because everyone else has had run ins with Dwight. Toby, by the way, what does "redacted" mean? There is a file full of complaints in here marked "redacted"... ?
column101: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: Yeah, it just means whoever complained came to me later and withdrew it, so I took their name off.
column102: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Oh, ok. There were a bunch of complaints about Dwight that were put in the redacted file about six months ago.
column103: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: Whoa.. wha... wait. If someone has a problem with me, why would they withdraw it six months ago?
column104: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: [notices Angela's intense concern] Um... let's move on. I volunteer. Did anyone have a problem with me?
column105: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: All right, Pamela. Come on down! Let's do it! And [looks through the file]... okay. Just one complaint. Actually, it has been withdrawn. So that is no help to us. Next.
column106: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: Wait, what did it say?
column107: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Uh... [reading]"Does she have to plan her wedding on office time? Couldn't she do that at home?" [Pam looks Angela an angry look] Who else? Why don't we just warm up first? Warm up emotionally, all right?
column108: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: I have this kind of big secret about Angela. And I've been really nice to her... and I haven't told anyone. And what the hell?!
column109: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Here is a Kelly complaint: "Ryan never returns my calls." Ugh, join the club.
column110: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Ryan: My voicemail's really spotty... sometimes...
column111: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Kelly: I didn't file a complaint. I was just talking.
column112: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: To your HR representative.
column113: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Kelly: To my friend, I thought. I want that withdrawn.
column114: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: Fine, I'll take your name off. [looks at Michael] So no one will know.
column115: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [crumbles up the complaint paper] Makin' progress. [Jim raises his hand] Yes?
column116: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Dwight tried to kiss me.
column117: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: What?!
column118: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: And I didn't tell anyone because I'm not really sure how I feel about it.
column119: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: That is not true. Redact it. Redact it!
column120: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Well, I'm not actually making a formal complaint. I just really think we should talk about it.
column121: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: Okay, question. [looks at Toby] When a name is withdrawn, does that also apply to the permanent misbehavior file in New York?
column122: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: Sure.
column123: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Stanley. [off camera]
column124: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: [gets up and walks over to Angela, whispering to her] Hey. Thanks for ratting me out!
column125: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [still of camera] You got a lot of anger under there buddy. Come on start us out. Unleash it.
column126: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Anglea: I didn't do it! [Michael and Stanley continue to talk off camera, but it's inaudible]
column127: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: I find that hard to believe... considering you have problems with every single person in this entire office except Bobblehead Joe.
column128: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;
column129: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;
column130: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;
column131: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Someone complained that the men's room is "whites only". Stanley, you know that's not true.
column132: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Stanley: I didn't say that.
column133: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Creed: Then why is there a picture of a white man on the door? [Michael, along with the camera, look at the standard stick man on the bathroom door.]
column134: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Okay, Phyllis. You complained that Angela's giving you dirty looks. And you tried to get off the party planning committee.
column135: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Phyllis: No, I never said any such thing. Angela and I are close.
column136: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: And... also, Phyllis, Stanley says that you cry too much, and that bugs him.
column137: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Phyllis: Stanley and I are close, too.
column138: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Stanley: We sit close.
column139: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Oh... ok.
column140: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: [sits down for his ID picture] Just take it. [flashes goes off, while he is standing back up again]
column141: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: I can't believe Angela. I went against my better judgment, and I gave her a Save The Date. And now it turns out she complained about me to Toby.
column142: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Well, it was redacted. Look, if she wants an invite, maybe she's just trying to be friends.
column143: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: Don't take her side.
column144: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: [sighs] Well, what does Roy think about everything?
column145: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: I don't know. I try not to bother him about this kind of stuff.
column146: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: You mean your thoughts and feelings?
column147: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: Yeah.
column148: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Yeah...
column149: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Phyllis: I know you keep saying it's your space, even though there's no assigned parking, but I keep forgetting.
column150: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Angela: Yes, that's the problem.
column151: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Phyllis: I guess so...
column152: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Okay, well... all settled, then.
column153: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Phyllis: [whispering to Angela] I don't like you.
column154: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: OK, Ryan. You told Toby that Creed has a distinct old man smell?
column155: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Creed: I know exactly what he's talking about. I sprout mung beans on a damp paper towel in my desk drawer. Very nutritious. But they smell like death.
column156: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: All right, Kevin. You are accused of making sexually suggestive remarks to Angela that made her feel uncomfortable. Solution: Angela, you are to make sexually suggestive remarks to Kevin that will make him uncomfortable.
column157: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Kevin: I accept your decision!
column158: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Hey... you know what, Dwight? Maybe we should get our photo I.D. taken together.
column159: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: That doesn't make any sense.
column160: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Well, it saves time, you know. 'Cause we could just meet in the parking lot every morning. Walk in together. Perfect.
column161: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Photographer: [to Dwight, who is sitting in front of the camera] Smile.
column162: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: No.
column163: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: I never smile if I can help it. Showing one's teeth is a submission signal in primates. When someone smiles at me, all I see is a chimpanzee begging for its life.
column164: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: This came out really well. [picks up Dwight's I.D. from the laminating machine and hands it to Dwight] There you go.
column165: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: This is humongous. I am not a security threat...
column166: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Oh.
column167: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: And my middle name is 'Kurt', not 'Fart'.
column168: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: What did I write?
column169: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: I have another complaint for Jim's permanent file.
column170: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Toby: Talk to Michael. I gave him the box.
column171: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: What box?!
column172: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Phyllis: But I didn't report your snoring-
column173: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Stanley: Wednesdays, tearful. Tuesdays... [Dwight walks in and rummages through his complaint box]
column174: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Uh. Dwight.
column175: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: Ah... agh... dgh... Ahh! No, no! Four years of malfeasance unreported. This cannot stand.
column176: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Okay! Calm down.
column177: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: No! You calm down! Who's side is Toby on? Who's side are you on?
column178: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Hey, hey!
column179: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: Him or me?
column180: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Stop.
column181: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: Him or me? I cannot work with Jim anymore.
column182: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Okay...
column183: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: Either he goes, or I go.
column184: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Dwight...
column185: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: You choose!
column186: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Stop...
column187: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: One of us is out of here by the end of today! [runs out]
column188: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Oh... kay...
column189: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: I am not bluffing!
column190: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Okay.
column191: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: Okay?
column192: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Yes.
column193: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: Do the right thing here, Michael. Okay, I have served you loyally for years.
column194: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Mm-hmm.
column195: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: I deserve this. You know I do!
column196: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [picks up Dwight's I.D. and snickers] You know your I.D. says you're a security threat?
column197: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: You have till five.
column198: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: Oh, look, Jim. There's a sales manager position open in Stamford. Want me to call Jan and tell her you're interested? I could put in a good word for you, 'cause I'll still be working here. Transfer! Transfer! Everybody! Transfer! Transfer! Transfer! Transfer!
column199: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Okay... you two, in the conference room with me. Nobody leaves until we work this out. Cage match!
column200: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Cage matches? Yeah, they work. How could they not work? If they didn't work, everybody would still be in the cage.
column201: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Okay, so Dwight, in your own words - [reads from complaint paper] "Someone replaced all my pens and pencils with crayons. I suspect Jim Halpert." [flips to another paper] "Everyone has called me 'Dwayne' all day. I think Jim Halpert paid them to."
column202: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: [laughs] Yes! Five bucks each. And it was totally worth it.
column203: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [reading] "This morning, I found a bloody glove in my desk drawer and Jim Halpert tried to convince me I committed murder. I think he may be the real murderer." [flips to another paper] "Jim Halpert said there was an abandoned infant in the woman's room. When I went to save the child, I saw Meredith on the can." Gah. "This morning, I knocked myself in the head with the phone."
column204: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: That actually took a while. I had to put, uh, more and more nickels into his handset, till he got used to the weight, and then I just... took 'em all out.
column205: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [reading] "Every time I typed my name, it said 'Diapers'."
column206: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Just a simple macro. You know, these actually don't sound that funny one after another. But he does deserve it, though.
column207: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: "By the end of the day, my desk was about two feet closer to the copier."
column208: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Yeah, I just moved it an inch every time he went to the bathroom. And that's how I spent my entire day that day.
column209: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: The Japanese have this thing called shiatsu massage, where they dig into your body, very hard. And it is very painful. And apparently, some people throw up. But the next day they feel great. I've never had one. They sound awful.
column210: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Maybe Stanford would be cool.
column211: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: It's a good market. Higher volume.
column212: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Yeah. Maybe we should both go.
column213: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: I have a girlfriend...
column214: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Sure you do, Dwight. Sure.
column215: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Hey, there's like, 300 more of these. Let's get to them later.
column216: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: So, you going to transfer Jim or not?
column217: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Maybe, I haven't decided yet. Let's get to work.
column218: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: I want an answer by tomorrow.
column219: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Okay. Oh... actually, tomorrow's not good. How about later in the week?
column220: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: Fine.
column221: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Good. Okay.
column222: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Hey! Wait. How about a group picture while you're here?
column223: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Photographer: I can't. I only get reimbursed for the I.D. photos.
column224: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Well... that's... what, a computer camera, right?
column225: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Photographer: You mean digital?
column226: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: It'll take like two seconds.
column227: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Photographer: 20 bucks.
column228: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Ugh... All right. Everybody, [looks around at the employees] come on. Group photo for the newsletter.
column229: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Stanley: You gotta be kiddin' me.
column230: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Come on, everybody.
column231: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Dwight: Come on, let's go. Creed, Kevin, Oscar... andale! Let's go.
column232: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Photographer: One, two, three... smile. [camera flashes, but no one smiles] Try to smile.
column233: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: We resolved a lot today, everybody. Think happy thoughts.
column234: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Photographer: Alright, I'm just gonna take it on three... whether you smile or not. One, two, three. [camera flashes]
column235: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: Good, let's check that out. [looks at preview screen] Ew, okay, all right. One more. We'll take one more.
column236: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Photographer: That'll be another 20.
column237: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: What?
column238: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: Angela, I want to talk to you about something.
column239: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [off camera] You just press the button.
column240: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Angela: What?
column241: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: No, Pam.
column242: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: [looks at to Jim] I am. [looks at Angela] It's about the Save The Date.
column243: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Pam, it wasn't her.
column244: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: What?!
column245: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: I'm the one who complained about you.
column246: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: I... I didn't know that Toby was gonna write it down. [the camera flashes] I was just venting.
column247: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [off camera] Okay, good. Check that out.
column248: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: You know, it was one day.
column249: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [off camera] That's terrible.
column250: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: And I took it right back. It was like...
column251: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Pam: Okay.
column252: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Phyllis: Oh, dear.
column253: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [off camera] Let's pay Mr. Price Gouger. [rejoins the group, on camera] Okay... we can do this. Come on, everybody. All right. Here we go. [flash goes off before he sits down]
column254: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: It was really hard getting a good picture of fifteen people. He would not give me a good discount. And eight tries added up.
column255: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: [flashback the photo being taken] One, two..[flash goes off] Didn't say three, did I?
column256: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: But, I'm sort of an expert at Photoshop, so it turned out fine in the end. When people work together, there is going to be conflict. You can't outrun your problems.
column257: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: [on Pam's answering machine] Hey, Pam... it's Jim. Um, I have a doctor's appointment in the city. So I probably won't be in till the late afternoon. Just thought I'd let you know. Okay, bye. [camera shows Jim sitting on a waiting coach in another Dunder Mifflin office]
column258: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Female worker: Okay, Jan will see you now.
column259: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Jim: Oh, thanks.
column260: 02x21 - Conflict Resolution;Michael: And that is why the idea of a cage match is so universally appealing. But here's the thing about cage matches: sometimes you have to open the cage. And that is something Toby will never understand.

column1: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Tonight the Scranton Business Park is having Casino Night and we are converting our warehouse into a full-blown gambling hall. And I know it's illegal in Pennsylvania, but it's for charity. And I consider myself a great philanderer. It's just... It's nice to know at the end of the day, I can look in the mirror and say, "Michael, because of you, some little kid in the Congo has a belly full of rice this evening." Makes you feel good.
column2: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Excuse me. How long is the wait for a table for two?
column3: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: I would never, ever serve you. Not in a million, billion years.
column4: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: It's a nice tux.
column5: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: I know. It belonged to my grandfather. He was buried in it, so family heirloom.
column6: 02x22 - Casino Night;Roy: So, what's the deal? We gotta pay for our own drinks? That's lame.
column7: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Come on, it'll be fun, and besides, I'm a roulette expert.
column8: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Impossible. Roulette is not a game of skill, it is a game of chance.
column9: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: I can always kind of win at roulette.
column10: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Oh, really? Mmm-hmm.
column11: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Yeah.
column12: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: How would you do that?
column13: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Mind control.
column14: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: [laughs] You can't be serious. Are you serious?
column15: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Ever since I was a little kid, like, eight or nine, I could sort of control things with my mind.
column16: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: I don't believe you. Continue.
column17: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: It was just little thing, you know, like I could make something shake or I could make a marble fall off the counter. You know, just little things.
column18: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: [scoffs] That's ridiculous. You know what? Uh... Why don't you move that coat rack? Excuse me, everyone! Attention in the office, please. Jim is about to prove his telekinetic powers and he needs absolute silence. Go ahead.
column19: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Okay, I'll try. [The coat rack wobbles] [Pam holds up an umbrella handle to the camera in another scene]
column20: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Oh, my God.
column21: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: I try not to think of it as lagging behind. It's more of a David-and-Goliath thing.
column22: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: [on phone] Yeah, but... Well, the fact of the matter is that your branch is currently number four of the five branches that I oversee.
column23: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Top 80 percent!
column24: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Michael?
column25: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Yeah?
column26: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: You know that I'm very serious here.
column27: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Jan, listen, I promise that I will kick it up a notch. Bam!
column28: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: What?
column29: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Emeril. Oh, actually, while I have you, not that I have you or have ever had you, but we're having our Casino Night tonight and I think everyone would love to see their fearless leader here.
column30: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: I thought that you were their fearless leader.
column31: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: I am, but you are the Eva Peron to my Cesar Chavez.
column32: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: [laughs] I think you can handle it.
column33: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Oh, come on. Come on.
column34: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: I think so, Michael...
column35: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: You know, it'd be fun. I can hear it in your voice. You need a break.
column36: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Goodbye, Michael.
column37: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Jan and I understand each other. The romance thing is sort of on hold for the time being, but we've remained good friends. Good friends with privileges. Not now, some day.
column38: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Okay, everybody. Tonight's event is to benefit the Boy Scouts of America.
column39: 02x22 - Casino Night;Oscar: Again? We do that every year.
column40: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Well, they need our money. They don't have cookies like the Girl Scouts.
column41: 02x22 - Casino Night;Oscar: It'd be nice to do something for people who are actually suffering.
column42: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Well, Oscar, if you don't like it, then you should concentrate on winning. Because the person at the end of the evening with the highest chip count will receive $500 to donate to the charity of their choice. And they will get a mini-fridge compliments of Vance Refrigeration.
column43: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Yes!
column44: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: So get your charities in to Pam. I, for example, am playing for Comic Relief.
column45: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: That doesn't exist anymore.
column46: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Comedy is very much alive, as are homeless people.
column47: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: No, they stopped making that show.
column48: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Well, then, they need our money more than ever.
column49: 02x22 - Casino Night;Angela: You have to pick an approved, non-profit organization.
column50: 02x22 - Casino Night;Creed: There's a great soup kitchen in downtown Scranton. Delicious pea soup on Thursdays. I'll probably give the money to them.
column51: 02x22 - Casino Night;Kevin: Something with animals. Or people.
column52: 02x22 - Casino Night;Kelly: Kobe Bryant has a foundation, and he is so hot. And he gave his wife the biggest diamond ring. I know he didn't do it. ...Maybe he did it.
column53: 02x22 - Casino Night;Angela: We are giving money that has been gambled. Why don't we just deal drugs or prostitute ourselves, and donate that money to charity?
column54: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Oh, and another fun thing. We, at the end of the night, are going to give the check to an actual group of Boy Scouts. Right, Toby? We're gonna...
column55: 02x22 - Casino Night;Toby: Actually, I didn't think it was appropriate to invite children since it's... You know, there's gambling and alcohol, and it's in our dangerous warehouse and it's a school night... And, you know, Hooters is catering. You know, is that enough? Should I keep going?
column56: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Why are you the way that you are? Honestly, every time I try to do something fun or exciting, you make it not... that way. I hate so much about the things that you choose to be. Okay, you know what? I will not donate my winnings to Comic Relief, since apparently it doesn't exist. I am going to donate to Afghanistanis with AIDS.
column57: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: I think you mean the aid to Afghanistan.
column58: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: No, I mean Afghanistanis with AIDS.
column59: 02x22 - Casino Night;Phyllis: Afghani.
column60: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: What?
column61: 02x22 - Casino Night;Phyllis: Afghani.
column62: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: That's a dog.
column63: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: No, that's Afghan.
column64: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: That's a shawl.
column65: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Wait, canine AIDS?
column66: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: No. Humans with AIDS.
column67: 02x22 - Casino Night;Creed: Who has AIDS?
column68: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Guys, the Afghanistananies.
column69: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Okay, you know what? No. No. AIDS is not funny. Believe me, I have tried.
column70: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: There are certain topics that are off-limits to comedians, JFK, AIDS, the Holocaust. The Lincoln Assassination just recently became funny. "I need to see this play like I need a hole in the head." [laughs] And I hope to someday live in a world where a person could tell a hilarious AIDS joke. It's one of my dreams.
column71: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: What are you doing?
column72: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Oh, nothing.
column73: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: "Till Death Do Us Rock."
column74: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: They're wedding bands.
column75: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Oh.
column76: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Roy was supposed to pick the band, but he's concentrating more on the bachelor party now.
column77: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Wait, wait, where you going? I mean, even if you don't hire a band, you still have to watch the bands. Pam, these are people who have never given up on their dreams. I have great respect for that. And, yes, they're all probably very bad and that will make me feel better about not having dreams.
column78: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: There's a KISS cover band in here.
column79: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Let's do it.
column80: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: I'm pretty happy these days. I'm getting married soon and I'm getting along with everybody at work.
column81: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Why did I talk to Jan about transferring? Well, you know... I have no future here.
column82: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: I have already put down the deposit. Do you understand how a deposit works?
column83: 02x22 - Casino Night;Darryl: Mike, I am not having fire-eaters in a paper warehouse.
column84: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: It's Casino Night like Las Vegas. There are fire-eaters all over the place.
column85: 02x22 - Casino Night;Darryl: Except my warehouse.
column86: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Well, actually, it's my warehouse.
column87: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Actually, it's owned by Beakman Properties, and Dunder Mifflin is four years into a seven-year lease.
column88: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Why are you here?
column89: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: When Darryl was coming, you said you wanted me here for protection.
column90: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Not. I said, not that.
column91: 02x22 - Casino Night;Darryl: We just have a lot of stuff down there that could be stolen.
column92: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: That's ironic.
column93: 02x22 - Casino Night;Darryl: What?
column94: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: That you are afraid.
column95: 02x22 - Casino Night;Darryl: Why? 'Cause I'm from the hood?
column96: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Dinkin' flicka.
column97: 02x22 - Casino Night;Darryl: [sighs] Dinkin' flicka.
column98: 02x22 - Casino Night;Darryl: I taught Mike some, uh, phrases to help with his interracial conversations. You know, stuff like, "Fleece it out." "Going mach five." "Dinkin' flicka." You know, things us Negroes say.
column99: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Give me some. [Michael and Darryl perform simultaneous hand gesture]
column100: 02x22 - Casino Night;Darryl: Oh, yeah, I taught him a handshake, too.
column101: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: [Jim ejects a videotape from the VCR and puts in a new one] Wow. I don't know how you're gonna decide. They are all extremely good.
column102: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: I think I should hire them all. Do like Lollapalooza.
column103: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Yes.
column104: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Have three stages, yeah.
column105: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Your mom would love that. She would. Oh, this band is called Scrantonicity.
column106: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Oh.
column107: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Let's take a look. Nice.
column108: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Oh, wait. That's Kevin. On the drums.
column109: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: What?
column110: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: On the drums! On the drums!
column111: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Oh, my God, that's Kevin! Great song, Kev. Oh, my God, he's the drummer and the singer.
column112: 02x22 - Casino Night;Kevin: We really don't do a lot of weddings. We actually don't play in public very often. We are all really hoping that Pam's wedding works out. This could be a turning point for the band.
column113: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Wow. Oh!
column114: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Oh, my...
column115: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Yeah, you haven't seen that since 1983. That is amazing. Okay, we have to sign him. I'm gonna call the label, we're gonna...
column116: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: No! No!
column117: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: No, Pam, you're gonna lose him to another wedding.
column118: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: No, come back! No, no, no!
column119: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Kev!
column120: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Jim is great. Being with him just takes away all the stress of planning my wedding.
column121: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: [phone rings] Yes
column122: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: [phone rings] Michael, Carol Stills for you.
column123: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Who?
column124: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Carol Stills.
column125: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Do I know a Carol Stills?
column126: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Your realtor.
column127: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Oh, yeah, put her through. Hey Carol, how goes the real estate biz? Is it real good?
column128: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: It's still me.
column129: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Sometimes I don't put Michael through until he's already said something. I look at it as a practice run for him. He usually does better on the second attempt.
column130: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Carol, you're on with Michael.
column131: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: [on phone] Hello, Michael?
column132: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Hi, Carol. How you doing?
column133: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: I'm great. I just needed one last signature for your mortgage insurance.
column134: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Oh, hey, no problemo. Incidentally, I love the place.
column135: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: Oh, great.
column136: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Great. It has a little bit of a weird smell. It's okay. At Christmas, the tree helped.
column137: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: Oh, good, I'm glad. Can I drop it over later?
column138: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Actually, I'm sort of hosting this charity thing in our warehouse, Casino Night.
column139: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: Oh, great.
column140: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Yeah, it'll be good. You know what? Why don't you come by? Bring the papers, I'll sign them and then you can stay and have a drink.
column141: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: To the casino thing?
column142: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Yeah. It'll be fun. What do you...[phone rings] What do you...
column143: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: What?
column144: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Oh, I'm sorry. Could you hold on? Yes?
column145: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Michael, Jan's on line two.
column146: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Okay, put her through. [Deep voice] Jan Levinson, I presume?
column147: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: It's still me. Uh, Jan, here's Michael.
column148: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Michael?
column149: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Hey, Jan. How you doing?
column150: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: You know, I... I thought about it and you are right.
column151: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: I am?
column152: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: I could use a little fun. So, I am going to drive up for your Casino Night.
column153: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Oh, okay.
column154: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Incidentally, what is the charity?
column155: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: AIDS.
column156: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Okay, then. I will see you tonight.
column157: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Okay, sounds great.
column158: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Bye-bye.
column159: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Bye Hello, Carol? Hi, sorry about that. I just...
column160: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: No problemo.
column161: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Right.
column162: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: To answer your question...
column163: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Yeah?
column164: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: Yes.
column165: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: What?
column166: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: I'd love to go.
column167: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Okay.
column168: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: I have to get a sitter, but that shouldn't be a problem.
column169: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Problem. Good.
column170: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: And I'll bring the papers, too.
column171: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Good, All right. Sounds great.
column172: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: I'll see you tonight.
column173: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Bye.
column174: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: Bye.
column175: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Two queens on Casino Night. I am going to drop a deuce on everybody.
column176: 02x22 - Casino Night;
column177: 02x22 - Casino Night;
column178: 02x22 - Casino Night;
column179: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: [People playing casino games as the actual Casino Night begins] Oh, my God!
column180: 02x22 - Casino Night;Roy: Yeah! That's great.
column181: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Hey, hey.
column182: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: Hi.
column183: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Hey, Carol.
column184: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: Hi.
column185: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: You look great.
column186: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: Thanks. Thank you for inviting me. It looks so great in here.
column187: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Oh, well... Kiss. [Michael kisses her on the cheek, pauses and then kisses her on the other cheek] That's how we do it in the paper biz. It's European and... Yes? Ah, Dwight [Kisses cheeks]
column188: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Code name Re/Max is here. No sign of Lan Jevinson.
column189: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: I'm Michael's wingman. I've got his back. Two dates. He's got two dates tonight. My job is to keep Jan away from Carol and vice versa. Michael said, "We must deceive them, so as not to hurt them, and in that way, we honor them."
column190: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Can I get you a drink? The food is from Hooters.
column191: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: Drink would be good.
column192: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Okay.
column193: 02x22 - Casino Night;Creed: Oh, I steal things all the time. It's just something I do. I stopped caring a long time ago. You should see how many supplies I've taken from this place. Honestly, I love stealing things.
column194: 02x22 - Casino Night;Billy's Girlfriend: I'm gonna get a drink. Do you need anything?
column195: 02x22 - Casino Night;Billy: No, I'm fine. Thank's sweetheart.
column196: 02x22 - Casino Night;Billy's Girlfriend: Okay.
column197: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Billy, your nurse is hot.
column198: 02x22 - Casino Night;Billy: That's my girlfriend.
column199: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Your nurse became your girlfriend? Sweet.
column200: 02x22 - Casino Night;Billy: She was never my nurse. I met her at Chili's. She was my waitress.
column201: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Chili's is great.
column202: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Welkommen, Bienvenue, and welcome to Monte Carlo! Dwight. I am no longer your boss. Lady Fortune is your boss.
column203: 02x22 - Casino Night;Stanley: [Under his breath] Will Lady Fortune give me a raise?
column204: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Shut it, shut it, shut it. Will Lady Fortune be your mistress? Only time will tell, my friends. Leave all your preconceived notions about casinos at the door. Old friends, new lovers, and the disabled! Welcome all! Great, okay. Shuffle up and deal. Let's get it started! Black-Eyed Crows.
column205: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dealer: Okay, the game is No-Limit Texas Hold'em. Good luck, everybody. That's at least four red chips to you, sir.
column206: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: All-in. [Other players fold their hands]
column207: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Bluffing is a key part of poker, which is too bad, because I'm not very good at bluffing. Did you believe me?
column208: 02x22 - Casino Night;Toby: I'll call.
column209: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: What are... That's insane.
column210: 02x22 - Casino Night;Toby: I have good cards.
column211: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Well, Toby, I went all-in on the first hand, so doesn't that tell you that I might have good cards, too? So don't be stupid. Just take it back.
column212: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dealer: No, I'm sorry. He can't, sir. He's gone all-in.
column213: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Okay, all right, whatever.
column214: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dealer: Flip them.
column215: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: You really screwed that up. [Michael leaves]
column216: 02x22 - Casino Night;Meredith: Wow.
column217: 02x22 - Casino Night;Toby: I don't really play cards, but I'm not gonna lie to you. It felt really good to take money from Michael. Gonna chase that feeling.
column218: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: I expect to do very well tonight. I have an acute ability to read people. Jim, for instance, has a huge tell. When he gets a good hand, he coughs.
column219: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: [coughs] I will raise. [Dwight sighs and folds his cards] Thanks.
column220: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: It's the weirdest thing. Every time I cough, he folds.
column221: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: Wow, bad luck.
column222: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Yeah, whatever. Hey, you know what? If luck weren't involved, I would always be winning. [Sees Jan] Oh, my God. Oh, my God.
column223: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Michael?
column224: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Jan.
column225: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Hi.
column226: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Look, okay, I think we're all adults here, and it has always been my understanding that we have an open relationship.
column227: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: What are you... Just... Wait, what're you talking about?
column228: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: What does that mean?
column229: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: After you said you weren't coming, I invited Carol to come and I don't think that I did anything wrong.
column230: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: No. No, you didn't. Hi, I'm Jan. I'm Michael's boss.
column231: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: Hi, hi.
column232: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Does anyone want a drink?
column233: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: No, I'm good.
column234: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Okay. [Carol stares at Michael]
column235: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Um...
column236: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Hey, hey.
column237: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Hey. What...
column238: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Jan's here.
column239: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Give me the dice.
column240: 02x22 - Casino Night;Kevin: Come on, Dwight.
column241: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Let's go.
column242: 02x22 - Casino Night;Billy: It's all on you, baby. Let's go.
column243: 02x22 - Casino Night;Angela: Good evening, Dwight. What is this?
column244: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Evening, Angela. This is craps. I need to roll an eight. If I do, everyone wins.
column245: 02x22 - Casino Night;Kevin: Yes.
column246: 02x22 - Casino Night;Angela: Then roll an eight.
column247: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Thank you, Angela.
column248: 02x22 - Casino Night;Angela: Good luck, Dwight.
column249: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Yeah! Yeah! [Kisses Angela, she slaps him and walks away smiling]
column250: 02x22 - Casino Night;Kevin: Dwight, let's keep it going. Let's keep it going. Let's go.
column251: 02x22 - Casino Night;Oscar: Let it ride. Let it all ride.
column252: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Give me the dice!
column253: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Yeah, right.
column254: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: "Yeah, right," what?
column255: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: What was this? [Makes face]
column256: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: [Laughs] I have good cards.
column257: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Really?
column258: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Mhmm, And I'm gonna take you all-in.
column259: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Wow. I think you're bluffing.
column260: 02x22 - Casino Night;Kevin: Yeah, I think she's full of it.
column261: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Straight.
column262: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Oh. Three nines.
column263: 02x22 - Casino Night;Kevin: Pam. Jim Halpert, ladies and gentlemen.
column264: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Thank you very much. It was fun.
column265: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Cosmopolitan, please.
column266: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: Can I get a red wine? So, two hours? That's a long drive.
column267: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Well, it's part of the job, you know? Keep an eye on things. So... Why not? So, how long have you and Michael been...
column268: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: Oh, well, actually, I guess this would be our first date. I guess.
column269: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Casino Night in the warehouse. Good sport.
column270: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: Well, I'm having a nice time.
column271: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Oh, me too. Me too.
column272: 02x22 - Casino Night;Ryan: One beer and one Seven and Seven with eight maraschino cherries, sugar on the rim, blended if you can.
column273: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: So, that's still going on, huh? You and Kelly?
column274: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: All right!
column275: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dealer: The point is four. Shooter, roll it. Four!
column276: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Come on, shooter!
column277: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Four! [Holds dice in front of Carol] Blow. Blow for luck! Yeah! Also, you. Not playing favorites. [Holds dice in front of Jan] All right, here we go!
column278: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: All right.
column279: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Yeah!
column280: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dealer: Five.
column281: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: So close. So close.
column282: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Come on. [Turns to Jan] So where you staying? Radisson?
column283: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: What?
column284: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Super 8?
column287: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: I didn't... I don't know...
column288: 02x22 - Casino Night;Dwight: Holiday Inn? The Hyatt in Wilkes-Barre? You staying with Michael?
column289: 02x22 - Casino Night;Kevin: I won the 2002 $2,500 No-Limit Deuce-to-Seven-Draw Tournament at the World Series of Poker in Vegas. So, yeah... I'm pretty good at poker.
column291: 02x22 - Casino Night;Phyllis: Okay, let's do it.
column292: 02x22 - Casino Night;Bob Vance: Good Luck, honey.
column293: 02x22 - Casino Night;Phyllis: Oh, thank you, Bobby. But it doesn't matter, it's just fun to play.
column296: 02x22 - Casino Night;Phyllis: I have an ace.
column297: 02x22 - Casino Night;Oscar: No, that's a flush.
column299: 02x22 - Casino Night;Phyllis: Oh, I have a flush!
column301: 02x22 - Casino Night;Phyllis: Look, I won! Look I have all the clovers! You wanna play again?
column303: 02x22 - Casino Night;Roy: She took you down, huh?
column304: 02x22 - Casino Night;Kevin: I do not want to talk about it.
column305: 02x22 - Casino Night;Roy: Hey, I saw your tape. Your band, Scrantonicity? You guys rock.
column307: 02x22 - Casino Night;Roy: Yeah, you guys wanna play our wedding?
column308: 02x22 - Casino Night;Kevin: Awesome. Did Pam say it was okay?
column309: 02x22 - Casino Night;Roy: Whatever. I'm in charge of the music.
column310: 02x22 - Casino Night;Kevin: Dude, you will not be sorry.
column314: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: No, thanks. You having fun?
column315: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Fabulous time. I drove two and a half hours to get here.
column316: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Yeah, we all really...
column317: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Left work early, drove down here. And I am completely underdressed
column318: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Well, I think you look great.
column319: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Why did I hook up with Michael?
column320: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Yeah, why did you?
column321: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: It was very late, Jim. Very... Very late and... Have you given any more thought to the transfer?
column323: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Good. Have you told anyone?
column326: 02x22 - Casino Night;Bob: Excuse me. Big moment. The evening's chip leader and winner of this beautiful mini-refrigerator courtesy of Vance Refrigeration, Creed Bratton, Dunder Mifflin!
column327: 02x22 - Casino Night;Creed: Thanks. I never owned a refrigerator.
column328: 02x22 - Casino Night;Roy: Sorry, babe. I am just beat.
column329: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: It's okay. I'll see you at home.
column330: 02x22 - Casino Night;Roy: Okay. Hey, don't try to lose too much money, all right?
column332: 02x22 - Casino Night;Roy: If you still want a honeymoon. Hey, Halpert. Keep an eye on her, all right?
column336: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Hey, how's it going?
column337: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Good, especially after I took all your money in poker.
column338: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Yeah. Hey, can I talk to you about something?
column339: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: About when you want to give me more of your money?
column341: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Did you wanna do that now? We can go inside. I'm feeling kind of good tonight.
column342: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: I was just... I'm in love with you.
column344: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: I'm really sorry if that's weird for you to hear, but I needed you to hear it. Probably not good timing, I know that. I just...
column345: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: What are you doing? What do you expect me to say to that?
column346: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: I just needed you to know. Once.
column347: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: Well, I um... I... I can't.
column349: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: You have no idea...
column351: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: ...what your friendship means to me.
column352: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Come on. I don't wanna do that. I wanna be more than that.
column353: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: I can't. I'm really sorry if you misinterpreted things. It's probably my fault.
column354: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jim: Not your fault. I'm sorry I misinterpreted our friendship.
column357: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: So, I just wanted to congratulate you on a fantastic evening. You did the company proud.
column359: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: And thanks for inviting me. You were right, I needed it. So, thanks.
column360: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Okay. Thanks for coming.
column361: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: Nice to meet you.
column363: 02x22 - Casino Night;Jan: And you guys have a good time together.
column364: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Okay. Talk to you Monday.
column367: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Good night. She's a good boss.
column368: 02x22 - Casino Night;Carol: She seems really nice.
column370: 02x22 - Casino Night;Michael: Love triangle. Drama. All worked out in the end, though. The hero got the girl. Who saw that coming? I did. And Jan was really happy for me. So actually the hero got two girls. He got the girl that he works with and he got the girl that he buys real estate from. So, I've got my New York girl and my local flavor. Life is good.
column371: 02x22 - Casino Night;Pam: [On phone] About 10 minutes ago. No, I didn't know what to say. Yes, I know. Um, I don't know, mom, he's my best friend. Yeah, he's great. Yeah, I think I am. [Jim enters] I have to go. I will. Listen, Jim... [They kiss]

column1: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;[ The Accountants, Webisode 01 - "The Books Don't Balance" ]
column2: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Jan: Okay. So what is it that you wanted to talk to me about?
column3: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Well, we've been trying to balance the books for a week now, and for some reason, they're not balancing.
column4: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Jan: I'm sorry?
column5: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: There's about $3,000 missing, and we're trying to figure out where it went.
column6: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Jan: Well, it's probably just some accounting error.
column7: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: It is not an accounting error.
column8: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Jan: Well, it could be...
column9: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: It is not an accounting error. Well, it's not my accounting error.
column10: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: This is the first I've heard of it. They never tell me anything. I like it that way.
column11: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Jan: Obviously we do need to find it quickly to ensure that it's not a criminal action.
column12: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Absolutely, Jan.
column13: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Jan: But... I guess that's it. So, call me when you have news. Okay?
column14: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Okay.
column15: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Michael said to stop by on your way out. [door bangs]
column16: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: I'm pretty sure Michael's involved because every other time there's been money missing from the office, it's always been Michael. Except, he's usually really obvious. Like, he'll say he spent $50 on a lunch with a client, and he'll submit a receipt from J. Crew.
column17: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Are we absolutely sure it's not an accounting error?
column18: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: I went over my books three times.
column19: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Me, too.
column20: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Has anyone in the office bought anything nice recently?
column21: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: That's a very nice watch, Oscar.
column22: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Yes, it is. My grandfather left it to me when he died.
column23: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: I've never seen it before. He must have died very recently.
column24: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Yes, he did, actually. About three weeks ago.
column25: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;[ The Accountants, Webisode 02 - "Phyllis" ]
column26: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Phyllis: You guys wanted to see me?
column27: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Yeah.
column28: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Hi, Phyllis. Um, we're going over everyone's expenses for the year. It's just standard procedure.
column29: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: We're missing $3,000 and we're trying to figure out where it went. Michael is the obvious suspect, but he is the boss, so we have to at least pretend to ask other people first.
column30: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: So, I know the answer's probably "no," but did you take any money, or buy anything with company money or anything like that?
column31: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Oh, my God.
column32: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: I knew it.
column33: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: You did?
column34: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Phyllis: Well, about three months ago, I was on a sales call and I broke the heel on my shoe and I only had the corporate card. I'm really sorry.
column35: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Well, how much was that?
column36: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Phyllis: $14.
column37: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: We're talking more like $3,000.
column38: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Phyllis: $3,000? That wasn't me.
column39: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: No. We didn't think it was.
column40: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Phyllis: It will never happen again. My boyfriend, Bob Vance, from Vance Refrigeration gave me a Vance Refrigeration credit card. Only for emergencies.
column41: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: An emergency like, you have an ice cream cake, and you're in the sun, and it's melting?
column42: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: You don't use it to buy refrigerators, Kevin!
column43: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Don't yell at me.
column44: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Okay. Thank you, Phyllis.
column45: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Phyllis: Okay.
column46: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;[ The Accountants, Webisode 03 - "Meredith" ]
column47: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: So, is there anything you want to tell us about? Accounting-wise?
column48: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Meredith: Gosh, I don't think so.
column49: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: We're trying to find out who stole money from the company.
column50: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: It's better to be embarrassed by the truth now, then to go to jail for it later.
column51: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Why don't we just ask her if she took the $3,000?
column52: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Idiot. Now we don't have the element of surprise. It's impossible to trap her, and we won't be able to register the look on her face when we ask her if she stole $3,000.
column53: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Meredith: You think I stole $3,000?
column54: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Oh, we know you did... or someone else did.
column55: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Did you use any company money for anything? We're just trying to balance the books.
column56: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Meredith: Please. If I stole $3,000, I wouldn't be here. I'd be on a beach in Jamaica drinking Red Stripe.
column57: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Oh, I love Red Stripe.
column58: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: I do, too. That's Jamaican beer?
column59: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Meredith: Yeah. We should go out and get a beer after work. Or, hey, you want to go right now?
column60: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: It's 11:15.
column61: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Meredith: Yeah. So, that's too early?
column62: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: You didn't take any money at all? You're sure?
column63: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Meredith: Yes. I'm a single mom. I would never do anything to jeopardize my kid.
column64: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: I thought you had two kids.
column65: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Meredith: My ex-husband took Wendy, the good one.
column66: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Okay. Thanks for your time.
column67: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Meredith: Sure.
column68: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Thanks, Meredith.
column69: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Meredith: You guys want to get that beer?
column70: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;[ The Accountants, Webisode 04 - "Stanley" ]
column71: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Stanley: Somebody stole some money. That is fantastic. How much did they get?
column72: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: $3,000.
column73: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: We're in the process of interviewing everyone in the office. I think it's kind of fun. It's a great chance to catch up with people.
column74: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: I'm sure it's not you, but we have to ask.
column75: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Stanley: I hope they bought something nice, and I hope you never catch them.
column76: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: We'd appreciate your cooperation if you find out who did it.
column77: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Stanley: I'll tell you what, if I find out who did it, I will shake their hand, pat them on the back, give them 72 hours to get out of the country, and then I'll let you know who it is. Is there anything else?
column78: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: No. Okay. Thanks for your help.
column79: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Stanley: Thank you.
column80: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: I don't think it was him.
column81: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Really, genius?
column82: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Angela thinks it's an insult when she calls me a genius, all sarcastic and whatnot, but technically, guess what? I am a genius. When I was a kid, I took an IQ test and I scored over 100. So, joke is on you, Angela.
column83: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: [sighs] All right. Who should we ask next?
column84: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: I don't know.
column85: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: You know, my mom picks the worst times to visit.
column86: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Why? What's going on?
column87: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Well, my mom's in town, but a bunch of my friends are in town, too, and we were going to go watch The Prince of Tides.
column88: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Why?
column89: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Well, we don't like it. We make fun of it. It's like a Rocky Horror Picture thing we do.
column90: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: All right.
column91: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: But, my mom's in town, so I can't go.
column92: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Can we focus, please?
column93: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: I've never seen it.
column94: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Kevin, it's really bad.
column95: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;[ The Accountants, Webisode 05 - "Someone in the Warehouse" ]
column96: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: I really don't think it was anyone in the office.
column97: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: It had to have been someone.
column98: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Yeah, I do think it's someone in this office, which really breaks my heart, to tell you the truth. Because I thought we were all good people here.
column99: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Maybe it was someone in the warehouse.
column100: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Who?
column101: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Maybe it was Roy. He's getting married. He can use the money.
column102: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Roy wouldn't do it.
column103: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: How do you know?
column104: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: He wouldn't do it. He has too much character.
column105: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: You have a crush on Roy.
column106: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: I do not. That is inaprobable... inappropriate.
column107: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: You have a crush on Roy. Unbelievable.
column108: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Stop it! Stop it right now!
column109: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Does he excite you? Does he get your blood flowing? [Oscar growls]
column110: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Kevin...
column111: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Does he get your... [Oscar growls]
column112: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Kevin, you guys don't know anything.
column113: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: [singing] Roy and Angela sitting in a tree K-I-S
column114: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Kevin, cut it out!
column115: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: We don't think it was you.
column116: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: No.
column117: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: But we have to ask everybody if you used any money to buy anything and forgot to report it, or...
column118: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Roy: Well, I mean, how would I do that even if I wanted to?
column119: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: You would have to take some from petty cash.
column120: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Roy: Well, I don't even know where that is.
column121: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: In Oscar's drawer.
column122: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Roy: Isn't it locked?
column123: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Well, he keeps the key behind his computer...
column124: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Kevin, why are you giving him instructions on how to steal?
column125: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Roy: Wait, hold on. I'd never do something like that. It's wrong. I don't steal things.
column126: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Well, I'm satisfied. So, thank you very much for your time, Roy.
column127: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Oh, Roy, one more question. What do you think of Angela?
column128: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: You don't have to answer that one.
column129: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: But you can if you want to.
column130: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: But you don't have to.
column131: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;
column132: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;
column133: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;
column134: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;[ The Accountants, Webisode 06 - "The Memo" ]
column135: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: So, it isn't Phyllis, it isn't Stanley or Jim, it isn't Meredith, it isn't any of us.
column136: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: We don't know that.
column137: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Oh, come on.
column138: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: I didn't steal $3,000 from petty cash. I am not stupid. If I wanted to steal from this company, there are a lot of easier ways to do it. For example, I could seal people's coats and sell them on eBay.
column139: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: It obviously isn't Dwight because he has the most integrity of anyone in the office. [both Oscar and Kevin glance over to the camera] What? Did you talk to Kelly?
column140: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Yes. She said she didn't do it, then 45 minutes later the conversation ended.
column141: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: I talked to Creed, and he said he didn't do it. And then he tried to sell me dietary supplements.
column142: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Okay, enough of this investigation stuff. We just have to put a memo to the office and ask that someone come forward anonymously.
column143: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Fine. I'll write it.
column144: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: No, I wanna write it.
column145: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: No.
column146: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: No. Angela, you never let me write accounting memos.
column147: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Fine. I'll supervise.
column148: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Yeah. [Oscar bumps into Kevin as they leave the conference room] God.
column149: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: The date should be right-justified. [keys pounding] Right-justified, not left-justified. Do you know what "justified" means?
column150: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Yeah, as in "justifiable homicide."
column151: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: "To whom it may concern?" Really, Kevin? Really?
column152: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Fine, then you write it.
column153: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Thank you, it's just easier this way.
column154: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: I finished my own memo. [The memo reads: "Tuesday To Whom it May Concern: ANGELA STINKS. Kevin Malone, Accounting"] Angela stinks. I mean, I'm not handing it out or anything. And don't tell her I said it. It's just for me. In fact, forget that I said anything about it, ever. Oh, God. What have I done? [groans]
column155: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;[ The Accountants, Webisode 07 - "Things Are Getting Tense" ]
column156: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: We are missing $3,000. Things are getting tense.
column157: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Wait. Here, I found it! Here it is! $2,800 returned to petty cash. Angela, I forgot to sign in the money.
column158: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Okay. Yeah.
column159: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: It's got to be it.
column160: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Oops. Um, I took that and then I briefly lost it, but then the Pistons beat the Cavs, and so now I'm returning it all back. Go Pistons. But this is completely unrelated to the other $3,000.
column161: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: You gambled petty cash?
column162: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Yeah, but I won, didn't I?
column163: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: That's not the point. How are we supposed to believe you didn't take the other $3,000?
column164: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: 'Cause I'm telling you that I didn't.
column165: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: You have to admit, man, this looks a little suspicious.
column166: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Oh, suspicious. Well, how come Angela suddenly has a new necklace, all of a sudden?
column167: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: My friend gave it to me.
column168: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: What friend?
column169: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Diane... Chester... Snydburgh.
column170: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: What? That's not even close to being a real person.
column171: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Well, it's none of your business who gave it to me. But, I didn't steal any money.
column172: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: You guys, this is stupid, that we're turning on each other. That is exactly what they want us to do.
column173: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Who?
column174: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: The guys who stole the money.
column175: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: All right, you know, there's only one more thing to do. We have to investigate Michael.
column176: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;[ The Accountants, Webisode 08 - "You're Mean" ]
column177: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: He is still in there.
column178: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Yeah, we know.
column179: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Basically, we're convinced that Michael took the missing $3,000, so we're waiting until he leaves his office so we can go in and search for evidence. When I say it out loud, it really doesn't seem like a good idea.
column180: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: He said he was leaving right at 5:00.
column181: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: What time is it now?
column182: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: You don't have a watch?
column183: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: It's slow.
