column184: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: You can't look at the clock up there?
column185: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Well, you can't just tell me what time it is?
column186: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: I think people should be self-sufficient.
column187: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: I think you're mean.
column188: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Okay, guys, let's just wait for him to leave.
column189: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: What are you doing tonight? Wanna get a beer?
column190: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: I can't. I have errands to run.
column191: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: What are you doing?
column192: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: I'm going to the mall. I need a new wok. Just stuff like that.
column193: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: What happened to your old wok?
column194: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Nothing. Nothing. I just want a new wok, there's a new one...
column195: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: You know, I'm not mean. I'm just demanding. I'm sorry if I was mean.
column196: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: It's okay.
column197: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Thank you.
column198: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: That was uncomfortable.
column199: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Angela, Angela.
column200: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Shh, shh.
column201: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Okay, let's go.
column202: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: This is so much fun.
column203: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: It's not supposed to be fun. ...Again, sorry.
column204: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: [imitating Animal House's Bluto] Get it?
column205: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: What is it?
column206: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Animal House. You guys are breaking my spirit.
column207: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;[ The Accountants, Webisode 09 - "Michael's Office" ]
column208: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: [in megaphone] Attention! There is a lot of junk in here! Over!
column209: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Don't touch anything. You'll leave fingerprints.
column210: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: You think he's gonna dust for fingerprints?
column211: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: [Kevin blowing train whistle] Stop that.
column212: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Awesome.
column213: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: What are we even looking for?
column214: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Receipts maybe. Any evidence he took the money. Or something worth $3,000.
column215: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Do you think this thing is worth $3,000? It's cool.
column216: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Check this out. "Michael Scott is the proud owner of a quality Seyko timepiece." You think he paid $3,000 for a knock-off of a $40 watch?
column217: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: I'm gonna go on his computer.
column218: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Okay, this drawer is locked. Oscar, do you have a key?
column219: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: No, Kevin, I don't. If I were Michael, where would I hide a key to that drawer? In this drawer. One, two, three, six, nine. Count them. Nine snow globes with Dunder Mifflin logos on them and nothing else.
column220: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: He has a snow-globe drawer.
column221: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: And he keeps it locked.
column222: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: I'd lock it, too. That is very embarrassing.
column223: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Put it back, Kevin. It's not yours.
column224: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: I like it.
column225: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Okay, just go to Quicken, 'cause I setup online checking for him.
column226: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Okay, here we go. Last transaction was $23 to Jack's Joke and Magic Shop.
column227: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: No.
column228: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Go to the beginning of the month.
column229: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Last eight transactions are to Jack's Joke and Magic Shop. [sighs]
column230: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: But what are you doing?
column231: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Paying his electric bill.
column232: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: I do not think you should do that.
column233: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Well, it's about to be shut off.
column234: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Okay. This is pointless. Someone just has to talk to him.
column235: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin and Oscar: [in unison] Not it.
column236: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Hey, wait. [train whistle blowing] Not it.
column237: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;[ The Accountants, Webisode 10 - "The Best Day of My Life" ]
column238: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Dwight: You're saying Michael stole money from his own company?
column239: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Well, we've asked everyone else.
column240: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Dwight: No! No, that's insane. It has to be somebody else. Like Meredith. Or Creed. No. Meredith, definitely.
column241: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: We asked her. She said she didn't do it.
column242: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Dwight: Which is exactly what you'd say if you did do it. Oh, man! I should've been handling this investigation from the beginning.
column243: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: I believe she didn't do it. Are you doubting me?
column244: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Dwight: No.
column245: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: And here.
column246: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Oh, my God.
column247: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Dwight: There has to be a better explanation.
column248: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: How did he afford that new waterbed he's always bragging about?
column249: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Dwight: He charged it. Discover. Made a little cash back on the deal. Smart. If he were a general in the Army, and you accused him without proof, you would be court-martialed in front of a firing squad.
column250: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: That's not true.
column251: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Dwight: Okay, watch "A Few Good Men" and tell me that that's not true. I own it on DVD if you wanna come by later. "You can't handle the truth." Just kidding, you can.
column252: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Well, Dwight says that Michael didn't take it, but frankly, I think he's hiding something. [clears throat] What?
column253: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: We, uh... We found it.
column254: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: You did? Where?
column255: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: In your books.
column256: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Excuse me?
column257: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: You accidentally logged this equipment depreciation twice.
column258: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Well, that doesn't sound like me.
column259: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Did you let someone else have access to your books?
column260: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Absolutely not.
column261: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Then...
column262: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Oh...
column263: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Yeah. Oh.
column264: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Angela: Very well. Case closed.
column265: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Very well. Very well.
column266: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: Very well.
column267: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Oscar: Very well. [Kevin and Oscar pound their fists together in triumph]
column268: 03x00 - The Accountants Webisodes 1-10;Kevin: This is the best day of my life.

column1: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Ryan: Yeah, I'm not a temp anymore. I got Jim's uh, old job. Which means at my 10 year high school reunion it will not say "Ryan Howard is a temp." It will say "Ryan Howard is a junior sales associate at a mid-range paper supply firm. ...that'll show 'em.
column2: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jim: [after "the kiss"] You have no idea how long I've wanted to do that.
column3: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Pam: Me too. ...I think we're just drunk.
column4: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jim: No I'm not drunk. Are you drunk?
column5: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Pam: No... [Jim leans in for another kiss] Jim---
column6: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jim: Are you really gonna marry him? [Pam nods] ...Ok.
column7: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: [sobbing] Jim is gone. He's gone. I miss him so much. Ooooh I cry myself to sleep, Jim! [serious] False. I do not miss him.
column8: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: No! That is the fun of this place. I call everybody "faggie". Why would anybody find that offensive?
column9: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Toby: OK I think Oscar would just like if you used "lame" or something like that.
column10: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: That's what faggie means!
column11: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Toby: No not really...
column12: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Toby: Apparently you called Oscar "faggie" for liking the movie Shakespeare in Love more than an action movie.
column13: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: It wasn't just an action movie, it was Die Hard!
column14: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Toby: All right Michael, but Oscar's really gay.
column15: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Exactly!
column16: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Toby: I mean for real.
column17: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Yeah, I know.
column18: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Toby: No, I mean he's attracted to other men.
column19: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: OK, a little too far, crossed the line.
column20: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Toby: OK, I am telling you, Oscar is an actual homosexual. Yeah, he told me this morning. And, obviously he hopes he can count on your discretion.
column21: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: I would have never called him that if I knew. You don't... You don't call retarded people "retards". It's bad taste. You call your friends "retards" when they're acting retarded. And I consider Oscar a friend.
column22: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Listen man, I am so sorry. I had no idea.
column23: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: No, it's fine.
column24: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: No. No it's not. I feel terrible about it. I have been calling people "faggie" since I was in junior high, and I have never made this mistake. If I don't know how to behave, it is because I am just so far the opposite way, you know? I'm just... I, I can't even imagine... the... thing. Maybe we could go out for a beer sometime. And you could tell me... how... you do that to another dude.
column25: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: That sounds like a great, wonderful idea, let's do that.
column26: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Angela: [in reference to Oscar being gay] It explains so much.
column27: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: No, I'm not gay. And I don't understand why anyone would think, that I'm gay... if... [sighs] Uh... yeah I'm gay.
column28: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jim: I can't say whether Dunder Mifflin paper is less flammable, sir, but I can assure that it is certainly not more flammable.
column29: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jim: Why did I transfer to Stamford? I think that's pretty obvious. I got promoted! And you can't beat that view... right?
column30: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Andy: Hey, Big Tuna! You're single right?
column31: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jim: Uh-huh, yeah. I am.
column32: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Andy: She's pretty hot huh? [Jim nods] She's completely crazy. Steer clear Big Tuna. Head for open waters.
column33: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jim: OooOK.
column34: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Andy: OooOK.
column35: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jim: I ate a tuna sandwich, on my first day. So, Andy started calling me Big Tuna. ...I don't think any of them actually know my real name.
column36: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Andy: Big Tuna is a super ambitious guy, you know? Cut your throat to get ahead kind of guy, but I mean I'm not threatened by him. I went to Cornell, you ever heard of it? [laughs] I graduated in four years. I never studied once. I was drunk the whole time, and I sang in the acappella group, "Here Comes Treble."
column37: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Josh: So, end of day we are going to have a little diversity policy refresher, because of some more problems at the Scranton branch. And I have a list of business startups I got from the chamber. Yes, I am going to need someone to cold call them.
column38: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jim: Oh, I can do that.
column39: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Karen: Jim's nice enough. I dont... I don't know how well he's fitting in here. He's always looking at the camera like this. [makes classic "Jim"-camera face] What is that?
column40: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Can you tell who's gay and who's not?
column41: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: Of course.
column42: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: What about Oscar?
column43: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: Absolutely not.
column44: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Well, he is.
column45: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: Well, he's not dressed in women's clothes, so...
column46: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: [deep sigh] There could be others... I need to know. I don't want to offend anybody else.
column47: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: You could assume everyone is, and not say anything offensive.
column48: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Yeah, I'm sure everyone would appreciate me treating them like they were gay.
column49: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Hey, what about Angela? She's hard and severe. She could be a gay woman.
column50: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: I really don't think so.
column51: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: I don't know, I can imagine her with another woman, can't you?
column52: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: [creepy smile]
column53: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Do some research. Find out if there's a way to tell by just looking at them.
column54: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: Jim told me you could buy gay-dar online.
column55: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: That's ridiculous.
column56: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: Yeah probably. He didn't tell the truth a lot.
column57: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: [sighs] Let's call him and get the website.
column58: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: Definitely.
column59: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jim: What's gay-dar? Oh, oh, gay-dar, yes! No, uh, I think they have it at Sharper Image. Oh, you know what? I could check for you. No problem. [loudly fake typing] It's sold out! Yeah sorry about that, that's a bummer.
column60: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Well, they're sold out.
column61: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: Damn. [thinks] I'll try Brookstone.
column62: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jim: I miss that.
column63: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Roy: Chicken or fish?
column64: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Pam: [loud sigh] Chicken.
column65: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Roy: So you havin' a good day?
column66: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Pam: Excellent, thanks.
column67: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Roy: Good, glad. OK.
column68: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Pam: Yeah, I didn't go through with the wedding. I got cold feet, a few days before. And I can't really explain it. I just had to get out of that relationship. We still had to pay for all the food. So we froze it. But I'm, I'm doing well. I have my own apartment. I'm taking art classes. And I have lunch for the next five weeks.
column69: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Roy: After Pam dumped me, I um, I kinda stopped taking care of myself there, and uh, I hit bottom when uh, drunk driving arrest. I've been working out and um, you know, I'm not gonna take her for granted. I gotta win her back.
column70: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;
column71: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;
column72: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;
column73: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Stanley: I got them a toaster. They called off the wedding and gave the toaster back to me. I tried to return the toaster to the store, and they said they no longer sold that kind of toaster. So now my house has got two toasters.
column74: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Kelly: That is so cool that you're gay. I totally underestimated you.
column75: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: Yes I'm super cool. I am an accountant at a failing paper supply company, Scranton. Much like, um, sir Ian McClellan.
column76: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Angela: Sure, sometimes I watch Will and Grace... and I want to throw up. It's terribly loud. I do like it sometimes when Harry Connick Jr. is on. He's so talented.
column77: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Andy: OK. Who put my calculator in Jello? Good one. But uh, seriously, guys who did this? Seriously guys, who did this? I need to know who put my calculator in Jello, or I'm gonna lose MY FRICKIN' MIND!
column78: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jan: You know, it's amazing to me that in this day and age, you could be so obtuse about sexual orientation.
column79: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: I watch the L Word. I watch, Queer as F***, so...
column80: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jan: That's not what it's called.
column81: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Toby: OK, Michael, are you aware that you ousted Oscar today?
column82: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: What? What does that even...
column83: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jan: Coming out, is a significant moment for a gay person, and they should be allowed to select the timing and manner of announcing it.
column84: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Well, gay pride, right? Gay pride parade? It's not like gay... shame festival.
column85: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Toby: All right, now Oscar's feeling discriminated against by his co-workers, primarily Angela, and um, that's your fault.
column86: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: I think Angela might be gay. Could Oscar and Angela be having a gay affair? Maybe! Is that what this is about?
column87: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jan: NO!
column88: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: I don't kn--
column89: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jan: No, it's not possible.
column90: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Anything's possible.
column91: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jan: You know, imagine... you were gay.
column92: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: [laughs] Well, I'm not gay Jan, and you should know that better than anybody!
column93: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Jan: Michael, your immaturity is extremely disappointing and may even lead to a lawsuit which is the absolute last thing this company needs right now. Do you understand?
column94: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: The company has made it my responsibility today to put an end to 100,000 years of being weirded out by gays.
column95: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: Am I the first gay man you ever knew?
column96: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Trick question! Cause you can't always tell, so... how would I know. Is that the right answer?
column97: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Pam: Michael, Dwight's looking at gay pornography on his computer.
column98: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: Uh, Michael knows Pam. He asked me to do this just for him. He has his own reasons.
column99: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: [looking at gay p0rn] Nothing wrong with this stuff. At all. This is fine. You know what. Gay p0rn, straight p0rn, it's all goooooood! I don't particularly get into this. But uh, you know what. I totally see the merit! And actually... it is quite beautiful.
column100: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: Ah damn pop-ups.
column101: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: What are you doing?!
column102: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Angela: Watching some of your friends.
column103: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: [yelling] All right, everybody in the conference room! I don't care if you are gay, or straight, or a lesbian, or overweight! JUST GET IN HERE! RIGHT NOW!
column104: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Did you know that gay used to mean happy? When I was growing up it meant lame. And now it means a man, who makes love... to other men.
column105: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: We're all homos! Homosapiens. Gays aren't necessarily who you think they are, people. I mean anybody could be gay. Business-men. Like antique dealers, or hairdressers, or... accountants. Oscar, why don't you take this opportunity to officially come out, to everybody here. However you want to do it. Go ahead. Stand up. I'm doing this for you.
column106: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: Yes I'm gay. And I didn't plan on sharing that part of my life with you today, so, whatever. Can I sit down now?
column107: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Creed:[/b]: I'm not offended by homosexuality. In the sixties I made love to many many women, often outdoors, in the mud and the rain. And it was possible a man slipped in, and there would be no way of knowing.
column108: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Who should be the judges and juries of our society?
column109: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Angela: Judges and juries!
column110: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Yes, that's a good point. She has a good point. Because gay marriage currently is not legal, under U.S. law. I bet a lot of straight men wish that applied to them. So they could go out there and have some torrid unabashed monkey s*x as much as they could. You know? Sounds pretty good, right?
column111: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Kevin:[/b]: That sounds great.
column112: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: I think all the other office gays should identify themselves, or I will do it for them.
column113: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: No one else in this office is gay.
column114: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: What about Phyllis? She makes absolutely no attempt to be feminine!
column115: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Phyllis: I'm getting married to Bob Vance.
column116: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: That's great. Congratulations Phyllis. That is great, and frankly kiiiiiiiind of amazing! [laughs] See? Everybody has a chance!
column117: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: But still, Phyllis, in college? Did you ever experiment with other women? A lot of women do!
column118: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Phyllis: No, you knew me in high school. Course, we all thought you were gay in high school.
column119: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: [laughing] Right! [serious] And I take that as a compliment.
column120: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Phyllis: Well with your ties and your matching socks and ---
column121: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Well, I just like to look good OK, so ---
column122: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: You sound pretty defensive Michael.
column123: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: No, I am just coming out myself. I am coming out hetero!
column124: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: I think the problem with this office is that you are sending mixed signals about my being here.
column125: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: No no no. The only signal that I am sending is[/b]: Gay, good.
column126: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Look, if I was gay, I would be the most flamboyant gay you have ever seen. I would be leading the parade covered in feathers, and just... I would be waving that rainbow flag.
column127: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: I don't think I can work here any longer. This has been the worst, most backwards day of my life.
column128: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: You misunderstand-- OK. You know what, OK. I uh, I'm gonna put my money where my mouth is. You ready? I am going to embrace Oscar. You might want to watch this Angela, because you can't catch anything. Here we go. We are going to make a statement. You and I are going to make a statement together. Oscar is my friend ---
column129: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: I would rather not.
column130: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: ...and I just don't care who sees it, doesn't bother me!
column131: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: No, NO! I don't want to touch you, ever consider that? You're ignorant, and insulting, and small!
column132: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: All right, um... sorry.
column133: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: Michael... I'm sorry. That was a good idea. Come on, come on. [Oscar and Michael hug]
column134: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: [sobbing] I'm sorry I called you faggie. You're not faggie. You're a a good guy.
column135: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: Michael appears to be gay too. And yet he is my friend. I guess I do have a gay friend.
column136: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: [embracing Oscar]You know what, I'm going to raise the stakes. I want you to watch this. And I want you to burn this into your brains. Because this is an image that I want you people to remember for a long time to come. Whenever you come into the office I want you to think about this. [awkwardly kissing Oscar] I did it. See. I'm still here. We're all still here. [everyone claps]
column137: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: [Dwight gets up to kiss Oscar] Oh come on! Dwight! Come on, man!
column138: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: We are not in the playground anymore. There are new rules. We have to be mature. But we can't lose the spirit of child like wonder. What is love... anyway? Maybe it's supposed to break all the rules. Like me and Jan. Or Oscar... and some guy. Life is short. When two people find each other, what should stand in their way?
column139: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: I am glad that today spurred social change. That's part of my job as regional manager. But you know what? Even if it didn't, at least we put this matter to bed. ...that's what she said. Or he said.
column140: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Michael: Oh, there's Gill. Oscar's roommate. I wonder if he knows?
column141: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: I was going to quit. But Jan offered me a three month paid vacation and a company car. All I had to do was sign something saying I won't sue. Gill and I are going to Europe. Kids, sometimes it pays to be gay.
column142: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: [reading the note with the gay-dar] "Hope this helps. -Jim" Nice!
column143: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Oscar: [Dwight is running the gay-dar over Oscar's body] What are you doing?!
column144: 03x01 - Gay Witch Hunt;Dwight: Shhh. Don't be scared. [gay-dar beeps over Oscar's belt buckle, Dwight smiles] It works. [gay-dar goes off next to Dwight's belt buckle] ...oh no.

column34: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Guess where I am going. I will give you a hint. It is a booze-fueled s*x romp, where anything goes. You are correct, sir! I am headed to Philadelphia for the Annual Northeastern Mid-Market Office Supply Convention. And Jim Halpert is going to be coming, which will be fun. Poor little guy. He's been stuck working under Josh, the poor man's Michael Scott, as he is known around my condo.

column37: 03x02 - The Convention;Dwight: Monkey, I am an A. R. M., Assistant Regional Manager.

column39: 03x02 - The Convention;Dwight: Yes, Monkey.

column41: 03x02 - The Convention;Angela: In the Martin family, we like to say, "Looks like someone took the slow train from Philly." That's code for "check out the slut." What is... why are there flies in here?
column42: 03x02 - The Convention;Kelly: Oh my God! Are you so excited for tonight? I am so excited. You guys are going to click, I can feel it. So what are you wearing?
column43: 03x02 - The Convention;Pam: This.

column46: 03x02 - The Convention;Pam: Yes, I have a date. He's a cartoonist for the local paper, which is really neat, because I like to draw too. I'm kind of nervous. I haven't been on a first date in nine years... probably shouldn't broadcast that.

column73: 03x02 - The Convention;Josh: Pretty good.
column74: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Good to see you. There he is! There's the traitor! Traitor! Traitor! Come here, you. Come here! Yeah! The product... the progidal... my son returns.

column84: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: You know, when I saw Dwight, I realized how stupid and petty all those pranks I pulled on him were. And then he spoke. I wonder how hard it would be to get a copy of his room key.

column94: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Ah.

column146: 03x02 - The Convention;

column174: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Oh yeah?
column175: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Yeah. Moved Ryan over to your desk.
column176: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Oh, tell him I say hi.
column177: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: I will call him later with that message.
column178: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Hey, how is... Toby?
column179: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Toby Flenderson is everything that is wrong with the paper industry. Is he why you left?
column180: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Oh, no, it was... you know, a good opportunity for me, a promotion. I got a chance to...
column181: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Opportunity, promotion, blah, blah. You know, Jim, those are just words. Have you taken into account other factors, vis-a-vis bosses? Is Josh funnier than I am? Does he even have a girlfriend? Because I have two, basically.
column182: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Michael, it's really not a competition.
column183: 03x02 - The Convention;Josh: Jim got us a great lead with a new rep from National Envelope. We can grab lunch with them tomorrow.
column184: 03x02 - The Convention;Jan: Great!
column185: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Hey, Jan, Jan? Don't worry, I have got the tip.
column186: 03x02 - The Convention;Dwight: Whoa. Michael.
column187: 03x02 - The Convention;Waiter: Wow, oh my God, thank you.
column188: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: You're welcome.
column189: 03x02 - The Convention;Dwight: Was that your per diem?
column190: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: No, that was a different hundred dollar bill.
column191: 03x02 - The Convention;Jan: What have you generated, Michael?
column192: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: I have generated a lot of interest in my party this evening.
column193: 03x02 - The Convention;Jan: What party?
column194: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: The party I'm having tonight in 308. Obviously, you are invited.
column195: 03x02 - The Convention;Jan: Michael, um... Jim and Josh are in meetings all day. And I am in and out of meetings. I can't stay on top of you 24/7.
column196: 03x02 - The Convention;Phyllis: You should order the most expensive thing on the menu, so he knows you're worth it.
column197: 03x02 - The Convention;Stanley: If you do that, you're going to have to put out.
column198: 03x02 - The Convention;Phyllis: Oh, yeah. You'll have to put out.
column199: 03x02 - The Convention;Angela: Is there a key for Jane Doe? Thank you.
column200: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Any messages for 308? All right.
column201: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Hey hey, fellers.
column202: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Michael.
column203: 03x02 - The Convention;Dwight: Hey, Michael.
column204: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: What's up?
column205: 03x02 - The Convention;Josh: Well, Jim and I have a meeting with Uni-ball in about forty-five minutes, so we should probably go now.
column206: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Hey, check this out. How about that? A little friendly competition. Stamford versus Scranton.
column207: 03x02 - The Convention;Josh: I don't think so.
column208: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Oh, Jim. Looks like you picked a bad time to defect, my friend.
column209: 03x02 - The Convention;Josh: Fine! All right.
column210: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Okay! Excellent. Oh...
column211: 03x02 - The Convention;Dwight: Keep the wing flaps.
column212: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Shut it. [answering phone] Hey, Pam, what's up? Yep, yech... no. Tell him I will give him general specifics tomorrow, okay? Yes. [to others] Say hi to Pam!
column213: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim, Josh, and Dwight: Hi, Pam.
column214: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Yes. That is Josh and Dwight and Jim. [to others] Pam says hi. [into phone] Have fun on your date! Very good, talk to you later. Bye.
column215: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: You first.
column216: 03x02 - The Convention;Dwight: Come on. Nice try, Josh!
column217: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Not. It hit the rim. Okay, and... okay. Double or nothing.
column218: 03x02 - The Convention;Josh: Or what? We didn't bet anything, Michael.
column219: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Well, let's...
column220: 03x02 - The Convention;Josh: Yeah, we should go.
column221: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Come on!
column222: 03x02 - The Convention;Josh: We gotta go.
column223: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Come on!
column224: 03x02 - The Convention;Josh: Uh... we'll do it later.
column225: 03x02 - The Convention;Evan: Say, while I have you here, could I talk to you about some new and exciting advances to our product line?
column226: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Fine.
column227: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Jim and I have different definitions of friendship. I think it's talking and being friends, and Jim thinks it's moving to Connecticut and being best friends with Josh. Well, phooey on that. I, uh, I'm done. I am not going to be speaking with him anymore. Whatevs. Long-distance relationships never work.
column228: 03x02 - The Convention;Evan: That is so true. Ready?
column229: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Okay, let me tell you what we're looking for.
column230: 03x02 - The Convention;Evan: Great.
column231: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Sorry, my meeting ran late.
column232: 03x02 - The Convention;Jan: Really?
column233: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Yes, Jan, really. With a rep from HammerMill.
column234: 03x02 - The Convention;Josh: They're exclusive with Staples.
column235: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Used to be. Evan will call you in the morning to work out the details. We can now sell HammerMill products.
column236: 03x02 - The Convention;Dwight: Yes! Ha!
column237: 03x02 - The Convention;Jan: Well, Michael, I underestimated you.
column238: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Yeah, well, maybe next time you will estimate me.
column239: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Dwight's room key. And... Dwight's room. What can I say? Old habits die hard.
column240: 03x02 - The Convention;Angela: D?
column241: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Oh my God. Dwight got a hooker! Oh my God, I gotta call... well, I gotta call somebody, I don't even know who to call. Dwight got a hooker!
column242: 03x02 - The Convention;Kelly: So, Alan, Pam is obsessed with your cartoons. She reads them every day.
column243: 03x02 - The Convention;Alan: Oh, great.
column244: 03x02 - The Convention;Ryan: I don't want ketchup.
column245: 03x02 - The Convention;Kelly: You love ketchup! He loves ketchup.
column246: 03x02 - The Convention;Pam: So how do you come up with your cartoons?
column247: 03x02 - The Convention;Alan: Well, I just, uh... I kinda think about stuff that I see, or dream them.
column248: 03x02 - The Convention;Pam: You dream in cartoons? How fun!
column249: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Hey, first guest! You are going to have some tequila, my friend.
column250: 03x02 - The Convention;Guy: I thought there was a party in here.
column251: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: This is the party.
column252: 03x02 - The Convention;Guy: This is room 308?
column253: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Party central! So, what can I do you for? [Guy leaves] All right.
column254: 03x02 - The Convention;Alan: See, this one is great, because it can work on a couple of different levels.
column255: 03x02 - The Convention;Pam: Huh.
column256: 03x02 - The Convention;Alan: [French accent] Freedom fries for the table.
column257: 03x02 - The Convention;Pam: Freedom fries. Yeah.
column258: 03x02 - The Convention;Alan: Yeah. I mean, people always say, like, "Don't be edgy." But I don't know any other way. Yeah, you get it.
column259: 03x02 - The Convention;Pam: Well, it was, uh, it was really nice meeting you, Alan.
column260: 03x02 - The Convention;Alan: Yeah. Next time bring some of your illustrations, I'll let you pick my brain.
column261: 03x02 - The Convention;Pam: More freedom fries.
column262: 03x02 - The Convention;Alan: Yeah.
column263: 03x02 - The Convention;Pam: That's great.
column264: 03x02 - The Convention;Alan: Okay.
column265: 03x02 - The Convention;Pam: I went on a date. It wasn't a love connection, um... I think when I like someone again, I'll just kinda know.
column266: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Michael. Am I the first to arrive?
column267: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: People have been filtering in and out.
column268: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Can I get a drink?
column269: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: What?
column270: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Can I get a drink?
column271: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Sure. You like Cosmos?
column272: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Yeah.
column273: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Sure, sounds good. So why are you here? Is Josh busy?
column274: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Michael...
column275: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: I get it! No, no, I totally get it. He made a better paper airplane, Stamford is better in sales... I get it. We had some fun. We had some laughs. And that's just...
column276: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Wait, wait. I didn't transfer because of you. You're a good boss. You're a great boss.
column277: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: I'm not better than Josh.
column278: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Michael, it's not about... I transferred because of Pam.
column279: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Oh my God. You don't even know. She's single now.
column280: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: No, I just... I heard something about that. It's just, I kind of put it all on the line. Twice, actually. And she said no. Twice.
column281: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: I'm sorry, man. I'm sorry. Hey, you know what? I will talk to her.
column282: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: Nope, that's okay.
column283: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Yeah.
column284: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: That's all right.
column285: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: I will. I'll talk to her. You should at least talk to Roy. I mean, he knows exactly how you're feeling.
column288: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Hey! No, you know, people have been filtering in and out.
column290: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Evan, this is Jim.
column292: 03x02 - The Convention;Evan: Hey, uh... Arnie Reisman. Michael, Jim.
column293: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Hey, Ernie, how ya doing?
column294: 03x02 - The Convention;Evan: Do you guys work together?
column295: 03x02 - The Convention;Jim: No, we used to. Now we're friends.
column297: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Some people need dozens of friends to say, "Hey, look at me, I'm popular." But not me. I'm very picky. I need three, maybe two. When you meet that someone special, you'll just know. Because a real relationship, it... it can't be forced. It should just come about effortlessly.
column298: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Now, would you do the pleasure of hitting the lights, sir? [lights go out, leaving Michael's black light on] Ha, ha, ha.
column299: 03x02 - The Convention;Dwight: Ha, ha, ha, ha.
column300: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Whoa. What are those stains?
column301: 03x02 - The Convention;Dwight: Blood, urine, or semen.
column302: 03x02 - The Convention;Michael: Oh, God, I hope it's urine.

column1: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: [waiting on Pam to be done with the microwave] Ahhhhhhhhh. [whispering loudly] I'm hungry.
column2: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Movie Monday! The only cure I know for the Monday blues is... Varsity Blues!
column3: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Let's gooooo! Let's go, let's go, let's go!
column4: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: [directing people to their assigned seats] Take a seat down there. Second from the end.
column5: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Alright, everybody here? Yes.
column6: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: [walking in with a tray of six popcorn bags] Popcorn anyone?
column7: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Yes pleeeeease! Thank yooouuu!
column8: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: [with five popcorn bags left] Anyone else? Nooo.
column9: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: Movie Monday started with training videos, but we went through those pretty fast. Then we watched a medical video. Since then, it's been half hour installments of various movies, with the exception of an episode of Entourage, which Michael made us watch six times.
column10: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Entourage!
column11: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Kevin, would you like to do the scenes from last week?
column12: 03x03 - The Coup;Kevin: Yes!
column13: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Why him?
column14: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Don't whine. Get the window. [Dwight exhales]
column15: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Previously on Varsity Blues...
column16: 03x03 - The Coup;Kevin: Ok. Billy-Bob, got a head injury, but coach made him play. So then Lance, he gets sacked, he's out for the year...
column17: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: [walking into an empty office because everyone is watching Varsity Blues] Hello?
column18: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Not everyone approves of Movie Monday. I won't say who.
column19: 03x03 - The Coup;Angela: I don't approve. I don't.
column20: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: Hello? [Angela coughs and points to the conference room]
column21: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: [Jan walks in on Movie Monday] Hi Jan! Hope you brought the Milk Duds!
column22: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: How would a movie increase productivity Michael? How on earth would it do that?
column23: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: People work faster after...
column24: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: Magically?
column25: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: No... they have to... to make up for the time they lost watching the movie.
column26: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: No.
column27: 03x03 - The Coup;Angela: [walking past Dwight's desk] Kitchen.
column28: 03x03 - The Coup;Angela: Michael is going to get us all fired. You sat back and let him play that dumb movie, and now Jan is peeved off and we're all going to lose our jobs.
column29: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: That's not going to happen.
column30: 03x03 - The Coup;Angela: You know she has it out for him now.
column31: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: That's not his fault! He had to follow his heart!
column32: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Ever since Michael dumped Jan for Carol, Jan's been bitching out on him. Reject a woman and she will never let it go. One of the many defects of their kind. Also weak arms.
column33: 03x03 - The Coup;Angela: Dwight, you should be running this office.
column34: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Michael would never let me...
column35: 03x03 - The Coup;Angela: It's not up to Michael, it's Jan's call. Talk to her.
column36: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: I could never do that!
column37: 03x03 - The Coup;Angela: Fine! Sit back and do nothing and let us all get fired!
column38: 03x03 - The Coup;Angela: I know that patience and loyalty are good, and virtuous traits. But sometimes I just think you need to grow a pair.
column39: 03x03 - The Coup;Jim: At the Stamford branch, they all play this World War II video game called Call of Duty, and they're all really into it. I'm told it started as a team building exercise. Unfortunately I really suck at it. We didn't play many video games in Scranton. Instead we'd do stuff like, uh, Pam and I would sometimes hum the same high pitched note, and try to get Dwight to make an appointment with an ear doctor. And uh, Pam called it... Pretendenitus.
column40: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: [on the phone] Hey Kelly, my stuff just got here. [Kelly screams with excitement into the phone and Pam has to take it away from her ear]
column41: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: Kelly really likes to online shop. Soooo, I felt like I wanted some new clothes. I mean, I just, I wanted to, it just, I felt like it was time, to maybe um... just get new clothes.
column42: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: [pulling her new shirt out of a box] Ok.
column43: 03x03 - The Coup;Kelly: [gasps] I love it!
column44: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: Really? I don't know.
column45: 03x03 - The Coup;Kelly: You haven't even tried it on yet, try it on.
column46: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: Not at work, I'll try it on---
column47: 03x03 - The Coup;Kelly: Fashion show! Fashion show! Fashion show at lunch!
column48: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: ...noooo
column49: 03x03 - The Coup;Kelly: [clapping her hands in unison] Fashion show! Fashion show! Fashion show at lunch! Fashion show! Fashion show! Fashion show at lunch!
column50: 03x03 - The Coup;Andy: Why did you do that?!
column51: 03x03 - The Coup;Jim: I'm just killing Germans, any way I can.
column52: 03x03 - The Coup;Andy: We're on the German team. Shoot the Brittish.
column53: 03x03 - The Coup;Jim: [turning around to Karen] Wait, are we playing teams?
column54: 03x03 - The Coup;Karen: [laughing] Yeah.
column55: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: [outside in the parking lot, pacing back and forth] WAH! GAH! [breathing heavily]
column56: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: [answering the phone] Hello?
column57: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Is this Jan?
column58: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: Who is this?
column59: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: This is Dwight Schrute. I am calling about an extremely sensitive matter.
column60: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: You should talk to Michael, and he'll talk to me, and that way we don't have to speak to each other.
column61: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: It's about Michael.
column62: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: What about him?
column63: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: [exhales] I can't talk here. It's too sensitive.
column64: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: It's not about a surprise party is it?
column65: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: No, but we should discuss that another time.
column66: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: Look, I am already an hour outside of Scranton, Dwight, I'm not coming back.
column67: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Pull over at exit 40. There is a Liz Claiborne outlet. I know you like that store. Go inside and shop, until I can meet you.
column68: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: How do you know I like that store?
column69: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Many of your blouses are Claiborne's.
column70: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: How do you know that?
column71: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Part of my job.
column72: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: No it's not. It's officially not.
column73: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: ...noted.
column74: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: [walking into Michael's office] I'm going... to the dentist.
column75: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Ok.
column76: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: I have to have an emergency crown put in.
column77: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Ouchy.
column78: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Yes. It's a new dentist. He's far. I might be gone... three hours.
column79: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Three hours, wow. Have fun. [Dwight walks away staring through the blinds at Michael]
column80: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Did you get anything good?
column81: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: Yeah.
column82: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: New blouse? Halter top? Camisole? Teddy?
column83: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: I can save the branch.
column84: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: Really?
column85: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: If you let me run it.
column86: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: Ok.
column87: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: [excitedly] "Ok" I can run it?
column88: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: What would you do differently?
column89: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Mostly get rid of waste. Which is half the people there. And clean house. [to waitress in diner] Right here. It's all for me. Thank you.
column90: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: Dwight, you must feel strongly, to speak with me this way, behind Michael's back, and turn on so many of your co-workers.
column91: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: The decision to turn on Michael was difficult. [pouring way too much syrup on his food] But once I did it, I didn't look back. And mostly I feel that Michael would approve. It's really what's best for the branch. And I could care less about my co-workers. So [cutting his food, giving Jan a "so there" look], here we are. It's all, on the table. I want... the branch. And I await your decision.
column92: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: [shoveling waffles into his mouth] Oh, by the way. There's a new Ann Taylor outlet store near here. I know you like their earrings.
column93: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: [thinks for a second] Where is it?
column94: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: [on speakerphone with Michael] Michael.
column95: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Hi.
column96: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: I just had a very interesting conversation with one of your employees.
column97: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Oh. That's nice.
column98: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: No, it wasn't. Dwight just told me that he thinks he can run the branch better than you.
column99: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: ...what?
column100: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: Mm-hmm.
column101: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: ...you were at the dentist?
column102: 03x03 - The Coup;Jan: You can't have people undermining you. Get control of your branch immediately.
column103: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Ok.
column104: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: What was Dwight thinking? That he could turn Jan against me? She's my ex-lover! ...ish.
column105: 03x03 - The Coup;Phyllis: [Pam walks out of the bathroom wearing her new red shirt] Woooooow.
column106: 03x03 - The Coup;Kelly: It's so sexy. You look so hot.
column107: 03x03 - The Coup;Phyllis: It's really something.
column108: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: [smiling] It's too much.
column109: 03x03 - The Coup;Kelly: What?
column110: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: I'm gonna return it.
column111: 03x03 - The Coup;Kelly: No, you have to keep it today, just see how you feel.
column112: 03x03 - The Coup;Roy: [walking into the break room] Hey.
column113: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: Hi.
column114: 03x03 - The Coup;Roy: You look nice.
column115: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: Thanks.
column116: 03x03 - The Coup;Kelly: Isn't that like your third soda today?
column117: 03x03 - The Coup;Jim: Yeah I think we can be a big help to your company. [someone dims the lights, signifying that it's game time] Ok, see you next week. Bye. [to Karen] Again?
column118: 03x03 - The Coup;Karen: Scared?
column119: 03x03 - The Coup;Karen: [with her hands making the rocker sign] Call of Duty!
column120: 03x03 - The Coup;
column121: 03x03 - The Coup;
column122: 03x03 - The Coup;
column123: 03x03 - The Coup;Josh: [sounding upset] Andy, Jim, can I see you in the conference room for a minute?
column124: 03x03 - The Coup;Andy: Now?
column125: 03x03 - The Coup;Josh: Yes now.
column126: 03x03 - The Coup;Andy: Put the game on hold everyone.
column127: 03x03 - The Coup;Josh: This is not working, ok? We are getting slaughtered out there.
column128: 03x03 - The Coup;Andy: It's the new guy. [looks at Jim]
column129: 03x03 - The Coup;Jim: Oh, I'm sorry I don't know... what we're talking about...
column130: 03x03 - The Coup;Andy: See what I mean?
column131: 03x03 - The Coup;Josh: We just need a strategy, ok? We're going to set up a trap in the gun room. All right Jim, are you using the MP-40 or the 44?
column132: 03x03 - The Coup;Jim: Um, sniper rifle?
column133: 03x03 - The Coup;Josh: SNIPE--
column134: 03x03 - The Coup;Andy: WHAT?
column135: 03x03 - The Coup;Josh: JIM!
column136: 03x03 - The Coup;Andy: Are you playing for the other team?!
column137: 03x03 - The Coup;Josh: You don't snipe in Carrington, ok?
column138: 03x03 - The Coup;Andy: Saboteur!
column139: 03x03 - The Coup;Josh: Andy, it's not---
column140: 03x03 - The Coup;Andy: Saboteur! I'm going to kill you for real. This game--- the game is over. I'm really going to shoot you.
column141: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Hey Dwight.
column142: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Hey.
column143: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Do you want an M&M?
column144: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: No thanks I'm stuffed.
column145: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: No seriously. You should have an M&M, they're really good.
column146: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: ...ok. [takes and eats several M&M's]
column147: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: They're good, huh?
column148: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: ...so good.
column149: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Hey. I thought you weren't supposed to eat anything for a couple hours after you've had a crown put in.
column150: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: They have this new kind of quick drying bonding, so...
column151: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Sounds like a good dentist.
column152: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Oh, yeah.
column153: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: What's his name?
column154: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: [long pause] Crentist.
column155: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Your dentist's name is Crentist.
column156: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Yep.
column157: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Huh. Sounds a lot like dentist.
column158: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Maybe that's why he became a dentist.
column159: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Let me see your teeth. Let me see 'em. Let me see 'em.
column160: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: [reluctantly opens his mouth and Michael peers inside] Ahh. Aaaah.
column161: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: You should... floss.
column162: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: I know...
column163: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: [exhales] Well then... I am glad you're ok.
column164: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Business is like a jungle. And I... am like a tiger. And Dwight, is like a monkey, that stabs the tiger in the back with a stick. Does the tiger fire the monkey? Does the tiger transfer the monkey to another branch? [smiling] Pun. There is no way of knowing what goes on inside the tiger's head. We don't have the technology.
column165: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Dwight, can I talk to you for a second?
column166: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: [in Michael's office] Wow, this is tough.
column167: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: What?
column168: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Ohhhh. Arrrgggh!
column169: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: What is it?
column170: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Well, I just got off the phone with Jan. And um... she demoted me.
column171: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: No.
column172: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Yeah. You know what the craziest part of this is? She demoted me to your job!
column173: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Gahh!
column174: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: And she said that you should be expecting a call later from corporate, and that um, I guess that means that you are going to be acting manager of Dunder Mifflin, Scranton.
column175: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: I can't believe this news. That--- wow.
column176: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: I know. I told her I didn't know whether you'd wanna do it... because you've always been so loyal to me. You've been my most trusted ally.
column177: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: You said that?
column178: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Yep, I did. I did. But I think... you should do it.
column179: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Well... Gosh, if you think I should. Then I will.
column180: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: [exhales] Perfect, well, we're settled.
column181: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: All right.
column182: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: All right. Well then, you are now acting manager of Dunder Mifflin Scranton Branch, and I... am assistant regional manager.
column183: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Assistant to the regional manager. Thank you Michael, for staying on. I really appreciate it.
column184: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Ohh..
column185: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Hey... I can't imagine this place without you.
column186: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: [muttering] Can't you? That's so nice.
column187: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Well... I guess we should go tell the troops.
column188: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Yeah, when I'm ready, Mike. [Dwight exhales, Michael looks at the camera] Ok let's do it.
column189: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Hey, hi, hello. Everybody, I have some good news, and I have some bad news. I... am being replaced, as your leader, by Dwight.
column190: 03x03 - The Coup;Phyllis: You're kidding...
column191: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: You might think that I am kidding, and I understand that.
column192: 03x03 - The Coup;Angela: Congratulations Dwight.
column193: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Thank you Angela.
column194: 03x03 - The Coup;Stanley: But... why Dwight?
column195: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Because, Dwight... never lies.
column196: 03x03 - The Coup;Stanley: How does that qualify him to run a branch?
column197: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Because that's all it takes.
column198: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Ok, Dwight, would you like to say a few words to everybody... about loyalty?
column199: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Thank you Michael. I just want to say, to the few of you who will remain under my employ, that I intend to lead you into the black! With ferocity!
column200: 03x03 - The Coup;Phyllis: Michael, what will you do?
column201: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Oh, I'll be fine.
column202: 03x03 - The Coup;Kevin: Do you have any savings?
column203: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: No, no, I don't, but---
column204: 03x03 - The Coup;Kevin: Michael, you might lose your condo.
column205: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: I... won't. I won't.
column206: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: I have this little vacuum cleaner that's broken. If Dwight doesn't work out, maybe that could be manager.
column207: 03x03 - The Coup;Phyllis: Maybe I'll quit.
column208: 03x03 - The Coup;Angela: It's really happening!
column209: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Yes.
column210: 03x03 - The Coup;Angela: We can make a difference here.
column211: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: I, will, make a difference here.
column212: 03x03 - The Coup;Angela: You alone? Because I thought together we could---
column213: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Oh please, don't be naive. But you can be in charge of the women.
column214: 03x03 - The Coup;Karen: [whispering] Look how cute he is! He's trying to shoot with a smoke grenade.
column215: 03x03 - The Coup;Jim: I'm sorry what are you whispering about?
column216: 03x03 - The Coup;Karen: I'm sorry nothing, just concentrate on turning around.
column217: 03x03 - The Coup;Jim: I'm trying---
column218: 03x03 - The Coup;Karen: Just tap S then D.
column219: 03x03 - The Coup;Jim: Oh.
column220: 03x03 - The Coup;Karen: [her players gun is pointed directly at Jim's player's head] Any... last words? No?
column221: 03x03 - The Coup;Jim: What? [Karen's player shoots Jim's player, "You killed Jim Halpert" appears on the screen, Karen giggles]
column222: 03x03 - The Coup;Jim: Wow. Psychopath. [Karen grins widely at Jim]
column223: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: What?
column224: 03x03 - The Coup;Creed: I'm just looking.
column225: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: Please go back to your desk.
column226: 03x03 - The Coup;Creed: In a minute.
column227: 03x03 - The Coup;Pam: Well, I remember why I dress the way I do at work. But I'm gonna keep the clothes. I mean, it'll be cool to just have some after work clothes that aren't pajamas.
column228: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Well, I guess it's time, that I turn over the keys, to the famous Sebring.
column229: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: [smiling] No thank you.
column230: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: It's a corporate lease Dwight, you've earned it.
column231: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: No thanks.
column232: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: What?
column233: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Not my style.
column234: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: But you said you liked it. You've always admired it.
column235: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Well that was before. I'm thinking about getting something German, something with decent gas mileage. Plus, that convertible, it's a ridiculous choice for this climate.
column236: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: [Michael finally breaks] Take it back.
column237: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: [confused] No.
column238: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: That's my car.
column239: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: What did you---
column240: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: THAT'S MY CAR.
column241: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: Yes.
column242: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: I know, Dwight. I know. I know. I know.
column243: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: You know what?
column244: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Jan called me about your little meeting!
column245: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: No!
column246: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: I know, what you did. I made the whole thing up, Dwight.
column247: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: I think the Sebring's cool. It's cool. The Seabring's cool. It has a cassette and it has a CD.
column248: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Oh do you? Do you like the Sebring--- HOW DARE YOU?! How dare you, Dwight?
column249: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: [Dwight gets on his knees and puts his face down on the ground] Don't fire me. Please.
column250: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Give me one good reason why I should fire you RIGHT HERE ON THE SPOT?!
column251: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: [terrified] I HAVE EXCELLENT SALES NUMBERS!
column252: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Not. Good. Enough!
column253: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: [sobbing] I'll do anything! Anything! I'll do your laundry for a month! For a year!
column254: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: I have a laundry machine!
column255: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: I'm sorry! I'll do anything, I swear. [squeaking, crying]
column256: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: I don't know if I can trust you anymore.
column257: 03x03 - The Coup;Dwight: You can't. You can't. But I promise I'll never betray you again. What can I do, Michael. What can I do? [Michael exhales] What can I do? [Dwight has his face to the ground but his butt raised high in the air] What can I do? What can I do?
column258: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: You can get up. Get up. [Dwight gets up with spit hanging from his lips] And you can hug it out, bitch. [Dwight and Michael have a firm embrace]
column259: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Hug it out, bitch. That is what men say to each other, after a fight. They hug it out, and doing so, the just... let it go. And walk away. And they're done. Not a good idea to say that to a woman however. I have found. It doesn't translate.
column260: 03x03 - The Coup;Jim: [leaving his desk for the day, pretends pull the pen out of a pretend grenade, and tosses it to Karen]
column261: 03x03 - The Coup;Karen: [throws some desk material in the air to signify debris from the grenade explosion, grins as Jim walks away]
column262: 03x03 - The Coup;Michael: Yep. Yeah, we hugged it out. But, it turns out, I was still a little angry. So, I felt I needed to punish him, just a little bit more, [cut to Dwight standing on a box with "LIAR" written on a piece of paper hung around his neck, Dwight's head hung in shame] and I'm making him do my laundry for a year.

column1: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Hey Ryan, can I get you a pencil from the warehouse?
column2: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Ryan: Uh, no thanks, I'm good.
column3: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Oh, it's okay, I'm going down.
column4: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Ryan: Um... Yeah, absolutely.
column5: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: All right, I'll be right back. [goes down pretend stairs]
column6: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: [laughs uproariously and applauds] Whoo!
column7: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: [hands Ryan pencil] There you go.
column8: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Awesome!
column9: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Ryan: Thank you.
column10: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: You're welcome.
column11: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Michael, can you get me a pen from down in the warehouse?
column12: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Don't mind if I do. See you in a minute. [goes back down pretend stairs and grabs pen from Stanley's desk]
column13: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Okay. [continues to laugh] Whoo!
column14: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: There you go, fresh from the warehouse.
column15: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: Hey Michael, would you get me some coffee from the warehouse?
column16: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: There's coffee in the kitchen, Pam.
column17: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: But the warehouse coffee tastes SO much better.
column18: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Ryan and others: Yeah. Yes, it's better. It's great.
column19: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: [breathless] All right. Okay. [goes back down pretend stairs, crawls on belly to the kitchen for the coffee]
column20: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: I am like Bette Midler in For the Boys. Gotta keep the troops entertained.
column21: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: [after Michael returns with coffee] With cream and sugar?
column22: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: [sighs] All right.
column23: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jan: [on speakerphone] So, I wanted to let you know that we lost Ed Truck.
column24: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Oookay. Let me see if I have his cell. Is this the only reason you are calling, Jan? Or does somebody miss me?
column25: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jan: Michael, Ed died over the weekend.
column26: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Oh, wow.
column27: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Attention, everybody. I just received a call from corporate with some news they felt that I should know first. My old boss Ed Truck has died.
column28: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Kelly: Oh, Michael, that's such terrible news! You must feel so sad.
column29: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Yes, I am. It's very sad. Because he was my boss.
column30: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Phyllis: That's a shame. Ed was a good guy.
column31: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: That's right, you worked with him. So did Creed. Well, I'll be in my office in case anybody wants to drop by. Cheer me up.
column32: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: So did you hear the news?
column33: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: The news that you just announced? That Ed died?
column34: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Yeah.
column35: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: Is there anything I can do?
column36: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Oh, gosh, what can anybody do, really? It's... pssssh... . He was almost 70. Circle of life.
column37: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: Yeah.
column38: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: [holds out arms to Pam]
column39: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: Oh. Okay.
column40: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Yeah. Mmmmmm.
column41: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: [extricating herself] Okay.
column42: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Josh: What's going on with Fairfield County schools? Karen, did you generate that price list?
column43: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: Um, shoot. Uh, I will. Sorry.
column44: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Josh: Okay, just get it done. Jim, will you make sure?
column45: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: Oh yeah, definitely.
column46: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Andy: [coughing out his words] Suck up! Josh, did you hear what I said?
column47: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Josh: Thank you, everyone.
column48: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: [at vending machine] Dammit.
column49: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: What's up?
column50: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: Uh, nothing. They're just out of Herr's chips.
column51: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: Oh.
column52: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: But don't worry about it. My snack food doesn't fall under the umbrella of your authority.
column53: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: Mmm, that's where you're wrong. I'm your project supervisor today, and I have just decided that we're not doing anything until you get the chips that you require. So, I think we should go get some. Now, please.
column54: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Creed: It's a real shame about Ed, huh?
column55: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Yeah. Must really have you thinkin'.
column56: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Creed: About what?
column57: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: The older you get, the bigger the chance is you're gonna die. You knew that.
column58: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Creed: Ed was decapitated.
column59: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: What?
column60: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Really?
column61: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Creed: He was drunk as a skunk, he was flying down Route 6. He slides under an 18 wheeler. Pop. It snaps right off.
column62: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Oh my God.
column63: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: That is the way to go. Instant death. Very smart.
column64: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Creed: You know a human can go on living for several hours after being decapitated.
column65: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: You're thinking of a chicken.
column66: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Creed: What did I say?
column67: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: That is just not the way a Dunder Mifflin manager should go, I'm sorry. Alone, out of the blue, and not even have his own head to comfort him.
column68: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: [clears throat] So, I'm not exactly sure how to say this...
column69: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Ed was decapitated.
column70: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: What are you doing?
column71: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: You said you didn't know how to say it.
column72: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: I didn't... he was driving on the road and he went under a truck. And that's when his head was separated from the rest of him. And I will let you know more as soon as I find out.
column73: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Hey.
column74: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Angela: Hi.
column75: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: If my head ever comes off, I would like you to put it on ice.
column76: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Angela: I do not wanna talk about this.
column77: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: When I die, I wanna be frozen. And if they have to freeze me in pieces, so be it. I will wake up stronger than ever because I will have used that time to figure out exactly why I died and what moves I could have used to defend myself better now that I know what hold he had me in.
column78: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: I don't understand. We have a day honoring Martin Luther King, but he didn't even work here.
column79: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jan: [on speakerphone] I understand how you feel, Michael. I really do. So, would it be helpful to give everyone the day off?
column80: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: You really don't get it, do you? You don't understand these people. That is the last thing that they would want is a day off.
column81: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jan: Well, what would you suggest?
column82: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: [thoughtfully] A statue.
column83: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jan: Of Ed?
column84: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Yeah.
column85: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jan: [scoffs] I'm not sure that's realistic.
column86: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Well, I think it would be very realistic, it would look just like him.
column87: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jan: No, that's not---
column88: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: We could have his eyes light up, we could have his arms move...
column89: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: That is not a statue, that is a robot.
column90: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: I think that is a great way to honor Ed.
column91: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: And how big do you want this robot?
column92: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Life-size.
column93: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Mm, no. Better make it two-thirds. Easier to stop if it turns on us.
column94: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jan: What the hell are you two talking about?
column95: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Well, we are talking about how to properly honor a man who gave his life as regional manager of this company, Jan.
column96: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jan: You know what, Michael? I've really tried with you today...
column97: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Mm hm.
column98: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jan: ...and I have to get back to work.
column99: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Oh do you? You know who wished they could get back to work is Ed Truck.
column100: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jan: So call me when you feel like having a real conversation.
column101: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: But Ed truck can't because he is---
column102: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jan: Goodbye. [hangs up]
column103: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: DEAD.
column104: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Look [holding up sketch] I gave him a six foot extension cord so he can't chase us.
column105: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: That's perfect.
column106: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: Okay, that is a "no" on the on the West Side Market.
column107: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: Okay, great. I think that's enough. Can I get back to work now?
column108: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: Wow. Never pegged you for a quitter.
column109: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: I am NOT a quitter. I will do this all day if you want.
column110: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: Really?
column111: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: Yeah, all day.
column112: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Andy: Hey. What are we doing? What's the game? I want in.
column113: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: Oh, there's no game. We're just trying to get these chips for Karen.
column114: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Andy: Did you check the vending machine?
column115: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: Oh, the vending machines! How did we miss that?
column116: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: I have no idea. We went right for the copier.
column117: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: Mm.
column118: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: And then we checked the fax machine.
column119: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: Yeah, nothing there.
column120: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Andy: Did you check your... butt?
column121: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;
column122: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;
column123: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;
column124: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Oohh... can you imagine how much blood there was? If it happened right here, it would reach all the way to reception. Probably get on Pam.
column125: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Phyllis: Okay that's enough.
column126: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: What?
column127: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Stanley: We do not wanna hear about this.
column128: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Well, you know what? I didn't wanna hear about it either, Stanley, but I did and now I can't stop picturing it. He leaves work, he's on his way home... wham! His cappa is detated from his head!
column129: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Stanley: You have just spit on my face.
column130: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Well, you know what? There's something wrong with you. There is something wrong with everybody in here. Because we have lost a member of our family and you don't wanna talk about it, you don't wanna think about it, you just wanna get back to work!
column131: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: There are five stages to grief, which are [glancing at computer screen] denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and acceptance. And right now, out there, they're all denying the fact that they're sad. And that's hard. And it's making them all angry. And it is my job to try to get them all the way through to acceptance. And if not acceptance, then just depression. If I can get them depressed, then I'll have done my job.
column132: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: I am going to throw you this ball. When you catch the ball, I want you to say the name of a person very important to you, somebody really special who died, and then I want you to say how they died, and you may cry if you like, that is encouraged. Let me just start. Let me show you how this works. I catch the ball. I lost Ed Truck. And... it feels like somebody took my heart and dropped it into a bucket of boiling tears... and at the same time, somebody else is hitting my soul in the crotch with a frozen sledgehammer... and then a third guy walks in and starts punching me in the grief bone... and I'm crying, and nobody can hear me, because I am terribly, terribly... terribly alone.
column133: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Roy: Excuse me, I'm sorry to interrupt, uh, I need to see Pam. There seems to be, like, something wrong with the radiator in her car.
column134: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Okay, fine. Hurry back.
column135: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Roy: [as they leave] There's nothing wrong with your car. I just thought you might like a break from the "grief counseling" session.
column136: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: Oh. I would like a break.
column137: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Roy: How are you likin' the new car?
column138: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: Great.
column139: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Roy: Yeah? Sure is small. Got airbags?
column140: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: I think so. I don't know, I was mainly focused on the cup holders.
column141: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Roy: [laughs] Well, you're not still driving so fast, are you? Yeah.
column142: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: [on phone] Hi, yeah. This is Mike from the West Side Market. Well, we get a shipment of Herr's salt and vinegar chips, and we ordered that about three weeks ago and haven't ... . yeah. You have 'em in the warehouse. Great. What is my store number... six. Wait, no. I'll call you back. [quickly hangs up] Shut up [to Karen].
column143: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: [laughing] Six?
column144: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: [as Pam returns to conference room] Okay, we can start. Um...
column145: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: You waited for me?
column146: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Yeah. Pam, you're a member of this family. So we will wait for our family members. Phyllis, you wanna give it a shot?
column147: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: [grabbing ball] I got it. When my mother was pregnant with me, they did an ultrasound and found she was having twins. When they did another ultrasound a few weeks later, they discovered, that I had resorbed the other fetus. Do I regret this? No. I believe his tissue has made me stronger. I now have the strength of a grown man and a little baby.
column148: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Okay, why don't you throw the ball to somebody else.
column149: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Stanley: [throwing ball back] Nope.
column150: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: [returning ball to Stanley] Oh, yes Stanley. Come on. Your turn, you have to go.
column151: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Stanley: I will NOT. [throws ball back]
column152: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Okay... I'm going to toss the ball to Pam.
column153: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: Let's see. I had an aunt that I was really close to. She was this amazing female boxer. Um, anyway, she was injured in a fight, and she was paralyzed. So, you can imagine how upset I was when I found out that she asked her manager to remove her breathing tube so she could die.
column154: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Wow. If you wanna cry, that's okay.
column155: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Ryan: [catching ball] Thanks. Um, a few years ago, my family was on a safari in Africa and, um, my cousin, Mufasa was um, he was trampled to death by a pack of wildebeests and, um, we all... took it really hard. All of us kind of in the audience of what happened.
column156: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Do you want to talk about it anymore?
column157: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Ryan: Oh, it would probably take me like an hour and a half to tell that whole story.
column158: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Kevin: Me, me, me, me, me me. [catches ball] Yes. Okay, um. I was trying to throw this party once. And everyone was over for the weekend. And then my uncle Bernie died, and so me and my best friend, we had to pretend like he was alive, so...
column159: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Wait a second. That's Weekend at Bernie's. [upset] Do you think that this is a game?
column160: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Phyllis: Well, there is a ball.
