column161: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: All right, we're starting over.
column162: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Stanley: No, I'm done.
column163: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: You are not leaving. No! We are not done.
column164: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Angela: We really have a lot of work to do right now.
column165: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Yeah. Well, you know what? The guy who had my job has died. And nobody cares! And he sat at my desk. [breaking down]
column166: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Toby: Michael, look. I know this is hard for you, but death's just a part of life. I mean, just this morning I saw a little bird fly into the glass doors downstairs and die. And I had to keep going.
column167: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: How do you know?
column168: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Toby: What?
column169: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: That that bird was dead? Did you check its breathing?
column170: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Toby: It was obvious...
column171: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Was its heart beating, Toby? Did you check it? No, of course you didn't. You're not a veterinarian. You don't know ANYTHING! [runs out of conference room crying]
column172: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Michael! [following Michael downstairs] Michael. Michael ...
column173: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: [seeing bird] Oh, God!
column174: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: [in disgust] Oh...
column175: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Oh my God! Oh my God, come on ...
column176: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Poor little fella.
column177: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Oh shhhh--oot!
column178: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: He is a goner.
column179: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: No, he's not.
column180: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Yeah.
column181: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: No, he's not. [cradling bird next to face]
column182: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Michael, get him away from your head! He is covered in germs and bacteria!
column183: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Well, you can't get diseases from a bird!
column184: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Angela: A dead bird should not be in the kitchen!
column185: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: We don't know if it's dead.
column186: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Kelly: Ugh, no that thing is dead.
column187: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: You want me to flush him?
column188: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Attention everybody. This will only take a second of your time. Today at 4 p.m. we will be meeting in the parking lot to have a funeral service for this bird.
column189: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Meredith: I have a lot of work to do.
column190: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Well, I'm sorry to inconvenience you, Meredith. But that is what you do when things die. You honor them. Toby killed this bird. And now we are going to honor it.
column191: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Angela: But...
column192: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: No, no, no! That's enough! You know what? This bird is dead. He died alone. The least you can do is be there for him now. [to Dwight] Find a box for him.
column193: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: I'm calling a supermarket in Montreal.
column194: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: Nice!
column195: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: [on phone] Bonjour. Je cherche des tchips de la marque Herr's. Non? Ah... merci quand meme. Au revoir.
column196: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: Sounded good.
column197: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: Thanks.
column198: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Kelly: [crying]
column199: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: It's okay. It's okay. [pats Kelly on shoulder] Shh... yes, I know, I know. It's been a tough day, but it's good to let it show.
column200: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Kelly: I mean, how many times to I have to confirm with Ryan [Michael walks away disgusted] for him to know that we have a date tonight?
column201: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: [trying to shove bird into a can] Argh... gah!
column202: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: What are... What are you doing?
column203: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: What? No, this is about the right size.
column204: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: No, God, no it's not! What is the matter with you? Is that the beak!?
column205: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: I'm sorry, I grew up on a farm. We slaughtered a pig whenever we wanted bacon. My grandfather was reburied in an old oil drum. [pause] It would have fit if he had given me another minute.
column206: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: I need a box. I need a box. A small box... not too confining.
column207: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: Is it for the bird?
column208: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Yeah.
column209: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: I have it covered. [hands Dwight a decorated box]
column210: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Oh, thank you.
column211: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: If you wanna do something for the funeral...
column212: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Yes, please.
column213: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: Maybe you could play a song on your recorder.
column214: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Excellent.
column215: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: Do you have it with you?
column216: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Always. [runs off]
column217: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: Did I wake up this morning thinking I'd be throwing together a bird funeral? You never can tell what your day here is gonna turn into.
column218: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Karen: [spotting Herr's chips on her desk] Where'd you find them?
column219: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: Where'd I find what?
column220: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Jim: I called the manufacturer, who referred me to distributor, who referred me to the vending machine company, who told me that they sell them in the machines in the building next door.
column221: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Glad you could all make it.
column222: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Kelly: You told us we had to.
column223: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Dwight, do you have the box?
column224: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: Actually, I have it.
column225: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: You made this? Wow. [impressed] That's... that's very nice.
column226: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Ryan: When I was five my mom told me that my fish went to the hospital in the toilet and it never came back so we had a funeral for it. And I remember thinking "I'm a little too old for this." And I was five.
column227: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: I'd also like to say a few words if that's okay.
column228: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Yes.
column229: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: What do we know about this bird? You might think, "Not much. It's just a bird." But we do know some things. We know it was a local bird. Maybe it's that same bird that surprised Oscar that one morning with a special present from above.
column230: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Kevin: Oh, I remember that. That was SO funny.
column231: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: And we know how he died. Flying into the glass doors. But you know what? I don't think he was being stupid. I think he just really, really wanted to come inside our building to spread his cheer and lift our spirits with a song.
column232: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: He's not a songbird.
column233: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Shhh.
column234: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: An impression, then. Lastly, we can't help but notice that he was by himself when he died, but of course, we all know that doesn't mean he was alone. Because I'm sure that there were lots of other birds out there who cared for him very much. He will not be forgotten.
column235: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Angela: [quickly] Amen.
column236: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: [begins playing recorder]
column237: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Pam: [singing] Just smile for me and let the day begin. You are the sunshine that lights my heart within... on the wings of love ...
column238: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Michael: Society teaches us that having feelings and crying is bad and wrong. Well, that's baloney, because grief isn't wrong. There is such a thing as good grief. Just ask Charlie Brown.
column239: 03x04 - Grief Counseling;Dwight: Let's get back to work.

column1: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Brain teaser. I have two coins totaling 15 cents and one of them is not a nickel. What are they?
column2: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: A dime and a nickel.
column3: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: No, I said one of them is not a nickel.
column4: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: But the other one is. I've heard that before.
column5: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Ok. A man and his son get into a car accident. They are rushed to the hospital. The doctor says, there is no way I can operate on this boy, ...
column6: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Because he's my son. The doctor is the boy's mother.
column7: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: A man is found hanging from the ceiling...
column8: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: He stepped on a block of ice, hung himself, and the ice melted.
column9: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: A hunter.
column10: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: It's a polar bear because you're at the North Pole.
column11: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Damn it!
column12: 03x05 - Initiation;Jan: Tell me what you did yesterday.
column13: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Uhhh... nothing.
column14: 03x05 - Initiation;Jan: Nothing?
column15: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Yeah, nothing. How was your day?
column16: 03x05 - Initiation;Jan: I don't care how your day was Michael.
column17: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Wow. Well. Ok. I don't care how your day was either, Jan. I was just asking you because you asked me. Why do you set me up like that?
column18: 03x05 - Initiation;Jan: Tell me what you did yesterday.
column19: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: I worked. And then I went home to my condo. And Carol came over. And then we had s*x. Is that what you want to hear?
column20: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Never ever, ever sleep with your boss. I am so lucky that Jan and I only got to second base.
column21: 03x05 - Initiation;Jan: Hi, Pam.
column22: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Hi.
column23: 03x05 - Initiation;Jan: I'm great. So, Pam I would like you to keep a log of everything Michael does hour by hour so we can analyze it at corporate. Ok?
column24: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Oh, I don't know if I'm...
column25: 03x05 - Initiation;Jan: Thanks Pam.
column26: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: It's weird. Jan use to treat Michael like he was a ten year old, but lately it's like he's five.
column27: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: So you excited?
column28: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Yeah.
column29: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Very excited?
column30: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Yes. I'm very excited.
column31: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Extremely excited? ... Just very? That's cool.
column32: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: I have spent a year here. I have to commit or get out. Dwight's the top salesman in the company and he's taking me on my first sales call today. And, um, I'm excited.
column33: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: I am very excited. Ryan hasn't made a sale yet, but more importantly, he hasn't made an ally yet. Is he going to be a slacker-loser-wise-ass like Jim was? Or is he going to join the Dwight Army of Champions?
column34: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: So what if they're not talking much, then does it makes sense to kind of lead the conversation? You know, just 'till it gets to a point where they are asking questions? [car stops] So where's the sales office?
column35: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: When you are ready to see the sales office, the sales office will present itself to you. Your journey begins now.
column36: 03x05 - Initiation;Karen: [squeaky chair] Hey.
column37: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: What?
column38: 03x05 - Initiation;Karen: My chair is squeaking.
column39: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Is it?
column40: 03x05 - Initiation;Karen: You took my chair.
column41: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: No, I didn't. I took back my chair that you took from me, but I didn't take your chair.
column42: 03x05 - Initiation;Karen: When you get up, I'm just going to take it back anyway, so...
column43: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: So I guess I can't get up.
column44: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Hey Koselli, the Kos. Cosby. Hey hey hey. I love Jello Pudding Pops. My son, Theo, loves Jello Pudding Pops too.
column45: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Do you know where we are, temp?
column46: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: I know where we're not.
column47: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: I hold in my hand, a beet seed. Take it. [Ryan tries to take it, Dwight closes hand] AH! [Ryan tries again and takes seed] When... Damn it.
column48: 03x05 - Initiation;Andy: Hey, Big Tuna, can I talk to you for a second.
column49: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Sure.
column50: 03x05 - Initiation;Andy: Can you stand up? And talk to me over there?
column51: 03x05 - Initiation;Karen: That's it? That's what you came up with?
column52: 03x05 - Initiation;Andy: I'm acting my heart out here.
column53: 03x05 - Initiation;Karen: Really?
column54: 03x05 - Initiation;Andy: Yeah, really. You asked for my help, so I helped.
column55: 03x05 - Initiation;Announcer: Attention Scranton Business Park, there will be complimentary pretzels in the lobby from now until 4 o'clock as a thank you to our loyal tenants.
column56: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Once a year they bring in a little cart and they give away free pretzels. It's really not a big deal. To some people it is.
column57: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Productivity is important but how can I be productive if I have this one little thing in my brain? That I cannot get out. And that one little thing is a soft pretzel. So I'm just going to have my soft pretzel, then I'll get to work, and I'll be super productive. Look out for me.
column58: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: [looks at long pretzel line] Oh, shhh... Come on.
column59: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: And just as you have planted your seed in the ground, I'm going to plant my seed in you.
column60: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: I don't think you know what you're saying.
column61: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Smells pretty bad, doesn't it?
column62: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Uh huh.
column63: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: It's called bull crap and a client can smell it from a mile away.
column64: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Gotcha.
column65: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Oh hey, I forgot something in my car. I'll be right back.
column66: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Ok. [Dwight drives away] Of course.
column67: 03x05 - Initiation;Stanley: I wake up every morning in a bed that's too small, drive my daughter to a school that's too expensive, and then I go to work to a job for which I get paid too little, but on Pretzel Day? Well, I like pretzel day.
column68: 03x05 - Initiation;Kelly: Because they acted all tough and everything...
column69: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Uh huh.
column70: 03x05 - Initiation;Kelly: But what they were rapping about was cupcakes and the Chronicles of Narnia. God. Who invented cupcakes, right? I want to...
column71: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: [Phyllis embraces Bob ahead in line] Hey, hey, hey! Phyllis, what are you doing?
column72: 03x05 - Initiation;Phyllis: I'm just saying hi to Bob.
column73: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: No, I think you're cutting in line.
column74: 03x05 - Initiation;Bob: Well settle down, Scott.
column75: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: No, I'm not going to settle down.
column76: 03x05 - Initiation;Stanley: No way.
column77: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Get in the back please.
column78: 03x05 - Initiation;Stanley: Boooooo. Booooo. Back of the line.
column79: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Boooooo. Thank you. [hi-five's Stanley]. That's right.
column80: 03x05 - Initiation;Bob: What a pair of Mary's.
column81: 03x05 - Initiation;Stanley: This is Pretzel Day.
column82: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Hey Dwight, you're a great salesman. Can you teach me? Sure, Ryan. I'll make you the ole commodor. I'll abandon you in a beet field. Huh. That sounds great, Dwight, I'll really appreciate that. Thank you so much for your mentorship.
column83: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Congratulations resourceful salesman. You have passed the second challenge. Welcome to Schrute Farm.
column84: 03x05 - Initiation;Karen: [rocks in squeaky chair]
column85: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: [sings] Love me, love me, say that you love me, fool me, fool me,
column86: 03x05 - Initiation;Karen: stop.
column87: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Go on and fool me. Love me, love me, say that you love me
column88: 03x05 - Initiation;Karen: This is not fair, this is going to be in my head all day. Please.
column89: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: fool me, fool me, go on and fool me. Love me,
column90: 03x05 - Initiation;Karen: This is not a proportionate response.
column91: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Love me, say that you love me. Fool me, fool me, go on and fool me.
column92: 03x05 - Initiation;Andy: I don't care 'bout anything but you... what ever happened to those guys?
column93: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Michael.
column94: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: No cuts. Oh, Pam. Just the woman I'd like to see. You read my mind.
column95: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Great! I thought you could use this time to authorize some checks.
column96: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: I thought that maybe you could wait in line for me while I go to the bathroom. You're an angel.
column97: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Hey, why don't you just go up to your office, get some work done, and I'll just bring you a pretzel.
column98: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Because I like them a certain way, and if it gets screwed up, then whole thing is blown.
column99: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: You know, I just think it's really important that you be productive today.
column100: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Pam, productivity starts with patience and determination. I'll be back.
column101: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: It is time for your next test. You have planted the beet seed. You have walked the long lonely walk of loneliness.
column102: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Look man, I was in a frat in college. So I know what you're doing. I get it.
column103: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: You know what your problem is? You know why you haven't made any sales? Cause you think you know everything. You have to trust that maybe there are other people that can teach you things. Are you ready to learn? Are you ready for the final test?
column104: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Yeah.
column105: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Come on!
column106: 03x05 - Initiation;Stanley: Thank you! [takes pretzel]
column107: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Hi. Please tell me that you have a sweet pretzel left.
column108: 03x05 - Initiation;Pretzel guy: We do.
column109: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Thank God.
column110: 03x05 - Initiation;Pretzel guy: And we have 18 different toppings. We have sweet glaze, cinnamon sugar, chocolate, white chocolate, fudge, M&M's, caramel dip, mint chip, chocolate chip, marshmallow, nuts, toffee nuts, coconuts, peanut butter drizzle, Oreos, sprinkles, cotton candy bits, and powdered sugar.
column111: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Is there anyway that you could do all, all of them?
column112: 03x05 - Initiation;Pretzel guy: The Works. You got it.
column113: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: All right! Thank you!
column114: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Please be seated. [man runs behind Dwight]
column115: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Who was that?
column116: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Pay no attention to the spirits that haunt this hallowed ground.
column117: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Is that your Cousin Mose?
column118: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Yes.
column119: 03x05 - Initiation;
column120: 03x05 - Initiation;
column121: 03x05 - Initiation;
column122: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Mose is my cousin and he lives here. He will always be my best friend. Unless things go well with Ryan today in which case, I won't hang out with Mose so much anymore.
column123: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: What is the greatest danger facing Dunder Mifflin?
column124: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Outsourcing and consolidation of competition.
column125: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Wrong. Flash floods. What is the true cause of Robert Mifflin's suicide?
column126: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Depression?
column127: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Wrong. He hated himself. What is the DHARMA initiative?
column128: 03x05 - Initiation;Kelly: I can't believe that Ryan is not back yet. Where could they be?
column129: 03x05 - Initiation;Angela: Sales take a long time.
column130: 03x05 - Initiation;Kelly: Oh my God, I'm so worried.
column131: 03x05 - Initiation;Angela: I'm sure Dwight will protect him.
column132: 03x05 - Initiation;Kelly: I don't know. Dwight's so weird.
column133: 03x05 - Initiation;Angela: He's not weird, he's just individualistic.
column134: 03x05 - Initiation;Kelly: No, he's a freak.
column135: 03x05 - Initiation;Angela: You're a freak!
column136: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Final question, young Ryan Howard. What is Michael Scott's greatest fear?
column137: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Um, loneliness. Maybe women.
column138: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Wrong. He's not afraid of anything. Also, I would have accepted snakes. Fear is what it's all about. You cannot sell while undergoing fear. You need to vanquish fear! One must wrestle fear to the ground. You will now wrestle my cousin Mose.
column139: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: No. Ok. All right. All right. It's over. This is over. OK.
column140: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Wrestle him to the ground.
column141: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: No, you're a freak. I'm not doing this anymore. This is over. Goodbye.
column142: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Ryan. Don't. Ryan! You don't have to wrestle him. Just get in the coffin. Ryan?
column143: 03x05 - Initiation;Cousin Mose: Bye, Ryan. He seemed nice.
column144: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Where are all the animals?
column145: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Ryan, come on. I am sorry. I am sorry. Mose is sorry too. Look, he sent over a basket with eggs and some fat back bacon. And look, something he whittled.
column146: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: You still mad? It's just Jim and I didn't get along, and I didn't want it to be that way again. You know, I wanted us to be a team. An unstoppable team that competed against other teams.
column147: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Look, that, that's not what I wanted, ok. I just wanted to go on a sales call.
column148: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Screwgun. The sales call!
column149: 03x05 - Initiation;Kevin: [Michael is listening to "Rock And Roll Part 2 by Gary Glitter" and everyone can hear it. Kevin singing in unison with the song] Hey! Hey!
column150: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Mr. Kosseli. Hey hey hey, the Cos. What's going on? Do we have a deal? Deal or no deal? Let's make a deal. So what is the deal?
column151: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Establish time frames. Keep the phrase "real dollars" in their head. And always keep the power in the conversation. That's why you're losing them on the cold calls. Cause you say the word please too much.
column152: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Wait, can you go back?
column153: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Michael always said, K.I.S.S. Keep it simple, stupid. Great advice, hurts my feelings every time.
column154: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Ok, I'm going to establish time frames.
column155: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Good.
column156: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: I'm going to put everything in terms of "real dollars".
column157: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Right.
column158: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: I'm going to ask a lot of questions that all have sort of positive answers.
column159: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Uh huh.
column160: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Saying, that would be better, or we would like that. That sort of thing.
column161: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Exactly. Yes.
column162: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: I'm going to try to be confident, but not cocky.
column163: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Oh! Hey! Everyone, I am officially streamlining the efficiency of this corporation. Second...
column164: 03x05 - Initiation;Toby: Second?
column165: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Yes, second, Toby. Second, I am insisting on increased accountability from every single one of you.
column166: 03x05 - Initiation;Kevin: Account...? Michael, what is going on?
column167: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: And I will be taking questions.
column168: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Did you have a lot of sugar today, Michael?
column169: 03x05 - Initiation;Phyllis: What's on your suit?
column170: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Carmel Dip. But, one question at a time please. Phyllis, Stanley. I want you to switch desks, I'm going to reorganize and restructure the physical layout of the office to maximize everything! I think we're getting a lot done, don't you? On paper at least. And we are, after all, a paper company. Are we not, are we not, are we not? Are you with me, are you with me? Thank you very much!
column171: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: They really didn't like me.
column172: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: They did not. They didn't have to say it to your face.
column173: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: I don't get it. I don't get what I did wrong.
column174: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: Not everything's a lesson, Ryan. Sometimes you just fail. It's those online paper jerks. The whole business is changing. You know what? They're going to be screwed once this whole internet fad is over. What are you doing? [Ryan throws egg at building] Oh no no no no! Ryan! Yes! Ryan the temp! Come on! Courtesy of Dunder Mifflin. Come on! Drive.
column175: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: You drive.
column176: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Oh, hi Jan. He's, uh, on a sales call. No message? Bye, Jan.
column177: 03x05 - Initiation;Dwight: [Dwight chokes as Ryan downs a beer in one drink] Temp! Temp! Temp! Temp! Ryan! Ryan! Ryan! Ryan! Yes! Just think, that temp agency could have sent you anywhere.
column178: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: I think about that all the time.
column179: 03x05 - Initiation;Kevin: Night, Pam.
column180: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Night.
column181: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Hey, what time is it?
column182: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: 20 past 5.
column183: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: AM or PM?
column184: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: PM.
column185: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Oh, good.
column186: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: These came for you. Contracts? Brent Koselli?
column187: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Oh. Koselli. With the Jello.
column188: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: This is a huge sale.
column189: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Yes. Right. Good.
column190: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Night, Michael.
column191: 03x05 - Initiation;Michael: Goodnight!
column192: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: [phone rings] Dunder Mifflin.
column193: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Ah, hey.
column194: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Oh my God.
column195: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Hi.
column196: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Hi.
column197: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Sorry, I forgot Kevin's extension. It's a fantasy football thing.
column198: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Oh.
column199: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: And I was just going to go through the system cause I didn't think you'd be there. Why, why are you still there?
column200: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: I had to work late. Jan's making me keep a log of everything Michael does all day.
column201: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Wow. Do you think you could send me a copy of that?
column202: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Yeah, totally. So...
column203: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: So...
column204: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Do you...
column205: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Oh, I'm sorry. Go ahead.
column206: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Uh, no, I um. Everything's pretty much the same here.
column207: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Oh, good.
column208: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: A little different. What time is it there?
column209: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: What time is it here? Um, we're in the same time zone.
column210: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Oh, yeah. Right.
column211: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: How far away did you think we were?
column212: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: I don't know. It felt far.
column213: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Yeah. I have a question for you.
column214: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: What?
column215: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: How many words per minute does the average person type?
column216: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: I type 90.
column217: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Shut up. Mavis Beacon doesn't even type 90.
column218: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: It's true.
column219: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Ok, I said average.
column220: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: 70? How many do you type?
column221: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Forget it. I was just about to brag but forget it.
column222: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Come on. Tell me.
column223: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: No.
column224: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: You have to tell me now.
column225: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: 65. Ok, no need to laugh.
column226: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: No, it's, that's respectable.
column227: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Respectable?
column228: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: So ok. I'm watching the movie, by myself...
column229: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Right.
column230: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Because I just wanted a relaxing evening at home...
column231: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Ok.
column232: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: And, I'm freaking out.
column233: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Yeah.
column234: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: That movie is so scary!
column235: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: I know!
column236: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: But I'm holding on because I keep waiting for Sandra Bullock to show up.
column237: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: No way. How do you confuse 28 Days with 28 Days Later?
column238: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Because I got it at Blockbuster and they don't put the pictures on the box.
column239: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: No, you're making this up!
column240: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Would I make that up?
column241: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Yes. Fancy New Beesley would make that up. New apartment, new stories.
column242: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Oh, yeah, in my fancy new apartment. I have one bedroom, one bathroom, and a closet.
column243: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: And how many kitchens?
column244: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: I have one kitchen.
column245: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Wow, you got totally taken for a ride Beesley.
column246: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: It's actually...
column247: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Most apartments these days have like three.
column248: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Three kitchens?
column249: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Yes! How are you going to cook every meal of the day in one kitchen?
column250: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: [Ryan and Dwight enter] Hey, Ryan, are you ok?
column251: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Pam?
column252: 03x05 - Initiation;Ryan: Yeah. Yeah.
column253: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Pam?
column254: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Um. Ok, bye.
column255: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Oh, yeah, I should, I should, I should probably go too.
column256: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: No, I was um...
column257: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Oh, no no.
column258: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: You have to go?
column259: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Yeah, uh, well.
column260: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: No, I should probably go too.
column261: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Ok.
column262: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: I mean, yeah.
column263: 03x05 - Initiation;Jim: Yeah. Bye Pam.
column264: 03x05 - Initiation;Pam: Bye Jim.
column265: 03x05 - Initiation;Stanley: Three hundred and sixty four days, 'till the next Pretzel Day.

column1: 03x06 - Diwali;Kelly: Here you go.
column2: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: Nice dress, Ryan.
column3: 03x06 - Diwali;Kelly: It's not a dress. It's a kurta.
column4: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: [laughing] OK.
column5: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: Tonight, one of our most ethnic co-workers, Kelly, has invited us all to a Diwali celebration put on by her community. What is Diwali, you may ask? Well, to have Kelly explain it [girly voice] it's ada blah blah blah, it's so super fun and it's going to be great. [normal voice] Lot of gods with unpronounceable names. Twenty minutes later you find out that is essentially a Hindu Halloween.
column6: 03x06 - Diwali;Kelly: You look so handsome.
column7: 03x06 - Diwali;Pam: Really you do. I love the material.
column8: 03x06 - Diwali;Kelly: I know.
column9: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: How come you didn't get me one?
column10: 03x06 - Diwali;Kelly: I...
column11: 03x06 - Diwali;Phyllis: Ok, so, between Meredith's Mini-van and if I borrow Bob's Yukon that should fit about twelve people.
column12: 03x06 - Diwali;Pam: I actually might not go. Feeling kind of tired.
column13: 03x06 - Diwali;Meredith: Do you want to make Appletini's and watch 's*x and the City' at my place?
column14: 03x06 - Diwali;Pam: Oh, I don't know. I haven't decided yet.
column15: 03x06 - Diwali;Kelly: I don't get why you won't go. Did I do something wrong? I mean, I thought we were really close friends.
column16: 03x06 - Diwali;Pam: I just feel kind of tired, you know.
column17: 03x06 - Diwali;Dwight: Maybe you've got mono.
column18: 03x06 - Diwali;Pam: Maybe. I just ...I don't really have anyone to go with.
column19: 03x06 - Diwali;Kelly: Well, go with Dwight. He's single, too. Right?
column20: 03x06 - Diwali;Dwight: Yeah, totally single. Hundred percent available.
column21: 03x06 - Diwali;Kevin: Are you guys going to this Indian thing tonight?
column22: 03x06 - Diwali;Roy: I don't know. Who's... uh, who's going?
column23: 03x06 - Diwali;Kevin: Oooh. Do you mean like, is Pam going?
column24: 03x06 - Diwali;Angela: Don't go. They eat monkey brains.
column25: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: Hey. Hey. Stop that. That is offensive. Indians do not eat monkey brains. And if they do... sign me up... because I am sure that they are very tasty and nutritional.
column26: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: It's important that this company celebrates its diversity. And you know what, Stanley? Come Kwanzaa time, I have got you covered, baby.
column27: 03x06 - Diwali;Stanley: I don't celebrate Kwanzaa.
column28: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: Wha? Really? You should! It's fun.
column29: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: I love the people here. And if there was one thing I di... don't really care for is that they can be terribly, terribly ignorant about other cultures. And I don't want them embarrassing me in front of my girlfriend, Carol.
column30: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: Diwali is a very important holiday for the Hindus. But, frankly, I'm a little appalled that none of you know very much about Indian culture. So, without further ado, Kelly you are on.
column31: 03x06 - Diwali;Kelly: Um... Diwali is awesome... and there's food... and there's going to be dancing... and... Oh! I got the raddest outfit. It has, um...
column32: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: Kelly?
column33: 03x06 - Diwali;Kelly: Sparkles...
column34: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: Um... why don't you tell us a little bit about the origins of the holiday.
column35: 03x06 - Diwali;Kelly: Oh, um... I don't know. It's really old, I think.
column36: 03x06 - Diwali;Angela: How many gods do you have?
column37: 03x06 - Diwali;Kelly: Like hundreds, I think. Maybe more than that.
column38: 03x06 - Diwali;Angela: [points at picture on the wall] And that blue busty gal? What's her story?
column39: 03x06 - Diwali;Kevin: She looks like Pam from the neck down.
column40: 03x06 - Diwali;Dwight: Pam wishes. [generalized laughing] Kelly, I'll take this one. Diwali is a Celebration of the Coronation of the God-King Rama. After his epic battle with Ravana, the Demon King of Lanka. It symbolizes the battle between good and evil...
column41: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: All right, all right, all right, all right. This isn't 'Lord of the Rings'.
column42: 03x06 - Diwali;Jim: Sorry.
column43: 03x06 - Diwali;Jim: I started biking into work. Josh does it and he lives a lot farther away than I do. And also it saves gas money, keeps me in shape... helps the environment. And now I know it makes me really sweaty for work.
column44: 03x06 - Diwali;Karen: Nice basket.
column45: 03x06 - Diwali;Jim: Thank you.
column46: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: Now, a lot of people say that Kelly is one in a million and that's true, but it's also not true. Because, frankly, there are literally billions of people just like Kelly in the world. Here are some famous Indians. [slide show] Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar. He is a Nobel prize-winning physicist. Impressive. Apu from the Simpsons. Hilarious. Indian. M. Night Shyamalan. 'The Village', 'Unbreakable', 'Sixth Sense', 'Sig... '
column47: 03x06 - Diwali;Dwight: I see dead people.
column48: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: Okay. Spoiler... alert.
column49: 03x06 - Diwali;Dwight: He was dead the whole time.
column50: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: Just stop it. [slide of Michael & Carol kissing] What's the... oh, whoa! [laughs] Where did that come from?
column51: 03x06 - Diwali;Tony: Karen, my chips got stuck in the vending machine again. I need your skinny, little arms.
column52: 03x06 - Diwali;Karen: Oh. Did you shake it?
column53: 03x06 - Diwali;Tony: Yeah, I shook it, I shook it.

column55: 03x06 - Diwali;Jim: 'Scuse me?
column56: 03x06 - Diwali;Andy: Roller-coastery friendship. Hot. Cold. On again. Off again. Sexual tension filled type of deal. It's very Sam and Diane.
column57: 03x06 - Diwali;Jim: Wow.
column58: 03x06 - Diwali;Andy: From 'Cheers'.
column59: 03x06 - Diwali;Jim: Yup.
column60: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: And another thing about the Indian people... they love s*x positions. I present to you the Kama Sutra. I mean look at that. Who's seen that before?
column61: 03x06 - Diwali;Creed: I have. That's the 'Union of the Monkey'.
column62: 03x06 - Diwali;Meredith: Oh, that's what they call it.
column63: 03x06 - Diwali;Kevin: This is the best meeting we've ever had.
column64: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: Thank you, Kevin.
column65: 03x06 - Diwali;Angela: I find this incredibly offensive.
column66: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: Well, I find it beautiful.
column67: 03x06 - Diwali;Angela: Well, whatever Kelly wants to do in her own house is fine but we shouldn't all be subjected to it.
column68: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: No...
column69: 03x06 - Diwali;Toby: Actually, she's right. This isn't appropriate. Why don't I take these.
column70: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: No, You're not going to collect them.
column71: 03x06 - Diwali;Toby: Yes.
column72: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: No. This is delightful, charming culture.
column73: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: My Indian Culture Seminar was going great until Toby decided that he was too immature to deal with culturally explicit images. It's just s*x. People... everybody does it. I'm doing it... with Carol! Probably tonight.

column75: 03x06 - Diwali;Karen: Thanks.

column77: 03x06 - Diwali;Karen: Got it.
column78: 03x06 - Diwali;Jim: Once a quarter, the sales staff at this branch has to stay late to do order form consolidation... which, amazingly, is even less interesting than it sounds.

column91: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: I'll have one of those as well. Thank you very much. Now these are limes, lemons, onions...

column101: 03x06 - Diwali;
column102: 03x06 - Diwali;

column107: 03x06 - Diwali;Kelly: Ruka, Nipa, Tiffany. Stop acting like such little losers and just be cool. Come on, Ryan. Come on. Leave him alone. I hate you guys.

column116: 03x06 - Diwali;Kelly: Uh... excuse me. I want to get a...

column124: 03x06 - Diwali;Karen: Ooh.

I'm sorry, could I have your attention, please. Thank you. Ah-hah... Hi. Sorry. I just have an announcement to make. Um... okay. I have learned a lot about Indian culture tonight. But I have learned even more about love. And I know you're all thinking 'who is this crazy gringo and what is he talking about?' Well, I'm not crazy. Maybe I'm crazy in love. So without further ado, Carol? Carol Stills. I would like you to do me the honor of making me your husband.

column143: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: [lowers microphone] Oh, you've got to be kidding me. Okay.

column151: 03x06 - Diwali;Carol: Okay, good night, Michael.

column156: 03x06 - Diwali;Kelly's Mom: ...to start a family and home.

column171: 03x06 - Diwali;Andy: Wait, wait.
column172: 03x06 - Diwali;Andy and Jim: [sing] the less I seek my source...

column177: 03x06 - Diwali;Andy: TUNA! Are you kidding me!!

column187: 03x06 - Diwali;Pam: Yeah.
column188: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: Yeah. Uuuuh... well.
column189: 03x06 - Diwali;Pam: I kind of thought something would happen tonight too.
column190: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: We're so alike. So alike. [leans in to kiss her]
column191: 03x06 - Diwali;Pam: What are you doing?
column192: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: What are you doing?
column193: 03x06 - Diwali;Pam: I'm rejecting your...
column194: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: I'm... what? I didn't
column195: 03x06 - Diwali;Pam: ...kiss.
column196: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: [scoffing noises] Can I have a ride home?
column197: 03x06 - Diwali;Pam: If you sit in the back.
column198: 03x06 - Diwali;Karen: Goodnight, guys.
column199: 03x06 - Diwali;Jim: Can I have a ride, man? I... uh... I have my bike.
column200: 03x06 - Diwali;Andy: No way, dude. I am not driving home. I have brought an inflatable bed for just such occasions. You're welcome to share it though. It's a roomy twin.
column201: 03x06 - Diwali;Jim: Okay.
column202: 03x06 - Diwali;Jim: Oh.
column203: 03x06 - Diwali;Karen: Hey dummy, get in the car!
column204: 03x06 - Diwali;Jim: I'm a drunk driver.
column205: 03x06 - Diwali;Karen: Yes, you are. Here. Let me take that. Just... uh... get in the car.
column206: 03x06 - Diwali;Jim: Man, you can really hold your liquor, Billabelli.
column207: 03x06 - Diwali;Karen: Yeah, you can't.
column208: 03x06 - Diwali;Jim: No kidding. And I am just going to lie down in the back, if that's all right.
column209: 03x06 - Diwali;Karen: Sure. Here's your bag. Just don't puke on anything. You okay?
column210: 03x06 - Diwali;Jim: So good.
column211: 03x06 - Diwali;Karen: Good.
column212: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: These are not my shoes. This is just like that show 'Taxi Cab Confessions'.
column213: 03x06 - Diwali;Pam: You say one more word; I'm stopping the car.
column214: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: Sorry.
column215: 03x06 - Diwali;Michael: This is going out to Indians everywhere. It's a tribute to one of the greats... Mr. Adam Sandler. [sings] Diwali is a festival of lights. Let me tell you something. Tonight has been one crazy night. So put on your saris, it's time to celebrate Diwali. Everybody looks so jolly. But it's not Christmas, it's Diwali. The goddess of destruction Kali stopped by to celebrate Diwali. Don't invite any zombies to a celebration of Diwali. Along came Polly to have some fun at Diwali. If you're Indian and you love to party, have a happy, happy, happy, happy Diwali. Happy Diwali!
column216: 03x06 - Diwali;Crowd: [loud clapping, cheering, and whistling]

column1: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Karen: Hey.
column2: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: Hey.
column3: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Karen: Who are you faxing so early in the morning?
column4: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: Oh, umm... kinda hard to explain.
column5: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: I don't have a ton of contact with the Scranton branch, but, before I left, I took a box of Dwight's stationery, so, from time to time, I send Dwight faxes. From himself. From the future. [reading fax] "Dwight, at 8 A.M. today, someone poisons the coffee. Do not drink the coffee. More instructions will follow. Cordially, Future Dwight."
column6: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: No![knocks coffee out of Stanley's hand.] You'll thank me later.
column7: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: There she is - Jan Levinson. First...
column8: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Michael.
column9: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: ...thing in the morning. Love to start my morning with a hearty bowl of Jan.
column10: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Michael.
column11: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: [singing] Just call me Levinson in the morning, baby.
column12: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Michael.
column13: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Yes.
column14: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: I am here to tell you that we are closing the Scranton branch.
column15: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: I don't understand.
column16: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: The board voted last night to close your branch.
column17: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: On whom's authority?
column18: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: The board's.
column19: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: What?
column20: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: I'm very sorry. I don't relish telling you this. You've been a big part of this company, and the board asked me to thank you for your years of service.
column21: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: You're welcome.
column22: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: A small number of people will be transferred to the Stamford branch, and the rest will be getting severance packages.
column23: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Am I a small number person or a severance package person?
column24: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Well, we haven't made final decisions about personnel yet. But you're a severance package person.
column25: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Oh... [burrys head in hands] Oh, my god. Oh, my god! I don't really get it 'cause we're not doing that bad and our numbers are gonna come up.
column26: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Well, it's not all about numbers, Michael.
column27: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Well...
column28: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: It's... it's about talent.
column29: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Oh, you gotta be... Josh?
column30: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Our CFO believes that Josh is going to play an important role in our company's future.
column31: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Oh really, what role is that? King of the stupid universe?
column32: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: It is an outrage, that's all. It's... hey're making a huge, huge mistake. Let's see Josh replace these people. Let's see Josh find another Stanley. You think Stanleys grow on trees? Well they don't. There is no Stanley tree. Do you think the world is crawling with Phyllises? Show me that farm. With Phyllises and Kevins sprouting up all over the place. Ripe for the plucking. Show me that farm.
column33: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Pictures. Memories. [Picks up a framed photo of Stanley's daughter from Stanley's desk] Look at that. They grow up so fast.
column34: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Hey stranger.
column35: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Don't say that. That just sounds weird. Please.
column36: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Sorry. I just feel like we haven't talked in awhile.
column37: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Well... we have nothin to talk about, Dwight. Just do your work ... while you still can.
column38: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight : When you become close with someone, you develop a kind of sixth sense. You can read their moods like a book. And right now, the title of Michael's book is, "Something Weird is Going On." Colon, "What Did Jan Say? The Michael Scott Story. By Michael Scott, with Dwight Schrute."
column39: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Karen: Hey, um... did you hear about your friends in Pennsylvania? Rumor has it that the Scranton Branch is... [clicks her tongue to her mouth motions chopping off a head]
column40: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: Really? Wow... that's bad.
column41: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Andy: Um, sorry... the Scranton branch is closing? [Karen nods and Andy looks at Jim] In your face!
column42: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: Well, I work here now.
column43: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Andy: Mmmm.. suck-ah!
column44: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: Are you okay?
column45: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Yeah, great! Amazing. Best physical condition of my life.
column46: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: What did Jan want?
column47: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Nothing. Just checking in. I can't tell you, so...
column48: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: What can't you tell me?
column49: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Nothing, Pam.[whispers to himself] What difference does it make? We'll be gone in a couple of weeks anyway.
column50: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: What?!
column51: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: What?
column52: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: You just said that we're gonna be gone...?
column53: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Do I have any messages?
column54: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: Michael, what's going on?
column55: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Ok, ok...
column56: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: [facing the whole office] Listen up, everybody... I have some news. We are screwed. Dunder-Mifflin, Scranton is being shut down.
column57: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Toby: Michael, uh... we shouldn't be talking about this until all the decisions have been made.
column58: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: You knew about this all along, didn't you?
column59: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Toby: Jan told me just a few minutes before she told you.
column60: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Traitor. You are a traitor.
column61: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Angela: What about us, Michael? Do we still have jobs?
column62: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: I don't know. Probably not. This is the worst.
column63: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Ryan: It makes perfect sense that it would happen today because I just received this in the mail. [holds up cards] A thousand business cards with this address and phone number.
column64: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Angela: I don't want to blame anyone in particular. I think everyone's to blame.
column65: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Kelly: If I get to stay and Ryan is laid off, I will kill myself. Like Romeo and Juliet, the Claire Danes one.
column66: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Andy: [surrounded by clapping coworkers] Stamford, Connecticut! Stamford, Connecticut!
column67: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: I worked in Scranton for a really long time. And uh, it's going to be weird that it's all disappearing. I mean, I always knew that the branch would shut down someday. I just figured it would be because Michael sold the building for some magic beans.
column68: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Stanley: I couldn't be happier. I'm gonna take the severance and retire. My wife and I are gonna travel. [chuckles] I really couldn't be happier.
column69: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: It's a blessing in disguise. Actually, not even in disguise. Sometimes at home, I answer the phone, "Dunder-Mifflin, this is Pam." So, maybe that'll stop now.
column70: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Roy: What does that mean?
column71: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Kevin: Well, some of us are fired and a few are going to Connecticut.
column72: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Roy: I don't really want to work here without Pam. You know that Cinderella song, "You Don't Know What You Got (Till It's Gone)"? That pretty much says it better than how I know how to say it... in words.
column73: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Darryl: Hey Mike.
column74: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Darryl. Noble Darryl. [sighs]
column75: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Darryl: Look, I heard about the office. Tough break.
column76: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: I know, I know. Well, I'll land on my feet. Don't worry about me.
column77: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Darryl: I wasn't.
column78: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: So, you'll be okay too. You're a warrior. You're smart, capable. You'll find something else and...
column79: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Darryl: Actually, Bob Vance bought out the warehouse. So he's keeping on the whole crew. So, we good.
column80: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Awesome.
column81: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: This is my house. The CFO is taking away my house and giving it to Josh. And Josh is giving the garage to Bob Vance.
column82: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: All right, listen up. Some of you may have heard some rumors about the branch closing. But, I am not going to take this lying down. I have a plan and I am going to save our jobs. So just hang in there. [Looks at Dwight] Let's go.
column83: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Yes!
column84: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: Oh, good... you're bringing Dwight.
column85: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Yes. This might get ugly. I need backup.
column86: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: What's the plan?
column87: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Go to New York, confront the CFO, show him he's making a mistake... save the branch.
column88: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Can I drive?
column89: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: No... way.
column90: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Shotgun!
column91: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: No. There's no one else.
column92: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Still.
column93: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Thank you very much. [hangs up cell phone] Okay, secretary says Wallace is away for the day and won't be coming back into the office.
column94: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Okay, okay. Um...
column95: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: But, do not worry. I have his home address right [presses cell phone button] here.
column96: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Why?
column97: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Christmas card list.
column98: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: You sent him cards? You never met him.
column99: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: But when I do, we'll have something to talk about.
column100: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: Hey, do you have a second?
column101: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Josh: Sure, what's up?
column102: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: I know it's not definite or whatever, but uh, do you know who's coming over here from Scranton?
column103: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Josh: I honestly don't. I don't know.
column104: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: Okay, so is it like sales or... accountants?
column105: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Josh: You know what, Jim, I wouldn't worry about it.
column106: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: What does that mean?
column107: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Hi.
column108: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Josh: Jan, hey.
column109: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Oh, good. You're both here. Ready to talk logistics?
column110: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Ryan: [to Kelly] I just feel like it could have been something special if we could have kept working together, but I'm gonna go someplace else and you're gonna go someplace else. It just doesn't make sense.
column111: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Ryan: This kinda worked out perfectly for me. I got some good experience. Uh, Michael's gonna write me a great recommendation. And as far as me and Kelly goes, I think it's for the best.
column112: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Okay, this is it. [runs up the stairs of CFO's house, with Dwight] This is exactly what Michael Moore does, famous documentarian. He goes up to people with a camera and he's like "Why did you do this? Why did you pollute? You are bad. You're a bad person." It's very dramatic. Although, I can't say I was a big fan of 'Bowling for Columbine', because I thought it was going to be a bowling movie, like 'Kingpin'. And it wasn't. It was something else.
column113: 03x07 - Branch Closing;
column114: 03x07 - Branch Closing;
column115: 03x07 - Branch Closing;
column116: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: So, Josh will be running what is now called Dunder-Mifflin ,Northeast, which is all the offices north of Stamford. And Jim, fi you want the job, you'll be his number two.
column117: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Josh: Wow. Uh, sure. Absolutely.
column118: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Awesome.
column119: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Josh: Excuse me, Jan, I'm sorry... I'm gonna have to stop you there. I, um, will not be taking the job.
column120: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Wha... excuse... why not?
column121: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Josh: As of today, I have accepted a senior managment position at Staples.
column122: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Today?
column123: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Josh: [nods]
column124: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: You leveraged your new position with us into another offer?
column125: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Josh: [sighs]
column126: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Damn it, Josh. This whole restructuring thing was based around keeping you. I...
column127: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Josh: I'm sorry, all right? It's done, it's done.
column128: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: I'm gonna make some calls.
column129: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: Say what you will about Michael Scott, but he would never do that.
column130: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: So, do you know what you're gonna say when he shows up?
column131: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: I will improvise. I will speak from the heart.
column132: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: No. Bad idea. You need an attack plan. Here, I'll be him, you be you. Let's practice.
column133: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: All right.
column134: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: [as David Wallace] Dum, dum, dum, dum... coming home from work.
column135: 03x07 - Branch Closing;M ichael: Excuse me, Mr. Wallace? David Wallace?
column136: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Yes? What is the meaning of this?
column137: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael : Can you tell us why you are shutting down Scranton and putting 15 people out of work?
column138: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Well, the branch is no longer finicially viable. It's simple dollars and cents.
column139: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Yes, but these are employees, Sir. These are human beings.
column140: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Listen, Scott... we're losing money, okay? It's not a charity; it's a business. And it's a dying business.
column141: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: [no longer talking to Dwight as Wallace] Stop... stop it! Just, okay. He's not going to say any of that.
column142: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: [as himself] Whoa hey, why not?
column143: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Because he'd be intimidated and I, just... let's start again. Just be more scared of me, okay?
column144: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Okay.
column145: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Don't touch me this time.
column146: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: [as David Wallace] Dum, dum, dum, du, doy, du, do... coming home from work...
column147: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Excuse me, Mr. Wallace?
column148: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: [frightened] Uh!
column149: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: So... we are still scrambling here. But uh, it looks like Scranton is going to absorb Stamford.
column150: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: Wow.
column151: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: And I know that you just left there a couple of months ago, but we would like to offer you the number two position at that branch.
column152: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: Thank you.
column153: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Yeah.
column154: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: No, it's just I'm not sure if I um... well to be quite honest with you, Jan, I have a few unpleasant memories of Scranton. And um...
column155: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Michael.
column156: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: No. No, no. Just um... some personal stuff. And I'm not really ready to revist that, I don't think.
column157: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Ah. Well, please think about it. And call me. We will do whatever we can to get you to stay.
column158: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: Okay.
column159: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Phyllis: Hey guys. Uh, I'm trying to organize a little group lunch for everybody since you know, we're never gonna see each other again.
column160: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Kevin: Where are we going?
column161: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Phyllis: I thought maybe DJ's.
column162: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Kevin: How about Cugino's?
column163: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Angela: I don't want to go all the way to Dunmore.
column164: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Kevin: How 'bout Cooper's then?
column165: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Angela: No seafood.
column166: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Kevin: But, I don't want to go to DJ's.
column167: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Angela: Oh, now all of a sudden you get picky?
column168: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Phyllis: Okay, forget it. [walks away]
column169: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Kevin: Hooters?
column170: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Angela: No.
column171: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Ah. [takes a gulp of Gatorade and passes the bottle to Michael] Here, replinish your fluids.
column172: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: [takes bottle and cleans off cap with his tie]
column173: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: [in Scranton] Where's Michael?
column174: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: He's not here. I don't know where he is.
column175: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: [looks around, noticing that no one is working] Wha... what's going on here?
column176: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Phyllis: We know the branch is closing; Michael told us.
column177: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Ah, god. Okay. You know what everybody? I'm sure there is a better way to do this but I've drive something like 400 miles today and I'm completely exhausted so I'm just gonna tell you. Your branch is not closing; Stamford is closing. Um, for the time being, it seems that all your jobs are safe.
column178: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Angela: Yes!
column179: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Kevin: Yes! [hugs Angela]
column180: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Phyllis: Stanley! [hugs Stanley]
column181: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: Is it because of Michael? Did he actually do something?
column182: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Well, reasons are not important. Would you just call him, please? Wherever he is... and tell him.
column183: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: Sure, uh, Jan... um, do you know, is anyone coming back to Scranton?
column184: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Back?
column185: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: Coming to Scranton. Is anyone coming to Scranton?
column186: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jan: Uh, we don't know. Probably. A few.
column187: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: [referring to Michael's ringing phone] who is it?
column188: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: The office.
column189: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Gonna get it?
column190: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: No, not until I have some good news for them. Not until I have some good news.
column191: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: I guess some new people might be coming from Stamford. Should be fun. New blood.
column192: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Ryan: Is Jim coming back.
column193: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: That's, um... I hadn't thought about it, huh.
column194: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Ryan: I just don't want it to be weird, you know? I mean, I took his old job and his old desk.
column195: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: Yeah, that might be weird. Overall though, we still all have our jobs... so, good news, right?
column196: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Ryan: Oh, yeah, totally.
column197: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Kelly: Ahhhhh! [hugs Ryan] I'm so happy we don't have to break up now, Ryan! [kisses him] This is the best day of my whole l ife!
column198: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Karen: What you gonna do?
column199: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: I really don't know. How you doing with all this?
column200: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Karen: You know, I'm fine. I'll be better when I know if I have a job.
column201: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: You'd actually move to Scranton?
column202: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Karen: Yeah, if they let me, I think I... I think I would.
column203: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: New York City is 45 minutes down the road from here. And you wanna move to Scranton? I dunno. If I were you I'd move to New York?
column204: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Karen: Yeah, you know... I might do that. I, who knows? I... I might do that.
column205: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Josh: Hey Andy!
column206: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Andy: [after screaming and throwing papers around in the kitchen] What's up, Josh?
column207: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Josh: I just want to say thanks. Good luck.
column208: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Andy: Thanks, man. You, too. Totally.
column209: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Anything?
column210: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Nothing. [puts down binoculars]
column211: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: What if this doesn't work? What is the office actually goes under?
column212: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Then it was an honor to have worked with you.
column213: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: [pats Dwight and sighs] All right, favorite moments in Dunder-Mifflin history. Go.
column214: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: My first day when you hazed me by spraying me with a fire extinguisher.
column215: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: That was hilarious. The foam ...
column216: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Uh,... my first sale, my promotion to assistant regional manager, our basketball game, when you took me to the hospital, and told me that you cared about me.
column217: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Oh, right. Okay, that's enough. That's good.
column218: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: What were your favorite moments?
column219: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Oh, hmm, all of them. I loved them all. Every single one.
column220: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: What about when Jan said the branch was closing?
column221: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: God, Dwight!
column222: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Well, it doesn't...
column223: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Kevin: Hey Pam, we're going to Poor Richards. Creed's buying shots.
column224: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: No thanks, guys.
column225: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Kevin: All right.
column226: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: Have fun though.
column227: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Kevin: Cool.
column228: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Phyllis: Hey, I hear Jim's coming back.
column229: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: Really? Where did you hear that?
column230: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Phyllis: I was...
column231: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Kevin: [interupting] Hey Ryan, you coming?
column232: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Ryan: Uh yeah, we'll meet you there.
column233: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Kevin: Awesome. Let's go, Phyllis.
column234: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Phyllis: [to Pam] I'll tell you later.
column235: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: Okay.
column236: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Roy: Crazy day, huh?
column237: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: Yeah.
column238: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Roy: Yeah, man! I'm uh... I'm really glad you're still gonna be working here.
column239: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: Yeah, me too.
column240: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Pam: Maybe this is good. Finding another job is a pain. There's another annoying boss, another desk, I'd have to learn everything all over again. So, there are reasons to stay.
column241: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: Hey, um, I think I am gonna take that job. And Scranton... it's not that bad. So, if they offer you a job there, I think you should take it.
column242: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Karen: Okay, yeah. Maybe I will.
column243: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Jim: Okay.
column244: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Karen: Yeah, I'm happy he said that. I mean, I don't think he's into me or anything, but, I'm kind of into him. So...there you go.
column245: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: What are we still doing here? It's over. Let's go home. Get the car.
column246: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: [picks up his beeping cell phone]
column247: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Oh, this was such a stupid idea! This was so stupid. I am such a stupid idiot. I let everybody down. Everybody hates me. I lost everybody's jobs. Nobody likes me anymore!
column248: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: [on the phone] Oh my God!
column249: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: What?!
column250: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight:: Stranford is closed! Michael, we're not closed. Stamford is closed. Stamford is closed.
column251: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: We did it? We did it.
column252: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: We did it!
column253: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael and Dwight: We did it! We did it!
column254: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Right here! Right here! [pounds his chest against Dwight's]
column255: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael and Dwight: Ouu! Ou! Ouu! Ouu!
column256: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: Yeah, baby!
column257: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: In your face!
column258: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: We did it!
column259: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: Oh, man.
column260: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: How did we do it?
column261: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Dwight: I don't ... have no idea.
column262: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Michael: I don't understand.
column263: 03x07 - Branch Closing;Toby: Well for a minute there, I saw myself selling my house, moving to Costa Rica, learning how to surf. But, Costa Rica will still be there. When I'm 65.

column1: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: The Stamford branch is closing and everybody's just packing up their stuff. Andy Bernard made these tasteful hats.
column2: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: [to office worker] That's the other thing you got to watch out... [to Jim] Yo! Tuna! I wanna talk to you about this new boss, Michael Scott.
column3: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Yeah.
column4: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: So what's he like? Likes? Dislikes? Favorite sports? Favorite movies? Favorite men's magazines?
column5: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: You know what? I think you just need to meet him.
column6: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Playing your cards close to the vest. I get it. Good luck over there, Tuna. Cross me and I will destroy you.
column7: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Sounds good Andy.
column8: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: This is going to be an adventure.
column9: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Yes. This is going to be very interesting. All right, I'm out of here. See you later?
column10: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: Right on. [to Andy] Hey is that Josh's computer?
column11: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: What?
column12: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Hey!
column13: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: Hey.
column14: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: How'd the run go?
column15: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: Ah, pretty good. I finished.
column16: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: That's great!
column17: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Psh, why is that great?
column18: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Because he accomplished something.
column19: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: What was your mile time?
column20: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: About seven.
column21: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: [scoffs] I could beat that on a skateboard.
column22: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: Well, that has wheels.
column23: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Yeah, well my feet don't. And I can still crush that time.
column24: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Really, Dwight? How fast are you?
column25: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Let's just put it this way. Last weekend I outran a black pepper snake.
column26: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Really?
column27: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: I am fast. To give you a reference point. I'm somewhere between a snake and a mongoose. And a panther.
column28: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Man, what is taking Toby so long?
column29: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Oh, I'll just time him later.
column30: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: And you'll compare the times?
column31: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Yeah. Are you ready?
column32: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: No, my groin...
column33: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Set
column34: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: ...is really tight.
column35: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Go!
column36: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: I can't... [starts running]
column37: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Am I being mean to Dwight? I don't know. I did just make him run around the building and I have no intention of timing him. This isn't even a stopwatch. It's a digital thermometer. He does make my life harder, sometimes. And on purpose. Like he tried to put meters on the bathroom stalls as a way of bringing in more money for the company. [yells to Dwight] Hey, three more laps to go. Gotta pick it up if you're going to beat Toby.
column38: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Aaaaah!
column39: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: I should probably get back to work.
column40: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Here... Who's here?
column41: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Nametag?
column42: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Yes, please.
column43: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Karen Filippelli.
column44: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Karen Filip... [In Italian voice] Ka-ren Fili-pell-li.
column45: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Probably Italian. Possibly Filipino.
column46: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Okay.
column47: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: My branch is absorbing the Stamford branch. Or, as I like to put it, my family is doubling in size. That's all I'm going to say about it because I have a gigantic performance ahead of me. And I have to get into my head and focus. [exhales]
column48: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Who's next?
column49: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: That's Andy Bernard.
column50: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Andy Bernard.
column51: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: If I were you...
column52: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Saint Bernard.
column53: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: ...I would fire Anthony Gardner...
column54: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: What?
column55: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: ...before noon...
column56: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: I'm not...
column57: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: ...to consolidate power.
column58: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: I'm not firing somebody on the first day.
column59: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: No, no, no! Not somebody. Gardner.
column60: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: The Japanese camp guards of World War II always chose one man to kill whenever a batch of new prisoners arrived. I always wondered how they chose the man who was to die. I think I would have been good at choosing the person.
column61: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Good morning!
column62: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Got the food? Good! Looky-looky-looky. What I want you to do... set it up in the conference room, please. Make it look nice. As if you are trying to impress a much older man who's way out of your league.
column63: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Okay.
column64: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Yes! I'm in a good mood today! I'm excited to meet all the new people and to see my old friend again, definitely. That's always a thing that makes people happy... to have an old friend back.
column65: 03x08 - The Merger;Hannah: Hello?
column66: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Ah! Ding-ding-ding-ding-ding. Our first arrival. Welcome to Scranton. This is Hannah Smoterich-Barr.
column67: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Hannah Smoterich-Barr.
column68: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Welcome to our humble abode. Follow me to your desk. Your ball and chain is right over here.
column69: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: You know for a lot of these people this is the only family they have. So... As far as I'm concerned, [holds up WORLD'S BEST BOSS mug] this says 'World's Best Dad'.
column70: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Ah! There he is Tony... what's your last name?
column71: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: Gardner.
column72: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Gardner! I knew that. There you go. Gift bag... for you. [laughs] Okay.
column73: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: Thanks.
column74: 03x08 - The Merger;Kevin: Michael, I didn't get a gift bag.
column75: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Well, they're just for guests. If there are any left over, you can buy one later.
column76: 03x08 - The Merger;Hannah: My bag's mostly pencils.
column77: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Wh..and coupons... to various hot spots around Scranton. [to Tony] All right! Let me show you to your area, sir. Come on, big guy.
column78: 03x08 - The Merger;Kevin: Can I have your pencils?
column79: 03x08 - The Merger;Hannah: No.
column80: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Hi!
column81: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: Hi.
column82: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: I'm Pam.
column83: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: Karen. I love your sweater.
column84: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Oh, thanks. My Mom made it for me.
column85: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: Really? That's so cool. I've always wanted to learn...
column86: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Welcome.
column87: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: ...to knit.
column88: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Welcome, welcome, welcome! [in robot voice] Take me to your leader. Oh wait, I am your leader.
column89: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: Uh wait, are you a robot or a Martian?
column90: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Mmm... dah. I am actually your boss, Michael Scott. Welcome. Wow! You are very exotic looking. Was your dad a G.I. or uh?
column91: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: I'll be the Number Two guy here in Scranton in six weeks. How? Name repetition, personality mirroring, and never breaking off a handshake. I'm always thinking one step ahead. Like a carpenter that makes stairs.
column92: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Hello.
column93: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Ah! You must be Andy Bernard. Aloha and welcome!
column94: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: And you must be Michael Scott. Aloha and... hello.
column95: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: A-ha-ha-ho. Very good! Welcome to our little kingdom. Ah, we have a bag of nifty gifties for you.
column96: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Michael, thank you for welcoming me to your little kingdom, Mike.
column97: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Oh.
column98: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Nifty!
column99: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: They are nifty! They're nifty gifties.
column100: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: You know who I really like? Is this guy Andy Bernard. He has got this very likable way about him.
column101: 03x08 - The Merger;Martin: ...which is why they need a passing game.
column102: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Right.
column103: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: [to Jim] No way. Get him out of here. We don't want any of this kind in here. Good to see you, man.
column104: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Okay.
column105: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: [to Martin] How are you? Martin Nash, I presume? This is a little gift bag for you.
column106: 03x08 - The Merger;Martin: Oh! Thanks.
column107: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Free of charge. Follow me, I will show you where all the slaves work. [shakes head] Not... so, your desk is...
column108: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Hi, I'm Jim. I'm new here.
column109: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Oh my god! It's really you!
column110: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Yeah, I was just doing a little joke there about how we'd never met...
column111: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: I know. I don't care.
column112: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Awesome! Good to be back. The place looks really good.
column113: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: It's really good to see you.
column114: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: You, too.
column115: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Where do I stand with Pam? Um... no idea. I mean, we're friends. Always have been friends. Um... .that is where we stand.
column116: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Well, well, well. Look what the cat dragged in from Stamford.
column117: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Hey, Dwight.
column118: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Fact - I am older. I am wiser. Do not mess with me.
column119: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Okay. Sounds good.
column120: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: What are you doing?
column121: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: I don't know what you're talking about.
column122: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: I have a smudge on my forehead?
column123: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: No. Looks good.
column124: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Why are you looking at my forehead?
column125: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: I'm not.
column126: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Meet my eye line, Jim!
column127: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: I am.
column128: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Stop acting like an idiot!
column129: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Okay.
column130: 03x08 - The Merger;Ryan: Hey, buddy. Welcome back.
column131: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Hey! How are you man? Good to see... you.
column132: 03x08 - The Merger;Ryan: I'm good! How are you? So...
column133: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Oh, I'm sorry. Are you sitting here now?
column134: 03x08 - The Merger;Ryan: Yeah.
column135: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Oh.
column136: 03x08 - The Merger;Ryan: Um... unless you really, really want it back.
column137: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: You know, man, it's really you're call.
column138: 03x08 - The Merger;Ryan: Cool, thank you.
column139: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: [whispers] Let me get that for you.
column140: 03x08 - The Merger;Ryan: Yuh.
