column141: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: This one taken? No. Good.
column142: 03x08 - The Merger;Ryan: Yeah. Jim is a nice guy. That's why I got the desk.
column143: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: Hey, this came with the Stamford book. [Sets down box that says: Personnel Files Stamford CT Office Confidential] Can you take care of it?
column144: 03x08 - The Merger;Kevin: Oh, yes I can.
column145: 03x08 - The Merger;Kevin: In general, they do not give me much responsibility. But they do let me shred the company documents. And that is really all I need.
column146: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Michael Scott. Thank you. I appreciate it, Mike.
column147: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Right.
column148: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Hello. I don't believe we've been introduced. Dwight Schrute. Assistant Regional Manager.
column149: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Andy Bernard. Regional Director in Charge of Sales.
column150: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: So you'll be reporting to me, then.
column151: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Umm, on the contrary.
column152: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: My title has 'Manager' in it.
column153: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: And I'm a director.
column154: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Oh.
column155: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Which on a film set is the highest title there is. Do you know anything about film?
column156: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: I know everything about film. I've seen over 240 of them.
column157: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Congratulations.
column158: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Hey, Toby!
column159: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: Hey, Jim!
column160: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: How are you, man?
column161: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: Oh, really good.
column162: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: I just wanted to say hi.
column163: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: How are you? Hey. Welcome back. [puts out fist to bump]
column164: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Oh. Is that like your new thing?
column165: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: No, I'm sorry, it's...
column166: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: No. It's cool.
column167: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: No, it's nothing. We'll just... [shakes hand]
column168: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: All right. Good to be back.
column169: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: So... okay.
column170: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: All right.
column171: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: All right... sorry... sorry about that.
column172: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: No problem.
column173: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: It was just...
column174: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: [off camera] ...what?
column175: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: Nothing.
column176: 03x08 - The Merger;Kevin: This thing is so awesome. It will shred anything. Ooh! It will shred a CD. It will shred... a credit card. It will shred... oh! [whispers] Shoot.
column177: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: [talking to himself] I present the orientation video.
column178: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: We need to talk!
column179: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Not now.
column180: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Which is higher? Assistant Regional Manager or Regional Director in Charge of Sales?
column181: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: I told you the titles are irrelevant. They just relate to pay scale.
column182: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Okay. So who gets paid more? Me or Andy?
column183: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: It is not a matter of more or less. Your pay is just different. Okay? All right! Show time, part one.
column184: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Ok. Who reports to who?
column185: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: I don't care! Dwight! You all report to me! That's all that matters! The rest of it just work out amongst yourselves, ok?
column186: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: And then if I want...
column187: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Work it out amongst your selves!
column188: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: I...
column189: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Please! I have a company to run. Well, you let me run the company?
column190: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: I...
column191: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Will you?
column192: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: One...
column193: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Please?
column194: 03x08 - The Merger;Kelly: Jim!
column195: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Kelly!
column196: 03x08 - The Merger;Kelly: Oh! Oh my god! I have so much to tell you!
column197: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Really?
column198: 03x08 - The Merger;Kelly: Yes! Tom Cruise and Katie Holmes? They had a baby and they named it Suri. And then Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie? They had a baby, too, and they named it Shiloh. And both babies are amazing!
column199: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Great. What's new with you?
column200: 03x08 - The Merger;Kelly: I just told you.
column201: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Okay. Everybody settled in? Good. Why don't we all proceed in to the conference room? Or, should I say, the banquet hall. For... drum roll, please [makes drum roll noises], the official Merger Day All-Family Welcome Breakfast. Come on in!
column202: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Yoko shack.
column203: 03x08 - The Merger;Male voice: ...thank you James. [laughs]
column204: 03x08 - The Merger;Meredith: Hey, champagne.
column205: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Nope, no. Guests only.
column206: 03x08 - The Merger;Kelly: Looks like salmon.
column207: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Nope. Um... for the guests it is. For you, consider it cow-meat. Strictly taboo.
column208: 03x08 - The Merger;Kelly: I eat beef.
column209: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Well, then... consider it poisoned beef. No touchy.
column210: 03x08 - The Merger;Kevin: The beef is poisoned?
column211: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: No, it's not beef... just... sit down, please. [talks to group] Welcome. Help yourself.
column212: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: Um... You might want these orientation materials.
column213: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Wrong. Toby, this is an orientation not a borientation.[talks to group] Okay. Do not worry. All of your questions are about to be answered. Cell phones and pagers off, please.
column214: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Oh, this looks promising.
column215: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: You won't be disappointed.
column216: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Let's face it. Moving to a new job can be very stressful. So I have made an orientation video especially for you newcomers. But it's not like any orientation video that any of you have ever seen. It's funny. It's got a little bit of a zing to it and I hope that it gives you a flavor of what we're all about here at Dunder Mifflin. And what we're all about here in Scranton. So let's just all laugh together and watch "Lazy Scranton".
column217: 03x08 - The Merger;Video: [Lazy Scranton Video]
column218: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Sittin' in my office with a plate of grilled bacon, call my man Dwight just to see what was shakin'.
column219: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Yo Mike, our town is dope and pretty.
column220: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: So check out how we live
column221: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael & Dwight: in the Electric City!
column222: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: They call it Scranton.
column223: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: What?
column224: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: The Electric City. Scranton.
column225: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: What?
column226: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: The Electric City. Call poison control if you're bit by a spider.
column227: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: But check that it's covered by your health care provider!
column228: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: It reminds me of the orientation video showed on my first day. 'The Scranton Witch Project'.
column229: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: [in video] I am so scared... when people don't label their personal food.
column230: 03x08 - The Merger;Video: [Lazy Scranton video continues]
column231: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: You like coal mines and you wanna see 'em, Well, check it out, yo, the Anthracite Museum! Plenty of space in the parking lot,
column232: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: But the little cars go in the compact spot
column233: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael and Dwight: Spot, spot, spot, spot ...
column234: 03x08 - The Merger;
column235: 03x08 - The Merger;
column236: 03x08 - The Merger;
column237: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: [on video in background] Spot. Scranton. What? The Electric City. Scranton.What? The Electric City. Scranton. What?
column238: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Well, so far, I think it is killin'. I thought it would either be an 'A' or an 'A+' but I completely forgot that there's an 'A++'.
column239: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: [recording phone message] This is Karen Filippelli. Please leave a message.
column240: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Terrible. Totally unconvincing.
column241: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: [recording] This is Karen Filippelli. Please leave a message.
column242: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Not bad, but you are Italian so... try it more Italian.
column243: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: [recording] [in bad Italian accent] Dis is Kar-en Fill-uh-pel-li. Please leava me da message. A bon danza.
column244: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: You feel good?
column245: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: Mm-hm.
column246: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: All right.
column247: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: [recording phone message] Karen Filippelli.
column248: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Hey, buddy. Anything new to report?
column249: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Do you mean to me? From you? Cause that's how it works.
column250: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Sure thing, buddy.
column251: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Am I trying to get under his skin? Yes. Because the angrier he gets, the more marginalized he becomes. Meanwhile, Andy Bernard is out there layin' on the charm.
column252: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Hey, Angela. Check this out. It's my new screen saver.
column253: 03x08 - The Merger;Angela: Oh.
column254: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Do you like it?
column255: 03x08 - The Merger;Angela: I do like it, actually.
column256: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Thank you. You have such a pretty smile by the way.
column257: 03x08 - The Merger;Angela: Thank you.
column258: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: You're welcome.
column259: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Hey.
column260: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Hey!
column261: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: What happened to grape soda?
column262: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Oh yeah. I'm trying to move away from that. Getting into more of a bottled water phase.
column263: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Oh. You've changed so much.
column264: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Well, I'm evolving, Pam.
column265: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: So when do I get to hear everything? Are you still getting unpacked or... you want to grab a coffee or something after work?
column266: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Oh! Um... tonight, actually? No. I'm uh just still getting settled.
column267: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Oh, yeah, no! You know. Whenever.
column268: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Okay.
column269: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Oh-kay. Sorry to interrupt. I...
column270: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Nope. You're not interrupting anything. Nope. I'm...
column271: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: All right.
column272: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Don't...
column273: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Okay.
column274: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: All right. [to Pam] I should probably get back to work. Get back to work.
column275: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Yeah. I know, me too.
column276: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: All right!
column277: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: The day's going fine. It's been a little chaotic but it's fine. It's great! A lot of distractions. But, it's good.
column278: 03x08 - The Merger;Hannah: [using breast pump] Take a picture. It'll last longer.
column279: 03x08 - The Merger;Ryan: I'm sorry. It's just, it's a little distracting.
column280: 03x08 - The Merger;Creed: Ditto that, my brother.
column281: 03x08 - The Merger;Hannah: Look what's on his computer.
column282: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: What is that? A squid's eye or...
column283: 03x08 - The Merger;Hannah: It's my left breast.
column284: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: How did you...
column285: 03x08 - The Merger;Creed: Right place at the right time.
column286: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: Uh, what's that smell?
column288: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: Must be an... air freshener plugged in somewhere. It smells like a funeral home.
column289: 03x08 - The Merger;Phyllis: Oh, I'll help you find it.
column290: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: Oh, you know. Never... .never mind.
column292: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: I... I... I, uh, think I'm just allergic to your perfume.
column294: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: It's just my crazy nose. I'm... uh, used to different smells.
column295: 03x08 - The Merger;Phyllis: Bob Vance bought this perfume for me in Metropolitan Orlando. It's made from real pine.
column297: 03x08 - The Merger;Phyllis: You have a lot to learn about this town, sweetie.
column298: 03x08 - The Merger;Stanley: I don't know who these new people think they are. I've sat downwind of Phyllis' stinky perfumes for years. Never said a word.
column299: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: People hate people that are different from them. That's natural. But you know what makes people forget their differences? A great show. That is why I created the 'Integration Celebration'. This is the moment when Scranton and Stamford come together as one. United in applause.
column300: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: I know what a lot of you must be thinking. 'Wow! What a day! Feels more like a night at a party than a day at work.' Well, in my opinion, business should feel like a night out. A night... at... the Roxbury. Okay. There's supposed to be music and it's... I got it, I got it! I got it. Dwight! Just.
column301: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Do you have batteries?
column303: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: [sings drum beat intro to 'What is Love?']
column307: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Baby, don't hurt me.
column308: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Okay, here we go.
column309: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy & Michael: Don't hurt me! Baby, don't hurt me!
column311: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Baby, don't hurt me!
column314: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Scuse me! Scuse me!
column316: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: You me? You me? Me you? You! You! You me! Bow Bow Bow!
column318: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: You me? You me? Me you me! You! You! You me you! You! Oh my nose so itchy, why's my nose so itchy!
column319: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Oh, probably because of all the nose candy.
column320: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: [laughs hysterically] Okay, I told you these guys had a sense of humor.
column324: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: All right, all right, I'm on a roll.
column325: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Why are the new people on the table? To show them that we are not above them.
column326: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: Shouldn't we be equals?
column327: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Not today. No. Tony! Please join your cohorts on the table if you would.
column328: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: Uh... this is difficult, for me.
column329: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: I understand. We're all friends.
column330: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: No. I mean I can't physically. I can't get on the table.
column331: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Oh, well. Just use the momentum of your lower half to hoist yourself up.
column333: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: You know what? I'll help. I will...
column335: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Don't be shy! Dwight! Let's do this!
column336: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Do this. Come on. Ready?
column337: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Come on. We're doing this thing! Let's get up.
column338: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: On three. One... two... three.
column339: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Bend at the knees. Okay, here we go. Here we go. I'm under this... I'm under this hock here. I don't know what I'm grabbing here.
column340: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: All right. All right. Stop. Put me down.
column341: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: We've almost got it. Push it! Push it!
column343: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: I'm right in your crack!
column344: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: Put me down right...
column348: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: Put me down right now!
column351: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: You've got it, you've got it.
column352: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: PUT ME DOWN RIGHT NOW or else!
column353: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Whoa Whoa Whoa! Okay.
column358: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: It's just not going to work for me.
column360: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: I have to go.
column362: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: I was on the fence about this and... it's just not a good fit.
column363: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Well, we'll squeeze you in.
column364: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: I can't work here. I have to quit.
column365: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: You can't quit! On the first day. That's [deep voice] heresy, my friend! [regular voice] Okay, let's talk about this. What happened? I mean, what... Was it Toby? Did he say something? Cause he's... what?
column366: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: No. Toby was helpful. He was very kind. It's just your management style.
column367: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: My management style? So... didn't you think 'Lazy Scranton' was funny?
column368: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: No. Was it supposed to be funny?
column369: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Okay. Well, don't bother quitting because you're fired.
column371: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: You are fired! I'm sorry, but we don't have quitters on this team! Just clean out your desk!
column372: 03x08 - The Merger;Tony: But there's nothing in my desk except coupons.
column373: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Don't try to apologize to me, man! It's too late. Just get out! Take your bad vibes with you.
column374: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: That was my advice. Remember? I'm the one who suggested that you fire him.
column375: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Probably the best advice you ever gave me, Dwight.
column376: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: And what advice has Andy given to you today that you have acted on? Would 'none' be an accurate estimate? None advice? [whispers] Fire Andy. Fire. Andy.
column377: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Dwight may have won the battle. But I will win... the next battle.
column378: 03x08 - The Merger;Hannah: Tony was right. This environment is dysfunctional.
column379: 03x08 - The Merger;Angela: Maybe that's because some people treat it like their own private Hooters strip club.
column380: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Whoa, Angela! Hold on. Hooters is a restaurant. With over 400 locations worldwide.
column381: 03x08 - The Merger;Stanley: Back to work. We don't have to get along. We just have to work together.
column382: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: No. We do have to get along. Can't we all just get along? Or have we forgotten the words of the Reverend King.
column383: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: The word merger comes from the word marriage. And that was what today was supposed to be. The loving union between people. Instead, it has become like when my Mom moved in with Jeff. And once again, it becomes my job to fix it.
column384: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Hey! Hey, everybody! Something happened! Those guys from Vance Refrigeration, they let the air out of our tires.
column386: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Yeah! They punk'd us! They punk'd us good! Come on. Come on!
column387: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: Does Bob Vance work for Vance Refrigeration?
column389: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Man, they got us so bad. We cannot let them get away with this. We have got to pull together as one and steal their refrigerators.
column392: 03x08 - The Merger;Toby: I don't... I don't think we can do that.
column393: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Go home, Toby. Just...
column394: 03x08 - The Merger;Martin: Hey! Why doesn't your car have a flat tire?
column395: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Why? I will tell you why. Because they saved the worst for me. They put a hate note under my windshield wiper. Check this out. It's so hateful. [reads note] "You guys SUCK! You can never pull together as one and revenge us. That is why you SUCK!"
column396: 03x08 - The Merger;Hannah: For crying out loud.
column397: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: No. No, no, no. No. You are falling for it. You're playing right into their hands. This is just what they want you to do. Don't, oh...
column398: 03x08 - The Merger;Martin: [to Stanley] What's up with this guy?
column399: 03x08 - The Merger;Stanley: Got an hour? I'll try to explain.
column400: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: THIS IS EGREGIOUS! This is egregious!
column401: 03x08 - The Merger;Stanley: Trust me. It only gets worse.
column402: 03x08 - The Merger;Martin: Is he always like this?
column403: 03x08 - The Merger;Ryan: Sometimes he brings more costumes.
column404: 03x08 - The Merger;Hannah: When do people work?
column405: 03x08 - The Merger;Phyllis: Oh, we find little times during the day.
column406: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: How are we going to get home?
column407: 03x08 - The Merger;Phyllis: Bob Vance has an air pump. He said he'd fill all our tires up.
column408: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: Bob Vance of Vance Refrigeration.
column409: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: See that? Mission accomplished. Like a bunch of fourth graders. Sometimes, what brings the kids together is hating the lunch lady. Although that'll change. Because, by the end of the fourth grade, the lunch lady was actually the person I hung out with the most. [answers phone] Jell-o!
column412: 03x08 - The Merger;Jan: Did you fire Tony Gardner when he was trying to quit?
column413: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: I did. Major personnel crises averted. Compliment accepted.
column414: 03x08 - The Merger;Jan: Do you realize, Michael, that we now have to pay him severance?
column417: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: But do you realize that that was actually Dwight's idea? Bad advice from my Number Two.
column418: 03x08 - The Merger;Jan: What? No. No. No, Jim is your Number Two.
column420: 03x08 - The Merger;Jan: He's the only one who has worked with both groups. I sent you a memo about this.
column421: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Yes, I know that. For, I do read the memos.
column422: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: So after a great deal of thought and introspective-shun, I have decided to make Jim my new Number Two.
column423: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: If he even wants it. It doesn't come with a pay raise.
column424: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Yeah, it does, actually.
column425: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: So who will be your new Number Three?
column426: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Uh... that I have not decided yet.
column427: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Michael, I would just like to say you have handled this entire situation with great aplomb.
column428: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Thank you, Andy. That's... very kind. Thanks.
column429: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: And I have to say your leadership...
column432: 03x08 - The Merger;Michael: Shut it! That's... [whispers to camera] suck up!
column433: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: [talking on cellphone] Hey! Where you at, Filippelli?
column434: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: [off camera] I'm at the grocery store buying a corkscrew to give myself a lobotomy.
column435: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: [laughs] What's wrong? You didn't have a good first day?
column436: 03x08 - The Merger;Karen: Oh my god! Hey! You want to meet at Cooper's in an hour? I need a drink.
column437: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Yeah. Sure. Sounds good. I... . [sees Pam in rearview mirror] Hey! You know what? Can I give you a call right back?
column443: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: I thought you had already... left.
column444: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Uh... no. I just uh had some other stuff I had to do.
column447: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Oh, nothing. I just feel bad. I feel like things were a little weird today... or something.
column448: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: What do you mean?
column449: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: I just think I should tell you that... I've sort of started seeing someone. And uh...
column450: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: Oh. That's totally cool. You can do whatever you want.
column452: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: We're friends. We'll always be friends.
column454: 03x08 - The Merger;Pam: It's good to have you back.
column455: 03x08 - The Merger;Jim: Yeah. Good to be back.
column456: 03x08 - The Merger;Meredith: Where'd you get that salad?
column458: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Saw your dorkmobile in the parking lot. What does it get, like four miles to the gallon?
column459: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Uh, try double that. Classic TransAm, vintage American muscle. Please.
column460: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Yeah, my Xterra's pretty sweet. Luxurious, yet rugged. Leave it to the Japanese.
column461: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Xterra's not even a real word.
column462: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Actually, it is. It's Latin for "earth."
column463: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Oh, so you drive an X-Earth?
column465: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: That makes sense. I'd rather drive a classic TransAm than an XEarth.
column466: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Yeah, I bet you would. Oh, by the way, 1985 called. It wants its car back.
column467: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Well I hope 1985 has a time machine 'cause I drive an 87.
column468: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Oh, speaking of time machines, I just got back from the future and I went to your funeral and, guess what, nobody came.
column469: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: Speaking of funerals, why don't you go ahead and go die.
column470: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: Oh, that was a really well constructed sentence. You should be an English professor at Cor-not University.
column472: 03x08 - The Merger;Andy: If I were an idiot, I'd be driving a TransAm.
column473: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: If you were driving a TransAm, you would be the smartest idiot in the whole world.
column475: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: [coughs sentence] You're the idiot!
column477: 03x08 - The Merger;Dwight: [coughs sentence] I was making fun of your comeback! That's why it worked. [talks normally to camera] Totally got the best of that interchange.

column1: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: Ohhhh! She's absolutely adorable!
column2: 03x09 - The Convict;Hannah: He.
column3: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: ...Oh, sorry. He's--he's dressed all in pink.
column4: 03x09 - The Convict;Hannah: That's his favorite color.
column5: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: ...Oh. That's... fun for him.
column6: 03x09 - The Convict;Stanley: Fantastic.
column7: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Ohhh, wow. Look at that. How cute.
column8: 03x09 - The Convict;Hannah: Thank youuu.
column9: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Ohh. May I?
column10: 03x09 - The Convict;Hannah: Uh, sure!
column11: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: [climbs under desk] Hey, look at me, I'm a baby! I'm one of those babies from "Look Who's Talking." What am I thinking? [Laughs] Look at all those staplers! What's a stapler!? I don't even know, I'm a baby! Hey, Mom, I'm thirsty! I'm thirsty, Mama! I want some milk. And you know where milk comes from! Breasts.
column12: 03x09 - The Convict;Karen: Hey.
column13: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Hey.
column14: 03x09 - The Convict;Karen: ...Almost done?
column15: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Just about... yup. Now.
column16: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Yes. I have started to see Karen. It's very new, and... not really ready to talk about it openly yet, just because, I think, once the word gets out there, it might affect the way people behave around us or... I dunno. Just, not yet.
column17: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Yeah, Jan, it um... looks like a check, piece of paper of some sort. Receipt. I don't know.
column18: 03x09 - The Convict;Angela: Jan, this is Angela Martin from accounting.
column19: 03x09 - The Convict;Jan: [over phone] Mmhmm.
column20: 03x09 - The Convict;Angela: Look, we have a rebate from... the Federal Work Opportunity Program and no one knows what that means.
column21: 03x09 - The Convict;Jan: We get that money for hiring an ex-convict.
column22: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: I didn't hire an ex-convict. Unless they mean Toby. Convicted rapist. [Jan sighs] ... I'm just kidding.
column23: 03x09 - The Convict;Jan: When did the check come?
column24: 03x09 - The Convict;Angela: Last week.
column25: 03x09 - The Convict;Jan: Okay, that's when the branches merged, so Josh must have been taking advantage of this program. Smart move.
column26: 03x09 - The Convict;Angela: One of the Stamford people is a criminal?
column27: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Hey Jan, speaking of Stamford, Hannah brought in her baby.
column28: 03x09 - The Convict;Angela: Jan, which one of the new employees is a criminal?
column29: 03x09 - The Convict;Jan: Uh, reformed convict, and, uh, I'm not sure. Though hang on, let me email our HR, stay on the line.
column30: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: [whispering] Who is it?
column31: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Hannah?
column32: 03x09 - The Convict;Kevin: Hmm.
column33: 03x09 - The Convict;Angela: Hmm.
column34: 03x09 - The Convict;Kevin: Andy.
column35: 03x09 - The Convict;Angela: Andy?
column36: 03x09 - The Convict;Kevin: Hmm. Martin?
column37: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Kuhhhh... you are such a racist.
column38: 03x09 - The Convict;Kevin: Wait, why am I a racist?
column39: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Because you think he's black.
column40: 03x09 - The Convict;Kevin: He is black... right? And...
column41: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Stop it. Stop it right-stop it right now.
column42: 03x09 - The Convict;Jan: ...Okay it's someone named Martin Nash.
column43: 03x09 - The Convict;Kevin: Yeah!
column44: 03x09 - The Convict;Jan: Michael?
column45: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Why did the convict have to be a black guy? It is such a stereotype. I just wish that Josh had made a more progressive choice. Like a white guy... who went to prison for... polluting a black guy's lake.
column46: 03x09 - The Convict;Kevin: I wonder what he did.
column47: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: In our society, a black man can be arrested for almost anything. He was probably at a sporting event and... saw some people pushing each other, and he intervened.
column48: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: Why would anyone go to jail for that?
column49: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Sssssso, what we need to do... is to forget about this whole Martin in prison thing. People will draw unfair conclusions about Martin and or black people.
column50: 03x09 - The Convict;Kevin: Cool.
column51: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: Okay. Angela?
column52: 03x09 - The Convict;Angela: Sure. Let's protect the convicts. At the expense of the general feeling of safety in the workplace. As a 90-pound female that sits in an ill-lit, rarely-visited corner of the office, naturally I agree with that.
column53: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Good. All right. [everyone leaves]
column54: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: [picks up phone] Jim Halpert.
column55: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: [over phone] I am so horny.
column56: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: ...Okay I can't... help you... with that.
column57: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: Oh, I think you can, Big Tuna. Tell me about that Indian chick, Kelly. She seems pretty slutty. Good for a romp in the sack.
column58: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: She is dating Ryan, I think.
column59: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: Oh, and I care why?
column60: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: She's... high-maintenance.
column61: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: Next. How about... [motions toward Angela]. Blondes are more fun. C'mon, trust me on that.
column62: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Yeah, trust me, that would be fun for no one.
column63: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: Okay fine. Um. Pam, the receptionist. Paaam. Should I go for it?
column64: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: ...Absolutely you should.
column65: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: Jackpot.
column66: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Just... try to be cool.
column67: 03x09 - The Convict;Dwight: I am cool.
column68: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Okay, are you cool, really?
column69: 03x09 - The Convict;Dwight: I'm cool, I'm cool, I'm so cool. Tell me what is going on.
column70: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Um... Martin, from Stamford, was, at one time, in prison. [Dwight starts to run] No. Dwight! Be cool! Be cool!
column71: 03x09 - The Convict;Dwight: I am greatly concerned about having a convict in the office. And I do not care if that convict is white, black, Asian, German, or some kind of halfsy. I do not like criminals.
column72: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: All... righty, let's get started. What is she into?
column73: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: I know Pam pretty well. I know the things that she likes, and, just as important, I know the things that she hates. So, one of the things that she likes is pranks. And, the things that she hates...
column74: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Frisbee-based competitions...
column75: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: Are you kidding?
column76: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: She...
column77: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: I started the main Frisbee golf club at Cornell. Where I went to college. I live to frolf.
column78: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Lead off with that. She loves hunting. She also loves those ads for Six Flags, with the old guy. [Andy hums Six Flag ad] Got it. Also... do you speak pig latin?
column79: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Hey Martin, how's it going?
column80: 03x09 - The Convict;Martin: Good. Getting settled, you know?
column81: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Ah. Good good. Good. Just a second. Everybody? May I have your attention please? I realize that a lot of you have already heard that Martin here has had some trouble with the law, but I just want to declare publicly that I... trust... him, completely, and that anybody who doesn't is an ignorant, dumb... person. Okay? As a matter of fact, you show me a white man you trust and I will show you a black man that I trust even more. Pam. Tell me a white person you trust.
column82: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: My dad.
column83: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: ...Danny Glover. [Jim raises hand] Yeah.
column84: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Jonas Salk.
column85: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Who?
column86: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Justin Timberlake?
column87: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Oh. Please. Colin Powell.
column88: 03x09 - The Convict;Karen: Hey I got one.
column89: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Yup.
column90: 03x09 - The Convict;Karen: Jesus.
column91: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Apollo Creed.
column92: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Close your eyes. Picture a convict. What's he wearing? Nothing special, baseball cap on backwards, baggy pants... he says something ordinary like... 'yo, thats shizzle.' Okay. Now slowly open your eyes again. Who are you picturing? A black man? Wrong. That was a white woman. Surprised? Well, shame on you.
column93: 03x09 - The Convict;Martin: So... you all wanna know what I was in for?
column94: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: No. That's not cool. You don't have to tell them.
column95: 03x09 - The Convict;Martin: Um, I really don't mind. It was a stupid mistake. I was working in finance and, I... got involved in some insider trading. So, I spent a little time in the clink.
column96: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: [laughs] That is awesome.
column97: 03x09 - The Convict;
column98: 03x09 - The Convict;
column99: 03x09 - The Convict;
column100: 03x09 - The Convict;Kevin: I had Martin explain to me three times what he got arrested for, because... it sounds an awful lot like what I do here every day.
column101: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: What was prison like?
column102: 03x09 - The Convict;Martin: Not terrible. Boring. We do the same thing every day. But... at least we got outdoors time.
column103: 03x09 - The Convict;Kevin: You got outdoors time?
column104: 03x09 - The Convict;Martin: Two hours, every day. Sometimes we'd play pickup football games...
column105: 03x09 - The Convict;Kevin: Michael, why don't we get outdoors time?
column106: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: Yeah, some days I never go outside.
column107: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Well, we are running a business, so.
column108: 03x09 - The Convict;Meredith: What was your cell like?
column109: 03x09 - The Convict;Martin: Not good. Uh... a little bit bigger than Michael's office... but, you know, I really only slept there. You know, during the day, there-our time's our own. They had uh, classes, I took some... watercolor classes.
column110: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: They have art classes?
column111: 03x09 - The Convict;Martin: Yeap. Yeah.
column112: 03x09 - The Convict;Ryan: They have business classes there?
column113: 03x09 - The Convict;Martin: They did, taught by some uh, Harvard business school guys--a lot of the guys also, that were in the class, the inmates, a lot of them have gone on to do extraordinary things in business.
column114: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: Kinda sounds like... prison's... better than Dunder-Mifflin.
column115: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Ah. Well. That's not true.
column116: 03x09 - The Convict;Kevin: I would so rather be in prison.
column117: 03x09 - The Convict;Ryan: Prison sounds great.
column118: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: No you would not.
column119: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: This place is not prison. It's... way better than prison.
column120: 03x09 - The Convict;Creed: [singsong voice] Baby. Hello baby. Here you want to play with this?
column121: 03x09 - The Convict;Karen: You can't give paperclips to a baby. He could swallow.
column122: 03x09 - The Convict;Creed: Oh, it's okay. I've got tons of them. You like that? Goo-goo-goo-goo?
column123: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: Pam-a-lama-ding-dong. Listen, you're cute. There is no gettin' around it. So... I don't know if you like country music, but I was thinking maybe one of these days we could drive out to a field, crank up some tunes, smoke a few Macanudos... maybe even toss a disk around. Utway ooday ooyay inkthay, Ampay?
column124: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: Wow... I--
column125: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: Shh. Think about it. I'll hit you back.
column126: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: Wow. That was... wow.
column127: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Okay! Listen up everybody! Um, you guys said that prison was better than this place, and I heard ya, loud and clear, so, I am instituting some changes to make this more like prison. We are going to start with an hour of outdoor time. So let's go!
column128: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: Michael, it's freezing out.
column129: 03x09 - The Convict;Phyllis: I can't feel my toes.
column130: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Why don't we... pump some iron? Anyone wanna... pump up?
column131: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: What is that, like... five pounds?
column132: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: It's uh... two and a half. I'm not going for bulk, I'm going for tone.
column133: 03x09 - The Convict;Stanley: I'm going back inside.
column134: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Yeah, it's... freaking cold out here. Anybody wants to stay out, you've got about... twenty-seven minutes of rec time.
column135: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Oh heyyy. Martiiin. You have TV in the joint?
column136: 03x09 - The Convict;Martin: Yeah, in the rec room.
column137: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Ah. A ten inch black and white?
column138: 03x09 - The Convict;Martin: Actually, our TV was bigger than that one.
column139: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: These people don't realize how lucky they are. This office is the American Dream. And they would rather be in the hole.
column140: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Oh. Andy. I thought of one last tact you can take with Pam.
column141: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: Yeah.
column142: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Quick question - do you play the guitar?
column143: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: I play the banjo.
column144: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Hold on, let me think about that, yes, that'll work. But can you sing in a sexy high falsetto voice?
column145: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: [singing] You know I can, my man.
column146: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Yup. That's perfect.
column147: 03x09 - The Convict;Karen: Hey.
column148: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Hey.
column149: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: I'm gonna go get my banjo out of my car.
column150: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Perfect.
column151: 03x09 - The Convict;Karen: What is going on?
column152: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: ...I'm messing with Andy. I'm sending him to all the women in the office with... just... terrible information on how to get them to go out with him.
column153: 03x09 - The Convict;Karen: I love it. I want in. Who's the target?
column154: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: ...Oh, you know what? ... It was... gonna be Pam, but...
column155: 03x09 - The Convict;Karen: Perfect. What do I do? Just give me an assignment.
column156: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Uh, you know what though? I feel like I already sicked him on Pam... we'll give her a break. Let's think of someone else.
column157: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: All right everybody, there has been a lot of name calling against our office today. Corporate maligning, slurring, much of it coming from one of you, who claims that prison is better... than... here. And none of can say "Boo" because none of us have ever been to prison. Well, there's somebody I'd like you to meet. Somebody else who has been to prison, who can tell you what it is really like [puts on bandanna]. I'm prison Mike! You know why they call me prison Mike?!
column158: 03x09 - The Convict;Angela: Do you really expect us to believe you're somebody else?
column159: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Do you really expect me to not push you up against the wall, beeyotch?! [employees protest] All right, hey, hey, hey, hey, that's just the way we talk in the clink. Been a lot of fun talk about prison today, but I am here to scare you straight. I AM HERE TO SCARE YOU STRAIIIGHT!! In prison you are somebody's bitch. Oh, and you. [points to Ryan] You, my friend, would be da belle of da ball. Don't drop the soap! Don't drop the soap!
column160: 03x09 - The Convict;Ryan: Michael, please. [Michael makes kissing noises]
column161: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Where... did you learn all of this?
column162: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Internet.
column163: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: So, not prison.
column164: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: And prison. Eh, fifty-fifty, both. Look, prison stinks, is what I'm saying. It's not like you can go home, and, recharge your batteries, and come back in the morning and, be with your friends, having fun in the office.
column165: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: What'd you do, Prison Mike?
column166: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: I stole. ... And I robbed. And I kidnapped... the... president's son. And held him for ransom.
column167: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: That is... quite the rap sheet, Prison Mike.
column168: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: And I nevah got caught, neither.
column169: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Well, you're... in... prison, but, mmhmm.
column170: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: Prison Mike? What was the food like in prison?
column171: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Gruel. Sandwiches. Gruel omelettes. Nothing but gruel. Plus, you can eat your own hair.
column172: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: Wow. Prison sounds horrible.
column173: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Yeah. Yeah. Well, thank you, Andy. Tanks.
column174: 03x09 - The Convict;Dwight: Prison Mike. What's the very very worst thing about prison?
column175: 03x09 - The Convict;Angela: Don't encourage him, Dwight.
column176: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: The worst thing about prison was the... was the Dementors. They... were flying all over the place, and they were scary. And they'd come down, and they'd suck the soul out of your body, and it hurt!
column177: 03x09 - The Convict;Karen: Demen-Dementors like in Harry Potter?
column178: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: No, not Harry Potter. ... There are no movies in prison. This is my point! You guys got it soft, and cushy! This place is freaking awesome! The people are awesome! Your boss is nice! Everyone seems to get along! People are tolerant! People who... have jumped to conclusions can redeem themselves! Nobody is nobody's bitch. I hope that this scared you. And from me, Prison Mike, to you, I just wanna thank you for listening to me. Letting me be a part of your life today. 'Cause you got a good life! YOu got a good life. A good life. [turns around, takes bandanna off] So. What do you think? It doesn't sound so great, does it?
column179: 03x09 - The Convict;Pam: Wow. Thank you. Um, that must have been hard for you to relive that. Both of you.
column180: 03x09 - The Convict;Martin: Yeah, that... wasn't really... at all my experience. There were certain elements of what you performed, I've seen on television. But it didn't remind me of my time in prison.
column181: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Okay. Okay, fine. You guys think prison is so great? All right. Well, here you go. [locks employees in conference room]
column182: 03x09 - The Convict;Jim: Okay, Michael. Come on. Let us out.
column183: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: No! If you think is prison is so wonderful, then, enjoy prison! They are such babies. I am going to leave them in there until they can appreciate what it's like to have freedom. And if this doesn't bother them, then I am out of ideas.
column184: 03x09 - The Convict;Kevin: [knocking on door] Hey! Let us out of here! Hey! I have--
column185: 03x09 - The Convict;Hannah: Shh!
column186: 03x09 - The Convict;Toby: [answering phone] This is Toby. Hey Pam. Where are you calling from?
column187: 03x09 - The Convict;Toby: Michael. Why's everyone locked in the conference room?
column188: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: They were very disrespectful to me, and to the office. And Martin has had a bad influence, to think that I gave him the benefit of the doubt.
column189: 03x09 - The Convict;Toby: Well, you're going to have to let 'em out. Or... or I will.
column190: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Okay. You know what Toby? I am teaching them a lesson, so.
column191: 03x09 - The Convict;Toby: You know they're teasing you. I mean... obviously, this is... a much nicer place than an actual prison. We get paid to be here. We go home afterwards and have social lives. We have... we have parties here. They're teasing you. To be funny.
column192: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: [unlocks door] Okay nutcases, get out of there! Good work. Long day. Really long. Why don't you guys head home. Early. Time off for good behavior! Heh. Good job. Enjoy your freedoms!
column193: 03x09 - The Convict;Michael: Martin went from being a new guy from Stamford... to a convict, to... my friend. Back to a convict. Then to... a kind of a nuisance, actually, to be completely honest. And finally, to... a quitter. And I will not miss him. And that is not because he is black.
column194: 03x09 - The Convict;Andy: [singing] So we've been told, and some choose to believe it, I know they're wrong, wait and see, 'cause one day we'll find it, the ainbowray onnectionkay, the lovers, the dreamers, and meeee...

column1: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Merry Christmas! [holds up dead goose and puts it on Pam's desk]
column2: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Merry Christ--[looks up] NO! Why... why did you bring that here?
column3: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Don't worry, she's dead. Oh wait. He's dead.
column4: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Dwight, what uh...
column5: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I accidentally ran over it. It's a Christmas miracle!
column6: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Well, get it out of here.
column7: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Relax, OK. And because this is Christmas, I am going to roast this goose and prepare it with a wild rice dressing. Do we have any cayenne pepper in the kitchen?
column8: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Merry Christmas Dwight.
column9: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Jim.
column10: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Wow. What have we got here?
column11: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: What does it look like?
column12: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Dead goose.
column13: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: And circle gets the square.
column14: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: All right.
column15: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [to Pam] So can you watch this? I'm gonna get my carving knife out of the trunk.
column16: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Toby: Oh, Dwight, we talked about this.
column17: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No, Toby, this is different. He's already dead.
column18: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Once I brought in a duck. To prepare for lunch. And people got upset. Apparently, they got attached to the duck and didn't want to see it killed.
column19: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: He was already dead. And we Schrutes use every part of the goose. The meat has a delicious, smoky, rich flavor. Plus you can use the molten goose grease and save it in the refrigerator, thus saving you a trip to the store for a can of expensive goose grease.
column20: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Wow. Win-Win.
column21: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Exactly. Thank you, Jim.
column22: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: I like goose. If it's already dead is it so crazy we eat it?
column23: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Creed: That's crazy. It's crazy.
column24: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Toby: Dwight, you cannot keep that here.
column25: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Ok, that is ridiculous. And totally against the spirit of Christmas.
column26: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Toby: Come on Dwight. We went over this, like for a half an hour.
column27: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: It's Christmas Toby.
column28: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Toby: It's a dead animal in an office. You can't...
column29: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Toby...
column30: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Toby: I'm sorry.
column31: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [sighs] Please? Please?
column32: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Toby: Clean it in your car.
column33: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: I would like it off my desk.
column34: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Oh Pam. Take a chill pill.
column35: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: [Riding a bicycle down the hallway and singing] Deck the halls with boughs of holly. Fa la la la la la la la la. [Struggling to stay on] 'Tis the ... ack. [expletive] Hey! [to Pam] I would like a nice slice of Christmas Pam. Side of candied Pams. And perhaps, some Pam-chops, with mint...
column36: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Can I help you, Michael?
column37: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'm looking for the toy drive box.
column38: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: It's behind you.
column39: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK... Well, I need to put this bike in there. I hope it'll fit, with all these little knickknacks.
column40: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Wow. What kind of bike is that?
column41: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Umm... I don't know? Average kind?
column42: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kevin: The tires look pretty worn.
column43: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well, that is probably from the test drive.
column44: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: But the paint's chipping. Is that your old bike, Michael?
column45: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: No.
column46: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: Yo, Michael, sweet ride Mike.
column47: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, thanks. [Michael and Andy do a fist bump and explosion.]
column48: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Michael?
column49: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes? [Pam holds up a bag] Oh Pam, that is so sweet. You didn't have to do that.
column50: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: [hands over bag] I didn't, it's from corporate.
column51: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK. Did everybody get one of these?
column52: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yup.
column53: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Terrific. Good.
column54: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: This is going to be the best Christmas ever. My girlfriend Carol is coming to our party tonight, and I have a little surprise for her. [singing] I've got two tickets to paradise! Pack your bags, we're leaving the day-after-tomorrow! Um, taking her to Sandals, Jamaica, all-inclusive. All-inclusive. You know what that means? Right? Yeah.
column55: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: [Creed takes toy from toy drive box.] Oh, I think you're supposed to put a toy in the box, Creed.
column56: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Creed: And a happy holiday to you.
column57: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: [Carol walks through door looking upset] [waves] Carol.
column58: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: Hi, is Michael around here?
column59: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: There she is. A Christmas Carol. Hello [kisses Carol] You're about five hours early to the party. You're such a blonde. [laughs]
column60: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: Michael.
column61: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey, everybody. I don't know who you haven't met yet, but I think this is one of them. This is my girlfriend - Carol. This is just the front of her. Show 'em, show 'em the other side.
column62: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: [whispers] What?
column63: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Turn around, turn around. Come on. [making a body turning gesture]
column64: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: Get outta here.
column65: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, you get outta here.
column66: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: Michael
column67: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes.
column68: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: If I may say. She's even prettier that you described her.
column69: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [standing up] Oh, ouch. Michael, I don't think there is anything wrong with the way you described her.
column70: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Thank you.
column71: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: I really need a moment alone with you. [Carol heads towards Michael's office.]
column72: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Not as much as I need a moment alone with you. [puts finger on her back and reaches for her butt] Berp.
column73: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: What is this? [Holds up a Christmas photo]
column74: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: That is my Christmas card. It's a picture of you and me and your kids on a ski trip, having a blast. Ski-sons Greetings.
column75: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: No. See, we never went on a ski trip.
column76: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I know.
column77: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: I went on a ski trip.
column78: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Right.
column79: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: Two years ago with my kids and my ex-husband.
column80: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes, but what you didn't realize at the time was that I was with you in a sense. I was in your heart...
column81: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: Michael.
column82: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: And next to your kids. What?
column83: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: This is so weird.
column84: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I don't understand?
column85: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: It's a bold move, to Photoshop yourself into a picture with your girlfriend and her kids on a ski trip with their real father. But then again, Michael's a bold guy. [Towards unseen cameraman] Is bold the right word?
column86: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: I think you're a really sweet guy.
column87: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK
column88: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: But, um, I don't know how to deal with, with this thing [waves Christmas card]. And, and the proposal. And I don't think things are going to work out with us.
column89: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, no no no Ok, OK, You know what, you're not thinking straight. You know what you need? You need to think this through in [making drum noise] Jamaica's largest fresh water pool.
column90: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: What are you talking about?
column91: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I got us tickets to Sandals, Jamaica, We leave day after tomorrow. [Carol shakes head in disappointment]. You better find the skimpiest bikini there is.
column92: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: Oh, no. Michael.
column93: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: And it's all inclusive.
column94: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: Michael...
column95: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes.
column96: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: I'm sorry.
column97: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, Carol. You walk out that door and it is over.
column98: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Carol: I know. [Closes door.]
column99: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Psst. Jim. [Jim turns around. Pam nods head towards her for him to come over] Um, hey. I need to give you your Christmas gift now because, well, I'll just tell you.
column100: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: What?
column101: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: For the past few months I've been sending Dwight letters from the CIA. [hands a folder to Jim]
column102: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Are you serious?
column103: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: They're considering him for a top secret mission. There's his application. Oh, and this is where I made him list every secret he promised he'd never ever tell.
column104: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: [Opens folder and reads from Dwight's file] Last year, my boss, Michael Scott, took a day off because he said he had pneumonia, but really, he was leaving early to go to magic camp. Wow.
column105: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: So... here's the gift. You get to decide what his top secret mission is. [Jim smiles] Sorry I didn't wrap it.
column106: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: [closes folder] You know what? Uh, I really don't think I should be doing this stuff anymore, you know?
column107: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Oh.
column108: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: No, because of the promotion.
column109: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Oh yeah.
column110: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: It just feels a little bit, like...
column111: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: No, I get it, of course. OK. [holds out hand for folder. Jim gives Pam back the folder.]
column112: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: I feel like there's a chance for me to start over. And if I fall back into the same kind of things I used to do., then ... what am I doing?
column113: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'd like everybody's attention. Christmas is canceled.
column114: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Stanley: You can't cancel a holiday.
column115: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Keep it up Stanley and you will lose New Year's.
column116: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Stanley: What does that mean?
column117: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Jim, take New Year's away from Stanley.
column118: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Michael, what's going on?
column119: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Carol and I split up. Amicably. And I just don't think it would be appropriate to celebrate under the circumstances.
column120: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Will they still air 'Rudolph?'
column121: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kevin: That's not fair.
column122: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [over everybody else's talking] Are we gonna cancel Hanukah as well?
column123: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Fine! [everybody stops talking] Have your party. Just no guests.
column124: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: But we invited guests.
column125: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well, you know what Phyllis? All of your guests would have probably canceled at the last minute anyway, leaving your life a stupid rotten mess.
column126: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, oh, oh, oh, it hurts.
column127: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: I know.
column128: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: It hurts my heart. It hurts my stomach. It hurts my arms.
column129: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: OK, well, why are you laying like that?
column130: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: [moves a little] Thanks. How did you push away the bad thoughts?
column131: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Like what?
column132: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Like maybe, the real reason they left was because there were things they wanted you to do in bed, that were, foreign, and scary?
column133: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Well.. um I, I don't...
column134: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: And not that you didn't want to try them. Some wine may have helped. Do you know what I'm referring to?
column135: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: I don't need to know.
column136: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Michael. Sorry to interrupt. Uh, It appears we're one bathrobe short.
column137: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Take it from Toby.
column138: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Copy.
column139: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey, would you like to go to Sandals, Jamaica with me?
column140: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: No, thank you.
column141: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: It's all... [Pam walks away.] OK.
column142: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Toby: Hey Dwight. Pretty nice robe- [Dwight grabs bag with robe in it and walks away.] Why?
column143: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: Phyllis, I need you to pick up green streamers at lunch.
column144: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: I thought you said green was whorish.
column145: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: No, orange is whorish.
column146: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Uh, so I had a couple of ideas to make the Stamford people feel more at home. Each year we have a Christmas raffle ... [Phyllis and Pam nod their heads in agreement].
column147: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: It would never work here.
column148: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Ok ... um, another idea was karaoke ...
column149: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: No.
column150: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: A Christmas drinking game ...
column151: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Meredith: Yes.
column152: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: God help you.
column153: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: What?
column154: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: These are all terrible ideas and none of them are on the theme of "A Nutcracker Christmas." I think you should leave.
column155: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: You're kidding.
column156: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: You tried this out, and it's clearly not for you. It's time to go. Come on. [Angela gets up from seat] Please. [Karen gets up and leaves] Thank you. OK, thank you very much. [Angela closes door]
column157: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: What are you doing? ["Goodbye My Lover" by James Blunt plays]
column158: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [putting things into a box] We are getting rid of everything that reminds you of Carol.
column159: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: Hey, what's the haps? [Dwight shuts door in his face.]
column160: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Carol?
column161: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Oh, look at this. [looks through papers] Your old condo closing papers. It's riddled with Carol's name. I wish I could throw this in the box. [Michael hits repeat to "Goodbye My Lover" on computer]
column162: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Why don't you just buy the whole song?
column163: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I don't have to buy it. I just want to taste it. I just... I just want a little taste of it.
column164: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Oh, look at this, she saved you two thousand dollars 'cause they failed to report a mold problem. [Continues to sift through papers] But wouldn't that affect the final... How did she? Oh, oh, I see what she did. That is good. Wow. Carol is one smart cookie.
column165: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: [singing] Goodbye my lover. Goodbye my friend. [hits repeat again]
column166: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: This is an old adage, but they say when you find true love, you know within the first 24 hours. With Carol, I knew within the first 24 minutes of the second day I met her.
column167: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: I feel like I've been kinda cold to Karen and there's no real reason for it. I mean it's not like she's ever done anything to me. So, I think I probably shouldn't be cold to her.
column168: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Hey, Karen. Sorry about that meeting today, that was really crazy.
column169: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Yeah, right? I'm so glad you said that. Because, I don't know how those meetings usually go.
column170: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Um, usually like that.
column171: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Does anyone ever stand up to Angela or..?
column172: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: I think one of her cats did once. She came in with scratches all over her face. [both laugh]
column173: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Right.
column174: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Um, I really liked your karaoke idea.
column175: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Oh cool, yeah.
column176: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: That could really be fun.
column177: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Oh, thank you.
column178: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: You guys do a raffle?
column179: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Yeah, we do a raffle...
column180: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Toby: Hey Kev.
column181: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Hey. [Toby puts hand on Kevin's back, who is wearing the robe and feels it a little bit.]
column182: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: This should've been up yesterday. [refers to party flyer]
column183: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: It'll be all right.
column184: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: [Pam puts up another flyer] What is that? [Reads flyer] The "Committee to Plan Parties invites you to a margarita-karaoke Christmas?" There's no such thing as the "Committee to Plan Parties."
column185: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: There is now. We just started it.
column186: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: Well, you just can't start a committee. You have to have funding.
column187: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: What's your funding?
column188: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: Two hundred dollars.
column189: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: What's ours again?
column190: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Umm, two hundred and one dollars.
column191: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Oh right.
column192: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kelly: [pointing] Hey, a margarita-karaoke Christmas party, that sounds like fun.
column193: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: No, that is not a party. There's only one party and it's hosted by the Party PLANNING Committee and it starts at three o'clock.
column194: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Then why are there two flyers?
column195: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Oh, I understand that this is confusing for everyone, let me explain. There's a party that starts at three.
column196: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Right.
column197: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: And then there's a way more fun party that starts at two forty-five.
column198: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Right, and if you're interested in the way more fun party, all the info can be found here on our more brightly colored flyer. [Angela rips down brightly colored flyer and walks away. Karen rips down Angela's flyer.]
column199: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kevin: I didn't see where it was.
column200: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yup, looks like the Scranton people and the Stamford people are finally coming together. And that's what you want, right?
column201: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: I think that's a really good option...
column202: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Pam and Karen. I am ordering you to cease and desist all party planning. Immediately.
column203: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: You can't do that.
column204: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: As ranking number three in this office, I am order -
column205: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: Umm... I'm number three.
column206: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: You're number four.
column207: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: Yeah, but I'm number three.
column208: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Ah, no. [to Pam and Karen] You must turn over to me all Christmas decorations and party paraphernalia immediately that will be returned to you on January fourth.
column209: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: OK, I think I can help here.
column210: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Ok, good
column211: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: As ranking number two, I am starting a committee to determine the validity of the two committees and I am the sole member. The committee will act on this now.
column212: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: OK, this is stupid.
column213: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Could you please keep it down? [interrupted Dwight] I'm in session. I've determined that this committee is valid. [Pam and Karen cheer.]
column214: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No no, no, wait, wait, wait [raises hand] Permission to join the Validity Committee.
column215: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Permission denied.
column216: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Damn it!
column217: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: Hey. I can't concentrate when I know you're in pain, man. Let me take you to lunch. [Michael sighs.] C'mon, my treat.
column218: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: All right. Nothing here to distract myself with anyway.
column219: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: That's my boy. I know the perfect place, too.
column220: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hooters?
column221: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: No. Benihana. Much classier. But don't worry, the babes are totally hot, too. [do a fist bump and explosion]
column222: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ah, I need my entourage [both exit Michael's office] Jim. Dwight. Ryan. C'mon, we're going to Asian Hooters.
column223: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Ah man, I can't.
column224: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Why not?
column225: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Ryan: I'm not feeling so well. I've got a ton of work to do here. MSG allergy, peanut allergy, I just ate there last night. [Michael feels Ryan's forehead]
column226: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ok, feel better.
column227: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Thanks.
column228: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: C'mon Jim, let's go.
column229: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: OK. [to Ryan] Wow, thanks for taking all the excuses, dude.
column230: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Doctor appointment, car trouble, plantar warts, granddad fought in World War II. Use your head, man. I keep mine in here. [Holds up blackberry.] Look alive, Halpert. Welcome back.
column231: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Bros before hos. Why? Because your bros are always there for you. They have got your back after your ho rips your heart out for no good reason. And you were nothing but great to your ho and you told her she was the only ho for you. And that she was better than all the other hos in the world. And then ... and then suddenly she's not yo' ho no mo'.
column232: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: So she looks really hot, so I said, "You look hotter than usual today." [to waitress] Thank you. Michael [gesturing to sit down.] Head of the table.
column233: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Get out Jim. [Dwight tries to sit between Andy and Jim] Actually, um... [to two other people at the table] Sir, I'm going to need take this chair.
column234: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Dwight, just, just leave them alone please. They're on a date. They look very happy.
column235: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: So she looks at me right, and she goes, "I'm sorry, don't I even know you?" After a year, a year of buying lattes from her, do you believe that?
column236: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yes.
column237: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I can't... I can't here what you're saying.
column238: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Carol used to drink lattes.
column239: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [off screen at other end of table] What're you talking about?
column240: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: She would get this little foam mustache...
column241: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [still off screen] Carol had a mustache?
column242: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: And I used to say "Hey, got latte?" And she'd say, that's not funny.
column243: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [off screen] What are you guys talking about?
column244: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: She totally got me. She understood that we didn't have to laugh to enjoy ---
column245: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Michael! Repeat what you said louder!
column246: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);
column247: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);
column248: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);
column249: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: It is my job to be there for Michael. How can I be there for Michael if I'm here for Michael? [food is thrown at Dwight's face]
column250: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'm already starting to forget what color eyes she had. I can't, OK, I'm gonna call her. I am gonna call and find out...
column251: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: No.
column252: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Who are you calling?
column253: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'm just gonna call her.
column254: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: Put that away. Put that away. S.O.S. We... I... May day. Haha. Man down over here, [to waitress] we need your help.
column255: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Waitress: What can I get for 'ya?
column256: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: I think we'll start with a round of noga-sakes. [waitress gives confused look]
column257: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: One part eggnog, three parts sake. Some places won't make it for you though, because eggnog is seasonal.
column258: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: You should, you should put out salt for the rims [referring to margaritas]
column259: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: That's a great idea.
column260: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: Phyllis?
column261: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: I was just getting a snack.
column262: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: You can have your snack in here.
column263: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: Pam, don't tell her what to do! Phyllis.
column264: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: OK.
column265: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kevin: I think I'll go to Angela's party, because that's the party I know.
column266: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Ryan: I miss the days when there was only one party I didn't want to go to.
column267: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Roy: So I only use three?
column268: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: If you're using more than three pieces of tape to wrap a present, you're doing it wrong.
column269: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Roy: OK. And where to do you get all those cool bows?
column270: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Oh, I just get those at any party supply place.
column271: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Roy: OK. Are you sure I can't use like, the cartoons from the newspaper?
column272: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Oh yeah, your mom would love that.
column273: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Roy: [Karen walks in] Hey. All right, I'll see you guys later. [leaves room]
column274: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Bye.
column275: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: He's cute. You should date him.
column276: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Oh, yeah... Maybe.
