column277: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Looks like you've got a little Nakiri knife action going there.
column278: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Chef: No, it's Usuba.
column279: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Yeah, I bet you wish you had a Nakiri, though.
column280: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Chef: Actually, the Usuba's the better knife when you're working with this quantity.
column281: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Nah, I don't know... Still think Nakiri's better.
column282: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Woman at bar: I think he'd know. [Dwight and her stare at each other]
column283: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Nothing he's doing is cheering me up.
column284: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: Wait for the onion. Trust me. Hey Cindy, he just had his heart broken, you wouldn't do that to him, would you?
column285: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Cindy: I don't know.
column286: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, sure you would. Look at you, I bet you break up with a guy every hour. [Cindy laughs and walks away]
column287: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: You made her laugh. Yes! She totally digs us. [referring to what chef is doing] Watch, watch, watch, watch. [Onions smoke up] Heh, heh? What did I tell 'ya?
column288: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: You're right. That's good.
column289: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Hello everyone. We would just like to announce that our party is starting now in the break room. So... you can come by... .
column290: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: I have a very important announcement to make... about... your paychecks. Umm... Your paychecks will be arriving as scheduled on Friday. And they will be in the correct amount that they are normally in... Please stand by for a very important announcement... refer..[starts to leave office] for further regarding your paycheck! [runs outside]
column291: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: [on cell phone to Dwight] I need to know if I can start the party?
column292: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Michael! Hey! Over here, Michael! [waves down Michael with a napkin and whistles to get attention]
column293: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: This drink... [in audible conversation with Michael]
column294: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I don't know. No one can hear me. You know what? Start the party.
column295: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: Did Michael give you permission to do this?
column296: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [with conviction] Start the party.
column297: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: [Angela slams phone shut and runs back to office.] Also, I would like to inform you that, um, as a special treat, my party will be starting early. In fact, it will be starting right now [opens door to conference room.]
column298: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Our party is also starting now [opens door to break room.]
column300: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: [Stanley gets up and walks towards the break room.] All right Stanley. Woo.
column301: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Good choice. [Kelly drags Ryan to the break room.]
column302: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: Welcome Hannah. You will not be disappointed.
column303: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Hannah: Why would I be disappointed?
column304: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: I said you wouldn't be disappointed. [Meredith heads towards break room.]
column305: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: Meredith, if you don't come to my party, you will be very, very sorry.
column306: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Meredith: Is that a threat?
column307: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: No, it's an invitation.
column308: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: We have vodka!
column309: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Lots of it! [Meredith leaves to break room party.]
column310: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kevin: I hear Angela's party will have double-fudge brownies. It will also have Angela. Double fudge... Angela... double fudge... Angela [puts out hands to weigh his options] Hmmm...
column311: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: Brownies. Cupcakes. [Kevin walks toward conference room]
column312: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Don't push it.
column313: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Are we taking this too far? You know what, I don't think we're taking this far enough. [Pam and Karen look at each other] What?
column314: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: I got goose bumps.
column315: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: I don't back down. My sister and I used to be best friends, and we haven't talked in 16 years. Over some disagreement, I don't even remember. So... yeah. I'm pretty good.
column316: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ahh, damn this chicken is good. My compliments to the chef. [points to chef] Which is you! Right? Hahahaha. Awesome! I need some meat. I want some steak. [leans over to neighboring man's plate] I see steak.
column318: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Excuse me [tries to take away meat with chopsticks] Ah, un guard. [Fights with chopsticks and laughs] Family style.
column319: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: No, it's not.
column321: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I don't think... I love it!
column322: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: I want you to close your eyes and imagine your dream house. [Cindy laughs] C'mon, do it for Michael. He's had a really long day.
column323: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: [laughing] I don't know what he's doing.
column324: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: This is great.
column325: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Jim! Jim! What... What's happening?
column326: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh, [points to Cindy] she's asleep.
column329: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: Now open your eyes and describe it to me.
column330: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Cindy: I... don't know, it has four bed rooms and a loft...
column331: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Oh my gosh, now she's up.
column332: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: And she's trying to correctly butcher a goose, but she's having trouble coming up with it.
column333: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Oh, OK. Cindy! Yo, Cindy! Cindy! Hold its neck back and insert the knife below the jaw. Bring it all the way around, there's going to be a good amount of blood. [Cindy looks confused. Woman next to Dwight is disgusted] Don't let it bother you. Have a bucket there, for the blood... and the innards... and the feathers.
column334: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh no, this is different. The CIA thing, that was a prank on Dwight. This is more like a umm... OK, it's pretty much the same thing.
column335: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kelly: What d'ya think? [to Stanley about his drink]
column336: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Stanley: Fruity and delicious.
column337: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kelly: See, I told you. You want one Meredith?
column338: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Meredith: No thanks. They're too sweet.
column339: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Hey, so what's the status.
column340: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Looks like they forgot the power cord.
column342: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Oh, you're kidding me?
column344: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Oh, you guys, guys, um... I'm sorry, but there's a problem with the karaoke machine. [everyone sighs]
column345: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Well that blows.
column346: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Darryl: Hang on little ladies. You don't need this thing, I'll go grab my synthesizer. [Everyone cheers]
column347: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Everybody: Darryl! Darryl! Darryl! [Darryl exits break room and passes Phyllis]
column349: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Darryl: Hey. Hey, look, when you get done with your... [looks inside conference room] meeting, you should, uh, come to the break room. We're having a party.
column351: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Darryl: All right. Se you later...
column352: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Hannah: [tries to break nut on a Nutcracker doll] These nuts are really hard to crack.
column353: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: Try harder then. [Hannah smashes Nutcracker on top of nut. Sees Kevin take another brownie] Uh uh. No one has seconds until everyone's had some.
column354: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kevin: You've got to be kidding!
column355: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: You've got to be kidding. {Kevin takes bite of brownie]
column357: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Huh? [puts on jacket]
column358: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: Maybe that'll help. Is it cold in there?
column359: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: [referring to waitresses] They have been checking us out, all night! I am not kidding!
column360: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: You know what we should do?
column362: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: We should invite them to the Christmas party.
column363: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: Now, you are thinking. Yes. And you know what? Because you have had such a rough day, you get Cindy.
column364: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, you are such mench my friend. [They stand up and do fist bump and explosion]
column365: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK, where is everybody? I would like them to meet my new girlfriend. [Guys walk in with two different waitresses from Benihana's]
column366: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: I'm sure they'll want to meet her, too.
column367: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: The least I could do was give some poor sick kid a bike.
column368: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Second Cindy: That rocks.
column369: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Nah, you rock. Tell you what, if you want it, it's yours.
column370: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Second Cindy: Thanks! I, I wanna give you something.
column371: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh. [She whispers in his ear. Michael starts to laugh] That's what she said.
column372: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hello? I would like everybody to meet my new girlfriend.
column373: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: My new girlfriend.
column375: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Second Cindy: Is he the hot one or the giant baby?
column376: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: [whispers] The giant baby. Wow, I am so sorry, I had no idea this party would be so lame.
column377: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: [under her breath] There's another party in the break room.
column378: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, party in the break room! Let's go, let's go! Thank God! Let's go to the break room.
column379: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: Hey, excuse me! Waitress lady! Hey, where do you think you're going with that? [refers to toy she just took from table]
column380: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Second Cindy: I thought I could have it.
column381: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: You can't have it [takes back toy] I don't walk into your house and steal your Hello Kitty backpack.
column382: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Shhh... Shut it! C'mon! Party.
column383: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Hey! It's Angela! [Angela slams door shut, but not before Kevin sneaks out] Hey!
column384: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: We're going to ...
column385: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kevin: [singing] I want you to know. That I'm happy for you. I wish nothing but...
column386: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I just think there are two, two specific kinds of people in the world. People who own houses and people who own condos. [turns to reach for pretzel while Second Cindy turns other direction] And... my question to you [points and pulls away other waitress] is do you agree?
column387: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Other waitress: Do I agree about what?
column388: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Do you agree about what? [laughs] Wow. You're lucky you're so darn cute.
column389: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Other waitress: What're you talking about?
column390: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: What're you talking about?
column391: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kevin: [singing] And I'm here to remind you of the mess you left when you went away. It's not fair, to deny me of the cross I bear that you give to me. You, you, you, you, you, you, you oughta know ta know.
column392: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: All right [high fives Kevin]
column393: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: Did you have fun at Benihana's?
column394: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No. It was awful. I couldn't hear anything. [cheers from other party]
column395: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: I've had the worse day here [turns up Nutcracker music on the stereo. [Sighs. Dwight reaches for and holds Angela's hand]
column396: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: [Karen and Pam enter] Dwight, you won the raffle! [holds out gift]
column397: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No... way! Yeah!
column398: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Open it! Open it ! Open it! [Dwight rips open present. Angela is upset and Pam notices]
column400: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Do you like it?
column402: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Can I talk to you a second?
column404: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Well the Committee to Plan Parties has served its purpose. We're gonna disband. In the name of Christmas.
column405: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: [holds up rice krispie shaped like a star] In the name of Nutcracker Christmas.
column406: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Angela, we've been hearing really great thing about uh... your brownies and we were hoping you'd consider merging into two parties.
column407: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: I'm not sure. Does your karaoke machine have Christmas songs?
column408: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yeah, but we don't have a power cord.
column409: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: Oh, I may have seen it somewhere. [Goes to plant and picks up power cord] Is it this one?
column412: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: We'll go tell everyone.
column414: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy and Michael: [singing] And if you want love, we'll make it. Swim in a big sea of blankets. Take all your big plans and break 'em. This is bound to take awhile. Your body is a wonderland. [Michael notices Cindy ride up to him on the bike and looks confused] Your body is a wonderland.
column416: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Both: Your body is a wonderland.
column417: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Andy: I'll use my hands on it.
column418: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Both: Something 'bout the way your hair falls in your face...
column419: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kelly: [singing] Whatever we deny or embrace. For worse or for better. We belong, we belong, we belong together... Ryan...
column420: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: When you know, you just know.
column422: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Check her out. My little gal over there. Babe-alectable.
column423: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Roy: Which one is she? [Michael stares at both waitresses]
column424: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: It's... it's one of those two. [points at both]
column425: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Roy: You don't know?
column426: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Dude, you should know.
column427: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah... well, it's been hard, they're wearing the exact same uniform. And I've been drinking. And you know how all waitresses look alike.
column428: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I honestly don't see what the big deal is. Stevie Wonder is married. Are you going to tell me that Stevie Wonder doesn't love his wife just because he's not sure what she looks like?
column429: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey. Where's my girl? Is she in the fridge? Where is she hiding? I don't know where she is. 'Cause I'm drunk, I can't even find her.
column430: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Second Cindy: You know where I am.
column431: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Haha, I do! I just haven't hugged you in awhile [marks Cindy's arm with a black marker]
column433: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, good. That felt good. Let's go. Party.
column434: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Creed: [singing] Spinnin' n reelin with love. Give it the time, I might come back down. But it feels so good. My feet don't touch the ground. Wha..wha..wild. Wha..wha..wild. Well everybody knows, I'm crazy about 'ya...
column435: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [into walkie-talkie] Monkey, this is Possum. Do you copy?
column436: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: [into another walkie-talkie] Copy, Possum. What's your twenty?
column437: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: No way. [both hold up Bridget Jones' Diary movie DVD]
column438: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: What a horrible, horrible movie that was.
column439: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: And now we get to remember it forever.
column441: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Karen: Thank you. [Both hug]
column443: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey, hey, you. How are ya?
column444: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Second Cindy: Hey. This party blows, so we're gonna leave.
column445: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, no, no. Hey, you should stay because we are having fun and...
column447: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Where do you wanna go?
column448: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Second Cindy: I... We're just gonna take off.
column449: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I... you know what? I, OK, listen. I like you. I really like you. So much in fact, that I would like you to accompany me on a trip to Sandals, Jamaica.
column450: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Second Cindy: No... I have school. [leaves with other waitress and bicycle]
column451: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: You want help? OK... Merry Christmas.
column452: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Second Cindy: Merry Christmas.
column453: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [singing] Lady, from the moment I saw you standing all alone. You gave all the love that I needed...
column454: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: That waitress was the one.
column455: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: No. She wasn't.
column456: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: How can you be sure?
column457: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Well, for starters, I've known you as a couple since the beginning of the relationship, which was approximately [looks a watch] three hours ago.
column458: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Don't make fun... You're making fun of me.
column460: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I guess, I didn't know her very well. I marked her arm.
column462: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I, I put a mark on her arm. [Both are laughing] So I could tell them apart. I don't... I know, I know. I can't believe I gave her my bike!
column464: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, why do I feel like crap?
column465: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: You just had a rebound.
column466: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I had rebound? Yeah.
column467: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yeah. Which, don't get me wrong, can be a really fun distraction, but, when it's over, you're left thinking about the girl you really like, the one that broke your heart.
column468: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: I totally rebounded. Someone else shoots and I take the ball and I score. Well, I guess I didn't score and I'm not sure who's actually shooting, but, whatever. Doesn't matter. It's all good. Or as my ex might say. Domo arigato, Mr. Scott-o.
column469: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: [singing, with Dwight holding up microphone] Little baby, parum pum pum pum. I am a poor boy too, parum pum pum pum. I have no gift to bring, parum pum pum pum. That's fit to give our King, parum pum pum pum..
column470: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Michael: [on phone] Yes, I just wanted to see if, uh you would like to come to Jamaica with me. There's this resort called Sandals. Really? OK. All right. I promise you won't be disappointed. Umm, It's all-inclusive...
column471: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: [singing] ... Shall I play for you, parum pum pum pum [Oscar and Gil walk through door]
column472: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Too soon. [both turn back around and walk out]
column473: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Angela: [singing] I played my drum for Him, parum pum pum pum. I played my best for Him, parum pum pum pum, Rum pum pum pum, rum pum pum pum.
column474: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [singing along] pum pum pum pum pum pum pum
column477: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: [to Pam] Oh, you know what? Sorry, forgot to tell you. I intercepted a transmission earlier and it seems that the CIA is gonna need Dwight down at their headquarters in Langley for training and an ice cream social with the other agents.
column478: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: We should get him a bus ticket. [types on computer] To make his trip easier.
column479: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh no, that would be great.
column480: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Pam: It costs seventy five dollars.
column481: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Jim: Hmm... Well, maybe the CIA can send a helicopter?
column483: 03x10/11 - A Benihana Christmas (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [Cell phone beeps] What the? [Reading text message] "You have been compromised. Abort mission. Destroy phone." Destroy phone? [Dwight throws phone off of the roof and walks away]

column1: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: All right, let's get started. Umm... Oh, first off, we're supposed to be pushing cardstock this week. So... let's push cardstock this week. Uh, also... [to Dwight] what is this?
column2: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: Tape recorder.
column3: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: For what?
column4: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: For recording. Michael is on vacation and he's asked me to record all meetings and to type up the transcripts.
column5: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: OK. Uh, Karen, any news from that law firm?
column6: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Karen: Yeah, the deal closed yesterday, it's the six month commitment.
column7: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Oh my God, Dwight, what're you doing?
column8: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: What?
column9: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: You're not allowed to take off your pants in the middle of the office.
column10: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: I'm not.
column11: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Dwight, you know what, just back up, okay, that's making me uncomfortable. This is sexual harassment, by the way. Oh my God! He's got a knife!
column12: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: I do not have a knife!
column13: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: No, let the record show that Dwight K. Schrute is now completely nude and is holding a plastic knife to Stanley's neck?!
column14: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: [leans into tape recorder] Let the record show that Jim Halpert is a liar!
column15: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: [picks up tape recorder and speaks into it] Dwight Schrute is now wearing a baby's bonnet.
column16: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: Give me it. I am not.
column17: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Phyllis: Oh, Jim Carrey just walked in! Dwight, get his autograph for Michael quickly...
column18: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: Jim Carrey did not just walk in, OK.
column19: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Karen: Dwight, what is that on your stomach? Is that a Muppet Babies tattoo?
column20: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Oh my God, Karen, you're right, that is Animal from the Muppet Babies.
column21: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: You can't see... You can't see my stomach.
column22: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Andy: I am now chopping off Phyllis' head with a chainsaw! ... Rin-in-in-in-in-in!
column23: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Hey, mon!
column24: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Hey. You have a bunch of messages and... [sees Michael shaking head with beads in hair] that's nice. Hannah quit while you were gone. I guess she memo-ed to file some complaints she had about being a working mother? And so you might also have to be deposed.
column25: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah. Relax.
column26: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: OK.
column27: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Just relax, OK? I'll get to all of it later.
column28: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: It's kind of serious.
column29: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Aren't you going to ask me how Jamaica was? Say it. Ask me.
column30: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: How was Jamaica?
column31: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: It was so good. Oh, Hey mon! At Sandals, Jamaica, when somebody says "Hey mon," everybody says "Hey mon" back.
column32: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Stanley: Oh, Michael, I'm glad you're here.
column33: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Stanley. You know what? It is really good to see you, too.
column34: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Stanley: My bonus check was a hundred dollars less than you promised.
column35: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: OK, well payroll is in charge of all that.
column36: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Stanley: They said I should talk to you.
column37: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Well, I am just getting settled in. So, I'm gonna...
column38: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Stanley: I am not doing a lick more work until I get my full bonus check.
column39: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: You are not as much fun as your Jamaican brothers... mon.
column40: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: You want to talk about it?
column41: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Karen: Nope.
column42: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Karen: I still haven't found an apartment yet. I'm living in a hotel. Yesterday, I saw a "for rent" sign down the street from Jim and he said he didn't think it'd be such a good idea. He said it would be like we were living together. In different houses. Two blocks away.
column43: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Feelin' hot, hot, hot! [playing conch shell] Feelin' hot, hot, hot! Feelin' hot, hot, hot! Feelin' hot, hot, hot! That's all I know so far, but I'm gonna keep practicing.
column44: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: That's good. [Michael continues to play conch shell]
column45: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: You know, I had never been out of the country before now?
column46: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Huh.
column47: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Got to see how Jamaicans live. It is great, you know. They just relax, they party all the time.
column48: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: It's kind of an impoverished country.
column49: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Yeah... Gosh. Great. You know what, Pam? Make a note. I want us all to start having pina coladas every day at three.
column50: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: But you can't today, we're doing inventory.
column51: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Inventory's at the end of December.
column52: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: We couldn't do it without you, so we postponed.
column53: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: I specifically went on vacation so I would miss it.
column54: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Inventory is boring. In the islands, they don't make you do stuff like take inventory. Why do you think so many businesses move to the Caymans?
column55: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Tonight, we are going to have an inventory luau. I want to bring back a little slice of paradise to the Dunder Mifflin warehouse inventory. So, Party Planning Committee, get on it.
column56: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Angela: By the end of the day? That's impossible.
column57: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: The Jamaicans don't have a word for "impossible."
column58: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Yep, it's English, it's "impossible."
column59: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Angela: Michael, there's no way we can do it in time.
column60: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: How hard is a luau? All you need are some grass skirts, pineapple, poi, tiki torches, suckling pig, some fire dancers. That's all you need.
column61: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Come on in. Settle in. Settling. Settling... and settled. Good, there is something I would like to show everybody. See this sign? [points to a TV monitor of a picture from Jamaica and reads] "No Shirt, No Shoes, No Problem." This is an attitude I would like all of you to have right here. So what, if we have to stay late to do inventory? No problem.
column62: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Oh my God. Is that Jan? [points to same monitor]
column63: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Everybody: What? Where?
column64: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: On the left.
column65: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Everybody: Oh yeah, oh my God.
column66: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: No, no, no. No, that's a German woman named Urkel Grue.
column67: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Jan told me to play it cool and not tell anybody because it can get us both in trouble. So officially, I did not see her. But I did see Jan there. In our room. At night. And in the morning. That's all I'm gonna say. s*x. We had s*x. I had s*x with her. I had s*x with Jan.
column68: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: [on phone] Hey dude. I just got back from Jamaica.
column69: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Packer: Big whoop! I was in Hot-lanta. That whole town is whacked.
column70: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Yeah, that sounds amazing. You know what? The lady Jan Levinson wanted to go to Montego Bay.
column71: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Packer: You took the ice queen? I don't buy it.
column72: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Well I'm looking at a photo, right now. And I'm telling 'ya, could be in Maxim.
column73: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Packer: They wouldn't give you a subscription to Maxim.
column74: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Oh no?
column75: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Packer: No.
column76: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: OK. Well, check this out. I am sending you some email. You got it?
column77: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Packer: Well, no. I got nothing.
column78: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Check it again. Hit refresh.
column79: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Packer: Yeah, Mike, still nothing.
column80: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: OK, wait a second. I sent it to you at... [reading computer screen] Packer@DunderMifflin.com. Packaging@DunderMifflin.com. Uh oh.
column81: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Packer: Wait, I just got it from somebody else. Wow. This is hot. Damn! How do I get you out of this picture?
column82: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Darryl?! Hey. Hi. Where's Darryl?
column83: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Roy: He's in the office.
column84: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: OK, Hey, man, how's it going?
column85: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Darryl: All right, what's up Mike?
column86: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: That's great, OK. Um, so did you get an email from me?
column87: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Darryl: Yup.
column88: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: OK. Well, that was supposed to go to Packer, not "packaging." Did you already, um, forward to a whole bunch of people?
column89: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Darryl: Uh huh.
column90: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: OK. Um, well, did you get the second email that I sent? Explaining that the first email was a mistake and that you should delete it.
column91: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Darryl: Yup.
column92: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: And you sent that out to everyone?
column93: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Darryl: Mike, I'm very busy down here. [eats chicken]
column94: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Yikes.
column95: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Kevin: Already sent it to you my friend.
column96: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Fantastic.
column97: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Andy: Boring. Call me if she rolls over.
column98: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;
column99: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;
column100: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;
column101: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Hey.
column102: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Hey.
column103: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: You OK?
column104: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Yeah.
column105: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: You sure?
column106: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Yeah. Yes. Um, I'm just in this, like, stupid fight with Karen.
column107: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Oh. You want to talk about it?
column108: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Really?
column109: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: I have a special assignment for you.
column110: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: Who's the target?
column111: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: A sensitive email has been released to the office. It contains a file, a picture. The file name is "Jamaican Jan Sun Princess."
column112: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: What's it of?
column113: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Not important.
column114: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: Unless you're willing to tell me everything, I cannot accept this assignment.
column115: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: OK, forget it.
column116: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: OK, I accept it.
column117: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: So, I dunno, I just feel likes we've been dating a month, right? Same street. I think that might be a little close. A little much.
column118: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Hmm.
column119: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Hmm, what?
column120: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: How far away does she live now, like ten minutes?
column121: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Yeah, I guess.
column122: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Honestly, I think you should go easy on her.
column123: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: No, I didn't mind helping Jim with his problem. That's what friends do. I help Phyllis all the time. Just yesterday, I untangled a piece of tape from her hair. So, yeah.
column124: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Hey, thanks a lot.
column125: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Oh, don't worry about it. I mean, it's better than listening to Michael play a conch shell... which is what I was doing. Oh, also, Michael went to Jamaica with Jan!
column126: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Oh, yeah, How have we not talked about this already? I mean what happened there? Kidnapping? [both start laughing]
column127: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Toby: Hey I need to talk to you right now.
column128: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Not now, not ever.
column129: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Toby: About you and Jan.
column130: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Aww, none of your business.
column131: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Toby: Wish it were true, but it, it uh, seems from that photo that you took, you've entered into an intimate relationship.
column132: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: That photo is my personal property and if you are telling me you went on my computer and stole that photo, then I am going to call the cops.
column133: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Toby: Michael, nine different people emailed me that photo, including my ex-wife... we don't talk now.
column134: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: This is probably the icebreaker you need.
column135: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Toby: You know, for your own protection, you should disclose the relationship to HR.
column136: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: I bet you would love all the details, wouldn't you? Skeevy little perv.
column137: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Toby: All right, if you're having a relationship with your superior, you must disclose it.
column138: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: No, no, no. I am not dating Jan. She was very clear about that. Just two like souls having a romantic time in the most romantic place on earth. Got enough, weirdo?
column139: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Toby: All right, thanks Michael.
column140: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: OK.
column141: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Angela: OK, we only have three hours people to plan a whole luau, and you're not helping.
column142: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Karen: What are the ingredients of poi?
column143: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Phyllis: I called every grocery store in Scranton, and no one sells whole pigs.
column144: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Angela: Did you try the petting zoo?
column145: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: [on phone] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Just a second. Michael, it's Jan on the phone for you.
column146: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Oh, God, no. No, no! Hang up! Hang up! Tell her I'm not here. Tell... tell her, I ran out for cash. I hit a deer. I hit a deer with my car. Tell her I hit a cat. Tell her I hit a cat.
column147: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: He'll call you back. OK, great.
column148: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: She bought it? [Pam nods] OK. OK.
column149: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: [to Jim and Ryan] Michael hit a deer?
column150: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: Michael! Michael! [pokes head through blinds in Michael's office] There's an emergency in the warehouse.
column151: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: There an accident? Somebody hurt?
column152: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: No, it's... involves the photograph.
column153: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Oh. God. No, no, no, no, no.
column154: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Roy: [starts clapping] Mike, you are a rock star, man. You are the man! Well done.
column155: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: All right. [continued clapping and cheering for Michael]
column156: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Roy: That corporate booty, he likes to hit it!
column157: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Hello. Hi. Attention everyone. Um, apparently, there is an email circulating around that contains a very PG-13 rating picture of me and a woman---
column158: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Kevin: Jan.
column159: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: No, Kevin. A woman. Maybe Jan, maybe...
column160: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Urkel Grue.
column161: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: My point is that, if you get it, I would ask that you just delete it. Sight unseen. Let's be professional, all right?
column162: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Feelin'... feelin' hot, hot, hot! [plays conch shell]
column163: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Hey.
column164: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Hey.
column165: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: What are you doing out here?
column166: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Island living. You know?
column167: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Jan called. She's coming in later to talk to you.
column168: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Did she say what it's about?
column169: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: That's all she said.
column170: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Andy: Ole ole - ole ole... Ole ole - ole ole. People in the party - hot hot hot [playing conch shell]
column171: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Uh, I think you dropped this [hands over piece of paper]
column172: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Karen: You sure?
column173: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jim: Definitely.
column174: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: I have disconnected the office T1 line. I have ordered that that [referring to large picture of Michael and Jan in Jamaica on the wall] be taken down and destroyed all print outs from the bathroom.
column175: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: There are copies in the bathroom?
column176: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: There were. A lot of them.
column177: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: All right.
column178: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Karen: I think I owe you one.
column179: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Sorry?
column180: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Karen: For talking sense into Halpert. The Day's Inn room 228 was starting to get really depressing.
column181: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Oh, yeah, no. Don't worry about it. I mean, he was being ridiculous.
column182: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Karen: Yeah, but... thanks. Seriously.
column183: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Sure.
column184: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Darryl: Oh, yes! Yes! What'd I tell you? I knew he'd turn up [holds up an iPod inside speakers] You see that? This is the greatest night of my life.
column185: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: Who did this to you? [refers to Pam crying] Where is he?
column186: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: What? No, it's not... it's nothing.
column187: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: [takes off coat to tie around waist] It's hot in here.
column188: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Yeah.
column189: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: Yeah.
column190: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: [Dwight hands out handkerchief] Thanks. You don't need to stay here.
column191: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Dwight: I know. [puts arm around Pam who continues to cry] So you're PMSing pretty bad, huh?
column192: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jan: Hello everyone. Hello Michael.
column193: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Guh.
column194: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Kevin: Hi Jan, you look... tan.
column195: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jan: I was in Scottsdale visiting my sister.
column196: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Kevin: Yeah. How was it?
column197: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jan: Very sunny. Family's important. Michael, I would like to speak with you, in your office.
column198: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: OK, yup.
column199: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jan: Why am I here, Michael?
column200: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: I...
column201: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jan: In the last year, I've gone through a divorce, an identity theft, a husband who would not... communicate. This is nether here or there. My psychiatrist thinks that I have some self-destructive tendencies and that for once, I should indulge them. You following me?
column202: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: I... I... Yes.
column203: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jan: I think I owe it to myself to find some kind of happiness, you know? I mean, even, even if it means... lowering my expectations or, or redefining the word, itself.
column204: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: OK, yeah.
column205: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jan: This is the kind of thing, you know? I am... attracted to you. I, I don't know why, I... but, I am. And, I need to follow my instincts. At least that's what Dr. Perry thinks.
column206: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Who is Dr. Perry? I...
column207: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jan: This is the point, OK? You're wrong for me. In... In... every way. But I still find myself wanting to... be with you.
column208: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: And I, to you, in addition, feel the same feelings that you are as well.
column209: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jan: Good, good.
column210: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: So, umm... thanks for coming by. So, I, uh...
column211: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jan: Well, good, OK. Thank you... for taking the time...
column212: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Well thanks for coming over, I appreciate - [Jan leans over and kisses Michael passionately]
column213: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jan: Wait 15 minutes, find an excuse, and meet me at your condo.
column214: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Michael: Jan, you... complete... me.
column215: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Jan: Oh, God.
column216: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Roy: Hey, remember when we were planning our honeymoon and you wanted to go to Hawaii and I wanted to go to Mexico?
column217: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Pam: Yeah.
column218: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Roy: I was definitely right. [both laugh] Oh, brother.
column219: 03x12 - Back from Vacation;Kevin: What am I going to do? [Refers to large pictures of Jan and Michael] I'm gonna hang it up at home. I don't have a lot of art. [smirks]

column1: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Jim, could you come in here please?
column2: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Harvey: Hi, Jim.
column3: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Hello.
column4: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Harvey: I am Harvey, a computer. Jim sucks.
column5: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Sorry, oh wow, that's so rude. I'm sorry, I can't control him.
column6: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Yeah, you can.
column7: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: You know what? Get Pam.
column8: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: For this?
column9: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Pam.
column10: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Harvey: Pam, you look very hot today.
column11: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Pam, meet Harvey. This is Michael's new friend.
column12: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Great.
column13: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Harvey: Me so horny. Me love you long tim.
column14: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Oh, that is gross.
column15: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Who is 'Long Tim'?
column16: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Damn it.
column17: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Harvey: Long time. Me lobe yoy long time.
column18: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Oh well, 'Yoy' should bring in 'Long Tim' in one day. Shouldn't he?
column19: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: I would love to meet Long Tim.
column20: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Yeah. Right?
column21: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Yeah.
column22: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Harvey: You ruined a funny joke, you. Get out of my offive.
column23: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Ok.
column24: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Ok. Bye Harvey.
column25: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Harvey: Boobs.
column26: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Kevin: Angela.
column27: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: What?
column28: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Kevin: That was a voicemail that corporate left last night. They did not get our tax forms. Did you send them?
column29: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: They arrived this morning.
column30: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Kevin: Are you sure? It is a big deal.
column31: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: Is it a big deal? Is it Kevin?
column32: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Kevin: ... Do you really not know? Because it is a big deal.
column33: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Five of us transferred from Stamford. There are two of us left. Me and Karen. It's like we are touring Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory and dropping off one by one. Well, guess what? I am not falling in a chocolate river.
column34: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: Everything ok? [Takes candy from Pam's desk]
column35: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Everything is fine. You are in the clear.
column36: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: Thank you. [Puts candy back] I... I don't want those.
column37: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Dwight, care to join us, finally? Thank you.
column38: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Hey Dwight, pass the tardy sauce. Get it Michael?
column39: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Yes. Ok, here is the dream team. My sales dream team. Today we are going to team up for sales calls. Andy, since this was your idea, you get to pick first.
column40: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Hmmm, well... let me think about this for a minute. Oh, I don't know. Michael Scott.
column41: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Oh.
column42: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Ph. D. Doctor of Sales.
column43: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Well, I appreciate that. That is very gracious of you.
column44: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Well, it is very gracious of you to accept.
column45: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Well, thank you sir. Ok, now going by seniority. Phyllis, our resident senior.
column46: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Phyllis: We're the same age and I'll pick... Karen.
column47: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: Oh, uh, thanks.
column48: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Good. Next up, Superfly himself, Stanley.
column49: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Stanley: Pass.
column50: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: You can't pass. You've got to pick somebody.
column51: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Stanley: ... I'll take the kid.
column52: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Ryan: I am very flattered. I was his second choice after "Pass."
column53: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: So that just leaves Dwight and Jim.
column54: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Ok, wait. Does anyone want to trade?
column55: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Yup. I'll trade.
column56: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Dwight and I used to go on sales calls all the time. In fact, I have a picture to remember that time. Oh young Jim. There is just so much I need to warn you about. And yet, tragically, I cannot.
column57: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Sebring by Chrysler. Heck of a... motor... carriage.
column58: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Dwight?
column59: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Yup?
column60: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Here ya go. [throws laundry]
column61: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Yeah! You want shirts on hangers?
column62: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Please.
column63: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: He does your laundry?
column64: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Long story. All right everybody, circle up. Here we go. You know what this is? This is the "Amazing Race." [To Ryan and Stanley] And you guys are the retired marines. [To Phyllis and Karen] And you guys are the mother and daughter. [To Dwight and Jim] And you guys are the gay couple. And we are the firefighter heroes. Are we ready to go?
column65: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: Wait, "Amazing Race" like, the biggest sale wins?
column66: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: No, we're just going to rush out, do the sales thing, and come back.
column67: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Ryan: Is there a prize?
column68: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Just bragging rights.
column69: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Phyllis: Then how is this "Amazing Race"?
column70: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: It's just... brrrrrr... It's "Amazing Race," Phyllis. Okay? We're in teams of two and we are on a mission. All right, so, on your mark, get set, go. Let's do it.
column71: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Come on!!
column72: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Phyllis: Michael. [Michael throws Phyllis' keys under the car.]
column73: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Whoah, whoah. Oh hahahaha. Vamanos!
column74: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Bueno.
column75: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Phyllis: Do you have a pole?
column76: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: Let's go get a broom.
column77: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Seriously? You're going to sit in the back?
column78: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Uh, yeah. It's the safest part of the car. In the event of a crash, the driver always protects his side of the car first.
column79: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Here we go.
column80: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: In order to take down Dwight, I have to chip away at his ally, which, in this case, is Michael. Here's the good news. Every success I've ever had at my job or with the lady-folk has come from my ability to slowly and painfully wear someone down.
column81: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: What's the deal with Dwight doing your laundry?
column82: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Ugh... that is a long story. Um, couple of months ago, Dwight tried to go behind my back with Jan and get my job and I am now having him do my laundry as punishment.
column83: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Wow, that is a long story, but quite well told, Michael. I find it very interesting. Especially about the part Dwight going behind your back and basically, like, being a terrible person. You know if you want your laundry done right? I used to work at Abercrombie. So, pretty good folder.
column84: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: Hey Pam. Would you like to go with me to grab a coffee?
column85: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Really?
column86: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: Yeah, I could use some fresh air. Might be fun.
column87: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Ok. Sure.
column88: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: Ok.
column89: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: Why are we turning in here, this is a beauty salon?
column90: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Phyllis: Um-hmmm.
column91: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Ryan: Hey, do you mind if I take the lead on this one and then you can critique me after?
column92: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Stanley: You want the lead?
column93: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Ryan: Yeah, if you don't mind.
column94: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Stanley: Mind? Nothing would delight me more.
column95: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Leave the keys.
column96: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: You still do that thing?
column97: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Leave the keys!
column98: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: I think you have assembled an amazing team at Scranton. It's really a pleasure to be a part of it. It's like, everyone has their own special skill, you know, just like the Superfriends. Except for Dwight, who is more like a SuperDud. I mean, he would be a Superfriend if there was a Superfriend whose super power was always being late. You know?
column99: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Hawkman.
column100: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: My plan is taking longer than I thought but I don't give up easily. I have walked two marathons.
column101: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: [Walks out of the Ladies' Restroom] Let's go. The men's room was disgusting.
column102: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: After you sir.
column103: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: No thank you, I never let anyone walk behind me. Seven out of ten attacks are from the rear.
column104: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Ok, well, that still leaves a 30% chance that I will attack you from the front.
column105: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Uh, yeah, but it will be easier to stop. I can always block the blow. I can counter it with... [Jim slaps Dwight]
column106: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Angela, you seem so happy. I bet you wish you were like this all the time.
column107: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: This friend of mine - let's call her Noelle - she missed this deadline turning something in to Corporate in New York. But then this gallant gentleman - we'll call him Kurt - he drove all the way to New York and handed it in for her. That's... I don't know. I guess he really just likes her a lot.
column108: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: That's great.
column109: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: Yes, it is. [Walks up to the counter where there is no employee] Hello?
column110: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Hey, did you catch that up at Lake Wallenpaupack?
column111: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Buyer: Yep.
column112: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: You know, I used to go up there all the time with my step-dad, and I never caught anything that big.
column113: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Caught an eighty-pound shark off of Montauk. It's in the Hamptons. My dad's got a 42-ft Bayliner. Sniped it with a rifle from the crow's nest. Also shot a deer once.
column114: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: You know what? Let's get right down to it. Dunder-Mifflin may be just two rooms and a warehouse, but what we lack in flash, we will make up for with hardwork and decency.
column115: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Ok, this is the classic undersell because you should know we don't work out of a log cabin. We trade on the New York Stock Exchange. Ever heard of it? It's in New York.
column116: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Buyer: Uh, I have to say I am a little wary with getting involved with a big company. We've had some problems in the past.
column117: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: I think what Andy is trying to express is that while we have the resources of a large company, we will give you the care and attention of a small company.
column118: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Oh, man, that is, like, poetry.
column119: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: No.
column120: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: I swear, this guy could sell paper to a tree.
column121: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Stop it. [Puts his hand on Andy's shoulder] Stop it.
column122: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Ow.
column123: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;[ Newpeat Quote ]
column124: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. [excited] This is Pam. I did?
column125: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Oh man. Talk about your classic "Lame dash O." Do we even want that guy buying our paper?
column126: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Yes.
column127: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;
column128: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;
column129: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;
column130: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: I... I'm so sorry man. I really screwed that up.
column131: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Ah, no. Don't worry about it.
column132: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: I really 'Schruted' it.
column133: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: What?
column134: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: 'Schruted' it. It's just this thing that people say around your office all the time. Like, when you screw something up in a really irreversible way, you 'Schruted' it. I don't know where it comes from though. Do you think it comes from Dwight Schrute?
column135: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: I don't know. Who knows how words are formed.
column136: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Phyllis: It's a big order. Thanks Kenny.
column137: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: Yeah, thank you.
column138: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Phyllis: Hey, how's Annie?
column139: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Kenny: Oh, she's great. This is us last year in Bermuda. Lovely place. You ever been to Bermuda?
column140: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Julius: Stanley Hudson.
column141: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Stanley: Ah, Julius, how's it goin'?
column142: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Julius: Great, great, great.
column143: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Guy: Stanley.
column144: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Stanley: So good to see you too. I'd like you fellas to meet Ryan Howard.
column145: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Ryan: Hi.
column146: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Stanley: I'm gonna let Ryan do a little pitch for you while I do my crossword. Ryan?
column147: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Ryan: Um... [To the Buyers] Hi. Hi. Hi. Hi.
column148: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Julius: Hello, Ryan. What do you have for us?
column149: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Ryan: Oh...
column150: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: We can offer our biggest discounts on 30% recycled and ultra-premium laser.
column151: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Man: 'Kay. 'Kay.
column152: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Can I use your phone?
column153: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Man: Yeah, sure, go ahead.
column154: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Thanks.
column155: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Let me talk to you about a few of the other things we can offer. Namely, we know the tax season is coming up, so by April 1st we can have you fully stocked.
column156: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: [On Phone] One...
column157: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: We have discount prices on ink cartridges...
column158: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Three...
column159: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: And, also, any forms that you are going to need...
column160: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Seven...
column161: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: We can custom make them.
column162: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;[ Newpeat Quote ]
column163: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Yeah I did a watercolor of Frances Willard Elementary School for a contest they were having. They were calling with the results. And I won. I won! My painting won. So I like to thank my mom for always encouraging me. And I like to thank my dad for buying me my first set of art pencils. And I'd like to thank the sixth grade class that picked me.
column164: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;[ Newpeat Quote ]
column165: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Hey Kev, guess what. I won an art contest today.
column166: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Kevin: How much did you win?
column167: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: $100.
column168: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Kevin: I won $400 bucks on the Celtics game last night.
column169: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Cool. Congratulations.
column170: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Kevin: Thanks, so sweet.
column171: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Stanley: Ha ha ha! And you just said, "Hi! Hi! Hi!" Ha heh ha! You sounded like my niece, and she's six months old!
column172: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Man: We'll I appreciate what you guys are saying but it, uh, makes more fiscal sense to go with one of the big guys.
column173: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Sure.
column174: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Sure, that's true we can't compete with their prices. But let me ask you something. How important to you is customer service?
column175: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Man: It's very.
column176: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Phone: Please keep holding, your call is very important to us.
column177: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Erm, that's one of the 'Big guys.' Been on hold this whole time.
column178: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: [Dials cell Phone] And this is Dunder-Mifflin.
column179: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Kelly: Dunder-Mifflin customer service, this is Kelly.
column180: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Hey, Kelly, it's Jim.
column181: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Kelly: Oh my god, Jim. How are you ? I wanted to tell you ... . [Jim hangs up]
column182: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Here is my card. It's got my Cell number, my pager number, my home number, and my other pager number. I never take vacations, I never get sick, and I don't celebrate any major holidays.
column183: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Man: All right, I get it. We got a deal.
column184: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Thanks.
column185: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;[ Newpeat Quote ]
column186: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Hey, Angela. I got good news today too. I won an art contest.
column187: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: That's great Pam. I like having these little moments with you. You know what? Sprinkles recently had kittens.
column188: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Oh.
column189: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: I would like to offer you the dominant male. His name is Ash.
column190: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Oh?
column191: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: Mmm-hmm.
column192: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Hmm. I don't think so. But thanks. My building manager... is... You understand.
column193: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: Well then. Have a nice day.
column194: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: Thanks. That was fun.
column195: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Phyllis: Yeah, I really enjoy spending time with you. You are a very nice person.
column196: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: Thank you.
column197: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Phyllis: I'm so glad you're with Jim. He was hung up on Pam for such a long time. Never thought he would get over her.
column198: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: That's nice.
column199: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Phyllis: You can pay me back later for the makeover.
column200: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Hey boss. Got a minute?
column201: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Yes, Andy.
column202: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: I forget, why did Dwight say he was late this morning?
column203: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: He didn't say.
column204: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: That's weird. Because I was just walking past his desk and I saw this, which is a tollbooth receipt from New York City, stamped really early this morning. So, why would Dwight go to New York without telling anyone? Do you think he went to see Jan? That's not like him. Is it? Someone told me a story about this, with, like, laundry and betrayal. Did you betray Dwight and try to steal his job or something?
column205: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: No, you are remembering it wrong.
column206: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Dwight betrayed me once before. So this is his strike two. You know what they say? Fool me once, strike one. But fool me twice, strike three.
column207: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: I like Karen. She's pretty and appears intelligent.
column208: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Well, I like pretty women who have the appearance of intelligence.
column209: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: My girlfriend is also beautiful and smart. She could be a model or a college professor which is intimidating to a lot of guys.
column210: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: We should go on a double date.
column211: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: No thank you.
column212: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jan: Dwight's name is on the security sign-in sheet, but I don't know who he met with. And where it asks to state your business, he wrote "Beeswax. Not yours, Inc."
column213: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: I knew it. [Dwight and Jim walk in]
column214: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Oh, doggie.
column215: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: Hey, do you want to grab a coffee?
column216: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Sure. Look at you!
column217: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: Yeah.
column218: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;[ Newpeat Quote ]
column219: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Beesley, coffee?
column220: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: No, thanks. I had some already.
column221: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: All right.
column222: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Oh, but, hey, Jim.
column223: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Yeah.
column224: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: I won an art contest today.
column225: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: No way! All right Pam. Congratulations. [high five]
column226: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Thanks.
column227: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Which one was it?
column228: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: I sent in one of my watercolors.
column229: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Cool.
column230: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: It was the new one I did.
column231: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Oh
column232: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: You ready Jim?
column233: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Yeah. Can I see it when I get back?
column234: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Yeah.
column235: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Congratulations.
column236: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Pam: Thanks.
column237: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Big deal.
column238: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Hey, we nailed the sale!
column239: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Where were you this morning?
column240: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: I overslept. Damn rooster didn't crow.
column241: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Why do you lie, liar?
column242: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: I am not a liar.
column243: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: You are lying right now.
column244: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: It sure seems like he is lying.
column245: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Stay out of this, you!
column246: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: I know that you went to corporate this morning, and I know that you lied about it. And given our history, I need you tell me this instant exactly what you were doing.
column247: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Michael, I cannot tell you what I was doing there. But you have to trust me, I would never do anything to hurt you or this company.
column248: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Ok, you know what? I want you to think about your future in this company. I want you to think about it long and hard.
column249: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: That's what she said.
column250: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Don't. Don't you dare. I want to know what you were doing this morning by the end of the day.
column251: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: It's going to be ok.
column252: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: How is going to be ok, Dwight? Everyone will know our business.
column253: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: That's not the worst thing in the world. I'll just stand up in front of the office and reveal our true love. It won't be that bad. Look at Kelly and Ryan.
column254: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: I hate those two people more than anything in the entire world.
column255: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Well, I don't have a lot of choices.
column256: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: So, let me ask you a question.
column257: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Ok.
column258: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: Did you ever have a thing for Pam?
column259: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Pam? Did I ever have a 'thing' for her? No, why? Did she say something?
column260: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: I moved here from Connecticut...
column261: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Yeah. Ok, here's the ... I had a crush on her before I left. And I told her about it and she didn't feel the same way. So, it didn't amount to anything, and I left. I'm really glad you're here. 'Kay?
column262: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: 'Kay.
column263: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: Ahem-hem-hem. May I have your attention please? This will only take a moment of your time. Although I love this company more than almost anything in the world, I have decided to step down from my post and spend more time with my family. I do not fear the unknown and I will meet my new challenges head-on and I will succeed. And I will laugh in the faces of those who doubt me. It has been a pleasure working with some of you and I will not forget those of you soon but remember, while today it is me, we all shall fall. In other words, I am quitting. So... .
column264: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Oompa-Loompa Doompity-Dawesome, Dwight is now gone which is totally awesome. Why was he gone, he was such a nice guy? No, he was not. He was a total douche. Doompity-doomp.
column265: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: I would like to give the rest of my belongings to Michael Scott. Just take them. Except this.
column266: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Michael: Good luck.
column267: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Ryan: Dwight will be missed. Not by me so much, but, he will be missed.
column268: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Angela: Dwight, from sales, was one of the most honorable and efficient employees this company has ever had.
column269: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Dwight: One of my life goals was to die right here in my desk chair. And today, that dream was shattered.
column270: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Jim: Hey man. [Dwight hugs Jim and leaves]
column271: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Karen: What happened on your sales call?
column272: 03x13 - Traveling Salesmen;Andy: Um, am I happy the way things turned out? Oh, well, happy's such an ugly word. But, um, I saw what needed to be done and I did it and now I'm thrilled. So, it's pretty... [camera had focused in on Angela watching] Hello? Pretty good.

column1: 03x14 - The Return;Dwight: I have left Dunder-Mifflin after many record-breaking years and am officially on the job market. And it's very exciting.
column2: 03x14 - The Return;Dwight: For your convenience, I've broken it down into three parts: professional resume, athletic and special skills resume, and Dwight Schrute trivia.
column3: 03x14 - The Return;Dwight: I am ready to face any challenges that might be foolish enough to face me.
column4: 03x14 - The Return;Dwight: How would I describe myself? Three words. Hard-working, Alpha male, Jackhammer, Merciless, Insatiable.
column5: 03x14 - The Return;Dwight: There is nothing on my horizon except everything. Everything is on my horizon.
column6: 03x14 - The Return;Dwight: [in Staples uniform] I got this job to make some money while I continue my employment search. And uh, it's fine for the time being. Oops. Break's over.
column7: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: [to Ryan] Big Turkey. [cellphone plays "Rockin' Robin"]
column8: 03x14 - The Return;Jim: Is that you singing?
column9: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: All four parts. Recorded it on my computer. It took me forever.
column10: 03x14 - The Return;Jim: Nice job.
column11: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Thank you muchly. [cellphone continues playing]
column12: 03x14 - The Return;Jim: You gonna answer it?
column13: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: I called it myself. I just thought you'd get a kick out of the new ring.
column14: 03x14 - The Return;Jim: Yikes.
column15: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Side note. I'd just like to say I'm thrilled to be working directly beneath you.
column16: 03x14 - The Return;Jim: Thank you.
column17: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: I feel I have a lot to learn from you, even though you're younger and have less experience. So here's to the future... Andy and the Tuna. [sings] Andy and the tuna...
column18: 03x14 - The Return;Jim: I miss Dwight. Congratulations, universe. You win.
column19: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Yes, Dwight Schrute has left this company. More personnel turnover.
column20: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: The cost of doing business.
column21: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Yes, well. It is a big loss. Dwight was the top salesman...
column22: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Was the top salesman...
column23: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: I said 'was'.
column24: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: [chuckles] Addition by subtraction.
column25: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: What does that even mean? That is impossible.
column26: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Mmmm. Yeah you're right.
column27: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: But, there is some good news. Oscar is back. Addition by addition. So we are going to have a big party today to welcome him back and hopefully that will lift everybody's spirits.
column28: 03x14 - The Return;Oscar: Hey, everyone.
column29: 03x14 - The Return;Kevin: Oh, hello, Oscar. How was your gay-cation?
column30: 03x14 - The Return;Oscar: Oh, that's very funny.
column31: 03x14 - The Return;Kevin: Yeah? I thought of it like, two seconds after you left.
column32: 03x14 - The Return;Oscar: [sits at his desk] Hi, Angela.
column33: 03x14 - The Return;Angela: Oscar.
column34: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Hey, boss.
column35: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Hey, what's up.
column36: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Noooothin'. Ehrrrrrrrrr. Heh. Man. TGI-Wednesday. Am I right?
column37: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Yep.
column38: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Gonna go home. Get my beer on. Get my "Lost" on. What are you doing later, wanna hang out?
column39: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: I don't know. Maybe.
column40: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Well, I will take that as a maybe. [Michael gets up] Where are you going?
column41: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Bathroom.
column42: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Oh, well, I'm going to the kitchen, I'll walk with you.
column43: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: [lurking by the bathroom door] Yeah, things are going pretty good. Gettin' a lot of face time with the boss.
column44: 03x14 - The Return;Angela: Oscar? I have a question. Would you like to join the party planning committee?
column45: 03x14 - The Return;Oscar: The one of all women?
column46: 03x14 - The Return;Angela: Yeah.
column47: 03x14 - The Return;Oscar: Because I'm gay?
column48: 03x14 - The Return;Angela: No. No. Certain events have transpired. And I've thought about certain things. And I'm sorry for the way those certain events transpired. [starts to cry] And I would just like to make some changes about certain things and certain situations.
column49: 03x14 - The Return;Oscar: OK, OK, OK, all right, all right. I'll join. I'd love to. That's -- thank you.
column50: 03x14 - The Return;Angela: Thank you. [sniffles]
column51: 03x14 - The Return;Kevin: Can I join too?
column52: 03x14 - The Return;Angela: Never.
column53: 03x14 - The Return;Staples Guy: You sell those two printers this morning? Nice work.
column54: 03x14 - The Return;Dwight: [scoffs] Child's play. Give me something hard to sell.
column55: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Wow. [walks over to the plant] What is wrong with this thing? It looks terrible.
column56: 03x14 - The Return;Pam: Do you want me to ask the cleaning crew if they stopped watering it?
column57: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Yeah. And you know what? Ask them about the toys on my desk too. They always used to arrange them in a very pleasing way. It used to brighten my morning.
column58: 03x14 - The Return;Pam: Oh, that wasn't the night crew. That was Dwight.
column59: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Really? That was very nice of him. We need more attitude like that around the office.
column60: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Feel ya, dawg.
column61: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Yeah, do you?
column62: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Absolutely.
column63: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: What did I say?
column64: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: You said... [makes gibberish noises]
column65: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Huh.
column66: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Which is like, "Right on." And Pam was like "blah blah blah" and you were like "Yeah, psht." Nailed it.
column67: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Oh, no.
column68: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Oh, no.
