column69: 03x14 - The Return;MIchael: Love that Andy, right? Solid fellow. Seems smart enough. Likes me a lot. A lot. Too much. Like a crazy person. A little. Not super crazy... just... there's something about him that creeps me out. I can't really explain it. He's always up in my bidness. Which is ebonics for "being in my face and annoying the bejesus out of me." I don't understand how someone could have so little self-awareness.
column70: 03x14 - The Return;Oscar: I really have no preference. We don't even have to have a party.
column71: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: No, hey, hey. Don't be ridiculous. Of course we are going to have a party. A celebration of Oscar. Oscar night. And I want it to be Oscar-specific.
column72: 03x14 - The Return;Oscar: Michael --
column73: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: No, no, no. I mean, not because you're gay. Your gayness does not define you. Your Mexican-ness is what defines you to me. And I think we should celebrate Oscar's Mexicanity. So Phyllis... I want you to go find firecrackers. And a Chihuahua. Pam, in the frozen food section, Swanson makes a delightful chimichanga.
column74: 03x14 - The Return;Oscar: Why don't you have me riding in on a donkey into the office like Pepe.
column75: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Ah, a burro, of course. If Oscar wants a donkey, let's get him one.

column104: 03x14 - The Return;
column105: 03x14 - The Return;
column106: 03x14 - The Return;
column107: 03x14 - The Return;Phyllis: Dwight has a big personality and I have a big personality. And a lot of times when two people like that get together it can be explosive.

column117: 03x14 - The Return;Paris: I don't like him, his giant head, or his beady little eyes. That's all I got to say on the matter.

column138: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Where is my FREAKING phone?!

column141: 03x14 - The Return;Jim: Okay.
column142: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: [trying to look in Phyllis's desk, she slams the drawer shut] I don't trust you, Phyllis!
column143: 03x14 - The Return;Angela: I wanted to let you know that Dwight was late that morning because he was driving to New York to drop off the correlated documents that I forgot to send. Though to be fair, Kevin never reminded me.
column144: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Why would Dwight do that for you? I think I know why. Because Dwight loves this company.
column145: 03x14 - The Return;Angela: Yes.
column146: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Do you think that anyone else out there would have driven to corporate for you?
column147: 03x14 - The Return;Angela: None of them. Especially not Andy.
column148: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Pam, I have a mission to accomplish. Make sure this party gets rolling and I will be back shortly.
column149: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Wait up. Where are you going? Do you want me to come with?
column150: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: Um.
column151: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Just listen, I forgot to tell you the plan for this Saturday. You, me, bars, beers, buzzed. Wings. Shots. Drunk. Waitresses, hot. Football - Cornell/Hofstra. Slaughter. Then a quick nap at my place and we'll hit the tiz-own.
column152: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: No. I don't want to do any of that.
column153: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Duh. Which is why I was just joking about doing that.
column154: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: No, just stop. Stop. Stop doing it. You're going to drive me crazy.
column155: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Fine. I'll just sit at my desk and be quiet. Sorry I annoyed you with my friendship. [Andy's phone rings] Excuse me. And I'm also sorry that a lot of people here for some reason think it's funny to steal someone's personal property and hide it from them. Here's a little newsflash! It's not funny! In fact, it's pretty freakin' unfunny! Oh, my GOD. [punches a hole in the wall] That... was an overreaction. Gonna hit the break room. Does anybody want anything? Pam, you good?
column156: 03x14 - The Return;Pam: Yeah.
column157: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: Sure? Okay.

column166: 03x14 - The Return;Dwight: Accepted.

column200: 03x14 - The Return;Jim: [long pause and then he sighs and nods] Yes.
column201: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: And now, ladies and gentlemen, the big finale! Sir, would you do the honor? [hands broom to Dwight, though Oscar thinks he's handing it to him]
column202: 03x14 - The Return;Dwight: Oh, man. [Kevin starts to put a blindfold on] No, no, no. I don't need it. Get out! [beats up pinata]
column203: 03x14 - The Return;Michael: It takes a big man to admit his mistake and that's what I did. The important thing is I learned something. I don't want somebody sucking up to me because they think I'm going to help their career. I want them sucking up to me because they genuinely love me. Hmm.
column204: 03x14 - The Return;Andy: So Michael had a little chat with corporate and they decided to send me to management training. Anger management, technically, but still. Management material. [gets out of his car] This whole thing supposed to take ten weeks, but I can be done in five. How? Name repetition, personality mirroring, and positive reinforcement through nods and smiles. So, don't worry about old Andy Bernard. I'll be back. Just like Rambo, so.

column148: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Look at that. Nothing like grilling in the great outdoors.
column149: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ryan: Is this the same grill you grilled your foot on?
column150: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: No. Yes.
column151: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ryan: Oh gross.
column152: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: But I got all the foot off of it.
column153: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: Okay Ben Franklin!
column154: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Karen: Ben Franklin tied a cherry stem with his mouth!
column155: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ben Franklin: Well, that is because I am a renaissance man.
column156: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: Ben Franklin, do you wear boxers, briefs, or pantaloons?
column157: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ben Franklin: Well, you're very saucy! [Winks at Pam.]
column158: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Guys, beef! It's what's for dinner! Who wants some man meat?
column159: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Dwight: I do! I want some man meat!
column160: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Jim: Michael, Dwight would like your man meat.
column161: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Well then my man meat, he shall have. There you go. Deliciousity.
column162: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Stanley: [Stanley's fork breaks.] Of course.
column163: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Karen: So I guess you have the Ben Franklin wig and the costume and you figure, how can I put this to practical use?
column164: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: Well I like to think that his dad was a Ben Franklin impersonator and he really pressured him into it.
column165: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Karen: Hey um, I wanted to talk to you. I know this is weird or whatever, but Jim told me about you guys.
column166: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: What do you mean?
column167: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Karen: Well that you kissed. And we talked it through and it's totally fine, it's not a big deal. It's just a kiss. Wait- you're not still interested in him?
column168: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: Oh yeah.
column169: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Karen: Really?
column170: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: Oh no, I was confused by your phrasing. You should definitely go out with Jim. I mean, you're going out with Jim. I'm not going out with Jim. You're dating him, which is awesome, because you guys are great together.
column171: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Karen: Okay.
column172: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: I'm not into Jim. Yeah.
column173: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Karen: So um, well good.
column174: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: Yeah. Sorry.
column175: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Karen: What are you sorry about?
column176: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: Um, what?
column177: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Karen: What are you sorry about?
column178: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: Nothing. I was just thinking of something else.
column179: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Kevin: Okay. The game is no limit deuce to seven lowball. Lines twenty five fifty, nickels are worth ten, dimes twenty-five, and quarters fifty. Nothing wild.
column180: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: I call shuffle. Here we go. [Spreads cards out all over the table]
column181: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Kevin: Michael.
column182: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Ah, gentlemen, the entertainment is here. Everybody I'd like to introduce you to Elizabeth.
column183: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Elizabeth: Hi guys!
column184: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Nice outfit.
column185: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Elizabeth: I hear there's an important meeting here.
column186: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Roy: I'm not really into strippers. You know what I find sexy? Pam's art. She's an artist and I appreciate that. It's very moving and sexy. The art.
column187: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Elizabeth: Hit it. [Feel Like Makin' Love plays in background] So where's the groom?
column188: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: He's right there. There he is.
column189: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Bob Vance: Absolutely not. That's all you. That's all you.
column190: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Okay. Alright, I'll do it. Yeah. Lets do it. Lets do this thing. Yeah. What do I?
column191: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Elizabeth: Just sit on down.
column192: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Alright.
column193: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Elizabeth: Alright.
column194: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Okay.
column195: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Elizabeth: Here we go.
column196: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Here we go. Alright!
column197: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Elizabeth: Yeah!
column198: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Not bad! Not bad! You smell nice. Like Tide.
column199: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Elizabeth: Mmm, what's that?
column200: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: You smell like Tide detergent. Do you use Tide detergent? Ha ha ha! I have a girlfriend so...
column201: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Elizabeth: I bet she'd be jealous. [Rips off shirt]
column202: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Yeah she probably, yeah she would be. You know what, okay, excuse me. Please stop it, stop it. Turn off the music. This is wrong, this is wrong! This is wrong! I have a girlfriend. And you are engaged and I'm sure you have a boyfriend in prison or something so lets just clear out okay. Shame on you. Go back to work!
column203: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Dwight: Elizabeth, I want you to sit here. When the phone rings, answer it.
column204: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Elizabeth: You want me to answer phones with my clothes on.
column205: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Dwight: We hired you for three hours work and we're going to get it.
column206: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Elizabeth: Oh I love your poster.
column207: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Angela: Thank you.
column208: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Kevin: [Mouths 'hi' at the stripper]
column209: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ben Franklin: You know I invented electricity.
column210: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: I know.
column211: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ben Franklin: Well I'm sensing a little electricity right here.
column212: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: Didn't Ben Franklin have syphilis?
column213: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ben Franklin: Yes, but I don't. My name is Gordon.
column214: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: Ohhh.
column215: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: On one hand I want to be honest with Jan and tell her the truth but on the other hand I'm afraid she's going to dump me.
column216: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ben Franklin: You know Michael, I fathered an illegitimate son.
column217: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Really.
column218: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ben Franklin: But I kept all this from my wife Deborah. These things only serve to upset the women. They are the gentler s*x.
column219: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Well, Ben Franklin, you're really kind of a sleezebag.
column220: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Stripper? Could I ask you a question about women? Um, should I tell my girlfriend that you danced up on me?
column221: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Elizabeth: Secrets, secrets are no fun. Secrets, secrets hurt someone.
column222: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Wow. Thank you.
column223: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Dwight: Care for a piece of chocolate?
column224: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ben Franklin: Chocolate! Where did you acquire it? That is a delicacy in the Amazon but it has not yet been imported to the United States.
column225: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Dwight: Who is the king of Austria?
column226: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ben Franklin: Joseph the 2nd.
column227: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Dwight: Who is the king of Prussia?
column228: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ben Franklin: Fredrick Wilhelm the 3rd.
column229: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Dwight: Who is the king of England?
column230: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ben Franklin: Why the tyrant King George, of course!
column231: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Dwight: I don't care what Jim says, that is not the real Ben Franklin. I am 99% sure.
column232: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Jan: [On speaker phone] Michael, I left a meeting. What is so urgent? Are you, are you okay?
column233: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Not really, look I don't know how to say this so I just will.
column234: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Jan: Okay.
column235: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: I went to a bachelor party and things got a little out of hand.
column236: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Jan: Uh when, when did, when last night?
column237: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: No, today at work.
column238: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Jan: You went to a bachelor party at work?
column239: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: Yes. I kind of arranged it.
column240: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Kelly: Well I don't even think the stripper was that hot. Do you guys think she was hot?
column241: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ryan: Kelly don't do this.
column242: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Kelly: Do what? I just asked you a question.
column243: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ryan: You know what you're doing.
column244: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Kelly: Anyway, do you know who was totally flirting with Ben Franklin? Pam.
column245: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Jim: Really? Looks like I hired the right guy. I'm glad. Any real potential there Beesley?
column246: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: Yeah, right. God, I need a boyfriend. You know Ryan I'm totally ready to be set up with one of your business school friends. Whenever.
column247: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ryan: Ok.
column248: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Elizabeth: Oh my God, I would get so fat if I worked here.
column249: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: Yeah? I lose my appetite all the time.
column250: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Elizabeth: You could strip you know.
column251: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Pam: Thanks.
column252: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: So you don't want to end our relationship?
column253: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Jan: I'm closer to firing you.
column254: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: That is so sweet. You are the best GD girlfriend in the world. Do you know that?
column255: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Jan: I'll talk to you later.
column256: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: You are. You are.
column257: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Michael: So you know who turned out to be kind of a creep? Ben Franklin. And Elizabeth the stripper gave me great advice. Which rhymed. Really makes you wonder how Ben Franklin can become president, but someone like Elizabeth can't.
column258: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Dwight: Are you near sighted or far sighted?
column259: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Ben Franklin: Both. That's why I invented the bifocal.
column260: 03x15 - Ben Franklin;Dwight: GAH!!!

column3: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Jim: In school, we learned about this scientist who trained dogs to salivate at the sound of a bell by feeding them whenever a bell rang. For the last couple of weeks I've been conducting a similar experiment.
column4: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Jim: [Windows reboot sound] Dwight, want an Altoid?
column5: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: Okay.

column9: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: Inbwit? Yes.

column12: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: I...

column16: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Photographer: Okay, for this next one everyone hop out. Just Phyllis and Dad. Actually, let's bring Mom back in. And the sisters. And you, and you, and you. Great.
column17: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Phyllis is getting married. And I am in the wedding party. She has asked me to push her father's wheelchair down the aisle. So, basically, I am co-giving away the bride. Since I pay her salary it is like I'm paying for the wedding. Which I'm happy to do. It's a big day for Phyllis. But it's an even bigger day for me. Employer of the bride.
column18: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Phyllis: Yes, I put Michael in my wedding. It was the only way I could think to get six weeks off for my honeymoon. No one else has ever gotten six weeks before.
column19: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Pam: Phyllis... ended up using the exact same invitations as Roy and me. So it was kind of like being invited to my own wedding. And I was like 'Wait, thought I called that off'.
column20: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Jim: So what's in the box?
column21: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Stanley: A toaster, you?
column22: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Karen: A toaster.
column23: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Stanley: Unbelievable.

column25: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Angela: Hi, Dwight.
column26: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: You look as beautiful as the Queen of England.
column27: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Angela: Thank you. Don't linger. Break left. Left!
column28: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: The Shrutes have their own traditions. We usually marry standing in our own graves. Makes the funerals very romantic, but the weddings are a bleak affair.
column29: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Jim: Those flowers are nice.
column30: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Karen: Yeah. P and R?
column31: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Jim: Phyllis and Robert.
column32: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Karen: Ah, of course.
column33: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Pam: Also, Pam and Roy.
column34: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: There she is. I swear Phyllis you are as beautiful as the first day you started work at Dunder Mifflin.
column35: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Phyllis: Thanks, Michael. That's sweet. Same as when you said it outside.
column36: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: How you doin'? You excited.
column37: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Phyllis: Yes, very.
column38: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Me, too. If you need to vomit, that is ok. I did. Do you want to talk about tonight?
column39: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Phyllis: No.
column40: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: You're probably worried about pleasing Bob. A lot of pressure. Phyllis, did you break wind? It's okay, if you did. It's a very natural reaction. It's your wedding. And you're nervous...
column41: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Phyllis: That wasn't me.
column42: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Okay... umm... I'm sure that Bob... Wow. That is... that is pungent. I lost my train of thought. Aaah... Are you set on that hairstyle?
column43: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Phyllis: I thought it was...
column44: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Here, let me...
column45: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Phyllis: Michael... No.
column46: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Just cover up that bald patch.
column47: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Phyllis: I don't need your... thank you. No, Michael please... I just need some time alone.
column48: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Okay.
column49: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: You might be surprised to learn that I've only been to one other wedding. It's actually a very cute story. My Mom was marrying Jeff. And they asked me to be ring bearer. I was understandably emotional and somehow my pants became wet.
column50: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: [in video of Michael as a kid] I hate you!
column51: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Long story short: Jeff's dog ended up as ring bearer. And the irony is that after the ceremony that dog peed on everything and nobody said 'boo'.
column52: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: Why are all these people here? There are too many people on this Earth. We need a new plague. Who are all these people?
column53: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Jim: You know what? I bet a lot of them are wedding crashers.
column54: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: No way.
column55: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Jim: Did you ever see that movie?
column56: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: Of course I saw it.
column57: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: I saw Wedding Crashers accidentally. I bought a ticket for Grizzly Man and went into the wrong theatre. After an hour, I figured I was in the wrong theatre, but I kept waiting. That's the thing about bear attacks, they come when you least expect it.
column58: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Jim: You know I just wish, I wish, I had the investigative powers to smoke some of these guys out.
column59: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: Once again, Jim, I will take care of this. I will locate the wedding crashers and report them to Phyllis. That way I won't have to get her a gift.
column60: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Kevin: [to Toby's date] Hi. I'm Kevin. [to Toby] Where did you find her?
column61: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Toby: At the gym.
column62: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Kevin: Riiight. The gym. [snickers]

column65: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Kelly: I know but there was an emergency.
column66: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Kelly: I look really good in white.
column67: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: This strappy young lad sitting here is Phyllis' father, Albert, and he is quite the ladies' man, aren't you Albert, hah? Ah, ringbearer. I could have done better. I will do better. I am going to be better. I can't believe I'm actually doing this! Ooh! Are you ready for this, Albert? I am. Let's do it.
column68: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Pam: That's my dress.
column69: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: [whispers to father] That's ok. [Albert gets out of his wheelchair and starts walking]
column70: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: It's a miracle.
column71: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Crowd: [generalized clapping]
column72: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: This is bull****!
column73: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Me walking Phyllis down the aisle was supposed to be the highlight of the wedding. And now... the wedding has no highlight.
column74: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: I can't believe I pushed that... that guy's lazy ass around all day... until he was ready to stand up and steal the show. That's... well... I got news for you, Albert. If that's your real name. The show's not over.
column75: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Priest: And do you, Phyllis, take Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration, to be your lawfully wedded husband?
column76: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Phyllis: I do.
column77: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Ladies and Gentlemen, may I present to you for the first time as a couple, Mr. and Mrs. Bob Vance!
column78: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Priest: And do you, Bob...
column79: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Oh, shiii...
column80: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Priest: ... take Phyllis to be your lawfully wedded wife
column81: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Bob Vance: I do.
column82: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Priest: You may now kiss the bride.
column83: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Ladies and Gentleman, for the first time as a couple, Mr. and Mrs. Bob Vance. [generalized clapping and cheering] Yeah! That's what I'm talking about!

column87: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Angela: Congratulations, Phyllis. You look lovely. Your dress is very white. So white, my eyes are burning.

column98: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Pam: Oh... um... no. That's... um... That's actually fine
column99: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Kelly: There's no way it's fine. I'm sorry. If I was you, I would just like freak out and get really drunk and then tell someone I was pregnant.

column107: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: Got to find yourself another wedding to crash, my friend.
column108: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Uncle Al: Oh!
column109: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Phyllis! Are you happy with everything? What can I do to make it more perfecter?
column110: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Phyllis: It's beautiful. Why don't you find your seat. Enjoy the buffet.
column111: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: I'm already on it. The chicken? Totally undercooked. I sent it back.

column113: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: I will take care of that.
column114: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: I do. I know a fair amount about fine food... and drink. This is a white.
column115: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Kevin: No this is not our first wedding. This is the THIRD wedding that Scrantonicity has played. We also played our bassist's wedding and our guitarist's wedding.
column116: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Kevin: Attention, everyone. Attention, please. I am supposed to ask if anyone has seen Uncle Al. He is old and has brown eyes and dementia. His family is very concerned. It is a very serious situation. [sings] Roxanne. You don't have to put on your red light.
column117: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Roy: Hey.
column118: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Pam: Hey.
column119: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Roy: I know I normally don't notice these kind of things but uh... This wedding's really nice! I mean, the flowers and stuff? Phyllis has got some great taste.
column120: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Pam: You're kidding me, right?
column121: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Roy: I know you're probably not going to remember this, right? But um... Those color roses? I got you those color roses for our prom.
column122: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Pam: Roy, I picked those flowers. Phyllis just stole all of my ideas for our wedding.
column123: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Roy: I uh guess I wasn't really too involved in the planning.
column124: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Pam: Yeah.
column125: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Roy: Sorry about that.
column126: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Pam: It's okay.
column127: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Roy: You think this sucks for you? I was the one who actually wanted to get married.
column128: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Randy: Phyllis, you're a wonderful woman. And you're a hell of a bowler!
column129: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Crowd: [cheering and clapping]
column130: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Unknown: She is.
column131: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Randy: Cheers.
column132: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Crowd: Cheers.
column133: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Thank you, Randy. That was great. Thank you. Thank you very much. Hi, I'm Michael Scott and for the next forty minutes, I'm going to be your tour guide through the lives of Phyllis Lapin and Bob Vance. One of the great, seemingly impossible, love stories of our time. My name is Michael Scott. Webster's Dictionary defines "wedding" as the fusing of two metals with a hot torch. Well, you know something. I think you guys are two metals. Gold medals. For those of you who don't know me, I'm Michael Scott, Phyllis' boss. To quote from The Princess Bride "Mawige...
column134: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: The most important part of a speech is the opening line. When time is not a factor, I like to try out three or four different ones.
column135: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Phyllis and Bob: their celebrity couple name would be Phlob. You look at her... and she's kind of matronly today, but back in High School, I swear, her nickname was 'Easy Rider'. Now as for Bob... Bob Vance...
column136: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Bob Vance: Oh okay. That's enough.
column137: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: is a guy that...
column138: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Bob Vance: Thanks, Michael. Give me...
column139: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: he works... Okay hold, hold on, hold on. Look. Look. I didn't say anything when Phyllis' dad upstaged me at the ceremony. And I think you owe me this. Kay.
column140: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Bob Vance: Give me the microphone.
column141: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: No. I'm not going to...
column142: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Bob Vance: Give me... Give me the microphone, Michael.
column143: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Ok. All right.
column144: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Bob Vance: You're out of here!
column145: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Oh. Yeah. You're out of here! You're... Yeah. I hate you!
column146: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Jim: Hey.
column147: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Pam: Hey!
column148: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Jim: When are we going to get to see some of those famous Beesly dance moves?
column149: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Pam: Oh... I'm pacing myself.
column150: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Jim: Come on. Get out there. Give the people what they want.
column151: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Pam: No. I'm such a dorky dancer.
column152: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Jim: I know. It's very cute.
column153: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Jim: Hypothetically, if I thought Pam was interested, then... No, it's totally hypothetical.
column154: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Come... Come on!
column155: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: I can't let you in, Michael.
column156: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Dwight, just...
column157: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: No, it's Bob and Phyllis' orders.
column158: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Look, I just wanted to go in and quietly sit and have a piece of cake. I'm not even going to dance one song.
column159: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Dwight: You are a real life wedding crasher and I must bounce you. I'm sorry, it gives me no pleasure.
column160: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: OK.
column161: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Roy: Hey, they're playing our song.
column162: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Pam: Yeah, that's weird. I thought they only played the Police.
column163: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Roy: I know. Uh... I gave them twenty bucks. You want to dance?
column164: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: [sings] ee... I was meant for you... buppity du bom bu.
column165: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Roy: [to Pam] Hey, want to get out of here?
column166: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Jim: Here's a 'not hypothetical'. I'm really happy I'm with Karen.
column167: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Karen: [sings] Every little thing she does is magic. Every little thing she do just turns me on. Even though my life before was tragic. Now I know my love for her goes on. Every...
column168: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Women: One... Two... Three. Ahhhh! [Phyllis throws the flowers, Ryan knocks them out of Kelly's hands, Toby's date gets them]
column169: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Toby: Toby! Yeah!
column170: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: I just want Phyllis to have a great day.
column171: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Uncle Al: Phyllis and you will be great together.
column172: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: We are great together. We are a great team.
column173: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Uncle Al: The Celtics were a great team.
column174: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Yes. Yes. They were. Robert Parrish! I should talk to her. I don't want this to ruin her honeymoon.
column175: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Uncle Al: Nobody ever helped me. I had to do it myself. Even the doctor didn't know!
column176: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Dude, keep it together. I listened to you for half an hour even though most of that stuff went right over my head.
column177: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Phyllis. Phyllis! Wait! Please. I'm sorry. I just... I just wanted to make this a day to remember.
column178: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Phyllis: You found Uncle Al!
column179: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Yeah. Yeah. He's kind of a weirdo.
column180: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Phyllis: Thank you, Michael.
column181: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: You're... You're welcome.
column182: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: They say that your wedding day goes by in such a flash that your lucky if you even get a piece of your own cake. I say that's crazy. I say let them eat cake. Margaret Thatcher said that about marriage. Smart broad.
column183: 03x16 - Phyllis' Wedding;Michael: Be careful. Oh no!! [Phyllis and Bob smear cake on each other's face] Oh wow! Phyllis! Phyllis! You look like a clown! Here. Get me! Get me! [Michael smears cake on his own face]

column1: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Oh hey, Kevin, nice of you to join us, where were you?
column2: 03x17 - Business School;Kevin: My tire blew out on the way here, Michael.
column3: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Huh?
column4: 03x17 - Business School;Kevin: I almost died. I... I went into this skid---
column5: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Pop quiz.
column6: 03x17 - Business School;Kevin: ...What?
column7: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Why is today a special day?
column8: 03x17 - Business School;Kevin: I almost died.
column9: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Today's a special day, because I am being honored as a... visiting... professor, special lecturer, emeritus... how did you, how did you...
column10: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: You will be a guest speaker... in my Emerging Enterprises class.
column11: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: In business school, Kevin. Business school.
column12: 03x17 - Business School;Kevin: Wow.
column13: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: If you bring your boss to class, it automatically bumps you up a full letter grade. So... I'd be stupid not to do it, right?
column14: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: A boss is like a teacher. And I am like the cool teacher. Like Mr. Handell. Mr. Handell would hang out with us, and he would tell us awesome jokes. And he actually hooked up with one of the students. Um... and then like twelve other kids came forward. It was in all the papers. ... Really ruined eighth grade for us.
column15: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Here we go. College Roadshow. Gotta bring our... A game. What was the most inspiring thing I've ever said to you?
column16: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: "Don't be an idiot." Changed my life.
column17: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: Whenever I'm about to do something, I think, "Would an idiot do that?" And if they would, I do not do that thing.
column18: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Will they throw their hats, you think?
column19: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: What?
column20: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: A lot of times, at a... school, or naval academy, after a rousing speech, the crowd would throw its hats high into the air.
column21: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: Y-You understand nobody's graduating.
column22: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Yeah, I know, I know. I'm just saying if they did throw their hats I've got a great line for that: "May your hats fly as high as your dreams." ... That was a pretty good line.
column23: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: ...It doesn't apply.
column24: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: I understand! Wow. Relax, spazzy boy. Sometimes you're such a little spaz! [pokes Ryan] Whoa, hey!
column25: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: Quit it!
column26: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: We have fun.
column27: 03x17 - Business School;Roy: I can't for your art show tonight.
column28: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Okay, just so you know, it's just the students from my class in a little studio.
column29: 03x17 - Business School;Roy: I-I wouldn't miss it for the world.
column30: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Thanks.
column31: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: I'm really happy to be back with Roy. I think it shows maturity. Maturity and dignity. ... Is that braggy? I don't mean it to be braggy.
column32: 03x17 - Business School;Roy: Love ya.
column33: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: You too.
column34: 03x17 - Business School;Jim: Pam's with Roy. I'm with Karen. And, uh, Brangelina is with Frangelina. Movin' on.
column35: 03x17 - Business School;Kelly: I can't believe you're back together with Roy!
column36: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Oh, yeah! We have such a solid foundation, you know.
column37: 03x17 - Business School;Kelly: Oh my God. You're so in love now.
column38: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Yeah. Oh, you should come to my art show, by the way.
column39: 03x17 - Business School;Kelly: Oh, art show!
column40: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: I mean, it's not a big deal, but I think a lot of people from the office will be there.
column41: 03x17 - Business School;Kelly: ...Oh... yeah. Definitely... I'll be there. For sure.
column42: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Campus. Brings back so many memories. ... That I would have made. Hey. Frisbee. Check that out. Aww! What do you say we get our Fris on before class? [runs over, throws frisbee] Whoo!
column43: 03x17 - Business School;College Student: ....Dude.
column44: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: ...Oh my God. Animal stool. [jumps on desk]
column45: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Dwight, what are you doing?
column46: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: Solving a mystery, if that's quite alright with you. [opens ceiling tile] Come to Papa. Okay, ladies and gentlemen, what we have here is a bird that has been trapped in a vent. Fortunately I have found it befo--BAT! BAAAT! BAT!
column47: 03x17 - Business School;Karen: Oh my God!
column48: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: BAAAAT! BAT! NO! EVERYONE REMAIN CALM! There it goes!
column49: 03x17 - Business School;Stanley: Goooood bye.
column50: 03x17 - Business School;Angela: [on ground] ... Please don't let that stupid thing near me...
column51: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Okay, this is it. Ryan is doing my intro right now.
column52: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: ...Dunder-Mifflin can't compete with the modern chains, and management is unwilling, or unable, to adapt. Their customers are dying off...
column53: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: I can't hear what he's saying, but he looks like he's really into it.
column54: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: We have... a bat... in the office.
column55: 03x17 - Business School;Toby: The simple solution would be to open a window... if we had... windows that could open.
column56: 03x17 - Business School;Angela: Poop is raining from the ceilings. Poop!
column57: 03x17 - Business School;Jim: Okay. Thanks. [hangs up phone] Animal control will be here at six.
column58: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: At Six?! No, that is unacceptable. Okay, Jim, you are the number two in this office. You need to step up and show some leadership.
column59: 03x17 - Business School;Jim: I'm sorry what did you say? So wierd...
column60: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: What? What's so wierd?
column61: 03x17 - Business School;Jim: The bat, I mean, I know I felt it bite me, but look. There's no mark. I feel so... tingly... so strangely powerful... [shrugs] Oh well.
column62: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: And now, without further ado, I present the regional manager of Dunder Mifflin, Scranton, Michael Scott.
column63: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Hello everyone, I am Michael Scott. And I would like to start today by inspiring you. May I borrow someone's textbook, please? Thank you. What have we here? Ooh. Economics. Very, very interesting. [rips pages out of book] You cannot learn from books. Replace these pages with life lessons, and then, you will have... a book... that is worth its weight in gold. [gives book back] I know these are expensive, um, but the lesson is priceless. Good. Alright. I think you're inspired. Shall we proceed? There are four kinds of business: Tourism. Food service. Railroads, and sales. And hospitals slash manufacturing. And air travel.
column64: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: [sighs] This is your job, Halpert.
column65: 03x17 - Business School;Jim: Ow!
column66: 03x17 - Business School;Karen: Oh, what happened?
column67: 03x17 - Business School;Jim: That bread on your desk? I just picked it up. It's white hot.
column68: 03x17 - Business School;Karen: But Jim, this garlic bread is cold.
column69: 03x17 - Business School;Jim: What? ... No. It burned me. I... bizarre.
column70: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: No... no. One crisis at a time.
column71: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: If a vampire bat was in the U.S., it would make sense for it to come to a "sylvania." Like PENN-sylvania. Now that doesn't mean that Jim is going to become a vampire. Only that he carries the vampiric germ.
column72: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: So, you wanna start a business. How do you start? What do you need? Well, first of all, you need a building. And secondly, you need supply. You need something to sell. Now this could be anything. It could be... a... thingamajig. Or a... a whosi-whatsi. Or... [pulls out a candy bar] a Whatchamacallit [throws bar]. Now, you need to sell those in order to have a PayDay [takes out a PayDay, throws it]. And, if you sell enough of them, you will make a 100 Grand [throws 100 Grand bar]. [pulls out a Snickers] Satisfied?
column73: 03x17 - Business School;Toby: Oh, this looks great. I'd, I'd love to be there, but my daughter's play is tonight. ... Damnit! You know, one of the other parents will probably videotape it.
column74: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Oh! No, you should go.
column75: 03x17 - Business School;Toby: Well, it's important to support local art, you know. And what they do is not art.
column76: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Okay, I'm seeing some confused... faces out there. Let me slow down a little bit. Break this down. Okay. The more stickers you sell, the more profit, fancy word for money, you have to buy PlayStations and Beanie Babies.
column77: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: Michael.
column78: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: ...And products!
column79: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: What we normally do here is more of a question and answer thing.
column80: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Well... okay, I was just kind of getting it going. Um, alright. Well, okay, we can do questions. Okay. Very good. First hand up.
column81: 03x17 - Business School;Business Student #1: Sir, as a company that primary distributes paper, how have you adapted your business model to function in an increasingly paperless world?
column82: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: We can't overestimate the value of computers. Yes, they are great for playing games and forwarding funny emails. But real business is done on paper, okay? Write that down. [everyone types on their laptops]
column83: 03x17 - Business School;Karen: Hey Jim, here's the aspirin you wanted.
column84: 03x17 - Business School;Jim: Oh, thank God. I have such a headache from that glare.
column85: 03x17 - Business School;Karen: What glare?
column86: 03x17 - Business School;Jim: The glare off Angela's crucifix? It's blinding.
column87: 03x17 - Business School;
column88: 03x17 - Business School;
column89: 03x17 - Business School;
column90: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: I don't have a lot of experience with vampires, but I have hunted werewolves. I shot one once. But by the time I got to it, it had turned back into my neighbor's dog.
column91: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: Extraordinary events call for extraordinary actions. We form an allegiance--
column92: 03x17 - Business School;Creed: Sure.
column93: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: --to use sudden violence.
column94: 03x17 - Business School;Creed: Okay.
column95: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: Do you have the tools to turn a wooden mop handle into a stake?
column96: 03x17 - Business School;Creed: What size?
column97: 03x17 - Business School;Business Student #2: What do you say to a customer who wants to leave you for the convenience and savings of a nationwide chain?
column98: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: ...I say you will miss our service, and I absolutely guarantee you'll come back.
column99: 03x17 - Business School;Business Student #2: Has anyone ever come back?
column100: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: ...We don't want them back, 'cause they're... stupid.
column101: 03x17 - Business School;Business Student #3: How far has your Herfindahl index declined since the merger?
column102: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Nice try, how's your Pollack-says-what index?
column103: 03x17 - Business School;Business Student #3: ...What?
column104: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Thanks, Kowalsky. Um, can we get on track here?
column105: 03x17 - Business School;Business Student #1: By your own employee's calculation you'll be obsolete in the next five to ten years.
column106: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: ...Wait, Ryan said that?
column107: 03x17 - Business School;Kelly: What are you doing? You'd better not hurt that little bat.
column108: 03x17 - Business School;Creed: Animals can't feel pain.
column109: 03x17 - Business School;Kelly: Don't hurt that bat, Creed! It's a living thing with feelings and a family!
column110: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: Flush him towards the door. On my go... NOW!
column111: 03x17 - Business School;Kelly: AHH! KILL IT! KILL IT! KILL IIIT!
column112: 03x17 - Business School;Kevin: [locks bat in break room] I... am a hero!
column113: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Yeah sure, you know business, sitting up here in your ivory tower. And your ebony tower. You know what? Tell you one thing, Dunder-Mifflin is here to stay.
column114: 03x17 - Business School;Business Student #2: But how can you compete against a company with the resources of a nationwide chain?
column115: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: David will always beat Goliath.
column116: 03x17 - Business School;Business Student #1: But there's five Goliaths, there's... Staples, Officemax...
column117: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Yeah, yeah. You know what else is facing five Goliaths? America. Al-Qaeda, global warming, s*x predators... mercury poisoning. So do we just give up? Is that what we're learning in business school?
column118: 03x17 - Business School;Business Student #1: But in the big picture...
column119: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Dunder-Mifflin is the big picture! Can't you understand that? No, you can't. You're too young. Ryan... has never made a sale. And he started a fire trying to make a cheesy pita. And everybody thinks he's a tease. Well you know what? He doesn't know anything, and neither do you. [walks out] SO SUCK ON THAT!
column120: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: ...It wasn't personal.
column121: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Business is always personal. It's the most personal thing in the world. When we get back to the office, pack your things.
column122: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: Pack my--?
column123: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: You heard me, pack your things.
column124: 03x17 - Business School;Meredith: I really want to come out!
column125: 03x17 - Business School;Creed: Good night, Mary Beth!
column126: 03x17 - Business School;Jim: So... you're cool to just wait here for animal control?
column127: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: Animal control? I've been controlling animals since I was six.
column128: 03x17 - Business School;Jim: Cool. Okay. I'm gonna go home and lie down, draw the shades... there's just so much sun in here... bye Dwight.
column129: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: Goodbye Jim. And good luck.
column130: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: Jim is on a path now. An eternal journey, and I wish him well. But I have a destiny in this realm. Specifically, in the kitchen.
column131: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: ...And it's all from the same series.
column132: 03x17 - Business School;Woman: Oh.
column133: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Called 'Impressions.'
column134: 03x17 - Business School;Woman: Oh.
column135: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Not that I call myself an impressionist, per se.
column136: 03x17 - Business School;Woman: Maybe one day.
column137: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: I hope so.
column138: 03x17 - Business School;Woman: Mmm.
column139: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: I still need... you know, my breakthrough, or whatever. [Woman leaves, Roy enters] Hey, babe, how are you?
column140: 03x17 - Business School;Roy: Good. Alright I brought my brother, huh?
column141: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Hey, Kenny.
column142: 03x17 - Business School;Kenny: Hey Pam.
column143: 03x17 - Business School;Roy: How 'bout this, huh? I show up with my brother, and, no one from work is here? That's... pretty cool, huh?
column144: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: Magic time. Gyeeeaahhh! [puts bag over Meredith's head]
column145: 03x17 - Business School;Meredith: Ahh! Ahh! Ahh! Get off! Get off me! Get off me!
column146: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: Hold still, woman!
column147: 03x17 - Business School;Meredith: Get off me! Get it off! Ahhhh!
column148: 03x17 - Business School;Dwight: ...[captures bat in bag] ... You're welcome.
column149: 03x17 - Business School;Roy: It's cool if I go, right? I mean, I looked at all of them.
column150: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Yeah, I'll just, I'll drive myself home.
column151: 03x17 - Business School;Roy: To my place?
column152: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Maybe, I'm a little tired.
column153: 03x17 - Business School;Roy: Your art.. was the prettiest art of... all art.
column154: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Thank you.
column155: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: Look, I'm sorry, okay? I was just trying to do my presentation, and... of course, I was wrong to suggest that Dunder-Mifflin might ever go out of business. But you don't have to fire me.
column156: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Fire you? No, no no. You are moving... to the annex.
column157: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: To the annex? Where... Kelly is?
column158: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: A good manager doesn't fire people. He hires people and inspires people. ... People, Ryan. And people will never go out of business.
column159: 03x17 - Business School;Oscar: You're the one who said we needed more culture.
column160: 03x17 - Business School;Gil: This is culture to you?
column161: 03x17 - Business School;Oscar: It's her first try.
column162: 03x17 - Business School;Gil: Yeah, on Van Gogh's first try, he drew the hands of the peasants.
column163: 03x17 - Business School;Oscar: Meaning what?
column164: 03x17 - Business School;Gil: Meaning, real art takes courage, okay? And honesty.
column165: 03x17 - Business School;Oscar: Well, those aren't Pam's strong points.
column166: 03x17 - Business School;Gil: Yeah, exactly. That's why this is... motel art.
column167: 03x17 - Business School;Artist: Thanks for coming.
column168: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Pam-casso! Sorry I'm late, I had to race across town.
column169: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Oh, Michael.
column170: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Wow! You did these... freehand?
column171: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Yep.
column172: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: My God, these could be tracings! Ohh! Look at this one. Wow! You nailed it. [sighs] ... How much?
column173: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: What do you mean?
column174: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: I don't see a... price.
column175: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Um... you wanna buy it?
column176: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Well, yeah. Yeah, we have to have it for the office. I mean, there's my... window, and there's my car! That your car?
column177: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Uh-huh.
column178: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: That is our building... and we sell paper. ... I am really proud of you.
column179: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: [hugs Michael] ... Thank you.
column180: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: What?
column181: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: Do you have something in your pocket?
column182: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: ...Chunky. Do you want half?
column183: 03x17 - Business School;Pam: No thank you.
column184: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: Okay.
column185: 03x17 - Business School;Michael: It is... a message. It is an inspiration, it is... a source of beauty. And without paper, it could not have happened. Unless, you had a camera.
column186: 03x17 - Business School;Kelly: Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God...
column187: 03x17 - Business School;Ryan: It's only temporary, okay? Don't get excited.
column188: 03x17 - Business School;Kelly: I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't...

column1: 03x18 - Cocktails;Michael: Can you confirm that the straps are tight?
column2: 03x18 - Cocktails;Dwight: Yes. But this [pulls at straight jacket] seems to be...
column3: 03x18 - Cocktails;Michael: And now, the chains.
column4: 03x18 - Cocktails;Michael: A lot of people think that magic camp is just for kids. And that's why so many other people in my class were kids. Self fulfilling prophecy. It's um, it's really for anybody with a dream and a belief in magic and a little extra time after school.
column5: 03x18 - Cocktails;Michael: MAGIC MAGIC Magic Magic magic magic... And now, Michael the Magic, will attempt to escape from extreme bondage. [Kevin giggles] Can he do it? I don't see how he can.
column6: 03x18 - Cocktails;Dwight: I know how. Dislocate his shoulder and slip his arm out from underneath.
column7: 03x18 - Cocktails;Michael: No. No. Everyone, now count down with me. THREE!
column8: 03x18 - Cocktails;Jim: Sorry, quick thing. Is it true that if you can't get out, you don't want anyone to help you?
column9: 03x18 - Cocktails;Michael: I will get out. Oh yes, I will.
column10: 03x18 - Cocktails;Pam: So we shouldn't help you, no matter how much you might beg and plead?
column11: 03x18 - Cocktails;Michael: No. Alright, this is getting hot. So let's just do this. Ok, ready? Three, two, one, go. [Michael spits out key, Jim covers it with his foot.]
column12: 03x18 - Cocktails;Michael: AHHHH!
column13: 03x18 - Cocktails;Kevin: Is everything ok, Michael?
column14: 03x18 - Cocktails;Michael: Yes.
column15: 03x18 - Cocktails;Michael: I cannot tell you how I plan to escape. Other than by using magic. That is the magician's code. Separately, on an unrelated note, if you happen to find a small brass key...
column16: 03x18 - Cocktails;Michael: Alright.
column17: 03x18 - Cocktails;Dwight: [trumpet sounds]
column18: 03x18 - Cocktails;Michael: Ready? Come on guys. Early worm gets the worm.
column19: 03x18 - Cocktails;Jim: Another worm? Like, are they friends?
column20: 03x18 - Cocktails;Dwight: It's early bird gets the worm.
column21: 03x18 - Cocktails;Michael: Pam, would you smell my breath?
column22: 03x18 - Cocktails;Pam: No, no.
column23: 03x18 - Cocktails;Dwight: Let me smell. [Michael breathes at Dwight] Good, not great.
column24: 03x18 - Cocktails;Michael: "Michael, you go to parties all the time, why is tonight so special?"
