column38: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: What did I tell you about "yeppers?"
column39: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: I don't... remember.
column40: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: I told you not to say it. Do you remember that?
column41: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Yeesh...
column42: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Pam: I really don't want to talk about it. I don't mean to be rude, but I just... I don't want to comment on what happened. It sucked.
column43: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: I guess... all things considered, I was lucky Dwight was there. And Roy was lucky that Dwight only used pepper spray. And not the nunchucks or the throwing stars.
column44: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Hey man, I never got a chance to thank you... for stopping Roy. Thank you.
column45: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Dwight: Thank you not necessary and thus, not accepted. I saw someone breaking the law and I interceded.
column46: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Okay. Um... Got you something.
column47: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Dwight: Don't want it.
column48: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: You don't know what it is.
column49: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Dwight: Don't want it. Won't open it. Don't need it. Won't take it. Citizens do not accept prizes for being citizens.
column50: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: It was a little glass display case for his for his bobblehead. That would have made us even, I think. He saves my life, I get him a box for his desk toy. Even Steven.
column51: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Dwight: No, don't call me a hero. Do you know who the real heroes are? The guys who wake up every morning, and go into their normal jobs, and get a distress call from the commissioner, and take off their glasses and change into capes and fly around fighting crime. Those are the real heroes.
column52: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Oscar: Angela, Roy's check. He's coming in later to pick it up.
column53: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kevin: Man, I cannot believe I missed the fight.
column54: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Oscar: It was crazy.
column55: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Angela: You saw it? Describe it please.
column56: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Oscar: Well, I heard some shouting. And I look over and Roy's by reception and you could just tell he's gonna punch somebody. Jim says something. Roy stomps over there. All of the sudden, BAM. Roy goes down, and Dwight's standing there like an action hero.
column57: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Angela: Oh...
column58: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Oscar: It was insane!
column59: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Angela: [flustered] Well... good for Dwight.
column60: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Ok I want you to be Darryl and ask me for a raise, because I want to try out some of these negotiation tactics on you.
column61: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Where'd you get that?
column62: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Wikipedia.
column63: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Wikipedia... is the best thing ever. Anyone in the world can write anything they want about any subject, so you know you are getting the best possible information.
column64: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Ok, Darryl, ask me for a raise.
column65: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Hey, Mike. Since Roy left I've been doing a lot more work, and I need a raise.
column66: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Hmm, well that's interesting Darryl. I think... [mumbling softly] that maybe you should... [mumbling jibberish]
column67: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: I can't hear you.
column68: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: What I'm saying is that, [continues to mumble jibberish]
column69: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Still nothin'.
column70: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Ok, see what I did?
column71: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: No.
column72: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: By leaning back, and by whispering, I established a dominant physical position.
column73: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Nice.
column74: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Ok, let's try another one. Um...
column75: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Okay.
column76: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Walking out of the room unexpectedly.
column77: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: And what happens in this one?
column78: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: It's a surprise.
column79: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Okay.
column80: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Go ahead, ask me for a raise.
column81: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Can I have a raise?
column82: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: [gets up and begins to walk out of the room]
column83: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: [softly] s*x, Steve Martin, Terri Hatcher.
column84: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: What?
column85: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: What?
column86: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: No, what did you say?
column87: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: I didn't say anything. I was waiting to see what happened.
column88: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Oh it... sounded interesting... what you were gonna...
column89: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Dwight: I saw the perpetrator advance toward the victim at a high rate of speed. His head was thrown back, his shoulder and arm cocked indicating an attack position. Perp grabbed the victim. I removed my weapon from its secure hiding place.
column90: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Toby: Which is where?
column91: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Dwight: Irrelevant. Discharged it at a distance of a little over a meter into the perpetrator's eyes, nose, and face area. Rendering him utterly and completely disabled. Then I contacted the authorities. The end.
column92: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Toby: Thanks Dwight.
column93: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kelly: That is the bravest thing I have ever heard.
column94: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Ryan: I can't imagine what I would have done.
column95: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kelly: I can. You would have left me to fend for myself. Like that time we were on the Ferris Wheel and that kid dropped a milk shake on me and you just laughed.
column96: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Ryan: Well that was funny, that's why.
column97: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kelly: Oh it was?
column98: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Ryan: Mm-hmm.
column99: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kelly: Okay, well the next time that you get scared, that you think a murderer's in your apartment in the middle of the night...
column100: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Ryan: Okay.
column101: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kelly: ...and you call me, to calm you down...
column102: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Ryan: You know what? I didn't---
column103: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Toby: Can you stop...
column104: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kelly: ...you can just call somebody else 'cause I'm not gonna do it anymore, Ryan. I'm not.
column105: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Toby: There's a bunch of people back here, maybe...
column106: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Ryan: Well, don't talk to me about calling people in the middle of the night...
column107: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Toby: Guys...
column108: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kelly: I call you in the middle of the night to tell you that I love you!
column109: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Toby: I don't think Michael intended to punish me, by putting Ryan back here with Kelly. But, if he did intend that? Wow. Genius.
column110: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: [knock on door] Yeah.
column111: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: You ready for me?
column112: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Yes, yeah, absolutely. Have a seat.
column113: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Cool.
column114: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: You know what? Actually, let's go into the conference room.
column115: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Okay.
column116: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: No, you know what? Let's stay here. No let's go... Yeah let's go to the conference room.
column117: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Tactic number six. Change the location of the meeting at the last second. Totally throws 'em off.
column118: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Number 14, declining to speak first. Makes them feel uncomfortable, puts you in control.
column119: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: [long pause] I am declining to speak first.
column120: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Okay, I'll start. It's pretty simple really. I uh, I think I deserve a raise. I'm scheduled to get one in six months, but I'd like that to be moved up to now.
column121: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Hmm. Ohh, Darryl. You are a good worker, and a good man. I just, you know, times are tight. And I just don't think corporate is going to go for this right now.
column122: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Are you wearin' lady clothes?
column123: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: What?
column124: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Are you wearin' lady clothes? Those look like lady... pants.
column125: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: No, this is a power suit.
column126: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: That there's a woman's suit.
column127: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: [Darryl laughs] I do not buy woman's clothes. I would not make that mistake again.
column128: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: I'ma call Roy, man.
column129: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Ohh... kay.
column130: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: This is gonna make him feel better.
column131: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: All right.
column132: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: This is too good.
column133: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Alright, you know what? Pam, could you please tell Darryl that this is not a woman's suit?
column134: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Pam: Oh my God, that's a woman's suit!
column135: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kevin: You're wearing a woman's suit?
column136: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: No, I do, I, I wear men's suits, OK? I got this out of a bin.
column137: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: There were these huge bins of clothes, and everybody was rifling through them like crazy, and I grabbed one. And it fit! So I don't think that this is totally just a woman's suit. At the very least it's bisexual.
column138: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kevin: Who makes it?
column139: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Uh, [reading the inside of his jacket] MISSterious. And it is mysterious because the buttons are on the wrong side... that's the mystery.
column140: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Phyllis: Look, it's got shoulderpads, and did you see that lining?
column141: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Okay.
column142: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Phyllis: Did you see...
column143: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Would you stop it, please?
column144: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: So, none of that tipped you off?
column145: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: It's European, OK? It's a European cut.
column146: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Pam: Michael, the pants don't have any pockets.
column147: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: No, they don't. See? [Michael lifts his jacket tail, sticks out his back side and shows Pam]
column148: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Pam: [Laughing, covering her mouth]
column149: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Italians don't wear pockets.
column150: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Pam: It's been a really rough couple of days... This helps a little.
column151: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Karen: Hey, maybe you want to come over and raid my closet?
column152: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: No, I don't want to do that because I'm twice your size anyway.
column153: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Yeah, he look like Hillary Clinton.
column154: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Um, let's just do this in 15 minutes.
column155: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Okay, can you just stand right there? [snaps camera phone picture] I gotta send some e-mails.
column156: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Negotiations are all about controlling things. About being in the driver's seat. And make one tiny mistake, you're dead. I made one tiny mistake. I wore woman's clothes.
column157: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kevin: Karen, how do you feel that Roy tried to kick your boyfriend's ass over another woman?
column158: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Karen: I feel great, Kevin. Thank you.
column159: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Stanley: You must have been scared out of your mind.
column160: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Karen: Well, you know it happened so fast I didn't really have time to be scared.
column161: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Angela: What happened, exactly? I wasn't here, so I haven't really heard the whole story.
column162: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Karen: Um, well, Jim and I were talking and Roy walked in looking super angry.
column163: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Angela: Mm-hmm.
column164: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Karen: And he's a big dude, you know? And all of a sudden, Jim pushed me out of the way, and Roy cocked his fist, and then bam, Dwight sprays him and knocks him on his butt.
column165: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Angela: [flustered] Goodness.
column166: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Karen: When I heard Jim and Pam had kissed, my reaction was to have lots of long talks with Jim about our feelings. Roy just attacked him. I'm not sure which one Jim hated more.
column167: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Let's get down to business. Why don't you tell me why you think you deserve a raise.
column168: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Well, it's simple Mike. I mean we merged these two branches right? So now we're shipping twice as many orders as we used to. With Roy gone we got a smaller crew. And I'm pickin' up all of his slack, so I think I should be compensated fairly, by gettin' a raise.
column169: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: [mumbles jibberish]
column170: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: What? I can't hear you.
column171: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: [mumbling softly] That was a very good point.
column172: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: I can't--- what, Mike? Are you---
column173: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: [mumbling softly] You make a very compelling argument.
column174: 03x19 - The Negotiation;
column175: 03x19 - The Negotiation;
column176: 03x19 - The Negotiation;
column177: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Pam: Sorry I almost got you killed.
column178: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Yeah, that was nuts.
column179: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Pam: He could have broken your nose or something. Crazy. It's just so stupid. I mean, getting back with Roy and everything. I mean, what was I thinking, right?
column180: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: No, I mean, you guys really seem to have a strong connection.
column181: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Pam: Not anymore. It's, um... It's completely over now.
column182: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: We'll see. I'm sure you guys will... find you way back to one another someday.
column183: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Pam: Jim... I am really... sorry.
column184: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Oh, yeah. Don't worry about it.
column185: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: I am going to give you a piece of paper. I want you to write down how much you want, and I want you to slide it back across the desk to me.
column186: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Why can't I just... tell you?
column187: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Because, that is the way these things are done. In... films. [Darryl writes the amount and starts to hand the paper to Michael] No, slide--- slide it, yes.
column188: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: There you go.
column189: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Oh. [scoffs] Come on. Be serious.
column190: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: I am serious, Mike. That's a 10% raise. That's what I want.
column191: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: I... I can't give you that, I--- I don't make this much.
column192: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Come on, be for real Mike.
column193: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: I don't. Want me to prove it to you? There is... a pay stub.
column194: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: [laughs] Are you serious? You're earning this?
column195: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Plus perks, yes.
column196: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Mike, this is barely more than I make. You been here ten years, dog. [laughs]
column197: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Fourteen years.
column198: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Ho-ho!
column199: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: No, please, please...
column200: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Oh, I'm sorry Mike, some of my folks got to hear about this one. [texting on cell phone] Ah. [laughs]
column201: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Ok, let's take 15, again.
column202: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: A boss's salary isn't just about money, it is about perks. It... for example, every year I get a $100 gas card... Can't put a price tag on that.
column203: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Ok, if you don't want a gift, at least let me buy you a beer, or lunch or something.
column204: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Dwight: When Han Solo returns to the Death Star in the Millennium Falcon, and shoots down the TIE fighters and saves the Rebel cause, do you think he does so for a free beer?
column205: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Boy I---
column206: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Dwight: No. And why are you so interested in buying me something Jim, what's your angle?
column207: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: It's like when he annoys me and I want to screw with him to get him back, he never sees it coming. But now, I want to be nice to him, and actually give him something, and he's like an eel. I just can't grab onto him. It's infuriating.
column208: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Karen: Maybe you just feel guilty about all the pranks.
column209: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Well... yes, that's probably what it is. So what do I do?
column210: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Karen: Hmm... I don't know. Maybe you should go back out there and sell paper so we can go on a trip.
column211: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kevin: Michael, here's the, uh, $15 I owe you.
column212: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Oh, thank you.
column213: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kevin: Yeah. I heard you might need it. So...
column214: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Creed: Here's the $40 you gave me.
column215: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: I didn't give you $40.
column216: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Creed: In a way you did.
column217: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Stanley: Yeah, I heard how much Michael makes. I still think he's way overpaid.
column218: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: [on cell phone] Fourteen years. Fourteen. I know. [laughing] Ok, alright. I gotta go. Later. [hangs up]
column219: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Okay. Okay, here's the straight... dope. No tricks. No Wikipedia.
column220: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: What?
column221: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: I talked to corporate, and they told me that I can only give you a 5% raise.
column222: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: That's 'cause of you, Mike. They're not gonna give the workin' man more than the boss.
column223: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Well what am I supposed to do?
column224: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Get your own raise. You gotta get out there and earn, son.
column225: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: I'm not gonna go out and ask for a raise right now. That is ridiculous.
column226: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Well, when they merged the two branches together, they put you in charge. Okay, and we're shippin' more now than we ever have.
column227: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: [exhales] That's true.
column228: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Yeah that's true. You gotta call your girl, and get paid. Show her who wears the pants in the relationship.
column229: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: You know what? I should.
column230: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Yeah, you should.
column231: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: I have been a loyal employee for a long time.
column232: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Fourteen years long.
column233: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: You know what? I deserve a bump.
column234: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Make it happen, cap'in.
column235: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: I am makin' it happen, sergeant.
column236: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Creed: I remember it was very late at night, like 11, 11:30. Big fella comes in screamin' about God knows what. I think maybe Halpert had stolen his car. [Angela rolls her eyes] Something like that. So the big fella pulls out a sock filled with nickels. Then Schrute grabs a can of hairspray and a lighter---
column237: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Angela: You're useless.
column238: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: Why don't we talk next month, after the quarter ends?
column239: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: No, Jan. I've never asked for a raise in 14 years. This is long overdue. I wanna do it today.
column240: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: Today. All right, well, uh, if you want to do it today, we should meet in person, and uh, can you get here by five?
column241: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Yshhyah. Um, yeah. I'll leave right away.
column242: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: Great. Uh, and listen. Because of our, uh, our... you know, situation, we're gonna need to have a third party present.
column243: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Yes, I'm bringing Darryl.
column244: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: Da--- Darryl from the warehouse?
column245: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Mm-hm.
column246: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: No, Michael. We, we need an HR rep. So, uh, I think you should just bring Toby.
column247: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Hey, I'd rather kill myself.
column248: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: Michael, he's your branch's HR rep...
column249: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: [talking over Jan] No, Toby is terrible. Toby is the worst human being I've ever known.
column250: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: ...and we need someone else, in the room, because of our relationship. You know this. Michael, either Toby comes with you, or we don't do it.
column251: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: [sighs] Fine.
column252: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kelly: You are so mean.
column253: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Ryan: I don't know what you're talking about.
column254: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kelly: Yes you do, Ryan Bailey Howard. You called me stupid.
column255: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Ryan: No, I said your idea was stupid.
column256: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Toby, come on. Let's go.
column257: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Toby: Where?
column258: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Where? I'm gonna smack you in the head with a hammer. Come on, let's go.
column259: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kelly: What is so stupid about wanting to name a baby Usher?
column260: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Toby: Alright.
column261: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kelly: Usher Jennifer Hudson Kapoor.
column262: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Ryan: Don't you see why that's insane?
column263: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kelly: Oh, so I'm crazy now?
column264: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Comfortable, Mike?
column265: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Yeah. Fine.
column266: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: How about you, man. Comfortable?
column267: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Toby: No.
column268: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: [imitating Chris Tucker] Don't ever touch a black man's radio! ...Chris Tucker. Rush Hour. I won't touch yours, by the way.
column269: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Thank you.
column270: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Well...
column271: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: I haven't been to New York in a long time.
column272: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Mm, the Big Apple.
column273: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Maybe I'll stay overnight. Got a cousin lives down there.
column274: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Toby: How would we get home?
column275: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Oh you could stay too. He's got a big place.
column276: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Maybe I'll stay.
column277: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Mm, it's not that big.
column278: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Well...
column279: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Busses, though. They get you home quick.
column280: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: [mouth full of pretzels] Oh, I...
column281: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kelly: And all of a sudden, Dwight stood up and was like "No!"
column282: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Angela: Then what'd he do? [Kelly's phone rings]
column283: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kelly: You should just read the report that Toby did. He took everyone's stories. [answering phone] Dunder Mifflin, customer service, this is Kelly. Oh yeah I could totally help you with that. Ok, let me just get the folder out. Okay, it seems here that you ordered 12,000 reams of paper. Oh, 12 reams...
column284: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Hunter: Hey guys, Jan is ready for you.
column285: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Okay, bring it home now. And don't forget the new black man phrase I taught you.
column286: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Pippity poppity, give me the zoppity.
column287: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Yes sir. Remember that. I'll be right outside if you need me
column289: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Darryl: Yeah, I taught Mike some new phrases. I want him to get the raise, I... just can't help myself.
column290: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Roy: [to Jim] Hey man, uh... I'm sorry. [Jim motions "Don't worry about it"] [Roy receives his check from Angela] Thanks. [to Pam] Can I, like, see you after work for coffee, or... something?
column292: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Roy: Please. I just got some stuff I gotta say to you. [Pam nods, meekly]
column293: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Kevin: [as Roy is walking out] Jim--- Roy--- Look out!
column294: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Thanks, Kev. I'm good though.
column295: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: Thank you, Hunter. [to Michael and Toby] Hello. Come in. [exhales] Ah, Okay.
column296: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Who's the boy toy?
column297: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: That's my new assistant.
column298: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Were you going to tell me that you hired James Van Der Beek?
column299: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: I have to call you the second I get a new assistant?
column300: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Be nice to get a memo, we are lovers.
column302: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: Hi, Toby. [clears throat] First--- [Michael clears his throat] First off, Michael, this is a salary negotiation. All matters regarding our personal relationship have to be set aside. Are we clear?
column304: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: Right now we can offer you a 6% raise.
column305: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Six percent? After all we've been through?
column307: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: I got you... jade earrings.
column311: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: No. You gonna play it like this? You give me a good raise, or no more s*x. [Toby begins to write] [to Toby] What are you writing, perv-ball?
column312: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Toby: Just preparing for the deposition.
column313: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Toby: This may be the first time that a male subordinate has attempted to get a modest scheduled raise by threatening to withhold s*x from a female superior. It will be a groundbreaking case when it inevitably goes to trial.
column314: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Roy: I'm so sorry, Pammy. I really wasn't gonna do anything. But then I... kept thinkin' about you two together, and... I just thought you guys were really good friends, or... or maybe he was gay or somethin'... Not that that's wrong.
column315: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Pam: I'm sorry too. I just, I think that we both made some bad choices.
column316: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Roy: So you gonna start datin' Halpert then?
column317: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Pam: Um... no. No, he has a girlfriend.
column318: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Roy: Oh yeah... Wait a minute, you... broke off our wedding for the guy.
column319: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Pam: No, there were a lot of reasons.
column320: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Roy: But you're not even gonna try to go out with him? [Pam meekly shakes her head] I don't get you Pam.
column324: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Dwight: Certificate of Bravery, from the Scranton Police Department. "Recognizing outstanding citizenship from a very brave young man. Dwight K. Schrute"
column325: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: Wow. I guess word got around. That's a nice... honor.
column326: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Dwight: Please. They hand these out to little kids. Look. There's a teddy bear in a policeman's cap.
column327: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: [under his breath] Didn't think you'd notice...
column328: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Why don't you just take that pen and stab me in the heart. This is me, Jan. This is me!
column329: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: Okay, Michael. Please, why don't we just take a break. This is really going nowhere.
column330: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Okay, no, no, no, no. You do not try tactic number eight on me. I invented tactic number eight. I'm not going anywhere.
column331: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: Ok, Toby, how about if you...
column334: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: What's wrong with you?
column335: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Ohh. It was a weird day. I accidentally cross-dressed. And then Darryl made me feel bad for not making any money. And then I had to ride up here with stupid Toby. And then, your assistant, is all young and hot. And I---
column336: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: Okay, Michael. I can offer you a 12% raise, but you have got to ask for 15.
column337: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Well that's ridiculous I'm not gonna make---
column338: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: No, just... I just need you to ask for it, so I can record that you asked for it. Okay?
column339: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Ah, so... All right, Levinson. Here's the rub. I would like a 15% raise.
column340: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jan: No. But we can offer you 12.
column341: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: But you just said 15.
column342: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Michael: Negotiation is an art. Back and forth. Give and take. And today, both Darryl and I took something. Higher salaries. Win win win. But you know, life is about more... than just salaries. It's about perks. Like having s*x with Jan--
column344: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Stanley: So you and Bob are looking at a historical house?
column345: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Phyllis: Mm-hmm, near the river.
column346: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Stanley: Mm, how many bedrooms?
column348: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Angela: Dwight. Dwight. I've been doing some very interesting reading.
column350: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Angela: Mm-hmm. Tales of bravery.
column352: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Angela: Mm-hmm. I was thinking tonight, we could... read it together.
column353: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Dwight: Sounds... fun. [they kiss, Jim walks out of the bathroom and sees]
column354: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Jim: [scoffs] I... will never say a word. And now, we are even.
column355: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Andy: I graduated from anger management the same way I graduated from Cornell. On time. Now I'm back. Got a second chance, and I'm not gonna blow it. [in a forceful voice] So look out Dunder Mifflin! [laughs] [snaps] I mean, look out... in a fun way! You know, not like, I'm gonna hurt you...
column356: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Andy: Hey guys! Guess who's back! [Dwight pepper-spray's Andy] AHHH! [screams in pain] OH, GOD!
column357: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Dwight: No need to thank me.
column358: 03x19 - The Negotiation;Dwight: I am not a hero. I am a mere defender of the office. You know who's a real hero? Hiro, from Heroes. That's a hero. Also, Bono.

column1: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: Good morning, Pam.
column2: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: Oh, welcome back, Andy.
column3: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: Drew. I'm Drew now.
column4: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: Oh. Drew. Sorry.
column5: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: Apology not... accepted. Because it wasn't even necessary in the first place. [laughs]
column6: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: Several weeks ago, Andy Bernard had an incident. [cut to shot of Andy punching a hole in the wall] But after five weeks in Anger Management, I'm back. And I've got a new attitude. And a new name. And... a bunch of new techniques for dealing with the grumpies.
column7: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: Mornin' Jim.
column8: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Hey, Andy. How are you, man?
column9: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: Good. Drew.
column10: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: What's that?
column11: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: Dr--- You can call me Drew.
column12: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: No, I'm not gonna call you that.
column13: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: Cool. I can't control what you do. I can only control what I do.
column14: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Andy.
column15: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: Drew. [walks to Dwight] Dwight. How's it goin' man?
column16: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Yes, I have decided to shun Andy Bernard for the next three years. Which I'm looking forward to. It's an Amish technique. It's like slapping someone with silence. I was shunned from the age of four until my sixth birthday... for not saving the excess oil from a can of tuna.
column17: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Jim, could you please inform Andy Bernard that he is being shunned.
column18: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Andy, Dwight says welcome back, and he could use a hug.
column19: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Ok, tell him that's not true.
column20: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Dwight says that he actually doesn't know one single fact about bear attacks.
column21: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: You guys...
column22: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Ok, no. Jim, tell him that bears can climb faster than they can run. Jim! Tell him!
column23: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: [half-heartedly] Andy! Nah, that's too far.
column24: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Damn you.
column25: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Today is Safety Training Day. Toby is leading ours upstairs. Yeauck. But, I am giving everyone a little bit of a treat. We are going to listen in on Darryl's presentation to the warehouse. And if I know Darryl, it gonna be zoppity.
column26: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Now, this is the forklift. You need--- [Michael rattles it] You need a license to operate this machine. That means the upstairs office workers can't drive it. ... Quiz! Mike.
column27: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Hmm.
column28: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Should you drive the forklift?
column29: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: I can, and I have.
column30: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: No! No no no no no! I said should you. You should not drive it. You should not drive the forklift, you understand?
column31: 03x20 - Safety Training;Lonny: You're not allowed to drive the forklift.
column32: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: It's not safe, you don't have a license.
column33: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Guys, I'm not the only one who's driven the forklift. [points] Pudge has driven the forklift.
column34: 03x20 - Safety Training;Madge: Madge.
column35: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: I thought your name was Pudge?
column36: 03x20 - Safety Training;Madge: No, it's always been Madge.
column37: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Okay. Um, her.
column38: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Her. Yes, "her" is qualified to work a dangerous machine. You are not. Okay?
column39: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Ah, fine.
column40: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Do you understand that?
column41: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Yeeesh.
column42: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: We do safety training every year, or after an accident. ... We've never made it a full year. This particular time, I was reaching for a supply box on the top shelf, when one office worker, who shall remain nameless, kicked the ladder out from under me and yelled...
column43: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: [barely keeping his composure] "Hey Darryl, how's it hangin'?!" [laughs]
column44: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: And I fell and busted my ankle. I'm legitimately scared for my workers.
column45: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: The baler can flatten a car engine. It can cut off your arm and crush your entire body without skipping a beat.
column46: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Yeah!
column47: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: It's on!
column48: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: How many people a year do you think get their arms cut off in a baler?
column49: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Bail'er? I hardly know her.
column50: 03x20 - Safety Training;Lonny: Dammit, Michael. Pay attention, man.
column51: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Anybody wanna take a guess? Anybody?
column52: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: Five bucks says it's over 50.
column53: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: You really wanna bet?
column54: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Anybody?
column55: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: Ever since March Madness ended, I am so bored.
column56: 03x20 - Safety Training;Guy: How many?
column57: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Ok, you're on.
column58: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Ten people, Michael. Ten people. Would you like to be one of them?
column59: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: [mouths] Damn...
column60: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: [in background] You have to be alert, and calm. And always careful...
column61: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: No, don't worry about it. We'll just got double or nothin'.
column62: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: On what?
column63: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: I don't know, we'll figure somethin' out.
column64: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: Nice.
column65: 03x20 - Safety Training;Oscar: What are you guys talkin' about?
column66: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: These are very dangerous machines down here, and the upstairs workers, Michael, should not go anywhere near them.
column67: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Yes, yes. But it wouldn't be the worst thing in the world... if somebody...
column68: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darry: It would be the worst thing in the world! It would! Very much so.
column69: 03x20 - Safety Training;Lonny: What the hell is wrong with this man?
column70: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: It's a big red trash compactor!
column71: 03x20 - Safety Training;Lonny: What are you---
column72: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: It's not a trash compactor! It's a baler!
column73: 03x20 - Safety Training;Lonny: Don't disrespect the baler!
column74: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Okay, okay! I got it. I got it. ... Only on the rarest of occasions...
column75: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: No do not touch it!
column76: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: ...would I go near---
column77: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: There is no occasion for you to go near this stuff, okay?
column78: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Toby now has the floor... and he is going to try not to screw this up, like everything else in his life. Let me rephrase that. I believe that you can do safety training and make it sound just as good as Darryl. Here we go!
column79: 03x20 - Safety Training;Toby: Ok, um, one thing that you're gonna want to look out for is carpal tunnel syndrome. It's recommended that you take a ten minute break from typing every hour. For your circulation, you're gonna want to get up out of your chairs and uh, and move around about ten minutes every hour.
column80: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Yes, good. Fine. Like stretching and...
column81: 03x20 - Safety Training;Toby: Um, yeah. You're computer screen can be a big strain on your eyes, so uh, it's also recommended that you step away for about... about ten minutes every hour.
column82: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Wow, that is... that time really adds up. That's like... a half an hour, every hour?
column83: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Take them at the same time.
column84: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Ok, you know what? You're making it sound kind of lame. So, skip ahead to the really dangerous stuff. Like sometimes computers can explode, can they not?
column85: 03x20 - Safety Training;Toby: No, no. Um, you always want to keep a sweater or cardigan of some sort, in case it gets drafty.
column86: 03x20 - Safety Training;Ryan: What about a long sleeve T?
column87: 03x20 - Safety Training;Toby: Well, that'll work.
column88: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: Long johns? A shaw?
column89: 03x20 - Safety Training;Toby: You know, anything that warms you.
column90: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Ok, you know what? I think that everybody is going to vomit due to boredom. [to warehouse guys] Sorry, he is very lame. [takes book from Toby] Um, let's see. "Seasonal affective disorder! A depression that includes weight gain, fatigue, irritability, brought on by the low light of winter."
column91: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Thank God we only had a baler to deal with.
column92: 03x20 - Safety Training;Lonny: Yeah, that dim light is a bitch, ain't it?
column93: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Ok guys, you know what? I didn't--- I didn't interrupt when you were having your presentation.
column94: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Actually, you did.
column95: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Yes. Okay, let's do another one. This is a good one. "A particular concern for office workers is a sedimentary life style, which can contribute---"
column96: 03x20 - Safety Training;Toby: Sedentary.
column97: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Yes. "Which can contribute to heart disease." Heart disease kills more people that balers.
column98: 03x20 - Safety Training;Lonny: That's called having a fat butt, Michael.
column99: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Mmmm, no, no, it's... sedentary...
column100: 03x20 - Safety Training;Lonny: Yeah, yeah. That's, that's fat butt disease. That's what you suffer from?
column101: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: No.
column102: 03x20 - Safety Training;Lonny: Fat butt disease, Michael?
column103: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kelly: Excuse me, sea monster, you weigh like a thousand pounds.
column104: 03x20 - Safety Training;Lonny: Yeah? I bet you'd like to swim with this sea monster, wouldn't you?
column105: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kelly: Ryan?
column106: 03x20 - Safety Training;Lonny: Dude, tell your girl to shut up.
column107: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kelly: What?!
column108: 03x20 - Safety Training;Ryan: Kelly, you insulted the gentleman. Please apologize.
column109: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kelly: Are you kidding me?
column110: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Alright, we outta here.
column111: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Darryl, I did not walk out in the middle of yours. So, I---
column112: 03x20 - Safety Training;Lonny: Yeah, but ours was real, Michael.
column113: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: That's what I've been trying to tell you, Mike. It's serious down there. We do dangerous stuff, man. This is shenanigans, foolishness, Nerf-ball. You live a sweet, little, Nerf-y life. Sittin' on your biscuit. Never havin' to risk it.
column114: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Okay. ... What, Nerf isn't cool anymore?
column115: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Darryl thinks he is such a man because he works in a warehouse. I worked in a warehouse. Men's Warehouse. I was a greeter. I'd like to see Darryl greet people. Probably make 'em feel like wimps. Not me, I... "Hello, I'm Michael. Welcome to Men's Warehouse. We have a special on khaki pants today." ... This is one example.
column116: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: [Pam is holding a jar of jellybeans] Ten.
column117: 03x20 - Safety Training;Oscar: Really, ten? That's your guess? You're a professional accountant.
column118: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: There's like ten green ones.
column119: 03x20 - Safety Training;Oscar: Forty-two.
column120: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: I'm gonna say fifty.
column121: 03x20 - Safety Training;Karen: Fifty-one.
column122: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Oh, don't be that person.
column123: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: That is lame.
column124: 03x20 - Safety Training;Karen: It's a strategy!
column125: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: It's called being smart.
column126: 03x20 - Safety Training;Karen: Thank you.
column127: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: Oh, geeze.
column128: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: I don't know how the whole betting thing started, but it's fun.
column129: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: Ten...
column130: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Kev's out.
column131: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: Damn it.
column132: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: 47, 48, 49! Jim wins!
column133: 03x20 - Safety Training;Everyone: Oooh! [Jim claps]
column134: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: That is not fair. He has spent hours up here at reception with you. Hours and hours.
column135: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Okay, okay.
column136: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: No, constantly. Like, for years.
column137: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Okay.
column138: 03x20 - Safety Training;
column139: 03x20 - Safety Training;
column140: 03x20 - Safety Training;
column141: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Pam, depression is as scary as a baler, right?
column142: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: I don't understand the question.
column143: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Working in an office can lead to depression. Which can lead to suicide. I mean this is really serious stuff.
column144: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: Yeah...
column145: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: I--- I--- Nobody commits suicide because they work with a baler, and yet those guys are makin' fun of me, calling me a Nerf, that...
column146: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: It's really hard to demonstrate depression. Their safety training had visuals.
column147: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Yeah... you are... ah, so right. They had visual aids. And all we had were the facts. You don't go to the science museum and get handed a pamphlet on electricity. You go to the science museum and you put your hand on a metal ball, your hair sticks up straight... and you know science.
column148: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: So, you're okay?
column149: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Indubitably.
column150: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: They use props. They use visual aids, and they just made us look like dopes.
column151: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Idiots! God, what are we gonna do!?
column152: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: I don't know, I don't know. Because you know what our killer is? Depression---
column153: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Wolves.
column154: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Nn--- Depression.
column155: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Visual aids.
column156: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Yes.
column157: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: A quilt. Depression quilt?
column158: 03x20 - Safety Training;Micheal: No time to sew a quilt. ... I got it. Give me the number for the Giant Big Box Toy Store.
column159: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: You may be asking yourself, "What am I doing on a trampoline?" Well, I thought I'd bounce here for a while, relieve some stress, and then move on with my day. Not! Here's the plan. Dwight, is going to gather all of the office workers and all of the warehouse guys, we're going to have another safety seminar. Only this time, where's Michael? Oh my God! He is on the roof! Now I have got their attention. I... tell them, about the cold hard facts of depression. And then I say, "Hey! You ever seen a suicide?" And I jump. And they freak out. And they get to see... the dangers of depression with their own eyes. Nice side note[/b]: They might think "Hey, I should have been nicer to Michael." But that's... not why I'm doing this... Then, I land on the trampoline, take a couple extra bounces for fun. I climb off, walk around the corner... Ta-freakin'-da! [Dwight nods]
column160: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kelly: So then the next movie moves to the top of the queue. So number five becomes number four, number six becomes number five, [Ryan checks his watch]number three becomes number two, etc, etc. And let's just say that I just sent back Love Actually, which was awesome. [Karen lays money down on the desk next to Ryan] And they sent me Uptown Girls, which is also awesome. But guess what, now I want to see love actually again, [Phyllis throws her money down] but it's at the bottom of the que! Oh no, what do I do!? [Creed throws his money down] What I do, is this. I go online, I go click, click, click. And I change the order of the que, so that I can see Love Actually [Pam throws her money down] as soon as I want to. It's so easy, Ryan. Do you really not know how Netflix works? [Jim throws his money down]
column161: 03x20 - Safety Training;Ryan: I guess I forgot. [kisses Kelly, gathers up all the money]
column162: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kelly: You're such a ditz.
column163: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: Ryan, well done. Two minutes, forty-two seconds. Additionally, Pam, you win ten because she said "awesome" 12 times, and Jim, you win five because she mentioned six romantic comedies.
column164: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: [on the roof] Okay, let's do this thing! I'll go summon the troops!
column165: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Maybe we should test it first. Letterman-style. Throw a TV over, or...
column166: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: We measured it once...
column167: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Go buy some watermelons.
column168: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Seedless?
column169: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Just...

column172: 03x20 - Safety Training;Creed: Hey!
column173: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: Hey.
column174: 03x20 - Safety Training;Creed: Hello. [Jim replaces Creed's apple with a potato][Creed takes a bite of the potato]
column175: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: Yes!
column176: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: Here you go. [hands money]
column177: 03x20 - Safety Training;Toby: Nice.
column178: 03x20 - Safety Training;Karen: I don't know this place as well as I thought I did. I'm getting cleaned out.
column179: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Ready?
column180: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Let's do it! Drop that sucker.
column181: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: [drops watermelon, watermelon bounces off trampoline, onto a car, bursts, car alarm sounds]
column182: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: BINGO! WHOA WHOA WHOA! Oh... crap. Deactivate the car alarm. Clean up the mess.
column183: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Okay.
column184: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Find out whose car that is. If it's Stanley's, call the offices of James P. Albini, see if he handles hate crimes.
column185: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Got it.

column187: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: We're not allowed to use the baler.
column188: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Have Pa--adge do it, or... the sea monster.

column191: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: Thank you.
column192: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: It means nothing. I need you to do something for me.
column193: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: Anything.
column194: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Okay, calm down. I need you to acquire an inflatable house, and/or castle.
column195: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: You mean a moon bounce.
column196: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: What do you think? You've got an hour.
column197: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: I'm gonna need... I'm gonna need petty cash.
column198: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Shunning resumed.
column199: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: Do you, do you want a drawbridge?
column200: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Un-shun. Yeah that sounds good. Re-shun.
column201: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Oh yeah, this is much better. Safer. Excellent decision.
column202: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Yes, thank you for seeing that.
column203: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: When you land, try and land like an eight year-old. These bouncy castles are not designed for adults.

column205: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Do you wanna do another test? I got plenty of watermelons in my trunk!
column206: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: No. No more. The tests are going terrible. If we keep doing it, we're not gonna want to jump. This is about doing, not thinking.
column207: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: That's right! Doing! Totally doing! It's rock n' roll!
column208: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Rock n' roll!
column209: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Yeah!
column210: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: That's right! I am not thinking.
column211: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: [imitating the sound and playing an air guitar] Near near near near near!
column212: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Yes! Yeah!
column213: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: [singing] Michael is awesome! Jumpin' off the roof!
column214: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Woo!
column215: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: [singing] Bouncin' on the bouncy bounce! Show 'em who's boss!
column216: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Woo!
column217: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: [singing] Rip a hole in the suuuuuuun!
column218: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: I am ready to do this! I am ready to make a point! [Dwight continues air guitar]
column219: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: [out of breath] Guys! Listen up! Michael is up on the roof, and acting strange!
column220: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: Whoa! What's the situation?
column221: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: [hesitates] Un-shun. I think he's suffering from depression. Re-shun.
column222: 03x20 - Safety Training;Andy: Ok, when's the shunning thing gonna end?
column223: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Un-shun. Never. Re-shun. I think he wants you all to come out to the parking lot and watch him die!
column224: 03x20 - Safety Training;Stanley: Is it nice outside?
column225: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: It's gorgeous. Let's go!
column226: 03x20 - Safety Training;Stanley: Do I need my jacket?
column227: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: No really, it's, it's very nice. Come on!
column228: 03x20 - Safety Training;Ryan: Will I be too warm in a long sleeve T?
column229: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Everybody's gonna be fine in exactly what they're wearing, let's go! Let's go!
column230: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: [outside] Come on, hurry up you guys!
column231: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: [on the roof] My life! Oh, my life...
column232: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: [on megaphone] Michael, what's wrong?!
column233: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Everything's wrong. The stress of my modern office, has caused me to go into a depression.
column234: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Depression? Isn't that just a fancy word for feeling bummed out?
column235: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Dwight, you ignorant slut. Depression is a very serious illness. Over 32 thousand people commit suicide every year! According to a 2004 study!
column236: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Is that the last year the data was available?
column237: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Yes! My head is in such pain! And turmoil!
column238: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Don't do anything rash!
column239: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Wait, where are the warehouse guys?
column240: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: I didn't... [Dwight runs up to the side of the building] I didn't think you needed them for this part.
column241: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Okay... that's...
column242: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: you said to just...
column243: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: That's the whole point, dummy.
column244: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Okay, I'm on it!
column245: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Okay.
column246: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Attention blue collar workers!
column247: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: What are the odds that this is in any way real?
column248: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: I'd say like... 10,000 to 1?
column249: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: Okay, I'd like ten bucks on those odds.
column250: 03x20 - Safety Training;Kevin: If someone gives you 10,000 to 1 on anything, you take it. If John Mellencamp ever wins an Oscar, I am going to be a very rich dude.
column251: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Michael's up on the roof and he's acting strange!
column252: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Oooooh, my life!
column253: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Michael! What's wrong?
column254: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Everything is wrong, Dwight. The stress of my modern office, has made me depressed.
column255: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Depressed? Isn't that just a fancy word for feeling bummed out?
column256: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Dwight, you ignorant slut.
column257: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Well, you know, the first performance was a little off. But I really think they hit their stride, in the second show. Um, might even bring my parents tomorrow, to the matinee.
column258: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: And that is why, I am going to jump off this roof!
column259: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Oh, excuse me. It's my... favorite part.
column260: 03x20 - Safety Training;Angela: This is just offensive.
column261: 03x20 - Safety Training;Ryan: At least we're outside.
column262: 03x20 - Safety Training;Creed: [zipping up his pants] Hey, check it out, there's a... there's a castle over there.
column263: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Oh my God, there is a castle.
column264: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: No, there's nothing to see over there, people! There's nothing to see. ...They found the castle, Michael.
column265: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Damn it.
column266: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: Oh... God. Oh my God, he's gonna jump.
column267: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Oh. He's going to kill himself, pretending to kill himself.
column268: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: Yeah...
column269: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Hey uh, Michael. Don't jump on the bouncy castle. You can't do that, because you're going to get horribly, horribly injured.
column270: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: Hey Michael! I have a present for you, but you have to come down and get it.
column271: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: What is it?
column272: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: Come down and... open it and you'll see.
column273: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Dwight, find out what the present is.
column274: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Okay, uh... I don't see anything. She might be bluffing.
column275: 03x20 - Safety Training;Jim: Dwight...
column276: 03x20 - Safety Training;Pam: Dwight, what are you---
column277: 03x20 - Safety Training;Dwight: Oh... It's uh, a Repliee Q1 Expo female robot, they're only available in Japan.
column278: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Dwight, you are such a liar. Pam, really, what is it?
column279: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Mike, this is the opposite of safety. You jump, you're gonna serious hurt yourself.
column280: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: You told me, that I lead a... cushy, wimpy, Nerf life.
column281: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Yeah, but I never said you had nothing to live for.
column282: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: What do I have to live for?
column283: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: A lot... of things. Uh, you, uh... What about Jan? Lovely, lovely, lovely Jan, man. It's goin' good, right?
column284: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: It's complicated with Jan. And I don't know where I stand, or what I want. The s*x isn't nearly as good as it used to be.
column285: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Mike, you're a very brave man. I mean, it takes courage just to be you. To get out of bed every single day, knowing full well, you gotta be you.
column286: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Do you really mean that?
column287: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: I couldn't do it. I--- I ain't that strong. And I ain't that brave.
column288: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: I'm braver than you?
column289: 03x20 - Safety Training;Darryl: Way braver! You Braveheart, man.
column290: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: I Braveheart. I am.
column292: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: Okay. Pam, I'm coming down to get my present.
column293: 03x20 - Safety Training;Michael: An office... is as safe as the people in it. And sometimes those people can drive you to do crazy things to show the dangers of the office. That's the danger I found myself in today. I saved a life. My own. Am I a hero? I really can't say. But, yes.

column1: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: [Dressed as Dwight] It's kind of blurry. [puts on his glasses] That's better. [exhales] Question. What kind of bear is best?
column2: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: That's a ridiculous question.
column3: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: False. Black bear.
column4: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: Well that's debatable. There are basically two schools of thought---
column5: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Fact. Bears eat beets. Bears. Beets. Battlestar Galactica.
column6: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: Bears do not--- What is going on--- What are you doing?!
column7: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Last week, I was in a drug store and I saw these glasses. Uh, four dollars. And it only cost me seven dollars to recreate the rest of the ensemble. And that's a grand total of... [Jim calculates the total on his calculator-watch] eleven dollars.
column8: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: You know what? Imitation is the most sincere form of flattery, so I thank you. [Jim places a bobble-head on his desk] Identity theft is not a joke, Jim! Millions of families suffer every year!
column9: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: ... MICHAEL!
column10: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: Oh, that's funny. MICHAEL!
column11: 03x21 - Product Recall;Pam: [on phone] Yes, I understand. Can I transfer you to customer relations?
column12: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: [on phone] Absolutely. I couldn't be more sorry about this.
column13: 03x21 - Product Recall;Phyllis: [on phone] I know, I know. We're all trying to get to the bottom of this.
column14: 03x21 - Product Recall;Stanley: [on phone] I am upset. Don't I sound upset?
column15: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: [on phone] It is disgusting. I totally agree. Well, we're going to recalling all of that paper.
column16: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: We have a crisis. Apparently, a disgruntled employee at the paper mill decided that it would be funny to put an obscene watermark on our 24 pound cream butter stock. Five hundred boxes has gone out, with the image of a beloved cartoon duck, performing... unspeakable acts upon a certain cartoon mouse that a lot of people like. I've never been a fan.
column17: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: Everybody in here. STAT. No time to lose. Cri-Man-Squa. F and C, doubletime.
column18: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: Cri-Man-Squa?
column19: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: Crisis Management Squad.
column20: 03x21 - Product Recall;Ryan: F and C, doubletime?
column21: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: Front and Center. Twice as fast as you would normally go. Any other questions?
column22: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: One more. Why are you talking like that?
column23: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: To save time, Jim.
column24: 03x21 - Product Recall;Karen: Actually I think you could make the argument that it wastes time.
column25: 03x21 - Product Recall;Pam: Yeah, she has a good point. I mean, for example, with the last thing you said, by the time you explained it, it actually took up more time.
column26: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: You know what? Bluh bluh bluh bluh bluh! Forget it. Where is Creed?
column27: 03x21 - Product Recall;Creed: Here.
column28: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: Creed. Quality assurance. Your job. I really think you screwed the pooch on one, Creed. Because of you, the entire company is in jeopardy.
column29: 03x21 - Product Recall;Creed: Every week I'm supposed to take four hours and do a quality spot-check at the paper mill. And of course the one year I blow it off, this happens.
column30: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: We have a lot of angry customers out there. This puts us at threat level midnight. Accounting, you are on customer service duty today.
column31: 03x21 - Product Recall;Oscar: That's really not our job.
column32: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: Midnight, Oscar! Don't worry, Kelly will be training you first.
column33: 03x21 - Product Recall;Angela: Kelly's training us?
column34: 03x21 - Product Recall;Kelly: This day is bananas. B-A-N-A-N-A-S. This day is bananas! B-A-N-A-
column35: 03x21 - Product Recall;Angela: [getting a pill from the bottle] I don't have a headache. I'm just preparing.
column36: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: Jim, big fire in your house. Your client, Dunmore High-school, sent out their prom invitations on this paper. Went home to all the kids.
column37: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Yeah, I gotta call out on that.
column38: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: No, no, no, no. Not good enough. This is a keystone account. I want you in the school. In person.
column39: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: All right.
column40: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: I want you to bring a partner.
column41: 03x21 - Product Recall;Ryan: I'll go.
column42: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: No, sweet cheeks. We need someone who's actually made a sale. Andy, you go.
column43: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: [English accent] William Dolittle at your service. A.K.A., Will Do.
column44: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Yeah, I'm definitely gonna go alone.
column45: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: No, no. I need two men on this. That's what she said. No time! But she did. NO TIME! Guys, get on this. Dwight, I want you to be in charge of the press conference.
column46: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: Yes! You are entering the "No Spin Zone!"
column47: 03x21 - Product Recall;Pam: We're having a press conference?
column48: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: No, Pam. The press is just gonna find out by themselves.
column49: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: Not! [scoffs]
column50: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: Here's the thing. When a company screws up, best thing to do is call a press conference. Alert the media, and then you control the story. Wait for them to find out, and the story controls you. That's what happened to O.J.
column51: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: I have invited Barbara Allen, one of our oldest clients, to come in here, and meet with me, for a personal apology. The press wants a story, I will give them a story.
column52: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Oh, did the press ask for a story?
column53: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: Here is your headline. "Scranton Area Paper Company, Dunder Mifflin, apologizes to valued client. Some companies still know how business is done." Okay? Battle stations everybody, let's go, go, go, go, go, go!
column54: 03x21 - Product Recall;Creed: Yes, hello. Creed Bratton, Quality Assurance, Dunder Mifflin Scranton. I was supposed to meet with one of your floor managers last week for a quality inspection, and he or she wasn't there. And I'm trying to remember who it was. Mm-hmm. Who wasn't there last week? Debbie Brown. And which day was that? Wednesday, the eleventh. Perfect.
column55: 03x21 - Product Recall;Creed: The only difference between me and a homeless man is this job. I will do whatever it takes to survive. Like I did... when I was a homeless man.
column56: 03x21 - Product Recall;Kelly: Look, I know the reason that you guys became accountants is because you're not good at interacting with people. But guess what? From now on, you guys are no longer losers! So give yourselves a round of applause. [Kelly and Kevin clap]
column57: 03x21 - Product Recall;Oscar: I wonder how many phone calls you're missing while you're teaching us to answer calls.
column58: 03x21 - Product Recall;Kelly: I know, right? Probably a lot.
column59: 03x21 - Product Recall;Angela: Can you just tell us what we need to do so we can go?
column60: 03x21 - Product Recall;Kelly: OK, Angela. I love your enthusiasm. All you need to know how to do is pick up the phone and say "Customer Service, this is Kelly!" Except don't say "Kelly," say your own name. Or if you're bored, you can just make up a name. Like one time, I said I was Bridget Jones, [in an English accent] and I talked like this for the whole conversation!
column61: 03x21 - Product Recall;Kevin: Oh! Can I be [horrible Australian accent] Australian, mate?
column62: 03x21 - Product Recall;Kelly: [in accent] Absolutely!
column63: 03x21 - Product Recall;Kevin: [in accent] 'ello, mate!
column64: 03x21 - Product Recall;Kelly: [in accent] I like ice cream! I need a boyfriend.
column65: 03x21 - Product Recall;Kevin: [in accent] I like ice cream too, mate. Alligators and dingo babies.
column66: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: Beer me!
column67: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: What's that?
column68: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: Hand me that water. I always say "Beer me." Gets a laugh like a quarter of the time. So how's what's-her-name?
column69: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: You know her name.
column70: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: Who, Karen? Yeah, she's only one of my oldest friends. [takes swig of water] Mmm. How's the apartment hangin'?
column71: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: It's fine.
column72: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: Nice. Check out this sunshine, man. Global warming, right? Today was supposed to be really cold, I bet.
column73: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: What about music? Do you have any music?
column74: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: Uh, yeah. Should have said so. [sings] Rha-dah-dah-dah! Give me the beat, boys, and free my soul. I wanna get lost in your rock and roll and drift away-he-hay. Ruu-da-doo-da-doo, ba-dit-da-doo-da-dun, Give me the beat, boys, and free my little-ole-soul, I wa--
column75: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: I was thinkin' about more like a CD, or... a CD.
column76: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: Your call, dude. My girlfriend made an awesome mix. Beer me that disc.
column77: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Lord, beer me strength.
column78: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: So, Tuna. When we get in there, let's do a really good job, okay?
column79: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Did that really need to be said?
column80: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: Well not everything a guy says needs to be said. Sometimes it's just about the music of the conversation.
column81: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: Whoa! What the--- Why is my girlfriend here?
column82: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Oh, is she that teacher in the white?
column83: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: No, she's a part-time frozen yogurt chef.
column84: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Which one... is she?
column85: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: The one in the green hoodie.
column86: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Wow.
column87: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: I wonder if she's, like, a... a guidance counselor, or something?
column88: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: No, I don't think so.
column89: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: She's like, probably a tutor.
column90: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Nope.
column91: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: She probably a t--
column92: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: No.
column93: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: Sh---
column94: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: No.
column95: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: OK, press conference in 45. Dwight, make sure this place looks nice.
column96: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: On it. OK, Karen, Ryan, Pam, center stage. Pam, run a comb through your hair.
column97: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: First rule in road-side beet sales: Put the most attractive beets on top. The ones that make you pull the car over and go, "Wow, I need this beet right now." Those are the money beets.
column98: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: [Chad Lite walks in the door] [to Office workers] Hey! [snaps twice] Look sharp! [to Chad Lite] Hey! Uh, Hi. Hello, Dwight Schrute.
column99: 03x21 - Product Recall;Chad Lite: Hi, uh---
column100: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: And you must be uh, from the Washington Post.
column101: 03x21 - Product Recall;Chad Lite: Scranton Times. Chad Lite, "Lighter Side of Life."
column102: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: And "Breaking Corporate News."
column103: 03x21 - Product Recall;Chad Lite: And obits.
column104: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: Oh, dear God. OK, here are your credentials. You've been granted level three security clearance.
column105: 03x21 - Product Recall;Chad Lite: Oh...
column106: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: Don't get too excited, that's out of 20. Right this way. Regional Manager Michael Scott will be addressing the client in the press room shortly. Have a seat, can I get you a beverage?
column107: 03x21 - Product Recall;Chad Lite: Uh, yeah, I'd like uh, uh---
column108: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: [shuts door on him] Great.
column109: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Oh, Andy. You know what? We don't have a lot of time, so we should probably...
column110: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: Jamie!
column111: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Andy--- Ohh...
column112: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: What are you doing here?
column113: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jamie: Andy?
column114: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: Are you a student here?
column115: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jamie: Oh... yeah...
column116: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: You never told me you were in high-school!
column117: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jamie: This is weird. I... gotta go to Spanish.
column118: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: OH MY GOD!
column119: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Oh my God.
column120: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: I had no idea.
column121: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Well... that's not gonna hold up in court.
column122: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: Huh... We didn't do anything illegal. Except knock over a mailbox with her friends.
column123: 03x21 - Product Recall;
column124: 03x21 - Product Recall;
column125: 03x21 - Product Recall;
column126: 03x21 - Product Recall;Kevin: [on phone] Sir, yes, you have a valid point. I'm sorry. No, I am so sorry.
column127: 03x21 - Product Recall;Oscar: [on phone] Really, Dixon City? ...Carbondale.
column128: 03x21 - Product Recall;Angela: [on phone] Excuse me? Well, I don't see how that's our fault. And I've already told you, the official position of Dunder Mifflin is apologetic, so I don't know what you want from me. [hangs up]
column129: 03x21 - Product Recall;Kelly: OK, first, I just wanna say that you are doing sooo good. Look, you have so many good qualities, that the one that you might wanna work on is, apologizing?
column130: 03x21 - Product Recall;Creed: When I went over Wednesday, for the spot-check, I got a call from Debbie Brown, saying she has an emergency dentist appointment.
column131: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: Emergency dentist appointment.
column132: 03x21 - Product Recall;Creed: Now I'm told she told her manager she had the flu. I'm a trusting guy, but uh, I just wish Debbie Brown had been there. We would have caught this.
column133: 03x21 - Product Recall;Pam: Yes, I'll be sure someone returns your call. I'm so sorry. Bye.
column134: 03x21 - Product Recall;Barbara: Hello, I'm looking for Michael Scott.
column135: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: Mrs. Allen is our most important client... because every client is our most important client. Even though she's a pretty unimportant client, really.
column136: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: And so, with the eyes of the nation upon us, I would like to say that Dunder Mifflin truly regrets this unfortunate incident. And, as a gesture of gratitude, for your continued loyalty, Mrs. Allen, I would like to present you with this novelty check, for six months of free paper or 25 reams, whichever comes first.
column137: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: [snaps picture with his camera phone] You look good in this.
column138: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: So, let us consider this matter ended.
column139: 03x21 - Product Recall;Barbara: Well it isn't ended. I'm... I'm very angry. I--- I could have lost business.
column140: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: I know, I know you're angry. And we are truly, truly sorry.
column141: 03x21 - Product Recall;Barbara: I don't accept your apology. The watermark was obscene and horrifying.
column142: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: Well, we are extremely sorry.
column143: 03x21 - Product Recall;Barbara: I don't accept.
column144: 03x21 - Product Recall;School Official: I'll be with you in a moment.
column145: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: All right.
column146: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: Who was that guy she was talking to? At her locker.
column147: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Not important. Because you're not dating her. Because it's a felony.
column148: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: But who was that guy?
column149: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Probably another high-school student.
column150: 03x21 - Product Recall;School Official: The issue with the watermark is very serious.
column151: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Absolutely.
column152: 03x21 - Product Recall;School Official: We teach our students that character counts.
column153: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: And you should.
column154: 03x21 - Product Recall;School Official: But---
column155: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: [scoffs] Pfft. You don't teach it well enough. One of your students is a bitch.
column156: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: Andy... is having a real rough day today.
column157: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: I want to take out an ad, in your yearbook. A full page, two words---
column158: 03x21 - Product Recall;Jim: "Good luck."
column159: 03x21 - Product Recall;Andy: That's not what I had in mind.
column160: 03x21 - Product Recall;Kelly: Ask where he's from.
column161: 03x21 - Product Recall;Angela: [on phone] Where are you from? Ohio? That's nice. So what do you want? [to Kelly] He's upset about the watermark.
column162: 03x21 - Product Recall;Kelly: OK, great. Now tell him that it was an unfortunate error, and we're doing everything we can do to fix it, and that you're sorry.
column163: 03x21 - Product Recall;Angela: [on phone] It was an unfortunate error. We're fixing it. And you already got your money back...
column164: 03x21 - Product Recall;Kelly: And you're sorry.
column165: 03x21 - Product Recall;Angela: ...and the company has already apologized, so you can take that apology or not. [hangs up] [to Kelly] I think he had Tourette's or something!
column166: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: We... are going to do everything humanly possible, to ensure that this never happens again.
column167: 03x21 - Product Recall;Barbara: Well, it--- it doesn't help, because it already happened to me.
column168: 03x21 - Product Recall;Michael: The watermark... it's a one time thing.
column169: 03x21 - Product Recall;Barbara: I don't care! It was disgusting. Cartoon characters having s*x?
column170: 03x21 - Product Recall;Dwight: May I point out that the s*x appeared to be consensual? Both animals were smiling.

column83: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: OK, temp.
column84: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Dwight is an obvious candidate for my job. He has the best sales record in the office. He loves the work. He is, however, an idiot.
column85: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: We are going to choose team names. Dwight?
column86: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: We will be called Gryffindor.
column87: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: Really? Not Slytherin?
column88: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: Slytherin are the bad guys, Jim.
column89: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: I know. Okay, we will be Voldemort.
column90: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: He-who-must-not-be-named? I wouldn't do that.
column91: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: [starts chanting] Vol-de-mort, Vol-de-mort ...[Kevin and Karen follow] Vol-de-mort! Vol-de-mort! Vol-de-mort!
column92: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: OK, seriously. You really shouldn't be saying that.
column93: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Hey, hey, hey. Ok, Ok... Stanley, your team name?
column94: 03x23 - Beach Games;Stanley: I don't care what you call my team.
column95: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Then I will name your team the Red team.
column96: 03x23 - Beach Games;Stanley: No [crosses arms], the blue team.
column97: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: I am also considering Stanley because of all the good that black people have done. For America.
