column98: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: We will be team U.S.A.
column99: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Very good. Pam, please take a note that Andy is patriotic.
column100: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Andy Bernard. Pros: He's classy. He gets me. He went to Cornell. I trust him. Cons: I don't really trust him.
column101: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: It is time for the great spoon and egg race. This one is with a little twist.
column102: 03x23 - Beach Games;Stanley: There's already a twist, you're carrying an egg on a spoon.
column103: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Shh... The person carrying the egg will be blindfolded. Please put on your blindfolds. That person carrying the egg will go down, circle a torch, come back, deposit their egg in the pail. First team back is the winner. Alright. Ready? Set. Go! [contestants start walking]
column104: 03x23 - Beach Games;Oscar: Come on Phyllis, you can do it. [Phyllis' egg falls off spoon] Ahh...
column105: 03x23 - Beach Games;Stanley: Thank you so much. [Stanley sits down and pulls out his crossword puzzle]
column106: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: Phyllis is out. Yes! [to Kelly] Follow my voice. Follow my voice. Yeah, keep it moving. Keep it moving. Right this way. Looking good. [Cheers]
column107: 03x23 - Beach Games;Kelly: I don't want to hit the big rock!
column108: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: Don't worry. You're not...
column109: 03x23 - Beach Games;Kelly: I know I'm near the big rock. I just know it.
column110: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: No where near the big rock.
column111: 03x23 - Beach Games;Kelly: [takes off blindfold] I just don't want to get hit by it...
column112: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: What're you doing? No! See, now we're disqualified.
column113: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: I am okay if I lose every single contest today. Honestly. Because I see these contests as an opportunity for me to demonstrate what a good sport I am. Mallard! [throws a stone]
column114: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: [to Karen] Woah, stop, stop, stop. There's a hole. Step over the hole.
column115: 03x23 - Beach Games;Karen: Hole?
column116: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: Yup. [Karen takes a big step] Perfect, oooh, just made it. OK, turn left.
column117: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: [to Ryan] Come on! Come on! Andale! Arriba! Arriba!
column118: 03x23 - Beach Games;Ryan: Can you just stop this right now, or I'm not gonna do this anymore.
column119: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: What are you saying?
column120: 03x23 - Beach Games;Ryan: You have to stop yelling at me or I'm not gonna do the egg race.
column121: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: OK, I apologize for yelling at you.
column122: 03x23 - Beach Games;Ryan: That's what being a good captain is about. It's about listening to the members of your team.
column123: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: I am trying to bring team spirit.
column124: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: [to Karen] Woah, stop, another hole. Take a big step. [Karen steps into lake] Yes!
column125: 03x23 - Beach Games;Karen: [lifts up blindfold] Oh my God! You ass! [chases Jim and throws egg at him] [both laugh]
column126: 03x23 - Beach Games;Pam: There's nothing better than a beautiful day at the beach, filled with sun, surf, and uh... diligent note-taking. [holds up notes]
column127: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: [off screen] Pam...you're missing things. [shakes off hand and starts writing in notebook]
column128: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: [at Ryan holding egg in spoon] Let's go! Let's go! Come on! Mush! Mush! Come on you b*st*rd! [Ryan takes off blindfold and throws it to ground along with egg and spoon] What the? Damn it temp!
column129: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: [begins to clap] Great job everyone, that was fantastic. [Michael sighs]
column130: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Okay Pam, I have another little project for you.
column131: 03x23 - Beach Games;Pam: Does it have to do with these shopping bags filled with hot dogs?
column132: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Smart as a whip! Yes! [holds up hot dog packages] These are pre-cooked, so it's not absolutely necessary, but I would appreciate it if you could heat up 800 hot dogs for a little contest I'm going to be having. I would greatly appreciate it.
column133: 03x23 - Beach Games;Pam: When's the contest?
column134: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Like umm...[looks at watch] ten minutes?
column135: 03x23 - Beach Games;Pam: How am I supposed to... get...
column136: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Thanks a bunch.
column137: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: A good manager has got to be hungry. Hungry for success.
column138: 03x23 - Beach Games;
column139: 03x23 - Beach Games;
column140: 03x23 - Beach Games;
column141: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: OK, who's hungry [Kevin starts to put hot dog in mouth] No, no, no. Do not touch the food. Please. Not yet. That is our next event. A hot dog eating contest. [sighs at the table] For those of you who are curious, the world record is 54 and one half hot dogs. Wow! And you know what? I personally have cooked up enough so each and every one of you could break that record. So shoot for the stars, OK? Alright, the team that eats the most hot dogs in ten minutes will be declared the winner. On you mark. Get set.
column142: 03x23 - Beach Games;Kelly: Can I have a turkey burger?
column143: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: No, I have the only one. I claimed it. Ready?
column144: 03x23 - Beach Games;Oscar: Turkey is a healthy meat.
column145: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: It's very good for you. [overlapping talk from all at table]
column146: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Guys, guys, guys. Come on! Pleeeeease... Let's just... OK, it's very important that you all try to eat as many hot dogs as you can. On your mark. Get set. Eat!
column147: 03x23 - Beach Games;Phyllis: Is there any mustard?
column148: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: No mustard, no mustard. Just eat it, eat it, Phyllis. Dip it in the water so it'll slide down your gullet more easily.
column149: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Come on, the winner gets a big, big prize.
column150: 03x23 - Beach Games;Meredith: [eating hot dog] What is it?
column151: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: I can't say.
column152: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: You can't say, or you can't pronounce it?
column153: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: The winner gets a regional manager's salary for a year, and a Sebring, and the feeling that they are making a difference in the world.
column154: 03x23 - Beach Games;Kelly: Can we just take those first two things?
column155: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: The winner of today gets my job. Ok? I'm interviewing for a job at corporate. And they're only interviewing a handful of people and I'm the most qualified and I'll probably get it. Alright?
column156: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: You're leaving?
column157: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: I didn't want to tell anyway. I didn't want to cast a pall over our fun beach day. But you know what? I don't know who to recommend because frankly nobody is stepping up.
column158: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: [slams fist onto table] I am so hungry! [starts eating hot dog real fast]
column159: 03x23 - Beach Games;Stanley: Do you expect me to believe that you're truly making your recommendations on this basis?
column160: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: [points at Stanley] Word. [Stanley starts eating hot dog] There we go. Let's see it.
column161: 03x23 - Beach Games;Stanley: I would rather work for an upturned broom with a bucket for a head than work for somebody else in this office besides myself. Game on!
column162: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Four. Three. Two. One. Stop your eating! And the winner is Andy Bernard, with 14 hot dogs!
column163: 03x23 - Beach Games;Kelly: Team U.S.A.!
column164: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: One came up.
column165: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: 13 hot dogs, everybody!
column166: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: Damn it!
column167: 03x23 - Beach Games;Creed: [holding a fish with all the meat stripped off] Nobody told me we were going to have hot dogs!
column168: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: Sabotage.
column169: 03x23 - Beach Games;Angela: What? What are you saying? Did you say sandwich?
column170: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: No. I was saying that before. Not now. Now I am saying sabotage. The ancient Dutch art of screwing up your own team.
column171: 03x23 - Beach Games;Angela: I knew you were saying sabotage. I was giving you an example of it. I will misunderstand everything that Andy says until he goes insane.
column172: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: If Michael organizes some kind of group hug, stand next to me.
column173: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: It's very simple. There are only three rules. You must not touch the ground. You must not step outside of the ring. And you must always wear the safety mittens.
column174: 03x23 - Beach Games;Stanley: Uh, we don't have any safety mittens
column175: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Probably left them in the trunk of my car. It's alright. It's alright. Here we go.
column176: 03x23 - Beach Games;Karen: Get 'em big boy!
column177: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Aaaaaand, go!
column178: 03x23 - Beach Games;Karen: C'mon, Jim!
column179: 03x23 - Beach Games;Stanley: [growly noises, Jim looks terrified]
column180: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: What are you doing?
column181: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Nice, Stanley!
column182: 03x23 - Beach Games;Stanley: [to Jim] Sorry about that. It's all about taking points away from Dwight.
column183: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: Yeah. No. Good.
column184: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: Oh, my God. I have never seen that look in a man's eyes... ever. I thought that I might die. On beach day.
column185: 03x23 - Beach Games;Oscar: If either of these guys are put in charge of the office I will transfer to Albany. Gil can come if he wants. I'm kinda looking for a way out of that relationship anyway. I think I might try girls for a while. Angela thinks I can cross over. We'll see.
column186: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: [Andy and Dwight sumo wrestle] Gaaaaa....
column187: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: One. Two. Three.
column188: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: Yaaaaa! Yaaaaa!
column189: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Excellent!
column190: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: Gryffindor! Gryffindor!
column191: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: I didn't win. But the only reason I didn't win is because I recently learned that it's better to work thing out with words.
column192: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: That's not why you lost.
column193: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: Yeah it is. I totally could have kicked your butt so bad.
column194: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: Yeah, right.
column195: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: Yeah, right, c'mon! C'mon! [Dwight and Andy wrestle]
column196: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: [bouncing off of Andy] Aaaagh! Uggggh! How do you like that?
column197: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: [Trying to wet bandana, falls in water] Oh, God! Waaa! Guhh! Wuuuh! Help! Angela! Angela, hey! Oh, thank God! Please tell somebody!
column198: 03x23 - Beach Games;Angela: What, Andy? Andy, what should I tell them?
column199: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: Go tell them I'm floating away, obviously!
column200: 03x23 - Beach Games;Angela: I don't understand what you want from me.
column201: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: Angela, it's pretty simple! Look at what I'm doing and go tell somebody about it!
column202: 03x23 - Beach Games;Angela: Sorry! Bye, Andy!
column203: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: Angela!
column204: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: I knew that finding a successor would be difficult. I did not know that it would be impossible. Thus far the candidates have been wildly disappointing. Uh, Jim is not taking it seriously. Uh, Stanley is having a stroke. And Andy, where is he? Where the hell is Andy? Where is he, Pam? Do you know? Ah... who's ahead in points?
column205: 03x23 - Beach Games;Pam: I think they're even. At various times you gave Jim ten points, Dwight a gold star, and Stanley a thumbs up. And I don't really know how to compare those units.
column206: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Check to see if there is a conversion chart in that notebook.
column207: 03x23 - Beach Games;Pam: I really doubt it, Michael.
column208: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Please just check.
column209: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: [on cell phone] Great. Yeah, I'll see you next week. Thank you, and here is Karen Filipelli. Bye.
column210: 03x23 - Beach Games;Karen: Hello? Yeah, hi David. Yes, I would like to be considered for the corporate position in well.
column211: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: In well?
column212: 03x23 - Beach Games;Karen: As well.
column213: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: How would that work in well? I just want to know.
column214: 03x23 - Beach Games;Karen: Yes. uh, huh.
column215: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: Wait a minute.
column216: 03x23 - Beach Games;Karen: That would be fine.
column217: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: If this job is in a well, I don't want it.
column218: 03x23 - Beach Games;Karen: [whispering] Cut it out!
column219: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: I don't!
column220: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: What does a great manager need most of all? Courage.
column221: 03x23 - Beach Games;Stanley: How so? I mean... sure thing, that sounds smart... I can't do this anymore! I'm goin' to sit in the bus.
column222: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Your loss, Stanley. Meanwhile the rest of us will have a super fun time defeating our fear and creating a lasting memory. Walking through FIRE!
column223: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Who among you has the guts to replace me? Let him walk across these coals.
column224: 03x23 - Beach Games;Kevin: Are you going to try it?
column225: 03x23 - Beach Games;Angela: I'm not going to talk through the fire after your disgusting feet have gone through.
column226: 03x23 - Beach Games;Kevin: Angela, it is a million degrees.
column227: 03x23 - Beach Games;Pam: I'm gonna do it. And I fully expect to burn my feet and go to the hospital. That's the right spirit when doing a coal walk, right?
column228: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: No. No, not you, Pam. You have to keep score.
column229: 03x23 - Beach Games;Pam: I'd like to try it.
column230: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Pointless.
column231: 03x23 - Beach Games;Pam: But I'm not kidding. I really want to do it.
column232: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Blah, blah, blee blup, blup, okay? This is about guts. It takes guts to be a regional manager. Jim, you're up.
column233: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: Nope.
column234: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Ji.. why not? C'mon.
column235: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: Oh, 'cause I don't want my feet to get burned.
column236: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: You do not have what it takes to be a regional manager.
column237: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: That's harsh.
column238: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Who's next? Andy? Where's Andy? Andy is never here today.
column239: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: [lying in water, car lights light up his location] Hello? Who's there? My name is Andrew Bernard, I was with a group called Dunder Mifflin. Hello?
column240: 03x23 - Beach Games;Kevin: Why don't you go Michael?
column241: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Because I already did. Remember? I burned my foot on a George Foreman grill.
column242: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: And that is not the same at all. If you're going to ask other people to do it, you should do it yourself.
column243: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Alright. Okay. Alright. Fine. 'kay. [clears throat, breathes noisily] The mind has to wrap around the foot. [exhales] Okay.
column244: 03x23 - Beach Games;Pam: Do you want us to count to three?
column245: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Yes. Count to three, please.
column246: 03x23 - Beach Games;Group: Three. Two. One.
column247: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Count the other way. Count... no, no, count one, two, three, not three, two, one.
column248: 03x23 - Beach Games;Group: One. Two. Three! Go! Do it! Go, Michael.
column249: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Wait! Am I going on go? Or am I going on three?
column250: 03x23 - Beach Games;Creed: On the go that's after three.
column251: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Okay.
column252: 03x23 - Beach Games;Group: One, two, three, go!
column253: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: No! It's okay. I will do this Michael.
column254: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Don't, don't.
column255: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: [walking on coals] I will walk and stand on these coals until you award me the position of regional manager!
column256: 03x23 - Beach Games;Group: Wow. Go, Dwight. Keep moving.
column257: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: [standing still, on the coals] GIVE ME THE JOB! GIVE ME THE JOB!
column258: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: I'm not going to give it to you.
column259: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: [falling on his knees, then on all fours] Aaagh, aaagh!
column260: 03x23 - Beach Games;Group: [yelling excitedly for Dwight to get off the coals]
column261: 03x23 - Beach Games;Pam: Michael, do something!
column262: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: Aggggh, that stings!
column263: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Being the boss is also about image. I've never looked like that. That was gross. I just, I don't see the connection between a firewalk and management. Worst seventy-five bucks I ever spent. You know what, if I had to pick my replacement based on today, it would be Mr. "Outside Hire."
column264: 03x23 - Beach Games;Angela: Or Mrs. "Outside Hire."
column265: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Yeah. Ummm, hmm... True. Look, I don't want to leave this branch that I love to an outside hire therefore we are going to have a one hundred point winner take all sudden death tribal council round. To test the aspect of my job that I think is the most important, something I call the Bob Hope factor.
column266: 03x23 - Beach Games;Kelly: Who's Bob Hope?
column267: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: God! He's a comedian.
column268: 03x23 - Beach Games;Kelly: Oh, like Amanda Bynes.
column269: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Who's Amanda Bynes?
column270: 03x23 - Beach Games;Kelly: She's from "What a Girl Wants."
column271: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Oh, I love that movie. Yes, Kelly is right, the person to replace me has to have a great sense of humor and they have to possess the leadership qualities of a Bynes or a Hope. So without further ado, Jim and Dwight show us what you got.
column272: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: Hey, I know what you're looking for, but um, I got to be honest, I really don't think I should be considered as your replacement.
column273: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: You are being too modest.
column274: 03x23 - Beach Games;Jim: Michael, on Thursday I'm going to drive down and interview with David for the open position in New York.
column275: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Hhhh... okay. That is not funny. I am deducting sixty points from Voldemort for false pretenses. Okay, Dwight your turn. Wow us.
column276: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: The Aristocrats. A man and his wife and his children go into the offices of a talent agency. And the talent agent says, "Describe your act." And the man says something really, really raunchy and the talent representative says, "What do you call yourselves?" And the man says, "The Aristocrats!"
column277: 03x23 - Beach Games;Pam: [breathes deeply and runs across coals] Oooh, uh hah, ooh! Wha-hoo! Ahhhh...
column278: 03x23 - Beach Games;Dwight: [finishes story] I mean truly repulsive acts.
column279: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: That is a very, very funny story.
column280: 03x23 - Beach Games;Pam: [runs over after walking over fire coals] Hey! I want to say something. I've been trying to be more honest lately and I just need to say a few things. I did the coal walk! Just, I did it! Michael, you couldn't even do that. Maybe I should be your boss? Wow, I feel really good right now. Why didn't any of you come to my art show? I invited all of you. That really sucked. It's like sometimes some of you act like I don't even exist. [turns and looks directly at Jim] Jim, I called off my wedding because of you. And now we're not even friends. And things are just like weird between us, and that sucks. And I miss you. You were my best friend before you went to Stamford, and I really miss you. I shouldn't have been with Roy. And there were a lot of reasons to call off my wedding. But the truth is, I didn't care about any of those reasons until I met you. And now you're with someone else. And that's... fine. It's... whatever. That's not what... I'm not... Okay, my feet really hurt. The thing that I'm just trying to say to you, Jim... and to everyone else in this circle I guess, is that I miss having fun with you. Just you, not everyone in the circle. Okay, I am going to go walk in the water now. Yeah. It's a good day.
column281: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: Pam, that was amazing. But I am still looking for someone with a sales background.
column282: 03x23 - Beach Games;Group: Flintstones, meet the Flintstones. They're a modern stone-age family. Ba-ba-da-da-da. From the town of Bedrock, they're a page right out of history. Ba-da-da-da-da. [overlapping singing of the wrong verses] When you're with the Flintstones, have a yabba-dabba-doo time, a dabba-doo time, we'll have a gay old time!
column283: 03x23 - Beach Games;Michael: WWWWIIIILLLLMMMMAAAA!
column284: 03x23 - Beach Games;Andy: Nice!

column1: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: [at Dunder-Mifflin Corporate in NY] David!
column2: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: [confused] Oh, Michael?
column3: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Are we all set?
column4: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Isn't our interview tomorrow?
column5: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes. I just happened to be in the neighborhood, thought I'd drop in and say hello.
column6: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: You happened to be in mid-town Mahattan?
column7: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Thought I'd catch a show.
column8: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: In the middle of a work day?
column9: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Naaah. You know what? Since I'm here, let me ask you a few questions about the job.
column10: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Okay.
column11: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Um, how many people are you interviewing?
column12: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: We're only interviewing the branch managers and some other upper level company people.
column13: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ah, well, good. Out of curiosity are you interviewing anyone who has been here longer than I have, or manages more people?
column14: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: I don't think so.
column15: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Great. One more... question. When you merged those branches who did you put in charge?
column16: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: I believe we put you in charge.
column17: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ah, great. No further questions.
column18: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Okay, Michael.
column19: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Okay.
column20: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: I'm really looking forward to our interview.
column21: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: And I'm really looking forward to working with you.
column22: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: I got it made in the shade. I know this company. The other branch managers are total morons. [on cell phone] Hey, Pam yeah, I forgot what day the interview was and I drove to New York accidentially. I'll be like three hours late.
column23: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: [Jim walk through the door sporting an obvious new haircut] Hey.
column24: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Hey, Kev.
column25: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: What's different about you? You look worse.
column26: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Thank you.
column27: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Meredith: You got a haircut. It's sexy, hot.
column28: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Ohhh...
column29: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Meredith: Turn around.
column30: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: No.
column31: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Meredith: Yes.
column32: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: No way.
column33: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Meredith: Do it!
column34: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: Blup-dup-do. What's up, Big Haircut? You are no longer Big Tuna. From henceforth, you shall be known as Big Haircut.
column35: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: [exhales loudly] Andy...
column36: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: What is it, Big Haircut?
column37: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Nothing.
column38: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: Sorry, I can't hear you Big Haircut.
column39: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yup.
column40: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: What?
column41: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Karen suggested that I get a haircut for the interview tomorrow so that I could look presentable and not, as she so lovingly puts it, homeless.
column42: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: Hey. I think it looks great.
column43: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Thanks, Pam.
column44: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: After I had my little outburst at the beach, Jim was really nice about it. He just basically said that he missed my friendship too and I would always mean a lot to him and I understand where he's coming from. For the record, I am not embarassed at all. It needed to be said, and I said it, and it only took me three years to summons the courage, so [quietly, and mock bowing] thank you.
column45: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: [knock on door] Yeah.
column46: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: You wanted to see me?
column47: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes, the time has come to name my own replacement. So please hand this letter of congratulations to Dwight K. Schrute.
column48: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: But that's my name. [opens letter and reads] Dwight, congratuations a-wipe. Don't screw the pooch. [begins to cry] Thank you.
column49: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Okay. Uh...
column50: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [cries harder] Thank you, Michael.
column51: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Uh, okay.
column52: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [sobbing, holding letter to chest] Thank you so much.
column53: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Stop crying.
column54: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [sobbing] Thank you.
column55: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ohhhhh...
column56: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: Hey.
column57: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Hey.
column58: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: Um, about the beach...
column59: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: It's okay, we all say things without thinking.
column60: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: Oh, no it's not that, I've actually been thinking that for a long time, and I'm glad I said it. I just... I'm sorry if it made you feel weird.
column61: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: [confused] Oh. Okay.
column62: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Pam is... kind of a bitch.
column63: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Hey, what if we leave tonight? Grab a bite, get a hotel room, enjoy the city a little bit.
column64: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Ahhh... just have so much paperwork to do. [exhales] Wow. Done. Okay, let's do it.
column65: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: So I was wondering if Karen and I could get off a few hours early 'cause we want to spend the night in the city.
column66: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Why so you can do it?
column67: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: [looks annoyed]
column68: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Whoops.
column69: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, um, well I was thinking that uh, actually we could all leave tomorrow and do a convoy you know? Convoys are really fun. Pull up next to each other, give each other the finger...
column70: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Hmmm.
column71: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Heh.
column72: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Moon each other.
column73: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Ah, we're gonna go tonight, but we're gonna see you there tomorrow morning, right?
column74: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: All right.
column75: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: All right.
column76: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Your loss.
column77: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Wait, how would you moon us if you were driving?
column78: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Cruise control.
column79: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Oh.
column80: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: So Jim, who do you think is hotter? Pam or Karen?
column81: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yeah, I'm not going to talk about this now.
column82: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Pam is taller.
column83: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: You sure?
column84: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Yes. She has bigger breasts, too.
column85: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Wow.
column86: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: I think Karen has a prettier face.
column87: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Uh, hmm. [thinking] Uh, hmm. What else?
column88: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Well I mean Pam's face is really pretty too. It's a very tough call.
column89: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Hm. Really tough call.
column90: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Yeah.
column91: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: You know what? Why don't you take the rest of the day, figure it out and then come back and tell me what you got.
column92: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Will do.
column93: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: All right. [smiles]
column94: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Hey, Pam I've been meaning to say something to you. I really miss our friendship. [group laughs]
column95: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: Wow, very funny.
column96: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Stanley: I've never heard you talk that much. I thought it was Kelly.
column97: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Are you kidding? I would have never done that. It was pathetic-ville. No offense, Pam.
column98: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: [smiles]
column99: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Meredith: You know what? Don't even worry about it. Everyone was so drunk, I bet no one even remembers what you said.
column100: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Creed: I remember. I blogged the whole thing.
column101: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Creed: www.creedthoughts.gov.www/creedthoughts. Check it out.
column102: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Last year Creed asked me how to set up a blog. Wanting to protect the world from being exposed to Creed's brain I opened up a Word document on his computer and put an address at the top. I've read some of it. Even for the intranet it's... pretty shocking.
column103: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: There they are, the Accounting Department. I shall miss your humility and your promptly printed checks.
column104: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Do you think it's gonna to be weird working with Jan in New York?
column105: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: No. Not at all. I haven't talked to Jan since we broke up, and I think if she had something to say she would have called me.
column106: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Maybe you should talk to her? Before...
column107: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, no, no. You know what? It's a done deal. I basically have the job already. There's nothing she can do to stop it now. I already sold my condo.
column108: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Michael...
column109: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: What?
column110: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Angela: Why?
column111: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Oscar: I'm sorry, that just doesn't make sense.
column112: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes, I...
column113: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Angela: Wha? Who gave you that advice?
column114: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Yeah, Michael you should never sell your condo...
column115: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: I have to buy another place.
column116: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Angela: But you said you were in debt. [crosstalk]
column117: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Oscar: You're not sure that you have the job.
column118: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: I sold it on eBay. The buyer was very motivated, as was I. It went for eighty percent of what I paid. Sold in record time.
column119: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: How would you like to spend the night with the Regional Manager of Dunder-Mifflin, Scranton?
column120: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Angela: No Dwight, I don't care if that is how they consolidated power in ancient Rome.
column121: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No, no, not Michael. [whispers] Me. I'm taking his job.
column122: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Angela: [smiles] Not now. [Dwight leaves] Goodbye, Kelly Kapoor.
column123: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [squeezing hand grips] Jim, Jim, Jim. Jim, Jim, Jim, Jim, Jim, Jim, Jim.
column124: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh hey, Dwight.
column125: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I am gonna be your new boss. [laughs] It's my greatest dream come true. Welcome to the Hotel Hell. Check in time is now. Check out time is never.
column126: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Does my room have cable?
column127: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No. And the sheets are made of fire.
column128: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Can I change rooms?
column129: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Sorry, we're all booked up. Hell convention in town.
column130: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Can I have a late checkout?
column131: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I'll have to talk to the manager.
column132: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: You're not the manager even in your own fantasy?
column133: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I'm the owner. The co-owner. With Satan!
column134: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Okay, just so I understand it, in your wildest fantasy you are in Hell and you are co-running a bed and breakfast with the devil?
column135: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Yeah, but I haven't told you my salary yet.
column136: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Go.
column137: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Eighty thousand dollars a year.
column138: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Once I'm officially Regional Manager my first order of business will be to demote Jim Halpert. So I will need a new number two. My ideal choice? Jack Bauer. But he is unavailable. Fictional. And overqualified.
column139: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: [signing interview sheet] I will see you at the inter-view.
column140: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Yes you will.
column141: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Who is D. Abramson?
column142: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: He's from that company in Pitts...
column143: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: [walks through front door] Michael.
column144: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Why... are you here?
column145: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Uh, how are you?
column146: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'm good. How are you, Janet? It's good to see you.
column147: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: I'm great. Uh, can we, can we talk... privately... for a minute?
column148: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Why privately?
column149: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: I just, [quietly] I uh... I don't uh... I, I don't, I don't like the way that we left things.
column150: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Okay, sure, fine. Um, why don't you wait in my office. I have some important business matters to take care of.
column151: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Okay.
column152: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Okay.
column153: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Pam, Defcon ten. Houston, we have a problem.
column154: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: What do you want me to do?
column155: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Uh, I may need some immediate assistance. If you would slowly and quietly gather the ladies in the conference room. Phyllis, Angela, Karen.
column156: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: What about Meredith?
column157: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: No. She's an alternate.
column158: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: So, how you been?
column159: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Been good.
column160: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Good.
column161: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Good.
column162: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah.
column163: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Sorry to drop by unexpectedly. I uh, I tried calling, but I kept getting voice mail.
column164: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Weird. Yeah, I didn't get both of your messages.
column165: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: So, um, Michael needs us in the conference room.
column166: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: 'Cause of Jan again?
column167: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Hey, uh, before I leave tonight, would you mind making a half a dozen copies of Jim's and my sales reports for our interviews tomorrow?
column168: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: Uh, sure.
column169: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Thanks.
column170: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: I really hope you get the job.
column171: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Thanks. [looks suspicious]
column172: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: After you ended... everything with us, I went on a vacation.
column173: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hmm.
column174: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: To kinda clear my mind.
column175: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Sound good. Sounds fun.
column176: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: It was. Yeah, it was good. [laughs] I think I'll just get right to the point, you know? Um, I, I feel good about myself for the first time in a really long time.
column177: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hmm..
column178: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: I've made some big changes in my life and... I miss you. I want us to get back together.
column179: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Would you excuse me for a second?
column180: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Ohh... [Michael leaves and walks into conference room]
column181: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Defcon twenty. She wants to get back together.
column182: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: What are you gonna do?
column183: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: I don't know, that's why you're here, help me. Please...
column184: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Do you want to get back together with her?
column185: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, no. What do I do?
column186: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: Just don't get back together with her.
column187: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: What if she makes me?
column188: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Angela: How can she make you get back together with her?
column189: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: She made me do a lot of things I didn't wanna do.
column190: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: This was a terrible relationship. You were not happy when you were with her.
column191: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: I wasn't.
column192: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: You're so much happier now. Just go in there and be strong.
column193: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: You're right. You're absolutely right. I'm gonna go in there and tell her that we can't be together.
column194: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: Right.
column195: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Wow.
column196: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Do it.
column197: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'm in a very good place right now. Thank you.
column198: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: [walks back into office with Jan] Okay. [clears throat] Jan, we need to talk. [Jan turns revealing that she has had her breasts enlarged]
column199: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Jan is in a different place right now, and it is a sign of maturity to give people second chances. So I am going to hear her out.
column200: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: Oh my God. [mouths to Jim] Huge!
column201: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yeah, bigger actually.
column202: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: [whispers] That's crazy!
column203: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Mm-hm.
column204: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: [mouths] Wow!
column205: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: [moves to block Jim from Pam's eyeline] Oh my God. Can you believe that?
column206: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Unbelievable.
column207: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Wow!
column208: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: She could put the cup right there.
column209: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: I know!
column210: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: No, it's fine. I'm sure it must have been weird for Jim when Roy and I were joking around... that one time.
column211: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Meredith: I would never do that. Waste of money. In my experience, guys are way more attracted to the back of you than the front.
column212: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: I love fake boobs. Often times, you find them on strippers.
column213: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Creed: I find it offensive. Au natural, baby. That's how I like 'em. Swing low, sweet chariots.
column214: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: So... [exhales] there are a lot of things that I would like to do differently.
column215: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah.
column216: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: I feel like, when we first got together, that I had a problem with my priorities.
column217: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: First got priorities.
column218: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: And if we could talk about a way to approach a possible reconciliation...
column219: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Let's get back together. [Jan smiles and laughs]
column220: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: No. No, no, no, no. I'll tell you this, it is not because of the boob job. Excuse me, boob enhancement. That would be shallow. And this is the opposite of shallow. This is... emotionally magnificent.
column221: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Okay, everyone, listen up! [claps] Time to begin the interview process! [looks at sign-up sheet, only contains Andy's name] Andrew Bernard.
column222: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: Saving the best for first!
column223: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: All right, you guys. See you later, wish us luck!
column224: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No! Hey, hey, hey, hey! Do not wish them luck. Do not wish them luck. All luck must be wished unto Michael.
column225: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Good luck, you guys! [everyone wishes them luck]
column226: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: What did I say!?
column227: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: [to Jim] Good luck.
column228: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Thanks.
column229: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: I'm happy for him. I hope he gets the job. I really just want him to be happy. And I know that sounds cliche. And I know saying it sounds cliche, sounds cliche... Maybe I'm being cliche. I don't care. Cause I am what I am. [thinks] That's Popeye.
column230: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I am going to begin this process with a simple test of intelligence and mental dexterity. What is the best color?
column231: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: White, because it contains all other colors.
column232: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Wrong. Black. It is the most dominant. How do you make a table?
column233: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: You make a chair, but you don't sit on it.
column234: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: What is the capital of Maine?
column235: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: The capital of Maine is Montpelier, Vermont, which is near Ithaca, New York, where I went to Cornell.
column236: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Okay, also, moratorium on Cornell talk. Don't wanna hear about it. Forget your personal history, and learn the history of this company.
column237: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: Should not be a problem. I minored in history in the Ivy League school which I attended.
column238: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: You're not off to a very good start, Bernard.
column239: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: I agree. But in another way, I am off to a very good start, wouldn't you say?
column240: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: I am a great interviewee. Why? Because I have something no one else has: my brain. Which I use to my advantage, when advantageous.
column241: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [Andy and Dwight arm-wrestle, Andy is about to win] Time! No, you failed.
column242: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: Damn it!
column243: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: This interview is over. I'll let you know.
column244: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: [Driving to New York] Hey, thank you so much for driving me down for my interview.
column245: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Totally, no problem. What are you interviewing for, by the way, my assistant? Or...
column246: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Oh, you know I'm gonna have a congratulations Karen party um, tomorrow night at my friend's house.
column247: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh wow, that sounds like fun. Is your friend named Karen too? What did she accomplish?
column248: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: No, I'm sorry I should have been clearer. It's for me.
column249: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh...
column250: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: 'Cause I'm going to get the job.
column251: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);
column252: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);
column253: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);
column254: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: [holding Jan's breasts] Remarkable.
column255: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Thanks.
column256: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Wait, wait. Check one more time.
column257: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Oh, okay.
column258: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Very good [Jan nods]
column259: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Well, I um, I have to get back, but I will see you in New York tomorrow, right?
column260: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes, indeed.
column261: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Good luck with your interview. [whispers] Bye.
column262: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: So, I guess we're getting back together.
column263: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: What happened?
column264: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Your advice was good, but Jan's was bigger.
column265: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Here's the sitch. Two weeks ago, I was in the worst relationship of my life. She treated me poorly. We didn't connect, I was miserable. Now, I'm in the best relationship of my life with the same woman. Love is a mystery.
column266: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: So we have all night. Where do you want to go first?
column267: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh, I dunno, how about the U.N.?
column268: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: How often do you come here?
column269: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Um, everytime my sixth grade class has a field trip.
column270: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: I think you'll really enjoy this, adult Jim.
column271: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey, everybody. The next time you see me, I'll be working for corporate. Starting tomorrow, Dwight Schrute will be running the branch. So without further ado, [clicks on small tape player] I would like to start saying my goodbyes [Song: Thank You, by Natalie Merchant plays in background] Okay. Goodnight, and good luck.
column272: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [Dwight clicks off tape player] Who's ready to work?
column273: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: [Karen punches buttons on an ATM] Yeah, we went to the Spotted Pig for dinner. It's in the Village. Uh, Karen knew it. And then we second acted Spamalot. That's when you sneak in at intermission with all the smokers. And then we went to a bar that used to be a church. Oh and at this one bar, I swear I saw Lorne Michaels.
column274: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: That wasn't him. [Jim nods, mouths, yes, it was]
column275: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: So what's going to happen to us when I get this job?
column276: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh do you mean when I get the job?
column277: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Well, if you get the job then I'd move here with you. Would you move with me? I'm not stupid. I was at the beach. We won't have a future in Scranton. There's one too many people there.
column278: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: You mean Kevin?
column279: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Exactly. But you get it, right? Can't stay there.
column280: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yeah, I do. C'mon. [they hold hands and cross street]
column281: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: [exhales] How are you guys doing? Need anything?
column282: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Uh, no, we're good. Thanks.
column283: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: I have been here a bunch of times, so I know where everything is, know everybody's names. If you need to know somebody's name, just ask me.
column284: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: [points at bearded man] Who's that?
column288: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: I'm gonna introduce myself.
column289: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, no, no, just... that's not his real name. That's just what I call him, so...
column290: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: I am by far the most qualified person they're interviewing. Jim and Karen are here, which is cute. They're like, kid actors tagging along with daddy, on the big audition, hoping to be discovered. Except daddy... is the best actor around. Daddy is Meryl Streep.
column292: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: Hail to the chief!
column293: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: My first order of business: make Andrew Bernard my number two.
column294: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: My first order of business: accept.
column295: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: As if you had a choice. [scoffs] Duh. [scoffs] Opportunity of a lifetime. [spits chew into Michael's World's Best Boss mug]
column296: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: Three months ago, I was nowhere. I was just a Cornell grad, in anger management. Look where I am now. Not bad. [washing out Michael's mug]
column297: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey! Hunter! Wha's up my brutha? This is Hunter, secretary extraordinaire.
column300: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Hunter: I think she's comin' in... later.
column301: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Could you give her a message for me, when she gets in?
column303: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Just say, "I want to squeeze them." It's code. She'll know what it means.
column305: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, and Hunter? Could you tell her, [Michael shakes his head and makes the "motorboat" noise] "Brbrbrbrbr!" also?
column306: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: You showed great leadership potential at the coal walk. Even if you did follow it with that embarrassing personal confession.
column308: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I had to make Andy my number two. It's political, complicated, you wouldn't understand. I want you... to be Assistant Regional Manager.
column310: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Well, in a sense. Although, publicly I am going to retain the Assistant Regional Manager position.
column311: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: You will be your own assistant.
column312: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Correct, I need someone I can trust. But I would also like the title... to be secretly applied to you. Just stripped of its pomp and frills.
column313: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: Okay. So... you would be the Regional Manager, and the Assistant Regional Manager. Andy is your number two. I would be the Secret Assistant Regional Manager.
column314: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Mmmmmm, let's call it Secret Assistant to the Regional Manager.
column318: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: I learned from Jim, if Dwight ever asks you to accept something secret... you reply, "Absolutely, I do."
column319: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: [knocks on door] Hello, hello!
column320: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Michael, good to see you!
column321: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Good to see you. Here are the post-merger performance stats that you asked for.
column322: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Oh, great. I've been meaning to thank you by the way. You didn't lose a single customer during the merger, and you still managed to trim the budget? That is nice work. [Michael smiles] So, let me ask you a question right off the bat. What do you think are your greatest strengths as a manager?
column323: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Why don't I tell you what my greatest weaknesses are? I work too hard. I care too much. And sometimes I can be too invested in my job.
column324: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Okay. And your strengths?
column325: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well, my weaknesses are actually... strengths.
column326: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Oh. Yes. Very good.
column329: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: Dwight is our new boss.
column330: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Oh, Michael's not going anywhere.
column331: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: Then who do you think will get the job?
column332: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Karen. She looks corporate. Those little pants suits.
column333: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: I think it's gonna be Michael.
column334: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Do you really think he's qualified for that job?
column335: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: No, but he wasn't qualified for the job he has now, and he got that one.
column337: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Listen up! Come to the center of the room, please. This... [holds up paper that resemles a sheet sized dollar bill with Dwight's face in the middle] is a Schrute Buck. When you have done something good, you will receive one Schrute Buck. One thousand Schrute Bucks... equals an extra five minutes for lunch.
column338: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: [raises hand] What is the cash value of a Schrute Buck?
column339: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Excellent question, Pam. 1/100th of a cent.
column340: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Oscar: So ten thousand of your dollars is worth one real dollar?
column341: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Just... zip your lid! Another announcement. Michael wasted an enormous amount of the group's time and patience with non-work related ethnic celebrations and parades of soft-minded dogoodedness. No longer. No more meetings!
column343: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Instead, today I will begin my first lecture in a long series of lectures designed to increase your knowledge on the world of paper.
column344: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: [raises hand] Do we have to?
column345: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Yes! Michael is gone. There's a new sheriff here in these offices, and his name is "me." Conference room! Ten seconds! All of you!
column346: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: I literally cannot wait to see what Dwight has planned. And I wish Jim were here.
column347: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: What do you think we could be doing better?
column348: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: I've never been a big fan of the name Dunder Mifflin. I was thinking we could name the company something like, "Paper Great. Where great paper is our passion. We're GRRRRRRRRRREAT!" I don't know, could be good. Or, uh, "Super Duper Paper. It's super duper." I don't know, something like that.
column351: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Thanks for comin' in, Michael.
column353: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: It is always a treat when our paths cross.
column354: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: It is always a treat when our paths cross. So, oh! Before I forget, I wanted to let you know, if you hadn't already heard, uh, Jan and I are back together. So... I may need to fill out one of those love documents again.
column356: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes. And I am very excited about the prospect of working under her... or on top of her. [laughs] Mm, that's not sexual, just... we're all professionals.
column357: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Okay, uh. Well, I thought it was clear in the description, the position... the job you're applying for... is Jan's job.
column358: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: I don't understand. So, we're gonna tag team it?
column359: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: No, we're letting Jan go.
column360: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Listen up. Let's start... from the ground up. Where does paper come from?
column361: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: [at the same time as Dwight] Trees.
column362: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Trees! And where do trees grow?
column363: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kevin: [at the same time as Dwight] Forest.
column364: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Soil. Right. We have, in front of you here, seven different types of Pennsylvania top soil. Now, what would you say... is the most important element in the production of above ground leafy growth? Probably phosphorus, right? [Angela smiles, shakes her head "no"] Wrong! It's nitrogen! Absorb this information. Good! Now, let us discuss precipitation. Stanley! When rainfall occurs, does it usually fall in a liquid, solid, or gaseous... state?
column366: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Very good! You have earned one Schrute Buck.
column367: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Stanley: I don't want it.
column368: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Then you have been deducted 50 Schrute Bucks!
column370: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: We--- Don't you wanna earn Schrute Bucks?
column371: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Stanley: No. In fact, I'll give you a billion Stanley Nickels if you never talk to me again.
column372: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: What's the ratio of Stanley Nickels to Schrute Bucks?
column373: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Stanley: The same as the ratio of unicorns to leprechauns.
column377: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: Class is canceled, everybody out!
column378: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No wait, what are you doing?!
column380: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No, no, no, wait! Class is not canceled.
column382: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: HEY! COME ON! Let's listen to Dwight's presentation! [Dwight winks at Pam]
column383: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Oscar: What--- What are you winking for?
column385: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: So, that's... my basic 5 year plan. And after that, who knows?
column386: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Okay. Uh, now, this may seem like an odd question, but...
column388: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: ...what do you think about Michael Scott?
column389: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: He's a very nice man. And he's very well suited for the job he has now.
column390: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: This is off the record.
column391: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: He would be disaster.
column394: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: How was your interview?
column397: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Could have gone better I guess.
column398: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Oh. [they kiss] I'll put in a good word for you.
column399: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Cool. Maybe you should do it sooner rather than later.
column401: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Daaah, let's just run away together. Let's just run away to Jamaica and live in a bungalow. You have some savings right? You could pay off my debts. It would... be fine. We'd have fun.
column402: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: What's... what's the matter? What... what happened in there?
column403: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: I can't tell you.
column405: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: You son of a bitch!
column406: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Jan, this isn't the time, we're in an interview---
column407: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: You're firing me? Where the hell do you get off?
column408: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Frankly, it's overdue. Your behavior in the last two years has been completely erratic.
column410: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Recently, you don't even show an interest in your work! You smoke constantly in your office. You spend most of the day online shopping. You disappear for hours at a time, sometimes days. Always saying you're visiting your sister in Scottsdale. You go to Scranton far more often than you used to---
column411: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: [opens up her overcoat] Is it because of these?
column412: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Wuuuoooh, hey, whoa, Jan---
column413: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: No, I wanna know. I wanna know! Because if it is, then, then, then I will see you in court!
column417: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: 'Cause he likes them. [points to Michael] Okay? He likes them. And, and that is, that is all I care about.
column418: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: The time has come for you to end your professional relationship with this company. You are clearly unstable.
column421: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: No--- We're all unstable.
column422: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Okay, you know what? I'm just not leaving. I'm not leaving. Not leaving.
column423: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: David, I did not tell her.
column424: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: It's like staring into my soul, when I look at this wall.
column425: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: It's like outerspace without the stars, it's so black. [laughs]
column426: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Andy: This is gonna look so awesome!
column427: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: It's so intimidating! Anyone who comes in here... is gonna have to take me seriously. Abandon all hope, ye who enter here!
column429: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: [giving a hug] Bye Hunter.
column431: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Good luck with your band.
column433: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Don't let them change you, okay? [Jan drops several items, Michael and Hunter help pick them up, she starts to walk out the door] So long, [censored].
column434: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: So, I am gonna... give her a ride home. Let me know about the job.
column435: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Actually, Michael, I think we're gonna take it in another direction.
column436: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Good, I'm glad we're on the same page. I have a lot of ideas for new directions.
column437: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: No, we're not giving you the job.
column438: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: You know what? That... is actually good... because, um, I don't think I could take... my girlfriend's job. That's not being a good boyfriend. So, I respectfully withdraw my name from consideration. Do you accept my withdrawal?
column440: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Good. Very good. I'm glad we are finally on the same page. Still have my job in Scranton, though.
column442: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Good. That's all I ever wanted. These two. [points at Jim and Karen] Either one of them... excellent candidates.
column443: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Wow. That was some serious... hardcore... self destruction.
column444: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yeah. Kinda feel bad for her though.
column445: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Don't! She's nuts! [they laugh]
column446: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh, man. You know what? This might take a while. You really don't have to stay, if you don't want.
column447: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Okay, good! Because, um, a bunch of my friends are meeting downtown for lunch. And, I was gonna meet them, so...
column449: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Karen: Just call me when you're done.
column453: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Receptionist: [phone rings, picks up] Dunder Mifflin, this is Grace. Sure.
column454: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Oh, God! I mean, I just don't understand! It's just so rude, you know? I mean, the absolute nerve of that guy!
column455: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: I know. I know, I'm sorry about that. That was terrible.
column456: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Oh, just... No, actually I think it's good, you know? It's fine, actually, I do. I really think it's great that it happened. Because, you know, my work has always been the thing that has gotten in the way of my happiness, so... [laughs]
column457: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well, it's... [Jan starts crying, high pitched whining] No, don't cry, it's gonna be OK.
column458: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: [sobbing] Oh, I know, I know. It's just... I'm sorry. It's just these painkillers that I started taking since the surgery. Ohhh! They make my moods totally unpredictable! Wow! What am I gonna do?
column459: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: [whispers] I don't know. [normal volume] Well I guess... you could come and stay at my condo. I think I could back out of the sale. [Jan exhales] Probably get some negative feedback on my eBay profile.
column460: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jan: Live together. Actually, wait a minute! This could be great! This could be perfect! You know, my full-time job could be our relationship. I could wear stretch pants and wait for you to come home at 5:15. [laughs] It could work. This could work, really!
column461: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: [in the office, imitating the terminator] I'll be baaaaack! And I am baaaack!
column463: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: No. No, Pam. I'm baaaaaack! For gooood! Kevin Nealon.
column464: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: Everybody, may I have your attention please? It is with great honor and privilege that I announce to you that I have officially withdrawn my name for consideration from the corporate job. I know, I know, I know. "Michael, what are you thinking? You were a shoe in." Well, got down there. I nailed the interview. And the strangest thing happened. Why is my office black?
column465: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: To intimidate my subordinates.
column467: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: It was Andy's idea.
column468: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: You shouldn't have taken it. Bad management! Good thing I'm baaaaaack. [laughs] Ryan, coffee.
column469: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Ryan: I don't do that stuff anymore.
column470: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, it's for me, bimbo. Kids.
column471: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: So I'm back. And I am never, ever going to leave. I am going nowhere. This place... is like... the hospital where I was born, my house, my old age home, and my... graveyard... for my bones.
column472: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: Did... Karen get the job?
column473: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Michael: [to everyone] Back to work. [to Ryan] Still waitin' on that coffee.
column476: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I wanted to thank you... for helping me, when you held the title, Secret Assistant to the Regional Manager. You served the office with great dignity. [Pam salutes Dwight, Dwight returns the salute]
column477: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: No, I don't know what the future holds, but... I'm optimistic. And, uh, I had fun goofing around with Dwight today. Jim and I... are just... too similar. Maybe one day I'll find my own Karen. But--- you--- that is, a, um, you know, not--- A man. A man version. But, uh, until then... I can hold my head up. ... I'm not gay.
column478: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: I don't know how I feel about hiring a Sixers fan.
column479: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: I should leave. [pretends to get up] [they laugh]
column480: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Uh, let me ask you a question, Jim. You're clearly a very bright guy.
column482: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Always hit your numbers, personable, you make a great impression on everyone you meet---
column483: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: I'm sorry, wait, so is the question "How'd I get to be so awesome?" [laughs] Because, I don't have an answer for you. [laughs]
column484: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Uh, oh, hey, do you have your quarterly numbers?
column486: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: And that, uh, questionnaire. Sorry to make you fill that thing out...
column488: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: ...that's a HR formality. We have this very irritating HR guy here, he's probably the only person you're not gonna like. [Jim notices a small note inside his papers, it reads "Jim, Don't forget us when you're famous! Pam" It has a gold medal yogurt lid attached.] Kendall. Ugh. So, first up...
column489: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: [hands David his papers] There you go.
column490: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: How do you think you function here in New York?
column491: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: [not thinking clearly because of Pam's note] What's that? Oh, uh, great. You know? I just um, I really appreciate the buildings, and uh, the people, and um, there's just a [sic] energy... New York has, uh... Not to mention, they have places that are open past eight. [David laughs] So that's a... bonus.
column492: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: You've been in the Scranton branch a long time. [Jim stares at Pam's note] What have you liked most about that place?
column494: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: Okay. Well, we want the person who takes this position to be here for the long haul. So... long haul. Where do you see yourself in ten years?
column495: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: [flashback to Beach Games] How are your feet?
column496: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: Medium rare. Thanks. [they laugh]
column497: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: The real reason that I went to Stamford... was because... I wanted to be... not here.
column499: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: And even though... I came back, I just, I feel like I've never really... come back.
column500: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: Well, I wish you would.
column501: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: [phone rings, Pam answers] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Just one moment, I'll transfer you.
column502: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: I haven't heard anything, but I bet Jim got the job. I mean, why wouldn't he? He's totally qualified, and smart, everyone loves him... and, if he never comes back again... that's OK. We're friends. And I'm sure we'll stay friends. We just, we never got the timing right. You know? I shot him down, and then he did the same to me, and... But you know what? It's OK. I'm totally fine. Everything is gonna be totally--- [Jim walks in]
column503: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: Pam. [to camera] Sorry. [to Pam] Um, are you free for dinner tonight?
column505: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Jim: All right. Then... it's a date.
column506: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Pam: [to camera, tearing up, smiling] I'm sorry, what was the question?
column507: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);David: [on phone] So, I know we left the other day on a note of uncertainty. But, after some more thought, I'm very pleased to be able to offer you this job. [laughs] Great! I'm so glad. We're all very excited you're going to be joining us. It'll be nice to have another MBA around here.
column508: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Ryan: [on phone, smiling] I'm excited too. Okay. Bye.
column510: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Ryan: [still smiling] Nobody. You and I are done.
column511: 03x24/25 - The Job (Parts 1&2);Kelly: What?! [Ryan smiles and glances at the camera]

column1: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ok, well I did not get the job in New York, but I got the real prize, domestic bliss. Jan made me breakfast this morning... well she bought the milk. It's soy. [walks into bedroom, Jan sleeping on bed] This is why I do it, that's what I have to come home to. [sighs] She probably won't be up for a few hours.
column2: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: This is going to be a very good year. Very good. Jan is at home. Jim is back. My protege Ryan is at corporate. Good stuff. Um... Andy and Dwight are rockin' the sales team. I feel very blessed. [slams on breaks, camera turns, Meredith rolls off the hood]
column3: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);IT Tech Guy: You know generally it's not a good idea to click on offers that you haven't requested. What was the exact offer?
column4: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: It was for a video.
column5: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);IT Tech Guy: Yeah, what kind of video?
column6: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: A celebrity s*x tape.
column7: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Really, what kind of celebrity?
column8: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Not relevant.
column9: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: How much did you pay for it?
column10: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Not relevant.
column11: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: You paid for it?
column12: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: It all happened so fast.
column13: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: I broke up with Karen after the job interview, and uh... it was a little awkward when she came back from the city. She told me, very clearly, just because we were broken up didn't mean she was going anywhere, because she worked really hard for her career. But the next day her desk was empty, and as for me and my current romantic life, I uh... I'm single now and looking, so if you know anybody.
column14: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Jim and I went to dinner a few times when he got back from New York. I talked him through his break up. It's really nice to be good friends again.
column15: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Are you kidding me, Pam and Jim are totally hooking up. All they do is smile; they're just keeping it a secret. Right? [looks at Oscar]
column16: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Oscar: I don't know, there is no evidence of intimacy. They've been in remarkably good moods. It could be other things.
column17: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Are you kidding me?
column18: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: And Sunday I'm thinking of going to that flea-market at the drive-in.
column19: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh that sounds fun. I'm mountain biking on Sunday. On Montage Mountain.
column20: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Cool.
column21: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yeah.
column22: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Well have fun with that.
column23: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ladies and Gentlemen. I have some bad news. Meredith was hit by a car.
column24: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: What?
column25: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Where?
column26: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: It happened this morning in the parking lot. I took her to the hospital, and the doctors tried to save her life. They did the best that they could... And she is going to be OK.
column27: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Stanley: What is wrong with you? Why did you have to phrase it like that?
column28: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Oscar: So she's really going to be fine?
column29: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes. She has a slight pelvical fracture, but, ah... people have survived far worse.
column30: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Thank God you were there.
column31: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah.
column32: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Andy: Did you see who did it?
column33: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No need we can just check the security tapes.
column34: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Gah. Kind of a good news bad news there. I was able to be on the scene so quickly because I was in the car that hit her.
column35: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Who was driving?
column36: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Oh, Michael.
column37: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: One day Michael came in complaining about a speed bump on the highway. I wonder who he ran over then.
column38: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: It's only Meredith.
column39: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah, it's only Meredith, thank God. But did you see the way they looked at me? Like I was a murderer or something.
column40: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Hey... Why did you do it?
column41: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: It was an accident.
column42: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Was she talkin' back?
column43: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: No.
column44: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Did you get sick of that face? Did she owe you money? Uh-oh. Is this downsizing? Did she spurn your advances?
column45: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Hey guys, we're all gonna visit Meredith at lunch. And we're kicking in $5 for flowers.
column46: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Who's we, you and Jim?
column47: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: No, uh, me Stanley and Phyllis so far.
column48: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Oh, I bet Jim goes too.
column49: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yeah, I haven't asked him yet.
column50: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Oh, I bet you ask?
column51: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: I was planning on it.
column52: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: I bet you were.
column53: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Angela?
column54: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Oscar: [whispers to Kevin] Subtle.
column55: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: What
column56: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: [to Angela] Are you coming?
column57: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: I can't, Sprinkles is sick.
column58: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: She's been sick for some time. Thank you for asking, no one asks... about Sprinkles.
column59: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: I have to give her her meds, I have to pet her, and who will she eat lunch with?
column60: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Can't your other cats keep her company.
column61: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: There's bad blood, jealousies, cliques.
column62: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Angela, you're the chairman of the party planning committee. I shouldn't even be planning this, it's your job.
column63: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: [sighs] All right!
column64: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: My lord my liege.
column65: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Yes Michael?
