column66: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: So Ryan got promoted to corporate, where he is a little fish in a big pond. Whereas back here in Scranton I am still top dog, in a fairly large pond. So who is the real boss? The dog or a fish?
column67: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: So I need a little treat for the gang. Something to win their affections back.
column68: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Back? Why is that Michael?
column69: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well, I ran down Meredith in my car.
column70: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Oh! Did you do this on purpose?
column71: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, I was being negligent. But she's in the hospital, she's fine, recovering nicely. Tiny little crack in her pelvis. But she will be up in...
column72: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Did this happen on company property?
column73: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes. It was on company property, with company property, so... double jeopardy, we are fine.
column74: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Ryan: I don't think you understand how jeopardy works.
column75: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, right, I'm sorry. What is: we are fine?
column76: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Ryan: [sigh]
column77: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Ryan: People keep calling me a "Wunderkind"; I don't even know what that means. I mean, I know what it means, it means very successful for your age, so I guess it makes sense, but... it's a weird word.
column78: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Hey D.
column79: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Hey monkey, what's up?
column80: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Can you do me a little favor? Go to my place at lunch and give Sprinkles her medicine.
column81: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Sure.
column82: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: I have to visit the alchy.
column83: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Check to see if she's faking. If a car hit me, it wouldn't crack my pelvis. You know what; I bet she cracked it at home. Jumped in front of the car to get some workers comp.
column84: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: I wouldn't put it past her.
column85: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: So what do you need me to do?
column86: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: I wrote it out.
column87: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Mm-hmm.
column88: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: There's a diabetes shot, roll the insulin in your hand, don't shake it. She gets an ace inhibitor with her meal, but you have to put her right in front of the dish or she won't see it because of the cataracts. Mix one capsule of omega fatty acid in with her kidney medicine, um... and you want to give that to her 15 minutes after she's eaten. And, oh and there's a fungal cream because she has this infection under her tail, so you're gonna have to lift her tail and put the cream right at the base of her tail.
column89: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ok, I have an announcement.
column90: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Oscar: You pushed Darryl out the window?
column91: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: No.
column92: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: You shot Dwight?
column93: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: No! That is not funny, I love my employees, even thought I hit one of you with my car. For which I take full responsibility. Look I'm just trying to take everybody's mind off of this unavoidable tragedy, and onto more positive things. So I thought we should plant a tree.
column94: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh good, so we don't have to work.
column95: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: OK, we're leaving for the hospital at 1.
column96: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: So, like a freedom tree.
column97: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: I can take 3 people.
column98: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: I can also take 3 people.
column99: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Oscar: [to Kevin] Separate cars.
column100: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Pam.
column101: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Alright, I will get a card at the hospital and we'll sign it outside her room.
column102: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Pam.
column103: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Sales people can go later in the day. Hourly works can go at lunch.
column104: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ok, good good, so we'll just all go down there together at lunch.
column105: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: I...
column106: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Excellent!
column107: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: I was thinking that we...
column108: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Good work Pam.
column109: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: But...
column110: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yaaaaaay, Pam! Alright, since I am the boss I will drive as well. Who wants shotgun?
column111: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Stanley: You can't be serious. You ran a woman over this morning.
column112: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Everyone inside the car was fine, Stanley!
column113: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Guess what, I have flaws. What are they? Oh, I don't know. I sing in the shower. Sometimes I spend too much time volunteering. Occasionally I'll hit somebody with my car. So sue me... No, don't sue me. That is the opposite of the point that I'm trying to make.
column114: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Eww. I hate hospitals. In my mind they are associated with sickness. Oh... She looks like an angel.
column115: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kelly: She looks awful.
column116: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: No... OK, she always looks like that... That is not my fault.
column117: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: I think she's awake.
column118: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: No... She's in a coma.
column119: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Nurse: No.
column120: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK... Meredith, [hauntingly] Ooooohhhhh. I brought all your friends from the office dear.
column121: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: At the same time.
column122: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah.
column123: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Stanley: Hello Meredith.
column124: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: This is weird.
column125: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Brought you some balloons. Why don't we... here you go. [wraps them around her IV] Tie these up, cheer up your tubes... [IV pops out] Oh! Shhhh... For God's sake!
column126: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Whoa!
column127: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Nurse.
column128: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: No don't bother the nurse, just put it back in.
column129: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: [groaning] I am going to be sick... I'm gonna puke.
column130: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: I wouldn't... I wouldn't worry about it. Don't touch it.
column131: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Nurse: What, what are you doing? Just gimme that.
column132: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: Thanks.
column133: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: [applauds]
column134: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: Does it hurt terribly?
column135: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: No, it's not too bad. They have me on a lot of painkillers.
column136: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Creed: Oh really, what kind? Codeine, Vicodin, Percocet, Fentanyl, Oxycontin, Palladone? What...
column137: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: I have no idea.
column138: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Creed: Oh. [laughs]
column139: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: Well it was really great of all of you to come and visit me at the same time. I'll see you guys at the office.
column140: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, OK... Wait up, wait up, guys guys guys, hold on a second. You know what I was thinking might be sort of fun? Is if you forgave me in front of everybody.
column141: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: Michael, I'm not gonna do that.
column142: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Cause you know what they say in the Bible about forgiveness? Forgiveness is next to Godliness.
column143: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: No, that's not. That's next to cleanliness.
column144: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well, just shhhh... just just...
column145: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: You cracked my pelvis
column146: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Look, I just... I don't understand what is preventing you from laughing this off and giving me a big hug.
column147: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: You're not forgiven.
column148: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Come on. [starts to climb onto the bed with meredith.
column149: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Michael! Michael!
column150: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: [screams]
column151: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Do I need to be liked? Absolutely not. I like to be liked. I enjoy being liked. I have to be liked. But it's not like a compulsive need to be liked. Like my need to be praised.
column152: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Hey.
column153: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Hey monkey.
column154: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Any problems?
column155: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Well you left the TV on, and your cat is dead.
column156: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: What!?
column157: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Sparkles, the white one, is dead.
column158: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Sprinkles.
column159: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: That was the sick one, right?
column160: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Uh-huh. But I thought she had more time.
column161: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No.
column162: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Did she look... When you saw her how was she looking?
column163: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Really dead. Like a... just a dead cat.
column164: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: [sobbing]
column165: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: So... Hey come on, don't be sad, just... OK... just. She's in a better place.
column166: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Alright.
column167: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Actually the place that she's in is the freezer, because of the odor.
column168: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: [still sobbing]
column169: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: [to Angela] It's gonna be OK.
column170: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK, you know what? Everybody, let's just get over the whole Meredith thing. She cracked her pelvis, a tiny little crack. She going to be fine, so let's just...
column171: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Michael, Angela's cat died.
column172: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Sprinkles?
column173: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: [nods]
column174: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: [sighs] Oh, sh... I'm sorry Angela. Man what a day huh? How could it get any worse? Her computer crashes with the p0rn, and then Meredith with the accident, and then... Sprinkles! God, that's 3 things. I'll tell you what's going on. This office is cursed, and we need to do something about it.
column175: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well, I am taking responsibility. It is up to me to get rid of the curse that hit Meredith with my car. I'm not superstitious, but... I'm... I am a little-stitious.
column176: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Did anyone do anything involving an Indian burial ground?
column177: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Like what?
column178: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Like park on it. Or dig up a body... Toby? Anything you want to tell us?
column179: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Toby: No, I did not violate an Indian burial ground. In fact I had some good luck recently, Alfredo's Pizza, picked my business card out of the basket, so... uh, I got a week of free pies.
column180: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: That's cool.
column181: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Toby: Yeah.
column182: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Perfect. So our tragedy is your good luck. Satan.
column183: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Sprinkles never hurt a soul. God in your infinite wisdom how could you do this? She wasn't ready. She had so much left to accomplish.
column184: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: She's only a cat.
column185: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: You never... you don't like them.
column186: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Cats do not provide milk or wool or meat.
column187: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Dwight please!
column188: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Dwight, you haven't seen Meredith yet, have you?
column189: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No, I have not.
column190: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well, I think you should go to the hospital, and pay your respects.
column191: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I do not respect her, but I will go.
column192: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Alright, I would now like to talk about each of your individual religious beliefs.
column193: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Toby: Oh, Michael, you can't ask about religious beliefs...
column194: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Satan is a master of lies. Everything he says is the opposite.
column195: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Toby: Alright, well then you can ask about religious beliefs.
column196: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Thank you for the permission. Psych! Alright let's just go around the room, and tell me what you believe in.
column197: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Stanley: I'm... um, Catholic.
column198: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK.
column199: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Darryl: Presbyterian.
column200: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Alright.
column201: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Oh me too.
column202: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Darryl: Oh?
column203: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: [puts hand up for high five] Same religion.
column204: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Darryl: Alright! [high fives Pam]
column205: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: I'm a Lutheran and Bob's a Unitarian. It keeps things spicy.
column206: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: That's why we're cursed.
column207: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Creed: I've been involved in a number of cults, both as a leader and a follower. You have more fun as a follower, but you make more money as a leader.
column208: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Kelly, you are Hindu, so you believe in Buddha.
column209: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kelly: That's Buddhist.
column210: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Are you sure?
column211: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kelly: No.
column212: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: What are you?
column213: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);IT Tech Guy: Well if you're going to reduce my identity to my religion then I'm Sikh, but I also like Hip-hop and NPR, and I'm restoring a 1967 Corvette in my spare time.
column214: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK, 1 Sikh, and...
column215: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: As a farmer, I know that when an animal is sick, sometimes the right thing to do is to put it out of its misery. With the electricity we're using to keep Meredith alive we could power a small fan for 2 days. You tell me what's unethical.
column216: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Blink once if you want me to pull the plug.
column217: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: Don't pull any plugs.
column218: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Intern: How are you doing Ms. Palmer?
column219: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: Better.
column220: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Intern: Excellent.
column221: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Are you a doctor, or a male nurse?
column222: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Intern: Um... I'm an intern, which makes me a doctor, but...
column223: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Pfft... Her chart doesn't indicate that she had a hysterectomy but she did, or at least she got time off for one.
column224: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Intern: Ah, so uh... so that is where her uterus went... Um, Ms. Palmer, your last tetanus shot was when you were bitten by a bat a few months ago?
column225: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: Yes. Dwight here, trapped it in a bag against my head.
column226: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Just doing my job.
column227: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Intern: It also says you were recently bitten by a raccoon?
column228: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: And a rat. Separate occasions.
column229: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: You spend your whole life trying to get people to like you, and then you run over one person with your car. [sighs] And it's not even one of the popular ones, and everybody gets on your case. Doesn't make any sense... God is dead.
column230: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kelly: If there was a God then Ryan and I would be married by now.
column231: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Maybe believing in God was the mistake. What did people believe in before? The sun? Maybe there's some sort of animal, that we could make a sacrifice too. Like a giant buffalo, or some sort of monster, like something with the body of a walrus with the head of a sea lion. Or something with the body of an egret with the head of a meerkat. Or just... the head of a monkey, with the antlers of a reindeer, with, ah... the body of a porcupine.
column232: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: I will do some research.
column233: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: I can help you with that.
column234: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: So, just to be safe they are giving her the rabies vaccine.
column235: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh God, Rabies?
column236: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Mm-hmm.
column237: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: I was in the hospital room with her. How contagious is that, is that like an STD?
column238: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No, no. You've gotta be bitten by something.
column239: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: This place is so cursed.
column240: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Actually the doctor said it was lucky she came in to the hospital, cause the only way to beat rabies, is to start treatment before the symptoms set in... Lock jaw.
column241: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: [walks out into the office] I know a lot of you are upset with me for endangering Meredith's life by hitting her, with my car. But it may make you feel a little better to know that before that happened, Dwight endangered her life, by putting a garbage bag over her head that had a bat in it.
column242: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Six of one, really.
column243: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Turns out Meredith has been exposed to rabies. Which is like 10 times worse than a little crack in your pelvis. Thanks to me she went to the hospital and I saved her life. Curse is broken. Curse is broken people! [Kevin claps] Oh... there is a God, and he has a plan for us after all. So go home get some rest, very very good work today. We got a lot accomplished.
column244: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Is there a God? If not, what are all the churches for? And who is Jesus' dad?
column245: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);
column246: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);
column247: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);
column248: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: [Pam walks out of the office into the parking lot alone. Kevin pops up from the back seat of his car as if spying] Oh well, if they aren't together now, then they probably never will be. I thought they'd be good together, like PB&J. Pam Beasley and Jim. What a waste. What - A - Waste!
column249: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: [Pam's car pulls out of parking lot and then off to the side of the road] I told you I'm not dating anyone. And even if I was, I don't think it's anyone's business. I mean, when I do fall in love, like when it's for real, the last person I'm gonna talk about it too is a camera crew, or my co-workers. [Jim gets into the passenger side] Almost marrying Roy Anderson was as close to Pamela Anderson as I ever want to be. [Jim leans over and kisses Pam] Trust me, when I fall in love, you'll know.
column250: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Michael Scott's Dunder-Mifflin, Scranton, Meredith Palmer memorial, celebrity rabies awareness, fun run race for the cure, this is Pam.
column251: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Pro-Am.
column252: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Pro-Am race for the... They hung up.
column253: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: A woman shouldn't have to be hit by a car, to learn that she may have rabies. But that is where we are in America. And that does not sit right with me. And that is why I'm hosting a fun run race for the cure for rabies. To raise awareness of the fact that there is a cure for rabies. A disease that has largely been eradicated in the US. But not very many people know that.
column254: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Stanley: [on the phone] No, rabies... Babies would be a good idea. Can I put you down for a dime?
column255: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hi Stanley, how many sponsors so far?
column256: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Stanley: Zero.
column257: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Come on man, gotta step it up! It's for a good cause. Jan called this morning and pledged $500.00.
column258: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Andy: Isn't that your money?
column259: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: That... is for a good cause. Phyllis, how's the rabies quilt coming?
column260: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: Oh, it's coming.
column261: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, look at that, 3. Way to honor Meredith, Phyllis.
column262: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Michael?
column263: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes.
column264: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: You cannot make me run.
column265: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK. [walks away]
column266: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: It is not a real charity. It's stupid Michael, and I'm not gonna do it.
column267: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Alright, alright.
column268: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: You didn't run for me...
column269: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Shhh...
column270: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: ...when I thought I had skin cancer.
column271: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: I know that you're probably scared of people seeing your fat legs in shorts.
column272: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: No.
column273: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK, well back in olden times, a large fat person, like this, was a person of power. A person who had money, could buy food, person of respect. Like the regional manager of the day. Whereas, someone athletic and trim, like myself, was someone who worked in the fields... And I was a peasant.
column274: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kevin: I just don't want to run. I didn't bring my sneakers or my clothes.
column275: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well, you're going to have to run, or you're going to be in a lot of trouble. It is not olden times anymore.
column276: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Andy: [in bathroom] I'm petrified of nipple chafing. Once it starts it is a vicious circle. If you have sensitive nipples, they chafe, so they become more sensitive, so they chafe more. So... I take precautions. [tapes a cotton ball to each nipple]
column277: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Andy: Hey Angela. Hey, um... I'm sorry about your cat. [Angela starts to cry]
column278: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: This is Sprinkles. [holds up a picture] She was my best friend. I kept her going through countless ailments. I asked Dwight Schrute to feed her once, and she is now deceased. This is Halloween last year, [picture of Angela holding Sprinkles] just a couple of kittens [starts to cry] out on the town.
column279: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Pssst. I'm having relationship problems. And since you're always having relationship problems, I thought you'd be able to give me some advice.
column280: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: What's wrong?
column281: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: I have this crazy thought, that I know is crazy. That maybe Dwight killed my cat.
column282: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Hmm...
column283: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: When I got home, Sprinkles' body was in the freezer where Dwight said he left her, but all my bags of frozen french fries had been clawed to shreds.
column284: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Ah.
column285: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Something's not right. The vet's doing an autopsy.
column287: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Did Roy ever kill one of your cats?
column288: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: I'm more of a dog person.
column290: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: So what's your strategy for this race?
column291: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Well I'm gonna start fast.
column293: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Then I'm gonna run fast in the middle.
column295: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Then I'm gonna end fast.
column296: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Why won't more people do that? [laughs]
column297: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Cause they're just stupid.
column299: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: [Pam and Jim watch video of their kiss on the tv] Oh, ah... No that's not... I mean that wasn't, ah...
column300: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yeah... That was um...
column301: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: I mean I can see how it would seem a bit like we uh... How it looks like um... I mean now a days you can edit anything, right? I mean you can edit anything to look like um... anything.
column302: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yeah, I gave him a ride home because...
column305: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Wow! There it is.
column306: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Ah, yeah. We haven't told anybody, but it's going really great. [looks at Jim] Right?
column307: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: It is going really great.
column308: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [Angela runs into Dwight] Oww!
column310: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: You're taking this out on me, but I was only the messenger.
column312: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [sighs] You'll feel better after the 5k. Exercise is good for depression.
column313: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: [pushes her chair into Dwight's legs] I'm not depressed I'm in grief.
column314: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: We have raised, almost $700.00, most of it from me and Jan. Um... when do they put that on the giant check? Or is that something that we write in later?
column315: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Well a giant check costs about $200.00 to make up. I have a print shop standing by but... What do you think Michael, that's over 25% of our funds?
column316: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hmm... That's a tough decision. Um... I always imagined it with a giant check. So...
column317: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yeah, I mean I personally am definitely on board for the giant check.
column318: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Giant check it is.
column321: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Well I don't know, on the other hand it does leave less money for bat birth control.
column323: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Wait, this money is going to bat birth control, right Michael, that's what you told me when I contributed.
column324: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: You didn't contribute very much. I was also hoping to hand the giant check to a rabies doctor. And how's that been going?
column325: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Not well. A doctor won't come out to collect a check for $700.00, or $500.00 if we go with the giant check.
column327: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: And also there is no such thing as a rabies doctor.
column328: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: What about a rabies nurse?
column329: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: I don't think so.
column330: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: You know what though, I've actually seen ads for nurses that you can hire by the hour, for parties and bachelor events.
column331: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: That's possible. Look into that.
column332: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Great, it's gonna cost a couple a hundred buck and ah... oh actually more with tips.
column333: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Maybe we should just skip the ceremony and setup a college fund for Meredith's son.
column334: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Have you met that kid? He's not going to college.
column335: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Michael, 5k means 5 kilometers, not 5 thousand miles. [knocks]
column340: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: What are you doing?
column341: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: You said come in!
column342: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: No I didn't, just please don't...
column344: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: So I closed the door but the image of his...
column348: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: ... still burned in my eyes.
column350: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: [Michael knocks slowly on door] Come in.
column351: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: May I enter the room?
column352: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yes. Or come in.
column353: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: See how I did that. That's the way you should enter a room. You knock and then you wait for the all clear.
column354: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: You couldn't have taken off all your clothes in the men's room?
column355: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes, but I have an office, so why would I do that.
column356: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: On average, how many hours a day do you spend naked in your office? Just ballpark.
column357: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: European offices are naked all the time.
column359: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Besides my shirt tail covered most of it so...
column360: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: I didn't see where it started but I saw where it ended.
column362: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: That's not gross, it is the human body. What is your problem? Pam you're an artist, right? Think of me as one of your models. OK, you know what, I don't want this to detract from what we really need to be thinking about today, it's not fair to people with rabies. And that's the point, right? OK, let's go have some fun.
column364: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: They say if you're nervous around someone you should picture them naked. I do not recommend this strategy. Try picturing them with more clothes on... or a funny coat.
column365: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: [naked from chest up] Oh, I'm sorry, is this a working office, and not a French beach?
column367: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Creed: Creed Bratton, 75 plus division.
column368: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jan: You're over 75 years old?
column369: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Creed: 82 November first. How much is the prize money?
column370: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jan: There's no prize money.
column371: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Creed: What, is any of this real?
column372: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Check that out. [points to Toby] Look at me, I'm Toby, I'm stretching, I know what I'm doing. Why is he even here?
column373: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jan: So I heard that you were peeping on Michael.
column374: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: What? Look, no it was not...
column375: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jan: I don't know what your deal is, but he's mine, OK? So hands off.
column376: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK everybody, listen up. Thank you for coming. Before we get started I wanted to say a few words about this deadly disease called rabies. And I'd like you to take a look into the face of rabies. [turns around a picture of Meredith in the hospital] That should scare you. It scares me. You people need to educate yourselves. Myth: 3 Americans every year die from rabies. Fact: 4 Americans every year die from rabies. How many of you know someone who has been afflicted or affected by rabies? Show of hands. One, two, three... too many to count. It is truly the silent killer. No, it is the foaming barking killer. And it is something... Darryl what are you doing.
column377: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Darryl: [feeding a squirrel] I'm giving him a peanut.
column378: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, don't give him... just, did you hear anything I said?
column379: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Darryl: Look how happy he is.
column380: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: He's happy because he's insane. You know what, that's the perfect example of the kind of awareness we need to generate. Where's the nurse? [Elizabeth walks up in nurse's outfit] This is the reason we're here.
column382: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh hey, I know you... Elizabeth?
column384: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Right? Wow, very cool you went back and got your degree. I would like you to accept this check, for $340.00 made out to science. Make sure that, that gets into the right hands.
column388: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK, fettuccine alfredo, time to carbo-load.
column389: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Just remember folks, it's not about winning, it is about finishing.
column390: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: On your marks, get set...
column391: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: [pulls Toby's pants down] Beow!
column394: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Oscar: You're doing great Michael, look at you go!
column395: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Creed: That's my boss! Yeah-ha baby!
column396: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: I am fast! I'm very fast! I'm like Forrest Gump, except I am not an idiot. [Creed, Stanley, and Oscar get into a cab]
column397: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Stanley: Oh yes I will work out today. I will work out a way to avoid running for a stupid cause.
column398: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Andy: I've walked 2 marathons. Pretty sure I can handle a 5k. Key is drafting, eliminate wind resistance. [running right behind Kevin]
column399: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yeah. [laughs] Oh we're in last place.
column400: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh, would you look at that.
column402: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jan: Water? Water? [Toby gabs water, drinks, then throws back at Jan] Water babe?
column403: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, no water for me. Not while rabies causes fear of water... solidarity!
column405: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Rabies victims... have to live with an irrational hatred of water their entire lives. So... least I could do.
column406: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Andy: Oh God! My nipples, it's starting.
column407: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Creed: [Creed, Stanley, and Oscar sitting at a table] Can we get another round?
column410: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Stanley: So we've got what, another 20 minutes?
column413: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: That fettuccine is sitting in my stomach like a rock.
column414: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: You've got nothing to worry about, I put Imodium in Toby's coffee before the race.
column415: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: [laughs] Excellent! ...Simpsons. Wait, Imodium or Ex-lax?
column416: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Toby: I'm makin' great time. Usually I have to take a bathroom break half way through a race like this, but not today.
column417: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Ooo! An estate sale. Wanna go in?
column418: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: I don't know I'm really committed to winning.
column419: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: OK, but what if I told you all the money you spend here, goes to preventing a disease that's already been cured.
column421: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: That's what I thought.
column423: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Right. Let's do some good.
column424: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Ryan: [Ryan looks at the phone as it rings... [Pam's voice] [You have reached the offices of Dunder-Mifflin, Scranton, currently the entire staff is out doing the Michael Scott, DM FM PMC rabies awareness Pro-Am fun run race... [Michael's voice] for the cure... [Pam's voice] leave a message" Ryan hangs up]
column425: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: [Burp] Oh God, Oh, alfredo sauce. I'm getting a stitch. [groans]
column426: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Andy: [runs into the back of Kevin] Ah, God watch the nipples, Kevin.
column428: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: How ya feeling, better?
column430: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Well you look cute as a button. You've worked up quite a sweat.
column431: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: The vet is removing all of Sprinkles organs right now and sending them to the lab.
column432: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I am a farmer Angela.
column433: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: What does that mean?
column434: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: OK, when a farmer sees an animal that is in pain, that has no quality of life, that has no utility, a farmer does what city folk don't have the stomach to do.
column435: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: You did kill her!?
column436: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I... I sang her, her favorite songs.
column437: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: You put her in my freezer.
column438: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: It was beautiful and gentle and respectful. I fed her antihistamines and she gradually fell asleep.
column439: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Well then she barfed them up in the freezer and tried to get out.
column440: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Well I'm not responsible for that!
column442: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Hey, Oww! [looks around to onlookers] It's OK.
column444: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: It's nothing, I'm robbing her.
column447: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: How could you do that without telling me?
column448: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I thought I was helping you. I expected a hug. I took care of that cat, the best way I knew how.
column449: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Cat Heaven is a beautiful place, but you don't get there if you're euthanized.
column450: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I know a great taxidermist. I'll pay to have her stuffed. Well he's not great, but he's pretty good.
column452: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: [runs by] Take bat bites seriously. Don't get bit.
column453: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Or we can have her buried out at the east field, by mother. Huh, Angela?
column454: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Angela: Don't touch me Dwight! [runs off crying]
column455: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: [holding lamp] You like it? It's kinda designy and cool, it was $8.00.
column456: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh, and I get to carry it.
column457: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Toby: [crosses finish line] And the winner is Toby Flenderson.
column458: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Have a seat, I'll write it down.
column460: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Kelly: I dunno, like 5 kilometers from the office.
column461: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Toby: He couldn't have made it a circle?
column462: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: [bent over] I am not going to finish. I can't beat rabies. Nobody can beat rabies, rabies has been around for a thousand years. I was a fool to think that I could beat it. [Creed,Stanley, and Oscar pass by in the cab and get out at the finish line]
column464: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yeah probably. Hey, Michael?
column465: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: What are you doing here? Did you come back for us, or...
column466: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: I can't finish. I feel so weak, I just...
column467: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Well, you're probably dehydrated.
column468: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: What do you want me to do Jim?
column469: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Glass of water would be a start.
column470: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, There are people all over the world, who have all sorts of problems and afflictions, and diseases. They're deformed, and they're abnormal, and... they're illiterate and ugly. Symphonies don't have any money. Public TV is bust. I can't do anything about it, I can't... you know. There's just one of me, and there's a thousand of them. And rabies wins.
column471: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Jim: Wow! You are a downer. We were having a pretty nice day.
column472: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: I'm still having a nice day.
column474: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yeah. Hey Michael, look at this lamp. $8.00.
column475: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: That's a good deal.
column476: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: And Michael, you don't have rabies. And chances are you're not going to get it anytime soon. So... you don't really have to think about it too much.
column477: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Pam, if everybody felt that way, nothing would get done.
column478: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yeah, but there's other, better people out there who are helping.
column479: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: You just don't think I am capable, of making a difference.
column480: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Pam: I know you Michael, I saw you naked.
column481: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: You don't, you don't know me. You've just seen my pen1s. I can make a difference, remember, I'm the one who started this whole thing off by hitting Meredith with my car. And I owe it to her to finish this... GD 5k [gets up groaning, Jim tries to help] No, no!
column482: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Finishing that 5k, was the hardest thing I have ever had to do. I ate more fettuccine alfredo and drank less water, than I have in my entire life. People always talk about triumphs of the human spirit, well today I had a triumph of the human body. That's why everybody was applauding for me at the end. My guts and my heart, and while I eventually puked my guts out, I never puked my heart out. And I'm very, very proud of that.
column484: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey Mer. How ya doing?
column486: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: It's ironic isn't it? I mean I'm in the hospital for not getting enough water, and you're in it for a disease that causes the fear of water.
column487: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Meredith: I'm in because you hit me with your car. But I wanted to say, I heard you were trying really hard, so I'm not mad at you anymore.
column488: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: Thanks, I'm not mad at you anymore. [sighs, takes sucker out of his mouth] Wanna share?
column490: 04x01/02 - Fun Run (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'm not really sick. [Meredith takes a lick and hands back to Michael] Nah, I'm good.

column1: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Hey.
column2: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Hey.
column3: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: I gotcha one. [Pam hands over a grape soda to Jim]
column4: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh wow, thank you.
column5: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yeah.
column6: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: I'm just gonna grab some chips, you want some?
column7: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: No. Thanks... uh we're still having lunch today, right?
column8: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: I guess. [Pam smiles and walks away, then comes back and kisses Jim on the cheek] How dare you.
column9: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey Toby. What's this? [holds up memo Toby has passed out to the staff]
column10: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: Ohh.
column11: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: [reads memo] I just want to remind everyone about the company rules involving PDA or public displays of affection.
column12: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: Yes, uh some people in the office have complained...
column13: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh really.
column14: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: ...about some other people engaging in PDA and, you know [Michael leans in closer to Toby] I just wanted to remind it's not appropriate to, to do that.
column15: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Is this about me and Jan? In my office? Because I will have you know that that was consensual. What we did has nothing to do with you or anyone here. I don't think. I don't think anyone heard anything. We were very discreet and, and most people had left by that point. So I don't think it's any of your business. What I think you should do is roll up the memo, real tight...
column16: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: Ok, look the memo is not about you...
column17: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: [to everyone in the room] For the record, I have never been involved with anyone at work, in any capacity.
column18: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: Alright everyone, look, it, alright my complaint was about Jim and Pam. So...
column19: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: [turns to address Jim and Pam] No way.
column20: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: What?
column21: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: You guys are together?
column22: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Ummm... yup. Yes, we are.
column23: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Woooah! Wow!
column24: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Andy: Tuna!
column25: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Awesome!
column26: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kevin: I knew it!
column27: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: You guys! Yes! Yes!
column28: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Toby, was this your fun little way of congratulating us?
column29: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: Yes.
column30: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh kay, mind is exploding. Get over here. [gestures to Pam to get up] Come on. Come here. Okay, okay, [to Jim] stand up. [Jim moves over in chair] OK, here we go. [holding both Pam and Jim's hand] Everyone, this is a day that will live in infamy. Because today, is the day that Jim and Pam become one.
column31: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Actually, we've been dating for a couple months.
column32: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: I love you guys, so much. [hugs Jim]
column33: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Ohh.. [Michael goes to hug Pam, phone rings]
column34: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Phone's ringing. [goes back toward desk]
column35: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, no, no Pam let 'em ring. Let the bells of Dunder Mifflin chime out your love. Because this is [starts to well up] really good, this is really good. My heart soars with the eagles nest.
column36: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I don't see it. I think they both could do better.
column37: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: It's not a surprise to me. Pam is the office mattress.
column38: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Andy: Jim Halpert's off the market. Guess who just became the best looking single guy in the office?
column39: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey. Can you make that straighter? That's what she said.
column40: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: Did you plan it?
column41: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: No. [tries to hide piece of paper, but Pam grabs it]
column42: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: [reading from paper] Can you make that straighter? That job looks hard. You should put your mouth on that. How can you even use that one naturally?
column43: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Blowing up balloons I thought.
column44: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: You might want to trim it a little.
column45: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: Michael... [Kelly enters conference room in a flirty red dress]
column46: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: [reading sign] Oh, is... Ryan coming back today?
column47: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yeah, he is.
column48: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Oh.
column49: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Pam and Jim are together. Ryan is visiting. Only thing that could make this day better is ice cream.
column50: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: What do you want?
column51: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: To give you this [reveals a cat from under a coat].
column52: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: Oh, what is that?
column53: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: It's a feral barn cat. I trapped him last night and I'm giving him to you as a replacement cat for the one I destroyed.
column54: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: Her name was Sprinkles.
column55: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: And his name is... Garbage. Mose calls him Garbage because he likes to eat garbage. [shakes cat] Don't you Garbage? [makes chomping noises]
column56: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: I can't believe you just thought you could replace Sprinkles. Before she's even in the ground.
column57: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: You haven't buried her yet?
column58: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: Don't rush me. I'm grieving.
column59: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Garbage can be very helpful. OK, he's a youthful cat. He killed an entire family of raccoons. [holds cat towards Angela] Look at him.
column60: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: I don't want Garbage! I want Sprinkles! [walks away]
column61: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Hey Toby.
column62: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: Hey... [sees both Jim and Pam] you two.
column63: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Hey. So now that we are dating, uh, we just wanted to know if we had to sign one of those 'we're dating' things for the company.
column64: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: Oh well, you know, those were only for, you know [makes quotes with fingers] relationships, so... if, if this is just a casual thing, there's no need, really.
column65: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh.
column66: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Well, I don't wanna speak for Jim, but, it's like pretty official. [Jim smiles]
column67: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: Uh huh.
column68: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Sorry, uh do we need to sign one, or...?
column69: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: Let's just wait and see what happens. [whispers] You know?
column70: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: What?
column71: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: Let's just wait.
column72: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh, OK.
column73: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: OK.
column74: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Great. [Jim and Pam walk away]
column75: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: [sees Ryan coming through door] Hey Ryan. Welcome back --
column76: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Hold on one second. [Ryan types on Blackberry for a few seconds] Hey Pam! It's great to see you. Is Michael in?
column77: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey!
column78: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yeah.
column79: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: There he is! There he is! He's back! And he's with a beard. [laughing] He... He has facial hair. Look at him! All grown up and no place to go. Hello, Mr. Sunny Crockett. I'm Tubs.
column80: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: OK. Should we get started?
column81: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ohh, yeah, let's get started because uh, yes, cause uh this is very serious business and umm..
column82: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Yep, exactly. This is a business meeting.
column83: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: ...business meeting --
column84: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kevin: [rubbing hands in Ryan's hair] Fire!
column85: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Stop that! Stop that!
column86: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: That's right! That's right!
column87: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: [to Kevin] You scared me.
column88: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Fire guy. Don't start any fires, Ryan.
column89: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Andy: Fire guy [makes flames with his hands]
column90: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kevin: You weren't here for that.
column91: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Andy: Here for what?
column92: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kevin: When he started the fire.
column93: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Look how big he is. Look at you, you are so mature and old and little man now. You're like our little man...
column94: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Little old man boy.
column95: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Michael and everybody, umm...
column96: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Beard.
column97: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Bearded man boy.
column98: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: ...let me just say something. I know I used to be a temp here, but now everything is different. I'd like your respect. I am your boss now. You're gonna have to treat me that same way you treated Jan.
column99: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, wow!
column100: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: So...
column101: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: That's a little kinky. I don't swing that way.
column102: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: OK...
column103: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Woooo![laughs] I think Ryan has a gay crush on me.
column104: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Enough! OK? This is inappropriate and it stops right now. Do you understand?
column105: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes, everybody, come on. Settle town. Let's get serious here. Um Ryan, has a very special, important presentation to do, which we will be doing in the conference room in [looks at Ryan] 10 minutes?
column106: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Perfect.
column107: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Sounds good. OK, alright.
column108: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah, Ryan snapped at me, but there was this twinkle in his eye that I picked up on, which said, "Dude, we're friends. I'm doing this for appearances. I am the big boss now. And I have to seem like an ogre. But you know me and you trust me. And we like each other. And we'll always be friends. And I would never take you for granted in a million years. And I miss you, man. And I love you." His words.
column109: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Dunder Mifflin Infinity represents a floor to ceiling streamlining of our business model. The center piece of the campaign is a new business-to-business website interface that will allow us to compete directly with big box chains.
column110: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Wait a second. Last time I checked, Dunder Mifflin already has a website. And quite frankly, I'm not really sure what's wrong with it. [Jim at his desk, showing the Dunder Mifflin website reading "Under Construction. Coming Christmas 2002!"]
column111: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: This is a massive overhaul. We're getting younger. Sleeker. And more agile so that we adapt to the market place. All essential personnel will be issued Blackberries for company use.
column112: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: OOhh. Gimmme, gimme, gimme, gimme, gimme, gimme.
column113: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: I'll stick around to help you set them up afterwards. Any questions? Dwight?
column114: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: What if we don't want to use a Blackberry because they are stupid and pointless?
column115: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: This is company-wide, Dwight.
column116: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Got it. [Andy's hand goes up]
column117: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Andy.
column118: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Andy: We should call it Dunder Mifflinfinity. You know, push the words together?
column119: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Any other questions? [Kelly's hand goes up] Kelly Kapoor.
column120: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Can we speak privately about our relationship?
column121: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Thank you everybody.
column122: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ryan Howard everybody. [starts clapping] Good job. [everyone gets up to leave]
column123: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Creed: That's some fun stuff. When does the website go up?
column124: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: As fast as possible. We want to start retraining people A.S.A.P., so we can hit the ground running with a new system.
column125: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Creed: Cool beans.
column126: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Creed: We're screwed.
column127: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Who is?
column128: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Creed: Us? You and me. The old timers.
column129: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: I am not old. You are old. You are like a hundred.
column130: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Creed: You're over 40, that's the cut off. Are you listening to what he's saying? Re-training. New system. Youth. I'm telling you this kid is the grim reaper. You deal with this or you, me, Sammy, Phyllis, the chick you hit with the car, we're goners.
column131: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Swore I wouldn't tell anyone this, but in the interest of revealing secrets. Oh my God, this will make your brain explode. Umm, Dwight and Angela dating. Have been for six months.
column132: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: No.. [in awe]
column133: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Swear to God. [Pam shakes her head]. Aww this is great. I was actually gonna wait and tell you on your birthday, but this is much more fun.
column134: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: No, they have been dating for like two years. [Jim in shock] Since before your barbeque.
column135: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Wait. What? [Pam nods her head] You knew? And you didn't say anything?
column136: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: You didn't say anything to me?
column137: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Fair enough. Wow! We should have started dating like a long time ago.
column138: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Can you believe that...
column139: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: Sorry, I didn't know you guys were in here.
column140: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh no, we're just sitting here.
column141: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: I couldn't see your hands. [Jim shakes his hands] Hey Pam, by the way, it's great that you're dating. But when a new client calls, you just have to randomly assign them to a sales person. You can't base who gets new clients on who you're sleeping with that week, OK?
column142: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: OK.
column143: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: OK.
column144: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: OK.
column145: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: And... that is why we waited so long to tell people.
column146: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: OK, what's up?
column147: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah, kay. I was just... After the presentation, just wanted to make sure, that vis-a-vie, that everything in the office is business as usual?
column148: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Well it is business, but not as usual.
column149: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah, I know I understand... we're making great strides and we're updating, but business as usual, no?
column150: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: No. [shaking head] We're throwing out the entire playbook, we're starting from scratch, we're implementing a brand new system.
column151: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Good, so, we're on the same page?
column152: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: No. We're not. Michael, I know exactly how much time and man power are wasted in this branch. This company is getting younger, faster, more efficient. You need to prepare yourself.
column153: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: We had a foreign exchange student live with us when I was young. And we called him my brother. And that's who I thought he was. Um, then he went home to what is now formerly Yugoslavia, taking all of my blue jeans with him. And I had to spend the entire winter in shorts. That is what Ryan is like. A fake brother who steals your jeans.
column154: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: So, how are you?
column155: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Awesome. I am dating a lot of guys.
column156: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Good.
column157: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: A lot. Black guys mostly.
column158: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Kelly...
column159: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: What?!
column160: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: Wait, uh, how do you touch just one of these buttons at a time?
column161: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Stanley: I don't know.
column162: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: Did you even try?
column163: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Stanley: If the kid wants to set mine up, I'll let him.
column164: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: I can't see half of the things. [adjusts glasses]
column165: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Stanley: It's too little. Use the phone.
column166: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: I want you to tell me that you care about me. That is what I want.
column167: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Kelly, I'm your boss now, OK? You can't keep talking to me like I'm your boyfriend.
column168: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Oh big strong man, fancy new whatever. I don't think you ever cared about me.
column169: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: I never cared about you? Six months ago Karen Filipelli sent me an email. Asked me out. I said no, because I was committed to our relationship.
column170: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Well, I hope you're still committed because I'm pregnant.
column171: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: [shaking head]
column172: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: And guess what buddy, [points at Ryan] I am keeping it.
column173: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: OK. OK.
column174: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Do you feel prepared to help me raise a baby?
column175: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: I can... I can't talk about this right now, OK? After work, we'll go out to dinner, we'll talk about it then, OK?
column176: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: We have a date!
column177: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Hello.
column178: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: Hello, Dwight. I've been thinking about things and I wanted to know if you would have dinner with me tonight?
column179: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Really?
column180: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: Yes.
column181: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I'll make a reservation. No, no. Let me cook for you. Cauliflower and noodles. Baked potato on the side.
column182: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: I would prefer a public place. See you after work.
column183: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: Hi, Pam.
column184: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Hi.
column185: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: Is Michael in?
column186: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: In his office. You can go right in.
column187: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: [to Ryan] Hey.
column188: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Jan.
column189: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: Ryan. Ryan. Ryan, Ryan.
column190: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: So elephant in the room, I have your old job.
column191: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: Well, not exactly my job... I had a different title.
column192: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Oh well, excuse me, same office, same responsibilities.
column193: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: Different salary. [laughs] You'll get there, don't worry.
column194: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Well... you look great.
column195: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: Thank you, thank you.
column196: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Scranton suits you.
column197: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: Best decision I ever made.
column198: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: You were let go.
column199: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: You know what? I love the beard. Keep it forever. [goes into Michael's office]
column200: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey.
column201: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: Hey.
column202: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: [holds up Blackberry] Hey, what is the actual deal with these things in terms of testicles?
column203: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: What?
column204: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: I don't want to grow weird sperm in case we ever want to have kids.
column205: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: So, what's Ryan doing here?
column206: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, I dunno, they're launching a big new business plan. New website, blah blah blah. He's being a real twerp about it, so, it's all about youth, and agility and streamlining and trying to squeeze out the older people.
column207: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: He's such a snake.
column208: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well...
column209: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: I hope he's gets hit with an ageism suit.
column210: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: What is that... word?
column211: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: Ageism? Companies they can't discriminate against people due to old age. Like a couple years ago we tried to force out some of the older branch managers with a mandatory retirement age and then Ed Truck, your old boss, threatened us with a lawsuit, so we had to back off.
column212: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: So older people have just as many rights as younger people?
column213: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jan: Yes, Michael, they do.
column214: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Creed?
column215: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Creed: Yes, sir.
column216: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Everything OK? [Creed has made his hair jet black]
column217: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Creed: Everything's cool, dude.
column218: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Creed: I'm thirty. Well, in November I'll be thirty.
column219: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Is there another meeting scheduled, I was gonna do the Blackberry tutorial in here.
column220: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Michael told us to wait in here. We don't know why.
column221: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: [notices pictures on the wall] Ohh... man.
column222: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Good, we're all here, we can get started.
column223: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Michael.
column224: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Have a seat.
column225: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: We're not doing this today.
column226: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Have a seat. Like everybody else.
column227: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: OK. This is...
column228: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Still my office, Ryan. [Ryan sits down] Well, there has been a lot of talk about new ideas today. Well, new ideas are fine, but they are also... illegal, because they are a form of ageism. What? Yes, I am right. Did you know that the Age Discrimination and Employment Act of 1967 prohibits employment discrimination based on age with respect to employees 40 years of age or older? I did.
column229: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: Technically, he's right.
column230: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey, shut up Toby. Look, why do we as a society hate old people so much?
column231: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Creed: Because they're lame.
column232: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, Creed, no they are not. In fact, many cultures revere old people because of their storytelling ability. Like the old lady from Titanic. [points to her picture on the wall] Or the funny things that they can do, like "where's the Beef?" [points to another picture on wall] [Jim raises his hand] Yeah.
column233: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Why do you have the Big picture up again? You used that already, when you burned your foot.
column234: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Reusing the Ben Kingsley, too.
column235: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: I was going to put up some new pictures, but umm, all of the ink in the printer was gone.
column236: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Oh. [man enters conference room]
column237: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Robert Dunder: Michael Scott?
column238: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: [puts hand up] That is me. Come on in. [They shake hands] Who is this old fart? Did you just stagger off the street? Out of a box or something? Who's this worthless bag of bones? Well, this guy is none other than one of the founders of Dunder Mifflin, Mr. Robert Dunder. Huh? [starts clapping, others join in]
column239: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Oh, yeah. Yes!
column240: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Robert Dunder: Thank you everyone.
column241: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Michael, [gets up] can I talk to you a second?
column242: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Sure thing. [both go out of conference room] 'Scuse me. [closes door]
column243: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: We have actual work to do.
column244: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Fine. Then I will call David Wallace and you can explain to him why you threw the founder of the company out on his ancient butt. [they glare at each other]
column245: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Bob, how old are you?
column246: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Robert Dunder: I'm 87.
column247: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Eighty-seven years young. And still active. That is great. Did you know, that Bob is still a member of the Board of Dunder Mifflin?
column248: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Robert Dunder: Well, I, I, I haven't been to a board meeting in years. I, I send a proxy.
column249: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ah, still sends his own proxy. Good for you.
column250: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I'm gonna live for a very long time. My grandma Schrute lived to be 101. My grandpa Manheim is 103, and still puttering around in Argentina. I tried to go visit him once, but my travel visa was protested by the Shoah Foundation.
column251: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Robert Dunder: I started this company in 1949.
column252: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Wow.
column253: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Robert Dunder: Back then, it was an uh, an industrial supplier of metal brackets mostly for, for construction.
column254: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, boy.
column255: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Robert Dunder: And then Mifflin, of course he killed himself later... Uh, but I knew Mifflin through the Rotary Club.
column256: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Great.
column257: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Robert Dunder: And he was, he was [starts laughing] at dinner with Beverly and her husband, wha-what was his name, umm... uhh... Jerry.. Jerry Trupiano from, from South Jersey and he was tall. Both he and Mifflin were tall guys.
column258: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Great.
column259: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Robert Dunder: And...
column260: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: That's great. Thank you for coming in. [starts ushering him out] Robert Dunder everybody. [clapping] Thank you. That was wonderful. Do you have a ride?
column261: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Robert Dunder: Well I, I, I came here in a cab.
column262: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Perfect. [starts closing the door]
column263: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Robert Dunder: Well, cou, could you get me another... [Michael closes door]
column264: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Inspirational. What have we learned? Well, we have learned that you can't teach an old dog new tricks, because it's illegal, and you will go to jail. [Pam raises hand]
column265: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: I think that I should help him get home.
column266: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, No. Don't help him. He doesn't need help, Pam. [Jim nods head and Pam gets up and leaves to help Robert Dunder, Michael shows Robert thumbs up] What a nice guy.
column267: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);
column268: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);
column269: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);
column270: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Good night guys. [staff leaves the office]
column271: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Well, today was a fantastic waste of time.
column272: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: I disagree, I think it was very valuable.
column273: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Michael, technology helps business OK? You should not resist it, this is the way the world is moving.
column274: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: I happen to think the old ways of doing business are better. And I can prove it.
column275: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Ok. I look forward to hearing your ideas. [Michael retreats back to office] [to Kelly] Where do you wanna go?
column276: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: You know, some place romantic and expensive.
column277: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Kelly, come on.
column278: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: You know what, you're right. I'm feeling kind of nauseous anyway. So, you know skip it. [Ryan hesitates and takes her hand and they exit]
column279: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Are you enjoying your vegetarian noodles?
column280: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: Very much. How's your meat?
column281: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Dry. Delicious.
column282: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: I heard a joke today.
column283: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Oh, that's funny.
column284: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: Yes, it was.
column285: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Are you enjoying your mineral water?
column286: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: I can't do this. I can't be with you. Every time I look in your eyes I see Sprinkles' stiff lifeless body.
