column287: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Then don't look in my eyes. Look right here [points to middle of forehead above the eyes], it's an old sales trick.
column288: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: I'm sorry. I gave this everything I could.
column289: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No, please don't do this, monkey.
column290: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: I will leave your toothbrush on top of your tire tomorrow morning. [gets up and leaves restaurant]
column292: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: Hey guys. This is my, uh, girlfriend, Amy.
column294: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Hey, Amy. How ya doing?
column295: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Nice to meet you.
column296: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: [under his breath] Nice to meet you.
column297: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: [gesturing to the rest of the office] This is everybody else... okay... This is the place... so thanks for the lift.
column298: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Amy: Yeah, sure. I'll, uh, I'll see you tonight, right?
column299: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: Absolutely. [Toby kisses Amy for an extended period of time, Pam and Jim are shocked]
column300: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Amy: Whoa. Easy tiger.
column301: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: I just really like you.
column302: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Amy: Okay. Bye guys. Nice to meet you.
column303: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: Have a great day!
column304: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Whoa, Toby. Watch out. You're going to violate your own PDA memo.
column305: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Toby: I wouldn't want to do that now would I?
column306: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Smell that. Do you smell that?
column308: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, Dwight. That smells like good business to me. What I have done here is I have collected all the finest gourmet items that Scranton has to offer.
column309: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Andy: Mmhmm, sweet, chocolate turtles.
column310: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes, no! No, those are for our clients. Actually, our exclients. I'll explain, later.
column311: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ryan wants everything in our company to be about emails and IM's, but I think he's forgetting about the original instant message. Letters attatched to baskets of food.
column312: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Excuse me, Angela. Michael asked me to turn in these reciepts for these gift basket items.
column315: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: Is that all?
column316: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Yes... [whispers] I miss you.
column318: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Angela: Dwight, you have to listen to me! We are not seeing each other anymore! Can you accept that?
column319: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Fine. [sighs] Then I just want to be friends.
column321: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Plus a little extra. Also, I love you.
column323: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kelly: I don't understand what the big deal is.
column326: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: You lied about being pregnant.
column328: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: You really don't understand why that might make me kind of angry?
column330: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: We're never getting back together.
column334: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Alright I just have to ask now that we're public, um, is the magic gone?
column335: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: It's funny you bring that up because yes it is.
column336: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: I knew it. Oh man, just like that huh?
column337: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: I think... I mean, I don't know what it is but...
column339: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: I now find you repulsive.
column340: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: That's honest. [sighs] Alright, fair enough. It was really fun while it lasted though, wasn't it?
column342: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: For me, it was.
column345: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey boss, I didn't know you were coming in today.
column346: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: What's, uh, going on here?
column347: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: I am glad that you asked, listen up everybody. In the last year, we have lost seven clients to the big chains. These gift baskets are our ticket back into their lives. We are going to show up at these businesses unannounced, and we are going to win them back.
column348: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: With gift baskets.
column349: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: With peanut brittle, with macadamia nut cookies, with chocolate turtles, with raspberry jam and a little bit of fat and salt because you know what? That's what people like.
column350: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ever since I was a kid people have been telling me I can't do things. "You can't be on the team", "You can't move on to second grade". Well, now they're telling me that I can't win back clients using old fashioned business methods. [shakes head] We'll see about that. And FYI, I eventually aced second grade, and I was the biggest kid in class.
column351: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK. We're gonna split up into teams. Jim, Phyllis. Stanley, Dwight. Me Andy.
column352: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Stanley: I'm not driving with him. [points at Dwight]
column353: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Andy: I'll go with you Stanley.
column355: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Why don't we just go by ourselves?
column356: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Why don't we just go as teams to demonstrate our teamsmanship?
column359: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: This is stupid.
column360: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK, that's not helpful Phyllis.
column361: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: How is giving people gift baskets going to get our clients back?
column362: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Gift baskets are amazing, Phyllis. Gift baskets are... the essence of class and fanciness. They are the ultimate present that a person can recieve.
column363: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Andy: What about cash? With cash you can buy anything you want, including a gift basket, so... it's kind of the best gift ever.
column364: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: What about a gift basket full of cash?
column365: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Andy: Yes! Cash basket! Nice work Tuna.
column366: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Fine, I'm just going to go by myself, and I am going to win them back by myself because this is important to me. [walks toward the door]
column367: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Michael, wait. Let me go.
column368: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, this is my quest.
column369: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Please, let me go. I need to win those clients back. [camera moves around and zooms in at Angela's face] Please.
column370: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Fine. Then God speed. To both of us.
column371: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Good luck Michael.
column372: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: We don't need luck.
column374: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: But thank you, that was really nice of you to say.
column376: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Business to business. The old fasioned way. No Blackberrys, no websites. I would like to see a website deliver baskets of food to people.
column377: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: [speaking on the phone] Yes, I understand that David. I just felt that if we were to downsize Kelly and then outsource customer service to India which a lot of companies... Yeah, no, yes Kelly is Indian... I understand that's confusing.
column378: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Creed: [looks at vending machine] Hey brah, I've been meaning to ask you, can we get some Red Bull for these things? Sometimes a guy's gotta ride the bull, am I right? Later skater.
column379: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [in Michael's car] Sweet ride, American made. What happened to the Sebring?
column380: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: It is in the body shop. Had to have the dent taken out of the hood where I hit Meredith.
column381: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Ah, that's a pain in the ass.
column382: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: I know. So who's next?
column383: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Larry Myers. Left us six months ago for Office Depot.
column384: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);GPS: Proceed to the highlighted route, then route guidence will begin.
column385: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Why do you use that thing? Let's them know where you are at all times.
column387: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: The government, spy satellites, private detectives... exgirlfriends. [sobs and then starts to cry]
column388: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Next night, I'm out, at a bar, 2 AM, I figure I'll get a sandwich because you can get a sandwich any time of the night. [claps hands] I run into Vince Vaughn.
column391: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Andy: Dude, you are so money, but you don't even know it, but you do.
column393: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Yeah, later dude.
column395: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Oh, Jim! How awesome is Ryan now?
column396: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yeah, he's definitely something.
column397: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kevin: What does that mean?
column398: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: That whole lifestyle, his whole vibe, you find that appealing?
column399: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Andy: Ha! Tuna... [inhales deeply] Tuna Tuna Tuna.
column400: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Tuna Tuna Tuna.
column401: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Andy: He has a killer job, he's rich, he smells like what I think Pierce Brosnan probably smells like, he wears really cool rich guy clothes.
column402: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kevin: And he can get any girl that he wants.
column403: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Andy: So, sorry Tuna but if you don't know why that's awesome... then... you need awesome lessons.
column404: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Tuna. Check you later.
column405: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: [places the gift basket on top of the table] Wow, those things are heavy! There's a lot of stuff in there. We have macadamia nut cookies, um, the honey mustard pretzels. Have you ever tried focaccia crisps?
column406: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Larry Myers: You know we closed our account with you right?
column407: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes we do.
column408: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Larry Myers: We're with Office Depot now.
column409: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Yes, yes we know but we just have not gotten over you.
column411: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: And we are dedicated to providing you with the very best customer service, the very best personal business relationship we can if you ever decide to come back to us.
column413: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Larry Myers: OK. I don't think we're coming back.
column414: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Please, come back.
column415: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK, you know what? Just enjoy the gift basket and remember that we provide a personal touch.
column416: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Remember what we had Larry?
column417: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Larry Myers: I mean, really it's about money.
column418: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well just, uh enjoy the gift basket.
column419: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Larry Myers: OK thanks.
column421: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Larry Myers: I mean their website is really easy to use too. That's a big deal for us.
column422: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: [driving] That guy was so... how can they not know how much better we are?
column423: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I don't know. Sometimes people are just impossible and they make you miserable.
column424: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: That is true.
column425: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Like Angela in accounting.
column426: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes, she is nuts.
column427: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Ugh... no, she's wonderful... at accounting. But she drives me crazy.
column428: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);GPS: Make the next right turn.
column429: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: How do they know? How does this know where to turn? That's very impressive.
column430: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Hey Pam. I haven't settled on our final design logo yet for Dunder Mifflin Infinity and I know you're into graphic design. Do you want to give it a shot? Maybe try and deisgn the logo?
column432: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Cool, that would be great. Um, can you do a couple mock ups and I'll take a look?
column434: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Thank you very much.
column438: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yeah, I'm gonna do some mock ups, and then turn those into thumbnails, maybe do some... splash frames. [laughs] I don't know what I'm talking about but I'm excited.
column439: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: And the last guy says "No, hairy body".
column440: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: You know I have heard it before.
column441: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ah, well it's still very good. I bet I know someone who hasn't heard that joke... your daughter Emily. How's she doing?
column442: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: She's great, thanks for asking. Great memory.
column443: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: She's gonna be like eleven this winter? Wow, they grow up so fast. I have a few of my own that I want some day. Listen, I don't want to take any more of your time, I know you're a very busy man. The reason we have stopped by is to drop you off this elaborate bag of goodies, and to ask you to reconsider.
column445: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK, OK! So you'll reconsider?
column446: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: OK thanks for the goodies.
column447: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ah... .is that all you have to say?
column448: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: It looks delicious? I don't know.
column449: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: You don't know?
column450: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Look, we want you back.
column451: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: Can you offer lower prices?
column453: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: Then we're not coming back.
column454: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: He's not coming back, it's over Michael.
column455: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: No it's not.
column456: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: No he's right.
column457: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Accept it, why would he come back?
column458: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Why would he come back? I will tell you, Dwight. He would come back because we offer a wide selection of products and because you're definitely not getting the same sort of customer service that you get with us.
column459: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: That's not gonna change his mind. He's moving on. We had our chance and we killed it.
column460: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Look... we're also coming out with a website soon. It's a state of the art thing, it'll be up and running, it's gonna cut costs and it will make ordering much much easier.
column461: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: Oh, OK. Well when it's up, I'll check it out, and if it really cuts costs maybe we'll come back.
column462: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Great, the magic of the gift basket.
column463: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: That I don't care about as much. Let me know when the site's up.
column464: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: OK, good. Don't let Emily have any of the cajun almonds, she's alergic.
column466: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [in Michael's car] Well we're O for six. Last chance is the Elmhurst country club. Other side of the lake, on the southeast side.
column467: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: I don't get it, I really don't get it. I thought this would work. I do everything I had at that guy and nothing.
column468: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: That's how it goes sometimes, you know? You lose everything and everything falls apart and eventually you die and no one remembers you.
column469: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: That is a very good point, Dwight.
column470: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);GPS: Make a right turn.
column471: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Wait wait wait! No no no! It means bear right, up there.
column472: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, it said right, it said take a right.
column473: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No no no, look, it means go up to the right, bare right, over the bridge and hook up with 307.
column474: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Maybe it's a shortcut Dwight. It said go to the right. [turns right]
column475: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: It can't mean that! There's a lake there!
column476: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: The machine knows where it is going!
column477: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: This is the lake!
column478: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: The machine knows--- stop yelling at me!
column479: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No, it's--- there's no road here! [car drives into lake]
column480: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Remain calm! I have trained for this! [unfastens seat belt] Okay, exit the window! [Dwight and Michael exit through the window] Here we go! Look out for leeches! [swims toward Michael] Are you okay?! Swim for it! I got you! [Dwight grabs onto Michael while Michael opens the back door for the camera man] Michael! Michael!
column481: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Let go, let go of me!
column482: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I got you, I got you! [Michael and Dwight reach the ground]
column483: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: [watching car get pulled from lake] You sure you're OK?
column485: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Good, that is what's most important.
column486: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Did you get the rental insurance? Because that is pretty important too at a time like this.
column487: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: What a disaster, this whole thing.
column488: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I'll call a cab. [brings out cell phone]
column489: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: These people just don't realize what a gift basket means, they don't get it.
column490: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Look at that, still works. Old fashioned cell phone.
column491: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: What about that last guy, Aaron? Is he a jerk. "I don't even know if I want it. They're website is so easy". Yeah, well, you can have your technology jackass, look where it got us.
column492: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [speaking on the cell phone] Yes, we need a cab at Lake Scranton, at the end of East Mountain Road, in the lake.
column493: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hang up. [Dwight hangs up] You know what we're gonna do? We're walking back. We're walking back to that office and we're gonna reclaim our gift basket!
column495: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: We're gonna take what's rightfully ours! We're gonna take a stand, Dwight! We're gonna take a stand!
column496: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Take a stand!
column497: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: So place it on the infinity thing without being obvious, you know? I'd love to do like a color version just to bring a little color to the logo.
column498: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: I like it a lot. It's clear and subtle at the same time. It's really good, you have a real talent for this stuff.
column500: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: I'd love to talk to you about it more.
column501: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: That'd be great.
column502: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Do you want to go out to dinner tonight?
column503: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: Oh... is it...
column504: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Wear something nice.
column508: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: I just... I just wanted to have dinner.
column509: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Pam: I'm uh, I'm dating Jim.
column512: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: That's... great, I... that's awesome.
column514: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: [grabs paper with mockups] So let me um, let me look at these.
column518: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: I guess he can't get any girl he wants.
column519: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: Did you forget something? What happened to you guys?
column520: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Give it back. The gift basket, give it back.
column521: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: Oh what is this?
column522: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: It's real simple. If you don't appreciate what we do, then give us back our basket.
column523: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: Maybe you should leave.
column524: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah, maybe we should, maybe we should leave. Come on, let's leave, but before we leave my wet friend and I are going to wait for our cabs on yours nice couches! [sits on couch]
column525: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Can you call us a cab please, I'm gonna [gets water from his clothes on the couch] Oops, sorry!
column526: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Look, my clothes are so wet!
column527: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Nice leather, oh my shoes are so muddy! [rubs shoes on couch]
column528: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: [comes back with gift basket] Alright here you go, take it back!
column529: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: It's been opened.
column530: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: Yeah it was mine!
column531: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: What's missing... the turtles. Where are the turtles? Where are the turtles?
column532: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: Come on guys, get out of here!
column533: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: WHERE ARE THE TURTLES? WHERE ARE THEY?
column534: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [enters nearby room] Excuse me I have an announcement to make. We seem to be missing a box of chocolate turtles with peacons, and we will not be leaving the premises until we obtain them. Hand. Over. The. Turtles. Now!
column535: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ex-client: I ate them OK, I ate the turtles, they're gone!
column536: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [leaving] We'll bill you.
column537: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: May I have your attention please? This office will not be using any new technology ever, starting now.
column538: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: That is not correct.
column539: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ryan thinks that technology is the answer. Well guess what? I just drove my car into a lake.
column540: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Oscar: You did what?
column541: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: I drove my car into a [bleep] lake. Why you may ask did I do this? Well, because of a machine. A machine told me to drive into a lake. And I did it! I did it because I trusted Ryan's precious technology, and look where it got me.
column542: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Into a lake.
column544: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: Did you get any clients back?
column545: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Maybe, maybe not, time will tell. But I will tell you one thing. Those gift baskets never endangered anybody's lives. [looks at Ryan] Game set match... point... Scott... game over... end of game.
column546: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Michael: Everyone always wants new things. Everybody likes new inventions, new technology. People will never be replaced by machines. In the end, life and business are about human connections. And computers are about trying to murder you in a lake. And to me the choice is easy.
column547: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: I'm not saying I had a meteoric rise... but I did. And if they knew how much I was paying for my haircut now, they wouldn't be giving me a noogie. ... It was two hundred dollars.
column549: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: You should come visit. The city is... amazing.
column550: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: I know. I love it there.
column551: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: No. You don't know until you live there. There's something about waking up every morning and just being in that city.
column552: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Mmhmm, yeah, last time I was there I had a lot of fun.
column553: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: No. You can't imagine it, though. The energy when you're actually there. You're just part of something bigger than you, that's moving faster than you. Your dreams are... . it just... everything feels so limitless.
column555: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Ryan: No. It... eh... you can't... it's not about how it sounds.
column556: 04x03/04 - Dunder Mifflin Infinity (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yeee... (grunts in frustration)

column1: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: And the same thing goes for quarterly reports. They are unreadable. They're just numbers and boring and blech. So what I was thinking is that maybe we should have some sort of graphic, like if we have a bad quarter, put in a storm cloud? And... when we have a good quarter, fireworks? Or a racecar? [everyone groans] Doesn't have to be a racecar. Use your imagination.
column2: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: There's this cube on the screen, and it bounces around all day, and sometimes it looks like it's heading right into the corner of the screen, and at the last minute it hits a wall and bounces away. And we are all just dying to see it go right into the corner. Pam claims that she saw it one day when she was alone in the conference room. Okay. I believe she thinks she saw it.
column3: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pam: I saw it. I saw it, and it was amazing! Who said I didn't see it? Did Jim say that I didn't see it? I saw it!
column4: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: We have a lot of colored paper here... why oh why do we keep printing this on white? [screen saver box hits the wall]
column5: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Dah! Come on!
column6: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah! I know. I know. It's bland.
column7: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Oscar: It's never gonna happen.
column8: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Dude, you gotta believe.
column9: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Maybe, we could have some sort of riddle?
column10: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: [to Pam] Wait for it.
column11: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Like, something that you have to look for. Sort of a "Where's Waldo." [screensaver box hits the corner of the screen]
column12: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Everyone: Oh! Yes!
column13: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: [everyone gets up and leaves the conference room] Alright. Alright. Let's quit while we're ahead.
column14: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Kevin: That was so awesome.
column15: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: That was awesome. Thank you.
column16: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Some days I am just on fire. What can I say?
column17: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Meredith: Hey... there he is.
column18: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Hey Meredith, how you feelin'?
column19: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Meredith: I never thanked you for coming to the hospital.
column20: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh, please, it was my pleasure. Well we all came, so...
column21: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Meredith: Well, I really appreciate you coming. I'm singling you ouuuut.
column22: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Haha...
column23: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Meredith: Anyway, I have this Sharpie...
column24: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Uh-huh.

column30: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Alright...
column31: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pam: Michael? This is the press release I was telling you about. Ryan wants you to share it with everyone.
column32: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, does he?
column33: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pam: He does.
column34: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Mmmmmm. Okay. Attention. Earthlings. I have some news. Beep beep beep beep, beep beep beep beep beep, beep beep beep beep beep, beep beep beep beep beep, beep beep beep beep. Okay. Today is the big day that I am heading to New York to attend a party with sushi and important people. On an unrelated note, if anyone has an interesting anectdote that is not boring and easy to memorize please drop by my office before I leave. Thank you.
column35: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Whoops. Is that really what Ryan wanted you to tell us?
column36: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: And... today the Dunder-Mifflin Infinity website officially launches.
column37: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well the website is the brain-child of my brain-child, Ryan. It is my brain-grandchild. And, uh, to celebrate it's birth, all of the different branches are going to have satellite parties, which will be connected via web-cams and fibers to the real party, which is going on in New York City at uh, a very exclusive nightclub, and that is where all of the VIP's, including yours truly, will be partying with uh New York City's finest, and I do not mean policemen...
column38: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: The company is projecting record high sales, and that by 6:00 the website will be the new best salesman in the company. Wow! Watch out Dwight.
column39: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: That's ridiculous. I'm not going to be beaten by a website.
column40: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Actually it sounds like you are.
column41: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Really? 'Cause Ryan says so?
column42: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Kelly: If that's from Ryan, does it mention if he's seeing anybody?
column43: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: No. It doesn't. I'll find out tonight.
column44: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Stanley: Yes, please let us know.
column45: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I can make more sales than a computer. In fact, I challenge that website to make more sales than me today.
column46: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Waste of time.
column47: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: What's that, pipsqueak?
column48: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Waste of time. The website's going to win.
column49: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: You believe a computer can beat me?
column50: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: I don't care, but yes.
column51: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Well I will prove you wrong.
column52: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: I don't care, and you won't.
column53: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: We'll see.
column54: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: I won't be watching, and I won't.
column55: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pam: Dwight mercy killed Angela's cat. It's very complicated. It's caused a lot of unpleasantness between Dwight and Angela. Who are both already prone to unpleasantness.
column56: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: Stanley, you're dancing!
column57: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Stanley: No I'm not.
column58: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Yeah. I created a website. Look, at the end of the day, apples apples flying at 30,000 feet. This is a paper company and I don't want us to get lost in the weeds or into a beauty contest.
column59: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Voice of Thomas Dean: I told you I don't want you doing these things in here. You can use your own office or do it in the hall.
column60: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Convergence. Viral marketing. We're going guerrilla. We're takin' it to the streets while keeping an eye on the street. Wall Street. I don't want to reinvent the wheel here. In other words, it is what it is. Buyin' paper just became fun.
column61: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: And this is where I will record your sales.
column62: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Hmm. Very nice. Very nice.
column63: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: And then I will say something positive, like kudos or job well done.
column64: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Or zipadeedoodaah.

column66: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Just ignore him.
column67: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Ehh, can't do that. Really hard for me to let things go.
column68: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: I was... mocking.
column69: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Thank you.

column71: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Yes like a chime or a bell...
column72: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Or a gong.
column73: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Go to my car. Open the trunk. Inside you will see many pelts. Under the smallest one is a case. Inside that case is a bear horn. Bring it to me.
column74: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Yes!
column75: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Isn't 7 pm a little late for a lunch party?
column76: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Lunch party? It's supposed to say launch party! What is wrong with you?
column77: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: Angela is worse than usual lately, and we have a party to throw. So I Googled how to deal with difficult people, and I got all of this. [whispering] So we're gonna try out some new things today.
column78: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: So how do you feel about the fact that the banner says lunch?
column79: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: I feel angry. Angry at you. Angry at you for doing something stupid. Angry at me for believing you could do something not stupid.
column80: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: I'm so sorry to hear that, that must be awful.
column81: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: It is awful. You've made this day awful!
column82: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Maybe you could just change the U into an A.
column83: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Then it would say lanch party, Kevin. Would it really be better if it said lanch party?

column88: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Plan a party, Angela. Oh! And the entire world will see it. Oh! And here's $65.00 for your budget. Oh and here are four idiots who'll do nothing but weigh you down. Oh. And your cat's still dead.

column110: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: It appears that the website has become alive. This happens to computers and robots sometimes. Am I scared of a stupid computer? Please. The computer should be scared of me! I have been salesman of the month for 13 out of the last 12 months. You heard me right. I did so well last February that Corporate gave me 2 plaques in lieu of a pay raise.

column149: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: So. This is the dealio. God has smiled upon me and given me two tickets to the big party in New York tonight. What are you doing this evening? Look at that. They have their own little language now. Like twins.

column173: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Phyllis. These are spoooons. Spoons have rounded tops, and are used to scoop things. What we need are forks, which have prongs, or tiny spears on top. And we need knives, which have blades. Do you understand me now?

column195: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I am not a bad person. When I left Staples, I took some of their leads with me but I never intended to use them. What did I intend to do with them? Who knows? Maybe keep them as a souvenir. Maybe use them.

I'm throwing up. You're making me throw up, Ryan.
column242: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: You know what this is like? I'll tell you what this is like. This is like when the Freshmen would throw a party and wouldn't let any of the Seniors go.
column243: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Doesn't it just piss you off sometimes that that little twerp got the promotion over us?
column244: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh actually I withdrew from consideration.
column245: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah. I withdrew too.
column246: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Four! Three! Two! One!
column247: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Yes!
column248: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Woo!
column249: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Woo!
column250: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: After numerous projections that the computer would crush all salesmen in it's path, I am very happy to report that our very own Dwight Schrute has crushed his electronic nemesis, if you will, by a whopping fifty-two reams.
column251: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Reams. Wait. Say it. Say it again. Announce it again.
column252: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Fifty-two reams!
column253: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No no no the first part.
column254: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Dwight has defeated the computer.
column255: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Hey. So. What do you think? I did it for you.
column256: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: I didn't ask you to do it for me.
column257: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: You didn't have to.
column258: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: How do you tell someone it's over? You send them a notarized letter, right? Well, what if the recipient is your notary?
column259: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Hello, Pam.
column260: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pam: Hello.
column261: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Hey. Do you have any men that you can fix me up with? I would like to have a relationship with a man.
column262: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pam: Um... uh... I'll get back to you.
column263: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Let me know.
column264: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);DunMiff/sys: [on monitor] You beat me. You are the superior being.
column265: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);
column266: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);
column267: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);
column268: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Alright who wants to party?
column269: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Why aren't you in New York?
column270: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ohhh, what? Oh I think I faked Oscar out.
column271: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Stanley: You said you weren't coming back and we could leave early.
column272: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: I think I faked Stanley out too. Who else thought that I was leaving? And they could all go home early? Gotcha. Gotcha. Gotcha. Well who needs New York? Right? We can have a killer party right here in Scranton.
column273: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Thank you.
column274: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Nope nope nope no. This is going to be nothing like the party you've been planning. This is going to be good and everybody's gonna come. What's wrong with Dwight?
column275: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: He beat the computer.
column276: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh hey! Good for you. Good for you. Scranton power. Alright you know what? Angela I'd like you to come into my office in ten minutes. Bring something to write with and something to write on. Good.
column277: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: This was a pretty disappointing day. It was kind of a slap in the face to realize that I wasn't as important as I thought I was to a certain young executive who I cared about. But, you know, I'm not gonna cry over it. I did that in the car on the way home.
column278: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: How we doing on time?
column279: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: The party starts in an hour.
column280: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Good. These are some things that I would like to have happen.
column281: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Beer, lite beer, streamers, orchids. Better lighting?
column282: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Mmmhmm.
column283: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Something made of ice?
column284: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Those are just things. This is how I want it to feel.
column285: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Pizza, pizza with mushrooms, pizza without mushrooms, white pizza, steak?
column286: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: I would like this party to be sexier, cooler, more important...
column294: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: I want it to embarrass all other parties. I want it to be a party that the guys in New York watch on the web-cam and say, "Wow! How did they get Al Roker to come?"
column295: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: I can't do this.
column297: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: I can't do it.
column298: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes you can. I know you can. I wouldn't say that if I didn't hundred percent believe it. Who else could do this?
column300: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: No seriously. Is there anyone else who could do it better? Because we don't have a lot of time. I'll get the pizza!
column301: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: What do you think of Angela?
column302: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I think she's efficient.
column303: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: No, not like that, as a woman. W-O-M-A-N.
column305: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: You hadn't noticed she's a woman?
column307: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: I hear she's single and ready to mingle. I'm thinking about making a play for her. What do you think? Crazy, right?
column308: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I think it's inappropriate to date someone you work with.
column309: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Isn't that part of the fun?
column310: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No. I think you should date Kelly.
column311: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: She works here too, how is that any different?
column312: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Uh, she works in the annex. You're also welcome to date Toby.
column315: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Stanley: We get to go home?
column316: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Guess who just ordered from your favorite pizza place, Alfredo?
column318: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Wait! Alfredo's Pizza Cafe? Or Pizza by Alfredo?
column322: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: You know what? I don't understand when you all talk at the same time.
column323: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Oscar, talk to him.
column324: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Michael, there's a very big difference between these two pizza places. Both in quality of ingredients, and overall taste. Which one did you order from?
column327: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Okay, okay, what's better? A medium amount of good pizza? Or all you can eat of pretty good pizza?
column328: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);All: Medium amount of good pizza.
column329: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: [sighs, walks back into office]
column330: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Oh no, it's bad. It's real bad. It's like eating a hot circle of garbage.
column331: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: You can pick one of these things. It's unreasonable for you to ask me to do all of this.
column332: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: It should take no time at all if you put the care into it that you normally do.
column333: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: [Balls up post-its and throws them in Angela's face]
column335: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: That seemed to shut her up.
column336: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Are you looking for dinner and a movie? Because you're not going to find it in that box. [Camera pans to Kevin giving an "are you kidding me?" look]
column337: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Just so happens that I know where you can find it, but again, not in the box.
column338: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Angela, are you hearing words that I'm saying?
column341: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: I have been working on a party for three weeks that just got thrown out the window. So now I've got to pull together a whole new party, and my useless number two quit, so now there's no one in charge of orchids, chocolates, or the thing that's made of ice. And my upper back itches, and it's itched all day, and I can't reach it, and Kevin had Greek food for lunch again.
column342: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: They say you should never mix business with pleasure. Really? Well then, explain to me how a putt-putt golf company operates.
column344: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pam: The Pizza by Alfredo guy is here.
column345: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: You don't have to say it like that.
column346: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pam: I said it normal.
column348: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: Hey. Sixty-three fifty, and that's not including tip.
column349: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Right, I have a coupon, so half of sixty-three fifty, and half the tip of sixty-three fifty.
column350: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: The half off coupon only applies to orders of two pizzas.
column351: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah, I told them on the phone that I was ordering eight pizzas.
column352: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: I don't care what you told them on the phone, that's our policy.
column353: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: You didn't actually think I was going to spend sixty bucks on pizza?
column355: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Okay, it doesn't say it anywhere on the coupon, and if it's policy, it should say it on the coupon.
column357: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: [sarcastic shrugging of shoulders] What do you mean hmm-um?
column358: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: Not my problem.
column359: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: It is your problem. That's no way to do business, okay? I ordered eight pizzas with a half-off coupon, so I would like eight pizzas for half-off. End of story.
column360: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: Great story. It's sixty-three fifty, and that's not including tip.
column361: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'm not giving that to you.
column362: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: Well then you're not getting you're pizzas.
column363: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, no you're not going anywhere. You're staying here until we figure this out.
column365: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: You know what? This young man needs to learn that's not how you treat people. I don't care if it's pizza. Good business is about respect and accountability and follow through. You don't just make promises and pull the rug out from under somebody, do you? Dwight, please escort this young man into the conference room. Right now, get in the conference room.
column366: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: I'm not going in there.
column367: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes you are, yes you are, and you will come out when you decide to give me a discount on the pizza. Please, thank you.
column368: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: This is stupid.
column369: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, you don't even know what stupid is. It's about to get all stupid up in here.
column371: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Kevin: We think it's a straight forward kidnapping.
column372: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Stanley, could you look up "accomplices"?
column373: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Stanley: Why can't you guys do it?
column374: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Because we're looking up jail time.
column376: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I've seen this kid before. He's one the kids who sneaks on my farm and steals my hemp.
column377: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: Yeah, I know that guy. He's that farmer that grows really crappy weed.
column378: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: You ready to give me my discount now?
column380: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Okay, what have you been doing in here this whole time?
column381: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: What kind of business is this?
column382: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: We're a paper company. The best paper company in the whole wide world.
column383: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Alright, Dwight, knock it off. You better think about what you are doing young man.
column384: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: You better think about what you're doing.
column385: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: No! I'm an adult, I don't have to think or do anything. You're a kid, a little snot-nosed, punk kid who thinks he's better than everyone else, because he's some hot shot, and you don't know anything about sales. So stop being a disrespectful little jerk, okay?
column387: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah sales, you sell pizza. Last time I checked that's called sales.
column388: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: You're such a loser.
column389: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: What did you just call him?
column391: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: What did you say?
column393: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Alright stop, stop making him say it! You just made this worse, a whole lot worse.
column394: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I can make him talk, Michael.
column396: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Stop talking all at once!
column397: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: You need to let him go.
column398: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Let go of the little jerk boy before he has learned his lesson?
column400: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: You know what Jim, the world would be a better place if people were held accountable for their actions.
column401: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yes, but not by kidnapping.
column402: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'm not kidnapping him, I'm keeping him until I get what I want.
column404: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: I think you're over-thinking it.
column405: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: I think you're under-thinking it.
column406: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes, is Alfredo there? Can I speak to a manager then? Okay, can you tell the manager that I'm keeping his delivery kid until I get a discount on the eight pizzas I ordered. Yes, I know it is not on the coupon. Also I would like him to throw in two, three pizzas for our...
column409: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: What did he say?
column411: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: So, we should let him go.
column414: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Listen up kid. [pops balloon with his hands] I don't like you, but because some town in Switzerland says so, you have rights.
column415: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: I have to hang these.
column416: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: Why are you looking at her like that?
column419: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Michael just called the pizza place with a list of demands.
column420: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Mister Overdramatic, what's up Kevin?
column421: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Kevin: We're getting hungry out there. We're all accomplices now anyway, so we figured we might as well eat. We would like to order some good pizza, from Alfredo's Pizza Cafe, while we wait for the hostage situation with the bad pizza to end.
column422: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: I needed another hour, it could have been done in another hour.
column423: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Meredith: I think it looks good.
column424: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: That's why you're not in charge Meredith.
column425: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Here you are my dear, one thing made of ice.
column426: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: How did you, um, where did you...
column427: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: It's just ice, it'll melt all over the floor.
column428: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Will you help me put it over there?
column434: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pam: Michael, Ryan wants to introduce the branch managers in a few minutes. You just have to wave and introduce yourself.
column435: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'll just wave and introduce myself.
column436: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Hey, quick question. If I take a pizza, do you think you could take some sodas and some napkins up to the roof?
column437: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pam: I'm all over it.
column439: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: What have we got here?
column441: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yeah, cheese, or do we have other flavors?
column443: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Which one's this? Perfect.
column444: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Do you remember what you said to me on my first day of work, just before you walked me over to my desk?
column445: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yeah, enjoy this moment, because you're never going to go back to this time before you met your desk mate Dwight.
column446: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: And that's when I knew. You?
column447: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pam: You came up to my desk, and said, this might sound weird, and there's no reason for me to know this, but that mixed berry yogurt you're about to eat has expired.
column448: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: That was the moment that you knew you liked me?
column450: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: Wow, can we make it a different moment?
column452: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Manager: Can I start talking? Is this thing on? Give me a signal when you want me to start.
column453: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Ryan: And now from my old hometown, Scranton Pennsylvania, my former boss, Michael Scott.
column454: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey, I just think you should know that one of my salesmen beat your stupid computer, so take that [bleep]hole.
column455: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Always a jokester. How about that image? Crystal clear.
column456: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: If anyone out there is listening, I'm being held here against my will. I'm a minor.
column457: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: Ow! What are you doing?
column458: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: You said your upper back itched.
column459: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: I didn't ask you to scratch it.
column460: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: Look Angela, I know this is weird because we work together, and up until and possibly now I've repulsed you, but I like you.
column461: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: I'm not dating you.
column462: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: So, Angela is stubborn as a mule, she's giving off fairly strong vibes that she's not interested.
column464: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: But do I like her or not, because if I like her, then I can't back down.
column465: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [kicks open bathroom door] If you're going number one you've got ten more seconds!
column466: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey, have you seen Jim?
column467: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Kevin: I guess he wanted to get out of here before the cops find out.
column469: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, what are you doing?
column470: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I'm just scaring him. The trick is to make him think you're going to do something to him.
column471: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Pizza guy: I can hear you, man.
column472: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Shut up, or I'm going to punch you in the throat!
column473: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey, hey, hey stop it. Stop it now, God. Oh my God, oh my God, no, no, no. I kidnapped a kid.
column474: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: You had to, what other choice did you have?
column475: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: I could have paid for the pizza.
column477: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh my God, oh my God.
column479: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Hello Michael, this is Ryan, first off thanks for the shout out.
column480: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: You're breaking up. I can't hear you.
column481: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Why is there a kid on your webcam saying that he's being held against his... [Michael hangs up on Ryan]
column482: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: [to Dwight] Mmm-kay. I want you to go in there, and pay him for the pizzas, and give him a generous tip, no more than ten percent.
column483: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: What will you do?
column484: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: I will open the door.
column486: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: And hopefully he will walk out, and the rest is out of our hands.
column487: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: So, I'm paying full price?
column489: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Here we go, sixty-five. You know what? There's two more.
column490: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: See ya, drive safely.
column491: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: [pizza guy flips him off] Okay.
column493: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Now we wait, and hopefully nothing happens.
column494: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Alright. Oh, I assume I'm going to be reimbursed for the pizzas.
column495: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Not now Dwight, please, it's not the time.
column496: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Jim: A toast, better make it good. To avoiding a class two felony charge.
column498: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: [answers two ringing phones] Hello, hey hang on a second. Hello, hang on.
column499: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: [Andy plus two voices on the phone singing] If you change your mind, I'll be first in line. Honey, I'm still free, take a chance on me. If you need me let me know, gonna be around. If you got no place to go, if you're feeling down. If your all alone when the pretty birds have flown, honey I'm still free, take a chance on me. Gonna do my very best, and that ain't no lie, if you put me to the test, if you let me try. Take a chance on me, that's all I ask of you Angela. Take a chance on me.
column500: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Voice #1 on phone: Hey how'd it go?
column501: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Voice #2 on phone: Yeah, what'd she say?
column502: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: I don't know yet, I have to call you back.
column503: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Voice #1 on phone: You have to give us something...
column504: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Andy: I'll call you back.
column505: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Angela: I have to go clean up after the party.
column506: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: What a horrible day.
column510: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well, I need to get the horrible taste of this pizza out of my mouth. I'd really like some sushi. I was hoping that I would have New York style sushi today. And you know what?
column512: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'm going to get it.
column514: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Uh-uh, no, there is only one place where they authentic New York style sushi.
column516: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: New York. Wanna go?
column525: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Bartender: I'm sorry, you guys are going to have to leave.
column526: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey, you know what? [Michael and Dwight grab plates of sushi] Come on, come on, let's go.
column527: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Man: Hey, you're the Scranton guy.
column529: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Man: I liked your statement tonight.
column530: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, thanks. This is the guy that beat the computer.
column531: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Man: Oh, very cool. It was funny to see Ryan all embarrassed by that.
column535: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: [mocking Ryan] I'm Ryan, and tonight didn't go the way that I thought it would, because it didn't work out for me, and I'm very embarrassed. I got egg all over my face.
column536: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: And I spent so much time in Scranton and I never sold any paper.
column537: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: I never sold any paper, because I'm an idiot.
column538: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I started a fire with my cheese pita.
column539: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: I made it with my cheese pita.
column540: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I date Indian girls.
column541: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: I started a fire, I started a fire.
column542: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Now I've got a beard, and I can do whatever I want, and I'm your boss.
column543: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: And I'm hot, I'm so hot. That's why everybody...
column544: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I don't get that, I don't understand that.
column545: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well, it's part of it, it's just the... uhhh.
column548: 04x05/06 - Launch Party (Parts 1&2);Ryan: [steps in front of camera, adjusts jacket, poses, winks]

column1: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Coat! [throws coat at Pam]
column2: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Michael just rented The Devil Wears Prada. He has his NetFlix sent here to the office, and he watches them in pieces when things are slow.
column3: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Steak! Where's my steeaaak?
column4: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: He's a big Meryl Streep fan, so I shouldn't be surprised that he's identified with her character.
column5: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Get me Armani.
column6: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: A suit?
column7: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: On the phone.
column8: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Like the main company number? Because I'm gonna have to call information.
column9: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Where's Armani? He's on the phone. Too slow. You are not going to Paris. I'm so much better than you are. [breaks into laughter]
column10: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I owe you an apology.
column11: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: You finished the movie.
column12: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah. It was awesome. Big surprise ending. Won't ruin it for you.
column13: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: No. Go ahead.
column14: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Meryl Streep is the bad guy. Never see it coming. Anyways, if I was mean in any way to you, I am sorry. I just want what's best for you, Mo Chuisle.
column15: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Mo Chuisle. He's watching Million Dollar Baby... He's gonna try to kill me.
column16: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Micahel: So this one goes with my eyes and this one goes with your eyes. People have said I have very pretty eyes.
column17: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: You do.
column18: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I haven't heard the same about you. So let's just go with mine.
column19: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: Well, they both go with the carpet I've ordered, and if you go with the brown leather on the sofas, then they go with that too.
column20: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: We already have a sofa. So why do---
column21: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: A futon's not a sofa.
column22: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: It... folds up. You've only seen it flat.
column23: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: I know what a futon is, Michael.
column24: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I--- Ok. How much is this going to cost?
column25: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: It costs what it costs.
column26: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michae: No--- don't... that doesn't even mean anything.
column27: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: We have gone through this.
column28: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes. Money has been a little tight lately. But, at the end of my life, when I'm sitting on my yacht, am I gonna be thinking about how much money I have? No. I'm going to be thinking about how many friends I have, and my children, and my comedy albums. I mean, I have a yacht, so I obviously did pretty well money wise.
column29: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: It's just that you say it's gonna cost what it costs--- [phone rings]
column30: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: [on the phone] Michael, it's Ryan for you.
column31: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: Conniving little runt. Put him through.
column32: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Put him through. Yes. Ryan, my man!
column33: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: [on the phone] I sent you an email about the new Powerpoint.
column34: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes, and thank you for sending that to me.
column35: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: I had IT install the updated Powerpoint on the computer so you can use it for the presentation. I really want people there using Powerpoint.
column36: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Okay, yeah, I dunno. I dunno, I think those IT guys messed up.
column37: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Hold on, I'll get them on the phone.
column38: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: [looking at nothing] Wait, oh, no, here it is, here it is. Found it.
column39: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: [talking on phone] Sure, I can hold.
column40: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [picks up phone] Dunder Mifflin, Dwight Schrute. Please hold. [opens book, then picks up phone] Schrute Farms, guten tag. How can I help you? Yes, we have availability on those nights. How many in your party? Oh no, I'm sorry, no king beds. No queen either. Well, we make our own mattresses that don't conform to the traditional sizes. Closest would be twin. Thank you so much for calling. Call back again. Aufedersein!
column41: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Hey Dwight.
column42: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: None of your business, Jim.
column43: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Do you run the bed and breakfest?
column44: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: It is not a B and B.
column45: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Agrotourism is a lot more than a bed and breakfest. It consists of tourists coming to a farm, showing them around, giving them a bed, giving them brekafest.
column46: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Does the Department of Health know about this?
column47: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I'm not telling you anything. [lookings into the camera] Permits are pending. [phone rings] Dwight Schrute, Dunder Mifflin.
column48: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Hello, I'm looking for a room.
column49: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Okay, this is a mis-use of company phones.
column50: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: It says here you cater to the eldery.
column51: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Where did you read that?
column52: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Trip Advsior.
column53: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Trip Advisor is the life blood of the Agrotourism industry. A couple of bad reviews there, you might as well close up shop. That's what took down the Stalk Inn. One of the cutest little asparagus farms you'll ever see.
column54: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: How many in your party?
column55: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Two?
column56: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: We offer tours of the fields, and of the barn. Uh, perhaps you'll be interested in, um, Mose's table making demonstration?
column57: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: So, um, I forgot to tell you that I need the car tonight.
column58: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh! Um, actually, I need the car.
column59: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: Why? Improv? Why don't you just pretend you have a car? Good practice, incase you ever do a scene where you need to pretend you have a car?
column60: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Use to have two cars, traded 'em in, now we're down to one. Good economic sense. Although the new car is a Porsche. For her.
column61: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: One cardigan, one sleeping cardigan and one sleep apnea mask.
column62: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Angela: What about my cherub figurine?
column63: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: You took that with you.
column64: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Angela: No I left it on my night table--- your night table, by the lamp.
column65: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: You are incorrect. I was recently scrubbing my room of memories, and I didn't see it there.
column66: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Angela: Fine.
column67: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: My girlfriend and I broke up recently. And I must say, I am relieved. Gives me a chance to sow my wild oats. In the Schrute family, we have a tradition, where when the male has s*x with another woman, he is rewarded with a bag of wild oats left on his door step by his parents. You can use these oats to make oatmeal, bread, whatever you want. I don't care, they're your oats.
column68: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kevin: The bar uses an applause meter. That is why it's so important that you all come and applaud only for my band. Scrantonicity 2. NOT Scrantonicity, which I am no longer a part of. Michael, can I count on you?
column69: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: You can not, I have a thing tonight.
column70: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kevin: Dammit.
column71: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Uh, Michael.
column72: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: What?
column73: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: That reminds me, uh, if the invitation still stands, Pam and I would love to have dinner tonight.
column74: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh no, I have a thing tonight.
column75: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Darn it!
column76: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Shoot!
column77: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: How about this weekend?
column78: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: No, can't.
column79: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: We only had tonight free, and we really wanted to spend it with you.
column80: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Dammit to hell. I-I-ugh, ok. All right.
column81: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Where are you going out tonight?
column82: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: You wouldn't understand. It's a secret.
column83: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: I wouldn't understand or a secret?
column84: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: You wouldn't understand, Jim. It's a secret.
column85: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'm sorry Mr. O'Brian, I didn't mean to interrupt your dinner. I just have a very exciting offer. My records indicate that you have expressed interest in losing some weight. Well, what if I told you that I have a pill that will make you 50 pounds lighter in 5 minutes? How does that sound? Amazing right? Well, it won't be that fast, but it will--[notices camera]-- it will be that easy.
column86: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: I can't believe this place is real. I mean, I've heard about his beet farm for years, but wow.
column87: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: The Beets Motel.
column88: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: The Beets Motel? That is, wow.
column89: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Thank you. Eh. The Embassy Beets. Radishon!
column90: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: How are you doing this?
column91: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: I don't know! [Mose starts running by the left side of the car]
column92: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Oh my gosh.
column93: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I just love sales. I love it to death. It's as simple as that. And I don't get to do it enough as a manager, so I took this second job. I count it as a hobby. Some people have golf, or relaxing.
column94: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Nick: What's going on here?
column95: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey, I just got off the phone, and I was gonna make another call.
column96: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Nick: We're a legit operation with a license from the city I can show you. We pay minimum wage against commision---
column97: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, they're with me, so... this is Nick Figaro, manager to the stars!
column98: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: We have three rooms, each with a different theme.
column99: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: What are the themes?
column100: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: American, Irrigation, and Night-Time.
column101: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Irrigation.
column102: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Nice.
column103: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I'll put you down for Irrigation. Well then, do you have any special needs or diertary restrictions?
column104: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yes. We will be requiring a bed time story.
column105: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No.
column106: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Not even Harry Potter?
column107: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: No. Jim, come on.
column108: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Mose: But you promised.
column109: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Mose, bags! Now!
column110: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Here we are, the Irrigation Room! A very special room. So I'll come get you before the table-making demonstration. And as of this morning, we are completely wireless here in Schrute Farms. But as soon as I find out where Mose hid all the wires, we'll get that power back on. All righty.
column111: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Nick: Everybody in the conference room. In 5 minutes.
column112: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: These meetings are useless.
column113: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Nick: I just want to remind you to stick to the script. Improving the work. So, make the call, say the lines, make the sale. Got it?
column114: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Very inspirational. [laughter]
column115: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Nick: We're offering a $50 bonus tonight to the guy with the most sales. Ok.
