column116: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Co-Worker 1: Or a woman.
column117: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Or a trained seal. [laughter]
column118: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Nick: You could make jokes when you've made a sale there rookie, ok? [laughter ends]
column119: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Hmmm, I'd say 1 in 6.
column120: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: What?
column121: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh, I thought you asked me what our chances were in being murdered here tonight.
column122: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: You know, I've just realized, this is Pam's and my first night away together. I use to play it over my head, and it was just a little bit different. Maybe a uh, nice hotel. Or a romantic dinner. Wine... uh but, wine that wasn't made out of beets. Didn't think Dwight would be involved at all. And uh, I always imagined less manure. I mean, some manure, just... less.
column123: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Mose, what are you doing? No Mose! Put the--- Put the manure down! Put it down! Do not throw it! DO NOT THROW IT! Ow!
column124: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes, is Mr. Hudson there?
column125: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Stanely: [on the phone] Yes, who is this?
column126: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'm just calling because you responded positively to the---
column127: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Stanely: Michael?
column128: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: ...Stanley?
column129: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Stanley: Why are you calling me here at home?
column130: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: [Spanish accent] Senor, are you happy with your---
column131: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Stanley: Michael, I know that's you. Why are you calling me here at home?
column132: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: [speaking with a different voice] Have you--- Have you considered satellite television?
column133: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Stanley: Michael, I know that's you. I know your voice. Why are you calling me here at home? [Michael hands up]
column134: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Stanley: [on the phone] When I'm at home at night in my own house in my sweats drinking some red wine watching my mystery stories, the last thing in the whole God forsaken world I want to hear is the voice of Michael Scott.
column135: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well your son sounds like he's really motivated. I think it's crazy the coach won't play him frankly.
column136: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Nick: [hangs up phone] My office.
column137: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: You bet.
column138: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Nick: Just dial the number on the sheet and stick to the script. Say those words exactly, got it? I don't know why we have to keep on having this conversation.
column139: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Look, I know sales, and I had that sale, I just needed a few more minutes---
column140: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Nick: A few more minutes is a waste of our time.
column141: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: It is not a waste of our time.
column142: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Nick: This is a trading game.
column143: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Micael: No.
column144: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Nick: You give a quick pitch. You make the sale. You move on. That's how Vikram does it.
column145: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Vikram doesn't have my people skills.
column146: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Nick: Good for Vikram, because he out-sells you every night.
column147: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well, I hope this conversation has helped.
column148: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [reading to Jim, Pam, and Mose] And Harry saw the white hand raise its wand, and felt Voldemort's surge of vicious anger. Saw the frail old man on the floor write in agony. "Harry?" It was over quickly as it had come. Harry stood shaking in the darkness, clutching the gate in the garden, his heart racing.
column149: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: What did you get tonight?
column150: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Vikram: Oh it looks like mixed masala, eggplant, and rice.
column151: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, that looks good.
column152: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Vikram: Oh, and what about you? Peanut butter flavor again?
column153: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I am going with the vanilla crisp this evening.
column154: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Vikram: Enjoy.
column155: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Thank you.
column156: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Vikram: I was a surgeon back home.
column157: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Really?
column158: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Vikram: Oh yeah.
column159: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Wonder what I would've been back home?
column160: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Vikram: Well this is your home.
column161: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I know, but it's competitive here. What's a dollar worth in your land? Medical school must cost like 40 bucks or a donkey or something.
column162: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Vikram: Uhh, no.
column163: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I would've been chief of surgery... Or a cowboy.
column164: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: [Jim and Pam hear noise] Wait, you're going up there?
column165: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Yeah. Coward.
column166: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: [Pam sees Mose in an outhouse] Oh my God. What century is this?
column167: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: You know what, here's the thing about Die Hard 4. Die Hard one, the original, John McClane was just this normal guy. You know, he's just a normal New York City cop, who gets his feet cut, and gets beat up. But he's an everyday guy. In Die Hard 4, he is jumping a motorcycle into a helicopter. In air. You know? He's invincible. It just sort of lost what Die Hard was. It's not Terminator.
column168: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Co-Worker 2: Dude, you should review movies. [other co-workers agree]
column169: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I actually wrote a movie.
column170: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Co-Worker 3: Really?
column171: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'm writing one, yeah.
column172: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Co-Worker 3: What's it about?
column173: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Um, sort of a spy, thriller...
column174: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Nick: What's so captivating? [everyone stops talking, go back to work] I like captivating things. And this must be really captivating because it's keeping you off the phones. I mean time is your money, that's how I know how captivating it is. Because how much time you spend talking.
column175: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: [Pam and Jim hear Dwight crying] Ugh, your turn.
column176: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [Jim knocks on Dwight's door, crying stops] Come in. Did you have another nightmare?
column177: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Hey Dwight.
column178: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Oh, Jim. I thought you were Mose.
column179: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Does Mose have nightmares?
column180: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Oh yes. Ever since the storm.
column181: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Is everything satisfactory with your stay?
column182: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yeah, yeah.
column183: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Great.
column184: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Just thought that I heard crying, moaning, or something in here.
column185: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Oh. Well I'll look into that in the morning. Thank you for bringing that to the attention of the staff.
column186: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Good night, Dwight. [Jim leaves, Dwight continues crying]
column187: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Co-Worker 2: Yeah, so we're all gonna go out for a beer. Do you wanna come?
column188: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Co-Worker 3: We'd love for you to come, Michael.
column189: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Thanks, no, I have work tomorrow morning.
column190: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Co-Worker 2: All right, next time dude.
column191: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Okay, see you guys. [Sees Jan] Hey, how you doin'?
column192: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: You drive, I had too much wine.
column193: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Okay. How's yoga?
column194: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: I didn't go.
column195: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Wh-Why not?
column196: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: I just didn't!
column197: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Okay.
column198: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: How was improv?
column199: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Good night Vikram.
column200: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Vikram: Good night.
column201: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey, congrats on the bonus.
column202: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Vikram: Thank you Michael.
column203: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'm gonna have it one of these nights.
column204: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Vikram: Well if you concentrate and make your calls faster, yeah.
column205: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Good night.
column206: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Vikram: Good night.
column207: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Michael. Morning. Hey Dwight, how are you?
column208: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: Pam.
column209: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: You okay?
column210: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I am better than you have ever been or ever will be. [Ryan walks in]
column211: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Hey guys! What's happening? How's my favorite branch doin'?
column212: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Okay, Michael, why dont you start us off?
column213: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Um... that wasn't much of an introduction.
column214: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Ladies and gentlemen, your boss, Michael Scott.
column215: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Ahh, still lame. Okay. All right. Thank you, Ryan, for that wonderful introduction. Okay, um, today we're gonna be talking... about...PowerPoint! PowerPoint! PowerPoint! PowerPoint!
column216: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yes I forgot about Ryan's presentation. And yes, it would have been nice to do well with the first presentation he had given me. But you know what else would have been nice? Winning the lottery.
column217: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);
column218: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);
column219: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);
column220: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: And the best way to start is to hit start. And up comes the toolbar, that's what she said. What we have to do here is go to Run, and then you look up to PowerPoint. And we are in. We are going to register. You hit register--- Updates are ready. I should update. Um, estimated time 12 minutes, so this should take 5 or 10 minutes.
column221: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Is this the first time you ever opened PowerPoint?
column222: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Why?
column223: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: You didn't prepare a presentation at all, did you?
column224: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, I had a really rough night, and my boss can back you up on that.
column225: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: I'm your boss.
column226: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: My other boss, Mr. Figaro.
column227: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: You have another job?
column228: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: What I do between 5:30 pm and 1 am is no one's business but mine and my other business'.
column229: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Are you a cocktail waitress?
column230: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: You can not have another job if it affects your work here.
column231: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: It won't.
column232: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: It did, all ready.
column233: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Okay, honestly, it was unlikely I was gonna figure this out anyways. [Kelly laughs]
column234: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kelly: You're so funny.
column235: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Why is Darryl here? He works in the warehouse.
column236: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kelly: I invited him.
column237: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: It's not a party. Darryl, back downstairs, this isn't information you need.
column238: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Darryl: There's information here? Yeah, you're right, I don't need this.
column239: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Okay. [makes out with Darryl]
column240: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Darryl: Hey, get off.
column241: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Umm, see you later tonight.
column242: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Darryl: I have plans later.
column243: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Okay, bye honey.
column244: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: How long until you actually get this presentation ready?
column245: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Why don't you do the presentation, because you know how to do it?
column246: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: You know what I really want? Honestly Michael, is for you to know it, so you can communicate to the people here, to your clients, to whomever.
column247: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Huh, okay.
column248: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: What?
column249: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: It's whoever, not whomever.
column250: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: No, it's whomever.
column251: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, whomever is never actually right.
column252: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: No, sometimes its right.
column253: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Creed: Michael is right. It's a made-up word used to trick students.
column254: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Andy: No. Actually, whomever is the formal version of the word.
column255: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Obviously it's a real word, but I don't know when to use it correctly.
column256: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Not a native speaker.
column257: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kevin: I know what's right, but I'm not gonna say, because you're all jerks who didn't come see my band last night.
column258: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Do you really know which one is correct?
column259: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kevin: I don't know.
column260: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: It's 'whom' when it's the object of a sentence, and 'who' when it's the subject.
column261: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: Yeah, that sounds right.
column262: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Well it sounds right, but is it?
column263: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Stanley: How did Ryan use it? As an object?
column264: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: As an object.
column265: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Ryan used me an object.
column266: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Stanley: Is he right about that?
column267: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: How did he use it again?
column268: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Toby: It was Ryan wanted Michael, the subject, to explain the computer system, the object.
column269: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Thank you.
column270: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Toby: To whomever, meaning us, the indirect object. Which is the correct usage of the word.
column271: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: No one, uh, asked you anything ever, so whomever's name is Toby, why don't you take a letter opener and stick it into your skull.
column272: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Ryan: Wait! This doesn't matter. And I don't even care. Michael, you quit the other job, or you're fired here.
column273: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I've never done this before. I've never quit anything in my life. So, you are filming history.
column274: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Nick, I had a dream last night that I had two full time jobs. One here at the Lipophedrazone diet pill company---
column275: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Mr. Figaro: Lipophedrine
column276: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: And the other I was a Regional Manager of a small paper supply company called Dunder Mifflin.
column277: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Mr. Figaro: Never heard of it.
column278: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: In this dream I did both of these jobs beautifully, and I loved it, and everybody loved me. But the truth is, I can't do this.
column279: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Mr. Figaro: Are you quitting?
column280: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I am.
column281: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Mr. Figaro: Come back anytime, don't forget to disinfect your headset.
column282: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I was never in this for the money. But it turns out that the money was an absolute necessity for me. I tried to live the dream. I tried to have a job, a girlfriend, another job, and I failed. But the good thing about the American dream is that you can just go to sleep, and try it all again the next night.
column283: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Andy: So.
column284: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: What's up?
column285: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Andy: Me. All night. Dreaming about Angela's smoking hot body.
column287: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Andy: Not from a male perspective. You need to set me up with her, I know she told you that she's looking, and she's totally not responding to my moves.
column289: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Andy: I have moon-walked past accounting like ten times.
column290: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: I can't believe that's not working.
column292: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Um, I don't know if I really see you two together.
column293: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Andy: Really? Well, maybe you should look in the smart part of your brain.
column295: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Andy: Okay, well I come from a line Wasps so long it leads back to Moses.
column296: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Okay, well she takes her convictions pretty seriously, she can be kind of severe.
column297: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Andy: Yeah, and I punched a hole in a wall.
column300: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Now that I think about it, Angela and Andy might actually make a good couple. But I couldn't do that to Dwight... or Angela... or Andy.
column301: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Hey Kevin, you're a gambler right? A rounder, you play the ponies, small horses.
column303: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah, I was thinking about doing some gambling myself. You know, just a little bit of money. Maybe doubling it, and them doubling it seven more times. I don't know, kind of just for fun. I was thinking, do you have tips, or ideas about sure things. Like a boxer who is going to throw the big fight, you know, like, like he's tied into some crooked dealings, maybe his kid is sick or something. Like, who do I call about that?
column305: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Do you know anybody in the mob?
column307: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Okay, um, Oscar, I'm going to need to take another advance on my salary.
column308: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kelly: What do you mean you have plans tonight?
column309: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Darryl: I have my daughter tonight; we're renting Charlotte's Web.
column310: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Well, you have to make a choice, it's either your daughter, or me.
column312: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Okay, I see how it is. [pushes a stack of files onto the floor] Oops.
column314: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kelly: [makes a W then an L with her fingers, and then runs a finger across her throat]
column315: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Phyllis: He's always been terrible with money.
column316: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Stanley: I bet it's Jan spending him straight to the poor house.
column318: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Meredith: I can't believe he has a second job.
column319: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar: He's not even good at his first one.
column322: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: What'cha talking about? [camera pans to each face in the break room] Okay, I know what's going on. You're talking about Jim and Pam, if they're having s*x, what it looks like, I know, I think---
column325: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Michael, are you having money problems?
column326: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Monkey problem? No, I'm not having monkey problems. Why would I have monkey problems?
column329: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: What's going on, why do you have a second job?
column330: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I don't have a second job. Maybe I'm having an affair with Suzanne Summers.
column332: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I don't talk to my girlfriend about money. It is rude, and unsexual.
column333: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kevin: True, it's best to hide our money problems from women.
column334: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I totally agree with you. But I don't have money problems, I don't. Alright, you know what? Watch this, if I had money problems, would I do this? [Michael holds up a bill, crumples it up, puts it back in his pocket]
column335: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar and Stanley: You just put it back in your pocket.
column336: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah, but I destroyed it, it's not even useable anymore.
column337: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Darryl: Hey, let's call this what it is.
column338: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Darryl: It's like she only wants to hook up when Ryan comes around. It's gotten to the point where I get excited every time I see that little dude walk through the door.
column339: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Well, I just need to know where this is going.
column340: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Darryl: Hey, I like you. Oh yeah, what's not to like? But you need to access your uncrazy side, otherwise maybe this thing's run its course.
column341: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Don't you dare walk away from me Darryl Philben, you are the most selfish person I've ever met in my entire---
column342: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Darryl: Slow down, think it over.
column343: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Kelly: Darryl Philben is the most complicated man that I've ever met. I mean, who says exactly what they're thinking? What kind of game is that?
column344: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Creed: Hey cuz, heard you're having money problems.
column346: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Creed: Listen, I've got the answer. You declare bankruptcy, all your problems go away.
column347: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Creed: Creed Bratton has never declared bankruptcy. When Creed Bratton gets in trouble, he transfers his debt to William Charles Schneider.
column348: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: How would that help Creed? In Monopoly when you go bankrupt, you lose.
column349: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Creed: You don't go by Monopoly man, that game is nuts. Nobody just picks up "get out of jail free" cards, those things cost thousands.
column350: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: That is a good point.
column351: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Creed: Bankruptcy, Michael, is nature's do-over. It's a fresh start, it's a clean slate.
column352: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Like the witness protection program.
column355: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I've always wanted to be in the witness protection program. Fresh start, no debts, no baggage. I've already got my name picked out, Lord Rupert Everton. I'm a shipping merchant who raises fancy dogs. That's the life.
column357: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Hey, I just wanted you to know that you can't just say the word bankruptcy and expect anything to happen.
column358: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I didn't say it, I declared it.
column360: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar: This is a lot of credit card debt.
column361: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah, tell me about it.
column363: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: You know, Jan has my credit cards, and she's using them as if I'm made of money, she thinks I'm a human ATM machine.
column364: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Okay, a hundred and twenty-five dollars, Amazon.
column365: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Oh, that's the Muppet Show, on DVD, classic.
column366: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Twelve hundred dollars. What's a Core Blaster Extreme?
column367: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: That is by far the best way to strengthen your core. This machine, you sit on a stabilizer ball, you put your feet into the power stir-ups, you reach up and you grab onto the super rod, and you twist, and you twist, and you twist. It strengthens your entire core. Your back core, your arm core, the Marine Core actually uses it. I think that's how they got a core.
column368: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Andy: I left a little present for Angela. I think she's going to like it, because I found it outside of Vance Refrigeration all alone, and I told her in the note that the cat came to find her, that they were destined to be together. I got game.
column369: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Okay, the green bar is what you spend every month on stuff you need, like a car and a house.
column370: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Mm-hm. That is so cool how you have my name at the top.
column371: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar: The red bar is what you spend on non-essentials, like magazines, entertainment, things like that.
column373: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar: This scary black bar is what you spend on things that no one ever, ever needs, like multiple magic sets, professional bass fishing equipment.
column374: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: How do they do this so fast? Is this power-point?
column375: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Man, Angela really had a hold on him. [Dwight playing the recorder in the background] Angela.
column376: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Michael, I'm going to set you and Jan up with a debt consolidator, you meet with this guy.
column377: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: No, no, we are going to leave Jan out of this.
column379: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: We will find another way, we'll ask power-point.
column380: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Michael, this is a presentation tool.
column381: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: You're a presentation tool if you think I'm gonna tell Jan about this.
column383: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: No you're not! Ok, just... you're not a tool. Look, we'll tell her that it's bad, but it could've been a lot worse but due to some fancy financial foot work I was able to cut it in half.
column386: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Dwight, how's the hotel business?
column388: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Have you checked Trip Advisor recently?
column392: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: We wrote a good review. Under comments, we wrote, the natural aroma of the beets drifts into the bedroom and makes you dream of simpler times.
column393: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: The dawn goose walk will tug at your heartstrings.
column394: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Table making never seemed so possible.
column395: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: You will never want to leave your room.
column396: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: The architecture reminds one of a quaint Tuscan beet farm.
column397: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: I'm glad you enjoyed your stay.
column398: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: We really did. It was fun.
column399: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar: So due to Michael's clever financial maneuvering, he finds himself tremendously in debt.
column401: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Um, that's, how did you get that from what Oscar's saying?
column402: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: [on phone] Michael, how did this happen? Where did all your money go? I don't, I don't get this. I really don't. I don't know how you could be so irresponsible. I mean, this is, it is astounding to me, really. I don't know what more to say.
column406: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: [on phone] Okay, where did he go?
column408: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: [on phone] Well, is he coming right back?
column410: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: [on phone] I'll be right there.
column411: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: What am I doing? I am blowing dodge. I'm getting out of town. Whatever you call it, I am running away from my responsibilities. And it feels good.
column412: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Angela: [to Andy] You may ask me out to dinner. Nothing fancy or foreign, no bars, no patios, no vegetables, and no seafood.
column415: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Did I ever tell you why I left Scranton?
column417: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yeah, I didn't think I had. Well, it was all about Pam.
column419: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yeah, I mean she was with Roy, and, uh, I just couldn't take it. I mean, I lost it Dwight. I couldn't sleep, I couldn't concentrate on anything. Even weird stuff, like food had no taste. So my solution was to move away. It was awful. It was something that I wouldn't wish on my worst enemy, and that includes you.
column420: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [sobbing, reaches out to Jim after he walked away]
column421: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Hey, I was thinking about dinner--- [Jim grabs her face and kisses her]
column422: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Ah, dinner. Let's see, maybe we should try the new Italian place, where the drive-in used to be.
column427: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Pam: Jim's just really passionate about Italian food.
column428: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jim: Yep, I'm very passionate about Italian food. In fact, um, I'm in love with Italian food.
column429: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Oscar: Jan, he went running that way.
column430: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: Alright. [throws her keys at Oscar]
column431: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: [singing] Runaway train, never come back. Runaway and I'm never coming back.
column435: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Not much, what's up with you?
column436: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: Well, why are you sitting on a train? Where are you going?
column437: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'm out of answers Jan.
column439: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I told you, no more answers. This is who I am now. A guy on a train with no answers. I hope that can be enough for you.
column440: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: Michael, come on. Running away from your problems won't solve anything. You know that.
column442: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: Your creditors can follow you anywhere with ease. Your debt follows you around the world, electronically.
column443: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I'll stay off the grid.
column444: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: Uh, Michael, come on, come on, you can deal with this. It's not that bad.
column445: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Yeah it is, it is. I really messed up.
column446: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: Well, when my life fell apart and they, and they screwed me in New York, and I felt like my whole world was collapsing around me, I didn't have anyone. I mean, my whole family still won't even talk to me, on the advice of counsel, and my friends were just waiting for this to happen.
column447: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: That's really nice of you to say.
column448: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: Michael, no, what I want to say is you were there for me. By my side. Without even a thought. That's just who you are. I mean, no matter how badly I treat you, or what I'm going through, you just, you are there for me. And that is a guy worth staying beside. So, where's this train taking us?
column449: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: I think the engineer left.
column450: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Dwight: [takes a ruler and shoves it between his desk and Jim's, knocking Jim's files on the floor] Hello, this is Dwight Schrute calling from Dunder-Mifflin, and according to our records you appear to be low on office supplies. Okay, sure, yeah I can take care of that right now.
column451: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Michael: Don't sell your implants please.
column452: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: I'm keeping them. I know you like them. They're kind of uncomfortable though.
column454: 04x07/08 - Money (Parts 1&2);Jan: It's kind of painful and my nipples are over-sensitive now.

column1: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Yeah! Everything! Oh it's all good, it's all good. Phyllis!
column2: 04x09 - Local Ad;Phyllis: Dancing babies!
column3: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Dancing babies! I love it! I love it!
column4: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: We are making a commercial for Dunder Mifflin today. Our first ad ever. Corporate purchased some air time in local markets to spread the word about Dunder Mifflin Infinity and they are even sending up a professional ad company to help us make it later so... it's uh, not too shabby.
column5: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: Best ad ever. [sings in the tune of the "Kit Kat theme song"] Gimme a break, gimme a break, break me off a piece of that... I am totally blanking. What is the thing?
column6: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Nobody tell him!
column7: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: What? No, why?
column8: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: You got it, you're so close!
column9: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: [singing] Break me off a piece of that... huh huh huh... br- applesauce.
column10: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Break me off a piece of that applesauce, I don't think...
column11: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: Break me off a piece of that Chrysler car.
column12: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Nope.
column13: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: Football cream. Grr!
column14: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Okay, it's football cream. It's football cream. Alright! So, anybody else?
column15: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: I'm taking a computer animation class so I could try to do a logo.
column16: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Look at that. Even the receptionist is getting in on the creativity. Very good, very good.
column17: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Hello hello!
column18: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 1: Hey, how ya doin'?
column19: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Michael Scott.
column20: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 2: Hey, Michael.
column21: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Regional manager.
column22: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 2: Hey Michael, nice to meet you
column23: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Excited to talk ideas.
column24: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 1: Let's do it, man.
column25: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: You know, I want this to be cutting edge. I want it to be fast, quick cuts, you know, youthful, sort of a MTV on crack kind of thing.
column26: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 1: That sounds great.
column27: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: All right, good, well this is what we have to work with.
column28: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: I would like you to meet Andrew Bernard. The 'Nard Dog. Who let the 'Nard Dog out?
column29: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: Hoo hoo hoo-hoo!
column30: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: He gives the best back rubs in the office.
column31: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: It's true, I give a mean backrub. I also do good aromatherapy [makes farting noise]. Not! You just got 'Nard dogged!
column32: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Now this gentleman right here is the key to our urban vibe.
column33: 04x09 - Local Ad;Stanley: Urban? I grew up in a small town. What about me seems urban to you?
column34: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Stanley is hilarious. Phyllis is like our Mrs. Butterworth. Kind of a less urban Aunt Jemima.
column35: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: These are our accountants. And as you can see they are very different sizes. What you might want to do is kind of a Papa Bear, Mama Bear, Baby Bear thing. That might be kind of fun.
column36: 04x09 - Local Ad;Kevin: [looking at Oscar] Mama Bear!
column37: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Who else?
column38: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: I think it's great that the company's making a commercial because not very many people have heard of us. I mean, when I tell people that I work at Dunder Mifflin, they think that we sell mufflers, or muffins, or mittens, or... And frankly all of those sound better than paper, so I let it slide.
column39: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: You playing that game again?
column40: 04x09 - Local Ad;Dwight: Second Life is not a game. It is a multi-user virtual environment. It doesn't have points or scores, it doesn't have winners or losers.
column41: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Oh it has losers.
column42: 04x09 - Local Ad;Dwight: I signed up for Second Life about a year ago. Back then my life was so great that I literally wanted a second one. In my Second Life I was also a paper salesman and I was also named Dwight. Absolutely everything was the same. Except I could fly. [shot of Dwight's avatar flying around]
column43: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: [reading off piece of paper] Little girl in a field holding a flower, we zoom back to find that she's in the desert and the field is an oasis. Zoom back further the desert is a sandbox in the world's largest resort hotel. Zoom back further the hotel is actually the playground for the world's largest prison. But we zoom back further---
column44: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 1: Okay I can tell that your time is valuable---
column45: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Actually I don't get paid by the hour anymore, but thank you, I get paid by the year, so...
column46: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 1: That all sounds really, really ambitious.
column47: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Yeah, I know.
column48: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 1: Why don't we show you what we did with the Nashua branch?
column49: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Mmm. Okay. [commercial plays on laptop, peppy music in background]
column50: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: That's what Nassau came up with? That sucks! [chuckles] Whoa.
column51: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 1: That's what we came up with.
column52: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Well we can do better than that.
column53: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 2: Well the main part of the ad has to stay the same, actually.
column54: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 1: Yeah, it's the last five seconds where we have some leeway.
column55: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: The waving?
column56: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 1: Well, no, no. You don't have to be waving. That was just what they did. You guys can be clapping. Sitting. Standing outside, inside, whatever. This is where you really get to be creative.
column57: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: I need some advice. I've been spending a lot of time making out with Angela lately. But we've been necking, but only necking. Right? Not actually kissing, our mouths, just the neck on neck. It's just like rubbing slash nuzzling our necks together. It's hot, I'm not going to lie to you , but it's a little weird, but you seem like a guy with answers, so how do I fast track this to get to first base?
column58: 04x09 - Local Ad;Dwight: We cannot talk about this... because, someone might hear us.
column59: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: We'll use code names.
column60: 04x09 - Local Ad;Dwight: Angela can stay the same, but we'll change Andy to Dwight.
column61: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: That's not different enough.
column62: 04x09 - Local Ad;Dwight: Dwike?
column63: 04x09 - Local Ad;Receptionist: You have a call from Eddie Murphy.
column64: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ryan: Hello?
column65: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: [on speakerphone, Eddie Murphy voice] Shrek! Shrek, I'm a donkey! I'm a donkey, Shrek! [laughing] I'm just kidding. It's me. Hello Ry.
column66: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ryan: What?
column67: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Okay, calm down. I have a small problem.
column68: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ryan: I told you not to call about small problems.
column69: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Yeah, well when I call about big problems you don't like that either, so make up you mind, kiddo. Here is the deal, the ad guys that you sent are locking me in a creative box, and sort of ignoring my ideas.
column70: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ryan: That's good. They're creative, you're not.
column71: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: I'm creative, Ryan.
column72: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ryan: It's not part of your job, it's like, maybe you can cook but it doesn't mean you should start a restaurant.
column73: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Well actually I can't cook, and I am starting a restaurant. Mike's Cereal Shack. I'm thinking we'll have as many varieties as you can buy in the store.
column74: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ryan: Okay, I'm not really interested in that right now. I'm delegating creativity to creative professionals. It's a different skills set. Look, I wasn't good at sales, right?
column75: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Yeah!
column76: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ryan: But I'm good at managing people who do sales .
column77: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Are you? I don't think you're doing such a good job here, suppressing ideas and creativity.
column78: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: All right, let me ask you this, tell me if you think this is creative. When I was five, I imagined that there was such a thing as a unicorn. And this is before I had even heard of one, or seen one. I just drew a picture of a horse that could fly over rainbows, and had a huge spike in its head. And I was five, five years old. Couldn't even talk yet.
column79: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Hey guys, um, you know what, we cannot shoot this ad today.
column80: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 2: Okay, when should we come back?
column81: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: How about never hundred hours, sir.
column82: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 2: We were sent here to help out.
column83: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ad guy 1: Okay I'm not going to argue with this guy. Let's go. Good luck dude.
column84: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Hey thanks. Thank you.
column85: 04x09 - Local Ad;David Wallace: [on phone] Michael, David Wallace. What is this about dismissing the ad people?
column86: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Yeah, I'm glad you called. Ryan is being a little bitch again.
column87: 04x09 - Local Ad;Ryan: I'm on Michael.
column88: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: What's up my brotha? Listen, David, I would like to do this ad in house. I want to use only the creativity that we have right here in the office. And I will send it to you tomorrow morning, take a look at it, and if you do not think that it's ready to air, send the ad agency back down here, and we'll do it on my dime.
column89: 04x09 - Local Ad;David Wallace: This is weird.
column90: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: I'm willing to stake my entire reputation on it.
column91: 04x09 - Local Ad;David Wallace: Okay, I'll see it tomorrow.
column92: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Okay. [hangs up phone] And thus, Michael Scott sealed his own destiny. In a good way.
column93: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Has anyone ever come up to you and said, "You're not creative"?
column94: 04x09 - Local Ad;Dwight: Yes.
column95: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Well they're wrong. You are creative. You are damn creative. Each and every one of you. You are so much more creative than all of the other dry, boring morons that you work with.
column96: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Who are you talking to, specifically?
column97: 04x09 - Local Ad;Kevin: I kind of know what it's like to be in commercials. My nickname in high school used to be Kool-Aid Man. [makes squinty face]
column98: 04x09 - Local Ad;Oscar: When I was younger I always wanted to be an actor in commercials. Then I realized I had a brain.
column99: 04x09 - Local Ad;Meredith: I'm excited about doing the ad, but I'm not really used to doing videos with so many people around.
column100: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: We have three scenes to film, big scenes. We have a song to write. So let's get cracking. Kelly, I want you to do makeup. Oscar, I would like you to do costume design, obviously. Phyllis, I'd like you look around town and see if we have any celebrities in our local area.
column101: 04x09 - Local Ad;Phyllis: [gasps] Sue Grafton is at the Steamtown Mall. She's doing a book signing right now.
column102: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Okay, okay, Phyllis this is what I want you to do. I want you to go down to the mall. I want you to get in line. I want you to get her to be in this commercial. This would be a huge coupe people. All right? Do not take no for an answer.
column103: 04x09 - Local Ad;Phyllis: Okay.
column104: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: Does anyone actually know what Sue Grafton looks like? I mean, is she hot or-?
column105: 04x09 - Local Ad;Creed: She's crazy hot.
column106: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: Well then maybe we should just use Angela and say she's Sue Grafton. Would anyone notice?
column107: 04x09 - Local Ad;Angela: That's not happening.
column108: 04x09 - Local Ad;Angela: I find the mystery genre disgusting. I hate being titillated.
column109: 04x09 - Local Ad;
column110: 04x09 - Local Ad;
column111: 04x09 - Local Ad;
column112: 04x09 - Local Ad;Phyllis: Bye everyone.
column113: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Line it up Phyllis.
column114: 04x09 - Local Ad;Creed: Get her Phyll.
column115: 04x09 - Local Ad;Darryl: [singing] Out of paper, out of stock, there's friendly faces around the block, break loose from the chains that are causing your pain.
column116: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy, Creed, Kevin, Kelly, Darryl: Call Michael or Stanley, Jim, Dwight or Creed. Call Andy and Kelly for your business paper needs.
column117: 04x09 - Local Ad;Darryl: Dunder Mifflin.
column118: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy, Creed, Kevin, Kelly: The people person's paper people.
column119: 04x09 - Local Ad;Darryl: Dunder Mifflin.
column120: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy, Creed, Kevin, Kelly: The people person's paper people.
column121: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Time out, time out, time out, time out, time out. I thought... I was under the impression that this was going to be a rap.
column122: 04x09 - Local Ad;Darryl: What's rap?
column123: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Okay, Darryl, wow, you need to learn a lot about your own culture. I'll make you a mix.
column124: 04x09 - Local Ad;Darryl: Great.
column125: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: News flash. I got some juicy updates on Operation Fallen Angel. Remind me to tell you later.
column126: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Hey.
column127: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: No talk, I'm animating.
column128: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Why don't we take a quick ten second break from that so I can show you what's going on here. [pulls up Dwight's game] Okay, this is Dwight's Second Life. He's on it all the time. So much so that his little guy here has created his own world. It's called Second Second Life, for those people who want to be removed even further from reality.
column129: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: Are you serious?
column130: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Yeah.
column131: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: Oh my God, he's really in pain.
column132: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: [sighs]
column133: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: Who's that?
column134: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Oh, it's just my avatar guy. Whatever.
column135: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: He looks a lot like you. How much time did you spend on that?
column136: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Not much, it's just for tracking Dwight so---
column137: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: Right... you're a sports writer in Philadelphia? Nice build too.
column138: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Yep.
column139: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: You have a guitar slung on your back. I did not know you played guitar.
column140: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: I... why don't we go back to this animation.
column141: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: No no no, I want to see more of Philly Jim. I want Philly Jim.
column142: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Ah, show me how this works.
column143: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: Oh boy.
column144: 04x09 - Local Ad;Darryl: [singing in different tune] Out of paper, out of stock, there's friendly faces around the block, break loose from the chains that are causing your pain. Call Michael, Stanley, Jim, Dwight or Creed. Call Andy and Kelly for your business paper needs. Call Dunder Mifflin.
column145: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy, Creed, Kevin, Kelly: The people person's paper people.
column146: 04x09 - Local Ad;Darryl: Dunder Mifflin.
column147: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy, Creed, Kevin, Kelly: The people person's paper people.
column148: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Stop. Stop stop stop stop stop stop. This is not me. This is not my music.
column149: 04x09 - Local Ad;Darryl: You're right, it's better than you! It's us! [sings] Dunder Mifflin.
column150: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy, Creed, Kevin, Kelly: The people person's paper people.
column151: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: No, I hate it! I hate it! ...I don't hate it, I just don't like it at all. And it's terrible.
column152: 04x09 - Local Ad;Darryl: You're on your own, Mike. [gets up and starts to walk away]
column153: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Okay, you know what. Hold on, hold on Darryl.
column154: 04x09 - Local Ad;Darryl: You just said you hated it.
column155: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: No. I said I hate the, the style.
column156: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: [singing] Break me off a piece of that lumber tar. Snickers bar.
column157: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Okay, wow. Wow, this looks uh, terrible.
column158: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: Break me off a piece of that Grey Poupon.
column159: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Andy, Andy, this is a pivotal scene in the ad. And if we don't get this, if we don't nail it, we're going to lose the whole triumph of the moment. The triumph of the will. Now, God, what? What Phyllis?
column160: 04x09 - Local Ad;Phyllis: [crying] Well, I got in line to buy Sue Grafton's book and when it came to my turn I asked if she wanted to be in the ad and she said no thank you, but I wasn't supposed to take no for an answer.
column161: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: That'a girl.
column162: 04x09 - Local Ad;Phyllis: So I kept on asking and they finally threw me out of the store in front of all my friends.
column163: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Did you, or did you not get Sue Grafton?
column164: 04x09 - Local Ad;Phyllis: [sobbing] No.
column165: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Ugh, can somebody give her a tissue please? [Kevin hands her piece of tape]
column166: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: I hope you're not killing yourself on this, because I'm sure it's good enough for Michael's ad that will probably be seen by no one.
column167: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: Maybe, but it's not good enough for me yet.
column168: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Okay. Do you want me to stay?
column169: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: No no, you can go home. I'm good.
column170: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Pam is staying late tonight to uh, achieve her dreams. So I'm pretty proud of her, unfortunately she was my ride home.
column171: 04x09 - Local Ad;Meredith: You comin'?
column172: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: I, ah...
column173: 04x09 - Local Ad;Meredith: Piss or get off the pot!
column174: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.
column175: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Good morning. [Pam sees breakfast sitting on her desk] Yeah I'm sorry, I looked away for a second and Creed snatched your hash browns.
column176: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: Thank you.
column177: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: You're welcome.
column178: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: I worked until about 2:45 AM. And then I had to decide if I wanted to spend the night with Michael editing in his office, and Dwight watching Michael edit in his office, or drive home and probably fall asleep at the wheel and die in a fiery car wreck. I passed out on my keyboard trying to decide.
column179: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: Let me pour you some bubbly because somebody got to a whole new level last night.
column180: 04x09 - Local Ad;Dwight: Andy, I can't hear this right now.
column181: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: No, no no no, this is good. You know how we haven't really gotten anywhere that I want to get to physically yet? Well, last night, that changed. We're makin' out, I'm kissin' her neck, and cheek and her ear lobe, and she's not really kissing me back. But she closes her eyes and she's like, "Oh D, oh D."
column182: 04x09 - Local Ad;Dwight: She called you D?
column183: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: Yeah. D for Andy.
column184: 04x09 - Local Ad;Dwight: Oh D.
column185: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: Oh D.
column186: 04x09 - Local Ad;Dwight: [whispers] Oh D.
column187: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: Oh D!
column188: 04x09 - Local Ad;Both: Ohhhhhh D! [laughing] Ohhhh D!
column189: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: I'm about to send the ad to corporate... and it is sent. They'll probably watch it right away. I know I would. Okay. [dials phone]
column190: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: [on phone] Yes?
column191: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: Pam, please clear my phone lines.
column192: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: Certainly. [makes beeping noises] Okay, clear.
column193: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: They could call at any second now. [sighs] Oh God...I better call.
column194: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: [Ten days later] Well, it's been tough. The uh, geniuses at corporate rejected my commercial and tonight they are airing the brain dead version. So welcome one and all to the world premiere of Corporate Crapfest!
column195: 04x09 - Local Ad;Everyone: [watching ad] Oh! [clapping and cheering]
column196: 04x09 - Local Ad;Bartender: Hey it seemed like a big hit.
column197: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: No, it was stupid. People like waving, waving sells. It's not art. Yet we made our ad, the real one was full of humor, and full of depth, and full heart and it was real.
column198: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Hey, could you do me a favor? Could you put that in the DVD player?
column199: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Hey everybody! Just want to welcome you all to the premiere of the real Dunder Mifflin commercial, the Michael Scott director's cut. Hope you like it.
column200: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael's Ad: [Chariots of Fire theme plays] It all starts with an idea. But you can never tell where an idea will end up. [people passing a Corporate Memo around to each other] Because ideas spread, they change, grow. They connect us with the world. [Kelly catches paper airplane that says "I love you"] And in a fast moving world, where good news moves at the speed of time [newspaper with Andy saying "Hometown Boy Wins Race"], and bad news isn't always what it seems. [Dwight hands Phyllis paper that says "You have a son, and it's me"] Because when push comes to shove we all deserve a second chance. [Stanley finds paper that says "Turn your life around. Now hiring at Dunder Mifflin"] To score. [Jim throws paper in basket, Michael retrieves it; it says "World's Most Creative Boss"] Dunder Mifflin. Limitless paper in a paperless world.
column201: 04x09 - Local Ad;Everyone: [claps and cheer]
column202: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Animation? All her by the way. [points at Pam]
column203: 04x09 - Local Ad;Bartender: Really?
column204: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: I just thought you should---
column205: 04x09 - Local Ad;Bartender: The animation was cool.
column206: 04x09 - Local Ad;Pam: Thanks.
column207: 04x09 - Local Ad;Bartender: Hey listen, you ever been on a motorcycle?
column208: 04x09 - Local Ad;Jim: Ahh. [puts his arm around Pam]
column209: 04x09 - Local Ad;Kevin: Michael, that was fun.
column210: 04x09 - Local Ad;Michael: That was fun. Next round of drinks is on me, people!
column211: 04x09 - Local Ad;Andy: [singing] Claude Van Damme, Hair for Men, poison gas, NutraSweet. [speaking] It's gotta rhyme with "piece." Fancy Feast! [sings] Break me off a piece of that Fancy Feast! It's the cat food. Nailed it.

column1: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Rolando: [on phone] Dunder Mifflin, this is Rolando. Oh yes, she's been expecting your call. [knocks on door]
column2: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Karen: Yeah.
column3: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Rolando: Karen? He's on line one.
column4: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Karen: Thanks Ro. Hey, we finally connected. How's Scranton?
column5: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Karen: I am the regional manager of Dunder-Mifflin Utica branch. Turns out it's a pretty easy gig when your boss isn't an idiot and your boyfriend's not in love with somebody else.
column6: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Karen: Look, All I'm saying is it would be a great opportunity, and we'd love to have you come aboard. So think about it, okay? Okay, bye.
column7: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Karen: Look, for the record, a certain Scranton salesman approached me, okay?
column8: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: This is perfect.
column9: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Dwight: He looks like your twin.
column10: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: This is a dummy, a la Ferris Bueller's Day Off. We have tied a string to the wrist, which goes to the door. When somebody opens the door, the hand goes down, hits the remote, turns on the tape recorder, which is me snoring. Now nobody knows whether I am here, or whether I am gone.
column11: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Dwight: I will know.
column12: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: But, you will not tell anyone.
column13: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Dwight: I won't need to because we'll be together playing hooky. Yeah.
column14: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: Well, sometimes. Most of the time I will be with Ryan, or Darryl. [knock on the door] Yes? Oh good, good Stanley! First victim, this is what I want you to do. Go out, come back in. We're going to hide. I want you to tell me if this looks like me, okay?
column15: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Stanley: I don't understand why sleeping at your desk is better than you not being here.
column16: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: Just go out, and come back in.
column17: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Stanley: I got an offer from Utica for more money, and I'm going to take it.
column18: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: What?
column19: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: Hey everyone, can I have your attention please? I just thought you all should know that Stanley Hudson is planning on leaving us, because our old friend Karen from Utica is going to give him more money to work there.
column20: 04x10 - Branch Wars;All: [applause]
column21: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: No, no, no, no, no-no, no no. You completely misinterpreted my tone, this is a horrible thing. Clearly, Karen is trying to get back at us because Jim dumped her.
column22: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Jim: Oh, I don't think that is what's happening.
column23: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: Okay, smarty pants, then why? Why is she trying to take Stanley from us?
column24: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Stanley: I think it's because of my sales record.
column25: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: That could not possibly be it.
column26: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: You cannot take the hilarious black guy from the office. Stanley is part of what makes this branch so extraordinary. The bluesy wisdom, the sassy remarks, the crossword puzzles, the smile, those big watery red eyes. I don't know how George Bush did it when Colin Powell left, and if Utica thinks that they are going to poach Stanley, they have another thing coming.
column27: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: How can I get you to stay?
column28: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Stanley: Money.
column29: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: Yeah we all want money. But there is none in the budget, so... Tell me why you're really leaving.
column30: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Stanley: Money.
column31: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: Mo money mo problems, Stanley. You of all people should know that. Let me ask you this, if I were-
column32: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Stanley: Money.
column33: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: Pssh, kay.
column34: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Pam: Oscar, did you bring it?
column35: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Oscar: To be Edwardian. His best work.
column36: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Pam: Okay, well I have the tablecloth, don't forget the flatware.
column37: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Oscar: Sure thing Pam, can't wait.
column38: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Pam: Oscar, Toby, and I are founding members of the Finer Things Club. We meet once a month to discuss books and art, celebrate culture in a very civilized way. Sometimes the debate can get heated, but we're always respectful. There is no paper, no plastic, and no work talk allowed. It's very exclusive.
column39: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Oscar: Besides having s*x with men, I would say that the Finer Things Club is the gayest thing about me.
column40: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Jim: So tell me again why I can't be part of your club?
column41: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Pam: Because some people think you monopolize the conversation by trying to be funny.
column42: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Jim: Oscar?
column43: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Pam: Some people.
column44: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Karen: [on phone] Hello?
column45: 04x10 - Branch Wars;Michael: Fillipellers, how's it hanging?
