column39: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: I thought we had that looked at.
column40: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: I'm sick of it Jim. I'm sick of this place.
column41: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: When Jan and I had satellite, we used to watch a reality show called "Survivorman." And, it was interesting because it was about a guy who would go out in the middle of no where and just try not to die, try not to get eaten by an animal, or be overexposed.
column42: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: OK, I will only need two things. Roll of duct tape and a knife.
column43: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: [winks] I'm on it. [leaves room]
column44: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: OK. Thirty minutes or less, please come back. Save the receipts. [Dwight comes back with set of knives] Hey, what...
column45: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: Let's see if any of these will work. [clears the front of Michael's desk]
column46: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Hey, hey hey! Dwight. [Dwight rolls out an assortment knives]. Dwight.
column47: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: I keep various weaponries strategically placed around the office. I saved Jim's life with a can of pepper spray I had velcroed under my desk. People say, "Oh, it's dangerous to keep weapons in the home or the work place." Well I say, "It's better to be hurt by someone you know accidentally, than by a stranger on purpose."
column48: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Dwight and I are going out. He will return later, but I will not. I will also be taking a personal day tomorrow, and perhaps the next day.
column49: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Pam: Do you want me to ask where you're going?
column50: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: No.
column51: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Pam: Great.
column52: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Dwight will be driving me deep into the Pennsylvania wilderness.
column53: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Pam: Oh.
column54: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Where he will then leave me to either die or to survive. The choice is yours.
column55: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Hmm, no, the choice is actually yours. Are you sure you want to do this?
column56: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Yes, and I am leaving you in charge of the office for the rest of the day and for the next several days. Do not try to follow me.
column57: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: OK, great.
column58: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: This is a very personal, private experience in the wild, that I wish to share it with me, myself and I.
column59: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Yup.
column60: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: When I return, I hope to be a completely changed human being.
column61: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: That'd be great.
column62: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: Do I believe that Michael possesses the skills to survive in a hostile environment? Let's put it this way[/b]: no, I do not.
column63: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: This is what a true survivor man does. You simulate a disaster, like a plane wreck. You could only wear the clothes that you have on, and you could only use the stuff you have in your pockets. Now, in this case, this disaster is a serial killer. Creepy guy who's abducted me and is taking me out into the wilderness to leave me for dead.
column64: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: No, I would never leave you for dead. You would never escape.
column65: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Well, yes I would. And I would survive.
column66: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: I would make sure that you were dead.
column67: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Well...
column68: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: First, I would remove your teeth and cut off your fingertips so you could not be identified.
column69: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: You...
column70: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: And they would call me the Overkill Killer.
column71: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: You... you are as creepy as a real serial killer. For real. [blindfolds eyes with tie] OK.
column72: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: What are you doing?
column73: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: I am putting this on so I have no familiarity with my surroundings. Now this way, I can't retrace my steps. I don't know what streets we've been--- [Dwight whacks Michael with his shoe] Ow! What are you doing?
column74: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: It would be better if you were unconscious.
column75: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: No! Gosh! Dwight. [Dwight tries to hit Michael with his shoe again] Stop it, stop it! Stop it.
column76: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: Do you want to do this right or not?
column77: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Just, please allow me to have one cathartic experience in my life?
column78: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Angela: Jim, we need to order a cake for Creed's birthday.
column79: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Oh, wasn't it just someone's birthday?
column80: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Angela: Yes. Kelly's was last week, remember?
column81: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: I do remember, yeah.
column82: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Angela: It's birthday month. Creed's is today. Oscar's is week after next. Meredith's is at the end of the month. [Jim exhales deeply] Michael usually goes with red and white streamers...
column83: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: You know what, I have an idea. Why don't we just do one big shared party?
column84: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Angela: What?
column85: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: There are thirteen people working in this office, so thirteen times a year Michael gets a cake and balloons, and some sort of joke gift and makes a toast. There are two types of toasts. One is a joke about how old you are.
column86: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: [flashback to Stanley's birthday] Look at those wrinkles. Blacks do crack! Not crack the drug.
column87: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: And the other is something inappropriate. Or horrible. Or both. What else? He only sings the high harmony to "Happy Birthday." And he's a very big believer in surprise parties. Maybe even, arguably, possibly to a fault.
column88: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: [flashback to Kelly's birthday, hiding in the elevator] Happy Birthday!
column89: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Kelly: Ahhh!! [drops the papers she was holding]
column90: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: [flashback to Oscar's birthday, hiding in the break room] Happy Birthday!
column91: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Oscar: Ahhh! [runs into door and Michael laughs]
column92: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: [flashback to Phyllis' birthday, sneaking up on Phyllis' car] Happy Birthday!
column93: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Phyllis: Oh! [Michael laughs]
column94: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: So... I think, yeah, I think getting these out of the way might be productive.
column95: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: We can just have one big fun party. Everybody's happy, nobody wastes their time.
column96: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Angela: I don't like it. [Angela leaves]
column97: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Pam: Wow! You're shaking things up a bit, huh?
column98: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: It's a pretty good idea, don't you think?
column99: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Pam: Do you think it's a good idea?
column100: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: No... I think it's a great idea.
column101: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Pam: [smiles] Hmm.
column102: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: We're here. [gets out of the car]
column103: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Dwight will take my blindfold off when we are deep in the forest. Just the two of us from this point out.
column104: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: [leading Michael from car] Here we go. Just the two of us [gestures for camera crew to follow]
column105: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: Here we go, into the wild. Mighty forest. Can you smell the trees and the nature?
column106: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: Keep going, you're fine. Just some bushes and some thickets [leads Michael into some tall grass] Keep going. You wanted wilderness, you got it.
column107: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: You know, try sending them another invoice.
column108: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Oscar: Ok.
column109: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Alright. [starts walking away, but returns] Oh, did you see my memo by the way?
column110: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Oscar: [picks up and reads memo] "Let's be honest, as fun as birthdays are we could all use a break from the constant cake, so let's celebrate birthday month in style today." This is really cool.
column111: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Right? I was just thinking...
column112: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Oscar: No, totally, totally. This way we get it all out of the way at once and it could actually be fun.
column113: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Right! Exactly. [pats Oscar on the back and walks away] Knew I could count on you. [Oscar rolls his eyes]
column114: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: Good a spot as any. [They stop and Dwight starts spinning Michael around in circles]
column115: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: What are you doing? Stop. Dwight, Dwight. Just --
column116: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: I'm just --
column117: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Stop.
column118: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: Spin. I'm trying to confuse your sense of direction. [stops spinning and takes Michael's blindfold off] Behold.
column119: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Alright, good. Thank you, Dwight.
column120: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: Here's your knife. Here's your duct tape.
column121: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Alright, very good. Ahh, OK. [Dwight gives Michael a hug]
column122: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: Good luck, Michael.
column123: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Thanks for the ride. OK. Leave me be, Dwight. [Dwight runs off]
column124: 04x11 - Survivor Man;
column125: 04x11 - Survivor Man;
column126: 04x11 - Survivor Man;
column127: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Meredith: Hey, Jim, can I have my own cake?
column128: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: What's that?
column129: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Meredith: I really prefer devils food cake.
column130: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Oh, sure.
column131: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Meredith: Yes!
column132: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: OK. [Meredith leaves]
column133: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Pam: Wow! That was easy.
column134: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Yeah, people like me I guess.
column135: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Creed: [knocking from outside window in break room] Jim.
column136: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Creed: I hate devils food.
column137: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Well I think Meredith was just --
column138: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Creed: Screw Meredith, I don't think it's fair to let someone else pick the cake on my birthday.
column139: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Everybody's birthday.
column140: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Creed: Today is actually my birthday and I want to pick the cake.
column141: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: What do you want?
column142: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Creed: I want pie. I want peach pie.
column143: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: You want a birthday pie?
column144: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Creed: I want a nice cobbler.
column145: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Well, I'm gonna to talk to Angela and we're gonna see what we can do about a pie.
column146: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Creed: I don't care who you talk to. Just make it happen.
column147: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: It will be Angela.
column148: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Creed: You tell her it's for Creed. She'll know what that means.
column149: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: [to own camcorder] Day One. I'm in the interior of the vast Pennsylvania wilderness. I've brought with me only the bare essentials. A knife, roll of duct tape, in case I need to craft some shelter or make some sort of water vessel. It's hot today. The sun is in the two-thirds easterly quadrant, which would make it about [looks at watch] 2 o'clock in the afternoon. It's really beating down on me now. I think that I want to get a little more comfortable because the sun is depleting my resources. [cuts pants with knife] OK. OH, there we go. Watch that I don't hit my corroded artery here...
column150: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: I lied to Michael. I said that I would leave him alone, but I will not. I will remain close by to provide unseen moral support, but I will never help him. I will let harm befall him. I will even let him die. But I will never let him lose his dignity.
column151: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: There we go. [standing with short sleeves and short pants] Much better. Now everything I brought with me can be used. My sport coat here, can be fashioned into a backpack of sorts [ties jacket around neck].
column152: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: I'm going to wear what was once one of my pant legs. [puts pant leg on head like a hat]
column153: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: See, this is a beautiful piece of material [rips other pant leg in half] This could be used for all sorts of things.
column154: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Some sort of kerchief to keep my neck nice and comfortable.
column155: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Andy: Tuna. [rolls in chair to Jim's desk]
column156: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Andy.
column157: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Andy: Me likey the ice cream cake, okay? Fudgie the Whale.
column158: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Not your birthday.
column159: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Andy: Well, I'm just saying, you know, if you want to make people happy, namely me, you will have a Fudgie the Whale.
column160: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Alright, I'll look into it, but the answer's no.
column161: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Andy: Wow, OK, harsh. Just don't expect me to show up.
column162: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Hey, Andy, I have some calls to make.
column163: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Andy: Loud and clear. [rolls in chair back to desk]
column164: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Alright. [Andy rolls back]
column165: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Andy: Pizza rolls.
column166: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: OK, I'm gonna go into this office here [gets up and walks into Michael's office] to do some work. So I will be in here.
column167: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Andy: Mushroom caps.
column168: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: I am totally alone right now, with only my thoughts. I love it. I'm loving it. I can literally say anything I want. No one is gonna here me. [screams] Wish I could have gone with Ryan on that cool retreat! Jan has plastic boobs! I HAVE HEMORRHOIDS! Doesn't even matter.
column169: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: Michael is a man of great depth and passion. I don't know what he's searching for out here. [pulls a nest from a tree] I hope he finds it. [picks up some bird eggs] Lunch.
column170: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Well it is a little chillier than I had thought, so I have fashioned my hat back into my pants. Several hours in, time for me to find some nourishment. Now, these woods are full of creatures that can sustain human life. Things like, uh, squirrels, nice juicy rabbit would be delicious.
column171: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: About two more minutes [cooking bird eggs].
column172: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: I have made this spear, with which I will impale my dinner. And it couldn't come a moment too soon because I have been without food for a good three hours or so. I'm startin' to feel it a little bit. Ohh... It's Creed's birthday. [singing] Happy Birthday to you. Happy Birthday to you. Happy Birthday to Creed. Happy Birthday to you. Happy birthday, buddy.
column173: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Meredith: What is Jim thinking? It's a birthday, so what if there's a lot of them?
column174: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Kevin: Yeah, I work hard all day. I like knowing that there's going to be a break. Most days I just sit and wait for the break.
column175: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Stanley: I took an extra shot of insulin in preparation for this cake today. If I don't have some cake soon, I might die.
column176: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Oscar: Why don't you just have an apple?
column177: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Stanley: Why don't you mind your business?
column178: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Creed: Listen, I figured this out. Jimmy had his birthday three weeks ago, so he doesn't care.
column179: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Oscar: Probably went to his head.
column180: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Creed: Yeah. [Jim enters room]
column181: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Oscar: Hey, Jim.
column182: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Hey guys, what're we talking about?
column183: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Creed: Nothing! Nothing going on. We're talking about nothing. C'mon gang.
column184: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Well if you take a look at this, I tented my pants. I've made myself a nice pants tent shelter. And this little guy [pats a large tree trunk] may be Dunder Mifflin paper some day.
column185: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: Nothing to worry about. Just using the scope. Safety is... [clicks rifle into safety mode] on.
column186: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Toby: [knocks] Hey Jim.
column187: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Toby.
column188: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Toby: Hey, I just got the word on the communal birthdays. Great idea.
column189: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Oh, thanks man.
column190: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Toby: Yeah...
column191: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Is there anything --
column192: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Toby: My birthday was two months ago.
column193: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Oh, OK.
column194: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Toby: There was no party.
column195: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: What?
column196: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Toby: Well, it... there was. But Michael scheduled it for 4:58 on a Friday. You know, people sang in the parking lot.
column197: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: I remember that.
column198: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Toby: I don't know, I just thought you could include me.
column199: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Seriously?
column200: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Toby: I just though you could add me. I don't see the harm in that.
column201: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Toby's great. He's great, but sometimes he can be a little bit much. [in Toby voice] I don't see the harm in that. Well, it's a cake Toby, so, c'mon.
column202: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: OK. Yeah, you know what, we're just gonna throw you in. Because more the merrier, right?
column203: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Angela: No. No way. I am not a machine, Jim. You can't just change plans willy nilly and expect these little magic party elves to do your bidding. We already have devils food, peach cobbler, Fudgie the Whale, mushroom caps.
column204: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Toby: I'm allergic to mushrooms.
column205: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: That's a bummer. OK, then we need to...[steps outside office] Hey everybody. Hi, how you doing? Can I have your attention please? 'Cause we have to talk about this birthday thing.
column206: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Pam: [raises hand] Conference room?
column207: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Yes, conference room in five minutes... No. No. We're gonna solve it right here. We're actually gonna talk about it out here. So, who has problems with the birthday thing? [everyone raises hands] One, two, three, everybody. OK, so then we just shouldn't do it.
column208: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Angela: What am I supposed to do with two cakes and a pie?'
column209: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Kevin: Oh, I'll take 'em.
column210: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Creed: Well nobody's touching my cobbler.
column211: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Phyllis: [raises hand] Hey, Michael. I mean Jim.
column212: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Yup, Phyllis called me Michael. And I will always and forever be haunted by that fact.
column213: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Under this tree, I think I struck the mother load. Those [points camera to mushrooms] are nature's best mushrooms. Wild, and I have to say these little buggers are damn tasty as well. [puts them in mouth]
column214: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Dwight: Stop! No, no Michael! Nooo! Nooo! [runs up to Michael and knocks him over] Nooo! Arghh. Get, get them out. [picks out mushrooms from Michael's mouth]
column215: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Everybody: Happy Birthday to you. Happy Birthday to you. Happy Birthday [Michael joins in with high note] to Creed. Happy Birthday to you. [Creed blows up candles on pie]
column216: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Yeah! [everybody clapping] Alright, skip around the room. Skip around the room. We want -- OK, alright. Yeah, don't do that. You're gonna break something.
column217: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Man became civilized for a reason. He decided that he liked to have warmth, and clothing, and television, and hamburgers, and to walk upright, and to have a soft futon at the end of the day. He didn't want to have to struggle to survive. I don't need the woods. I have a nice wood desk. I don't need fresh air, because I have the freshest air around, A.C. And I don't need wide open spaces. Check it out. [shows off computer screen scenery] I can also make it the sky.
column218: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Hey, buddy.
column219: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Hey.
column220: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: What up?
column221: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Sure glad you're back.
column222: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: You are relieved.
column223: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: You have no idea.
column224: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: So what did I miss?
column225: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Well, I tried to put all the birthdays together at once.
column226: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Oh.
column227: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: So, terrible idea.
column228: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Yeah, okay, I did that. Rookie mistake.
column229: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: You did do it?
column230: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Uh huh. Yeah, just wait. Ten years, you'll figure it out.
column231: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: Well, I don't think I'll be here in ten years.
column232: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: That's what I said. That's what she said.
column233: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: That's what who said?
column234: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: I never know. I just say it. I say stuff like that, you know, to lighten the tension. When things sort of get hard.
column235: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Jim: That's what she said.
column236: 04x11 - Survivor Man;Michael: Hey! Nice. Really good. Bravo, my young ward.
